description: EAST ORANGEThis city's delinquent book borrowers will be able, to turn over a new leaf very soon. If they return any overdue bookseven those overdue several yearsthey will be excused from paying any fines.

title: Highway Programs Showing Progress
description: NEWARKNew Jersey has more than $600milion In highwayconstruction projects miles of Interstate highways, as well as 420 miles of other freeways.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Representative Gerald Ford, the former Michigan football star, indicates what he would do as Vice President in response to a Presidential decision: You don't tackle your own quarterback after he has called the play.

title: Headlines
description: Oscar is a raccoon and a reporter. Claws and Paws, the paper he writes for and Theodore Cat edits, has a beaver proofreader, a flamingo society editor, a porcupine typesetter, a rat family and other fauna for employes. All wear civilian dress except for their bare feet, and most of them uncannily resemble their human counterparts. With the help of this anthropomorphic hodgepodge we get a burlesque, at times quite close to reality, of how a newspaper is published.

title: The Suffolk Focus Is on Local Races
description: YAPHANK, L. I.  Local races, by and large, dominate the races in Suffolk that the electorate will decide upon on Tuesday. They range from town supervisor to bay constable, scarcely the type of contests to galvanize the voters.

title: Jenkins, Fego Power Clifton Over Hackensack
description: Clifton blended a potent running attack with a stingy defense yesterday to stretch its winning streak to 16 games with a 34.0 victory over Hackensack in Clifton.

title: Wisconsin Beaten by Mich. State
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 3 (AP)David Brown, a Michigan State tailback, plunged for two touchdowns and caught a pass for a third today and the Spartans defeated Wisconsin 21 to 0, in a Big Ten game.

title: Islanders 64 Victors Over Bruins
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 3  The firstplace Boston Bruins hightailed it into Nassau Coliseum tonight, but the New York Islanders put them back on their heels en route to a 64 victory before 14,621 ecstatic fans.

title: Bonn and Moscow Agree to Work Out A Compromise on Berlin Institutions
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 3The Soviet Union and West Germany agreed today to develop a compromise formula on how to represent West Berlin's legal institutions in Eastern European countries.

title: Tannens Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Stephen D. Tannen of Lynbrook, L. I., on Oct. 18 in the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L. I. Mrs. Tannen is the former Miss Ann Koeppel. The child has been named Heather Dawn. Her father is a manager in the personal care products division of the ColgatePalmolive Company.

title: Bucks Win 9th in Row By 123115
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 3 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks, behind successive baskets by Bob Dandridge, Curtis Perry and Oscar Robertson, opened a 6  point lead in the first two minutes of overtime tonight and held on for a 123115 National Basketball Association victory over Detroit.

title: Ellen J. Goldberg Prospective Bride
description: Rabbi Jacob Goldberg, spiritual leader of the Fort Tryon Jewish Center, and Mrs. Goldberg have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ellen Judith Goldberg, to Stanley Mondrow, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alex Mondrow of Maspeth, Queens.

title: From well to skylight$37.000
description: It isn't what you have, it's how you put it together. This makes as much sense in building as it does in fashion. Othe most commonplace materials were used in this vacation home in East Hampton, LLsliding glass doors, plywood panels, Sheetrock, Lolly columns (usually used to hold up sagging floor beams), marine turnbuckles and cable. Yet, with these absolutely standard items, designer Joseph D'Urso fashioned an extremely sophisticated house. Harry Blumenfeld had been considering buying a builder's model house for $30,000 until D'Urso talked him into a custom design for the same amount. By the time the house was finished, it actually cost $37,000, but that included everythingall the appliances, the well, lighting, builtin furniture and the designer's fee. In return, Blumenfeld gained a moderatecost weekend retreat with three bedrooms and two bathrooms, that was completely individual, a house that would not be found in every resort subdivision.

title: Handicraft Fair Slated in Westfield
description: WESTFIELDAn international handicraft sale will be held at the Presbyterian Church here this week.

title: The Mystery the Missing Movies
description: WERE a battered when Carrie Snodgress drunlenly drowned her infant in the movie version of John Updike's Rabbit Run? Were you dazzled by the purity of Anouk Aimee's love for Omar Sharif in The Appointment? Did you find Lana Turner a trifle elderly for George Hamilton in The Big Cube? Did Alan Arkin make you laughor cryas, the oddball drifter in Deadhead Miles? Did you feel Bette Davis should have copped another Oscar as the sexually frustrated cradle snatcher in Connecting Rooms?

title: PLANNERS ACTING ON PRESERVATION
description: The City Planning Commission will announce legislation this week to create preservation districts in certain neighborhoods.

title: Queens Nan Slain In Traffic Dispute; Police Seize Youth
description: A 21yearold man was stabbed to death last night during a dispute over a traffic incident at the intersection of 148th Street and South Road in the South Jamaica section of Queens, according to the police.

title: Assemblyman Wright's Power Is Main Issue in 54th Assembly District
description: Whether or not affairs of Ocean HillBrownsville's 54th Assembly District will be dominated by one man is the main issue in the threeway race to fill the vacated Beat of Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright.

title: The Adventures of Rattlesnake Ralph
description: Tell you what, said the wise old editor as he handed me this book. Stay with this one. It may grow on you. Well, I did and it did. The Adventures of Rattlesnake Ralph is one of those stories that start out by making you impatient with the author's lack of imagination and end by making you ashamed of your own. The story of how Ralph Jones becomes Rattlesnake Ralph, a legend in his own time, is a very good yarn indeed. And that's rare enough these days, when good handmade, homespun yarns have largely been replaced by machinecut yardgoods.

title: Tabatchnick's Means Lox
description: UNIONThere is a food store in the Millburn Mall here that might well be the only one of its kind that stands back to back with its own huge fish processing and smoking plant. It isn't every appetizing shop that sells nearly 1,300 pounds of smoked fish a week up front, while processing 15,000 pounds of it to the rear.

title: The Economy
description: WASHINGTON  Can a nation's economy keep growing and producing jobs and profits when the future of the nation's political leadership is in grave doubt? The stock market last week seemed to answer a loud no, though the war in the Middle East may have contributed as much as the news from Washington to the biggest oneweek market decline in years.

title: Pitt Sends Syracuse to 8th Defeat
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 3 (AP) Tony Dorsett, a freshman tailback, and Billy Daniels, quarterback, combined for 376 yards rushing today and paced Pittsburgh to a 2814 football victory over Syracuse, which has not won eight games this year.

title: Civil Liberties Union Lauds Only Blumenthal
description: Of three major party mayoral aspirants, only Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, the Liberal candidate, reflects any concern for the goals of racial desegregation, the executive director of the New York Civil Liberties Union said yesterday.

title: Hansen Hits 113 M.P.H., Keeps Title
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 3 (UPI)Jerry Hansen broke the Road Atlanta class lap record by five seconds today, winning his second straight Formula A title and ninth Sports Car Club of America national championship.

title: Craft Speeds Toward Mercury On the Wings of Student's Idea
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 3Spacecraft used to get where they were going by brute rocket force alone. Now, a spacecraft, Mariner 10, is speeding toward Venus and eventually Mercury to demonstrate that the gravity of one planet can provide a free ride to a more distant planet.

title: Alabama Remains Unbeaten
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 3 (AP)  Secondranked Alabama got a 38yard touchdown run from Randy Billingsley and a 29yard scoring run from Willie Shelby tonight as the undefeated Crimson Tide crushed Mississippi State, 350; in Southeastern Conference football.The 28point underdog Bulldogs stayed with Alabama for a half, trailing only 130 after several of their offensive thrusts were choked off by Alabama's bigplay defense.

title: the traveler's world
description: THIS is our fourth annual report on the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission. Our countdown, as of today, is minus two years and eight months from target, the nation's 200th birthday, and the prospect is still for a celebration consisting of a hodgepodge of small and modest events, neighborhood and citywide block parties and community historical and cultural programs, but none of the blockbusting, grandiose events envisioned when Congress authorized the official recognition of 1976.

title: News of the Stage
description: For almost 25 years, Arthur Miller has refused to allow a professional production of his memorable Death of a Salesman, either in New York City or in any place within 100 miles of Broadway.

title: City Council Unit Sets Open Meeting Thursday
description: The following open hearing by a City Council committee will be held this week:

title: A Drawback Is Found in New Math
description: TRENTON  When Johnny starts discussing Commutative law, base five or set theory, those parents who have been unable to understand elementaryschool modern mathematics should ask him to multiply eight times nine. They may tot get an answer.

title: The Region
description: It was hard to believe. All week long residents of the metropolitan area, a capital of the consumer society, were belabored with warnings that come the winter they might have to make do with less heat and light and pay more for the little that was doled out to them.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Johncock Victor; Bobby Unser Hurt
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. (AP)  Gordon Johncock slipped by his teammate, Wally Dallenbach, 19 miles from the finish today and won the wreckmarred Arizona 150mile race at Fastrack International Speedway. The event was the last of the United Auto Clubs championship trail races of the season.

title: Ballet: Massive Parade
description: A good case could be made for. Lonide Massine's Parade being the most, arcane ballet in the American repertory. It was created by the Diaghilev Ballet in 1917 with a scenario by Jean Cocteau, scenery and costumes by Pablo Picasso and music by Erik Satie. Nearly 60 years later it still seems new and orginal.

title: Dating game, building game, eating game
description: This is a courageous book, an attempt to come to terms with a problem which many archeologists are merely hoping will go away. What has happened is difficult to explain concisely  and Colin Renfrew in fact takes five chapters to explain the dilemma in which archeologists now find themselves.

title: Marriage Planned By Barbara Desch
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Carl W. Desch of Garden City, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Kay Desch, to Michael D. Lenihan, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Joseph Lenihan.

title: Common Arena Urged for Area Shows
description: With the problem of obtaining show grounds becoming more acute each year, Mrs. Arlene Thompson, breederexhibitor, show chairwoman for the Bronx County Kennel Club and a judge, has come up with a possible solution. Speaking at the recent meeting of the Long Island Chapter of the Oviner  Handler Association of. America, she proposed that several clubs in the metropolitan area band together and use a common facility for their shows. She suggested the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L.I.

title: 12 Buildings Cited for Design
description: A dozen new buildings in Nassau and Suffolk Counties were singled out last week for recognition of their excellent design in the 13th of a series of annual competitions sponsored by the Long Island Association of Commerce and Industry and the Long Island chapter of the American Institute of Architects.

title: Hollywood's Happy Ending: A Profitable Twist
description: HOLLYWOOD  Just as the motion picture industry seemed to be climbing out of the financial trough it dug for itself in the late nineteensixties, it has been stunned by what it considers the abandonment of its business by MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc.

title: Headliners
description: There was joy in Cameroon last week: It was announced that the sacred African statue, the AfoAKom, would soon be back in the tiny, isolated kingdom of Kom. The present owner of the statue, Aaron Furman, a New York art dealer, agreed to return the statue without profit after learning about its significance, and the fact that it had been stolen seven. years ago, in a New York Times story. The AfoAKom, a centuryold, 64inchhigh carving of a man, is regarded by the 40,000 people of Kom as the manifestation of their political and religious heritage. It vanished mysteriously from its storage but in 1966, later, it is believed, was sold in Paris and eventually was bought by Mr. Furman from a dealer whose reputation the New Yorker described as impeccable. Following the loss of the statue, the Kom people went into mourning, began quarreling among themselves, and refused to accept a substitute symbol. Now they, feel peace and harmony will be theirs again.

title: Leigh Keyser, a Law Student, Is Engaged to Peter L. Phillips
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 3Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. William Adamson Jr. of Princeton and Marion, Mass., of the engagement of Mrs. Adamson's daughter, Miss Helen Leigh Keyser, to Peter Lewis Phillips, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Morgan Phillips of Whitemarsh, Pa., and Sargentville, Me.

title: Joe Frazier Forms Clinic
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3 (UPI)Joe Frazier, the former heavyweight boxing champion, has announced the establishment of a new clinic to treat sickle cell anemia and other blood diseases affecting Negroes. The clinic, named for Mr. Frazier's manager, the late Yancey Durham Jr., will continue efforts begun two years ago by the National Sickle Cell Anemia Foundation.

title: China Tour a Possibility For N.H.L.'s Top Stars
description: PEKING  Bobby Orrcoaching hockey in Peking?

title: A Texan Fulfills Wish Of Fatally Ill Woman
description: ALTON, Ill., Nov. 3 (AP)A wealthy Texan has fulfilled a wish of an Illinois woman who has been told the has terminal cancer.

title: Suit on Air Force Wig Ban
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3 (UPI)A class action suit here contends that an Air Force ban on shorthaired wigs, used by some servicemen to conceal hair longer than regulation length, violates freedom of speech and other constitutional rights of servicemen. The suit was filed in United States District Court Wednesday on behalf of nine members of the Illinois Air National Guard and other members of the armed forces.

title: Ohio State Conquers Illini, 300
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Nov. 3 (Al)  Cornelius Greene smashed to two of Ohio State's three touchdowns the fourth quarter and the Buckeyes, wore down Illinois for a 300 triumph today in a battle of uribeaten Big Ten football Contenders.

title: U. S. LIMITS USE OF COAST DESERT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 3 The Federal Government imposed restrictions this week on public use of a large part of the great southern California desert in an effort to curb its accelerating despoliation by motorized recreationists and Vandals.

title: Corena  A Boffo Basso Buffo
description: TWENTY years ago next Feb. 6, an unexpected debut was made at the Metropolitan Opera by a relatively unknown Swiss bass named Fernando Corena. He had been engaged for a new production of II Barbiere di Siviglia, scheduled to open two weeks later, but the illness of an artist due to sing Leporello in Don Giovanni precipitated Corena onto the Met's stage earlier and without a rehearsal.

title: Chlid to the Rothbards
description: MILLBURN, N.J., Nov. 3A daughter was born on Oct. 23 to Mr. and Mrs. George A. Rothbard at St. Barnabus Medical Center in Livingston. The child has been named Ellen Gayle.

title: State Formalizes Its Riparian Claims
description: HACKENSACKA public hearing here next Thursday could open the way for adding millions of dollars to the state's treasury. But the people who would have to pay that money are not expected to yield it all that easily.

title: Aglimmer Beats 12 Rivals In Firenze, Pays $10.20
description: While hopes for a match race between Secretariat and Prove Out evaporated on the telephone, a gray filly named Aglimmer raced to victory on the grass at Aqueduct yesterday in the $60,250 Firenze Handicap.

title: Episcopal bishop Calls for Renewal
description: Episcopalians of the staid 106yearold Diocese of Long Island last week warmly wet coned the Right Rev. Cuthbert K. N. Bardsley 66, Bishop of Coventry, England, during an eightday Call to Renewal.

title: Son to the Costellos
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Richard N. Costello on Oct. 19 in the New York Hospital. Mrs. Costello, a freelance writer and editor, and a former feature editor with Harper's Bazaar, is the former Miss Ann Dodds of Dallas.

title: Air Force Hands Army 7th Loss, 4310
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Nov. 3 (AP)Steve Heil and Paul DeHart returned interceptions for touchdowns as Air Forbe defeated Army, 4310, today.

title: A Placater for Turnpike and the Public
description: EAST BRUNSWICK Sometime in the near future, the New Jersey Turnpike Authority is expected to announce its plans for widening, from six to 12 lanes, that portion of the toll road that bisects Milltown and East Brunswick. The man most likely to feel the backlash from the announcement is Ray Dasch, the authority's new Community Relations Manager.

title: Stable Girl, 29, Jockeying for Position
description: Joy Gibson plans to be at the English Derby at Epsom in 1975as a jockey.

title: Pro
description: It's zoning hearing night in suburbia, and in hundreds of town halls you will hear a murmur building into a gusty version of the old World War I song, Over There. Though the verses differ in particulars from town hall to town hall, the essential chorus is the same:

title: North Korea Says It Seized Japanese Vessel Off Coast
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 3 (Reuters)North Korea announced today it had detained the 10man crew of a Japanese ship that it said had intruded into North Korean waters.

title: Rose, Harrelson Fined $250 Apiece for Brawl
description: Bud Harrelson of the Mets and Pete Rose of the Cincinnati Reds have been fined $250 each by the National League for their fight that. nearly precipitated a riot during the third game of the league playoffs on Oct. 8 at Shea Stadium.

title: REPUBLICANS FACE TEST IN ROCKLAND
description: NEW CITY, N. Y. Nov. 2Rockland County voters will finally get their chance Tuesday to indicate how seriously they considered longstanding Democratic charges of alleged corruption by Republican officeholders.

title: GUILD AND NEWS STEP UP TALKS
description: The Newspaper Guild and. The Daily News stepped up the pace of their contract talks yesterday in the face of a guild, threat to strike at 7 A.M, tomorrow if no agreement was reached.

title: Princeton Adopts Plan for Big Tract
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Motivated by the promise of profit and the need to defend itself against the inexorable encroachment of commercial and residential development, Princeton University has decided to convert part of its extensive land holdings into a universityoriented, 1,600acre planned development.

title: Horse Show Jumping Courses Flexible
description: It's rather like a child's building set, said Mrs. Pamela Carruthers as she fussed over her sketches of the international and open jumper courses at the National Horse Show at Madison Square Garden. From a supply of fences, rails, simulated brick walls and other obstacles she assembles a course that will test the rider's judgment as well as the horse's ability.

title: Home Repair Clinic
description: Questions from readers about home repair problems should be addressed to Home Improvement Department, The New York Times, Times Square, New. York, N.Y. 10036. Only those questions of general interest will be answered in this column:

title: Algeria's Leader Visits Syria; Soviet Aide Also in Damascus
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 3President Hafez alAssad of Syria conferred in Damascus today with... President Houari Boumediene of Algeria, officials in the Syrian capital said. Also in Damascus for talks was the Soviet Union's First Deputy Foreign Minister, Vasily V. Kuznetsov.

title: Sierra Club Loses a Plea For Lower Postal Rates
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 3 (AP)The Sierra Club has lost its bid in Federal District Court to be considered an educational organization and save about $50,000 annually by getting special secondclass and thirdclass postal rates.

title: Pop
description: THE old  time chick singer carrying the torch for her man who has made her either the most miserable or the happiest girl in the whole U.S.A. is fast being replaced by a new breed. Clearly Yoko Ono's credentials as a free spirit unencumbered by traditional chauvinist baggage are solid. But Bette Midler, wearing those practically paintedon dresses and recreating the Andrews Sisters, may seem a strange representative of change.

title: SAXBE'S NET WORTH IS PUT AT $275,000
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 3 (AP)Senator William B. Saxbe, Republican of Ohio, nominated to be United States At torney General, said today that his net worth is $275,000, including 25,000 shares in a ski resort in Ohio's Logan County. In a telephone interview from Washington, Senator Saxbe said the stock is in Ohio Resorts, Incorporated, which owns the Valley High Ski Resort, near Bellefontaine.

title: What's Doing in PUERTO RICO
description: OLD SAN JUANWalking the narrow, blue cobblestone streets of Old San Juan is a joy since the Institute of Puerto Rican Culture started a restoration program in 1956. The area is now a living museum with about onethird of its buildings restored as closely as possible to what they were in Spanish colonial times. San Juan was founded by Juan Ponce de Leon in the early 1500's, before he discovered Florida and more than 100 years before the Pilgrims landed at Plymouth, Mass. The city has the Western Hemisphere's oldest executive mansion (La Fortaleza), and church (San Jose). The institute oversees all aspects of historical restoration and among the results are gracious homes with interior patios, sweeping arches and carved wood balconies. Most gift shops, art galleries and restaurants are in restored buildings, as are the many small museums operated by the institute. A tour of the old city should include visits to the massive stone ramparts of El Morro and Fort San Cristobal, from which attacks by Sir Francis Drake and other marauders were repulsed. The official visitors guide, Que Pasa (What's Happening), lists 28 sightseeing stops in the old city.

title: Transportation Bond at Issue
description: Although billions in new transportation projects are at stake from Sunnyside, Queens, to the end of Suffolk, the campaign on Long Island for and against Governor Rockefeller's $3.5billion transportation bond issue proposal has proceeded as serenely and almost as secretly as the election of a new Pope.

title: U.N. Force in Egypt Reports Successes In Easing Tensions West of the Canal
description: CAIRO, Nov. 3The United Nations Emergency Force reported successes today in easing tensions between Egyptian and Israeli troops, especially in the mixedup positions west of the Suez Canal.

title: Opera Season Is Beginning
description: WEST ORANGE  When Alfredo Silipigni, the artistic director and conductor of the Opera Theater of New Jersey; lifts his baton in Symphony Hall in Newark tonight, thus launching the Opera Theater's eighth season, he will be adding the musical elements to a job that often has relatively little to do with music.

title: Migrants Learn to Harvest Sea
description: LEESBURG  Migrant farm workers are taking to the sea in an effort to rid themselves of the poverty they face on land.

title: Suffolk Weighing a Proposal to Require Developers to Plan for Sewer Systems
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I.Suffolk County is weighing a controversial sewers for all policy that would require every developer to make provisions for sewer systems, thereby, critics claim, taking the first step toward implementing a proposed $700million plan to construct sewers throughout the entire East End over the next 50 years.

title: Felicia The Critic
description: Harriet ran very fast all the way up to her room. I'm starting the sixth grade, she yelled, just to keep herself company. She got her notebook, slammed her door, and thundered down the steps. Goodby, goodby, she yelled, as though she were going to Africa, and slammed out the front door.

title: Detroit Rivals Avoid Race Issue
description: DETROIT, Nov. 3Not once during the campaign for Mayor of Detroit that will end with Tuesday's election has either candidate  one white, one blackmade any overt appeal to racial fear. That may be a first in the latterday bigcity politics of race, and therein may lie the campaign's meaning.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester* day was:

title: Navy Service Snarls Pension Case for City Worker
description: For the last five years a Police Department mechanic, recently turned 65, alas been trying to plan for his retirement, but has been thwarted by an apparent bureaucratic inability to compute his pension.

title: NASSAU ST. MAID BEING PROMOTED
description: Seeking to avoid a glaring omission in their approach to the aborted Madison Avenue Mall, city planners began last week to get grassroots reaction to a proposed nineblock pedestrian enclave on Nassau Street in Lower Manhattan.

title: Estate Provides A Link to Nature
description: LLOYD HARBOR, L.I. During the Revolutionary War, Target Rock was used for shooting practice by the British. But today, silence replaces the sound of guns, and nature lovers can enjoy the many types of plant and animal life as they walk through the 80acre national wildlife refuge.

title: Art in London
description: LONDON. JUST behind Burlington House, off the narrow thoroughfare named Burlington Gardens that runs between Regent Street and Bond Street, stands the Ethnography Department of the British Museum, otherwise the Museum of Mankind, a place in which few native Londoners  and, naturally, even fewer touristsseem ever to have set foot. Indeed, I did not learn of its existence myself until, during a recent visit to Mexico City, a Mexican friend spoke admiringly of its PreColumbian collection. Today, Burlington House is packed with visitors, drawn by the splendid Chinese exhibition that opened earlier this month; while the adjoining Museum of Mankind is as quiet as a monastery garden. This is regrettable; for its latest exhibition, besides being particularly wellarranged, precents a fine survey of a MesoAmerican culture that once extended from Guatemala, Honduras and San Salvador into Yucatan, Tabasco and other southeasterly regions of the modern Mexican Republic.

title: Stamps
description: CANADA has issued a new series of lowdenomination definitive stamps that strike out in a new direction in that nation's postal history. The new issue portrays six former prime ministers and Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Rosa Lee Kendall Is Affianced To Lieut. Robert V. Sinnott
description: FREDERICKSBURG, Va., Nov. 3Lieut. Col. Donald John Kendall Jr., U.S.M.C., retired, and Mrs. Kendall of Fredericksburg have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rosa Lee Kendall, to Lieut. (j.g.) Robert Vose Sinnott, U.S.N., son of Dr. and Mrs. John Sinnott Jr. of Rumson, N. J.

title: Soccer Storm Brewing in Soviet Bloc
description: The International Football Federation's decision Friday to eliminate the Soviet Union from the World Cup unless it agreed to play Chile in Santiago later this month affirmed the federation's position that it is not in soccer to serve political purposes.

title: Alfred's Kicks Sink Kings Point, 23 to 7
description: ALFRED, N. Y., Nov. 3Don Hockenberry kicked field goals of 22, 48 and 50 yards today as Alfred defeated Kings Point, 237 before a Parents Day crowd. It was the sixth victory In eight this year for Alfred and the 160th in the Alfred coaching career of Alex Yunevich.

title: And Then What Happened, Paul Revere?
description: How many times have opened these pages with some hesitation and a tinge of trepidation, to see what a faceless reviewer had to say about my latest book. Does he realize how much work I've put into it? Is he aware that it cost eight months of my life? Will he really look at it closely and look at it many more times before rendering his judgment? Is he aware of his obligation?

title: The Curious Partners in Arabian Oil
Engineer Weds Leslie A. Keeler, S. M. U. Alumna
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Nov. 3 Miss Leslie Anne Keeler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. LeRoy H. Keeler Jr. of Gladwyne, was married here this afternoon to William Gary Polsen, son of William Francis Polsen, Chief of Police for Yonkers, and WS. Polsen of Yonkers. The Rev. Dr. David B. Watermulder performed the ceremony in the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church.

title: L.I.R.R. Changes Schedule
description: The Long Island Rail Road says it plans to run an augmented holiday schedule of trains on Election Day that will retain more than 80 per cent of the line's regular weekday commuter runs.

title: Davis: Seven Touchdowns
description: Pierre Davis, an agile 5foot10inch, 185pound Bayside halfback, seemed unstoppable yesterday, scoring 50 points on seven touchdowns and four conversions as the Commodores routed inexperienced August Martin, 520, in a Queens P.S.A.L. game at Bayside. It was unbeaten Bayside's seventh straight victory.

title: HOLIDAY INNS AGREE ON MOTELS MERGER
description: ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 3 (Reuters)Holiday Inns, Inc., and American Motor Inns Inc. announced today that directors of the two companies had agreed on a merger of American Motor Inns into Holiday Inns in a transaction estimated at $38million.

title: San Francisco Leg Of Transit System Has Delayed Start
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 3The troubleplagued Bay Area Rapid Transit system officially opened operations in San Francisco today with bands, dancers, speeches and ribboncuttings.

title: Colonia Turns Back Iselin, 217
description: Pete Fenton ran 13 times for 69 yards and two touchdowns yesterday as Colonia continued to bid for Middlesex County Conference championship with a 217 victory over Iselin in Woodbridge.

title: KISSINGER PRESSES MIDEAST LEADERS FOR SETTLEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Secretary of State Kissinger's efforts to resolve the problems of the Middle East ceasefire apparently intensified today as he shuttled between the Egyptian Foreign Minister, Ismail Fahmy, and Premier Golda Meir of Israel.

title: Malcolm Lowry
description: Douglas Day's scrupulous and levelheaded biography of Malcolm Lowry fails, understandably, to raise one important question: Why should anyone ever want to be a writer? In Lowry's case everything was against it. He himself wrote of one of his transparently autobiographical heroes: He is disinterested in literature, uncultured, incredibly unobservant, in many respects ignorant, without faith in himself, and lacking nearly all the qualities you normally associate with a novelist or a writer. In Professor Day's milder words, Lowry was no natural. The early drafts of his works are clumsy and curiously naive, and he had to batter them into shape by, literally, endless rewriting. His one masterpiece, Under the Volcano, took him 10 years to complete and went through four separate drafts, the last of which itself went through at least four stages. Even after it had been published and made his name, he still talked vaguely of revising it yet again.

title: Broker Wins Big Judgment In Dispute on Commissions
description: Williams Real Estate Company, Inc., has won a $2.1million judgment against Sheldon H. Solow, the builder, in what is believed to be the largest award ever made in the city in litigation over real estate brokerage fees.

title: Comedian Burglary Victim
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3 (UPI)Don Rickles, the comedian, and Paul Kohner, a theatrical agent, were among the victims in a $30,000 burglary from six hotel rooms at the Ambassador East Hotel last night. The authorities said that the burglars apparently obtained a pass key and entered through service doors. They said that about $30,000 in United States foreign currency and jewelry had been taken.

title: Crenshaw, with 203, LeadsAgain
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Now 3 (AP)Ben Crenshaw, broke a fourway tie for the lead with a fiveunderpar 66 today and again took the top spot in the $125,000 San AntonioTexas open golf tournarnent. He had a total of 203 for three rounds.

title: Protagonist Wins Easily In Futurity.
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 3 (AP)  Elmendorf's Protagonist closed from well off the pace today to win going away in the $129,940 Laurel Futurity, the final rich juvenile rate of the season.

title: Lattimore's 2 Thefts Help Morristown Roll to No. 7
description: Tony Lattimore, a junior linebacker, excelled as Morristown edged Livingston, 2014, yesterday in a battle between unbeaten teams at Morristown. Each had won its first six games.

title: Seoul Aide Offers to Meet Pyongyang Official at U.N.
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 3 South Korea's Foreign Minister, Kim Yong Shik, said today that he would be willing to meet with Foreign Minister Ho Dam of North Korea in New York if Mr. Ho wanted such a meeting.

title: On 2dHalf Spree, 5114
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 3 (UPI)Mike Miley passed for one touchdown and ran for another today as unbeaten, seventhranked Louisiana State trounced Mississippi, 5114, in a nationally televised game.

title: An Agency Places Volunteers
description: SOMERVILLE  A group of women in Somerset County, operating with little money but much enthusiasm, recently opened New Jersey's sixth Voluntary Action Center.

title: Carol N. La Rosa Engaged to Marry
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Russell F. La Rosa have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol N. La Rosa, to Lawrence Paul Guiheen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Giheen of Somerville, N. J.

title: CONTROLLER RACE HAS 2 UNDERDOGS
description: State Senator Harrison J. Goldin, the DemocraticLiberal candidate for City Controller seems assured of victory on Election Day, but his two major opponents say they still hope to win.

title: Wallace Has Surgery; Condition Satisfactory
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 3 (UPI)  Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama underwent minor surgery today at University Hospital and later was listed in satisfactory condition

title: Law
description: A high school mathematics teacher orders an eightydollar pocket calculator by mail. After six weeks, all he receives is his cancelled check. The firm doesn't answer his letters of complaint; its answering service diverts his calls. Then he discovers that a few friends have had the same experience: What the company multiplies best is victims of consumer fraud.

title: Hospital Closing Is Avoided
description: The bankrupt Community Hospital of Brooklyn, which faced the possibility of being forced to shut down if it could not make a $55,000 bond payment by the first of this month, managed to make the payment as well as to raise an additional $25,000.

title: Byrne and Sandman Cool to Paring Power Over Judgeships
description: TRENTON  A proposal calling for the Governor of New Jersey to surrender part of his nomination prerogatives to an independent commission has received a cool reception from the major gubernatorial candidates in Tuesday's election:

title: Egyptian Says Missile Was Fired Before Truce
description: CAIRO, Nov. 3A Cairo editor said today that an Egyptian missile of the Zafir type was fired at a distant Israeli position only five minutes before the ceasefire with Israeli forces at 6:50 P.M., Cairo time (12:50 P.M., New York time), Oct. 22.

title: Football Transactions
description: DALLASActivated Cyril Pinder, running back, Raytield Wright, offensive tackle, and Toni Fritsch, kicker. Placed Otto Stowe, wide receiver, Les Sirayhorn, run. nine back, and John Niland, guard, on the move list.

title: Notes: Science Cruises Becoming Popular
description: WHEN two young entrepreneurs, Dr. Phil Sigler and Ted Pedas, sold an executive of the Greek Lines on the idea of sending a cruise ship into the path of an eclipse to enable the passengers to view and learn about astronomical phenomena, they started a minor but interesting trend. Since July, 1972, when 800 passengers jammed to capacity the Greek Lines' Olympia to sail to the midAtlantic and view a total solar eclipse, other cruise companies have successfully operated somewhat similar scienceoriented journeys. In the coming months another is scheduled: It is a short Atlantic cruise aboard Cunard's Queen Elizabeth 2 in December that will allow passengers to get a superb view of Kohoutek, a new comet recently discovered to be approaching the earth.

title: Vietnam Veterans in Area Failing to Utilize G.I. Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Vietnam veterans in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut are taking significantly less advantage of the educational benefits of the G.I. Bill of Rights than their counterparts across the country. On a per capita basis, for example, California veterans have received nearly twice as much in benefits New York's.

title: Reagan's Dream Package
description: Gov. Ronald Reagan of California has placed on the state's ballot a striking constitutional amendment that would limit state expenditures, reduce state income taxes, and thus make Ronald Reagan appear the answer to a taxpayer's prayer. His dream package, moreover, has been touted about the country in expensive press kits as a splendid model for the other states; and it is generally supposed that Mr.. Reagan will make a run for the Presidency on the platform that he is the man who saved California from the spenders, and who can save you, too.

title: The Friends
description: I feel especially blessed when reading the books of Virginia Hamilton, Toni Cade Bambara, Lucille Clifton, June Jordan, Louise Merriweather, Toni Morrison and other fine engage black women writers; for I am thinking of a young black girl who spent the first 20 years of her life without seeing a single book in which the heroine was a person like herself.

title: Police Band to Bring Pupils its Beat
description: IRVINGTON  A quintet called Les Cochons Bleus will perform at nine assembly programs at elementary schools here next week. What should make it interesting for the students is that the musicians are all Detroit policemen and the program will be rock music.

title: CLEVELAND POLL FAVORS THE G.O.P
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 3Despite overwhelming odds against their candidate, Democratic officials are working hard to get her elected as Mayor, Tuesday.

title: Yale Is Defeated
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 3 Dartmouth, badly mauled by Yale last year and beaten by them in a preseason scrimmage earlier this season, made amends today by defeating the Elis, 2413, before 19,000 fans in Memorial Stadium.

title: Brezhnev Seen Reaping Prestige Gain in Harvest
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 3Claims of a record Soviet grain harvest, now accepted by Western specialists, are expected to greatly increase the prestige of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the party leader, and Dmitri S. Polyansky, the Politburo troubleshooter in agriculture.

title: Florida Employing Fish From Siberia To Control Weeds
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 3 After four years of experiments, Florida scientists believe a Siberian fish called the White Amur may do a better job than either mechanical means or chemicals in controlling several species of noxious weeds that are choking the state's waters.

title: Joint Fight Set on Abuse Of Drugs And Alcohol
description: WYCKOFF  This community's DrugAbuse Council has taken the initative in what may become a new trend of increased cooperalion between drugabuse and alcoholabuse professionals.

title: Hagan and Suffern Win
description: REAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Nov. 3Mike Hagan posted his sixth victory of the season and led Suffern to the Class A team title today in the New York State Section Nine scholastic crosscountry championships. Hagan ran 12 minutes 47 seconds on the 2.5mile course for the fastest time of the meet.

title: If . . .
description: A personal note makes a professional point. A handsome offer to become Distinguished Professor in Residence came to me from a West Coast universityat the invitation of its Sociology Department. The English Department at Penn tate, host to the Science Fiction Research Association, had me attend a fourday symposium attended by scholars from all over the cormtry, and some from Canada, Israel, Australia and others. I then went to Cornell for an allUniversity ad= dress under the aegis of the Astronomy Department, and next to M.I.T. for a talk at the behest of the Artificial Intelligence Laboratory. Prof. Philip Klass of Penn State, who writes under the name of William Tenn, spoke recently in Delaware to their History Department.

title: CHICAGO 7 GAIN PARTIAL VICTORY
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3 (UPI)United States District Court Judge Edward Gignoux today acquitted the Chicago Seven of 18 of their 38 contemptofcourt charges but denied a blanket motion to dismiss the entire Government case.

title: A Milestone for Ward Melville
description: Ward Melville held Northport to minus 2 yards on the ground yesterday and the undefeated Patriots defeated the Tigers 140 to clinch the AAII league championship, their first since starting football in 1966.

title: Nixon Approves Rise in Aid To Amtrak of $407Million
description: KEY BISCAYNE Fla., Nov. 3 (AP)President Nixon signed with reservations today legislation increasing by $407million the Federal aid to Amtrak, the National Rail Passenger Corporation.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may he obtained from the beneficiary unless otherwise indicated:

title: 21 Architects Win Design Awards
description: Twentyone architects, including three from the New York area, have been cited for their imaginative use of cedar shakes and shingles in a competition sponsored by the American Institute of Architects and the Red Cedar Shingle and Handsplit Shake Bureau.

title: Mideast Aftermath War of Words Spreads As the Shooting Ends
description: WASHINGTON  People who had watched the NATO alliance over the past quarter of a century could not remember anything like itreproach following reproach by the highest United States officials publicly questioning the loyalty of the European allies and the basis of the alliance itself. Most of the West Europeans in the 15member alliance had their backs up, too.

title: Sun and Rain Cooperate for Brighter Farm Marketing Year
description: TRENTONMother Nature and market conditions have combined to produce a boom year for New Jersey farmers.

title: 8 Straight for Miami
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Nov. 3 (UPI)Miami of Ohio, rated 19th in the nation, posted its eighth victory today and took over the MidAmerican Conference leadership with a 249 victory over Western Michigan.

title: Chileans Execute 4 on Eve Of an Allende Anniversary
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 3 (UPI)Chilean military authorities intensified security measures today, the eve of the third anniversary of the inauguration of the overthrown President Salvador Allende Goyens, and announced that four men who had been Allende followers had been executed.

title: AROUND THE
description: Continue cleanup. . . . Use soft sponge and warm water to wash leaves of large foliage plants. . . Finish bulb planting soon.... Pull up spent vegetables and annuals; add to compost. . . . Start new house plants from seed or cuttings.

title: ULSTER INTERNEES REPORTED IN STRESS
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 3 The semi  permanent character of internment without trial in Northern Ireland is leading to increased psychological strain among internees, according to a report by the International Committee of the Red Cross.

title: Columbia Bows, 4414, To Cornell
description: ITHACA, N.Y. Nov. 3Mark Allen, Cornell's senior quarterback set a college career record today by throw ing four passes for touchdowns, as the Big Red defeated Columbia, 44 to 14.

title: A Lake Is Backdrop for ebate On Suburban Integration Plan
description: The Suburban Action Institute, a nonprofit group dedicated to opening the suburbs to minorities and the poor, has waged a long and emotionfilled campaign throughout suburbia. The battle has perhaps become most heated along the shores of Candlewood Lake, in Fairfield County, Conn., where an institute affiliate has proposed a 253acre residential development, known as WatersEdge. The plan has stirred the wrath of New Fairfield and Sherman, the towns it would affect. Last week, Suburban Action had suit against New Fairfield, charging that the town had illegally denied approval for the project. Below are the views of two of the participants in the controversy, Paul Davidoff, the executive director of the Suburban Action Institute, and Malcolm Cowley, the distinguished critic, who is a resident Sherman and a spokesman for the opposition.

title: Art
description: THE National Gallery of Art in Washington opened its first exhibition of modern art last Sunday. American Art at MidCentury, and around the place they'll tell you it's a landmark. In a way it is, but perhaps not in exactly the way they mean. As a symptom of policy this exhibition with Jackson Pollock's Blue Poles as its centerpiece indicates no change. It leaves the National Gallery what it was before, what it properly should be, and what let's fervently hope it will remaina repository and presentation case for art that has made the grade and stood the test of time.

title: Proposed Maine Power Authority Fought Bitterly
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 3Although there are no statewide contests for office in next Tuesday's special election the proposal to create a Power Authority of Maine has engendered enough controversy to guarantee a lively Election Day in Maine.

title: . . . And Women Are Taking HomeRepair Courses
description: EAST ROCKAWAY, L. I.  Basement workshops in suburbia soon may turn into a noman's land.

title: Toros Hand 54 Defeat To Whalers
description: BOSTON Nov. 3 (UPI)Guy Trottier scored a goal at 14:51 of the final period today and also had two Assists to lift the Toronto Toros to a 54 victory over the New England Whalers in a World Hockey Association game.

title: 50,000 Toll Seen in Ethiopian Drought
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 3 (Reuters)At least 50,000 people are estimated to have died in the last six months in a drought in central and northern Ethiopia.

title: DRUG LAW CHANGE SOUGHT BY PERCY Senator Plans to Ask Repeal of NoKnock Provision
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3Senator, Charles H. Percy has decided) to introduce within two weeks legislation to repeal the controversial noknock provision of the Federal statutes on drug abuse.

title: Remove Protective Coating A Little at a Time
description: No man is an island, said John Donne. Every man is an island, says John Donovan; or so it seems to me from his three novels. As an islander you can build your makeshift boats, make brief risky voyages, visit with other islanders; but at nightfall you must return to your own.

title: Clarkstown North Keeps Nanuet Scoreless in '73
description: Clarkstown North, the Public Schools Athletic League leader, continued its winning ways yesterday by trouncing Nanuet, 350.

title: Caso Is Confident of Victory In His Bid For ReElection
description: MINEOLA, L. I.Ralph G. Cato, the incumbent Republican Nassau County Executive who is seeking a second term as head of the most heavily populated suburban county in the nation, does not appear to be concerned about his bid for reelection this Tuesday against six other candidates.

title: Soil Cover Used to Bar New Scrub Fire
description: LYNDHURST The Hackensack Meadowlands Commission is beginning a massive effort to lay down a protective soil cover over 1,000 acres of inactive garbage landfills. Purpose of the program is to prevent a repetition of a subterranean fire that plagued the area for 17 days.

title: Atlanta's Black Mayor and and Its Business Image
description: ATLANTA Many of this city's businessmen wanted somebody else for Mayorsomeone other than Maynard H. Jackson Jr., a relatively unknown, black, onetime poverty lawyer. But now nearly everyone, drawn a winner, talks as if he had wanted Mr. Jackson all along.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Waiters circulated with drinks on silver trays among the 200 guests who stood on the red carpet of the Regency Hotel's ballroom suite. Their heads turned when Jim Brown, tall and tapered, appeared in a black cape. Underneath it he had on a black silk shirt, a blackandred plaid sleeveless sweater and black slacks. His hips were as slim as when he was the National Football League's most respected running back. But he's an actor now. During the day, he had been on location at West End Avenue and 70th Street, where they're shooting Three the Hard Way, his latest motion Picture.

title: The Splendor That Was China
description: TATUNG, ChinaThe attribute most pertaining to ancient China was neither the pure glory of Greece, based on harmony of sky, sea and earth, nor the imposing grandeur that was Rome, founded on order and organization, but rather a splendor, variegated and often gaudy, marked by inventiveness and boundless imagination.

title: O'DWYER FAVORED FOR COUNCIL POST
description: Paul O'Dwyer, who has made a name, if not a career, out of bucking the regular Democratic organization, has received solid organizational support in the contest for City Council President and is regarded by political observers as the man most likely to win the office this Tuesday.

title: MRS. WILLIAM M. ADAMS
description: CANAAN, N. Y., Nov. 3 Mrs. Eleanor Perry Adams, wife of Col. William Macmillan Adams, retired president of Sprague World Trade Corporation, died last night at the North Adams (Mass.) Regional Hospital. She was 67 years old and lived here.

title: The State of the Presidency
description: The visible disintegration of President Nixon's moral and political authority, of his capacity to act as Chief Executive, of his claim to leadership and to credibility leads us to the reluctant conclusion that Mr.. Nixon would be performing his ultimate service to the American peopleand to himselfby resigning his office before this nation is forced to go through the traumatic and divisive process of impeachment.

title: Leaks Gains 342 Yards; Texas Wins
description: DALLAS, Nov. 3A Southwest Conference recordbreaking 342yard rushing performance by Roosevelt Leaks paced 14thranked Texas to a 42.14 victory over Southern Methodist today.

title: Tennessee Upset, 3531, By Georgia
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 3 (AP)Andy Johnson ran 8 yards for the deciding touchdown in the final minute today as Georgia upset Tennessee, 3531. The play came as an aftermath of a Tennessee gamble on the fourth down that lost and gave the ball to the Bulldogs on the Vols' 26yard line.

title: Smith and Nastase Gain Final in French Tennis
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (UPI)Stan Smith of the United States and Ilie Nastase of Rumania assured the French indoor tennis tournament a rematch between old adversaries today when they swept through the semifinals.

title: These were bad years for radical politics
description: It doesn't matter when it began the S.D.S. split in 1969, the inability to do much about Kent State or Jackson or Cambodia in 1970, the Mayday jailings in 1971whenever it was, the Movement failed, and for a long time afterward failure seemed to touch every part of one's life. Old friends and lovers became terrible enemies; Janis Joplin overdosed; all the best songs the Stones put out were about snorting and needles and long winter snows. The Luce magazines talked about the cooling of America. What was really happening was that the student revolutionaries of the 1960's were, in the early 1970's, off on a nod.

title: A Beirut Calligrapher Pens Recurring Words of War
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 3Michel Ghafari's hands were steady and his bearing was proud, but his eyes looked very tired as he murmured: It is the same words again and againwar and battles and foreign planes, and how the Arabs are brave.

title: AlkaSeltzer's $143Million Headache
description: Splishsplash. FIZZZzzz. Two tablets are plunked into a glass of water. The name AlkaSeltzer appears.

title: How to make almost everything
description: This Age of Aquarius is also the Age of the Amateur. For, with more leisure and with a reawakening of interest in the Simple Life, the amateur has come into his own. One result has been an avalanche of howto books for both adults and children, from How to Build a House With Your Junk Mail to How to Turn Your Mugger Into Your Friend. (To be found in children's departments is a book that tells a child how to eat an ice cream cone and how to put a stamp on a lettera useful book for a child with an IQ of zero, living in a deserted cabin in the deep woods with a lazy mother.)

title: Lawrence and the Movements Of Modern Culture
description: Among the major writers of the first half of this century Lawrence is, I think, unique for the ambiguous response he has always received from his readers. Not alone today, as we try to fit him to a world which is so much changed from his, but even while he was alive and even among his admirers, his reception was qualified one. James, Proust, Kafka, Yeats, Joyce, Eliot: most of the figures of Lawrence's time, once they were recognized or at least where they were recognized, were accepted with sufficient singlemindedness even James, who probably came closest to Lawrence in the ability to create an unsure response in his public, was eventually more successful than Lawrence in persuading his readers to subdue their reservations to their appreciation.

title: Miss Lyon, Texas Rider, Wins Good Hands Event
description: Dana Lyons, an 18yearold equestrienne from Houston is the National Horse Show riding champion for 1973.

title: Planners Seek to Preserve 2 Neighborhoods in Queens
description: The City Planning Commission, in an effort to protect such neighborhoods as Fresh Meadow and Sunnyside Gardens in Queens from the tentacles of urban growth, has drawn up a proposal under which these areas would be designated preservation districts.

title: CABLE TV TODAY
description: STERLING MANHATTAN (Channel 10)

title: A VIETNAM BRIDGE DESTROYED AGAIN
description: AT THE ONG BO BRIDGE, South Vietnam, Oct. 26At 10 minutes to 1 this morning a shuddering black column of mud, steel and water rose out of the sinuous Trau River, which is framed by placid rice paddies and dimpled with water lilies.

title: U.S.C. Routs California; Davis Scores Five Times
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 3 (UPI)Anthony Davis, held to 55 yards a week ago in Southern California's only loss scored five toudhdowns today in leading the favored Trojans to a 5014 rout of California.

title: BATTISTA ASSIGNED POLICE PROTECTION
description: The Police Department has assigned a bodyguard on a 24hour basis to Assemblyman Vito P. Battista, who is the Conservative party candidate for Councilman at Large in Brooklyn.

title: Democratic Reform:
description: WASHINGTON  We peaked too late, quipped Senator George McGovern. But sure enough, just about a year after he'd led the Democrats to their worst Presidential defeat ever, the party inspired partly by President Nixon's agoniesshowed unmistakable signs of healing as it considered how its next nominee will be chosen.

title: Richard B. Shelton to Marry Wendy Kay
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 3 Miss Wendy Ellen Kay, a reporter for The Pottstown (Pa.) Mercury, plans to be married to Richard Barry Shelton, principal of the West Pottsgrove (Pa.) Elementary School. The ceremony is planned for Dec. 23 at the. Birchwood Country Club.

title: The Good Word: Rhapsodist in Blue
description: When the fine picture book Cole appeared two years ago, it looked as if a sturdy new fad was upon us. The formula was simple and infinitely repeatable: first round up your flotsam (snapshots, old dance shoes, etc.), then get someone as good as Bea Feitler to design it, a Robert Kimball to edit it and a Brendan Gill to introduce it, with the gossipy good taste of a gentleman's gentleman.

title: Joan Mayer Engaged to Dr. J. L. Weese
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Mayer, formerly of Bronxville, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Rebecca Mayer, to Dr. James Leighton Weese, who is serving a residency in surgery at the University of Michigan Medical Center in Ann Arbor.

title: Food Chain to Give Refunds
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Nov. 3 (UPI)The Internal Revenue Service has announced that WinnDixie, Inc., one of the nation's largest food retailers, has agreed to refund nearly $250,000 to customers in the two Carolinas, Virginia, Georgia and Florida. The I.R.S. said Thursday the concern had agreed to reduce prices to make up for violations of Federal price regulations in the past.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: THERE is truth in what Walter Kerr has to say about star actors in Britain supporting the work of new writers at the Royal Court (Sept. 9), but truth in these matters is always a distortion of the facts, and the fact is that the English Stage Company receives a handsome subsidyfrom the Arts Council and is therefore able to have a policy and a house style in its presentations at the Royal Court which are the envy and pride of all, from the humblest repertory company to the richest West End management.

title: Mansion Now Open Weekends
description: RINGWOODFor the first time since New Jersey began to operate Ringwood Park in 1936, the park's historic manor house will be open to the public on a yearround basis.

title: Maryland Bows, 4422
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 3Penn State's opportunistic;defense set up two quick touchdowns at the start of the second half with an interception and a fumble recovery today so the undefeated Nittany Lions could overcome a 2222 halftime deadlock and move on to defeat Maryland, 4222.

title: Puns and anagrams
description: ACROSS

title: Hospitals' Official Convinced Strike Will Begin Tomorrow
description: A spokesman for 48 hospitals and nursing homes in the city facing a threatened work stoppage tomorrow morning by 30,000 professional, technical, maintenance and clerical employes said yesterday he was absolutely convinced a strike would take place.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: From the Police Blotter:

title: Son to the Shatkins
description: A son was born Oct. 18 to Mr. and Mrs. Stuart Shatkin of Mount Vernon, N. Y., at the MidIsland Hospital in Bethpage, L. I. Mrs. Shatkin, whose husband is a lawyer for the Loews Corporation, is the former Miss Terry Redston, The child has been named Noah Scott.

title: Photography
description: TAURA GILPIN and Leland Rice, who are sharing the Witkin Gallery this time around, have little in common as imagemakers aside from their mutual concern with the finely crafted silver print as a communicative vehicle.

title: R. W. Riddle to Wed Geraldine Weathers
description: WESTBURY, LI., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Malvern D. Weathers have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Geraldine Floy Weathers, to Randolph William Riddle of Chicago, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Riddle of Winnetka, Ill.

title: Turnout Is Key In Tuesday Vote
description: TRENTONVoter interest, or a lack of it, in Tuesday's election will be the most important factor in determining control of the 120member State Legislature.

title: List of Nassau Candidates
description: Following are the candidates for Nassau County Executive and town and city supervisors. Asterisks denote incumbent:

title: A Pocket Full of Seeds
description: It is 1943 and the country is France.

title: LYMAN AND CHESS ARE BACK ON TV
description: Introduced by the Gillette sports song, Shelby Lyman, the chess teacher, returned to the air yesterday, providing a movebymove analysis on Channel 13 of the first in fourgame match between the champions of the Marshall and Manhattan. Chess Clubs.

title: DEMOCRATS' GAIN SEEN IN ASSEMBLY
description: Republican political leaders concede that when the final tallies are taken in the five Assembly races and one race for a State Senate seat, the Democrats may wind up with one of the four Assembly seats that have traditionally gone to the Republicans.

title: ExP.O.W. to Run in Dakota
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., Nov. 3 (AP)A Vietnam war veteran, who says his six years in a prisonerofwar camp showed him lie was lucky to be born an American, has announced, his intention to run for they United States Senate or House in 1974. Leo K. Thorsness of Sioux Falls, a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, said Thursday he would seek the Republican nomination for one of those seats.

title: Amy H. Danto Bride Of Michael Hundert
description: Miss Amy Hope Danto, daughter of Mrs. Jules A. Danto of Old Westbury, L. I., and the late Mr. Danto, was married here yesterday to Michael Lee Hundert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Hundert of Chicago. Rabbi Ronald Milstein performed the ceremony at the St. RegisSheraton.

title: Consumers Honor Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) The National Consumers League has presented Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, with its Distinguished Citizen Award.

title: 4 Concerns Ruined by Fire
description: WATERFORD, N.Y., Nov. 3 (UPI)Four businesses were destroyed and 13 families were evacuated from their homes when a fire heavily damaged half a city block in this Hudson River village north of Albany, authorities said. No serious injuries were reported.

title: Cookbooks: A Tester's Choice
description: Food is a terribly important part of the world of children but very few nowadays have the marvelous opportunity of seeing bread come out of the oven, or of knowing that olive oil and egg yolk will make a perfectly lovely aromatic mayonnaise, or of seeing milk, eggs, and sugar turn into a silken custard. To be sure, precious few young mothers have had these experiences either but there is cause for hope, and maybe even optimism, in the flowering of interest in cookery, reflected in the outpouring of literature on the subject.

title: Turf Could Halt Miami
Dig Turns Up Clues to 1800's
description: PATERSON  A group of industrial archeologists, who have been digging in and around an 89acre historic area in which 18thcentury and 19thcentury mills and waterworks are threatened by road construction, came in out of the cold last week and set up winter quarters in an old mill building here.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastem Standard Time

title: Walkowitz Takes 50Mile A.A.U. Run
description: Ed Walkowitz of South Hadley, Mass., a student at the University of Montana, captured the National Amateur Athletic Union 50Mile run yesterday. His time for the run through Central Park was 5 hours 31 minutes 1.8 seconds.

title: The Treasure Is the Rose
description: The children's book world is so difficult to survive in that one rarely has a chance to see a writer grow at his own pace. Julia Cunningham, however, has for many years continued to write without a single nod in the direction of The Market and for this reason her work is very pure. In boles such as Burnish Me Bright and Far in the Day she has created a blend of fantasy and realism that is hers alone, and The Treasure Is the Rose is surely her finest accomplishment.

title: Kerr on House Party
description: ED BULLINS has provided his own critic for House Party. There comes a moment in the authors new gettogether at the American Place when actor Earle Hyman, in frilly blue formal shirt and very sleek slippers, leaps to his feet on our side of the footlights, calls commandingly for house lights, puts a stop to the piano thats been tinkling beneath twinkling dragonwheels hung from the sky.

title: No Sense in Losing Any Sleep Over It
description: THE nation is in trouble. If I were in charge, I would (1) ban all Wacky Packs: Wacky Packs are what our kids get these days with their bubble gum instead of baseball cards, parody ads for popular products  Neverready batteries, Hawaiian Punks  satirizing our most cherished commercial values, destroying young minds and molars, turning profit on our free enterprise system by ripping it off. I would (2) fire every TV newscaster who looks like Mark Spitz. And I would (3) shut down all the networks at 1 o'clock in the morning, so that our citizens could rest up for the brave new work day.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: International Business Machines Corporation has completed an assemblage for an office building on the west side of Madison Avenue between 56th and 57th Streets.

title: New FuelRegulating Task Force to Plan Restrictions on Transportation and Residential Heating in City
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the formation of a task force to regulate fuel consumption in the city by developing an emergency contingency plan. Such a plan will restrict the heating of public and private housing and curtail public transportation and the use of private automobiles.

title: Sihanouk's Mother in China
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 3 (AP)The seriously ill mother of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed Cambodian chief of state, was carried aboard a jet aircraft on a stretcher today and flown to China for a reunion with her son.

title: Population
description: Growth has always been synonymous with the suburbs of New York City, but implicit in the inevitability of growth was the certainty that a limit would someday be reached. That day may have come: Figures updated from the 1970 census show a reversal of the trend in Nassau County. According to a U. S. Census Bureau report on population changes from 1970 to 1972, the population of Nassau has dropped from 1,428,838 to 1,416,800. Although the decline is only 1 per cent, it demonstrates demographically that the boom daysNassau's population increased by more than 750,000 from 1950 to 1970

title: Cardinal Silva Henriquez Of Chile Reports to Pope
description: ROME, Nov. 3  Pope Paul VI today received a report on developments in Chile from the Archbishop of Santiago, Raul Cardinal Silva Henriquez. The 66yearold Roman Catholic primate of Chile conferred with the Pope for an hour.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: Ato Abie Gobenge, Ethiopia's foremost author, called my novel, Kulubi, a love song to Ethiopia.

title: Lecture Tours Flourish as Watergate Whets Public Appetite for Learning
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3  The business of booking speakers is booming again in the wake of Watergate, which agents say has whetted the public's appetite for information of all kinds.

title: Sirica likes his country the way immigrants' sons do A man for this season
description: Mary McCrory says Sirica's not an intellectual. If it means writing books and that kind of thing, then I'm not. But a great intellectual doesn't make a great trial judge. A man who's been a trial lawyer is a better judge of human nature than Professor X at Harvard, who's probably never been in the well of a courtroom. I've been a prosecutor, a defense lawyer, a counsel to a very important investigation on the Hill. . . . I'm a realist as opposed to a theorist, you know me. You have to be able to evaluate peoplelike yori're evaluating me nowmake up your mind about their, credibility. . .. Appeals court judges don't have to shoot from the hip. They have the leisure to think, to decide. We have to make decisions in a split second, whether to sustain or overrule an objection.... You're an intellectual, you've been trained that way. So Sirica's not an intellectual. Who cares! The important question is whether a judge is honest, and does he have the courage of his convictions to do what is right at the moment.

title: AmusementPark Plan Is Main Issue for Mount Olive Voters
description: MOUNT OLIVE  Residents of this western Morris County township will have more on their minds than the general elections when they go to the polls on Tuesday. To many people, here, the ByrneSandman race will be overshadowed by a nonbinding referendum: Should a $20million amusement park be built on prime acreage right off Routes 80 and 46?

title: MRS. JOHN LAVALLE
description: Mrs. Martha Nicholson Lavalle, widow of John Lavalle, artist, died yesterday in New York Hospital. She was 78 years old and lived here and in Southampton, L, I.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Something new has crept into the Maj. SjwellPer Wahl booksif THE LOCKED ROOM (Pantheon, $5.95) is any indicationand that is downright slapstick farce. The same cast of Swedish cops is presentincluding Martin Beck, who has largely recovered from the wound he received in The Abominable Man. This time the husbandwife writing team mix in a few set pieces, including a hilarious sequence in which everything goes wrong for Beck and Company.

title: Penn State Wins
description: Penn State won its eighth straight game yesterday, defeating the University of Maryland, 42.22, in the day's top college football game. John Cappelletti, Penn State tailback, gained 202 yards rushing, a career high, and Chris Bahr, his teammate, kicked three field goals. Details in Section 5.

title: PRESIDENT TO GET BILL ONCE VETOES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3All of the elements in a bill President Nixon vetoed three months ago, causing this year's sharpest Congressional fight to override, are returning to his desk in a form he may be forced to sign.

title: Letters: How Polyglot Is the Waldorf?
description: To the Editor: James H. Winchester's hotel piece, Booze, Bellehops and Other Freebies (Travel Section, Oct. 14), intrigued us, particularly the comment: Hotels everywhere are hiring multilingual desk clerks but none tops the WaldorfAstoria in New York City, which has a staff fluent in a total of 31 languages.

title: Tommy Dorsey? Just Delovely
description: THE late Tommy Dorsey had a special genius for skillfully translating jazz into popular dance music. A firstrate trombon1st, Dorsey never pretended to be an important jazz soloist; his forte was the legato approach, and for sheer beauty, purity of tone and complete technical mastery of his instrument, he was unequalled. Yet Dorsey loved jazz, and his bands always reflected its driving force.

title: Sorts Editor's Mailbox: Secretariat, Pro and Con
description: To THE EDITOR: Sports figures and commentators have filled our eyes and ears with superlatives about Secretariat for months.

title: Israeli Describes Thrust Back to Canal as Decisive
description: The most decisive and hazardous action of the Middle East war, according to a highlinking Israeli participant, was the Israeli Army's thrust to the Suez Canal, which opened the :orridor through which tanks and men moved across the waterway into Egypt. ties on both sides, took place, he recalled.

title: Westfield Streak Ended At 48 by Montclair, 2015
description: Montclair came from behind in the closing minutes yesterday with a 75yard drive and defeated Westfield, 2015, in Montclair to end New Jersey's record unbeaten streak at 48 games.

title: Carle Place Victor On Basso's 2 Runs
description: Carle Place, a perennial smallschool power that in recent years has had a difficult time matching past glories, continued its challenge for the North Shore Division III championship yesterday by knocking Locust Valley out of first place, 130.

title: SHOP TALK
description: TENAFLYPiper's Ltd. is an offbeat type of clothing store that sells men's designer suits, coats and leather outerwear at prices way below the usual. Here, one can buy a $140 suit for $95, or, if you prefer, a $215 suit for $160. Comparable savings are offered on coats.

title: The Summer Of My German Soldier
description: This is an exceptionally fine novel about a young girl whose mediocre parents don't like her, precisely because she is an inconveniently exceptional human being. 12yearold Patty Bergen begins to learn to her genuine surprise that she is a lovable person, a person of value, from a German P.O.W. escapee in Arkansas during World War II.

title: New Hyde Park Defeats Elmont
description: The fourway tie at the top of Nassau County South Shore Division III was reduced to two yesterday as South Side took a 1614 victory over Hempstead and New Hyde Park pulled out an 8.3 decision over Elmont.

title: UConn Pins 2719 Defeat On Rutgers
description: STORRS, Conn., Nov. 3 (AP)Eric Torkelson ran for 164 yards and Al MacLellan caught two touchdown passes from Lou Mancari as Connecticut defeated Rutgers, 2719, today.

title: For Dec., Jan. and Feb.
description: Those who are fortunate enough to spend winter in a warm climate (or sailing on sunny southern waters), will relish the new crop of cruise clothes that just arrived in the stores. As usual, prints predominateusually in vivid colors to match the holiday mood. There are suits, dresses, pants and shirts appropriate for just about any daytime wintervacation activity.

title: Food in History
description: It figures that historians, like journalists, don't care much about food. The proof is in the eating at nearly any faculty club, or in the browsing through nearly any account (in Voltaire's and Gibbon's phrase) of man's crimes, follies and misfortunes. It is selfevident that the story of man, like that of any other species, is a constant struggle for nourishment and that, even when some men have been able to dominate that struggle for limited times, it profoundly shaped their conduct and their beliefs. Claude LeviStrauss (The Raw and the Cooked, From Honey to Ashes) traced a myth of Creation among American Indians and found that the Hero was punished by Fire and saved by Water, or punished by Water and saved by Fire, according to whether the tribe that told the myth boiled its food or baked it. But LeviStrauss is not a historian but an anthropologistphilosopher, and French to boot. Our standard works of history pay only glancing attention, if any, to the indispensable fuel of history.

title: HONEY PRICES SOAR AS SUPPLY DROPS
description: ALBANY, Nov. 3A strong demand for honey at home and abroad, mostly by fanciers of organic foods, has resulted in a shortage and skyrocketing prices, according to farm experts here and at the State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences at Cornell University.

title: Linda Ann Martin Will Be Married
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Bernard J. Martin have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Ann Martin, to Howard Adams Law 3d, son of Mrs. Law Jr. of New York and Harvey Cedars, N.J., and the late Mr. Law.

title: Mr. Ford's Early Views on Executive Privilege
description: In April of 1963, Representative Gerald R. Ford of Michigan was angered by the refusal of President Kennedy's aides to disclose to Congress closely held information on the Bay of Pigs operation. It was the issue of executive privilege. Representative Fordnow President Nixon's choice to be the new Vice President expressed his strong views in a speech delivered in the House.

title: Oklahoma Sets Back Iowa State
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 3 (AP)Steve Davis, quarterback, tossed two timely touchdown passes and Joe Washington, a halfback, ran 136 yards and scored two touchdowns on runs of 1 and 30 yards today, helping Oklahoma beat a stubborn Iowa State eleven 34 to 17 in a Big Eight football game.

title: Rites for Herbert's Daughter
description: A memorial service for Mrs. Ella Herbert Bartlett, daughter of the composer Victor Herbert, will be held today at 4 P.M. in St. James Episcopal Church, Madison Avenue and 71st Street. Mrs. Bartlett, the widow of Robert Stevens Bartlett, died Oct. 19 at her home here. She had been president of the Victor Herbert Foundation.

title: Sri Lanka Getting Vaccine
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Nov, 3 (AP)  More than a million doses of cholera vaccine are being rushed to Sri Lanka to counter a spreading epidemic, the Health Ministry said today. Twentysix deaths have been reported in Jaffna and Mannar on the island state's northwestern coast nearest India.

title: Conference Slated On 6 Urban Issues
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR  A threeday conference on Our Urban Environment will be held at Montclair State College from Wednesday through Friday. The parley will bring together urban experts and active concerned citizens to explore the complexities of contemporary metropolitan life.

title: Two Named to Head A Combined Drive By 2 Jewish Groups
description: Two prominent industrialists have been named general chairmen of an unusual combined campaign by the United. Jewish Appeal of Greater New York and the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies to raise $280million.

title: North Plainfield Gets Span
description: NORTH PLAINFIELDMotorists using Interhaven Avenue here can once more cross Stony Brook, but for the next eight months they will be driving on a singlespan temporary bridge.

title: The First Great Civilizations
description: A quarter of a century ago the first great civilizations were two, those of Egypt and of the land between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, commonly known by its Greek name, Mesopotamia. Now, thanks to excavations going back no further than 1945, there is a third, the Indus civilization of Pakistan, with its main centers at Harappa on the Ravi River in the northeastern sector and at Mohenjodaro some 300 miles to the southwest, on the Indus itself.

title: Nilda
description: When Nilda Ramirez was nearly 10, a white policeman shouted, God damn you people, at her and her neighbors. At other times in the course of this sad and beautiful book, Nilda and her family are called spics, animals and much worse. But they are always you people to the teachers, social workers, policemen, nurses and other white Americans who control their world.

title: Home cooking from Peking
description: The most refined cuisine of China comes appropriately from the north, from the region around Peking, the political, intellectual and cultural center of the country. Yet few Americans are familiar with it. Many, of course, have heard of Peking Duck; a privileged few have dined on this crispy skinned delicacy which is served with thin pancakes, scallions and sweet bean paste.
