But there are other superb dishes that deserve recognition, the Mongolian Firepot, for instance, which was brought to Peking by Kublai Khan. And the subtly sophisticated Sweet and Sour Carp. This is a dish that can be truly savored only in Peking, for the carp must come from a certain stretch of the Yellow River where the water is exceptionally clear and the fish are livelier than any place else. Peking cooking is known for its subtlety, its sophistication and its mildnessnot to be confused with blandness. The complicated dishes are based on two methods of preparation: Pao and Liu. Pao, very briefly, is a matter of stirfrying ingredients that are coated with a thick bean sauce over very high heat. The art consists of rendering down the sauce so that scarcely any is left, but not burning it. Liu demands even more skill and knowledge. With this method, food is cooked in rice wine or sometimes in vinegar to which sugar and cornstarch are added. Achievement of the correct flavor, smoothness and consistency is all important Great chefs used to vie with each other to achieve the ultimate subtlety. But for American cooks, the menu on these pages is a more rational introduction to northern cooking. The techniques are simple. One does not need to worry that the results might displease Confucius. The Velvet Chicken, a delicately flavored dish that lightened with eight egg whites, accompanied by a stirfried dish that uses up the egg yolks. The third dish is a sweet and sour cabbage salad.

title: Nassau Coliseum to Get A Computer Scoreboard
description: Although fans at the Nassau Coliseilm may not see any improvement in their team's' scores, the Islanders and Nets in a few months will unveil what has been described as the world's first indoor computer scoreboard, which is capable of showing a form of instant television replay.

title: Chicago Utility Sued
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 3 (UPI)Citizens for a Better Environment Thursday sought $9million from Commonwealth Edison company, charging that the utility was not concerned with environment and used false and deceptive advertising during the last three years.

title: Misusing the CIA: A Final Report
description: Along with the confusion over the Presidential tapes last week came some clarification on another aspect of the Watergate imbroglio. The House Armed Services Committee Special Subcommittee on Intelligence composed of four Democrats and three Republicansprobing into the CIA's role in Watergate and the Ellsberg case, concluded unanimously that, however reluctantly, the Agency had allowed itself to be used for improper purposes for which there was no support in law or reason. Following are excerpts from its report:

title: CHURCHES AIDING CHILEAN LEFTISTS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 3They are coming by the thousands to seek help from the new Committee of Cooperation for Peace in Chile, a human rights organization that began operations this week.

title: PERSONALITY ISSUE IN MICHIGAN RACE
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., Nov. 3  The two candidates for Mayor of this city were taping a television interview late in the campaign.

title: QUESTIONS
description: If you have a question, or know the answer to a question asked in these columns, please send it to Garden News, The New York Times, Times Square, N.Y. 10036, We will publish questions of general interest and the practical solutions. Please enclose a stamped, selfaddressed envelope.

title: Gibson Proposing MinorityHiring Plan
description: NEWARK  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson has moved to extend to municipal construction projects a minority hiring plan that is essentially the same as the one adopted last year by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey after a bitter struggle that held up for 14 months a $400million redevelopment project at Newark Airport.

title: Bronx Downs Manhattan in Stickball
description: Paced by strong, multisewer hitting and some spectacular off  the  fire  escape catches, the Bronx came from behind to beat Manhattan, 42, yesterday in the second annual citywide stickball championship.

title: Moscow Congress
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union discovered last week that the price of opening the traditionally proSoviet World Congress of Peace Forces to a number of moderate Western antiwar groups is having Soviet humanrights issues raised right on Moscow's doorstep.

title: Lehigh Aerials Topple Colgate
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 3 Lehigh stunned Colgate with an eighttouchdown barrage today en route to a 5826. triumph and its first over the Red Raiders since 1961.

title: Nets Beaten by Colonels; Drop 6th Straight, 93.87
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 3  The Kentucky Colonels completed a sweep of the New York Nets, 9387, tonight in the windup of a homeandhome series. The Colonels' victory was their sixth in a row while the Nets lost their sixth straight game. Dan Issel collected 29 points to pace the Colonels, Eastern Division leaders of the American Basketball Association, who now have a 101 wonlost record.

title: Tulsa Tops Louisville
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 3 (AP)Jeb Blount connected on two touchdown passes today leading Tulsa to a 179 football victory over Louisville.

title: Dr. Richard Bak, 89, Dead, Aided Medical Research
description: Dr. Richard Bak, an economist and a philanthropist, died iii Paris on Oct. 25. He was 89 years old and lived at 750 Park Avenue.

title: Con
description: It was an ominous peroration. On the fourth and last night of the WatersEdge hearing before the zoning commission Of New Fairfield, Conn., Jack Walter, general counsel for the Garden Cities Development Corporationand also a spokesman for Suburban Action Instituteleft the air rumbling with implied threats like thunder on the horizon.

title: John Regan Marries Charleen McMahon
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 3Miss Charleen Anne McMahon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Stephen McMahon of Dobbs Ferry and Spring Lake, N. J., was married here this afternoon to John Joseph Nagle Regan, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Sylvester Regan Jr. of South Orange, N. J., and Spring Lake.

title: The Blackout Has Gone, Leaving a Dimout Behind
description: The pro football fan in metropolitan New York who takes his games on television has so far been sullen, but not rebellious, over the effects of the new blackout rule. Because the Giants have been selling out at the Yale Bowl and the Jets always sell out Shea Stadium, the networks have been showall their games on local television, Channels 2 and 4. The 3yearold Rozelle rule, moreover, states that a station cannot televise a second game into an area when the home team is playing at home.

title: Former Soviet Spy Arrives In London and May Stay
description: LONDON, Nov. 3 (UPI)Leopold Trepper, the Soviet World War II spy, arrived from Poland for medical treatment yesterday and indicated that he might stay in the West.

title: The Chicago 7
description: CHICAGOThere they were back in court, nine of the characters in a 196970 conspiracy trial in Federal District Court that for nearly five months combined drama with the theater of the absurd and produced some of the most bizarre scenes in the history of American law.

title: Culebra, Where It's Always the 4th of July
description: UNSPOILED is not precisely the right word for the island of Culebra, just off the east coast of Puerto Rico. Nevertheless, this 11squaremile Caribbean isle, ringed with white, sunbaked beaches and a sparkling, bluegreen sea, is one of the rare patches of land hereabouts which is not overrun with tourists.

title: The Boy Who Didn't Believe in Spring
description: I guess it's not so bad to find only one picture book out of eight, that you might enjoy giving to a young boy or girl you love. (Walking into a fairly wellstocked bookstore may yield zero, after all, or else a full  blown case of immobilizing confusion.) But, still, it kind of shocks and depresses me to feel as much relief, as I do feel, for the one, really okay book in this uneven bunch of current offerings.

title: Swaziland Is Drafting Constitutior
description: MBABANE, SwazilandSol huza II, the 74yearold Kin of Swaziland, in southern Al rica, has appointed a royal con mission to draft a new const tution for his country.

title: Fees for Managing Pension Funds
description: Mutual funds have reported net redemptions for 19 of the last 24 months. The small investor still seems wary of the stock market. Fixedrate brokerage commissions are scheduled to end April 30, 1975. Is there no good news for Wall Street?

title: Gardens
description: FOR stunningly different house plants with low maintenance try bromeliads. Their care is almost foolproof. In fact, you can leave on vacation and they won't even miss you.

title: NEW PENSION PUN TO BE DESCRIBED
description: A plan for negotiations publicemploye pensions on coalition basis will be the subject of five public hearings two in New York City and three in upstate communities. The hearings have been scheduled by the Permanent Commission on Public Employe Pension and Retirement Systems.

title: Wagner Defeats Springfield, 146
description: Wagner College, snapped a threegame losing streak yesterday with a 14 to 6 homecoming day victory over Springfield College at Fischer Memorial Field Staten Island.

title: Bitter ChiefJudge Fight Called a Class Struggle
description: Chief Judge of New York Statean office of such eminence that for more than half a century it has been conferred, rather than contestedhas become the subject this year of the nastiest battle on the ballot.

title: PROF. F. B. DEKNATEL, ART HISTORIAN, DIES
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3Frederick Brockway Deknatel, who retired recently as the William Dorr Boardman Professor of Fine Arts at Harvard University, died today of a heart attack in New England Baptist Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Cambridge.

title: Modern Greek Poetry
description: Kimon Friar believes that modern Greek poetry is as rich as any in our time. The selections he has translated for his anthology bear out these words, which themselves are as finely measured as this entire remarkable volume. It includes translations of more than 400 poems of some 30 poets. There is great variety in the selection although both Rae Dalven's anthology and the Penguin Book of Greek Verse include some other poets. There is a long introduction on the historical background, there are critical biographies of the poets, bibliographies, comments on Greek pronunciation and metrics, and a wonderful essay on the art of translation. All is carefully weighed and responsibly set down. Friar tells us that this has been the work of 25 years and it has been done with the help of most of the poets he has been translating. The result is such that every reader must rejoice that Friar has been able to see the work through to its completion.

title: In the Company of Crickets
description: The September and October issues of Cricket, a slick and shining new children's monthly for 6to12yearolds, published in paperback book form ($1.25 copy), have arrived at bookstores, dropping names like Clifton Fadiman (senior editor); Isaac Bashevis Singer, Lloyd Alexander add Eleanor Cameron, editorial board members; contributors like Julius Lester and Nikki Giovanni; a highpowered battery of authors of children's books including Arnold Lobel, Jean Craighead George, Astrid Lindgren and Nonny Hogrogian; not to mention the likes of T. S. Eliot, William Butler Yeats and Walter de la Mare, who are represented by selections from their poetry.

title: Gasoline out of coal?
description: To the Editor: According to Robert E. Hunter in Can the Arabs really blackmail us? (Sept 23), ... we do have lots of coal, but ... don't yet have the technologies needed to convert it cheaply into a liquid gasoline substitute for automobiles.

title: Micronesians Divided on SelfRule Issues as Parleys With U.S. Draw Near
description: GARAPAN, Saipan  In a typical village school consisting of four bamboo poles and a covering of palm fronds held down by coral rocks, a brown  skinned politician searches for simple words in which to explain the difference between independence, the goal of many Micronesians, and free association with the United States, proposed by the American rulers of the tiny, jewellike islands of Micronesia in the central Pacific.

title: Mt. Vernon Wins In Surprise, 2614
description: Coach Dave Scarpino's rebuilding program was in full evidence yesterday as his Mount Vernon team came from behind to upset Blessed Sacrament, 2614.

title: Something Else for the Children
description: Some recommended children's books for the Christmas Season. (In anticipation of the many lists to come.)

title: Miss Schwed Has Nuptials
description: Miss Katharine Holding Schwed, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Schwed of New York, was married here this afternoon to Eric Franklin Wood, son of Dr. Lorne Wood of Vancouver, British Columbia, and the late Mrs. Wood. The Rev. W. Donald Harris performed the ceremony in the West Park Presbyterian Church.

title: Bruins Triumph, 76
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 3 It is a time for tears at Tigertown, where football has been a way of autumnal life for over 100 years. The Princeton team lost to Brown today for the first time since 1954 and at this point in time has the poorest wonlost recordone victory, five defeats of any Tiger squad in 30 years. It is the sole occupant of the Ivy League cellar.

title: FM Programs Set By Rutgers Station
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  The student voice of Rutgers University will soon be heardfor the first time in the homes and cars of thousands of Central Jerseyans.

title: Agency Helps Puerto Rican Veterans Get Benefits
description: Puerto Rican veterans, returning from Vietnam are entitled to the same benefits as any serviceman, but because of their language barriers and generally limited educations they have found it much more difficult than other veterans to get the advice needed to adjust to civilian life.

title: PROF. DOUGLAS YOUNG
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Nov. 3  Dr. Douglas Cuthbert Colquhoun Young, Paddison Professor of Greek at the University of North Carolina, died Oct. 24 at his home here. His age was 60.

title: Speak Action, Blum Up, Scores 15 Length Victory
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 3 (AP)  Harroblanda Stable's Speak Action, the horse that cost Ron Turcotte the mount on Secretariat in the colt's final race of his Career, sped to a 15length victory in the $29,100 Smithville Stakes at Atlantic City Race Course today.

title: R.O.T.C. Survives, Barely, at Princeton
description: PRINCETON  The Reserve Officer Training Corps programs at New Jersey's colleges are producing only a trickle of officers, and most units have little hope, of recouping enrollment losses suffered during the years of bitter antiwar protests.

title: Death and the Care of Bereaved Discussed at a Conference Here
description: In academic jargon that was interlarded with statistics, and invoices that trembled from a sense of loss, scores of men and women talked about death at an international convention here yesterday, about what death does to those who are left behind.

title: ROME RESTRICTING FOREIGN STUDENTS
description: ROME, Nov. 3Foreign students in Italy are worried be cause the Government has tightened the rules for admission to colleges and universities here and has started expelling from the country those who do not qualify.

title: Television
description: THE television future, we are told, will be full of humanity. Given what much of the television present is full of, any change might be an improvement. In any case, the program chiefs of the three commercial networks appear determined to ease up in the more obvious action areas. The lawenforcement form is on the way out. Each network has supposedly incorporated that dictum into its official policy. Different platforms are on the way in.

title: Richmond Romps, 270
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 3 (AP) Barty Smith ran for 206 yards and three touchdowns today as Richmond routed the Citadel, 270. The Spiders posted their seventh victory in eight games.

title: Miss LaMorgese Wed
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 3Miss Francesca LaMorgese, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Angelo LaMorgese of Springfield, was married here this afternoon to Timothy Cook of Westfield, son of Mr, and Mrs. Clyde Swift Cook of Palo Alto, Calif. The Rev. Felix Danford Lion, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the Manor. The bridegroom, whose previous marriage ended in divorce, is manager of passenger sales for Eastern Airlines in New York.

title: Peron
description: BUENOS AIRESFew Argentines have ever quest tioned Juan Domingo Pern's uncanny instinct for the achievement and manipulation of political power. Now, Mr. Peren's political game is being played within the parameters of his own volatile, heterogeneous movement. During the last month, with the backing of the 78yearold leader, rightwing trade unionists and politicians have been carrying out a widespread purge of leftwing Peronists.

title: Evander Takes Division Title Despite 2222 Tie by Clinton
description: Evander completed, the field for next weekend's Public Schools Athletic League semifinals yesterday by tying Dewitt Clinton, 2222, at Clinton Field.

title: OFFDUTY FIREMAN STABBED TO DEATH
description: An offduty probationary fireman was stabbed to death last night, according to the police, who said he was killed in a fight that began in a pool hall in the South Jamaica section of Queens.

title: Years Out
description: The Years Out refers to the years after college when one escapes the limits  and consolationsof school, family and most institutional supports. This first novel wanders in the wake of five young people who are out and who share a common fecklessness, confusion and curious inability to make intelligent choices. Their groping feels genuine, and the author allows us instants of poignant insight into their troubled discoveries. Gradually they seem almost more tellingly representative of the times than the radicals, hashheads and commune dwellers who attracted attention in the late 1960's.

title: Cincinnati Wins, 523, From North Texas State
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 3 (UPI)After a parachutist dropped in from 3,500 feet onto the 50yard line with the game bail, the University of Cincinnati defeated North Texas State, 523, today.

title: Pioneers, Yes. Abstractionists? Well...
description: THE exhibition, Pioneers of American Abstraction, now on view at the Andrew Crispo Gallery, 41 East 57th Street (through Nov. 17) is, in its way, a period piecean exercise in American art history that has all the clear advantages of hindsight. The show is a very large one, 150 paintings, watercolors and collages by nine American artistsOscar Bluemner, Stuart Davis, Charles Demuth, Arthur Dove, John Marin, Georgia O'Keeffe, Charles Sheeler, Joseph Stella and Max Weber.

title: Inside the Harvard Business School
description: The American business school has long made important contributions to the training of the world's business leaders. Among them the Harvard Business School has enjoyed a reputation of preeminence, one that has led some observers, not entirely without malice, to describe it as the West Point of capitalism. The Gospel According to the Harvard Business School, a new book by Peter Cohen, a recent graduate, provides a view of the school through a student's eyes.

title: News of the Screen
description: Eleanor Perry, the screenwriter who made her debut as a coproducer with The Man Who Loved Cat Dancing, which she admits she doesn't particularly love, is writing and is ready to coproduce her second feature film. It's her adaptation of Hatter Fox, a novel by Marilyn Harris published last summer by Random House, which she will produce with George Goodman, president of a recently formed independent company, Laurel Productions.

title: LYMAN AND CHESS ARE BACK ON TV
description: Introduced by the Gillette sports song, Shelby Lyman, the chess teacher, returned to the air yesterday, providing movebymove analysis on Channel 13 of the first in fourgame match between the champions of the Marshall and Manhattan Chess Clubs.

title: Toledo Blade Picks Editor
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 3 (AP) Bernard Judy, editorial director of The Toledo Blade's opinion pages since 1971, was appointed the newspaper's editor yesterday.

title: Trenton State Falls To Montclair State
description: EWING TOWNSHIP, N. J. Nov. 3With Bob Hermanni scoring two touchdowns, Montclair State gained its second New Jersey State College Confeience victory without a loss here today, downing Trenton State, 2410.

title: PRINTERS STAY OUT AT WASHINGTON POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Negotiations failed to end a work stoppage by printers at The Washington Post tonight, and The Post said that no new sections would be distributed with its Sunday editions.

title: In Paperbacks, Picturebacks and More
description: What with the average price of a hardcover children's picture book at the startling figure of $4.95 per 32page tale, it is comforting to tick off such relative newcomers to the growing parade of paperback imprints as Crowell Crocodile, Doubleday Zephyr, Dutton Anytime, Holt Owlet, Houghton Sandpiper, KnopfPantheon Pinwheel, and Macmillan Collier Books.

title: Vietcong Charge Thieu Is Receiving War Goods
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The Vietcong have rejected charges by President Nguyen Van Thieu that they and North Vietnam were preparing a general offensive in the South.

title: VIETCONG DENY PLANNING ATTACK
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 3The Vietcong said today that they had no intention of initiating an offensive against the South Vietnamese Government early next year, as President Nguyen Van Thieu recently predicted.

title: Son to the Clephanes
description: A son was born Oct. 13 to Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Painter Clephane of New York at New York Hospital. Mrs. Clephane is the former Miss Caroline Chapin Jones of Rye, N. Y. Her husband is a senior securities analyst with Oppenheimer & Co. The child has been named Cameron Leete.

title: 3 IN CREW KILLED AS PLANE CRASHES
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)  A Pan American World Airways 707 cargo plane with smoke reported in the cockpit and a fire in one of its holds crashed today while attempting an emergency landing at Logan International Airport. The three crew members were killed.

title: Ox Goes North
description: Three years ago, John Ney published a novel called Ox, of which I said that it was fine and wellproportioned, grave and unflinching, and ememplary. It is a pleasure to report that the sequel is all of these things and something more. Ox Goes North, has a plot at once tightly organized and marvelously grotesque, a combination more often attempted than achieved; end there is the same calm prose, the same perceptive dialogue that characterized Ox.

title: MRS. SAMUEL ZAHN
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 3Mrs. Gussie Krass Zahn, a leader in civic and charitable work in New York, died today in Good Samaritan Hospital. She was 82 years old and lived here and at the Sherry Netherland Hotel in New York.

title: At Least 10 Persons Die In California Bus Crash
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 3 (AP)At least 10 persons were killed and at least 20 others injured tonight when a Greyhound bus rammed an overpass abutment, the authorities said.

title: Mideast Ceasefire
description: WASHINGTONThey flew to Washington one by one last week  Ismail Fahmy, the Egyptian Foreign Minister, on Monday, Premier Golda Meir of Israel on Wednesday, and Mohamed Z. Ismail, the Syrian Vice Foreign Minister, on Friday. It was an instructive sequence. The United States, long the whipping boy of the Middle East, was now regarded by Arabs and Israelis alike as the most reliable honest broker going.

title: Bridal Planned by Verna Louise Relyea
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 3Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth D. Relyea have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Verna Louise Relyea, to Pvt. Robert T. Wentworth, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Reynolds Wentworth of Moscow, formerly of Short Hills, N. J. A wedding in the spring is planned.

title: In Wharton, No One's Rushing to Catch Up With World
description: WHARTONIn the northern end of Morris County, where nature is vibrant and highway development has been brisk, lies the Borough of Wharton, which seems to be old and lacking the vigor that only young ideas can generate. Despite the fact that this community shows its age in many ways, few residents fault the local government or criticize what appears to be a slow pace. On the contrary, the people talk about what was as if it Is, and they are reluctant to change direction.

title: Judson C. Travis of Metal Firm Dies
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 3Judson C. Travis, who rose from office boy to president and chairman of the board of Handy & Harman, New York, previous metals and alloys refiners and fabricators, died yesterday at his home here. He was 71 years old.

title: Lafayette Beats Gettysburg, 193
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Nov. 3  Tony Giglio rushed for 210 yards and three touchdowns today as Lafayette College rolled to a 193 victory over Gettysburg.

title: Rand Report Calls Future of St. Louis Economically Bleak
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 3A rather gloomy report by the Rand Corporation on the status and future of St. Louis has brought sharp protests from city leaders, but suburban leaders think some of the observations should be considered as warning signals.

title: SEOUL BOOK CALLED OLDEST OF ITS KIND
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 3  A university professor here says that a copy of a book printed in Korea with metal type in the elevensixties had been found in South Korea.

title: Livingston Tops F.D.U.
description: TEANECK, N. J., Nov. 3Nelson Hayspell scored two touchdowns today to lead Livingston College to a 2013 football victory over Fairleigh Dickinson University. Livingston now has a 43 wonlost record, while F.D.U. is 25.

title: 4 Women Seek Top Posts in Fairfield
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 3For years the women have poured the coffee, run the postage machines and campaigned for minor political offices. But in unusual numbers in Fairfield County this fall, they are running for major political posts and in four towns they are running for the top elective offices. Still others ran in the September primaries and were defeated.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Taipei Fetes Overseas Chinese In Its Competition With Peking
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 3 Each year during its autumn holiday season, Nationalist China extends special treatment to thousands of overseas Chinese visiting here.

title: Richter Tour, Including 2 Dates Here, Canceled
description: The piano recital by Sviatoslav Richter announced for Wednesday in the Who Makes Music and Where listings in today's Arts and Leisure Section will not take place. This Cainegie Hall event, as well as a recital scheduled for Nov. 19 at Avery Fisher Hall and performances in Boston, Philadelphia and Washington, have all been canceled.

title: Riding Free
description: Some people assume it is easier to write for children than adults. This misconception has led many illustrators, parents and professionals to try a children's book, only to find that it is not such a snap. Child psychiatrist Robert Coles has won at least six awards for his study, Children of Crisis, including the Pulitzer Prize for nonfiction in 1973. Yet Coles' latest book shows it is a problem for him to write for children.

title: White House Says Nader Tries To Whip Up Impeachment Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Ken W. Clawson, a White. House deputy press secretary, charged today that Ralph Nader and his associates were trying to orchestrate a campaign to impeach the President.

title: Numismatics
description: THE Number 1 United States and foreign numismatic show on the New York area's fall calendar  the annual fourday Grand Central Coin Conventionopens Thursday at 10:30 A.M. in the Americana Hotel. Seventh Avenue at 52d Street. The show will be open from 10:30 A.M. to 9 P.M. on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Next Sunday, the final day, the hours are 10:30 A.M. to 5 P.M. Admission is free.

title: Adams Runner Is First
description: Joe DeVito of John Adams upset Jon Williams of Edison to win the Queens Public Schools cross  country title yesterday at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx. DeVito led from the start and clocked 13 minutes. 9 seconds on the 2.5mile course. Williams was 30 yards behind in 13:16. Edison edged Van Buren for the team title, 55 to 58.

title: Mayor Race Enlivens Morristown Vote
description: MORRISTOWN  Some 200 years have passed since George Washington made his headquarters in this community while the War of Independence fizzled and raged along the hillsides. But if the Mayoral election of 1973 is any indication, closein skirmishes are not just a part of history here.

title: TransitBond Plan Termed an Underdog in Need of Heavy CitySuburban Vote
description: The state's plan to borrow $3.5billion for transportation projects  a plan described by its advocates as the best one we can get  is widely regarded as an underdog cause on Tuesday's ballot.

title: Federal Role on Coops Affirmed by U.S. Judge
description: A lawsuit involving a Park Avenue cooperative has produced a ruling that could lead to Federal jurisdiction in the sale of shares in a cooperative.

title: Miss Little Ties for 1st
description: APOPKA, Fla., Nov. 3 (UPI) Sally Little of South Africa a newcomer, shot a 69 today to move into a tie with Shelley Hamlin for the lead at 141 in the second round of the $50,000 Lady Erroll golf tournament.

title: VOTERS APATHETIC IN MIAMI ELECTION
description: MIAMI, Nov. 3Following a lethargic, twomonthlong campaign, Miamians vote next Tuesday for mayor and two commissioners from among 26 candidates.

title: Joe Kapp in Brawl
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Nov. 3 (AP)Joe Kapp, former Minnesota Viking quarterback, has been charged with public drunkeness and assaulting a police oficer during a browl at a local bar last night. He was released on his own recognizance.

title: Bills' Plane Makes Emergency Landing
description: CLEVELAND, Nov 3 (UPI)A chartered United Airlines 727 carrying the Buffalo Bills football team made an unscheduled landing at Cleveland International Airport today after problems had developed in the hydraulic system.

title: Margaret Teen Bride Of John DeSantis Jr.
description: Miss Margaret Alice Teen and John Albert DeSantis Jr. were married at noon yesterday by the Rev. Dr. Edward Jurgi in the Fourth Avenue Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn.

title: Berliners Jeer Singer, Ellington Stalks Off
description: BERLIN, Nov. 3 (UPI) Duke Ellington broke off a jazz festival performance at West Berlin's Philharmonic Hall last night when the audience booed and jeered his band's male singer, Tony Watkins.

title: Region
description: According to political Mythology, when Democrats win elections. Republicans are unhappy. But not so Tuesday in the two most important elections in the region, the New York City mayoral and New Jersey gubernatorial races.

title: Film Pornography Flourishes Despite Court Ruling
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 3 The Supreme Court decision last June that tightened the legal rules on obscenity has not proved much of an obstacle, according to Jim and Artie Mitchell, who have made 227 erotic films since they began cranking out 15minute shorts five years ago.

title: HighFlying Economies of the West
description: PARIS  The highflying economies of the Western industrialized states face three possibilities over the next 12 to 18 months: a soft landing, bumps, a crash.

title: New Canaan Gains Playoff Spot
description: New Canaan, the perennial Fairfield County Interscholastic Athletic Conference Eastern Division champion collected its sixth straight division title by blanking Roger Ludlowe of Fairfield, 12.0, yesterday.

title: Deenie
description: Deenie is a wellmeaning novel about a seventhgrade girl who discovers she has scoliosis, a spinal disease. Though neither fatal nor tragic, it's surely bad newsto correct it, she must wear a brace for the next four years.

title: Becoming a Man Where Abraham Stood, David Sang, Solomon Judged
description: AS I write, Egyptian tanks are bursting into the Sinai. The Syrians are attacking in the north. The Middle East is raging with the fourth war in Israel's short history. And I am going to a partya bar mitzvah party on Long Islandthat promises to be lavish with food and drink and entertainment. There has to be something wrong with that.

title: Legislature in Suffolk Approves $415Million Budget That Provides Tax Cuts
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. LThe Suffolk County Legislature appoved en apparent paradow last weekthe largest budget in the county's history, with a substantial drop in the tax rate.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: MISCALCULATION is the most neutral word that comes to mind as an explanation of why so much is so awry in the economic machine. Shortages of everything from oil to saybeans to glue. Inflation diminished, but nowhere near eliminated, despite two years of controls and a radical runup in interest rates. The national economy at a turning pointdownbut no one certain whether it is headed for a soft landing or a hard one. The chairman and the president of the Chrysler Corporation still driving last year's Dusters.

title: A Hero Ain't Nothin' But a Sandwich
description: There are too few books that convince us that reading is one of the supreme gifts of being human. Alice Childress, in her short, brilliant study of a 13 yearold black heroin user, A Hero Ain't Nothin' But a Sandwich, achieves this feat in a masterly way by telling a real story of the victims of today's worst urban plague, heroin addiction, and it reaffirms the belief that excellent writing is alive and thriving in some black corners of America.

title: What's Opened In the Theater?
description: RAISIN, a musical based on Lorraine Hansberry's A Raisin in the Sun, with book by Robert Nemiroff and Charlotte Zaltzberg, music by Judd Woldin and lyrics by Robert Brittan, got 13 favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watts, Post; Wallach, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Lewis, Bergen Record; Gayer, UPI; Harris, WCBSTV; Stewart. Klein, WNEWTV; Sanderrs WABCTV; Bookspan, WPIXTV; Geoffrey Holder, WNBCTV; Probst, WNBCRadio; Virginia Woodruff, WMCARadio), 10 mixed reviews (Watt, News; Glover, AP; Alvin Klein, WNYCRadio; Kalem, Time; Kroll, Newsweek; Feingolci, Village Voice; Simon, New York; Clurman, Nation; Stasio, Cue; Hewes, Saturday Review/World) and two negative reviews (Gottfried, Women's Wear; Gill, New Yorker).

title: Allison E. Josephy Engaged to Marry
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 3  Miss Allison Elizabeth Josephy and Steven Wolowitz, seniors at George Washington University, plan to be married in Washington in June.

title: A Question Of Whose Lights Dim
description: The crisis is much worse than all of us anticipated a week ago, Sen ator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, said last week after hear ing John A. Love, Director of the Pres ident's Energy Policy Office, assess, the nation's fuel shortage.

title: Ford Hearings
description: WASHINGTONNow, Mr. Ford, if you were President...

title: Julie Eisenhower Says She Proposes: Fight. Fight. Fight.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Fight. Fight, Fight. Mrs. David Eisenhower angrily scrawled that entry in her appointment calendar last Oct. 25. That was the day President Nixon alerted United States military forces around the world, leading to some speculation that he had created a crisis to distract attention from his Watergate problems.

Richard M. Nixon, then an attorney representing PepsiCola, left Dallas, Tex., aboard American Airlines New Yorkbound Flight 82 at 9:05 A.M. on Nov. 22, 1963, thus missing President Kennedy's arrival there aboard Air Force One by about twoandahalf hours. Nixon had spent the past two days at a PepsiCola Bottlers Associationmeeting. He was just beginning to learn the ropes as a corporation lawyer. He had filed a petition for admission to the New York State bar only the previous Friday, and his name was not yet on his office door, because he would not become a full partner in the law firm of Mudge, Stern, Baldwin & Todd until Jan. 1, 1964.

title: Photos of Pygmies Barred
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Nov. 3 Agence FrancePresse  Any foreign tourist found photographing pygmies in Zaire from now on will be taken to court, President Mobutu Sese Seko has announced. Addressing a mass meeting in Kisangani, capital of the Upper Zaire region, President Mobuto declared: Foreigners should know that from today onwards there are no more pygmies in Zaire. These people are and remain equal to all other ??airese citizens.

title: Four Soviet Researchers Simulate a SixMonth Space Journey
description: Four Soviet researchers, in an unusual experiment looking toward prolonged space travel to distant planets, have spent six months in a closed biological environment, simulating the earth's biosphere.

title: Music In Review
description: John Nelson, who was not scheduled to conduct the Metropolitan Opera's hew production of Les Troyens until the spring of 1975, suddenly found himself on the podium Tuesday night at this season's third performance. He replaced Rafael Kubelik, who was reportedly suffering from simple exhaustion after rehearsing the production, conducting two performances and fulfilling his daily chores as, the Met's musical director.

title: PASSENGER ON PLANE SUCKED OUT WINDOW
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov. 3 (AP)A mart was sucked out through a window of a National Airlines DC10 jetliner today when an engine apparently 1);tw apart in the air and ripped me aircraft skin, according to passengers and the police.

title: You'd Like to Believe Veronica
description: YOU'RE not supposed to doubt a suspense play step by Step, You're supposed to believe a suspense play step by step, and thereby make an idiot of yourself. If you don't feet a fool as the truth tumbles out about two minutes before curtainfall, where's the fun?

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Solutions to Lust Week's Puzzles
description: (EDOUARD) RODITI: MAGELLAN OF THE PACIFIC At first, because they had seen the small boats lowered from the Spanish ships, the Indians thought that the latter were giving birth to them and later, when the boats were lying alongside the ships as if suckling, were nursing them.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 50TH YEAR NOTED BY HILLEL GROUP
description: The B'nai B'rith Hillel Foundationsthe Jewish campus movement on 315 colleges and universitiesis noting its 50th anniversary without fanfare today.

title: Stabler No. 1 Air Raider
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 3 So you think lefthanded quarterbacks can't cut it in the pros? And you're not impressed with names like Bobby Douglass, Jim Del Gaizo, Frankie Albert and, yes, even Allie Sherman?

title: Mrs. Kemble Has Child
description: A daughter was born Oct. 10 to Mr. and Mrs. William Tyson Kemble Jr. of New York at the Mount Sinai Hospital.

title: Car Antipollution Program Is Tightened by California
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 3The California Air Resources Board said this week that owners of 1966 through 1970 model cars must install antipollution devices by Oct. 31, 1979, or be refused 1975 license plates and possibly be fined.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Stock prices plummeted last week as confusion and uncertainty gripped investors. The result was the biggest weekly decline in years for the DowJones industrial average.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 4, 1973

title: Josette B. Lee Plans Nuptials
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Nov. 3 Mr. and Mrs. Henry T. S. Lee have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Josette BeiWen Lee, to Daniel Vincent Greechan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh J. Greechan of Rye.

title: DEMAND GROWING FOR NIXON TO QUIT; HE DROPSINPOLL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Demands for impeachment of President Nixon or his resignation increased today, while at the same time a Gallup poll showed that only 27 per cent of those questioned approved of the way Mr. Nixon was handling his duties.

title: Hotels Here Enjoy High Booking Rate During Fall Season
description: Hotels in the city were reported to be enjoying an unusually high occupancy rate this fall80.2 per cent last month, up from 77.7 per cent in October, 1972.

title: COOP IS ACCUSED OF BID FOR SEEM
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 3 (AP)A former attorney for Associated Milk Producers, Inc., has charged that a lawyer for the cooperative offered to pay his legal fees if he refused to give additional testimony to the Senate Watergate committee.

title: CHURCH PAYMENTS TO CITIES SCORED
description: The Guild of St. Ives, a group of Episcopal lawyers and clergymen in the Diocese of New York, has urged churches to refrain from making voluntary payments in lieu of taxes to local governments in return for fire and police protection and other municipal services.

title: Milwaukee Firemen Sick
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 4 (AP)Nearly half the Milwaukee firemen scheduled to work today did not report, an acting deputy chief of the department said. The sick calls apparently signaled the start of a scheduled work slowdown. Officials of Fire Fighters Local 815 had threatened a job action if agreement was not reached on a new contract.

title: G.O.P. Hopes to Become Respectable City Council Minority
description: In the City Council elections tomorrow, the republican party stands to regain seats lost to Liberals four years ago, when Mayor Lindsay headed the Liberal ticket, and to become once again a minority party that can hold a caucus in something larger than a telephone booth.

title: Democratic Aide Sees End To Blind Party Loyalties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) The chairman of a commission writing a new charter for Democrats said today that blind loyalty to political parties is a thing of the past, and a good thing it is.

title: Despite the Warnings, Millions Can't, or Won't, Give Up Smoking
description: Charles H. Whitebread, professor of law at the University of Virginia, sat in his cramped, booklined office, lit a cigarette and talked about smoking. I have a friend, a writer, who tried to stop smoking and his entire life collapsed. His wife left him. His income from writing dropped 82 per cent. When he started smoking again, his wife came back, he started to write again, he was fine.

title: JAPANESE FIGHT AUTO POLLUTION
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4In addition to the Honda Motor Company, four Japanese automobile makers have developed and are ready to produce antipollution systems that each asserts will meet the most stringent standards yet set here or in the United States.

title: E.P.A. Staff Study Is Critical. Of Blue Ridge Power Project
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 regional staff report of the Environmental Protection Agency has recommended that the $350million Blue Ridge hydroelectric project on the North CarolinaVirginia state line be abandoned, and that the Ameriican Electric Power Company find an alternatiye means of generating the 1,800 megwatts of peaking power it says it needs for emergencies.

title: Kom Awaiting Statue With Joy and Disbelief
description: FUNDONG, Cameroon, Nov. 2  Joy mingled with disbelief in this remote mountain kingdom in Cameroon today as the news circulated among the Kom people that the AfoAKom, the sacred, centuryold statue taken secretly from this region seven years ago, would soon be returned.

title: Delaware Adviser Buys Future, Blue Chips for Nobel Portfolio
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 4 Baird C. Brittingham is a 42yearold investment counselor who often wears turtleneck shirts and is seldom seen behind his desk in a coat and tie.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: YESTERDAY'S GAME Indiana 128, Virginia 122.

title: Michael Timm Weds Mrs. Silver
description: Mrs. Jane Miriam Silver, a nutritionist with the city's Human Resources Administration, was married here yesterday morning to Michael Eric Timm, who is with the New York law firm of Goldstein, Shames & Hyde. The Rev. Melvin Hawthorne, a Baptist minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Church Center for the United Nations, where he is minister of the chapel.

title: Group of Mexicans Seeking Law to End Cruelty to Animals
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 4A group of prominent Mexicans has begun a campaign to obtain passage of a law to protect animals against cruelty.

title: O'Hagan Order Allows Reduction of Teams
description: The Fire Department, facing a threat by firemen to strike today, said yesterday that trucks would be operated with reduced crews and that, if necessary, civilians might be used to help lay hoses.

title: Proposition One YES
description: Proposition One on tomorrow's ballot will confront the voters of New York State with a clear choice. By voting for this proposal for a $3.5 billion transportation bond issue, they will opt for the desperately needed rehabilitation of the state's rundown public transit systems.

title: BYRNE, SANDMAN IN A CLASH ON TV
description: New Jersey's major candidates for Governor, carrying their battle for votes down to the wire, confronted each other yesterday in two televised appearances in which each reiterated his stands on such issues as the state income tax and legalized abortion.

title: Recently Published Books
description: Britten's Old Clocks end Watches and Their Makers, by Cecil Clutton, G. H. Baillie and C. A. Ilbert, eighth edition, revised by Mr. Clutton (Dutton, $40).

title: Defense Secretary Leaves For NATO Talks in Europe
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 4 (AP) Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger left tonight for The Hague for three days of meetings with the North Atlanic Treaty Organization's nuclear planning group.

title: Acid Is Retrieved in Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)A load of nitric acid dumped from a cargo plane that crashed near Logan International Airport were safely retrieved from Boston Harbor today, the authorities said. The Pan American jet lost radio contact and stopped sending radar signals three minutes before it crashed yesterday, killing the three persons aboard.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Erik Marcus Weds Deborah N. Cohen
description: Miss Deborah Natalie Cohen and Erik Marcus were married yesterday morning at the Ocean Parkway Jewish Center in Brooklyn.

title: T. Berra, Flanker
description: AMHERST, Mass.  Vermont's kickoff went to Tim Berra 3 yards from the Massachusetts goal line, and as he snugged the ball against his red jersey his father grunted involuntarily. He's got it! Yogi Berra said, as if Tim's mother, Carmen, didn't know. Tim started fast. He is an abandoned runner, all threshing elbows and pumping knees. He burst past a cluster of white shirts, slanted right across the hash marks and kept going. His father was playing cool but as Tim crossed midfield Yogi came to his feet. Carmen was already up. One Vermont player remained upright in Tim's path, two others were cutting across from his left.

title: Energy Policy Head Says Brownouts Might Occur
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) John A. Love, the White House energy policy director, says that under certain circumstances electricity blackouts or brownouts could occur this winter because of the fuel shortage.

title: JAIN SECT PLANS TEMPLE IN QUEENS
description: A Jain templethe first in the Western Hemispherewill be built in Queens next year.

title: C. W. Post's Weekend College Offers Working People New Opportunity and Hope of Getting a Degree
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Nov. 4When some of the current crop of students at a university! branch here look back fondly on their college days, the only two days they'll have in mind are Saturdays and Sundays.

title: Sugar Substitutes Get New Scrutiny
description: A series of recently completed experiments could turn the tables on the use of the leading artificial sweeteners  saccharin and cyclamate.

title: Pop Music: James and Oliver Bring Back the Era That Did Have That Swing
description: Bigband sounds from the swing era filled 52d Street on Friday evening. You could hear Jimmie Lunceford's Ain't She Sweet and Tommy Dorsey's On the Sunny Side of the Street at Roseland, where Sy Oliver, who wrote both arrangements, was leading his current band.

title: In Mean Streets of His Own Past, Father Lives for His Son's Future
description: ATLANTA, Ga.There are times when he feels like a man who is being asked to stretch himself too much. Then he goes for long walks at night, often in Grant Park, always alone. He needs to be away from what he values most: his family. They expect a lot of him, he says, and he wants to give it.

title: RYAN SAYS CAIRO MAY RENEW WAR
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 4 (Reuters) Defense Minister Moshe Dayan warned tonight that Egypt might resume hostilities in the Middle East and that she did not seem ready for what Israel regarded as a stable ceasefire.

title: Man Murdered in East Side Building Where Tenants Note Influx of Criminals
description: A 30yearold man was sho?? to death yesterday in a 10th floor apartment of a residentia?? highrise at 345 East 81s Street, and a man occupying the apartment was charged with homicide. The police said the slaying apparently stemmed from a dispute over narcotics.

title: Israelis Face Lean Times As Costly War Ends Boom
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 4In the wake of the costliest war in Israel's history, the country is bracing for a prolonged period of severe economic austerity.

title: 4 Mayoral Hopefuls Here In Final Joint Appearances
description: Two of the major mayoral candidates renewed yesterday their criticism of what they said were heavy realestate contributions to the campaign of Controller Abraham D. Beame, the Democrat who expected to be elected the 104th Mayor of New York City.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Theatrical Agent Killed In Fall From Apartment
description: A man identified as 46yearold Christopher Allan, a theatrical agent, was killed yesterday afternoon when he fell from his ninthstory apartment at 116 East 66th Street, apparently, while cleaning his windows, the police reported.

title: Jets and Giants Lose
description: The Miami Dolphins defeated the Jets, 2414, at Shea Stadium yesterday. In Oakland, Calif., the Raiders trounced the Giants, 420, for New York's sixth loss in a row. Details, Page 57.

title: MRS. MITCHELL SEES NIXON OUT BY APRIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Martha Mitchell, one of the first public figures to call for President Nixon's resignation, predicted last night that he would have to quit and will be out by April.

title: With Personal Service and Lollipops, Banks Strive to Remodel Stodgy Image
description: NEWARK, Nov. 4Call me Irving, says the Irving Trust Co. of New York, and in Newark, customers of the First Jersey National Bank Tell it to SAM.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: SHORT HILLS, Nov. 4Nancy McMullen, a doctoral candidate in experimental psychology at Columbia University, recently returned from a trip to Argentina with the United States women's field hockey team. Now, she's seriously engaging in a can paign for the creation of greener and plusher pitches in this country.

title: The Marshall Champion Leads, 1.0, in TV Match
description: Sal Matera, champion of the Marshall Chess Club here, took a 1to0 lead yesterday over George Kramer, champion of the Manhattan Chess Club, in their fourgame Emery Cup match being televised on consecutive weekends from Albany over the Eastern Educational Network.

title: Exchange of 2 Lots Saves a Dream House
description: MIAMI, Nov. 4 (UPI)The story of a man who accidentally built his dream house on Another man's lot has had a happy enging.

title: BROOKE APPEALS TO NIXON TO RESIGN FOR NATION'S SAKE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4  A year to the week after President Nixon's landslide reelection victory, Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts became today the first Republican Senator publicly to urge Mr. Nixon to resign.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ALMA, Mich., Nov. 4 (AP)A Canadian team finished first today in the annual Press On Regardless' threeday sports car rally through 1,700 miles in Michigan. The Class B team of Walter Boyce and Doug Woods of Ottawa brought its Toyota Corolla over the finish line about 22 minutes ahead of Jim Walker of Ann Arbor, Mich., and Terry Palmer of Jackson, Mich., in a Volvo 142S.

title: Knicks Down Sonics, 11 1106, on 4thPeriod Spurt
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 4 (AP) Walt Frazier, Dean Meminger and Dave deBusschere. poured in a total of 69 points tonight to lead the New York Knicks to a 111106 National Basketball Association victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Stage: Moonchildren
description: It would be easy to say welcome back to Michael Weller's dazzling but thoughtful play, Moonchildren, which last night arrived in a totally new production at the Theater de Lys. But it would be more accurate to say welcome home!

title: Mrs. Jane Kurland Wed to Dr. Paul Hans
description: Mrs. Jane Gold Kurland, widow of Robert J. Kurland and daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert A. Gold of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Paul Hans of Newton, Mass. Rabbi Samuel Berman performed the ceremony at the Plaza. Dr. Hans is the son of MM. Harry Hans of the Bronx and the late Mr. Hans.

title: JOHN M. BICKEL
description: MYRTLE BEACH, S.C., Nov. 4John M. Bickel, a retired vice president of the Carrier Corporation in New York, died here yesterday at Myrtle Beach Manor, a nursing home. He was 81 years old.

title: 13 Killed, 31 Hurt as RenoBound Gamblers Special Bus lifts a Pillar
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 4 (AP)  A gamblers' special bus carrying a group of 43 to the midnight floor show at a Reno casino smashed headon into a freeway pillar last night, killing the driver and 12 of the partygoers.

title: TV Review
description: Some intelligent planning and taste have gone into The Carroll O'Connor Special, a generally pleasant 90 minutes due tonight at 9:30 over the Columbia Broadcasting System. Many of these specials are duds, either rhapsodizing a familiar name with a maze of expensive upholstery or else puffing a frail new talent.

title: FLIGHTS HALTED BY T.W.A. STRIKE
description: A strike of Trans World Airlines stewards and stewardesses began at 12:01 A.M. today when negotiations on a new contract broke down in Washington at the expiration of a 30day coolingoff period.

title: BARTELS RETIRING FROM BENCH HOT
description: Judge John R. Bartels of the United States District Court here, known for his opposition to pretrial publication of a defendant's criminal record as prejudicial to the right of a fair trial, announced yesterday that he would retire from the bench on Dec. 31.

title: Patrick Takes Maclay Trophy for Riding
description: Four years ago Michael Patrick took his first riding lesson. Yesterday, the 18yearold youth, aboard Irish Coffee, at the National Horse Show, was named the winner of the championship trophy of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, more familiarly known as the Maclay class.

title: Paul Robsky, ExLawman With Ness Untouchables
description: MIAMI, Nov. 4 (AP)Paul Robsky, last of a band of lawmen who under Elliott Ness became known as the Untouchables, died Thursday in a hospital here. He was 76 years old.

title: Moscow Hunt ls On For Winter Parking
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4As the first snows glaze the city streets, many Muscovites are searching for what has eluded so many New York City motoristsa parking place.

title: Constitutional Test
description: Another test of the nation's ability to reverse the trend toward executive usurpation of constitutional rights and procedures is scheduled for Wednesday, when the House is expected to vote on the question of overriding a Presidential veto of the war powers bill.

title: FRANCE SIDESTEPS OILPOOLING ISSUE
Israelis Say Syrians Killed 12 P.O.W.'s in Golan Heights
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 4 (UPI)The Israeli Army radio said today that Syrian roops on the northern Golan heights front had killed Israeli prisoners of war.

title: Miss Taylor Aids Israelis
description: AMSTERDAM, Nov. 4 (AP)Elizabeth Taylor helped raise $184,000 at a benefit for Israel war widows and orphans here. The actress bought a diamond collar for $2,400 and sold the pearl necklace she wore to the ?? for $800.

title: Insurgents Said to Attack 5 Miles From Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 4 (Reuters)Communistled insurgents today attacked a Government position five miles outside Phnom Penh, the military command said. But the command gave no details of the reported attack, on Prek Thon, northeast of here, and did not mention casualties.

title: GUNMISHAP TOLL UP FOR CIVILIANS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 4A gun purchased to protect a family against an intruder is six times more likely to be used to kill a family member or a friend, according to a study disclosed here today.

title: Stark Contrasts Persist in Philippines's New Society
description: MMANILA  There have been few places in Asia where high society has been higher or the lower depths have been lower than in the Philippines. Now, according to the ideology that President Ferdinand E. Marcos has fashioned for his new society, the oligarchs are being put in their place and, the poor are rising.

title: Albert H. Aronson Dead; Headed Office at H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Albert Henry Aronson, a retired division chief of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare, died last night at George Washington University Hospital here. He was 69 years old.

title: STOPPAGE IMPEDES WASHINGTON POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Supervisory and management personnel were assigned tasks in the printing room late today as The Washington Post prepared an abbreviated Monday morning edition.

title: Briton Compounds Error Of 1815 Into $172Million
description: LONDON, Monday, Nov. 5 (UPI)In 1815 an army pay clerk made a $47.50 mistake, according to Ernest Shead, a retired schoolmaster. As he sees it, the Government owes him $172.5milion.

title: Falcons Triumph By 1513
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 4They played another of those fieldgoal games in Atlanta Stadium today and it came out right for the home side at last. Nick MikeMayer kicked five of them, the last with only 52 seconds to play, as his team, the Falcons, upset the Los Angeles Rams, 1513.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A publication associated with the fashion world has scooped us (which is not hard) on what is in and what is out in party food this season. We hasten to plagiarize.

title: 'BamaIrish Game Shapes Up
description: With bowl invitations set to go out just 12 days hence on Nov. 17 at 6 P.M., it appears more and more as if Notre Dame will meet Alabama in the Orange Bowl and Penn State will make a return trip to the Sugar Bowl or accept a Cotton Bowl offer. The Nittany Lions' opponent in the Sugar Bowl might be Louisiana State. The Cotton Bowl host is always the Southwest Conference champion, usually Texas.

title: MURFAAMCE
description: What has long been contemplated as EastWest negotiation for Mutual and Balanced Force Reductions (MBFR) in central Europe became reality last week under the name of the Vienna conference for Mutual Reduction of Forces and Armaments and Associated Measures Central Europe (MURFAAMCE). This is one case in which diplomats' propensity for complexity of jargon is an accurate reflection of complexity of subject matter.

title: Pleasure Boat Destroyed By Fire Off Far Rockaway.
description: A 25foot pleasure cruiser burned to the waterline t'esterday nearly three miles off Reynold's Channel and East Rockaway Inlet between Long Beach and Far Rockaway.

title: I.T.T.Units Bombed in France
description: PARIS, Monday, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Two powerful bombs exploded outside two factories affiliated with the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation in suburban BoulogneBillancourt last night. No one was reported hurt.

title: About New York
description: The saddest men are these: they are neither young nor old, but somewhere in between; they sit on the rock by the pond at the Children's Zoo in Central Park on Sundays and watch their daughters play; they take their sons to see the Knicks, and their daughters to the movies, and after they have taken the children home to their exwives they go to the hotels, the furnished rooms, the borrowed apartments, the places where they live, and brood about the children, and wonder what to do that night.

title: A Vanishing Breed of Film Director
description: Howard Hawks, Raoul Walsh and William Wellman have made in the last 50 years, from silents to talkies, from small screen to Cinemascope, almost 200 movies that form a rich library of American film history.

title: 10 Independents, on Ballot Offer Diverse Programs
Nastase Outlasts Smith In FiveSet Paris Final
description: PARIS, Nov. 4 (AP)Ilie Nastase dominated a weary Stan Smith in the final two sets today and won the singles final at the French indoor tennis tournament.

title: O'Hagan Order Allows Reduction of Teams
description: The Fire Department, facing a threat by firemen to strike today, said yesterday that trucks would be operated with reduced crews and that, if necessary, civilians might be used to help lay hoses.

title: SAXBE PLEA CITED ON RUINING TAPES
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, Nov. 5 (AP)  Senator William E. Saxbe, whom President Nixon has nominated as Attorney General, has been quoted as advocating last summer the destruction of Watergate tapes if they're incriminating, The Washington Post News Service reported today. The news service said that the Ohio Republican was quoted Aug. 23 by The Hong Kong Standard in a speech to the local chapter of the American Chamber of Commerce in Hong Kong.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 5, 1973

title: 200 Antique Cars Travel In LondontoBrighton Rite
description: BRIGHTON, England, Nov. 4 (AP)More than 200 antique cars traveled 50 miles from London to Brighton today in an annual ritual.

title: Truck Driver Held in Plot On Alabama Law Official
description: FRANKLIN, Tenn., Nov. 4 (A)An Alabama truck driver has been held for action by the Williamson County (Tenn.), grand jury on charges he plotted to assassinate Attorney General William J. Baxley of Alabama.

title: Way Out for Chile
description: Chile's military rulers have finally ordered an end summary executions, though military courts are still inflicting death penalties. The junta has also transferred the last group of foreign, prisoners from the Santiago stadium to the care of refugee agencies. These overdue actions in, themselves will not advance national reconciliation very far, nor halt the storm of criticism from abroad of the junta's excesses.

title: Grieseto Warfield Touchdown Is Key in 2414 Game
description: Uncharacteristic Miami mistakes and an uncharacteristic second quarter for the Jets excited the Shea Stadium crowd of 57,591 prematurely yesterday. Then cooler heads and more talented arms and legs prevailed in the second half, and the Dolphins posted a pre. dictable victory, 2414.

title: CharterStudy Proposals On Ballots in 9 Counties
description: TRENTON, Nov. 4Although the main focus is on the gubernatorial race, some professional politicians are concentrating farther down the ballot, on the County Freeholder election lines.

title: Ulster Bombings Go On Through the Weekend
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 4 (UPI)A parcel bomb planted outside a gas station in Lurgan, County Armagh, blew up today, causing exten sive damage but injuring no one, the police said.

title: Mariner May Reveal a MoonLike Planet
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 4When Mariner 10 reaches Mercury in five months, its television cameras are expected to return the first highresolution pictures for mapping more than half of the hitherto unexplored planet, a barren, sunbaked body that may resemble the cratered moon.

title: Eban Arrives in Rumania
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, Nov. 4 (UPI)Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel arrived today for a threeday official visit to Rumania at the invitation of Foreign Minister Gheorghe Macovescu.

title: Profit Off at Cannon Mills
description: Net income of the Cannon Mills Company declined to $7.1million, or 77 cents a share, in the first nine months of this year from $10.1million, or $1.09 a share, in the yearearlier period, it was reported over the weekend. Sales fell to $257.2million from $260.1million.

title: Crenshaw Records First Victory as Pro
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. Nov. 4 (AP)Ben Crenshaw, a rookie playing with the confidence of a seasoned pro, fashioned a fourunderpar 67 and scored a twostroke victory in the San AntonioTexas open golf tournament today.

title: Mideast Tests Dtente at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 4International efforts to make a Middle East ceasefire work have run up against repeated barriers of SovietAmerican disagreement.

title: Bridge: New Weekly Charity Series Starts in Westbury Today
description: Bridge clubs in the metropolitan area cover a wide spectrum, from the traditional membership clubs with permanent premises to small duplicate clubs running a weekly game.

title: Suns Drop 8th in Row By 10299
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 4 (AP)The Capital Bullets, paced by 25point performances from Mike Riordan and Phil Chenier, won their fourth straight National Basketball Association game tonight., holding off the Phoenix Suns, 10299, at the University of Maryland. It was the eighth loss in a row for Phoenix.

title: Florida Paper Appoints.
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., Nov. (UPI)Joseph Lyons, general manager of Gannett Florida newspapers, has been named publisher of Today, a Cocoa Beach morning newspaper.

title: Tight Curb on Use of Police Data Urged in Justice Dept. Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The Justice Department released today a report calling for tight new restrictions on the use of criminal information systems and intelligence files. Without such restrictions, and without conscious planning to control data gathering, the report said, the right of privacy is seriously endangered.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Assatiation of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities prices at wich securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Gulf Warning on Cyanide
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Nov. 4 (UPI)The Coast Guard today warned Gulf Coast residents from Texas to Florida to beware of small, corroded metal (canisters containing cyanide that may be drifting north after a shipping accident three months ago. They were part of a 390barrel cargo jettisoned Aug. 5, 90 miles off the coast of Yucatan, Mexico.

title: Offense, Defense Futile Against the Raiders
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 4Anyone who thought the New York Giants had hit bottom last week and the week before was wrong: They plunged deeper into total ineffectiveness today while being almost ludicrously manhandled by the Oakland Raiders, 420.

title: MAYOR ACTS TO PAY TOWN FOR HER LIFE
description: METTER, Ga., Nov. 4 (UPI)The Mayor of Metter says she ran for office to repay the town's citizens for saving her life.

title: 5 BROTHELS SHUT IN AN IDAHO TOWN
description: WALLACE, Idaho, Nov. 4People in this mining town were shocked when Closed signs and padlocks appeared on the doors of its five brothels Sept. 29.

title: Junta's Harsh Economic Measures Stagger Chileans
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 4 Seven weeks after overthrowing the Marxist coalition Government, Chile's military junta continues to tighten its control.

title: OFFERINGS HEAVY FOR TAXEXEMPTS
description: The taxexempt bond market faces another multimilliondollar slate of new offerings this week.

title: Eskimos Clinch First
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 4 (AP)The Edmonton Eskimos clinched first place in the Western Conference of the Canadian Football League today with a 2816 victory over the Saskatchewan Roughriders. Tom Wilkson threw three passes for touchdowns for the Eskimos.

title: Advertising: Prospect for 1974
description: Advertising budget cuts forced by the economy in recent years have proven to packagedgoods manufacturers that what they have been preaching for years is true. Advertising does move products.

title: Met College Hockey
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: A Patient Finn in the Mideast
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4A calm blueeyed Finn is the interim commander of a new multinational United Nations force whose ranks will ultimately reach 7,000 and whose job is to keep Israel and Egypt from fighting.

title: SADAT WILL SPEAK FOR OTHER ARABS
description: CAIRO, Nov. 4 President Anwar elSadat has been authorized to speak for President Hafez alAssad of Syria and other Arab leaders Tuesday when Mr. Sadat receives Secretary of State Kissinger here, a Government spokesman said here today.

title: CENSUS FINDS DIP IN NEGRO VOTING
description: A new census study of the nation's voting patterns reports that the percentage of Negroes who votedalready well below the percentage of whites voting declined faster than the figare for whites in last year's Presidential election.

title: Da Capo Players Heard Here In a Recital of Modern Music
description: The Da Capo Chamber Players, an ensemble that devotes its energies chiefly to contemporary music, appeared at Carnegie Recital Hall on Thursday night to play works by Morton Subotnick, Preston Trombly, Stefan Wolpe and Paul Hindemith.

title: Sabres Tie Canadiens On Tally by Martin, 11
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 4 (AP)Rick Martin's 11th goal of the season in the second period gave the, Buffalo Sabres a 11 tie with the Montreal Canadiens in the National Hockey League tonight.

title: Where Do We Go From Here?
description: This article is excerpted from National Review, a conservative weekly.

title: STUDY FINDS WIVES BECOME NEW FORCE
description: CHICAGO, (AP)After decades of being one of the most stable, unchanging groups in American society, wives of working class (blue collar) men are emerging as a new social, political and economic force to be reckoned with, says a recent study by Social Research Incorporated.

title: Segal Resigns From Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 4 (AP)Erich Segal, the author of Love Story, resigned from Yale University last June 30, according to a list released by the university over the weekend. Mr. Segal, an associate professor of classics, failed to gain tenure at Yale. He was on leave at the University of Munich last spring, and is now reported to be at Stanford University, working on a book about comedy.

title: College to Award 2 Years' Credits For Passing Tests
description: HOULTON, Me., Nov, 4 (AP) At Ricker College, a tiny liberal arts school two miles from the Canadian border, student may be able to skip two of the usual four years because of reading he has done or experiences he has had.

title: Edward Senz, MakeUp Artist For Theater, Film and TV, Dies
description: Edward Senz, a makeup man for theater, movies and television who had also run salons for politically and socially prominent people, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 300 West 55th Street.

title: KISSINGER LEAVES TODAY FOR TALKS IN MIDDLE EAST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Secretary of State Kissinger leaves, on a roundtheworld trip tomorrow that will take him to Cairo for crucial talks on strengthening the Middle East ceasefire and to Peking for a longplanned review of the international scene with Chinese leaders.

title: Young Vic Thrives on Critical Youth
description: The Young Vic, the experimental offspring of the National Theater, is one of three important British repertory theaters coming to the Brooklyn Academy of Music in fourmonth British Theater Season.

title: Northwest Mutual Sales Up
description: The Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Company reported yesterday that sales for the first nine months totaled a record $2.3billion, up 21 per cent from $1.9billion in the yearearlier period. Insurance in force also reached a peak of $24.9billion, an increase of 11 per cent from the yearearlier total of $22.5billion.

title: MRS. JOSEPH C. HAZEN
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 4Mrs. Ruth B. Hazen, widow of the Rev. Dr. Joseph C. Hazen, former pastor of the North Orange Baptist Church, died today at Memorial Center for Women in West Orange. She was 85 years oid and had been a resident of Summit since 1936, when her husband retired.

title: Forbes Balloon Hits Lines
description: HARTWOOD, Va., Nov. 4 (AP)A hotair balloon being piloted across the country by Malcolmn Forbes, the magazine publisher who says he is just out to have some fun, struck power lines here yesterday but landed safely.

title: The Special Prosecutor.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4For reasons going back centuries in AngloAmerican legal history, we have an adversary system of justice in this country. The premise of that system is that truth is most likely to emerge, in a court of law, from an open clash of conflicting interests. It is not the only possible view; other cultures differ. But it is ours.

title: Laughton's 2 Goals Lift Blades to a 43 Triumph
description: VANCOUVER, Nov. 4 (AP) Mike Laughton scored his second goal of the game late In the third period to give the New York Golden Blades a 43 World Hockey Association victory over the Vancouver Blazers today.

title: Andreas Case Is Postponed
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 4 (AP) The arraignment of Dwayne O. Andreas, a soybean company executive, on a charge of making illegal corporate campaign contributions has been postponed until Nov. 23 because Mr. Andreas is in Europe.

title: Morgenthau Says '70 U.S. Law Would Bar Fare Increase Here
description: Robert M. Morgenthau, former United States Attorney, said yesterday that a New York City subway and bus fare increasenow or in the futurewould be illegal under the 1970 Clean Air Act.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three persons were killed yesterday when a small private airplane crashed and burst into flames on the Southern State Parkway in North Amityville, L.I., near Route 110. The state parkway police said a Piper Cherokee singleengine craft crashed about 2:30 P.M.

title: 35 Students Visit Aged Brooklyn Jews
description: Thirtyfive New Jersey students from Teaneck High School, Englewood High School, Bergenfield High School and the Rogosin Yeshiva of Jersey City visited aged, indigent and lonely Jews in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon.

title: No London Papers Today
description: LONDON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)No daily or evening newspapers will appear in the London area tomorrow because of a oneday stoppage by Fleet Street newspaper mechanics. The workers are acting in support of the Amalgamated Union of Engineer Workers, Whose executive board is opposing a $187,500 fine iniposed on the union by the National Industrial Relations Court, for refusing to call off a strike at a machine parts factory.

title: Reds in Italy Oppose Abortion and Anger Feminists
description: ROME, Nov. 4  The Communist party has come out against legalized abortion, angering Italy's fledgling women's movement and pleasing the Vatican.

title: Steelers Activate Two
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Steelers said today they would activate Joe Gilliam, a quarterback, to replace injured Terry Bradshaw for their game with the Washington Redskins tomorrow night. A defensive lineman, Steve Furness, also was activated. Roy Gerela, a placekicker hospitalized two days with tonsilitis, has been released and will play.

title: Music: Levy's Masada
description: WASHINGTON timeless subject made timely by recent events but burdened with a timebound style pretty much sums up Masada, an eveninglong oratorio by Marvin David Levy, which was given its premiere here Tuesday night by the National Symphony Orchestra. The work was commissioned a year and a half ago, and the composer felt that the story of the ancient Jewish fortification would be worth treatment, never guessing that the first performance would shortly follow a new defense by Israel against its enemies.

title: City's Hospitals Prepare for a Walkout Today
description: Fortyeight voluntary hospitals and nursing homes stocked up on blood plasma and TV dinners yesterday in lastminute preparations for a strike of 30,0000 technical, service and maintenance workers set for 6 A.M. this morning.

title: Water Is on Again in Rome
description: ROME, Monday, Nov. 5 (AP) The water went on again this morning in many parts of Rome after a fourday dry spell to allow repair of the city's main aqueduct. Firemen said that about 100 apartments had been flooded because the occupants had left taps open.

title: 4 Mayoral Hopefuls Here In Final Joint Appearances
description: Two of the major mayoral candidates renewed yesterday their criticism of what they said were heavy realestate contributions to the campaign of Controller Abraham D. Beanie, the Democrat who is expected to be elected the 104th Mayor of New York City.

title: Vikings Stay Undefeated By Topping Browns, 263
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn Nov. 4The Minnesota Vi?? ings remained the only u?? beaten team in professional football today with a 26victory over the Cleveland Browns.

title: Price Bars Holiday Feast
description: CASTELLA, Calif., Nov. 4 (AP)There will not be any community Thanksgiving feast this year in this tiny Northern California town. The price of turkeys is too high, organizers of the dinner decided.

title: Pacers Set Back Squires by 128122
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 4 (AP)  The Indiana Pacers broke a 118118 tie with 10 consecutive points in the final 1 minute 32 seconds and defeated the Virginia Squires, 128 to 122, today in an American Basketball Association game.

title: City's Hospitals Prepare for a Walkout Today
description: Fortyeight voluntary hospitals and nursing homes stocked up on blood plasma and TV dinners yesterday in lastminute preparations for a strike of 30,000 technical, service and maintenance workers set for 6 A.M. this morning.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Personal Finance
description: Every year well over a million outofstate cars pour into New York.

title: TRAFFIC DISPUTES LEAVE TWO SLAIN
description: Two people were slain in separate incidents Saturday night after becoming involved in traffic disputes.

title: Scores Hurt as Protesters And Police Clash in Athens
description: ATHENS, Nov. 4Scores of policemen and civilians were hurt in street clashes here today after a memorial service to honor a liberal former Premier, George Papandreou, who died five years ago.

title: 3 Killed in Delta Blast
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Three persons were killed and 22 wounded last night in a bomb explosion at a restaurant in the Mekong Delta.
