The South Vietnamese military command reported that the explosion had occurred in a village on the outskirts of Ben Tre, capital of Kien Hoa Province. He said the bomb was planted by Vietcong guerrillas, who have been waging a campaign in the delta for the past month.

title: JERSEY STUDENTS VISIT AGED HERE
description: Thirtyfive New Jersey students from Teaneck High School, Englewood High School, Bergenfield High School and the Rogosin Yeshiva of Jersey City visited aged, indigent and lonely Jews in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon.

title: Steelers Activate Two
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 4 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Steelers said today they would activate Joe Gilliam, a quarterback, to replace injured Terry Bradshaw for their game with the Washington Redskins tomorrow night. A defensive lineman, Steve Furness, also was activated. Roy Gerela, a placekicker hospitalized two days with tonsilitis, has been released and will play.

title: Music: English Sinfonia at Hunter
description: Hunter College's 197374 Saturday evening series got off to a lackluster start on the weekend with the first appearance here of the English Sinfonia, a chamber orchestra from Nottingham, England, led by Neville Dilkes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Arabs Term T heir Oil Embargo More Severe Than Foreseen
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 9The Arab oil embargo against supporters of Israel is more severe than was originally foreseen, and new supply cuts are impending, Arab oil ministers said here today.

title: A TrailerCamp Plan In Vermont Opposed
description: PLAINFIELD, Vt.  The scarlet leaves of the maples and the yellow of the birches are nearly all down now, and in the wild forest surrounding Spruce Mountain the black bear are preparing their winter dens under uprooted trees or in hollow logs, where cubs will be born in late January or early February.

title: Nixon Standing Fast as Resignation Demands Increase
description: MIAMI, Nov. 4  President Nixon stood fast today in the face of multiplying demands for his resignation.

title: The Netherlands Takes a Carless Sunday in Stride
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 4The people rollerskated, bicycled, strolled six abreast or trotted on horseback through the streets of their cities today. They rowed in their canals, held sitdown, picnics in the middle of empty superhighways and went to soccer games in 19th century coaches drawn by manetossing steeds.

title: Australian Leader Leaves Peking With Sugar Order
description: PEKING, Nov. 4 (Reuters)Prime Minister Gough Whitlam of Australia left Peking today after a fiveday state visit that he hailed as a breakthrough in relations and the end of a generation of misunderstanding.

title: Philadelphia Job Study
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (AP)  A Federal study shows that blacks and women hold a strong portion of Philadelphia's city jobs, but that most are lowpaying. The Equal Opportunity Employment Commission charted the study.

title: Head of Bricklayers Union Wins in Rerun of Election
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) Thomas F. Murphy, president, and the rest of his executive board were easy winners yesterday in a rerun of elections for leadership of the Bricklayers, Masons and Plasterers International Union.

title: A MALL PLANNED BY ALEXANDER'S
description: Alexander's, Inc. one of New York's largest retailers, plans to build an enclosed shopping mall, parking garage and sevleral apartment houses on a site adjacent to its Rego Park store property in Queens.

title: 2 Reported Shot to Death In Moscow During Hijacking
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4 (Reuters) Unconfirmed reports here tonight said that security policemen had shot two men to death during an airline hijacking on Friday. Soviet authorities were not available for questioning on the reports.

title: Lebanese Indict 16 Arabs For Forming Islamic Party
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 4 (AP)The Lebanese Prosecutor General indicted 16 Arabs today for forming an outlawed Islamic Liberation party here, distributing subversive leaflets and slandering Arab kings and heads of state. The indictment asks sevenyear prison terms.

title: PLANES SEEKING MAN SUCKED OUT OF JET
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Nov'4 (UPI)Civilian and military search teams flew over hundreds of miles of rugged wilderness today seeking the body of a man who had been sucked through a jetliner's shattered cabin window 39,000 feet above the ground.

title: Stern Forms a Unit For Voting Complaints
description: NEWARK, Nov. 4 (AP)United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern has announced the creation of a Special Election Task Force to handle complaints of irregularities in Tuesday's statewide election.

title: KISSINGER LEAVES TODAY FOR TALKS IN MIDDLE EAST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Secretary of State Kissinger leaves on a roundtheworld trip tomorrow that will take him to Cairo for crucial talks on strengthening the Middle East ceasefire and to Peking for a longplanned review of the international scene with Chinese leaders.

title: 4 Women Are Among 5 To Get Judgeships Today
description: Although a new Mayor will be elected tomorrow, the present Mayor will demonstrate today that his, own power is still considerable ht, naming five Civil Court judges. Four of them will be women.

title: Lisa Ellick Bride Of Steven Eizen
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4Miss Lisa Ellick, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel D. Ellick was married here this afternoon to Steven Eizen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Eizen of Penn Valley.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: George Marnall, who will be 82 years old on Dec. 29, will return to acting after directing more than 400 films over the last 60 years.

title: SAIGON SAYS HANOI CAPTURES 2 CAMPS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 4.  North Vietnamese tanks and troops attacked and seized two Government camps, near the Cambodian border today after a daylong battle that was described by the military command in Saigon as one of the most savage since the Jan. 28 ceasefire.

title: Sharp Captures 2d U.S. Car Title
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 4 (UPI)Bob Sharp of Wilton, Conn., held off Gary Rodrigues of Lomita, Calif., today to win his second straight C production Sports Car Club of America national championship at Road Atlanta.

title: HOUSE MOVES SEEN ON SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) The House plans action this week on a Social Security increase, while the Senate concentrates on its inquiries on Watergate, the nomination of Representative Gerald R. Ford as Vice President, and the dismissal of Archibald Cox.

title: EVA LEE
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Nov. 4 Miss Eva Lee, an art dealer here, died today in Terre Haute, Ind., where she was undergoing medical treatment. She was 49 years old and lived at 7 Prospect Street here. Miss Lee, a refugee from Nazi Germany, was the owner of Eva Lee Gallery, Inc., which specialized in modern art.

title: Jets and Giants Lose
description: The Miami Dolphins defeated the Jets, 2414, at Shea Stadium yesterday. In Oakland, Calif., the Raiders trounced the Giants, 420, for New York's sixth loss in a row. Details, Page 57.

title: Activities of Grand Street Settlement Reflect Diversity of Neighborhood
description: A schedule of activities posted in the lobby of the old Grand Street Settlement House on Rivington Street in the heart of the Lower East Side lists, among other nightly events, wrestling, the Young Socialist League, sewing, Oneg Shabat (a Yiddish cultural organization) and karate.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
14 Die in Burlington County In 2 Automobile Mishaps
description: MOUNT HOLLY, Nov. 4 (UPI) Four persons were killed today in two automobile accidents in Burlington County.

title: Freed Canadian Is Back
description: WATERLOO, Ontario, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Ronald Patrik Lippert, a Canadian who spent 10 years in jail in Cuba after being found guilty of smuggling arms, for the United States Central Intelligence Agency, arrived home today after being pardoned. Mr. Lippert, convicted in 1963 for smuggling arms hidden in juice cans into Cuba, was originally sentenced to death but later his sentence was commuted to 30 years imprisonment.

title: SOCIAL SECURITY TO WATCH ALIENS
description: In two to four weeks the Social Security Administration will begin a program in which Social Security accounting will be used to discover aliens resident in the United States who are working here illegally.

title: Rangers Lose to Hawks
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4The Rangers' longest victoryless streak in almost four years reached seven games tonight in a 41 loss to the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: GUILD AND NEWS CONTINUE TALKS
description: Negotiators for the Newspaper Guild and The Daily News sought last night and early today to reach a contract agreement that would avert a strike threatened for today.

title: Saints' Defense Halts Bills, 130, Holds O. J. to 79 Yards Rushing
Forced Subscriptions In Soviet Are Criticized
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4 (AP)Highpressure subscription salesmen are harrassing Russians, and the practice ought to be stopped, the Communist party paper Pravda said today. Citizens often are subjected to bureaucratic pressure to subscribe to magazines, and newspapers by party activists, ministries and state publishing houses.

title: TWO ARE KILLED IN BROOKLYN FIRE
description: A man and a women were killed and more than a score of tenants were left homeless yesterday when a predawn fire that might have been set by an arsonist swept through the top floors of a threestory brick tenement building in Brooklyn.

title: Major Bills In Congress
description: Cambodia  Prohibits use of funds for bombing in Cambodia after Aug. 15, 1973 (PL 9352).

title: Meeting Called by Simon On U.S. RailAid Outrage
description: Norton Simon, the restless 66yearold financier and art collector, who is a director and one of the largest stockholders in Burlington Northern, Inc., feels that pending Federal legislation to restructure the bankrupt Eastern railroads with government  guaranteed loans is an outrage.

title: Books of The Times
description: There must be a bit of the worm in most of us, because watching him turn has an almost infallible appeal. Fair Game has another, even stronger pull: man against the, machine. The hero, or antihero, John Grueby is pursued by killers who use a computer to figure out where he will go and what he will do. In a climax that shows how far suspense novels are reaching for originality, Grueby gets a computer on his side and the two machines fight it out.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Group to Battle for Sports Complex

title: OffDuty Officer In Cleveland Kills Seven and Himself
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 4 (AP)An offduty policeman who had reportedly told his father everything was down on him shot and killed his wife, daughter, son and four upstairs neighbors before taking his own life this morning, the police said.

title: Auditing the Auditors
description: In an action last week that reflects the growing public concern over the failure of auditors to protect the public, the Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit against a major accounting firm, Peat, Marwick, Mitchell and Company, as well as against the corporation whose allegedly false statements the accountants certified. The case should be taken as a serious warning to the entire accounting profession, which has come under heavy criticism in recent years as a result of the collapse of the Penn Central Railroad, Equity Funding and other business disasters, of which the public had little or no warning.

title: White House Compiles Alleged Press Sins
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4In, the White House there is a carefully compiled list of alleged journalistic sins that television in particular has committed against President Nixon. They are sins of omission and sins of commission, and partly because of the list there is every indication, people in the White House say, that for the foreseeable future at least the President is going to keep up his attacks on the press.

title: BROOKE APPEALS TO NIXON TO RESIGN FOR NATION'S SAKE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 A year tb the week after President Nixon's landslide reelection victory, Senator Edward W. Brooke of Massachusetts became today the first Republican Senator publicly to urge Mr. Nixon to resign.

title: SAIGON SAYS HANOI CAPTURES 2 CAMPS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 5North Vietnamese tanks and troops attacked and seized two Government camps near the Cambodian border yesterday after daylong battle that was described by the military command in Saigon as one of the most savage since the Jan. 28 ceasefire.

title: Labor Israel Picks Shapiro
description: Dr. Judah J. Shapiro, Zionist National Committee for Labor leader and educator, was elect; ed yesterday president of the Israel at the close of the organizations's threeday golden jubilee convention at the New York Hilton Hotel. The committee raises funds for humanitarian projects carried out by Histadrut, the Israel labor federation.

title: Kom Statue's Homecoming Will End 3Year Search by Peace Corps Volunteer
description: BAMENDA, Cameroon, Nov. 2The sacred AfoAKom is coming home and the man who deserves substantial credit for its return is Craig. Kinzelman, a young American Peace Corps volunteer working here in the Cameroon grasslands.

title: Tight Curb on Use of Police Data Urged in Justice Dept. Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The Justice Department released to day a report calling for tigh new restrictions on the use of criminal information systems and intelligence files. Without such restrictions, and without conscious planning to control data gathering, the report said the right of privacy is seriously endangered.

title: U.S. PSYCHIATRIST ENDS SOVIET VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The president of the American Psychiatric Association has returned from a visit to the Soviet Union, hopeful of achieving a freer international exchange of information on the uses and abuses of psychiatry.

title: Proxmire Says Arms Bill Exceeds Funds Appropriated
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today that a joint HouseSenate conference version of the military procurement bill violated the spirit of the legislative process because it authorized more money than either Congressional body appropriated.

title: The Netherlands Takes a C arless Sunday in Stride
description: AMSTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 4The people rollerskated, bicycled, strolled six abreast or trotted on horseback through the streets of their cities today. They rowed in their canals, held sitdown picnics in the middle of empty superhighways and Went to soccer games in 19th century coaches drawn by manetossing steeds.

title: Don't Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Columnists James Reston and Joseph Alsop have joined Tom Wicker and Anthony Lewis in urging President Nixon, to resign.

title: CECILIA ALBANESE SINGS FIRST GILDA
description: The City Opera introduced a new Gilda in Saturday night's performance of RigolettoCecilia Albanese, a soprano from Venezuela who has been singing fairly extensively in European opera houses in the last few years.

title: NEW PRESIDENT SET BY HOLIDAY INNS, INC.
description: L. M. Clymer, former executive vice president of Holiday Inns, Inc., has been made its president, succeeding William B. Walton, who was elevated to vice chairman of the board, a post also held by Wallace E. Johnson, it was announced yesterday.

title: T.W.A. Strike Begun
description: A strike of stewards and stewardesses of T.W.A. began at 12:01 A.M. today, and the airline announced that all 421 scheduled domestic flights would be canceled, affecting 35,000 passengers. Details on Page 42.

title: Impact of U.S.Trade Tie On Russians Is Debated
description: The Nixon Administration's decision to seek postponement of Congressional debate on controversial trade benefits for the Soviet Union has focused attention on what the granting of lower import tariffs and of credits would actually mean to the Russians.

title: Israelis Face Lean Times As Costly War Ends Boom
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 4In the wake of the costliest war in Israel's history, the country is bracing for a prolonged period of severe economic austerity.

title: Bentsen Mentioned As '76 Contender For White House
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 4  Two Houston lawyers may be rivals for President in 1976.

title: G.O.P. Hopes to Become Respectable City Council Minority
description: In the City Council elections tomorrow, the r,3publican party stands to regain seats lost to Liberals four years ago, when Mayor Lindsay headed the Liberal ticket, and to become once again a minority party that can hold a caucus in something larger than a telephone booth.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUMS THE WORD There are splashes of fall color around town, and many of them have been planted by the Parks Department's new Urban Greenery Program. These colorful splotches are in the shape of 12,000 chrysanthemums that have been laid out for the fall season.

title: Blast Kills 2 in Germany
description: TELGTE, West Germany, Nov. 4 (AP)A gas explosion tore through a house today in this town in northwest West Germany, killing two persons, injuring eight, destroying six cars, putting apolice station on the ground floor out of commission and blocking a national highway with rubble, officials reported.

title: BYRNE, SANDMAN IN A CLASH ON TV
description: New Jersey's major Nandi, dates Governor, carrying their battle for votes down the wire, confronted each other yesterday in two televised appearances in which each reiterated his stands on such issues as the state income tax and legalized abortion.

title: Everyone Has It and It's Fun. . .
description: Mrs. Mortimer Solomon was waiting for her lunch date at Orsini's restaurant. She looked, as her husband is wont to say, like a million dollars. Her reddishhair was covered with a brown felt Adolfo hat; her sincere eyes peered from beneath a brown veil, and her shapely feet were shod in twotoned sling back sandals by David Evins.

title: U.A.W. LOCALS BACK HARVESTER ACCORD
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 4 (AP)A spokesman for the International Harvester Company said tonight that United Auto Workers members had ratified a threeiyear contract and were expected to begin returning to work tomorrow.

title: VOLUNTEERS BUILD A WATER SYSTEM
description: REDDING, Calif., Nov. 2 (AP)  A group of retired tradesmen put their skills to work again after learning that a water system for their community would cost $50,000 at regular rates. They did the job themselves for far less.

title: Wallace in Hospital
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 4 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace will remain in University Hospital one or two more days recovering from a minor operation, but hospital officials said the Governor was doing real, real well.

title: Auto Makers See Best Chance In Years to Raise U.S. Exports
description: DETROIT, Nov. 4  Each year, more and more ships from West Germany, Japan and other foreign countries dock at American ports to unload their cargoes of Volkswagens, Toyotas and other shiny new imported cars.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Additional Drop of 5% Set for December
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Arab oil states escalated today their oil weapon program of production cuts, with a new formula that seemed to require total embargoes on supplies to some more major consumers.

title: ADDICT AND PRISONER ARE FOUND HANGED
description: A 28  year  old drug addict detained in a state facility in Harlem and a suspect being held in a police station on East 21st Street both hanged themselves last night, the police reported.

title: Catholic Church Offers Its Cooperation in Chile
description: ROME, Nov. 5The Roman Catholic Church has offered Chile's military rulers the same collaboration that the church had given in all matters of common welfare to the Marxist Government of President Salvador Allende Gossons.

title: Terms Reached in Strike
description: FORT FRANCES, Ont., Nov 5 (AP)A tentative agreement has been reached to settle a fourmonthold strike by the International Association of Machinists chinists at the local plant of the OntarioMinnesota Pulp and Paper Company, Ltd.

title: City's Busiest Firehouse Supports Strike
description: The men of La Casa Grande, the busiest firehouse in the cityat 169th Street and Intervale Avenue in the East Bronxsat in their firehouse kitchen telling tales of dramatic fires and false alarms yesterday afternoon, waiting out the long hours of union negotiations in a mood of nervous jocularity.

title: STRIKE CURTAILS MEDICAL SERVICES AT HOSPITALS HERE
description: The most extensive hospital strike in the city's history began yesterday, forcing the curtailment of medical and custodial care at 48 voluntary hospitals and nursing homes in the metropolitan area.

title: Dey, Mr. Golf of P.G.A., Will Retire in February
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Nov. 5Joseph C. Dey, golf's commissioner, announced today that he would retire on Feb. 28, 1974, when his fiveyear contract ends with the Tournament Players Division of the Professional Golfers' Association.

title: Mercy Killer Acquitted on Insanity Plea
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 5Lester Zygmaniak, who shot his brother to death in a hospital bed where the brother lay paralyzed from the neck down after a motorcycle accident, was acquitted of murder today by a Superior Court jury on the ground that he was temporarily insane when he fired the fatal shot.

title: Public TV to Cover Watergate On Nightly Basis Through Tape
description: With the three commercial networks having discontinued their daily television pool of the Senate Watergate hearings, the National Public Affairs Center for Television in Washington has set up its own installation to resume coverage this week over the Public Broadcasting Service.

title: Small U. S. Towns, Thought to Be Dying, Show Renewed Vitality and Popularity
description: The dying American small town, once the backbone of the new nation and more recently the heralded symbol of the death of our national innocence, may not be dying at all.

title: Ches:
description: As a young player, I held the erroneous view that corn binations, as opposed to pure position play, were either a form of low trickery or, at best, icing on the cake. I suppose it's natural for beginners to feel that way, preoccupied as they must be with mastering the simple mechanics of the moves and onemove threats.

title: BACKER IN SENATE BIDS NIXON MAKE FULL DISCLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Senator Peter H. Dominick, a conservative Republican of Colorado who has been a stanch supporter of President Nixon, called on the President today to make a complete disclosure of all information about the Watergate investigations.

title: Cahill Will Ask the Legislature to Pledge Moral Support in Financing of Stadium
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5Governor Cahill announced this evening that he would ask the Legislature next week to rescue the proposed financing of a New Jersey sports complex in the northern Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Haldoman Feted at Welcome Home Bob Luncheon
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 Over 70 of Los Angeles's leading citizens were on hand today to pay tribute, at a Welcome Home Bob luncheon, to an old friend who is moving back to his home town.

title: Protection for Rare Bird
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Nov. 5 (UPI)The United States Forest Service will set aside four or five acres in the Croatan National Forest to protect the rare and endangered redcockaded woodpecker discovered by a group of East Carolina University students, as cording to the school.

title: STRIKE CURTAILS MEDICAL SERVICES AT HOSPITALS HERE
description: The most extensive hospital strike in the city's history began yesterday, forcing the curtailment of medical and custodial care at 48 voluntary hospitals and nursing homes in the metropolitan area.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: KISSINGER BEGINS TOUR IN MOROCCO
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 5 Secretary of State Kissinger tonight brought to the Arab world his effort to overcome Middle East ceasefire problems and to promote the start of fullscale peace negotiations. He arrived in Morocco to a military honorguard welcome.

title: Campaign in Jersey Ends on Bitter Note
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5New Jersey's campaign for Governor ended as it began today, on a bitter notethis one caused by a lastminute attempt by supporters of Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the Republican candidate, to create an emotional abortion issue.

title: Books of The Times
description: FEAR OF FLYING. By Erica Song. 340 pages. Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $6.95.

title: MARC ALLEGRET, 73, A SCREEN DIRECTOR
description: PARIS, Nov. 5Marc Allgret, the film director, died at his home here Saturday. His age was 73.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: From the Police Blotter:

title: Steelers Set Back Redskins
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 5The Pittsburgh Steelers survived the heroics and the avarice of a neophyte quarterback, Joe Gilliam, in the fourth quarter here tonight in their 2116 victory over the Washington Redskins. Gilliam, playing in place of Terry Hanratty, the starter who had to leave the game with his sore ribs injured again, threw a beautiful touchdown pass but also had two passes intercepted.

title: Israeli Finds Father's Grave
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5 (Reuters) An Israeli soldier has found Ithe grave of his father who died while serving with the British Army in Egypt during World War II on the west bank of the Suez Canal. We've been looking for my father's grave for 33 years, Itamar Weissbein told the Israeli Army radio tonight. We knew he had been buried near Ismailia. Mr. Weissbein has applied for permission to have the remains transferred to Israel.

title: ELIZABETH LINDEMANN
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N.Y., Nov. 5Elizabeth Lindemann, a retired New York history and civics teacher, who for more than 25 years worked with the late Dr. Angelo Patri in pioneering liberal teaching at Junior High School 45, in the Bronx, died today at the John E. Andrus Memorial Home. Her age was 85.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: Johannesburg, South AfricaArnold Taylor, 118 pounds, South Africa, knocked out Romeo Anaya, 118, Mexico, 14 rounds; Taylor won World Boxing Association's version of world bantamweight title.

title: Orderlies' Jobs Assumed By Hospitals' Executives
description: While the pickets marched and chanted outside on 77th Street yesterday, Edward Erskine slipped into a rumpled set of orderly's fatigues on the operating floor of Lenox Hill Hospital and began a daylong struggle with autoclaves and sterile pads.

title: Yearend Dividend Is $2.35 at G.M.
description: Directors of the General Motors Corporation at their regular monthly meeting here yesterday, declared a yearend dividend of $2.35 per share payable Dec. 10 to stockholders of record Nov. 15. In the fourth quarter of 1972, G.M. paid a dividend of $1.65 a share.

title: Opera: Magda Olivero Sings Title Role in Adriana Lecouvreur
description: NEWARK, Nov. 5Magda Olivero at last seems to have found a niche in American operatic life with the Opera Theatre of New Jersey. This very special singer, who appeals to very specialized tastes, opened the company's 197374 fouropera series last night at Newark's Symphony Hall in the title role of Cilea's Adriana Lecouvreur.

title: Illinois Representative to Quit
description: WEST FRANKFORT, Ill., Nov. 5 (UPI)  Representative Kenneth J. Gray, Democrat of Illinois, a 10term member of congress, announced today that he would retire for health reasons when his current term expires next year.

title: Thompson Wins Decision
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Nov. 5 (UP)The British Commonwealth lightwelterweight lioxing champion, Hector Thompson, took a 10round decision from Puerto Rico's Jose Marquez tonight. Thompson won seven rounds as he kept Marquez backing up with stiff left jabs and right crosses.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: SUNDAY'S GAME

title: City Center Actors Plan 4Week Broadway Run
description: The City Center Acting Company, New York's youngest, most peripatetic repertory theater, which grew out of the Drama Division of the Juilliard School, will make its Broadway debut in a special fourweek season of four plays at the Billy Rose Theater from Dec. 18 through Jan. 12.

title: Mayor Swears In Five Judges, Four Women, for Interim Terms
description: Mayor Lindsay swore in five Civil Court judges yesterday to interim terms for assignment to the Foster Care Parts and Family Court.

title: Secretariat's Goodby Today
description: Thousands of followers of form will pay their final respects to Secretariat at Aqueduct this afternoon without having to think about win, place or show. The great golden chestnut colt is due to make the final appearance of his career in what amounts to a nonracing walk. One of the most popular horses ever to run at New York's Big Wheel Belmont Park and Saratoga as well as the Big Athe 3yearold star of the Meadow Stable will parade down Aqueduct's stretch. The stroll will provide the highlight to ceremonies that will start in the paddock.

title: Prices for Wheat Close With Gains
description: Aster a day of seesawing prices, wheat futures ended as much as 20 cents a bushel higher, the daily trading limit, on the Chicago Board of Trade. Early in the session prices were down as much as 10 cents.

title: Arthur Daley
description: If Yale wanted to be a bit snobbish about the situation, the Elis merely exercised aristocratic rights that are especially proper for the anointed. When Alfred Earle Neale was named to the Yale football staff some 40 years ago, he was referred to only as Earle. No one in the area the Bowl would have dreamed of using the unattracive label the football world knew him by, Greasy Neale. Parenthetically, it might be mentioned that Douglas Walker was addressed as Douglas when he was added to the staff. Everywhere else he was known as Peahead Walker.

title: SENATE APPROVES ARMS FUND BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  The Senate passed a $21.3billion weapons procurement bill today. The measure now goes to President Nixon. The vote was 69 to 12.

title: Kings County Psychiatric Ward Is Evacuated by a Bedding Fire
description: All 40 patients in a ward of the Kings County Hospital psychiatric division were evacuated safely last night when a bedding fire sent dense, choking smoke rolling through the wing, hospital officials reported.

title: ISRAEL ISOLATED IN BLACK AFRICA
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5The blue and white Israeli flag flew to day from only five diplomatic missions in black Africa. Eighteen months ago there were 31.

title: Spanish Bus Plunge Kills 6
description: LOGRONO, Spain, Nov. 5 (AP)A passenger bus careened down an embankment near Logrofio.in northern Spain today, killing 5 people and injuring 40, officials said.

title: Fire Put Out on Freighter Bearing Cargo of Explosives
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 5 (UPI)A Liberian freighter carrying commercial explosives caught fire off the Washington Coast during the weekend but the blaze was brought under control without serious damage.

title: Chile's Military Ending Random Killings
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5Random killings of civilians by the police and armed forces have declined sharply in Santi ago in the last month, a survey of 20 workingclass communities in the capital shows.

title: Senate Backs Air Fare Cuts On Aged Young, Handicapped
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today authorizing airlines, railroads and bus companies to offer reduced fares to persons 65 years old and over or 21 and younger and to the handicapped.

title: Sony Unit Sets Heath Pact
description: The Sony Corporation of Japan announced yesterday ?? its subsidiary, the Sony Trading Corporation, has signed an agreement to distribute products of the Heath Corporation, including its Heathkit line, in Japan. Heath is reportedly the largest doityourself electronics company in the world and distributes its products in 60 countries.

title: Eight Strikes Since 1950 Have Shut Papers Here
description: The walkout yesterday by the Newspaper Guild at The Daily News is the latest chapter of a bitter history of newspaper labor relations in which citywide newspapers have been halted from publication eight times since 1950.

title: Firemen Set Strike Today Despite Warning by Court
description: The city's 10,900 firemen will strike this morning, the Uniformed Firefighters Association vowed yesterday, despite a State Supreme Court injunction and a court warning that every striking fireman would be cited for contempt.

title: NEWSPAPER GUILD STRIKES AT NEWS
description: The Newspaper Guild struck The Daily News in a contract dispute yesterday, preventing publication of its Tuesday editions. The guild, meanwhile, reached a tentative twoyear agreement with The New York Times a few hours after the start of the walkout at The News.

title: ExMackelllnvestigator Is Found Guilty Of Receiving Free Avis Cars as Bribes
description: Joseph Monty, former chief investigator for the Queens District Attorney, was found guilty late yesterday of receiving bribesin the form of free carsfrom the Avis RentaCar System.

title: False Advertising Of Wonder Bread Charged by F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI)  The Federal Trade Commission ruled today that Wonder Bread, the largest selling white bread in the country, had been falsely advertised for the last decade as an extraordinary food that would cause children to grow dramatically.

title: 39 Brooklyn Schools Mark Black Holiday Despite Board Edict
description: Thirtynine public schools in twa Brooklyn school districts closed yesterday to commemorate Black Solidarity Day in defiance of Board of Education directives that the districts be assessed for any loss in state aid because of the unauthorized closings.

title: DR. HAIM GINOTT, PSYCHOLOGIST, 51
description: Dr. Haim Ginott, noted child psychologist and author of Between Parent and Child, died Sunday at Beekman Downtown Hospital. His age was 51, and he lived at 923 Fifth Avenue.

title: Mercy Killer Acquitted on Insanity Plea
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 5Lester Zygmaniak, who shot his brother to death in a hospital bed where the brother lay paralyzed from the neck down after a motorcycle accident, was acquitted of murder today by a Superior Court jury on the ground that he was temporarily, insane when he fired the fatal shot.

title: NIXON AIDE HAILS HEALTH CARE PLAN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5Caspar W. Weinberger, the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, in a speech today at the formal opening of the 101st annual meeting of the American Public Health Association here, defended the Nixon Administration's policies of impoundment of funds and the reorganization of the Federal health system.

title: U.S. Says Israel Still Needs $2.2Billion but Revises Reasons
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Administration said today that the $2.2billion in emergency military aid requested for Israel would be used to replace her combat losses and build up her forces to a greater strength than before the war.

title: U.S. Dubious of a New Egyptian Attack
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Nixon Administration sought today to sidestep Israeli charges that Egyptians were massing forces for an attack and that Egypt and Southern Yemen were blockading Israelbound vessels at the entrance to the Red Sea.

title: Saigon Tells of Strafing Lost Outposts
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 6  South Vietnamese planes strafed and bombed North Vietnamese fromations yesterday around two Government militia outposts near the Cambodian border that on Sunday were overwhelmed by tanks, the South Vietnamese command announced.

title: Stock Prices Slump
description: Stock prices fell sharply again yesterday, pushing the DowJones industrial average down 15.88 points. The slump came amid widening uncertainties over the political future of President Nixon and mounting oil shortages. Details on Page 49.

title: SEGRETTI IS GIVEN A SIXMONTH TERM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Donald H. Segretti was sentenced today in United States District Court to six months in prison for his efforts to disrupt the 1972 Democratic Presidential primary in Florida.

title: Justices Will Be Ready To Settle Vote Disputes
description: Here are the 10 locations where Supreme Court Justices will he available to handle any disputes over voters' rights today from 7 A.M. in Manhattan, the Bronx and Queens, and from 6 A.M. in Brooklyn and Staten Island:

title: Schlumberger's Earnings Set a Record in Quarter
Boston Globe Sues Over Ban On Clifford Irving Interview
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)Attorneys for The Boston Globe have filed a civil complaint in United States District Court here against the Justice Department and Bureau of Prisons for being refused an interview with Clifford Irving, the author.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Senate Panel Told Desulphurizing Gas Is Costly
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Senate Public Works Committee was given a pessimistic view by a major oil company today on the prospects for dealing promptly with a newly highlighted health hazard in controlling auto emissions. At the opening of three days of critical hearings on whether auto pollution laws should be eased, the committee was told by a Mobil Oil Corporation official that removal of sulphur from gasoline would require major investments and aggravate the fuel shortage.

title: High Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: High Court Declines Review In Printers' Suit on Fund
description: WASHINGTON, No. 5 (AP)The Supreme Court today declined to review a lower court decision denying benefits from a jointly run newspaperunion trust fund to union member not employed by two participating New York newspapers.

title: Brasco Denies Guilt in Charge Of Bribery by a Mafia Figure
description: Representative Frank J. Brasco pleaded not guilty yesterday to a Federal charge of conspiracy to receive bribes in return for assisting a truck company controlled by a reputed Mafia member.

title: Saxbe Issues Denial That He Advocated Destroying of Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  Senator William B. Saxbe, the Attorney Generaldesignate, denied today having advocated destruction of the White House Watergate tapes if they proved to be incriminating.

title: For City's Next Mayor, Words of Advice Wisdom and Warning
description: Shirley A. Chisholm

title: Advertising: Women's Market
description: Women's service magazines love to help sell food and be sold near food. Both for economic reasons.

title: Election Ticket
description: The recommendations of The Times on candidates and issues in today's election are recapitulated below. Candidates whose names are followed by an asterisk are incumbents.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: There are many thoughtful wildlife biologists and hunters who are far from convinced that the current move toward making the use of steel shot mandatory for waterfowling is a good thing.

title: Israeli Strategy: P.O.W.'s First
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Israel's immediate goal in thediplomatic maneuvering in the Middle East is said to be to seek immediate return of Israeli prisoners and consolidation of the ceasefire under United Nations auspices, and then to delay all other issues until after the parliamentary election of Dec. 31. This account of the Israeli position has been pieced together from interviews with United States officials, Senators and analysts who have been in close touch with the Israeli Goverment. Isreal's top priority, they point out, is to get back the 390 prisoners whom Egypt is believed to hold and the 150 who are thought to be held in Syria. The Israelis have about 7,000 Egyptian and Syrian prisoners.

title: Mrs. Meir, Home, Voices Hopes of Unity With U.S.
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5Premier Golda Meir returned from Washington today and reported to her Cabinet on her talks with President Nixon, Secretary of State Kissinger and other United States leaders.

title: Jaworski Reportedly Had Role In Setting Up C. I. A. Aid Conduit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, once approved the use of a Houston foundation to launder money at the request of the Central Intelligence Agency, the foundation president said today.

title: Jaworski Assumes Office; Bork Praises Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Leon Jaworski was sworn in today as the new Watergate special prosecutor and called his oath of office more important, perhaps, than any I have taken in my lifetime.

title: Not Too Long Ago, All She Could Afford To Donate Was Time
description: It's really all quite improbable, this Transylvanian PingPang champion who survived Hitler's BergenBelsen and now runs so many of New York's charitable events, but that's the way it is. Livia Sylva Weintraub just isn't your typical social butterfly.

title: Egyptian Meets Pompidou
description: PARIS, Nov, 5 (Reuters)Dr. Mohammed H. elZayyat, Egypt's special envoy, handed a personal message from President Sadat to President. Pompidou today and discussed a pos sible European role in settling the Middle East conflict.

title: Gene Frankel Is Hopeful As His Workshop Reopens
description: When Gene Frankel says we brought the house down, he is referring with macabre humor to the destruction of his theater workshop and acting school in the collapse of the Broadway Central Hotel three months ago.

title: BACKER IN SENATE BIDS NIXON MAKE FULL DiSCLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Senator Peter H. Dominick, a conservative Republican of Colorado who has been a stanch supporter of President Nixon, called on the President today to make a complete disclosure of all information about the Watergate investigations.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The death of an Edison youth, shot in the back a city policeman after a highspeed auto chase Saturday night, was being investigated by Middlesex County detectives. The police identified the youth as 18yearold Gary Smerecki. They said he was shotgunned in the lower back by Patrolman Joseph Bingert, who has been relieved of duty.

title: Not Quick, Not Easy, But Right
description: The clamor for Richard Nixon's resignation is suddenly so deafening that it may drown out good sense and overwhelm due process. That clamor demands shortrun therapy for a catastrophic illness. It risks a rush to decision rather than an exercise of judgment, and it proposes a constitutional shortcut when the primary problem is that the Constitution already has been too often slighted or ignored.

title: PASSAGE OF BILLS ON SHIPPING SEEN
description: A favorable climate in Congress for three major items of maritime legislation was reported here yesterday by the chairman of the House Merchant Marine and Fisheries Committee, Representative Leonor K. Sullivan.

title: Federal Aid for Amateurs Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Micki King, the former Olympic diving champion, appeared today on behalf of the athletes advisory committee to the United States Olympic Committee at a hearing of the Senate Commerce Committee on the Amateur Athletics Bill proposed by Senator John V. Tunney, Democrat of California. Miss King, captain in the Air Force, appearing with representatives of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, the Amateur Athletic Union and the U.S.O.C., urged Federal aid be given to amateur sports.

title: NEW TAPS CITED BY RUCKELSHAUS
description: MIAMI, Nov. 5A former high official of the Justice Department has disclosed that telephone wiretaps were placed on Nixon Administration officials and possibly newsmen who were not included in the previously reported 21month effort that President Nixoil has said was aimed at stopping leaks of classified information to the press.

title: DR. CYRIL LEVIN, 61, RADIOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Cyril M. Levin, who retired recently as director of radiology at Richmond Memorial Hospital and associate attending in radiology at Staten Island Hospital, died yesterday at his winter home in Long Boat Key, Fla. He was 61 years old and also lived at the Richmond County Country Club.

title: GUARDSMEN BATTLE FIRES IN MILWAUKEE
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 5 (UPI) National Guardsmen helped fight a fire this morning after they were ordered to duty following a red flu epidemic that stripped the Milwaukee Fire Department of about 30 per cent of its work force.

title: 15 South Koreans Assail Dictatorship
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 5 A group of South Korean intellectuals and religious leaders issued a statement today calling on the nation to rise up and struggle for the restoration of democracy.

title: Fire Visible for 10 Miles Put Out at Oil Refinery
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 5 (AP)  A gasoline additives fire roared 200 feet in the air from the middle of an Atlantic Richfield refinery here, but company officials said it was put under control today before there was any threat of a disaster.

title: People in Sports: Svare Quits Charger Job
description: After a 190 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs which reduced his team's record to 161, Harland Svare resigned as head coach of the San Diego Chargers yesterday and was replaced by Ron Waller.

title: ROXANNE TROUPE A DANCE DELIGHT
description: Roxanne is really Risa Jaroslow, Stormy Mullis and Wendy Perron. It's a dance company, and it gave its premiere performance Friday evening at St. Clements Church. The dancers complement one another nicely, and the dances were tailored to show them to advantage.

title: Notes on People
description: The brightest Senator, according to a survey of Senate legislative assistants, is Jacob K. Javits, the New York Republican. The survey, conducted by Ralph Nader's Capitol Hill news service, polled the behindthescenes senatorial aides who do much of the daytoday support work all Senators depend upon.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: MRS. EMILY W. DESS
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 5Mrs, Emily Wissler Dess, who retired in 1970 after 27 years with The New York Times, died Friday of a heart attack at her home in Surfside. Her age was 65.

title: Trucker Network Curbs Crackdown on Heavy Loads
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 5 (UPI)The executive secretary of the Iowa Reciprocity Board said yesterday that a nationwide grapevine communications network among truckers significantly reduced the number of arrests during a 48hour crackdown on overweight trucks traveling through Iowa last week.

title: Indonesia May Increase Oil Exports to the U.S.
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Nov. 5 (UPI)Indonesia may increase her oil exports to the United States by about 20,000 barrels a day after the dedication of the new Kassim oil field in West Irian next week, sources at the Indonesian oil monopoly, Pertiamina, said today.

title: Campaign in Jersey Ends on Bitter Note
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5New Jersey's campaign for Governor ended as it began today, on a bitter notethis one caused by a lastminute attempt by supporters of Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the Republican candidate, to create an emotional abortion issue.

title: 42 Seamen Reported Saved After Ship Sinks in Atlantic
description: TENERIFE, Canary Islands, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Fortytwo survivorsincluding 30 Norwegianswere picked up in midAtlantic today after the 98,894ton tanker Golar Patricia broke in two and sank after an explosion, according to radio messages received here.

title: Stock Prices Slump
description: Stock prices fell sharply again yesterday, pushing the DowJones industrial average down 15.88 points. The slump came amid widening uncertainties over the political future of President Nixon and mounting oil shortages. Details on Page 49.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Aid for Tenants In Evictions Urged

title: Newcombe, Rosewall Triumph
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 5 (UPI)  John Newcombe, suffering from a stomach disorder, defeated a fellow Australian, John Alexander, 63, 46, 6.4, in the opening round of the first Australian indoor tennis championship today. The $50,000 tournament is restricted to men.

title: Newly Militant Fire Union Doubts City's Good Faith
description: The threat of the city's first firemen's strike this morning was the outgrowth of a new policy of militancy and a sense of frustration over the city's unwillingness to bargain in good faith on a new contract, fire union sources said yesterday.

title: Fewer Aides See Nixon As Haig's Role Increases
description: WASHINTON, Nov. 5A few days ago, former Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., his eyes red from lack of sleep and his face drawn with fatigue, observed that he had never known military combat to be as arduous as being President Nixon's righthand man in recent weeks.

title: Bill on Oil Accidents at Sea Sent to House by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today to implement the international treaty designed to prevent or mitigate the effects of accidents at sea that might cause oil pollution.

title: Chamber Ensemble Blends Imagination And Warm Playing
description: Strictly instrumental music has been at a premium these days at Lincoln Center, what with the New York Philharmonic on strike, but on the infraorchestral level superior concerts are still to be had. The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center presented another of its imaginatively programed, scrupulously prepared and warmly played concerts on Sunday evening at. Alice Tully Hall.

title: The Oil Weapon
description: The war in the Middle East and the Arab decision to impose an embargo on oil shipments to the United States, the Netherlands or any other country that provides support to Israel have given the NATO alliance its most severe internal shock since France withdrew from military integration in 1966.

title: Ford Favors Role for Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Representative Gerald R. Ford said today that he thought ?? President should be truthful thoughtful, humble and able t?? exert moral and ethical lead ership.

title: Sohio and Subsidiary Set Gas Allocations
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 5The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) and its subsidiary, the B. P. Oil Company, began allocations yesterday on gasoline supplies because of the embargo by oilproducing nations in the Middle East.

title: Soviet Air Minister Oversees Foiling of Hijacking
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5Marshal Boris P. Bugayev, the Soviet Minister of Civil Aviation, personally directed the successful foiling of an attempt to hijack a Soviet domestic airliner to Sweden last Friday, unofficial sources said today.

title: President Nixon has set about to reverse the flow of power and return it to the states and local communities.
description: WASHINGTONA year ago today, in a landslide, Americans elected Richard Nixon for four more years as their President. A recent study conducted by the University of Michigan's Center for Political Studies has upset the conventional wisdom about the 1972 election, and made a point I believe in very deeply.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Up At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 Yields on United States Treasury bills, rose in the Government's weekly competitive sales of these shortterm securities. The average rate for threemonth bills in this week's sale is 8.098 per cent up from 7.196 last week, while the average rate for sixmonth bills in this week's sale is 7.987 per cent, up from 7.236 last week.

title: U. S. STEEL PLANS SOME PRICE RISES
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices by $2 to $12 a ton on various sheet and strip products, beginning Jan. 1.

title: State University Studies Ways to Save on Heating
description: ALBANY, Nov. 5 (AP)Officials of the State University said today that discussions were under way on alternatives to heat classrooms in the event of an energy shortage this winter.

title: Ailing Knicks (75) Are the Healthiest Team in Town
description: As the only one among the seven active New York major league teams over .500, the Knicks were feeling fairly content today, having returned from their first Western trip of the season with threevictories in four games.

title: DR. TAUBENHAUS, HEALTH DIRECTOR
description: Dr. Leon J. Taubenhaus, director of community health services at Beekman Downtown Hospital and a specialist in emergency medicine, died Sunday in La Paz, Mexico, where he had been on vacation. He was 61 years old and lived here.

title: Cambodian Government Force Said to Retake Town on Mekong
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 5 (UPI)A Cambodian. Government task force today recaptured the Mekong River town of Prek Luong, four miles north of Phnom Penh, and began moving on other rebelheld river front villages, according to reports from the field.

title: Watergate Unit to Hear Convicted Florida Builder
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Senate Watergate committee is to hear testimony this week from a witness who is a key figure in a Justice Department investigation involving a committee member, Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida.

title: EAST GERMANS PLAN TO RAISE VISIT FEES
description: BERLIN, Nov. 5East Germany announced today that its fees for visits by Westerners would be doubled this month and sentenced to prison a West Berliner and two West Germans accused of having smuggled East Germans out of the country.

title: Students Move Into Dean's Office In Protest at Division of Rutgers
description: PISCATAWAY, Nov. 5Some 200 Livingston College students took over the dean's office here today and presented 43 demands, including several for the ouster of certain college officials.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Kissinger brought to the Arab world his effort to overcome Middle East ceasefire problems and to promote the start of fullscale peace negotiations. He received a military honorguard welcome in Morocco. American officials accompanying Mr. Kissinger cautioned against any spectacular breakthroughs during his talks in Morocco and other Moslem countries he plans to visit. [Page 1, Column 7.]

title: Counsel for Krogh Says Access to Data Is Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The White House has balked at meeting a request by Egil Krogh Jr. that he examine documents of the plumbers unit he directed at the time of the Ellsberg breakin in 1971, his attorney said today.

title: People and Business
description: Herbert Kunzel, a 65yearold retired industrialist, has been elected president and chairman of the executive committee of the WestgateCalifornia Corporation, the financially troubled conglomerate. In the dual role, he succeeds C. Arnholt Smith, the San Diego civic leader and friend of President Nixon, who was chairman, and Philip A. Toft, who was president.

title: WASHINGTON POST PUBLISHING AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Washington Post resumed publishing on a normal schedule tonight following the settlement of a labor dispute that had kept it from printing all but supplemental sections over the weekend.

title: Kingmaking
description: WASHING TON, Nov. 5What a weekend! Phone ringing constantly. Children dashing into the dining room just at dinnertime to cry, Daddy, Moscow's calling! or, Daddy, Key Biscayne's calling!

title: The Restaurant's Design Succeeds Elegantly
description: Architects rarely have the chance to design restaurants. There are a few architectdesigned eating places in New York  among them, Gamal el Zoghby's Cleopatra, a splitlevel creation on upper Broadway, and Philip Johnson's Four Seasons, still a stunning piece of architecture after 15 yearsbut that honor roll is short indeed.

title: Storm Damage Assessed
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov, 5 (UPI)City officials estimated today that property damages would exceed $1.5million as a result of a severe thunderstorm that struck the Jackson area late yesterday with winds up to 60 miles an hour. No serious injuries were reported, but the storm caused extensive damage to a number of businesses and homes.

title: Volume Advance for New Issues Held Factor
description: Corporate, government and taxexempt bond prices were lower yesterday in quiet trading.

title: The Soviet Repairman Gets Nasty Too
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5While Americans dwell on their troubles with insolent repairmen, Muscovites are savoring a horror story about the man who tried to get his outboard motor fixed.

title: Proximity Talks
description: A diplomatic dialogue that just two years ago was too bold and dramatic to be undertaken is now an active reality between the Israeli and Egyptian Governments through United States good offices.

title: NewCar Sales Dip Exceeds Estimates
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5Newcar sales in the first month of the 1974 model year are down more than had been forecast by the United States auto industry.

title: Surplus of Doctors Is Foreseen, So H.E.W. May Slash Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The nation's medical schools were warned today that the Nixon Administration may reduce, if not completely end, Federal aid for health manpower education next year.

title: As for the Jets, a Plea To Hang Onto Our Pride
description: To most people, it would appear the Jets' season already is over. To Earlie Thomas, though, the challenge of the season is just beginning.

title: CAHILL SEEKS BIEL TO AID STADIUM
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5Governor Cahill announced this evening that he would ask the Legislature next week to rescue the proposed financing of New Jersey sports complex in the northern Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Origin of Hospital Dispute Traced to Summer of '72
description: Obviously there will be no strike, Leon J. Davis, president of Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Workers Union said on June 29, 1972, after arbitrators awarded his members requested minimum 7.5 per cent pay rise plus other benefits for each of two years.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: Johannesburg, South AfricaArnold Taylor, 118 pounds, South Africa, knocked out Romeo Anaya, 118, Mexico. 14 rounds; Taylor won World Boxing Association's version of world bantamweight title.

title: Italian Hospital Physicians Begin Strike, Then Call It Off
description: ROME, Nov. 5Doctors in 1,500 hospitals all over Italy started a threeday strike today, but later agreed to call it off pending new negotiations with hospital administrators.

title: Plans to Ration Gasoline Are Updated
description: LONDON, Nov. 5  The threat of an energy crisis it Britain deepened today as the Government reactivated a key committee to monitor petro. leum supplies and moved an other step closer to gasoline rationing.

title: Con Edison Blamed by P.S.C. For Big August Power Failure
description: A State Public Service Commission staff report released yesterday attributed the massive power failure in the Jackson Heights section of Queens last Aug. 29 and 30 to the Consolidated Edison Company's failure to monitor and operate the network successfully.

title: I.C.C. Nominee Named
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 5 (AP)Charles L. Clapp, a White House aide, has been selected to fill a vacancy on the Interstate Commerce Commission, officials said today.

title: All T.W.A. Flights Canceled After 5,000 Cabin Attendants Strike
description: Struck by its 5,000 cabin attendants, Trans World Airlines, one of the largest carriers in the world, yesterday canceled all of its 457 domestic and international flights, which serve more than 40,000 passengers daily.

title: Adirondacks Weigh LandUse Law Impact
description: RAY BROOK, N. Y., Nov. 5 Amid mountain grandeur and the cold neon of now dormant vacation strips, a small group of state bureaucrats has begun to unravel the fine print of the historic new law designed to see that the Adirondacks' beauty does not die in the act of man's possessing it.

title: JOHN HALPERIN DIES; MORTGAGE BROKER
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. Nov. 5  John Halperin, mortgage broker, died today at his home here. He was 69 years old.

title: Newcombe, Rosewall Triumph
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 5 (UPI)  John Newcombe, suffering from a stomach disorder, defeated a fellow Australian, John Alexander, 63, 46, 64, in the opening round of the first Australian indoor tennis championship today. The $50,000 tournament is restricted to men.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ART LOBBY Years ago lobbies were places through which people more or less merely passed, necessary entranceways to what lay beyond. Of course, in hotels you had a species referred to as lobby lizards, who would monopolize the seats and stare imperiously at other sitters as though the latter were intruders. Now the trend is toward making lobbies a place to look at art. Every lobby in one of the new highrises has something called a work of art and many, such as Union Carbide or Lever House, have transformed at least part of their lobbies into exhibition areas.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The American Museum of Natural History will move its 3,000work rarebook collection, consisting of books, manuscripts, letters, diaries, journals, maps and drawings, into its longenvisioned Rare Book Room next Tuesday. Included in the works to be transferred from the museum's crowded library areas will be a printed plagiarism by Edgar Allan Poe (1839) of a work on conchology, and a first edition (1771) of the first travel book on Russia.

title: ATROCITIES BY ARABS CHARGED BY ISRAELI
description: Israel's delegate to the United Nations, Yosef Tekoah, accused Egypt and Syria of atrocities against Israeli prisoners of war yesterday as he joined Senator Jacob K. Javits, the four mayoral candidates and other speakers at a rally held to urge the prisoners' release.

title: Libya Charges Soviet Assists Israelis by Letting Jews Out
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Nov. 5The Libyan authorities accused the Soviet Union today of aiding the forces of Zionism by letting Soviet Jews emigrate to Israel, but they praised the Austrian Government for having barred the use of Schonau Castle as a transit camp.

title: Sports Today
description: CROSSCOUNTRY

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: SUNDAY'S GAMES

title: HOTEL GRILL WINS MENONLY BATTLE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Supreme Court voted 8 to 1 today to leave standing a decision upholding the right of a New Orleans hotel to refuse to serve women in its men's grill. The sole dissenter was Justice William O. Douglas, who would have taken the case for review.

title: Barrels of Poison, Dumped in a Storm, Nearing Gulf Coast
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Nov. 5 (UPI)The Coast Guard says 387 barrels of cyanide are floating in the Gulf of Mexico, and probably are heading toward the Texas coast between Brownsville and the Sabine Pass on the Louisiana state line.

title: Most Markets Open
description: Banks and governmental offices will be closed in many states, including New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania, today, Election Day, but in Wall Street it will be business as usual for stock trading, with the New York and American Stock Exchanges open for business along with the overthecounter market. Among the commodity exchanges that will be closed are the Commodity Exchange, Inc., the New York Cotton, the New York Coffee and Sugar and the New York Cocoa exchanges.

title: Election Day
description: Today is Election Day, a legal holiday in New York. State and city offices will be closed, as will schools and colleges in the metropolitan area and most of the suburbs. Mail will be delivered, and Federal offices will be open, as will the stock exchanges.

title: Notes on People
description: The brightest Senator, according to a survey of Senate legislative assistants, is Jacob K. Javits, the New York Republican. The survey, conducted by Ralph Nader's Capitol Hill news service, polled the behindthescenes senatorial aides who do much of the daytoday support work all Senators depend upon.

title: Dey, Mr. Golf of P.G.A., Will Retire in February
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Nov. 5Joseph C. Dey, golf's commissioner, announced today that he would retire on Feb. 28, 1974, when his fiveyear contract ends with the Tournament Players Division of the Professional Golfers' Association.

title: Paris: Braque and a Trap in His Painting
description: PARIS  France, which honored Georges Braque with a state funeral, had never given him a retrospective. Ten years after his death, this omission has at last been repaired: At the Muse de L'Orangerie, 141 paintings, drawings and papiers colls retrace the career of the cofounder of cubism. This remarkable exhibition comes at a time when, unlike his fellow pioneers early in the century, Picasso and Matisse, Braque seems almost forgotten. Braque's temperament was clear, measured, bourgeois, the German critic Wilhelm Uhde wrote nearly 50 years ago; Picasso's was somber, excessive, revolutionary. Current taste prefers the revolutionary to the bourgeois and tends to see Braque as a tasteful artisan, a modest practitioner of the French tradition. Nothing could be farther from the truth.

title: Stewardesses Exchange Trays for Picket Signs
description: As usual, Mary Frances rode out to the Trans World Airlines terminal at Kennedy International Airport yesterday, but instead of putting on her plumcolored stewardess uniform for a flight to Madrid, she donned a sandwich sign that said, Flight attendants demand adequate pay.

title: Skylab 3 Crew Completes Drills on Docking for the Launching on Saturday
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 5 (UPI)The Skylab 3 astronauts put in a final day of ground practice today on maneuvers to be used for docking with the eightroom space research laboratory that they expect to be working in for at least 60 days.

title: Vsevolod Kochetov, 61, Dead; A Conservative Soviet Writer
description: Vsevolod A. Kochetov, a writer who was long a conservative leader in Soviet literature, has died in Moscow, the Soviet press agency Tass reported yesterday. He was 61 years old.

title: Common Market Ponders SoybeanGrowing Subsidy
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 5  The executive commission of the European Economic Community, responding to this year's world protein shortage, has proposed that the ninemember Common Market subsidize soybean production in Europe and encourage other proteinrich crops.

title: Kitchen's No Slouch Either
description: The relationship between architecture and the quality of food has scarcely been noticed. Yet it is obvious that there is no room for a MamaandPapa bistro in one of our multibilliondollar skyscraper developments; only a conglomerate can pay the rent, and the food it serves will correspond to its nature.

title: UNION WILL PICKET AS MUSICIANS TOUR
description: Union musicians will continue to picket Avery Fisher Hall while more than 90 striking members of the New York Philharmonic are away on a 10day, sevenconcert tour of Spain, Portugal and the Canary Islands. The players, who have been on strike for higher wages and improved welfare benefits since Sept. 25, are scheduled to leave Saturday night for Lisbon, where the tour opens.

title: DAMON TO ACQUIRE U.S. PARAMEDICAL
description: The Damon Corporation an nounced yesterday it had agreed to acquire United States Administrative & Paramedical Services, Inc., of Los Angeles and its affiliates, and Aurora Clinical Laboratory of Aurora, Ill., for stock valued at $10.9million.

title: Board of Elections Ready and Waiting
description: At the city's Board of Elections yesterday, it was all over but the waiting. The last of the 6,900 voting machines were being taken to polling places, the absentee ballots were being bundled for delivery and the telephone lines to report machine breakdowns were being checked to see that they do not break down.

title: Chilean in China to Fill Post Vacated by Allende Backer
description: PEKING, Nov. 5 (Agence FrancePresse)A charg d'affaires has arrived in Peking to head the Chilean diplomatic mission.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Justice Department yesterday proopsed next Sept. 30 as a tentative trial date for its antitrust suit against the International Business Machines Corporation presently in its pretrial stage in Federal District Court for the

title: Eve of Election Day Finds Rivals Campaigning
description: A race that began last January with 10 fresh candidates for Mayor wound up last night with the four majorparty survivors, weary and still talking, hours before the voting began.

title: Saudi Arabia Is Tracking Every Barrel of U.S. Oil
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 4  We are tracking down every last barrel of oil that reached the United States, said Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, the Saudi Arabian Minister of Petroleum.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 0.5% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 3 rose to 2,929,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This was gain of 0.5 per cent over the 2,915,000 tons poured in the preceding week. The weekly production index rose to 120.1 from 119.5 a week earlier.

title: Player ShakeUp Is Planned by 161 Giants
description: A major player shakeup will be the next order of business for the New York Giants as they battle the San Diego Chargers and Houston Oilers to avoid becoming the worst team in pro football.

title: Cold Autumn in New York
description: This has been a fall with little to cheer about for the New York fan:

title: Eve of Election Day Finds Rivals Campaigning
description: A race that began last January with 10 fresh candidates for Mayor wound up last night with the four majorparty survivors, weary and still talking, hours before the voting began.

title: Ballet: SmallScale Sleeping Beauty
description: The Eglevsky Ballet Company of Long Island did a very daring thing at Massapequa (L.I.) High School on Sunday. It staged Tchaikovsky's The Sleeping Beauty, a ballet normally only produced by large and established companies. The strange thing is that it was remarkably successful.

title: British Riders Take Nations Cup
description: The British Equestrian Team, making its first appearance at the National Horse Show since 1968, won the Nations Cup last night and gained a leg on the Maj. Gen. Alfred G. Tuckerman Memorial Challenge Trophy before a crowd of 12,000 at. Madison Square Garden.

title: Strike City . . .
description: The long ceasefire on the labormanagement front ended painfully for New Yorkers yesterday. Strikes of hospital, newspaper and airline employes, coupled with a threatened total desertion of duty by unionized fireAlan, brought more dislocation than the city has experienced since President Nixon imposed wageprice controls in August, 1971.

title: The Forum Is Dedicated As the Mitzi Newhouse
description: The Forum at Lincoln Center, a 299seat theater, was formally renamed the Mitzi I. Newhouse Theater last night.

title: Wide Uncertainty on Nixon and Oil Stirs Decline
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday amid widening uncertainties over the political future of President Nixon and oil shortages induced by the Middle East conflict. Volume remained moderate.

title: Man Held in Wife's Slaying
description: FONDA, N. Y., Nov. 5 (UPI) Leonard Lisco, 43 years old of Fort Plain was being held in Montgomery County jail today on a murder charge in the slaying of his estranged wife. Sheriff's officers said Lisco's wife, Priscilla, 37, was shot to death with a .22 caliber rifle at his home. Investigators said Mrs. Lisco had been shot eight times following an argument. They said Lisco himself called the police.

title: Slobodyanik Plays a Rarely Heard Brahms Sonata
description: It is sometimes possible to tell a lot about a young musician's progress simply by looking at his programs as they change through the years. When the young Soviet pianist Alexander Slohodyanik made his New York debut five years ago, a brilliant performance of Schumann's Carnaval caught one's fancy most, and certified him as a young man to pay attention to.

title: In EgyptianHeld Sinai: We Are Ready for Israelis
description: IN THE SINAI, east of Qantara, Egypt, Nov. 4Egyptian infantry, artillery and armored troops bolstered camouflaged positions in the desert here today, observing the ceasefire with Israeli forces but bracing for any resumption of war.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: G.E. GETS CONTRACT FOR VOLT AGE SYSTEM
description: The General Electric Company announced yesterday receipt of a contract for over $45million for a domestic solidstate, high voltage direct current transmission installation by the Square Butte Electric Cooperative. This is reportedly the first system of this type in the United States and it will be part of a coal minemouth power project whose total cost is estimated at more than $70million.

title: Fire Department Sets Up a Special Station
description: The Fire Department set up an emergency command post yesterday on the 12th floor of its headquarters at 110 Church Street, with 80 special telephones and a corridor of maps and charts to help officials maneuver what might be an undermanned, inexperienced fire crew, in the event of a strike today.

title: Nixon Counsel Meet Haig On Eve of Tapes Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Two of President Nixon's chief legal advisers met again today with Alexander M. Haig to discuss the White House's attempts to prove that two of the disputed Watergate conversations were never recorded. It was the third meeting in two days between the two lawyers and Mr. Nixon's chief of staff, according to a White House source.

title: Business Briefs
description: U.S. Asks Sept. 30 Date on I.B.M. Suit

title: South Vietnam's Schools Have Trouble With History of Last 20 Years
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5The history examinations in South Vietnam's public schools contain no questions on the American role here, nothing about North Vietnam and no mention of the VietGong.

title: Bobby Seale Testifies Quietly For Chicago Seven Defendants
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (UPI)Bobby G. Seale, the former Black Panther chairman who was shackled and gagged following violent outbursts during the 1969 Chicago Seven conspiracy trial, spoke softly and politely at contempt of court proceedings today and told the judge he had not intended to be disrespectful to the court.

title: COST INCREASE SEEN FOR DOOMSDAY JETS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The cost of building the nation's flying military command posts has increased $66million in a year, despite eliminations of a computer system, Congressional auditors say.

title: Exchange Complaint Ended
description: A Federal District Court in Dallas yesterday issued a verdict dismissing an antitrust complaint charging that New York Stock Exchange regulations were unfair to nearly 3,000 overthecounter securities dealers who are not members of the Big Board. The complaint had been filed by Shumate & Co., which had sought permission to permit New York Exchange members to trade listed securities off the exchange in the OTC market.

title: In Exile Near Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov, 5 (Reuters) Viktor Krasin, who was given a threeyear prison sentence in September after pleading guilty to subversion, has been freed and exiled near Moscow, sources in dissident circles said today.

title: 39 Brooklyn Schools Mark Black Holiday Despite Board Edict
description: Thirtynine public schools in twa Brooklyn school districts closed yesterday to commemorate Black Solidarity Day in defiance of Board of Education directives that the districts be assessed for any loss in state aid because of the unauthorized closings.

title: SEGRETTI IS GIVEN A SIXMONTH TERM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Donald H. Segretti was sentenced today in United States District Court to six months in prison for his efforts to disrupt the 1972 Democratic Presidential primary in Florida.

title: Prices on Amex Down Sharply; OTC Also Shows a Decline
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market fell sharply yesterday in moderate trading. Some analysts attributed the drop to the increasing pressure being brought on President Nixon to resign.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ROBBINSVILLE, Nov. 5A few years ago the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association was faced with a major problem: crowd control at athletic events. Team buses were being stoned, windows broken, fights were breaking out in the stands and on parking lots. northern Jersey some football games had to be canceled; a school was suspended. A nearriot erupted along the boardwalk at Atlantic City after a state basketball tournament final.

title: Firemen Set Strike Today Despite Warning by Court
description: The city's 10,900 firemen will strike this morning, the Uniformed Firefighters Association vowed yesterday, despite a State Supreme Court injunction and a court warning that every striking fireman would be cited for contempt.

title: EDUCATOR BACKS PUBLICITY ON TESTS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5Edward W. Kilpatrick, Acting State Commissioner of Education, ruled today, that the results of the controversial statewide reading and mathematics tests given to public school pupils in the fourth and 12th graded last November were valid and, should be made public.

title: Pennsylvania Dutch Country Bridge: Is Home of the Swiss Teams
description: Tourists are often confused by the discovery that Pennsylvania Dutch country is substantially populated by people of German origin. Bridge players know better, however. For them, Lancaster, Pa., is the home of the Swiss.

title: Elmira Prosecutor Named
description: ALBANY, Nov. 5 (UPI)David B. Crew 3d of Elmira was named Chemung County Disrict Attorney today by Governor Rockefeller. Mr. Crew, 36 years old, an assistant district attorney since 1968, is running unpposed for the position tomorrow. He was named to fill the vacancy created by the appointment of John F. O'Mara to the Court of Claims.

title: KISSINGER BEGINS TOUR IN MOROCCO
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 5 Secretary of State Kissinger tonight brought to the Arab world his effort to overcome Middle East ceasefire problems and to promote the start of fullscale peace negotiations. He arrived in Morocco to a military honorguard welcome.

title: Bolivian ExMinister Vanishes in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5A former Bolivian Cabinet minister in exile here was taken at gunpoint from his home a week ago and has disappeared.

title: ALBERT A. POLLIO
description: Albert A. Pollio, founder and president of the Pollio Dairy Products Corporation of Brooklyn, died Sunday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L. I. He was 81 years old and lived in Brooklyn and Lloyd's Neck, L. I.

title: Secretariat's Goodby Today
description: Thousands of followers of form will pay their final respects to Secretariat at Aqueduct this afternoon without having to think about win, place or show. The great golden chestnut colt is due to make the final appearance of his career in what amounts to a nonracing walk.
