One of the most popular horses ever to run at New York's Big Wheel Belmont Park and Saratoga as well as the Big Athe 3yearold star of the Meadow Stable will parade down Aqueduct's stretch. The stroll will provide the highlight to ceremonies that will start in the paddock.

title: Defiant Fire Unionist Richard John Vizzini
description: Long before he assumed the presidency of the Uniformed Firefighters Association last Aug. 1, Richard John. Vizzini promised aggressive leadership and openly advocated a citywide strike to further the best interests of New York's 12,000 firemen. Those who know him best contended then that it was not mere talk, and those assertions were being repeated yesterday. The difference yesterday was that a lot of people were listening as the militant unionist stood in the glare of television lights, microphones clustered under the gray stubble of his jaw, and warned that he was prepared to defy a court order and call the first strike in the New York City Fire Department's 108year history.

title: Court Plans Review Of Tax Deductions On Equipment Use
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)The Supreme Court agreed today to review a lower court decision permitting tax deductions for depreciation of equipment used by companies in doing their own construction work.

title: Fewer Aides See Nixon As Haig's Role Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5A few days ago, former Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., his eyes red from lack of sleep and his face drawn with fatigue, observed that he had never known military combat to be as arduous as being President Nixon's righthand man in recent weeks.

title: Toyota Plans Plant in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 5 (AP)The Toyota Motor Company announced today it would establish a $50million automotive complex in northern Peru. It will be the company's largest manufacturing establishment in South America.

title: High School Sports
description: Tony Alguero and Pierre Davis don't know Richie Szaro. The two football stars were in grammar school when Richie scored 164 points for St. Francis Prep in his senior season to set a city scoring mark.

title: N.C.A.A. Bars Player for Outside Aid
description: Fred Saunders, who starred on the University of Southwestern Louisiana basketball team for the last two seasons, transferred to Syracuse University in September, hoping to play the 197374 season with the Orange. But the National Collegiate Athletic Association has declared the 6foot7inch athlete ineligible for more intercollegiate competition because he received financial aid not administered by the school [Southwestern Louisiana].

title: Neumann Defeats Gorosito 3d Time
description: Randy Neumann 24yearold college student at Fairleigh Dickinson, scored a 10round decision over Paul Gorosito of Buenas Aires last night at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum.

title: EGYPTIANS EXPECT NEW ROUND IN WAR
description: CAIRO, Nov. 5There is a pervading feeling among both Egyptian officials and ordinary citizens that hostilities will erupt again soon.

title: New Joffrey Cast Adds Odd Fiavor To Moor's Pavane
description: The Moor's Pavane is Jos Limon's seamless nearritual expressing Othello's passion and its tragic consequences, here formalized by courtly dance. There is little room for personalized interpretation in any of the four roles, but on Saturday afternoon the Joffrey Ballet, at the City Center 55th Street Theater, offered a cast new to these roles, giving the work an odd but affectingly naturalistic flavor. Dramatic situation tended to take precedence over form, with interesting if not always fully integrated results.

title: AGENCY PROPOSES RISE OF $5BILLION FOR HEALTH COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 The Cost of Living Council proposed today to allow increases in health care bills over the coming year that would cost consumers about $5billion annually.

title: PEPSICO SEEKS BREWERS'
description: Pepsico, Inc., which owns about 82 per cent of the outstanding stock of the Rheingold Corporation, proposed yesterday to acquire the remaining shares in a merger which would give Pepsico full ownership of the Rheingold beer operation.

title: Happy Days Here Again For Byrne's Supporters
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., Nov. 6Brendan T. Byrne waited till 9:45 tonight for a concession from his Republican opponent, Charles W. Sandmake his impatient supporters wait no longer.

title: Chrysler Begins a Recall Of 31,394 Motor Homes
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation announced today that it had begun notifying the owners of 31,394 motor homes built on Dodge chassis of a possible defect that could cause a loss of engine power.

title: Jenkins Is First In jump
description: The combination of Rodney. Jenkins and Idle Dice came into its own last night as the National Horse Show. celebrating its 90th year, ended an eightday run at Madison Square Garden.

title: Violence Breaks Out as Walkout at 48 Hospitals in Area Enters Second Day
description: Incidents of violence flared yesterday at struck hospitals in the metropolitan area, where growing heaps of uncollected contaminated refuse added to the problems caused by the twodayold strike of 30,000 nonmedical employes.

title: Democrat Elected in Stamford, Beating 2Term C. O. P. Mayor
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 6 Frederick P. Lenz Jr. a Democratic member of this city's Board of Representatives, was elected Mayor tonight, defeating Julius M. Wilensky, a twoterm Republican incumbent, in a surprise upset.

title: F.B.I. SAID TO CHECK A SAXBE ASSOCIATE
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Nov. 6 APThe Dayton Daily News says the F B.I. is investigating link between Senator William B. Saxbe, the Attorney Generaldesignate, and a slotmachine manufacturer, Sam W. Klein, of Cleveland.

title: Issues in Hospital Strike
description: PARTICIPANTS: The League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes, bargaining for 48 hospitals and nonprofit nursing homes in the city and in Nassau and Westchester, caring for 23,000 bedridden patients.

title: SKYLAB 3 IS READY FOR RECORD FLIGHT
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 6Final preparations are under way here for the launching Saturday of Skylab 3, the nation's last manned space mission before at least July of 1975.

title: Exodus Clouds City Business Outlook
description: William Greenfield, owner of the Murray Hill Card & Gift Shop in Manhattan glanced out of his window on a gray afternoon yesterday and observed, I think the new city administration has one big problem to face up to. It's got to find a way to keep businesses from leaving.

title: Museum Loses Blankets
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Los Angeles County Museum conducted an inventory recently and discovered that 76 rare Navajo blankets valued at $174,000 were missing, the authorities disclosed yesterday.

title: TV Review
description: Twenty years ago this week Dylan Thomas died in a New York hospital at the age of 39. Tonight at 8:30, Channel 13, in a programing gesture that might be considered either thoughtful or clever, or both, is rerunning the hourlong N.E.T. production Dylan Thomas: The World I Breathe. Produced and directed by Perry Miller Adato, narrated by John Malcolm Brinnin, the writer who brought Thomas to America on tours, the program was originally broadcast in January, 1968, and later received an Buy Award.

title: Engineer Societies Offer Plan to Curb Abuses in Obtaining Public Contracts
description: EAST ORANGE, Nov. 6 The three state professional societies of architects, professional engineers and consulting engineers have jointly proposed a program to curb lolitical influence and unethical conduct, such as the payment of kickbacks to government officials, in awarding public contracts to their members.

title: Election Day Closings
description: Banks and governmental offices were closed yesterday in many states, including New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania for Election Day, but the New York and American Stock Exchanges were open along with the overthecounter market. Among the commodity exchanges that were closed were the Commodity Exchange, Inc., the New York Cotton, the New York Coffee and Sugar and the New York Cocoa Exchanges.

title: A LANDSLIDE HERE
ARNOLD TULP
description: Arnold Tulp, a senior partner with the Manhattan law firm of Kirlin, Campbell & Keating, died of a heart attack Monday morning in his office at 120 Broadway. He was 62 years old and lived on Black Point Road, in Rumson, N. J., and in Jamaica, Vt.

title: Strikes in France Cripple Networks, Close Theaters
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (Reuters)French broadcasting services were crippled by a 24hour strike today and many theaters were closed by a separate work stoppage.

title: City's Five Borough Presidents, All Democrats, Are Easily Returned to Their Offices
description: The city's five incumbent Borough Presidents, all Democrats, were reelected easily yesterday. With the election of the Mayor, City Council President and Controller, their party was thus assured of complete control of the Board of Estimate.

title: SAUDI OIL TERMS FOR U.S. OUTLINED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Saudi Arabia's Oil Minister was reported today to have told two Congressmen that his country would relax its embargo on oil shipments to the United States only if Washington modified its support of Israel.

title: Chilean Cleric Sees Marxism Coexisting With Latin Church
description: ROME, Nov. 6 (AP)The Roman Catholic Archbishop ofSantiago, Chile, was quoted today as having said that he hoped it would be possible thatMarxism and Christianity could coexist in a LatinAmerican society.

title: U.S. Aide Confers in Bonn On TroopCost Payments
description: BONN, Nov. 6 (AP)American and West German negotiators held a fourth round of talks today on United States demands for higher German payments to help cover the costs of keeping American military forces here.

title: Vesco Seized on Island
description: Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, was arrested in Nassau, the Bahamas, yesterday on a United States request for his extradition on fraud charges. Page 32.

title: Admiral Gets NATO Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) Vice Adm. Means Johnston Jr. will be promoted to full admiral and assigned as chief of the Southern European Command of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, Defense Secretary James R. Schlesinger announced today.

title: Dollar Rises Sharply In Markets Abroad
description: PARIS, Nov. 6The dollar rose sharply today in currency markets because of fears of an oil crisis in Western Europe and Japan, whose economies are considered more vulnerable to Arab oil cutbacks than the United States.

title: Burge Conjures Up A Mystical Collage Of Music by Crumb
description: George Crumb's Makrokos. mos, Volume 1 (1972), was given its New York premiere on Monday night, and it strengthened the composer's reputation as one of the most imaginative and mesmerizing creators around. The work was performed by David Burge, the University of Colorado pianist to whom it is dedicated, in his program in Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Milk Lobby Official Denies Payoffs Went to Politicians
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A milk lobby official, denying accusations that an attorney fee was skimmed away for political payoffs, has charged that dairy farmers have been victimized by the pervasive corruption in the Nixon Administration.

title: MATTHEW J. CASEY
description: Matthew J. Casey, a retired advertising man, died Monday in the Westchester division of New York HospitalCornell Medical Center. He was 79 years old and had been residing at the White Plains institution.

title: Amusement Park Rejected
description: MOUNT OLIVE TOWNSHIP, N.J., (AP)The proposed construction of an amusement park in this Morris County township was voted down in a nonbinding referendum today. The proposal was defeated by a margin of about four to three. The Amusement Corporation of America, which had proposed to build a park on an early American theme, agree?? ?? abide by the referendum results even though they were legally nonbinding. A proposal for a binding referendum had been declared illegal in court.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Nobody's going to tell anybody in the next few months, Throw out your old clothes and start over.

title: Quake Shakes Aleutians
description: PALMER, Alaska, Nov. 6 (AP)  strong earthquake shook the Aleutian Islands late yesterday, a Palmer Observatory spokesman said. No injuries or damage were reported, however.

title: Red Smith
description: In Secretariat's mail yesterday was a postcard signed Fiji It read: I can't wait.. Fiji is a broodniare owned by Walter Salmon's Mereworth Farm, one of 30odd mares that will be dating Secretariat next year when the celebrated sex symbol takes up his role as a lover, bestowing his favors at $190,000 each. Preparing for his new career, the finest horse of his time formally closed up shop on the race track yesterday with a ceremonious farewell to his New York public.

title: Goldin as Controller
description: The second most important office in New York City's governmental structure is that of Controller. In addition to being the city's chief fiscal officer, paying its bills, managing immense pension, trust and sinking funds and helping shape its budgetary priorities as a member the Board of Estimate, the Controller by virtue of his position is deeply involved in social policies as well.

title: Army Begins to Destroy Stocks Of Nerve Gas Outside Denver
description: DENVER, Nov. 6The Army has begun destroying its nerve gas stockpiles at the Rocky Mountain Arsenal adjacent to Denver, but the Shell Oil Comparry plans to continue making on arsenal grounds concentrated pesticides that local toxicologists contend are as dangerous as the military's chemical weaponry.

title: One Down And Three to Go
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6On the first anniversary of Richard Nixon's spectacular reelection victory, this city is still trying to analyze what it was in his character that brought about the greatest fall since Lucifer.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Profits Up at MCA and General Host
Wright Tells of Receiving Belated Notice on Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Charles Alan Wright is back home in Texas after months of serving as President Nixon's chief legal strategist in the battle for control of the Watergate tapes.

title: SYRIANS ACCUSE ISRAELIS Of RAID
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 6Syria said today that Israeli planes had attacked Syrian positions with rockets in violation of the ceasefire but that they had been driven off by Syrian fighters and air defenses.

title: Squires, Manhattan Win CrossCountry
description: Last July, Pete Squires, Manhattan College junior, started a training program in which he ran 200 miles a week. In the early fall, he reduced it to 150 miles. Yesterday, he won the most important race, of his career.

title: Kissinger in Cairo or Talks With Sadat
description: CAIRO, Wednesday, Nov. 7 Secretary of State Kissinger arrived in Cairo late last night for consultations with Egypt's President, Anwar elSadat. The American and Egyptian Governments both hope that these talks will touch off a longrange diplomatic process leading eventually to a permanent settlement of the 25yearold ArabIsraeli conflict.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Italian Paramilitary Police Force Viewed as Vital Social Cement
description: ROME, Nov. 6  Italians like people elsewhere, worry a lot about violence, and when they do they usually say that there should be more carabinieri.

title: 2 Plead in Theft and Burning Of Coffin With Rock Singer
description: WEST LOS ANGELES, Nov. 6 (AP)Two men accused of stealing a coffin containing the body of Gram Parsons, the rock singer, and burning it in the desert with the body inside pleaded guilty yesterday to misdemeanor theft charges.

title: Vesco Is Arrested in Bahamas On U.S. Plea for Extradition
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Nov. 6Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, was arrested here this afternoon by the Royal Bahamian Police acting on a request from the United States for his extradition to face a fraud charge.

title: Soccer Results
description: By Reuters

title: Museum Loses Blankets
description: LOS ANGELtS, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Los Angeles County Museum conducted an inventory recently, and discovered that 76 rare Navajo blankets valued at $174,000 were missing, the authorities disclosed, yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: FLEMINGTON, Nov. 6In one way, Tom Pepe of Hunterdon Central High School is like any other 205pound middle guardhe loves to slam rival running backs to the ground.

title: No Authorization for New Work on Expansion Issued Since Embargo on U.S.
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Nov. 6  The Saudi Arabian Government has halted authorization for new work on the multimilliondollar expansion program of the Arabian American Oil Company.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: DU PONT WILL BUILD A NEW NYLON PLANT
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., said yesterday that it would construct a plant for the manufacture of more than 100 million pounds a year of bulked continuous filament nylon at Waynesboro, Va. The nylon is used extensively in carpets and upholstery.

title: California Cuts Speed Limit On Freeways to Save Gas
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 6 (Reuters)The maximum speed limit in California will be reduced from 70 to 65 miles an hour Dec. 1 in an effort to reduce consumption of gasoline.

title: WIDE MOBILE HOMES ON ROADS OPPOSED
description: HARRISBURG, Nov. 6 (AP) The public is lining up in overwhelming numbers against the state's decision to permit 14footwide mobile homes on Pennsylvania highways.

title: RICHARDSON BIDS NIXON DROP CLAIM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson said today that President Nixon should agree to drop all claims of executive privilege in the wideranging investigation of the Watergate scandals.

title: Records: All Gershwin
description: Since this is George Gershwin's anniversary season (he would have been 75 years old last September), there has been a celebratory flurry of Gershwin songs on records, headed by the twodisk set Robby Short Is KRaZy for Gershwin (Atlantic 2608, $11.96). This is a followup on similar sets in which Short proclaimed that he loved Cole Porter (Atlantic 2606) and was mad about Nel Coward (Atlantic 2607).

title: Galbraith Sees Resignation
description: WESTFIELD, Mass., Nov. 6 (AP)John K. Galbraith, the Harvard economist and former United States Ambassador to India, told reporters at a news conference here last night that he believed President Nixon would resign because Galbraith's Law states that anyone who says he won't resign four times, will.

title: Blades'
description: The New,, Golden Blades' franic Search for money heightened yesterday. Lawyers sought a transfusion of cash while club officials met with Madison Square Garden executives to see how the club could continue in word's most expensive arena.

title: A Rise in Social Security Checks Approved 1312 by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) A Republican plan to increase Social Security benefits 10 per cent in mid1974, financed by raising the payrolltax wage base in January, was approved by a 1312 vote in the House Ways and Means Committee today.

title: Football Transactions
description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE NEW ENGLANDPlaced Honor Jackson, defensive back, on waivers.

title: Football Transactions
description: NEW ENGLANDPlaced Honor Jackson, defensive back, on waivers.

title: In Kibbutz: Talk of War, Little Else
description: MISHMAR HANEGEV, Israel, Nov. 5About 100 of the 300 members of this kibbutz near Beersheba have gone off to war, and those who remain behind talk about little else but them and the war they are fighting.

title: His Honor, the Mayor
description: His campaign had essentially the same flavor as his preceding 23 years in public office. It was methodical, wellplanned, smoothrunning  qualities that his detractors said made him colorless and unimaginative, but that apparently persuaded the voters through two primaries and one election this year that Abraham D. Beame was the man they wanted to be the 105th Mayor of the City of New York.

title: Lion Coaches Have Been the Victims, Not the Causes
description: If Columbia's long and seldom distinguished football history proves anything at all, it is that the coaches have been victims rather than causes of a persistently weak situation.

title: OREGON BOTTLE BILL SCORED. BY BREWERS
description: MILWAUKIE, Ore., Nov. 6 (AP)New liquor rules required under Oregon's bottle bill will limper competition within the brewing industry, according to a representatives Of the United States Brewers Association.

title: Year of Twin Crises
description: There is nothing the stock market loathes more than uncertainties and with the doublecrises of 1973of the Presidency and of oilit has a belly full. How long will the uncertainty over the President's survival in office last? The President and his aides insist he has no intention of resigning. Congress does notat least not yethave the appetite or the votes for impeachement Yet, the firestorm, as Gen. Alexander Haig, Mr. Nixon's righthand man, called it, shows no signs of burning itself out.

title: JAWORSKI INQUIRY I.T.T. IS SOUGHS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Rep resentative J. J. Pickle, Democrat of Texas said today that he was dissatisfied with the Justice Department's investigation of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corpora. tion.

title: Police Officers and Civilians Augment the StrikeDepleted Ranks of the Fire Department for 5% Hours
description: For five and a half hour throughout the city yesterday desperate civilians and some police officers sounded alarms when fires broke out in thew neighborhoods, then lugged their own hoses, broke windows in smokefilled buildings and ptayed anxiously that the small force of nonstriking fire Wen would get to the fires in time.

title: Other Strike News
description: Violence flared yesterday in the twodayold hospital strike here. Page 29.

title: SOHIO PLUNGES 14; TRADING IS HALTED
description: The stock of the Standard Oil Company of Ohio fell 14 points to 156 in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday. Later in the afternoon trading was halted.

title: BREITEL BUILDING HEALTHY MARGIN
description: Associate Judge Charles D. Breitel, the almost unanimous choice of New York State's legal Establishment, took a comfortable lead last night in the election for chief judge of the Court of Appeals.

title: Music: Marlboro Skills
description: Music From Marlboro followed its normal course of events on Monday evening in Tully Hall. The program was solid and conservative, consisting as it did of a Boccherini quartet, the great G major String Quintet by Brahms and Schumann's familiar and everwelcome E flat Piano Quintet. The musicians were a mixture of veterans and talented newcomers.

title: Montclair May Let Attrition Resolve Housing Issue
description: MONTCLAIR Nov. 6Officials of this suburban town, plagued for almost two years by a housing problem involving two badly deteriorated apartment buildings, appear to have decided to depend on attrition for a solution.

title: AGENCY PROPOSES RISE OF $5BILLION FOR HEALTH COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Cost of Living Council proposed today to allow increases in health care bils over the coming year that would cost consumers about $5billion annually.

title: CHIEF JUDGE RACE REMAINS UNCLEAR
description: Associate Judge Charles D. Breitel, the almost unanimous choice of the New York State legal Establishment, and Jacob D. Fuchberg, a Manhattan lawyer who pictured himself in a massive advertising campaign as an opponent of the judicial status quo, were locked in an inconclusive battle last night for chief judge of the Court of Appeals.

title: Stocks on Amex Make Advances, Then Shift to Show a Sharp Fall
description: After opening higher, prices on the American Stock Exchange reversed their direction to close sharply lower in moderately active trading yesterday. Prices also declined in the overthecounter market.

title: MARCHI ASSAILS STOKES OF NBCTV
description: In an unusually bitter attack, State Senator John J. Marchi called last night for the dismissal of a television commentator for want Mr. Marchi described as a verbal mugging and vicious ethnic slurs.

title: New Delhi Paralyzed by Protest Strike
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 6  A trade union protest grew today into an angry citywide strike that paralyzed New Delhi and engulfed the capital in violence.

title: Soviet Singer Asks Asylum
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  A member of the Russian Bolshoi ballet company has requested political asylum in Italy during the company's appearance In Milan, the police said today. She was identified as Renata Babak, a 36yearold soprano.

title: SANDMAN ROUTED
description: Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic candidate, won an overwhelming victory in yesterday's gubernatorial election in New Jersey, defeating Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the conservative Republican candidate who had sought to reconstitute President Nixon's silent majority.

title: Lethargic Vote Creates a Weird Pattern.
description: This has been the weirdest electionit's so quiet, we're afraid, one official at the Queens office of the Board of Elections said late yesterday afternoon.

title: Notes on People
description: Because of the press of business in a world beset by recurrent crisis, Secretary of State Kissinger said in a letter to the Nobel Peace Prize committee in Oslo, he will be unable to accept in person the 1973 prize on Dec. 10.

title: N.A.A.C.P. FUND ASKS ACTION ON TEACHERS
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 6 (AP)  The N.A.A.C..P Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc., sought today to overturn waivers on faculty assignments. a court ruling that the Department of Health, Education and Welfare has not violated desegregation guidelines for teachers by giving five cities

title: Ban on Kangaroo Hides Urged by Animal Fund
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The Fund for Animals has renewed its plea to the Department of the Interior to impose a general ban on imports of kangaroo hides by declaring some kangaroos an endangered species.

title: ENGINEERS FAVOR CEILING ON GIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Strict legal limitations on political contributions from engineers who bid on government contracts were recommended today by a panel of the National Society of Professional Engineers as one means of combating recent allegations of unethical or illegal conduct by handful of consulting engineers.

title: POLICE CALL FOR AID A SURPRISE IN DALLAS
description: DALLAS, Nov. 6 (UPI)At 4:74 P.M. yesterday, the police dispatcher received a call to send the police quiek to an apartment complex. The caller hung up without saying Why the police were needed.

title: DEMOCRATS GAIN IN SUFFOLK RACES
description: BLUE POINT, L. I., Nov, 6Suffolk County Democrats appeered to be on their way tonight to the biggest gains in their party's history in this Republicandominated county unprecedented strength in the County Legislature and control of as many as three of the 10 town halls  all attributed to what they termed the Watergate backlash.

title: Zoo Directors Entertained
description: TOKYO (AP)Emperor Hirohito and Empress Nagako entertained zoo directors from some 20 nations at tea in the Imperial Palace recently.

title: Gilliam Flings, Steelers Win
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 6Can a team win in the National Football League playing its thirdstring quarterback, a 22yearold neophyte long on courage but short on judgment? The Pittsburgh Steelers did last night, defeating the Washington Redskins, 2116, with Joe Gilliam at the offensive controls after Terry Hanratty had to retire in the third period after bruising ribs.

title: New Jersey Chooses Well
description: In electing Brendan T. Byrne Governor by an unprecedented majority, New Jersey has, delivered an emphatic rebuff to the reactionary and divisive campaign waged by the Republican candidate, Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Strike and Flight Curbs Make Plane Seats Scarce
description: A cabin attendents' strike that shut down Trans World Airlines on Monday, coupled with flight cancellations by other airlines because of fuel shortages, made seats aboard planes scarce yesterday on several routes.

title: Nixon's Secretary Is Told to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Rose Mary Woods. President Nixon's personal secretary for more than 20 years, was summoned today to testify in the Federal court investigation into White House tape recordings and two missing conversations.

title: Bodies of 2 U.N. Observers In Mideast Are Recovered
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6  The United Nations said today that the bodies of two military observers killed while serving with its truce supervision organization in the Middle East had been recovered.

title: Equity Financing
description: Burnup & Sims, Inc., announced it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 1million common shares for sale through underwriters headed by White Weld.

title: CHRISTOPHER ALLAN
description: K. Christopher Allan, theatrical and ballet publicist, died on Sunday in an accidental fall from his ninthfloor apartment at 116 East 66th Street. He was 46 years old.

title: TRUCKERS GAVE $600,000 TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The trucking industry poured more than $600,000 into the Nixon campaign last year while it was fighting a Government proposal that would have caused more competition in highway shipping.

title: Mexico's Leader, in Clash With Rich, Stresses Backin by People and Army
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Assailed by wealthy businessmen, President Luis Echeverrfa Alvarez is going to the masses for support of his policies.

title: New Jersey Democrats Win Control of Legislature for the 3d Time in This Century
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6Democrats captured both houses of the State Legislature today for, the third time in this century) in a landslide that smashed normal Republican strongholds in Bergen, Monmouth and Ocean Counties.

title: About New York
description: It was like old times Al Blumenthal said that the realestate people owned Abe Beanie, and Mario Biaggi said that he loved Paul O'Dwyer. T.W.A. stopped flying, and the firemen went out on a short strike, while the newspaper reporters and hospital workers went out on longer ones. The city, of course, was back to normal.

title: Fire Doused
description: A judge's supermediation, backed up by the possibility of $1 million a day in fines, persuaded the city's rebellious firemen yesterday to end their incendiary strike five hours after it began.

title: NEW JERSEY PAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Senate Watergate committee asked its staff today to explore with the White House whether President Nixon would be willing to meet with the committee's members and, if so, under what conditions.

title: 3 SEATS IN ALBANY GO TO DEMOCRATS
description: Democratic candidates won three out of six special legislative elections yesterday, picking up one Staten Island Assembly seat formerly held by a Republican and retaining one Brooklyn Assembly seat and an upstate State Senate seat.

title: Vietnam Referendum Voted
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Nov. 6 (AP)A referendum to ask Congress to grant amnesty to Vietnam draft evaders was approved 2,933 to 2,812 in this affluent Bergen County community today.

title: WAVES OF GEESE GO TO COMEDIES
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 5Chinese cities staged rallies and flagwaving parndes last week to say farewell to masses of city youths being shipped to the countryside to labor on what is called the front line of agriculture.

title: Chile Shortens Curfew
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Chile's military government has shortened by one hour the nationwide curfew that has been in force since it seized power on Sept. 11. The curfew was reduced from eight hours to seven in Santiago last night. Its length varies in other cities.

title: Gaso Leads the Entire Republican Slate to 24 Victory Throughout Nassau County
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Wednesday, Nov. 7Ralph G. Caso, the incumbent Nassau County Executive, led the entire Republican slate of candidates on the county and town levels to victory by about a 2to1 margin on the basis of returns early this morning.

title: Other Strike News
description: Violence flared yesterday in the twodayold hospital strike here. Page 51.

title: FIRE CHIEFS'
description: We were just on the vergewe were just reaching the point where nerves were starting to run raw in the field. We were approaching the point of brother against brother. I didn't want to see it reach nightfall.

title: Caterpillar Tractor Strike Set for Nov. 15 by U.A.W.
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6 (AP)The United Auto Workers says it will strike the Caterpillar Tractor Company on Nov. 15 if agreement has not been reached by then on a national contract for 33,000 Caterpillar workers in eight states.

title: Alfred Romer, Evolution Authority, Dies
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 6 Dr. Aifred Sherwood Romer, a leader in using comparative anatomy to study the evolution of fossil vertebrates (animals with backbones), died in Mount Auburn Hospital last night at the age of 78. He had been in a coma since Oct. 20, when he choked on a mouthful of food.

title: Bridge: Players for Match Points Must Worry About Field
description: Tournament play for match points has one more dimension than rubber bridgethe players have to worry not only about what is happening at their own tables but also about the field. The declarer must occasionally modify his line of play in the light of his estimate of the likely proceedings at other tables on the same deal.

title: Larsen Takes First Place In Manila Chess Tourney
description: MANILA, Nov. 6 (AP) The Danish grandmaster Bent Larsen, playing with caution, got a draw on the 18th move against Yugoslavia's Ljubomir Ljubojevic today and won the First Philippine International Chess Tournament.

title: Mrs. Cordelia S. May Is Wed To Pittsburgh District Attorney
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 6Mrs. Cordelia Scaife May, one of the heirs to the Mellon family fortune, was married to Allegheny County District Attorney Robert W. Duggan on Aug. 29 at Zephyr Cove on the southeast shore of Lake Tahoe, Nev., it was disclosed today.

title: Morristown Elects Democrat
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Nov. (AP)  David V. Manahan, Democrat, defeated a Republican incumbent by four votes to win this town's mayoralty totoday. Mr. Manahan, 48 years old, defeated Mayor Emilio Gervasio, 63. The new Mayor is community relations manager for American Telephone and Telegraph in New York. Mr. Gervasio was a town policeman for 27 years before becoming Mayor.

title: Paul O'Dwyer
description: Whether pleading before the United Nations for the creation of an independent Jewish state, arguing in the Supreme Court against Englishlanguage literacy tests for Puerto Rican voters in New York or defending civil rights workers in a Mississippi courtroom, Paul O'Dwyer has rarely been without a cause.

title: 5 Here Accused of Gaming
description: Three women and two men were arrested yesterday at 750 Grand Concourse, the Bronx, near 156th Street, on charges of gambling, promotion of policy and possession of gambling records. The police seized $600 and 100,000 policy slips, which they said, indicated a daily wagering total of $80,000.

title: Mayor of 4 Upstate Cities Win Despite Corruption Allegations
description: Mayors of four major upstate cities swept to commanding reelection victories yesterday despite charges of municipal corruption by their opponents.

title: DEMOCRATS PICK UP 10 ROCKLAND SEATS
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Wednesday, Nov. 7  Two incumbent Rockland County Town Supervisors both under indictment for various forms of official misconduct, were resoundingly defeated yesterday in their bids for reelection by Democratic candidates who made official corruption the county's major campaign issue.

title: A Long Crammed and Very Typical Day in the Life of David Rockefeller
description: The man who runs the garage at the Chase Manhattan Bank Building had been keeping watch. When he saw David Rockefeller leave the Federal Reserve Bank New York, 100 yards or so to the west on Liberty Street, he shouted, O.K. Chester.

title: Rise in Consumer Credit Shows a Slowing in Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) Consumer credit, a key measure of confidence in the economy, slowed sharply in September, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Top Films Barred From PayTV by Network Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A representative of the American Broadcasting Company admitted that when the network buys major boxoffice hits from the motion picture studios it stipulates that the films be withheld from all forms of pay television. A case in point was The Poseidon Adventure, one of this, year's top moneymakers, which A.B.C. has purchased for one showing in the fall of 1974 for $3million.

title: Watergate Panel Asks Staff to Explore Possibility of Meeting With President
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Senate Watergate committee asked its staff today to explore with the White House whether President Nixon would be willing to meet with the committee's members and, if so, under what conditions.

title: Charter New York Loses Bid to Add Bank in Glen Head
description: The Charter New York Corporation, the $6.3billion holding company that owns the Irving Trust Company, has lost out in its bid to acquire the First National Bank of Glen Head, a $56million Long Island bank also sought by Arthur T. Roth.

title: WALKOUT AFFECTS 2 L. I. HOSPITALS
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I. Nov. 6Better bring somebody out with you.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Political and Security Committee10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Insurgents in Thailand Kill 30 Soldiers and Militiamen
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 6 (UPI)Police and military officials said today that 30 soldiers and militiamen had been killed in an ambush by Communistled rebelsone of the worst incidents in eight years of insurgency.

title: Potential to Double Oil Output Seen by Indonesians
description: Indonesia has the potential to double her present daily oil production of 1.3 million barrels in the next few years, the head of that nation's stateowned oil enterprise, Pertamina, said here yesterday.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: CANADA CONSIDERING RATIONING OF OIL
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 6 (AP)Energy Minister Donald Macdonald has outlined a threestage oilrationing program that the Canadian Government will implement if needed this winter.

title: First Working Session Held At Vienna TroopCut Parley
description: VIENNA, Nov. 6 (AP)Delegates from 19 countries, including the United States and the Soviet Union, today held their first working session on troop reductions in Central Europe.

title: Columbia's Coach Quits
description: Frank Navarro resigned as football coach at Columbia University yesterday after having struggled for six seasons to rebuild the Lions' fortunes.

title: Forbes's Balloon Ends CoasttoCoast Odyssey
description: GWYNN ISLAND, Va., Nov. 6 (AP)  Malcolm S. Forbes's transcontinental balloon trip came to a soggy end today when he and his son Bobby brought down their 65foothigh hotair craft.in Chesapeake Bay just southeast of this island off Virginia's eastern mainland.

title: Squires, Manhattan Win CrossCountry
description: Last July, Pete Squires, Manhattan College junior, started a training program in which he ran 200 miles a week. In the early fall, he reduced it to 150 miles. Yesterday, he won the most important race of his career.

title: California Apparently Rejects Reagan's TaxCurb Proposal
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 6Incomplete returns tonight indicated that California voters had rejected a plan for drastic revision of the state's system of collecting and spending taxes.

title: Oakland, Calif., School Official Killed in Ambush by 3 Gunmen
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 6Dr. Marcus A. Foster, the Superintendent of Schools here, was shot and killed tonight and his deputy, was critically wounded when gunmen ambushed them as they emerged from the Board of Education building.

title: Galbraith Sees Resignation
description: WESTFIELD, Mass., Nov. 6 (AP)John K. Galbraith, the Harvard economist and former United States Ambassador to India, told reporters at a news conference here last night that he believed President Nixon would resign because Galbraith's Law states that anyone who says he won't resign four times, will.

title: Two Updated FirstAid Manuals Seek to Reduce Seriousness of Accidents
description: Each year more than a quarter of the nation's population suffers an injury or sudden illness that requires first aidonthescene emergency care administered by layman. Yet, some doctors estimate, fewer than 5 per cent of these millions of victims receive the prompt and proper care that might save their lives or alleviate the seriousness of their condition.

title: Plan for New L. I. County Appears to Be a Loser
description: The hope of Eastern Suffolk County to set up a new bucolic county insulated from suburbia was apparently snuffed out yesterday in a statewide referendum.

title: Recital: Ani Kavafian
description: Ani Kavafian is a 24yearold violinist who was born in Instanbul of Armenian parents, reared in Detroit and topped off her studies with Ivan Galamian at the Juilliard School. Ida Kavafian is a younger sister whose history in almost every respect duplicates that of Ani's except that Ida is still at Juilliard studying with Oscar Shumsky.

title: Economist Scores U.S. Health Budget
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 6A Harvard health economist charged today that the Nixon Administration's health budget was a political document that was intended to make health services a business enterprise, like the popcorn and television industries.

title: Unitas Takes a Long Dropback
description: Have we seen the last of John Unitas? Pro football's most renowned player will move this week to the San Diego Chargers inactive list the taxi squad. Ron Waller, interim coach of the Chargers, proposes to play the young quarterbacks, Dan Fouts and Wayne About Clark, in the last six games. It is Clark who will move up to take the place of Unitas on the 40inan active roster.

title: What Beame Plans to Do, As Promised in Campaign
description: During the long mayoral campaign that culminated in his victory last night, Controller Abraham D. Beame enunciated his views on a variety of major city issues. Following is a summary of what he has said he will do:

title: News Summary and Index
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame, who began his public service as a parttime accounting teacher 44 years ago, was elected as the City's 104th Mayor in a landslide victory. Tallying close to 0 per ent of the vote, Mr. Beame was running far ahead of his major opponents: State Senator John J. Marchi, the Republican, who was in second place, slightly ahead of Assemblyman Albert H. Biaggi, Conservative. Mr. Beame's running mates, Paul O'Dwyer, the City Council President candidate, and State Senator Harrison Blumenthal, Liberal, Representative Mario J. Goldin, the Controller candidate, were also elected. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Son Bests Father for Mayor
description: QUASQUETON, Iowa, Nov 6 (AP)Reuben M. Hansen, 69 years old, tried but failed today to oust his son as mayor. Ronald M. Hansen, 33, was returned to office by a vote of 107 to 31.

title: Bond Issue Is in Doubt As Count Lags Upstate
description: Governor Rockefeller's $3.5billion transportation bondissue proposal was getting a 10to7 favorable vote in early returns from New. York City last night but was trailing badly upstate. The bond issue, a grab bag of hundreds of transit and highway projects, was losing by close to 2 to 1 upstate, where deep snow in many areas curtailed voting.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A recent Times editorial asks Congress to pause on Its way toward confirmation of a new Vice President only long enough to search for some skeletons in Gerald Ford's closet. We must ignore Mr. Ford's stand on issues, The Times tells us, because only the President is entitled to consider such factors under the terms of the 25th Amendment.

title: National Ballet of Washington Visits New York
Jenkins Is First In jump
description: The combination of Rodney. Jenkins and Idle Dice came into its own last night as the National Horse Show celebrating its 90th year, ended an eightday run at Madison Square Garden.

title: A LANDSLIDE HERE
The Secret Recesses
description: A MILITARY HEADQUARTERS, North ChinaField Marshal Montgomery once told me: There are two rules of war. The first rule is never invade Russia. The second rule is never invade China. As far as the first rule is concerned, I am convinced this country hasn't the slightest intention of breaking it. But it is clearly preparing for the contingency that Moscow itself might violate the second.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The minimum price for a gallon of milk will rise by 6 cents, to $1.30, next month, the New Jersey Division of Dairy Industry said yesterday. The increase will mean that a half gallon of milk will sell for at least 68 cents, up by 3 cents, and the minimum price for a quart will rise from 35 cents to 36.5 and be rounded off to 37 cents.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery, number yesterday was:

title: A TIDY TRANSITION SOUGHT BY BEAME
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame will soon handpick a group of experts to meet with representatives of Mayor Lindsay to facilitate a smooth transition between the administrations.

title: Sirica Calls Nixon's Secretary To Testify in the Tapes Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Rose Mary Woods, President Nixon's personal secretary for more than 20 years, was summoned today to testify in the Federal court investigation into White House tape recordings and two missing conversations.

title: Company to Shift Delivery Of Oil for Heating in Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 6 (AP)Effective Dec. 1, the Exxon Corporation will halt direct delivery of heating oil in the Buffalo area, making its fuel available only through one distributor, a spokesman announced yesterday.

title: 7 Mayors Protest Train Perils
description: BLOOMFIELD, Nov. 6 Mayors of seven towns along the route of the ErieLackwanana Railroad have banded together to protest what they see as the lack of safety of freight trains on the Greenwood Lake branch. The municipal authorities are slated to voice their objections at a public hearing to be held by the Public Utilities Commission tomorrow in Newark.

title: Europe's Oil Crisis: No Quick New Sources in View
description: PARIS, Nov. 6Until at least 1980 there will really be no adequate substitute for Arab oil to power the factories, run the cars and heat the homes of Europeans.

title: A Ceremonial Windup for Secretariat
Maurice Gordon, 68, Dies; A Boston Property Owner
description: NEWTON, Mass., Nov. 6 (AP)Maurice Gordon, Boston property owner and philanthropist, died yesterday at his home here, He was 68 years old.

title: VOTERS BACKING 2 JERSEY ISSUES
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6Two comparatively noncontroversial public questions on the New Jersey ballot appeared to be headed for approval tonight, on the basis of early returns.

title: 2 BigBoard Seats Sold
description: TWo New York Stock Exchange seats were sold yesterday, one, for $145,000 and one later for $140,000. The most recent sale previously was for $140,000, the exchange said. The lowest price for a seat this yearwas $72,000 and that was the lowest price since the late nineteen  fifties. The highest price for a seat this year was $170,000, the michange said. The record price for a seat was $515,000 in 1968 and 1969.

title: EUROPEANS URGE MIDEAST PULLBACK
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 6The European Common Market, under threat of an Arab oil boycott of all nine member countries unless they remain neutral in the Middle East war, called on Israel and Egypt today to return to the lines they held on Oct. 22, before Israeli forces surrounded the Egyptian Army's III Corps.

title: People and Business
description: H. Ross Perot, chairman and chief executive officer of the Electronic Data Systems Corporation, made a speech In September at a reinsurance conference sponsored by a subsidiary of the CNA Financial Corporation. A transcript of the speech was mailed to the press late last month. And now Mr. Perot wants those transcripts returned.

title: Harrison Goldin
description: The one successful candidate in yesterday's city election who knows he will have someone looking over his shoulder in January is Harrison J. Goldin, who will move into the office of Controller being vacated by the new Mayor, Abraham D. Beanie.

title: BLOUSTEIN BALKS AT OUSTING DEAN
description: PISCATAWAY, Nov. 6Rutgers University's president, Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, refused tonight to suspend Luis Nieves, the Livingston College dean for student affairs, whose resignation had been demanded by 200 black students who had occupied the college's administrative offices.

title: 11 Seized as Harassment Is ReportedLindsay Assails Cost Council
description: Incidents of violence flared yesterday at struck hospitals in the metropolitan area, where growing heaps of uncollected contaminated refuse added to the problems caused by the twodayold strike of 30,000 nonmedical employes.

title: GOING OUT
description: LADIES FIRST It's Women's Lib, but not hortatory Women's Lib, that occupies the stage in this first show of the new Theater at Noon season in St Peter's Center, 16 East 56th Street (PL 34669).

title: Percy and Mondale Told to File Reports As '76 Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) Whether they admit it or not, Senators Charles H. Percy, Republican of Illinois, and Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, are considered potential Presidential candidates.

title: Three Men Killed As 2 Small Planes Collide Above L.I.
description: Three men were killed when two small planes collided over Dix Hills, LI., early yesterday afternoon, the Federal Bureau of Aviation Safety at Kennedy International Airport reported.

title: Nixon Plans Watergate Initiative
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The White House said today that President Nixon, far from yielding to demands that he resign, was planning a broad new initiative to restore his credibility in the Watergate case.

title: NEWS AGAIN FAILS TO PUBLISH PAPER
description: Striking members of the Newspaper Guild prevented publication of The Daily News for the second day yesterday.

title: ExJustice Clark to Hear MaineNew Hampshire Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) Former Supreme Court Justice Tom C. Clark was named special master yesterday to hear evidence and make recommendations to the Supreme Court in the boundary dispute between New Hampshire and Maine.

title: British Drugstore Chain Buying Harrod's
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Harrod's, a huge department store that represents Britain's claim to worldwide supremacy in the retailing field, has been caught in the takeover trend that is sweeping British industry.

title: Picket Line Collapse Hospitalizes Fireman
description: Shortly before 11 o'clock yesterday morning, Harry Nolan, a 58yearold fireman, collapsed while on picket duty at the headquarters of Engine Company 329 at Riis Park in the Rockaways.

title: RATIONING OF GAS URGED BY SWIDLER
description: The state has urged the Federal Government to place gasoline under a consumer rationing program and to require refineries to curtail their gasoline production by two million barrels a day to provide more fuel oil.

title: They're Black, So Feminism Has Even More Obstacles Than Usual
description: The women who recently formed the National Black Feminist Organization are aware that, in both the black and white communities, they may be up against a somewhat formidable wall of misunderstanding.

title: Wagner and Steingut Win Easily as Democrats Retain a Large Majority in Council
description: Two scions representing the third generation of Democratic dynastiesRobert F. Wagner Jr. and Robert S. Steingutswept to easy victories in City Council elections last night as Democrats retained their overpowering majority on the newly expanded body.

title: New Hampshire Democrat Winner in Special Election
description: LEBANON, N. H., Nov. 6 (AP) Joanne Symons, a Democrat, easily defeated her Republican opponent, Lawrence Howard, for a vacancy in the State House of Representatives today.

title: People in Sports: Coast Kicker Admits That He Deliberately Missed
description: Efren Herrera, the kicking specialist on the University of California, Los Angeles, football team, missed an extra point on purpose, he says, in last Saturday's 6213 rout of Washington. Now Herrera's future on the U.C.L.A. team is up to his teammates, his coach says.

title: EGYPTIANS TO GET ADDED SUPPLIES
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 6Israel agreed today to permit an additional 50 truckloads of supplies to be delivered to the beleaguered Egyptian III Corps in an apparent effort to avoid a crisis over the resupply issue at the time of Secretary of State Kissinger's arrival in Cairo.

title: Many Ties Still Bind U.S., Egypt
description: CAIRO, Nov. 6 (AP)It's not easy for a stranger to find the American diplomatic presence in Egypt; it appears on Page 69 of the diplomatic list published in French under Espagne and is identified by the red and gold flag of Spain.

title: Vesco Seized in Bahamas On U.S. Extradition Plea
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Nov. 6Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, was arrested here this afternoon by the Royal Bahamtan Police acting on a request from the United States for his extradition to face a fraud charge.

title: RICHARDSON BIDS NIXON DROP CLAIM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson said today that President Nixon should agree to drop all claims of executive privilege in the wideranging investigation of the Watergate scandals.

title: Nixon Plans Watergate Initiative
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The White House said today that President Nixon, far from yielding to demands that he resign, was planning a broad new initiative to restore his credibility in the Watergate case.

title: O'Dwyer at Council Helm
description: As the Democratic party's nominee, Paul O'Dwyer won easily, as expected, in the balloting for City Council President. A citywide post with an independent and separate constituency from that of the Mayor, the City Council President chairs the open sessions of the city's representative body. He also sits with the Mayor, the Controller and the presidents of the five boroughs on the Board of Estimate, which decides the policy issues concerning zoning and housing and helps shape the city's budgetary priorities.

title: IRA VANDEWATER
description: Ira Vandewater, retired president and chief executive officer of R. W. Greeff & Co., an international chemical sales organization with headquarters here, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 150 Greenway Terrace, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Red Ryder Is 2d Winner From Circle Repertory
description: Last season the Circle Repertory Theater Company presented the premiere of Lanford Wilson's remarkable The Hot L Baltimore. On Monday it opened its season with the premiere of Mark Medoff's When You Comin Back, Red Ryder? On the strength of the two productions, it is clear that the Circle not only represents off Off Broadway at its finest, but that it also is a theater with the highest professional standards.

title: Seven Jailed Priests in Spain Try to Set Fire to Their Prison
description: MADRID, Nov. 6  Seven Roman Catholic priests serving long terms for political offenses in a special prison tried to burn it down today in protest against their isolation from other political prisoners in Spain.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Del Bello and Vetrano Running Neck and Neck
description: WHITE PLAINS, Wednesday; Nov 7Mayor Alfred B. DelBello of Yonkers, a Democrat, held a narrow lead early this morning in a race for Westchester County Executive called the closest in the county's history.

title: Cut in Arab Oil Output Since War Put at 28%
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 6 (AP)The total cut in oil production by Arab oil producers since the ArabIsraeli war began has already reached 28.5 per cent, or 5.83 million barrels a day, the Middle East Economic Survey reported.

title: Burns Defends Fed's Policy During 1973 Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the severe inflation of 1973 cannot responsibly be attributed to excessive growth of the nation's money supply or to public policies more generally.

title: MAYOR UNSEATED IN MINNEAPOLIS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 6Albert J. Hofstede, a young liberal Democrat, unseated Mayor Charles S. Stenvig tonight. Mr. Stenvig, a stanchly conseryative independent who is a former detective, was seeking a third term.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings, with the worst record in the National Hockey League, traded the team's assistant captain, Gary Bergman, for Minnesota North Star's captain, Ted Harris. Both are defensemen.

title: Market Place: Vanishing Stock In Weis Failure
description: Sol Siedman is a 55yearold small businessman who imports watchmakers' and jewelers' supplies and tools and who says he earns less than $15,000 a year. He sometimes plays the stock market. At least he used to.

title: A, New Weather Satellite Is Launched in California
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Nov. 6 (Reuters) A weather satellite capable of photographing the entire earth twice a day was successfully launched here today.

title: MARKET DECLINES 7TH TIME IN A ROW
description: The stock market registered its seventh consecutive loss yesterday after a sharp rally in the first hour of trading gradually faded away.

title: Byrne Is Man of Caution
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6Brendan T. Byrne's gubernatorial campaign opened on a dramatic note last April 24, which was 23 days after his 49th birthday, when he tendered his resignation as a Superior Court Judge to Governor Cahill and then used the Governor's outer office to announce his candidacy.

title: Advertising: 5 for the Money
description: During a family trip to Old McDonald's Farm in Darien, Conn., last summer, little Sara Kienast threw up. But, since she is one of quintuplets, things could have been a lot worse.

title: Bobst Library: An Emphasis on Space
description: It's been a long time since a great interior space was constructed in New York. Lately, architects seem to have been devoting more attention to removing great rooms than making them. So from that standpoint at least, New York University's new Elmer Holmes Bobst Library on Washington Square is a welcome addition to the city: its 100 by 100foot central hall, 150 feet high, surely makes for one of New York's most spectacular architectural experiences.

title: SOVIET URGES U.N. TO PUNISH ISRAEL
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6The Soviet leadership asserted today that the strictest sanctions under the United Nations Charter should be applied against Israel to force her to pull back forces to the Middle East ceasefire lines of Oct. 22.

title: Rangers Get New Worry Tonight: Big, Bad Bruins
description: As though they don't have enough trouble, the New York Rangers, mired in a slump of seven games without a victory, must meet the brutal Boston Bruins tonight at Madison Square Garden. ?? P.M. WNBC Radio, 660 on the dial).

title: CORPORATE BONDS CLOSE UNCHANGED
description: Corporate bond prices closed almost unchanged yesterday in light trading.

title: GURNEY ACCUSES PANEL ON INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, (AP)Senator Edward J. Gurney believes that he was investigated by the Senate Watergate committee on which he serves despite denials of such an inquiry by the committee's chief counsel, an aide to the Senator says.

title: City Firemen Go on Strike for 5 Hours Before Agreeing to Arbitration on Pact
description: The city was virtually without fire protection for a tense five and a half hours yesterday as firefighters walked off their jobs in the first strike in the 108year history of the New York City Fire Department.

title: RALEIGH ELECTS BLACK AS MAYOR
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 6 (AP) Clarence E. Lightner became today the first black man elected Mayor of a metropolitan Southern city with a white majority population.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5Richard Bach, author of the bestselling novel Jonathan Livingston Seagull, has won a preliminary court order pending trial for extensive changes to be made in the film version of the novel.

title: Books of The Times
description: STATE OF GRACE. By Joy Williams. 260 pages. Paris Review Editions/Doubleday. $6.95.

title: Connor's Willing to Play For U.S. in Cup Final
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 6 (UPI) Jimmy Connors, the 21yearold star, said today he wanted to play for the United States in the Davis Cup final. He had passed up the early rounds of cup competition.

title: A Ceremonial Windup for Secretariat
description: It was farewell to a thoroughbred at Aqueduct yesterday. Secretariat, the handsome, powerful champion who had raced so brilliantly for the Meadow Stable for two years, made the final public appearance of his career. He paraded in silks, with his regular jockey, Ron Turcotte, on his back while 32,990 fans cheered loudly and fervently. With Mrs. Helen (Penny) Tweedy and Lucien Laurin sharing the spotlight, Secretariat was the focus of attention to a degree almost comparable to the momentous occasions on which he won the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness and the Belmont Stakes to become the first horse in 25 years to wear the Triple Crown.

title: CAMBODIAN TROOPS RECAPTURE 3 TOWNS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Cambodian troops killed 30 insurgents today and recaptured three positions northeast of Phnom Penh, the military command reported.

title: No Haste In Picking Golf Chief
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Nov. 6 J. Paul Austin, chairman of the tournament players division policy board of the Professional Golfers' Association, indicated today no hasty selection would be made to name a new golf commissioner. Yesterday Joseph C. Dey of Locust Valley, L. I., advised the board he would retire when his fiveyear contract ended Feb. 28.

title: City's Support for. Bonds Is Offset by Upstate Vote
description: Governor Rockefeller's $3.5 billion transportation bond Tissue proposal apparently was rejected by the voters by a substantial margin yesterday. With approximately half of the votes counted, the statewide margin was 3 to 2 against the borrowing plan.

title: U.S. and Soviet Scientists To Plan Insect Research
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) United States and Soviet scientists will meet next week to draft plans for cooperative research on how to control crop and livestock pests without poisoning the environment, Agriculture Department officials announced today.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The executive directors of the International Monetary Fund have approved a technical change in the fund's rules that will make it easier for European countries to use their supply of Special Drawing Rights in financial settlements with one another, officials disclosed today.

title: Paper Ballots Come in First as Jersey Tries a ComputerizedVoting Test
description: WASHINGTON TOWNSHIP, N. J., Nov. 6A promised giant step from the stone age to the space age in voting procedures here stumbled in midstride when a computer developed difficulties in its counting of 7,500 ballots cast in this Gloucester County township's 18 election districts.

title: More Flight Cuts Planned
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)Texas International Airlines announced yesterday that it would reduce its scheduled flights by more than 7 per cent effective Saturday in response to the nationwide fuel shortage.

title: Chief of Struck Hospital Notes Organized Calm
description: George H. Adams, president and chief executive officer of Lutheran Medical Center in Brooklyn, kneaded his heavy eyelids yesterday, propped his chin in his hands and said he hoped to get home to West Hempstead, L. I., for the night after living in at the hospital since 5:30 A.M. Monday, the day the hospital workers' strike began.

title: Vietcong Say They Struck Bien Hoa Base in Reprisal
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 7The Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government said in an unusually frank statement yesterday that it had attacked Bien Hoa air base, near Saigon, with rockets to retaliate for recent air strikes originating at the base against Communist positions.

title: Wheat and Corn Futures Drop in Sluggish Trading
description: With many commodity futures markets closed on Election. Day, it seemed yesterday as if traders on the Chicago Board of Trade and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange were in a holiday mood. Trading moved aimlessly without much indication of trends.

title: Four Are Killed and 6 Injured in 2 Blazes in Brooklyn
description: Four persons died and six others were injured in two separate firesone of two alarms and one of fivelast night in Brooklyn. Fire Department officials said that full complements of firemen and equipment fought both blazes, which came only nine hours after the strike by city firemen has ended.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 25yearold upstate man was killed at 1 P.M. yesterday when the Volkswagen he was driving was struck by a speeding 1973 Lincoln Continental that was being chased by the police in Queens.

title: A U.S.SOVIET ROLE IN TRUOE UNIT SEE Waldheim Said to Accept 72 Americans and Russians
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 6  Secretary Genera: Waldheim has agreed to accept offers from the Soviet Union and the United States for each to provide 36 military observers for the United Nations Truce Supervision Organ. ization in the Middle East, delegates said today.

title: Carr Leads Cays'
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 6 (AP) Austin Carr scored 20 points and all but shut out Jerry West in the first period as the Cleveland Cavaliers upset the Los Angeles Lakers, 11596, tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: The Prosecutor
description: CONCORD, Mass.It is generally agreed that the appointment of a special prosecutor to carry on the task begun by Archibald Cox is indispensable to restoration of confidence in administration of justice. The nation cannot tolerate the spectacle of a potential defendant in the Presidency dictating to a prosecutor how far investigation may go. Acting Attorney General Bork's protestation that he means to be utterly independent in pursuing the Watergate and related investigations furnishes even less security than was furnished by the express charter of independence given to Mr. Cox by Attorney General Richard.

title: Israel Puts Dead at 1,854; 1,800 Are Still in Hospital
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 6Israel announced tonight that 1,854 Israeli soldiers were killed in the latest Middle East war.

title: A Children's Ballet And Other Ideas
description: It's a moralist's delight, ravages committed and penance done.

title: Maryland Ends 6Year Rap Brown Case. After Plea Bargaining
description: ELLIOTT CITY, Md., Nov. 6 Tangled litigation dating to a racial disturbance in Cambridge, Md., in 1967 was brought to a conclusion here today when H. Rap Brown, the black militant, pleaded guilty to a charge that he failed to appear at a trial in 1970.

title: MayorElect Beame
description: By a heavy margin, New Yorkers have chosen Controller Abraham D. Beame as the city's next Mayor. The dimensions of his victory attest to the esteem he has earned through years of dedicated public service as well as to the weakness of his opponents. The Beame vote cut across economic, ethnic and racial lines, an augury that the new Mayor will be able to count on broad support in efforts to ease tensions and rebuild community unity.

title: EUROPEANS URGE MIDEAST PULLBACK
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 6.The European Common Market, under threat of an Arab oil boycott of all nine member countries unless they remain neutral in the Middle East war, called on Israel and Egypt today to return to the lines they held on Oct. 22, before Israeli forces surrounded the Egyptian Army's III Corps.

title: AGENCY BARS STAY ON AUTO POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 The Environmental Protection Agency rejected today any delay in the 1975 use of catalytic controls for auto pollution, saying there were adequate ways of guarding against a newly spotlighted health hazard.

title: Justice Fine Declares Fear Prompted Firemen's Return
description: It took Justice Sidney A. Fine 40 minutes yesterday afternoon to shepherd opposing forces  the United Firefighters Association and the city administration  into a strikeending stipulation.

title: Audit of Reserve Is Blocked
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Reuters)The House Rules Committee blocked today action on a bill to require an independent audit of Federal Reserve Board operations. The House Banking Committee approved the bill last month.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: At 2 Emergency Rooms in Bronx, Surprising Tranquillity Reigns
description: At two strikeburdened hospitals in the central Bronx, the emergency rooms, normally among the most frenetic areas of a hospital, were running smoothly yesterday as fewer patients than usual turned up.

title: Israel Puts Dead at 1,854; 1,800 Are Still in Hospital
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 6Israel announced tonight that 1,854 Israeli soldiers were killed in the latest Middle East war.

title: Volvo Raising U.S. Prices; increase Set on Newsprint
description: Prices of Swedishbuilt Volvo automobiles sold in the Unite States will be increased b3 $590 to $715 in the 1974 mode line, the Volvo of Amerida Con poration said yesterday.

title: Facing the Realities
description: TEL AVIVIsraeliArab wars in the Middle East seem to have a repetitive rhythm. The Arabs attack or provoke a war. Their armies are beaten on the battlefield. Israel finds herself an involuntary purchaser of additional real estate. Israel declares herself ready to trade off territory for peace and negotiations, while the Arabs would rather lose territories than sit down at the green conference table to face Israelites.

title: Frederic Sanborn, Lawyer, Dies; Heard Cases of Nazis'
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 6 Frederic Rockwell Sanborn, an expert in international law and a former member of the Supreme Restitution Court of Berlin after World War II, died today at his home here. He was 74 years old.

title: HIGH PARKING PEE DRAWS UNIONS'
description: NEWARK, Nov. 6  Labor and management, often at odds with each other, agreed today in their scorn of a Federal plan to reduce automobile traffic in New Jersey by requiring employers to charge their employes high fees for using company parking lots.

title: SANDMAN, ROUTED
description: Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic candidate, won an overwhelming victory in yesterday's gubernatorial election in New Jersey, defeating Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the conservative Republican candidate who had sought to reconstitute President Nixon's silent majority.

title: DETROIT ELECTS A BLACK MAYOR
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6  State Senator Coleman A. Young became the first black man to be elected Mayor of Detroit by scoring a narrow victory today in the face of a strong lawandorder appeal by his white opponent, former Police Commissioner John F. Nichols.

title: Wright Tells of Receiving Belated Notice on Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Charles Alan Wright is back home in Texas after months of serving as President Nixon's chief legal strategist in the battle for control of the Watergate tapes.

title: Godwin Defeats Howell For Governor of Virginia
description: RICHMOND, Wednesday, Nov. 7Former Gov. Mills Godwin, a conservative Republican, won a hardfought race for Virginia's Governorship today, defeating Lieut. Gov. Henry Howell, an independent liberalpopulist.

title: Two Fictitious Orders: Buy National Paragon
description: Two fairly substantial orders to buy National Paragon shares turned out to be fictitious yesterday, according to the American Stock Exchange.

title: Tests for New Navy Planes
description: NORFOLK, Nov. 6 (AP)The first carrier tests of the Navy's newest tactical aircraft, the F14 Tomcat and the S3 Viking, are scheduled for later this month aboard the carrier Forrestal off the Virginia capes.

title: VOTE FOR SEWERS PRAISED IN STATE
description: State officials yesterday hailed the apparent passage of a constitutional amendment that gives localities extra borrowing power to build sewer plants.

title: Nine Are Found Slain in Sixth Mass Murder Case in California in the Last Four Years
description: LODI, Calif., Nov. 7 (UPI)Nine persons were found slain early today in the master bedroom of a large ranchstyle home in California's wine country.

title: Arthur Daley
description: An ironic jest that was seemingly in the process incubation failed to materialize yesterday. When Torn Seaver of the Mets was designated the National League winner of the Cy Young Award a week ago, every expert with a wayward sense of humor began contemplating the possibility of a sweep of Cy Young honors by the Mets. They had taken the first with Tom Terrific. Would they also take the American League prize with a castoff who has been a constant source of embarrassment to them, Nolan Ryan?

title: Strauss and Humphrey Support VicePresidential Reform Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)  Two top Democrats indicated support today for a proposal to remove the selection of future VicePresidential nominees from the Presidential nominating conventions.

title: Election Decimates the G.O.P.'s Ranks in. Trenton
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7Democrats apparently swept to the largest legislative victories in modern New Jersey history with margins so great in both houses that the few Republicans who survived the Brendan T. Byrne landslide in yesterday's election will have little if any leverage during their terms.

title: Excerpts From the Statement by Aiken
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Following are excerpts from a statement made in the Senate today by Senator George D. Aiken, Republican of Vermont:

title: Pay TV Can Help Arts Survive, Lincoln Center Aide Tells Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7A representative of the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts in New York told the Federal Communications Commission today at paycable hearings that, to survive, cultural institutions need to extend the seating capacity of their theaters through some form of television.

title: Democratic Victories in Philadelphia Rebuff to Rizzo, Who Backed G.O.P.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7 This city's top two Republicans were swept from office yesterday, dashing the governorship aspirations of District Attorney Arlen Specter while further wounding Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, a Democrat with two years left in office.

title: LEA NOEMI
description: Lea Noemi, a star of the Yiddish Art Theater with Maurice Schwartz, died Tuesday in St. Elizabeth's Hospital. She was about 90 years old and lived at 360 Cabrini Boulevard.

title: Dow Index Is Up 7 In Modest Trading
description: The stock market ended seven consecutive sessions of losses yesterday by scoring modest advance in moderate trading.

title: Discovery of Tiny Cracks in Base of Saturn Rocket Forces 5Day Delay in Skylab Liftoff
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 7  Fourteen tiny cracks at the base of the rocket today forced a fiveday postponement of the launching of the Skylab 3 astronauts.

title: Political Power of Blacks Held Decisive in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7The election yesterday of State Senator Coleman A. Young as Detroit's first black Mayor is widely interpreted as a sign that blacks for the first time, now hold decisive power in this industrial city.

title: Bridge: New Book on CardReading Is Viewed as One of the Best
description: Several excellent books have been written on the subject of cardreading, but the newest of them has a good claim to be considered the best of the bunch. It is How to Read Your Opponents' Cards by Mike Lawrence, published last week by PrenticeHall ($7.95 hardcover; $3.95 paper; 176 pages).

title: Gurney Associate Reportedly Agrees To Talks on Funds
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7 (AP)Larry E. Williams, a former fund raiser for Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida, has agreed to plead guilty to two felony charges and testify for the Government in an investigation of Senator Gurney's finances, The Miami Herald says in its Thursday editions.

title: The Little Three: Still Pure Amateur
description: I had heard of the Little Three before I came up here, said Bob Odell, Williams' head football coach since 1971. But I never really knew the importance of it. It's sort Of the way college football should be. Odell, formerly the head coach at Bucknell and Penn, learned about the Little Three in a hurry first two hurry Williams teams won the roundrobin series with Wesleyan and Amherst. Odell's Ephmen open defense of the Little Three title at Wesleyan Saturday. Amherst, which is undefeated, beat Wesleyan, 4126, in the roundrobin's opening game. The 1973 series will end when Amherst and Williams meet Nov. 17, in their usual season finale.

title: U.S. AND EGYPT SET RENEWAL OF TIES, CUT SINCE '67 WAR
description: CAIRO, Nov. 7The United States and Egypt announced today that they had agreed to resume diplomatic relations and would exchange ambassadors within 10 days or two weeks.

title: SCANDALS EFFECT ON VOTE IS MINOR,
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 The Watergate scandals had little impact on turnout or results in yesterday's elections, according to official Republican and Democratic analyses here today.

title: SLIPPAGE IS NOTED IN NONSMOKING GAIN
description: The American Cancer Society yesterday cited Government statistics showing some slippage in the gains made against cigarette smoking since 1964, when the Surgeon General issued a report on the health hazards of smoking.

title: High School Sports
description: The Public Schools Athletic League football semifinals begin in two days, but a final decision on the teams involved has not been made. New Utrecht and DeWitt Clinton, which tied for division titles but were eliminated by tiebreaking procedures, have lodged protests with the P.S.A.L. and a final decision,, will be made today at a meeting of the executive committee of the High School Games Committee.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The National Endowment for the Humanities has awarded grants totaling $500,000 to the New York University Institute of Fine Arts.

title: EUROPEANS MOVE TO CONSERVE OIL
