description: THERE is a rather special reason why latecomers at the Theater De Lys are not being admitted for the first seven minutes after curtain is up. The first seven minutes, more or less, of Michael Weller's Moonchildren take place entirely in the dark, and it is the very special mark of Mr. Weller's stunning play that its precise tone of voice, and its first tumbling laughs, are established without effort before we've seen a single human face.

title: Notes: The Ski Show Has Its Finger on the Skier's Pulse
description: TONIGHT the annual Ski Show (which has been in Boston) will be heading for the New York Coliseum, where it will open on Thursday evening and continue through Sunday with some 200 exhibits. Visitors to the show who cast envious eyes at the hotdoggers doing their freestyle skiing antics on the conveyor belt called the SkiDek and imagine they are going to emulate them on some steep trail as soon as the season starts had better check in at the stand labeled Y.M.C.A. SkiFitness Test. Its purpose is not to tell people how to do kickouts and the other aerial stunts that are the new ski art form, or even how to do a smooth stem christie, but to determine what kind of shape skiers are in. The test given at the stand measures heart recovery rate, or how long it takes a person's pulse to return to normal after a minute of strenuous exercise. The longer it takes, the less fit skier is.

title: Kissinger, in Peking for Talks, Hints U.S. Will Press for Full Diplomatic Relations
description: PEKING, Nov. 10Secretary of State Kissinger, his attention turned away from the Middle East, arrived in Peking today and assured Premier Chou Enlai that the United States was determined to complete the process of normalizing relations with China as rapidly as possible.

title: Oddities of Oil
description: PARISThere are a number of puzzling developments in the energy crisis now gripping the industrialized world.

title: Best Seller List
Morris Is Fighting Uncontrolled Building
description: MORRISTOWN  Morris County municipalities ire engaged in a struggle to pre serve what remains of their natural resources which, the United States Soil Conservation Service warns, are being eroded by uncontrolled building activity.

title: Plan Seeks to Deter Dropouts
description: NEWARKA special program operated by the Youth Consultation Service to prevent troubled children from dropping out of school has begun its third year with an optimistic assessment of results thus far.

title: Son to the Berenzweigs
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Nov. 10A son was born on Oct. 31 to Dr. and Mrs. Harold K. Berenzweig of Brookline at Beth Israel Hospital in Boston.

title: Swaziland Anthem Changing
description: MBABANE, Swaziland, Nov. 10 (AP)King Sobhuza II has offered a $149 prize for new music to accompany the words of Swaziland's national anthem. He said the melody now makes the anthem too difficult to sing.

title: Callas' Night, But Taylor Steals It
description: HAMBURG. IT was the night before The Concert. Just before midnight. The lobby of Hamburg's new Plaza Hotel was empty except for Maria Callas and Giuseppe Di Stefano, returning from a late dinner. Callas was clearly in a skittish mood. I'll make my entrance like this, she said and she swept around the wide, silent marble hall.

title: POEM RATIONS GASOLINE FOR CARS
description: LISBON, Nov. 10Motorists, who had to wait in long lines for gasoline last night, have begun to pay the price of what Portugal is calling fidelity to her alliances.

title: City Says U.S. Refineries Are Stressing Gas
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration said yesterday that despite the national oil crisis United States refineries were working at only 91 per cent of capacity as against 95 per cent last summer  and still emphasizing gasoline too much.

title: A Marathon in Soccer
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 10 (AP) Monroe County Community College battled through 11 overtime periods today before posting a 21 victory over Morrisville A. and T. It gave the winners the National Junior College Athletic Association Region 3 championship.

title: Pupils Learn by Doing in Plastics Shop
description: SPOTSWOODThirty junfor high school students here are leaving their classrooms for two periods each day to work in a small plastics factory on the school grounds.

title: Archiecture
description: I DON'T know bow many shows make a season, or whether three architecture shows make a trend. October has produced the New York Cultural Center's 1930's Expositions, reviewed two weeks ago, The Furniture of Antonio Gaudi at the Spanish Institute, Park Avenue at 68th Street (through Nov. 30) dealt with here, and an exhibition of architectural models from the collection at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Wooing Foreign Tourists
description: Executives of Hughes Airwest, a small regional airline little known beyond the enclave it serves in the Far West, decided recently that they were seeing so many Japanese faces on the company's planes that it was time to open a sales office in Tokyo.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: NOVEL IS BURNED BY SCHOOL BOARD
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 10 About three dozen copies of the novel Slaughterhouse Five were burned in Drake, N. D., this week, On orders of the local school board.

title: The Gabblers
description: No matter what the calendar says, it isn't November until you hear that high, distant gabbling. You don't have to see a flockon the wing they are more properly called a skeinto know. You may even hear them the night, for they are late travelers when they have distant destination. In the daylight they may be flying so high you can scarcely make out their broad V against the depth of the autumn sky. But you can always hear them.

title: Calendar of Dog Shows
description: TodayOnondaga K.A. allbreed and obedience, Onondaga County War Memorial, 515 Montgomery Street, Syracuse, 1,598 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Morris Knolls Is Spoiler For Randolph's Season
description: Morris Knolls scored an early touchdown yesterday and made it stand up for a 73 victory over previously unbeaten Randolph in Randolph.

title: Investigation. Joined by Watergate Prosecutor Officials Queried
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The Nixon Administration's minority capitalism program is under Federal investigation for alleged bribes and kickbacks.

title: Michigan Rally Tops Illinois, 216
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 10 (AP)Ed Shuttlesworth's 1yard touchdown plunge after Michigan had recovered an Illinois fumble in the second quarter today offset a surprising early 60 Illini lead and the fourthranked Wolverines went on to beat Illinois, 216, in a Big Ten football game.

title: Work on Alley Park To Begin in Spring
description: Construction of a natural wildlife preservation area, much like the one that exists in Jamaica Bay, is scheduled to begin next spring in the northern section of Alley Park in Queens. The cost of the project has been put at $1million.

title: The American Military Alert
description: Oct. 25

title: Long Beach Democrats Regain Power
description: LONG BEACH, L. I. The overwhelmingly Democratic electorate of Long Beach came home to the Democratic fold last week, dismissing the Republican officeholders who had served their purpose of providing a political housecleaning.

title: Eban Asks Action on P.O W.'s in Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 10  Foreign Minister, Abba Eban of Israel called today for vigorous international action to gain the release of Israeli prisoners still held by Syria.

title: Recordings
description: EVERY nation has its unexportable operas, those that find ready audiences at home but little enthusiasm abroad. The humor of lighter works, for example, may not travel well. Operas in languages other than French, German or Italian present practical difficulties, for relatively few Western singers can cope with, say, Russian or Czech. Only the most compelling works seem, tot win a permanent place in the repertory when translated (to be sure, Mussorgsky's Boris was, for 40 years, heard in New York only in Italian, and survived the experience!); otherwise, faced with performing in an exotic language or arranging a translation, impresarios may well settle for La Bohme instead.

title: Surprise Victor In East Hampton
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.Except for one campaign worker who insists, I knew we, were going to win back in January of 1973, Judith Hope's stunning upset victory in the race for East Hampton Town Supervisor came as a surprise to politicians and voters alike.

title: Home Improvement
description: UNLIKE power mowers, which get regular use every summer regardless of the weather, gasoline  powered snow throwers get only occasional use in many parts of the countryand in some areas a whole winter can go by without the machine being used at all. As a result snow throwers often act up or won't start when neededprimarily because a machine that is used regularily almost always seem to, give less trouble and is generally easier to take care of In addition, when a mower breaks down it only means that the grass will grow a little taller for a day or two; when a snow thrower breaks down it means that members of the family will be late for school or work because the car can't be moved out of the garage or driveway.

title: Rarities Reach New Heights
description: An uncirculated specimen of each of the two types of U.S. silver dollars struck in 1795 (the second year of issue) came on the block in the Oct. 31 auction held by Lester Merkin of 445 Park Avenue (N.Y. 10022). The first type, with the flowing hair bust (obverse and reverse, enlarged, top row), was bid to a record high price for this coin, $29,000. The second type (center), called the draped bust, also reached a record price, $21,000.

title: Japan Plans Supertanker
description: TOKYO, Nov, 10 (Reuters) Japanese shipyards will be authorized to build a millionton tanker in the near future, according to the Transport Ministry. The largest ships afloat at present, two 483,000ton tankers, were built in Japan.

title: Pioneer 10
description: The first American satellite designed to explore the planet Jupiter and then to shoot out of the solar system, perhaps to discover other worlds, has reached the vicinity of the planet.

title: Scandale
description: SaintGermaindeGrive is too small to have a cafe, which, in France, means that it is small indeed; but it is not too small to have a warehouse for wine, for it is in the heart of the Bordeaux wine area, in the littlevisited region called EntredeuxMers Between Two Seas, a trifle grandiloquent, for actually it lies only between two rivers, the Garonne and the Dordogne. Between March and June of this year, a wine agent prudently referred to by the press as Monsieur X moved 3,200 hectoliters (84,500 gallons) of wine from this backwater storage place, which has the advantage of being short of witnesses, to the cellars of one of the biggest wine dealers of Bordeaux, Cruse at Fils, Freres. The wine was presumed to be the product of the legally defined Bordeaux area and was supposedly destined to be bottled and sold under the prestigious

title: Allan Miller Ties Gilbert With 210
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Nov. 10  Allan Miller, a nonwinner in two years on the professional golf tour, battled wind and cold for a 72 today and tied Gibby Gilbert for the thirdround lead in the $500,000 World Open tournament.

title: STATE SCORES U.S. ON CLEANUP AID
description: ALBANY, Nov. 10Today, a year after voters in the state approved a $1.15billion environmental bond issue, the state issued a report criticizing the Federal Government for not supplying, quickly enough its share of funds to clean up New York's air and water.

title: Matz Is Riding High Despite a Late Start
description: Mike Matz, who joined the United States Equestrian Team less than three weeks ago, is a rarest of rarities in the show ring.

title: Freshman Tailback Stars
description: AUBURN, Ala., Nov. 10 (AP)  A freshman tailback, Secdrick McIntyre, blasted up the middle for three touchdowns today and Auburn defeated Mississippi State, 31 to 17.

title: Vermont Deer Season Open
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Nov. 10 (UPDDeer season opened today in Vermont. The Fish and Game Commissioner, Edward Kehoe, said the state's deer herd was in good condition and that hunters, with a little luck, should bag 10,000 deer.

title: State Girds To Thwart Predicted Fuel Crisis
description: TRENTON  The threatened energy crsis in New Jersey seems to mean that, while electricity and home fuel will host consumers more this winter, the chances are that they will be enjoying them less.

title: Squeezing the subjectivity out of knowledge
description: The exploration of the social conditions that facilitate or retard the search for scientific knowledge has been the nigjor theme of Robert K. Merton's work for 40 years. This collection of papers, selected with unerring discrimination, and provided with a most useful introduction by Norman W. Storer, represent a fascinating overview of this sustained inquiry.

title: Miami of Ohio Tops Kent State To Gain Title
description: KENT, Ohio, Nov. 10 (AP) Chuck Varner, a fullback, scored twice as Miami of Ohio won the MidAmerican Conference title today by downing Kent State, 20 to 10.

title: Bayside Routs Evander and Gains P. S. A. L. Final
description: Bob DiGorolomo's pases picked apart the Evander Childs defense yesterday as Bayside moved into the Public Schools Athletic League final with a 300 victory at Memorial Field, Flushing, Queens.

title: Holy Trinity Is 146 Victim
description: WEST ISLIP, L.I., Nov. 10Greg Geiger's allround play paced St. John the Baptist to a 146 victory over Holy Trinity today. Geiger, a senior quarterback, completed nine passes for 154 yards and rushed nine times for 78 more.

title: City Dimming Lights On Bridges in Effort To Save Electricity
description: The power shortage has begun to deprive the city of some of the jewelry that used to sparkle on its skyline at night.

title: Woman Forced to Commit Sex Act on Subway in Bronx
description: A 20yearold nurse's aide riding alone in the last car of a 10car subway train yesterday morning was forced to submit to a sexual act by a man who threatened her with a knife.

title: College Football Next Saturday
description: EAST

title: Chess: Soviet Women Challenged By England and Rumania
description: Since 1950, when women's competitions were resumed after the lull of the war years, the Soviet Union's players have held uninterrupted sway. First, Ludmila Rudenko, then Elisaveta Bykova and Olga Ruptsova, and, since 1962, Nona Gaprindashvili have worn the women's crown.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none. based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as farr, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Nov. 17 Triumph Sports Car of New Jersey Turkey Trot, T.S.D. night rally (turkeys for prizes). Start at Bowlero, junction of Routes 3 and 46, Clifton, N.J. Registration: 7 P.M., first Car off 8:01. Information: Anna Andrews, phone (201)2564397.

title: U.S. Museum Leaders Seek Art in Russia for Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) Four prominent American museum officials are going to the Soviet Union this weekend to explore possibilities for culturalexchange exhibitions.

title: New & Novel
description: Other People

title: Miss O'Connor Bride Of Robert Fitzpatrick
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 10  Miss Maureen Anne O'Connor and Robert Joseph Fitzpatrick, a manager of financial planning for I.B.M. World Trade Center in White Plains, were married here this morning in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Robert Grogan, a cousin of the bride.

title: DIVORCES IN CHINA DECIDED BY PEERS
description: CANTON, China, Oct. 31After Mrs. Li, a woman in her late 30's, was given specie responsibilities as an official of a rural production brigade in Kwangtung Province, her husband decided that he wanted a divorce.

title: Brookdale Hospital Dinner To Honor Guilden Saturday
description: The Brookdale Hospital Medical Center's 52d annual dinner at the Americana Hotel Saturday will honor Ira Guilden, philanthropist and chairman of the executive committee of the National Bank of North America. Mr. Guilden is a trustee of Brookdale, 1,000bed voluntary hospital at Rockaway Parkway and Linden Boulevard in Brooklyn.

title: Randall4K. Bart to Wed Barbara Dame
description: YARDLEY, Pa., Nov. 10Miss. Babaga Susan Davne and Randall Kerr Bart plan to be married in May according to the engagement announcement made by Dr. and Mrs. Albert Davne, parents of the prospective bride. Her fianc is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Roger Bart of Princeton, N. J. Dr Batt is director. of research projects: at the Union Camp Corporation.

title: A New Target for Oriental Art: Everybody
description: OUR American passion for initiation into the mysteries of what we call art appreciation a term without exact parallel in any other languagestems, I suspect, from the truth that submission to cultural injection is a less taxing form of selfimprovement than settingup exercises. Whatever its source, it is a passion peculiar to us. There is nothing like it in France, for instance.

title: Leaks Scores 3 Touchdowns
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov, 10 (AP) Roosevelt Leaks, the nation's rushing leader, ran for three touchdowns and Jay Arnold, a defensive back, intercepted two passes today as Texas scored a 426 victory over Baylor on the road to a sixth consecutive Southwest Conference title.

title: ...the People Will Insist on Making the Decision
description: WASHINGTONThe spreading political scandals we call Watergate have shaken most of the American people out of whatever complacency, they might have had about our institutions and our sense of national Wellbeing: but one group in particular has been affectedthe professional politicians.

title: Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Why Herbie Sold Out, Or The Evolution of Mann
description: I ALWAYS thought you were going to be a great jazz musician, a critic told flautist Herbie Mann some years ago, but then one day you just stopped.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Long before Garo Yepremian was born on the island of Cyprus and long before this future placement kicker had become one of the wonders of the Western world, Steve Owen of the New York Giants had formulated his philosophy. Although an acknowledged master of defensive play, the ponderous Owen was pretty slick with his offense, too, and no strategist in the business had sounder concepts.

title: Julia Webb Howe Is Married To Benjamin Moore Rowland
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 10Miss Julia Webb Howe and Benjamin Moore Rowland, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Rowland of New Britain, Conn., were married here this morning. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Treadwell Ruml of Glencoe, and the late John P. ??owe.

title: Faulty Distribution of Doctors Linked in Part to Federal Aid
description: Federal medical programs are indirectly fostering a widening gap between doctorpoor inland states and doctorrich coastal states, according to locational analysis of American urban health care just published.

title: What They Are Saying
description: George Foreman, the financially pressed heavyweight champion, frowns on one method of making ends meet: I don't care about making movies and television commercials. I don't believe in lying about some product just so I can make money. I'm a fighter. I think I ought to make money fighting.

title: Record Missouri Crowd Sees Oklahorna Win 313
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Nov. 10 (UPI)  Joe. Washington scored two touchdowns and Oklahoma's stout defense held Missouri to six first downs today as the Sooners posted a 313 victory.

title: 2 Presumed Dead in Fire
description: ROOSEVELTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 10 (UPI)  Two persons were believed dead and one was injured when fire destroyed a twostory home in this St. Lawrence County hamlet early today. Presumed dead in the rubble of the home was Harry Comins and his teenage daughter. Brenda. Mr. Comins's wife, Nancy, was listed in satisfactory condition at Massena Memorial Hospital. She apparently suffered ankle injuries after jumping from a secondstory window.

title: MOVIE OPENINGS
description: THE DON IS DEADRichard Fleischer's thriller, written by Marvin H, Alpert and starring Anthony Quinn and Frederic Forrest, Wednesday at the Rivoli and other houses.

title: This Spook Has No Respect for Human Life
description: DURING the darkest days of the sixties, those days when it seemed that the Vietnam war would never end and the war on poverty was grinding to a halt, those of us who were involved in the movements to change our country's policies from within the existing political system began to wonder if we weren't wasting our time, andalong with our timethe lives of all those people. to whom we had pledged ourselves. It was during those lonely moments that frustration replaced hope, sand we began to talk of revolution.

title: The American Indians
description: When the beleaguered American Indian Movement ended its 71day occupation of Wounded Knee, S. D., on May 8, its leaders vowed to continue fighting, violently if necessary, for Indian rights.

title: CANADA DRAWING SORE AMERICANS
description: TORONTO, Nov. 7  Canadians used to worry about the brain drain to the United States, but no more. The tide has reversed in the past few years, and the brains are now coming north.

title: This Week in Sports
description: Basketball

title: Miss Nguyen Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Nguyen Van Tang of Saigon, South Vietnam, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nguyen Thi Chung, to Anthony P. X. Bothwell of Miami. The wedding is planned for late, next month.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Housatonic Fly Fishing
description: SHARON, Conn.The season's first snow dusted the hills; bare, black branches reeled against the dark, heavy clouds above the Housatonic River, and no birds sang.

title: Revenue Sharing A RedTape Bore To Some Towns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP)We do not want any, revenue sharing, wrote an official of Ward Ridge, Fla. We can handle our own business.

title: Diamond Found in Siberia Equals Soviet's Biggest
description: MOSCOW Nov. 10 (UPI)Siberian miners have found a 232carat diamond, equaling the largest diamond ever found in the Soviet Union, the newspaper Trud said this week.

title: May 4 Nuptials Set By Sherrill Dixon
description: Miss Sherrill Sands Dixon plans to be married on May 4 to Thomas Cameron Ragan Jr., who is with the New York law firm of Coudert Brothers. Their engagement has been announced by the future bride's mother, Mrs. Falk Toerge of New York and Pinehurst, N.C.

title: Unbeaten Amherst Routs Trinity, 407
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 10 After scoring four times in the opening seven minutes of play today, unbeaten Amherst rolled on to a 407 victory.

title: If at First You Do Succeed, Try, Try Again
description: THERE'S No Business Like Old Show Business could well be the theme song for today's Brdadway musicals. Take Gigi, for example. Beginning life as a tale by Colette, she soon toddled into a French film, then made her Broadway debut as a naughty but nice comedy, learned to kick up her heels and carry a tune as a Hollywood musical, andbeginning Tuesday at the Uriswill blossom forth as a bona fide Broadway musical.

title: A Work by a Comic Genius
description: The precocious Gioacchino oRssini composed his first opera in 1810 at the age of 18 iWthin a few years he was famous, and L'Itriliana in Algeri merely served additional notice that a great comic genius was at work.

title: Navy Bows To Tulane By 1715;
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 10 (AP)Steve Foley threw two touchdown passes in the first three minutes and Tulane held on for a 1715 victory over Navy tonight. David Falgoust's 41yard field goal in the third quarter made the difference. A fashmam, Martin Mitchell, st up Tulane's first score with a 91yard kickoff return.

title: Elie Nadelman
description: Lincoln Kirstein is wellknown to the world at large as the founding director of the New York City Ballet, and he is also known to several smaller, overlapping specialized publics for his writings on dance, photography, painting, and sculpture, and for his book of poems, Rhymes of a Pfc, which W. H. Auden characterized as the most convincing, moving and impressive book about World War II he had read. An early novel is known to an even tinier public, and those with unforgiving memories will recall that in his youth Mr. Kirstein also founded and edited The Hound and Horn, one of the best literary journals ever published in this country, which he sadly permitted to out of business.

title: Dance: Ballet in Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 10  The Boston Ballet last night embarked on its 10th anniversary season at the Music Hall here. Under the direction of E. Virginia Williams this has grown from a group of 12 dancers to a company of nearly 40, and has established itself as one of the leading companies on the East Coast. This is the more remarkable when it is remembered that Boston is not nowadays, particularly hospitable to culture, and does not even support a resident theater company.

title: Cavaliers Fall, 10090, To Knicks
description: One good quarter of team basketball was enough to compensate for some continuing dreary play by the Knicks last night as they achieved a much desired victory, 10090, over the Cleveland Cavaliers, a perpetual victim, at Madison Square Garden,

title: Letters
description: Praise ye their names

title: Ford's Philosophy on Major Political Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10Following are some of the observations Made on various issues over the years by Gerald R. Ford, the nominee for Vice President:

title: Lindsay Also Cuts Back Top Speed Here
description: Governor Rockefeller ordered the immediate reduction yesterday of legal speed limits on all state highways and perkways to 50 miles an hour in keeping with President Nixon's plan to conserve, fuel.

title: Marguerite L. Brooks Is Married
description: WASHINGTON, Conn., Nov. 10Miss Marguerite Laura Brooks and James Earl Barnes were married here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church by the Rev. David F. Gurniak.

title: Paperbacks
description: ALL CREATURES GREAT AND SMALL, by James Herriot. (Bantam, $1.75.) A Yorkshire veterinarian rolls back his memories some 40 years, when he was starting his practice: welltold yarns, sharplyetched character sketches make this a happy book about a cleaner, simpler time and place.

title: Environmentalists Conderned Over. Steady Deterioration of State's Open Spaces
description: TRENTONAlthough New Jersey is the most urbanized state in the country, many leading conservationists contend that its parks include some of the nation's most beautiful woodlands and streams.

title: Behind the immolation in Boston
description: Twentytwoyearold Veronica, lanky and lightskinned, raised on Chicago's South Side by a white mother and a black father, is a ghettowise college dropout who works in a Boston youth center where teenagers found guilty of felonies are sent as an alternative to prison. She was on the job on Oct. 4 after missing a day, and one of the kids asked:

title: Lawrenceville Passing Crushes The Hill, 436
description: LAWRENCEVILLE, N. J. Nov. 10  Lawrenceville's tailback, Scott Coolidge, and its wingback, John Henningsgaard, passed for total of 225 yards today in a 436 victory over The Hill. Lawrenceville leads in the series with 40 victories, 18 losses and 11 ties.

title: 32 Study for the Catholic Diaconate
description: WAYNEAt 28, Timothy Lawless of Schooleys Mountain is the father of five children. Each day, he commutes a total of 120 miles to his job as an accountant with the General. Electrin Company in New York City.

title: An Opera With Strings Attached
description: On a pleasant weekend, just 200 years ago, Franz Joseph Haydn was a busy man. The Empress Maria Theresa of Austria was visiting at the palace of Prince Esterhazy, and Herr Kappelmeister had to conduct his opera L'Infedelta Delusa for her, along with his freshly subtitled Maria Theresa Symphony,

title: Florida State Loses Ninth.
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Nov. 10 (UPI)  James Barber scored two touchdowns today as Virginia Tech overpowered Florida State, 3613. The Seminoles have lostnine straight games.

title: Japan and Europe
description: For all their common problems and aspirations, Japan add, Western Europe have a long way to go to overcome their years of mutual disinterest. Premier Tanaka last month was the first Japanese Premier in eleven years to make an official tour of Europe; an important task of lediscovery was thus begun. But once thoughts were collected back in Tokyo, it became clear how much the job remains to be done. In the words of the Far Eastern Economic Review, Mr. Tanaka found that it poisible to be given redcarpet treatment and the cold shoulder at the same time.

title: Brooklyn Man Sentenced To 12 Years on Drug Charges
description: William Beckwith, an associate of Frank Matthews, a major fugitive narcotics dealer, was sentenced Friday by Federal Judge Orrin G. Judd to 12 years in prison and fined $50,000 on his conviction of selling heroin and cocaine.

title: Study Finds Patrd Cars Do Little to Reduc Crime
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 10 The basic crimefighting tactic of all American police departmentsthe regular patrol of the Streets by uniformed men in marked cars  does not appear to prevent crime, according to the preliminary findings of an elaborate yearlong experiment here.

title: Applications Due March 1 For Murrow Fellowship
description: The deadline for submitting applications for the 197475 Edward R. Morrow Fellowship for American foreign comespondents is March 1, the Council on Foreign Relations, Inc., announced yesterday.

title: Katherine Gerosa Fiancee
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y. Nov. 10Mr. and Mrs. Francis X. Gerosa have announced the engagement of their daughter Miss Katherine Christine Gerosa, to Craig Patrick Flynn, son of Mr. and Mrs. James P. Flynn of Kensington, Md.

title: William Gaunt Weds Wendy Hilles
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Nov. 10 Miss Wendy Alston Hilles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. R. Webster Hilles, was married here this afternoon to William Lalor Gaunt, son of Mrs. Nelson Billington and the late William E. Gaunt. Both families are of Haverford.

title: Notes: London Is A Winter Festival
description: NEW YORK may be a summer festival, but London sees winter as a promising time to lure visitors. The British capital will initiate a monthlong London Entertains program in February, and for the occasion the city will be scrubbed, sandblasted and floodlighted, according to Sir Anthony Milward, chairman of the London Tourist Board. Unveiling his plans in New York recently, Sir Anthony said the cleanup program would extend even to Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square, a notorious perch for pigeons, and that the illumination project could make London the rival of Paris as a city of light.

title: New Disease Fatal to Elms Is Striking Warren Trees
description: TRENTON  The State's Department of Agriculture reports that a new disease deadly to elm trees has appeared in New Jersey for the first time.

title: Strip Curbs Called Endangered
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The sudden national awareness of an energy shortage generated this week by the warnings of Government officials, from the President down, may have undercut a Congressional effort to curb the environmental abuses of strip mining for coal, some proponents of the legislation said today.

title: the traveler's world
description: CAPULCO, Mexico  Nine months ago, in the middle of a 35acre plot near the southeasterly end of Costera Miguel Aleman, the wide boulevard that embraces magnificent Acapulco Bay, there was a big hole in the ground occupied only by some foundations and a small, very busy army of workmen. No one but the Mexican Government officials supervising the construction of Acapulco's Centro Cultural y de Convenciones would have bet a fig that nine months later the cultural center and convention hall would be ready to house its first meeting, the 43d World Travel Congress of the American Society of Travel Agents, late in October. Mariana, you know, Mexican time, always late.

title: ROBERT J. WARREN
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I., Nov. 10Robert James Warren, a vice president of the Long Island Savings Bank, died yesterday of a heart attack in Nassau Hospital, Mineola. He was 42 years old and lived at 78 West Maple Drive.

title: Education
description: CANTON, Mass.As almost anyone who ever attended high school will probably recall, the prospect of taking physics was terrifying. Studded with vectors and pulleys, friction coefficients, dynes, jawbreaking algebraic equations, the course was a rocky shoal over which even good students felt they could venture only at the risk of foundering with a B or C or worse.

title: Rockefeller and Aides Consider Bills to offer in '74
description: Governor Rockefeller and his chief aides, observing an Election Day tradition, took their first long look at the 1974 legislative session last week from the comforting vantage of the Governor's Pocantico Hills estate and reportedly eyed such potential issues as offshore drilling, stronger court administration and handgun controls.

title: Behind the laughs, a portrait of America rushing sideways
description: Art Buchwald's new book, I Never Danced at the White House, a collection of his most recent columns, will never adorn the bookshelves of the Oval Office, just as Buchwald himself will probably never twostep in the East Room. Although the book ranges over such subjects as Women's Lib, food prices, the detente with China, the McGovern debacle and sex, Buchwald reserves his most pungent satire for Vietnam and Watergate. Many of the more than 140 essays deal with those two issues and one senses that Buchwald is not just milking popular themes, but is sincerely outraged at the current Administration.

title: DEBATE SET OFF BY MASS KILLING
description: SANTA CRUZ, Calif., Nov. 10 The question of who should be confined in mental institutions in California was raised again this week by the trial of Edmund E. Kemper 3d, who was convicted by a jury of the brutal slayings of eight women In this oceanside community.

title: Robyn Humberstone Wed
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Nov. 10 Miss Robyn Gay Humberstone, daughter of Mrs. Gay Robinson of New York and Bruce Humberstone of Beverly Hills, was married here at noon today to Lindley Armstrong Jones, son of Mrs. Lindley Armstrong Jones and the late Spike Jones, the orchestra leader. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Kermit Castellanos in All Saints Episcopal Church.

title: Alice B. Leff Plans February Wedding
description: GREAT, NECK, L. I., Nov. 10Mr. and Mrs. Leo S. Leff have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alice Barbara Leff, to Alan. A. Rhein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray H. Rhein of Woodmere. A wedding in February is planned.

title: Gardens
description: THE amateur gardener can expect to receive at least one thing free of charge: advice. Don't bother to bring a lantana into the house, one florist told me last fall. They need a lot of sun. Besides, they have those pesky whiteflies and you can't get rid of them.

title: Publications for Philatelists
description: THE 197374 edition of the Harris catalogue covering stamps of the U.S., the U.N. and Canada is out and reports more than 2,500 price changes reflecting rising demand.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Peter van Greenaway's THE MEDUSA TOUCH (Stein & Day, $6.95) has a bit of everything. One part of it is a murder mystery. Another part is fantasy. There are elements of science fiction. There is psychology. There is an unflattering look at contemporary society in general. The prose is leisurely, cultivated, sophisticated. The Medusa Touch also happens to be one of the most. original books to come this way for a long time, and perhaps minor masterpiece might not be too strong a word.

title: Housing Proposal Disputed In Queens
description: Another housing controversy may be brewing in Queens:

title: A Formula for Expansion
description: When Matthias Seefelder takes command of BASF, A.G., next June, he will have little more than 10 years to double the sales volume of the giant West German chemical maker to roughly $8billion.

title: Enchanting another generation
description: The real America has been rediscoveredas it is every decade or so. To each new generation the revelation appears more significant than a mere cyclic happening. Now it is the old country furniture and its kinship crafts that are capturing the hearts of young Americans, of the nonscholars, of the novice collectorseven of the chic decorators. This time, their surging interest may reflect a more casual way of life, but even more a yearning for simpler times, more enduring values.

title: Sigma Delta Chi Awards
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 10 (UPI)Sigma Delta Chi, the professional journalism society, announced this week the opening of entries for its 42d annual distinguished service awards. The society offers 16 awards for notable performance in print and broadcast journalism in 1973. Entries must be received by Feb. 1, 1974. Entry blanks can be obtained by writing to Sigma Delta Chi at 35 East Wacker Drive, Chicago 60611.

title: Shortages of Oil
description: WASHINGTONThe energy shortage was officially accorded crisis status last week: The President spoke to the nation about it, soberly and at length; Congress lurched into a number of hearings on various proposals designed to ease the situation, and the lights at the Washington Monument were turned off at 10 P.M.

title: The Delectation of Masterpieces
description: GREAT painting makes us greedy  for more great painting! The delectation of masterpieces may not be all there is to the art experience, especially these days, but it nonetheless remains the indispensable constituent of that experience, the foundation upon which everything else rests. Nothing is easier to disparage, to feign boredom with, to put at a discount in the frantic search for novelty and facile transcendence. And at times, to be sure, it may offer a convenient refuge for the most pious and ritualistic response a refuge, that is, for people who are adept at simulating an emotion they are incapable of feeling. But that is all part of the comedy of culture, as familiar to the world of Moliere as to any observer of the bidding at ParkeBernet, and a matter

title: Brown Triumphs Over Cornell, 177
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Nov. 10 Brown's football team, earning a winning image this season under its new coach, John Anderson, beat Cornell, 177, today on Schoellkopf Field before 9,000 chilled fans.

title: Upstate Man Is Victor By Margin of One Vote
description: GRAND ISLAND, N.Y., Nov. 10 (UPI)  Voters who say that one vote does not matter in an election probably will not be able to convince the new Grand Island highway superintendent  or the man he beat by one vote in Tuesday's election.

title: Who Needs More Gas?
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10The craziest notion that has hit this country in a long whileand we've had quite a few nutty notions latelyis that shortages of gas, beef and a lot of other things are bad for the American people.

title: Other Energy Developments
description: Transitsystem officials in many cities fear that rationing of diesel oil may curtail bus service just as the loss of riders to the automobile is being reversed. Page 61.

title: FIREMEN SICK CALLS END IN MILWAUKEE
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 10 (AP)  Firemen ended their weeklong work slowdown today and agreed to submit their contract dispute with the city to an independent factfinding party.

title: A fanatical fictionist who lusts for accuracy
description: I think like a genius, I write like a distinguished author, and I speak like a child, says the author of these opinions. So it is that reporters from Life, Time, Vogue, Playboy; from The New York Times; from the Paris Review, Wisconsin Studies, Novel; from the B.B.C., Swiss Broadcast, Bayerischer Rundfunk, Channel 13, write out their questions to King Nab in his Montreux Palace and he answers them in writing (often receiving the interviewer personally as well). Nabokov is an incessant reviser, as a fanatical fictionist he lusts for accuracy. He must control his answers. Sometimes he even adds questions of his own to the interviewer's. (And sometimes his answers to different questions are verbatim duplications.)

title: The Economics of Thanksgiving
description: CUMBACK, Ind.  From early May until midNovember every year Merle Lucas' life is for the birdsliterally.

title: Coming Down the Mountain where Coyotes Roam and the Apaches Skion Indian Time
description: THERE are a lot of wisecracks about Arizona's skiing. At the state's newest ski resort, which is on the Fort Apache Indian Reservation, they say you'll rip your ski pants on cacti sticking out of the snow and pass, tribal medicine men doing snow dances on the trails, Hardly. But what you will see are longhaired, wildeyed, whooping Apaches skiing fiercely down the slopes. They are skiing on their own mountain, on their own land, and if the white man buys a lift ticket he can ski there, too.

title: Cimeroon Seeking Relationship of Equals With France

description: Tomorrow night's game on national television will show the football fans a rare bird, a quarterback who runs intentionally and effectively. He is Bobby Dough, of the Chicago Bears, who stands 6feet 3inches, weighs 218 pounds and is tough.

description: The Fire Department has warned against the hoarding of gasoline by private individuals, pointing out that the practice was both illegal and highly dangerous. Is said there was increasing evidence that some New Yorkers were resorting to it because of widely, publicized fuel shortages.

title: Space: New Comet, Dim Now, to Be Awesome Sight
description: For residents of the metropolitan area with powerful binoculars, a clear view to the east and the will power to be up at 5:30 A.M., the comet Kahoutek has made its debut as a dim hint of the spectacle to come.

title: Letters: A Torch Might Have Saved The Arctic Whales
description: To the Editor: Regarding the story about the whalecapturing expedition (Chronicle of an Arctic Whale Hunt by Bill O'Hallaren, Travel Section, Oct. 28), I was amazed that not a single person on the sceneamong the members of the project, among the townspeople or among the Indians on hand when the polar bear attackedseemed to be aware of the one universal fear that exists among all land animals: the fear of fire.

title: Nixon Is Urged to Save Fuel by Staying Home
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)Two New Englanders suggested today that President Nixon should stop flying his jet to vacation homes in Florida and California to help conserve fuel.

title: Bridge
description: Pessimists are rarely successful at the bridge table. Their attitude damages their partners' morale and improves their opponents'. If you think the worst will happen, it probably will.

title: Soviet Legislature to Meet
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 10 (Reuters) A meeting of the. Supreme Soviet, the country's highest legislative body, is to open here on Dec. 12, the Soviet news agency Tass reported today. The December session of the Soviet parliament, normally lasting a few days, reviews the fulfillment of economic plans and approves budgetary? provisions for the coming year.

title: Ocean's Democrats Rolling Up Sleeves
description: TOMS RIVER  Ocean County Democrats, finding muscle for virtually the first time this century, are planrung new programs to consolidate their gains.

title: Two women poets: one old, one new
description: Jean Garrigue, the distinguished American poet who died last winter at the age of 58, was a civilized gentlewoman. She yearned, throughout her life and work, for order, reason, love. Her themes, she once said, were the dialogue of self with soul and the quarrel with the world. But she was also a master of evoking scenery, from large landscapes to tiny gardens, and the life of other sentient beings, from the inhabitants of cafes and plazas to the inhabitants of lonely rooms. Her personal style, informal yet lyrical and romantic, a constant over her six books of poems culminating in Canntry Without Maps (1964) and New and Selected Poems (1967), adhered to no school and was not influential. She merely sought, as she puts it in her final book, The true and single goverment/Of the anthology of forms, and could make her readers believe that such a thing existed because she believed it herself.

title: Samoans Turn Down New Constitution
description: Voters in the Territory American Samoa have rejecter a new constitution that would have allowed local election of their Governor and Lieutenant Governor in 1974, a first step toward independence.

title: At the Center of The World Based on Papago and Pima Myths. By Betty Baker. Illustrated by Murray Tinkman. 53 pp. New York: Macmillan. $4.95. (Ages 9 to 12)
description: The great themes of American Indian mythology are typically laid out in smallscale adventure tales, anecdotes, or beast fables. A common example, recurring in North and South America, is the story of the carrioneating buzzard who withholds from man the key to future life. Coyote, the robber of graves, plays a similar role in myths of the Plains and Rockies. From him men learn to hunt, plant and prepare food. In another widespread story the transition from want to plenty is symbolized by a brimming pot, magically inexhaustible. Stories of mystery and adventure tell of sexual miscreants transformed into bears, of social parasites who become monsters.

title: Mrs. Sarah R. Ross Is Remarried
description: RYE, N. Y., Nov. 10Mrs. Sarah Richardson Ross of New Canaan, Conn, was Married here this noon to Richard B. Hayes of Princeton and Mantaloking, N. J. The Rev. Joseph P. Bishop performed the ceremony in the Rye Presbyterian Church.

title: Six Favorite Ski Trails in the Northeast
description: MY assignment was to pick the six best ski trails in the Northeast. Naming the best of anythingbest dressed, best actress, best peacemakeris a chancy business. And picking the best ski trails is almost a lost cause before it's begun. How do you define a best trail? Is it the most difficult? The best engineered? Fastest? Smoothest? Prettiest? Is it best for experts or best for beginners?

title: Take Care In Buying A Puppy
description: With the holiday season approaching, many parents will be thinking about buying a puppy as a Christmas gift. Too often, this is done haphazardly. Rather it should be a wellplanned project, undertaken only after much advance thought. The animal is not just another commodity. It is going to require care and attention. A parent should be certain he's buying a pup the child will be able to handle, also when the animal matures. Too often the cuddly Christmas pup turns up, unwanted, in the local humane society, if he's lucky, or worse, if not.

title: Justice Douglas
description: WASHINGTON  The crisis in which Americans are living has made them more conscious of one of the great curiosities of their constitutional system. It is a demo_ cratic and highly political system, with elections frequent enough to seem almost continuous. But it entrusts many ultimate decisions to an institution of an entirely different nature and rhythm: the Federal judiciary, with its members appointed for life and very often serving through many political generations.

title: When the Mandate of Heaven Has Been Lost...
description: PIPERSVILLE, Pa.I was wrong. Last June I wrote an essay on Watergate in which I spoke of President Nixon with the sympathy and restraint owed by any citizen of a democracy to the President. I reached three conclusion's: (1) He seemed not to have committed any one specific criminal act for which he could be impeached. (2) It would be against his character for him to resign. (3) We would therefore have him with us as our President for another fortytwo months, a chastened but not a crippled leader.

It's a little difficult to figure out why she isn't a bigger star than she is.

title: What's Doing in MADRID
description: PRICESThis is what is really happening in Madrid. The inflation is what is known as galloping, and visitors who may have been here last year will find most things up by at least 10 per cent. Inflation is so bad (1.6 per cent in August alone) that the Government finally froze prices until the end of the year for a lengthy Iist of goods and services, including restaurants. But food prices are still climbing. Starting in January, de luxe hotels will be freed from all controls and a big jump can be expected. What makes the situation tolerable to some extent is that the rest of Europe is suffer. ing from the same disease, if not quite so acutely, as is the United States.

title: HELLO, FAREWELL BY NAGRIN GROUP
description: Hello, Farewell, Hello, struck a satisfying and confident balance between improvisation and preconceived structure. It was improvised within clearly thoughtout guidelines. Daniel Nagrrn and the Workgroup performed the piece Friday evening at New York University's Loeb Student Center.

The leader of. the expedition, Zbigniew Jaworowsld, said that the pollutionfound mainly in layers of ice that had accumulated along the peakswas visible.

What is more important to Messing is that he will miss the chance of going to Israel with the United States national team because his right knee was operated on last Tuesday and he can hardly walk.

title: Learning about sex, sin and guilt
description: It is hard to remember that one must learn the connection between the facts of reproduction and one's own eroticism (what have eggs to do with feelings?), as one must learn the connections between sex and sin and guilt. title: SKYLAB'S REPAIRS BEHIND SCHEDULE
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 10Work to replace defective tail fins on the Saturn rocket for Skylab 3 continued to run behind schedule today, but space officials remained hopeful that the mission could be launched next Thursday.

title: Balanchine & Co.
description: The New York City Ballet and I are celebrating, some anniversaries this fall. Forty years ago, George Balanchine arrived in this country, at the behest of Lincoln Kirstein, to found American classicism. Twentyfive years ago, a highbrow subscription organization called the Ballet Society (George Balanchine, artistic director; Leon Barzin, musical director; Lincoln Kirstein, secretary) became the New York City Ballet, a resident of the cozily gaudy City Center Auditorium on West 55th Street. Ten years ago, the Ford Foundation made an unprecedented grant to ballet, and out of $7.6million, almost $6million went to the New York City Ballet and its affiliate, the School of American Ballet.

title: Lone Bull's Horse Raid
description: When that strange beast which neighed and ran like the wind sand could bear men was first traded into the northern American plains by the Shoshoni Indians around the turn of the 18th century, the relations between the tribes living there Blackfoot, Assiniboin, Cheyenne, Gros Ventre, Crow and Siouxchanged dramatically. Buffalo could be shot from horseback instead of having to be chased over cliffs in chancy, organized drives. Tipis could be loftier, for now horses and not dogs dragged their poles. Life was richer and wealth was tallied in mounts. With guns and beads came leisure and refinement of high costume art. And then, most importantly, flowered the warrior etiquette of intertribal feuding, with horses and scalps and war honors as principal booty.

One of these is Wallington, a squaremile borough at the western end of Bergen County and hard by the Passaic River. The residents, 80 per cent of them of Polish heritage, freely admit that their town is old, Wallington but they defend their ness to change and point out that our patriotism is unmatched anywhere and we, don't have the local arguments that other towns do. Most people here will talk about their accomplishments in terms of their own lives and the ways in which they maintain their houses and

title: Jesse Hart Rosdail Has Visited 143 of the World's 147 Countries
description: JESSE HART ROSDAIL, a 59year;old fifthgrade schoolteacher from Elmhurst, Ill., spent two years trying to set foot on Tristan da Cunha, a windswept hunk of desolate volcanic rock in the middle of the South Atlantic. In pursuit of his objective he wrote entreaties to Britain's Foreign and Commonwealth Office in London and sent cables to Tristan's Administrator and other government officials. None of the persons Rosdail contacted responded enthusiastically about his proposed trip to Tristan because, unlike the island's usual visitors, who are mostly government agents, Rosdail could be of no particular service to its 260 inhabitants, even though he had his own special reason for wanting to see the place. Eventually, however, he was granted grudging permission to visit Tristan if he could get a berth on the R.S.A., a supply ship that plods to the island once a year from Capetown, South Africa, 1,800 miles away. There were more hassles, but finally Rosdail arranged passage last summer. It was a week before the little ship sighted Tristan, and then a storm forced her to stand off its leeward shore for four days. When the sea calmed and the vessel put into harbor, no one was more elated than Rodail.

Indeed, it was precisely in the younger Americans that I placed my hopes for a renewed commitment to the serious stage, suggesting that they had the potential to provide the theater with the values it needed survive.

title: Music
The vilest of blackguards is back
description: When Winston Churchill was reappointed First Lord of the Admiralty after years in the political wilderness, a signal was sent throughout the Fleet which read simply, Winston's back. And the best news is that Harry Paget Flashman, V.C., K.C.B., K.C.I.E., Chevalier, Legion of Honour, U.S. Medal of Honor and San Serafino Order of Purity and Truth, 4th Class. all honors thoroughly undeserved except perhaps for the order of his purityis, in the fourth installment of his improbable adventures, more loathsome than ever.

More likely we are thinking of a milieu at present seemingly awash in West German, Japanese and Australian currency, not to mention greenbackswhose central figures are persons who buy, sell, collect, display, discuss and publicize art. Most particularly, this year, persons who buy, sell and collect. It was not always thus.

title: Photography

Yet these few photographs are so well integrated into the show that a new dimension of understanding results.

title: Delaware Water Gap: A Recreation Area For All Seasons
description: NEW JERSEY is not particularly renowned for its natural beauty or wideopen spaces. True, there is a celebrated swamp in the north, which some politicians wanted to convert into a jetport, and there are the Pine Barrens in the south, which other politicians hoped to transform into a similar facility. But otherwise the pickings are so lean that not long ago a writer on the OpEd page of The Times drew up a tongueincheek list of the state's outstanding features and included Camden, Perth Amboy, the Cheesequake exit on the Garden State Parkway, trafficjammed U.S. 22 at Union and the dumpfringed old Paterson Plank Road.

But not even Mis Horne could drag this revival out of the doldrums.

They are members of the Entomological Society of America's eastern branch who spend most of their days as college professors, research specialists, cooperative extension staffers or industrial advisers.

title: Alas, Poor Molly, We Do Her Knell
description: THERE are some parts that can't be acted, they've got to be played by forces of nature. The late Gertrude Berg was such a forceperhaps Sara Allgood was another, if you want to shift the ethnic ground slightly  and when Miss Berg created, for radio and television purposes, the meddlesome, mettlesome, mountainfast Molly Goldberg, she wasn't so much imagining a character that could go without her as she was forcing the universe to conform to her own untidy, yet altogether invincible, shape. Thus she still holds some sort of celestial copyright on the role, and woe betide the adventuress who tries to climb into her corner without sporting her precise fighting weight.

title: Country Music Marches On
description: CALDWELLCountry music which has invaded the New York metropolitan area via Station WHN, has reached still another local front: The community concert series.

title: Police Arrest 3 in Bronx Narcotics Raid an
description: Acting on a complaint by a Bronx landlord, police officers staked out an apartment, surprised its three occupants in a raid, and recovered seven pounds of cocaine and six ounces of heroin, Bronx District Attorney Mario Merola disclosed yesterday.

title: Advertising: A Spritely Standby
description: Having spent one's youth taking clandestine peeks at National Geographic in the school Iibrary, one finds a visit to the magazine's New York advertising sales headquarters a bit disappointing. Everyone was fully clothed and not a single salesman carried a spear.

title: Western Visitors Sense the Charm of a Desert Fair in India
description: PUSHKAR, India, Nov. 11 At dusk, a vast pilgrimage of Rajasthani men and women climbed from this sacred valley town over the tawny sand dunes and paths of Serpent Mountain. The dusty villages, silent for nearly a week, began filling up.

title: 2 U.S. Officials Foresee Gasoline Rationing Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton said today that the odds are better than 5050 that the Federal Government would institute gasoline rationing within the next two or three months.

title: Israel Appeals to Red Cross
description: GENEVA, Nov. II (Reuters) The allSwiss International Committee of the Red Cross said today that it had received a complaint from Israel, charging that the Syrians had killed 28 Israeli prisoners of war. A spokesman said the complaint had been passed to Syria for comment. The Red Cross, he added, did not investigate such cases. That was up to the Government concerned, he said.

title: HOSPITAL PAY RISE CUT TO 6% BY US.; STRIKE END SEEN
description: The advisory committee of the Federal Cost of Living Council yesterday issued its salary recommendations in the weeklong strike at 48 voluntary hospitals and nursing homes here, and the union's leadership voted overwhelmingly last night to approve the recommended raise.

title: Chrysler Workers to Return
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 11 (UPI)Employes of the Chrysler truck assembly plant in Fenton, Mo are to return to work tomorrow, now that members of United Auto Workers Local 110 have ratified a local agreement to end a 16day strike. Agreement with the 3,500member local was reached during an allnight negotiating session. A membership meeting yesterday approved the contract, 308243.

title: Private U. S. Loans In Chile Up Sharply
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 11There has been a dramatic turnaround in the availability of private United States bank loans for Chile in the wake of the overthrow of the Marxist coalition government by a military coup last September.

title: Ban on Marx Scrap Book Lifted in Penthouse Case
description: Penthouse magazine reported last night that a temporary injunction to keep it from distributing its December issue was lifted yesterday by Justice Theodore R. Kupferman of the Appellate Division, State Supreme Court.

title: TWO SIDES CONFER BUT DO NOT AGREE
description: ON THE CAIROSUEZ HIGHWAY, Egypt, Nov. 11Egypt and Israel were unable to agree in two bargaining sessions on the first steps toward carrying out the ceasefire agreement they signed today.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Texas Bank Is Thriving on Local Color
description: RIO VISTA, Tex., Nov. 11  While many smalltown bankers are bemoaning the decline in depositors, Lowell Smith Jr. is looking forward to about $4million in new business in 1974. That's not bad for a bank in a rural community of only 400 inhabitants, especially when current deposits top $19million mark.

title: Action on Mr. Ford
description: The issue of the Presidential succession becomes more urgent as Mr. Nixon's authority diminishes daily in the face of even more unanswered questions about his conduct in office. The continuity of government is clearly the paramount concern as Congress considers the nomination of Representative Gerald Ford to the VicePresidency. Swift and singleminded attention to the filling of that glaring vacancy is inseparable from governmental stability.

title: Catholic Churchgoing Still Declining
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 11 Weekly church attendance by Roman Catholics continued to decline in the last year, according to a new survey. The decline was concentrated among Catholics over 30 years old and especially among those over 50.

title: Nixon Schedules Briefings For G.O.P. Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 President Nixon plans to meet this week with all 234 Republicans in Congress and answer all their questions on Watergate and related matters.

title: Sparing America the Anguish
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska  When you destroy hope, you destroy a nation. Yet more and more of our people are hopeless. And in their hopelessness they are turning inward. This is a real danger. We all know where a nation can go, as Germany did, if it follows the hollow eyes of hate.

title: Jurors Are Chosen To Select Winners Of '73 Book Awards
description: The names of jurors who will Choose winners of the 25th annual National Book Awards were announced yesterday by Roger L. Stevens, chairmen of the National Book Committee, Inc., which sponsors the awards.

title: Egypt Looks to Inventive Rebuilding
description: CAIRO, Nov. 11  Hopeful that peace with Israel is not a mirage, Egypt's planners and builders are drafting ambitious projects for reconstruction of the warruined cities along the Suez Canal, for the reopening and deepening of the 100milelong waterway and for related, development of farming, mineral and tourism resources of the Sinai Peninsula.

title: New Life for Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
description: WEST SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 11Before Cat on a Hot Tin Roof opened on Broadway in 1955, Tennessee Williams rewrote the third act on the recommendation of his director, Elia Kazan. Although the play won both the Pulitzer Prize and the New York Drama Critics Circle award as Best American Play, Williams always had reservations about his rewrite.

title: Pope Expresses Anguish Over Defections of Pries
description: ROME, Nov. 11Pope Pau VI during the last few days has repeatedly expressed his an push over the defections from the Roman Catholic preisthood and the conduct of some other priests.

title: Reform Jews Reclaiming Tradition They Once Rejected
Cowboys Down Aroused Giants, 2310
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 11 The New York Giants are not dead. They are not alive and well yet either, but they are stirring again, even after. dropping their seventh straight game, 2310, today to the Dana's Cowboys.

title: Paula Neustat Wed To Julian Alan Gold
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 11Miss Paula Sherry Nelistat of New York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Solomon Nestat, was married here dig afternoon to Julian Alan Gold, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Gold of Forest Hills, Queens. Rabbis Theodore S. Ross, grandfather of the bridegroom, and Erwin Zimet performed the ceremony at Temple BethEL.

title: TIBOR PAUL DEAD; OPERA CONDUCTOR
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Tibor Paul, Hungariianborn conductor, died today after a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Issue and Debate
description: The City University of New York recently became the country's first major institution of higher learning to impose a form of numerical restraint on the proportion of faculty members who may be granted tenure.

title: Nets Down Spurs, End Loss Streak
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 11The. New =York Nett, using John Williamson as a starter in tele backcourt for the first time this season snapped a ninegame losing streak tonight by defeating the San Antonio Spurs, 106 94, in the American Basketballs Assogiation.

title: INDIANA BANK BID CHALLENGES FED
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 11An Indiana bank holding company's application to the Federal Reserve Board to buy an Arizona savings and loan essociation has caused a dispute between banks and S. & L. groups.

title: Beatrice Calls Off Plan On Londontown Merger
description: A top official of Londontown Manufacturing said yesterday that Beatrice Foods had called off a proposed merger with the rainwearproducing concern because of a decadeold problem in accounting.

title: Gunmen in Irish Republic And Ulster Wound 4 Men
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 11 (AP)Four persons were shot by terrorists in Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic today.

title: STEADY OIL FLOW CONTINUES IN IRAN
description: TEHERAN  By continuing full production and export of oil while other Middle East countries are reducing output and instituting selective embargoes, Iran is becoming increasingly important in the eyes of petroleum consuming nations.

title: MILTON R. WEIR, 75, THEATRICAL LAWYER
description: Milton R. Weir, a lawyer who specialized in theater cases, representing managers and producers, died Friday in the Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived here.

title: DR. ISADORE E. COOPER
description: Dr. Isadore E. Cooper of 35 Caldera Place, Randall Manor, S.I., an internist, who retired several years ago, died here yesterday.

title: New Books
description: Advancing Paul Newman by Eleanor Bergstein (Viking Press, $7.95) Two women during the nineteensixties.

title: Nixon Schedules Briefings For G.O.P. Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 President Nixon plans to meet this week with all 234 Republicans in Congress and answer all their questions on Watergate and related matters.

title: Newark's Housing Worst, 30City Survey Concludes
description: NEWARK, Nov. 11HousinE in Newark was rated the worst and the best was found it San Jose, Calif., according to a 30city survey whose results. were announced over the week. end. New York City ranked high in some of the five categories of the survey data, and low in others.

title: A Sesame St. for Adults On Health Care Tested
description: The nonprofit Children's Television Workshop has rectived $7million in grants to produce next fall a healthinformation series for adults based on the same educationpldentertainment technique used successfully in Sesame Street and Electric Company.

title: Pop Music: Dory Previn Still Growing
description: Dory Previn's previous New York appearance was at Carnegie Hall, but for three days last week she appeared at the Bitter End, Bleecker Street. The smaller premises allowed her admirersthe place was packed continuously  more intimacy to observe her substantial and growing talent.

title: Gilbert Takes 5Shot Lead in World Golf on 70280
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Nov. 11 (AP)Gibby Gilbert, who has led or shared the lead all the way, clipped one stroke off par with a 70 and pulled away to a fivestroke lead today after four rounds of the $500,000 World open golf tournament.

title: 3Day Negotiations Leave the Israelis Breathless, Wary
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 11 The ceasefire accord signed near Suez today is the culmination of 72 hours of intensive negotiations that left officials here breathless at the pace of Secretary of State Kissinger's diplomacy, deeply suspicious of Egyptian motives and, at the same time, cautiously hopeful about the future.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Rangers Beat Islanders As Gilbert Sets Record
description: As Rod Gilbert put it, the New York Rangers are beginning to gel again, playing the way we're supposed to.

title: Catholic Protests Mount in Spain Against Special Jail for Priests
description: MADRID, Nov. 11A protest movement is growing within the Spanish Roman Catholic Church against the maintenance of a special prison for priests convicted of political crimes.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ROSELLE, Nov. 11It was in 1957 that a group of track coaches and officials, concerned about the low state of the sport in New Jersey Catholic high schools, met in Bayonne to do something about it. The result was the formation of the New Jersey Catholic Track Conference.

title: Student Dies in Plunge
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 11 (AP)William Markussen, 20 years old, of Belmont, died yesterday after falling 15 floors through an open elevator shaft in a University of Massachusetts dormitory, a university spokesman said today. A Northeastern University student he had been visiting the Amherst campus.

title: Sports News Briers
description: Conquistadors May Leave Home

title: Red Smith
description: With shrewish insistence, the words of a great man keep crowding back into mind, demanding to be printed. It does no good to protest that they do not seem to fit comfortably in a sports page among accounts of children's games. A small voice insists that the speaker was a fine wrestler as well as a wise man, and wrestling is a sport, isn't it? So all right, what the man said was: While the people retain their virtue and vigilance, no administration, by any extreme of wickedness or folly, can very seriously injure the government in the short space of four years. The optimist who said it was named Lincoln and the occasion was his first inaugural address March 4, 1861.

title: The Dance
description: What have Patsy Kelly and Margot Fonteyn got in common? Well they both appeared in Aurora's Wedding at the City Center 55th Street Theater last night, as part of a gala performance to benefit the National Ballet of Washington. Miss Kelly was making her debut in classic ballet. Dame Margot was not.

title: Major Bills In Congress
description: War PowersLimits the President's power to commit troops to combat in foreign countries to 60 days without Congressional approval.

title: A THEORY OF LIFE ON JUPITER GAINS
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 11 (UPI)  Discovery of rodshaped bacteria in an isolated alkaline spring gives new support to a theory that life may exist on Jupiter, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today.

title: Highway Police Take Wind Out of a Dutchman's Sails
description: THE HAGUE, Nov. 11 (UPI) Motorists stayed off the roads of the Netherlands today for the second Sunday in a row, but at least one man found a way of getting around the Government's fuelsaving ban on Sunday driving. So he thought.

title: PARAMUS BECOMES 2CAR LOT SCHOOL
description: PARAMUS, Nov. 11  The Paramus Public High School recently had to open a second parking lot to accommodate the overflow of cars. In nearby Wayne, cars from a high school often end up parked in a shopping center across the way because the school's own lot is too crowded.

title: DuryeaRockefeller Rift Wider
description: Now that the mayoral race is history and the gubernatorial contest is about to begm, one of the juicier feuds in town is taking on increasmg significance. Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea, the Legislature's top Republican, has been enlivening some cocktail parties with his charges that GovCity ernor Rockefeller Hall is trying to do Notes him in. What has Mr, Duryea fuming is the investigation of a bogus Liberal party committee that was set up with the goal of aiding Republican Assembly candidates last year by encouraging Liberal candidates and thus siphoning votes from Democrats. Several Duryea aides were allegedly involved in the New York version of dirty tricks.

title: Citizens' Panel Lauds PoliceProductivity Effort
description: The Lindsay administration's effort to improve police productivity in the last two years by creating anticrime units, increasing the number of auxiliary policemen and streamlining arrest procedures has significantly contributed to the wellbeing of many New Yorkers, according to the Citizens Budget Commission.

title: PERRY SMITH, 74, ARCHITECT, DEAD
description: Perry Coke Smith, the retired New York architect whose major works included the home office of the Irving Trust Company here, died Saturday in Sarasota, Fla. He was 74 years old and lived in Longboat Key, fla.

title: Opera: Rossini's L'Italiana in Algeri Is Revived at the Met
description: L'ITALIANA IN ALGERI, opera in two acts with music by Gioacchino Rossini and libretto by A. Anelli. New production by the Metropolitan Opera. Design of sets and costumes and stage direction by JeanPierre Ponnelle. Conducted by Gabor Otvos.

title: Ripon Proposes Restraint On Secrecy in Government
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 11 (UPI)The Ripon Society proposed legislation today designed to eliminate the use of official secrecy, justified by national security, as a weapon in public policy debate.

title: MRS. MEIR BITTER AT EUROPE'S MOVE
description: LONDON, Nov. 11Premier Golda Meir today told a meeting of world Socialist leaders, including eight other heads of government, that she deplored the lack of support Israel received from the European Economic Community in the Middle East crisis.

title: A CABARET DEC. 14 TO HONOR LAIDSAY
description: More than 7,500 New Yorkers have been invited to attend a cabaret and dance on Dec. 14 to honor Mayor Lindsay and help him pay off $100,000 in debts from his unsuccessful campaign last year to win the Democratic nomination for President.

title: Surgeon Scrubs Hospital Floor
description: With a ship tattoo on his right arm and an unlit cigarette in his mouth, a short, wiry man in blue jeans and a cotton Tshirt mopped his way, like a dirtchasing dervish, into and out of patients rooms and up and down corridors at University Hospital yesterday.

title: Sisco in Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 11  Assistant Secretary of State Joseph J. Sisco arrived here this afternoon from Beirut, Lebanon, for talks with Italian Government leaders.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Woodcock in Line for Prosecutor Post

title: Lawyers Cast Doubt on Admissibility of the Watergate Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Federal court hearings on the secret White House tapes have raised serious doubt among legal authorities that many of the tapes will ever be usable as evidence in Watergate criminal trials.

title: At 80, I. A. Richards Still Scales Mountains of the Mind
description: In his early years, I. A. Richards thought that elderly people were a nuisance. I may have been very nearly right, he said last week, with the mischievous wisdom of his 80 years.

title: Alouettes Beat Argonauts
description: TORONTO, Nov. 11 (Canadian Press)  The Montreal Alouettes scored 22 points in a 20minute overtime period today and defeated the Toronto Argonauts, 3210, in the Eastern Football Conference semifinal playoff.

title: Kinnelon Rallies to Save Ancient Butternut Tree
description: KINNELON, Nov. 11A poem may once have stayed the woodsman's ax, but it is taking more than a plea in quatrain today to save a butternut tree that stands lonely and vulnerable on a hillside in the outskirts of this Morris County community.

title: SportsBond Opponents Lobby in Trenton Today
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, Nov. 11Frank Gentle, a determined 30yearold school teacher, will go to Trenton tomorrow with a silverplated shovel to fight a proposed bill that is being backed by the Cahill administration and a large portion of the state's labor and business establishment.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: THE FOURSOME, a play by E. A. Whitehead, directed by Jacques Levy, with Matthew Cowles and Lindsay Crouse, at the Astor Place Theater, 434 Lafayette Street, 7.

title: Reform Judaism's Head
description: The mantle of leadership. for America's more than one million Reform Jews falls snugly and easily on the shoulders of Rabbi Alexander Moshe Schindler, new president of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations. Rabbi Schindler, who succeeds the late Rabbi Maurice N. Eisendrath to Reform Judaism's most influential and prestigious post, has served the congregational arm of the Reform movement for almost 15 years, first as a regional director and then as education director.

title: 2 U.S. Officials Foresee Gasoline Rationing Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton said today that the odds are better than 5050 that the Federal Government would institute gasoline rationing within the next two or three months.

title: INTEREST CONFLICT IN S.B.A. SUSPECTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)A House subcommittee said today that it had discovered serious problems in some offices of the Small Business Administration that might lead to criminal prosecution. A source said the problems involved a conflict of interest suspected in a few S.B.A. district offices.

title: F.B.I. to Open Secret Files, With Some Deletions, on Hiss, Chambers and the Rosenbergs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 The Federal Bureau of Investigation's secret files on Alger Hiss and Whittaker Chambers 53,000 pages long and holding, historians hope, some keys to the 25yearold debate over the innocence or guilt of Mr. Hiss  are about to become public.

title: DATES ADVANCED FOR HOLIDAY MAIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 Deadlines for the mailing of Christmas cards and packages have been moved up by the Postal Service from one to two weeks because of possible airflight cutbacks resulting from the energy shortage.

title: Guru's Followers Cheer Millennium in Festivities at Astrodome
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 11Maharaj Ji, the young Indian guru whose followers say he is god, talked about inner peace and accepted a golden swan in the Astrodome last night in the finale of what was billed as the most significant event in human history.

title: Paris Recalls 1918
description: PARIS, Nov. 11 (UPI) Marching soldiers and mounted guards participated in a small parade today marking the 55th anniversary of the World War I armistice.

title: 2 Slayings in 2 Boroughs Raise Query: Are Mafia Families Resuming Warfare?
description: A 60yearold gambler was discovered yesterday morning shot to death from very close range, his body slumped in the back seat of his blue Cadillac, which was parked on the west drive of Central Park near 97th Street.

title: President's StaffA Different Viewpoint
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11When demands for President Nixon's resignation were at their height a few days ago, a middlelevel White House aide pulled a visitor aside and expressed disbelief that any significant sector of the public could entertain the belief that Mr. Nixon should consider resigning. That was before Mr. Nixon's strong assertions that he would continue in office. The Presidential aide had no special knowledge of what was going on. He was simply expressing the predominant view from the White House which as usual was far different from the way the President's difficulties were perceived elsewhere.
