description: Lloyd's Electronics, Inc., a distributor of home radio, stereo and other electronic equipment, said yesterday that it had obtained a temporary restraining order against its chairman, Alvin Tanenbaum, enjoining him from interfering in any manner in the business of Lloyd's.

title: 35c Fare Is.Doomed, Governor Contends
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that he did not see any way to save the 35cent transit fare here and that anyone who said it could be saved was kidding the public.

title: ISRAEL STRESSES CONTROL OF ROAD
description: ON THE CAIROSUEZ ROAD, Egypt, Nov. 13Israeli forces today demonstrated that they retained control of the road leading to the city of Suez despite the two United Nations checkpoints that were set up yesterday.

title: Phillips Told to Divest Its Holdings in Tidewater
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13 (AP)  A Federal judge ordered the Phillips Petroleum Company today to divest itself of its holdings in the Tidewater Oil Company, ruling that Phillips's, acquisition of a Tidewater division seven years ago for $366million violated antitrust laws. United States District Judge Warren J. Ferguson directed Phillips to provide a plan for divestiture within 90 days. A Phillips spokesman called the decision erroneous and said the company would appeal to the Supreme Court.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Another 24hour extension, until 4 P.M. today, was agreed upon in negotiations aimed at averting a milk strike. The talks, between representatives of 3,000 workers and 120 dairies that distribute milk to retail stores in the city, continued at the Sheraton Inn at La Guardia Airport The contract expired at 4 P.M. Sunday, but members of the Metropolitan Dairy Institute and Local 584 of the Teamsters Union agreed to continue talks.

title: ALASKA PIPELINE VOTED BY SENATE; NIXON GETS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13In an atmosphere of crisis, the Senate approved the Alaska pipeline bill today and sent it to President Nixon. The vote was 86 to 5, and there was Only perfunctory debate.

title: Connecticut Tie Vote Resolved by NearTie
description: One vote made the difference last night in the runoff election for the post of First Selectman of Colebrook, in Connecticut's northwest corner.

title: Mortgage Bill Expected To Restore Bank Parity
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13  A bill to raise the interest ceiling on mortgages to 9.5 per cent, if passed by the Legislature, could put statechartered and federally chartered banks back on an equal footing in New Jersey.

title: Brifge: Two Partners Are Rivals For 1973 McKenney Trophy
description: A close race is in prospect for the 1973 McKenney Trophy, awarded to the player who wins most master points in a calendar year.

title: Nixon Meets 15 Senators; Watergate Doubts Remain
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 President Nixon met for more than two hours tonight with 15 Republican Senators and apparently persuaded most of them that he intended to tell everything that he knew about Watergate and allied scandals.

title: MOROCCO TO RAISE PRICE OF PHOSPHATE
description: The Moroccan office of phosphates said in Rabat yesterday that, beginning Jan. 1, the price of phosphate would be increased from its present level of $15 a ton to $48. Morocco is the world's biggest producer of the mineral, which is used in fertilizers. Output is estimated at some 16 million tons annually and Moroccan exports in 1973 represented 34 per cent of total world exports.

title: N.A.A.C.P. to Discuss Nixon
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13Roy Wilkins, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, said here today that the organization's board, having previously decided not to ask for the impeachment of President Nixon, now plans to take up the issue again.

title: SUFFOLK TO WEIGH AID FOR BUS LINE
description: HAUPPAUGE, L I., Nov. 13 The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N, Klein, said today that his administration would consider subsidizing privats bus companies and, in some cases, taking over entire bus routes to strengthen and expand the public transportstion system in the county.

title: A Bipartisan Administration
description: NEW HAVEN  Like a person, a nation may gain maturity and confidence from its torments, or decline into a chronic sickness of the spirit. Because of our preoccupation with Watergate, the tapes and other White House records, and impeachment, the country may easily lose sight of its major need, which is not merely to remove or even to convict particular officials guilty of wrongdoing, but to restore the supremacy of law and the spirit of constitutionality, and in so doing, rebuild among Americans a reasonable confidence that the Government mainly serves broader public purposes and not merely secret, private and partisan interests.

title: Pipeline Wins
description: Passage of the Alaska pipeline bill is the triumph of scare propaganda and economic pressure over reasoned public policy. The bill tears a gaping hole in the National Environmental Policy Act by barring court review of the environmental impact statement filed by the Interior Department to justify the pipeline. A project that cannot withstand orderly judicial examination is suspect from the start.

title: CITY RESISTS PACT WITH ITS FIREMEN
description: The city refused yesterday to accept the recommendations of an impasse panel for ending the firemen's contract dispute until the Cost of Living Council in Washington ruled on whether the settlement violated antiinflationary guidelines.

title: Skilled Trades Reject Pact at Ford
description: DETROIT, Nov. 13In an unusually bitter struggle over a contract ratification, the United Automobile Workers union announced today that its skilled tradesmen had refused to ratify a tentative agreement negotiated with the Ford Motor Company.

title: Family Tragedies Overwhelm Boy, A Suicide at 13
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 13 (AP)The first great blow in Gary Cohen's young life came three years ago, His mother died of cancer.

title: South Africa Tries 11 Apartheid Foes For Balking Inquiry
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 13Eleven leaders of organizations that oppose South Africa's policies of racial separation went on trial this week for refusing to testify before a secret Government investigating commission.

title: People and Business
description: Representative Wilbur Mills, back in his office for the first time since undergoing back surgery in August, said yesterday that trade legislation, delayed at the personal request of President Nixon in Mr. Mills's absence, should not be postponed any later than the week of Nov. 26, when Congress returns from its Thanksgiving recess.

title: IRAQ DISREGARDS ARAB OIL CUTBACK
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 13Iraq is disregarding the decision by Arab oil producers to cut back production 25 per cent and is shipping as much oil as she can through Mediterranean and Persian Gulf terminals, according to oilindustry sources.

title: Notes on People
description: Come New Year's and it will be farewell, Fun City, and hello, Golden Gate, for Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton, the heavyset, bearded, motorcycle  riding managerial artist of the expiring Lindsay administration. Mr. Hamilton will be heading out to California, to work with a consulting, firm in San Francisco and to teach courses in public finance, business and governmental expenditures at Stanford University in Palo Alto.

title: 17 Freed in Athens After Court Hears Of Police Beatings
description: ATHENS, Nov. 13  Seventeen. Greeks charged with rioting on Nov. 4 after a memorial service for the late Premier George Papandreou were set free tonight after a trial at which 11 defendants testified that they had been savagely beaten by the police.

title: City Data on Assessment Cuts Put on Books in Dollar Amount
description: The city made public yesterday the properties that were granted reductions of assessed valuations by the City Tax Commission for this year.

title: ADM. MORTON DEYO, LED NORMANDY UNIT
description: PORTSMOUTH, N. H., Nov. 13Vice Adm. Morton L. Deyo, who commanded gun support groups at the Normandy and Southern France landings in 1944, died Saturday in Portsmouth Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at Hookes Cove, Kittery Point, Me.

title: Knicks Topple Sonics
description: The Knicks just beat the best playground team in the National Basketball Association.

title: Archbishop Speaks Out For 113 Arrested in Spain
description: MADRID, Nov. 13  The Archbishop of Barcelona has openly intervened on the side of 113 opponents of the Spanish Government who were arrested Oct. 28 while meeting in a church building.

title: State Calls on Municipalities to Adopt Measures Cahill Ordered to Save Fuel
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov, 13The state's municipalities were urged today to adopt the same energyconserving measures Governor Cahill has ordered for state facilities.

title: On Eve of ear, the City Ballet Goes on Strike
description: About to perform for the gala opening of its 25th year, the New York City. Ballet was shut down last, night by the first strike of its dancers in the company's history. This is the fourth major strike against a cultural institution in the city this fall.

title: BRUNO MADERNA, CONDUCTOR, DEAD
description: Bruno Maderna, the Italian composer and conductor, died yesterday in a hospital at Darmstadt, West Germany, where he had lived for many years. He was 53 years old.

title: Study at Stanford Finds Coeds More Active in Sex Than Men
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)  Stanford University's coeds are more sexually experienced than their male counterparts, a study shows.

title: Louisiana Drilling Rigs Run Short of Diesel Oil
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. 14 (AP)The lack of diesel oil threatens to force a shutdown of oil well drilling rigs.

title: Soviet Warns Newsmen on Expulsion
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14  The Soviet press, which has been broadening its own coverage of American domestic problems, warned American correspondents in Moscow today that the, effort to improve SovietAmerican relations did not protect them from expulsion if the Soviet authorities disapproved of their coverage.

title: FORD IS CRITICIZED ON VOTING RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Representative Gerald R. Ford's conservative voting record on civil rights and other domestic issues came under attack today from his critics as the Senate Rules Committee neared a decision on whether to confirm him as Vice President.

title: Youth, 18, Convicted in Three Slayings
description: An impassive 18yearold Brooklyn youth, who was convicted yesterday in State Supreme Court in Queens of the slayings of three teenaged acquaintances calmly told the jury foreman, At least, you're all consistent.

title: Krogh Attorney Attacks Nixon Stand
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14A defense attorney in the Ellsberg breakin case declared today that the President has no right to order criminal activity. The comment was made by Norbert Schlei, an attorney for Egil Krogh Jr., the former White House aide who has been indicted for conspiracy and burglary here in connection with the breakin at the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist in September, 1971.

title: Yale Dramat Will Be Host To Undergraduate Festival
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 14The Yale Dramat today disclosed plans to revive a lapsed tradition by serving as host to a Yale Festival of Undergraduate Drama here, March 1517. The Dramat, a largely undergraduate theater group, has mailed some 200 invitations to college drama organizations across the country.

title: What's Larceny to One Is Strategy for Others
description: YONKERS, Nov. 14 I know there's no proof, the horseplayer said, cradling a 25cent beer in a bar across the street from Yonkers Raceway, but they're doin' it. Just watch, you'll see.

title: A Welfare Mother
description: BUBLINGTON, Vt.My husband is one of those who refused to join the Army during the Vietnam war. John is not a draft dodger, lie never made any attempt to run or hide from legal authorities in this country. On the contrary, he remained at home and worked steadily from the time of his initial refusal to join the Army (two and onehalf years ago) until he left for prison. His record was so good that the judge allowed him one week after sentencing to make arrangements for Eric (our son) and me before reporting to prison. It is obvions that John is not a dangerous person. It is inconceivable that any man who refuses to join the Army for moral reasons, knowing that a refusal means a prison sentence, could be considered dangerous. John refused to join the Army because he believes it is morally wrong to kill and wrong to be any part of an organization designed for the destruction of human lives.

title: Cranbury Bank Official Charged In a $220,000 Embezzlement
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14 (AP) The executive vice president of the First National Bank of Cranbury was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges he had embezzled nearly $220,000 in bank funds since 1968.

title: Response to New Bonds Good
description: New offerings continued to occupy the taxexempt and corporated bond markets yesterday. Underwriters again found good initial response to the new bonds and debentures.

title: Shot Psychiatrist Critical
description: BATTLE CREEK, Mich., Nov. 14 (UPI)Dr. James H. Snyder, a 58yearold psychiatrist, was in critical condition in Leila Hospital today after a patient allegedly shot him in his office at the Veterans Administration Hospital last night. The Federal Bureau of Investigation is investigating the incident because it occurred on Federal property. The bureau is holding a suspect, Isaac M. Armstrong. 24.

title: Price of Gold Drops
description: The price of gold plunged about $7 an ounce to about $90 on European free markets yesterday following the announcement Tuesday night by the United States and six European nations of the end of an agreement banning centralbank transactions in the privatesector bullion market. Page 67.

title: Snowmobile Safety Pushed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) Senator Claiborne Pell, Democrat of Rhode Island, today introduced a bill to establish nationwide safety standards for the manufacture and operation of snowmobiles. The bill would require persons operating snow machines on Federal lands to wear a helmet and travel at speeds no greater than 10 miles an hour.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Kidnappers in Munich Free Girl for $1.2Million Ransom
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Thursday, Nov. 15 (Reuters)The kidnaped daughter of a millionaire restaurant owner was freed early today after her father handed over $1.25million in ransom, the police said here.

title: More Federal Land Given To the States for Park Use
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) President Nixon announced today that 21 more parcels of Federal land in 13 states were being returned to the states and local communities for use as parks.

title: Business Briefs.
description: Donald E. Weeden, chairman of Weeden & Co., charged yesterday in remarks to a subcommittee of the Senate Banking Committee that New York Stock Exchange proposals on central market legislation were designed to preserve the status quo and block meaningful reform.

title: British Soccer
description: INTERNATIONAL MATCHES

title: ThalidomideCrippled Canadians Win Right to Sue for Damages in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14A Federal judge ruled today that Canadians could bring suit in Federal Court here against the New Jersey manufacturer of a thalidomide product that is alleged to have deformed their children.

title: SloanKettering Center Dedicated by Governor
description: Governor Rockefeller paid tribute to his brother Laurance yesterday, as he dedicated the new Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center, a 19story, $50million building that will continue a treatment and research tradition that began in 1884.

title: Nastase Tops Kreiss, 61, 61
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Nov. 14. (UPI)The topseeded players, Ilie Nastase of Rumania and Tom Okker of the Netherlands, advanced to the quarterfinals of the DeWar Cup indoor tennis tournament today.

title: Theater: Good Evening
description: I do not normally laugh in the theater. This is not because, like Queen Victoria, I am not amused, but because I do not wish to have backers watching me rather than the stage. After all, that first night may be their last chance to watch where their money went. Thus, while possibly a frothing caldron of ribald merriment inside, outside I am as cool as a frozen halibut with a head cold.

title: 500 Friends and Contributors Mark Anniversary of Journal of Ideas
description: About 500 friends of The New Leader, some of whom are not friends or coideologues of one another, came together yesterday to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the eclectic journal.

title: Army Secretary Discloses Plans for Nerve Gas Tests
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 14 (AP)  Secretary of the Army Howard H. Callaway said today the Army planned to test nerve gas in the open air, but no site had been chosen for the testing.

title: Saxbe and Kent State
description: The stilltentative promise by Assistant Attorney General J. Stanley Pottinger that the Justice Department may convene a Federal grand jury to hear evidence on the 1970 tragedy at Kent State University should swiftly be turned into a full commitment. The killing of four students and wounding of nine others by gunfire of Ohio National Guard men must not remain unfinished legal business.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: U.S. to Reduce Its Force In Taiwan to 6,000 Men
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 14 (UPI)United States troop strength on Taiwan will be cut by a third3,000 menbefore the end of the year, a military spokesman said today.

title: Mrs. Court Bombards King, Riggs
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 14 (AP)Mrs. Margaret Court steered several volleys today at Mrs. Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

title: SENATE VOTES BILL ON ALLOTTING FUEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The Senate passed and sent to, the White House today a bill requiring the President to allocate crude oil and refined petroleum products, including gasoline, in an effort to distribute fuels in short supply equitably.

title: U.S. and China Are Closer To Full Diplomatic Ties
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14Secretary of State Kissinger left China today after signing a joint communique that seemed to move Washington and Peking another step closer to the establishment of full diplomatic relations.

title: Two Library Aides Robbed, Raped by Book Borrower
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14, (UPI)Two women working behind the front counter at the South Side branch of the. Chicago Public Library were robbed and raped yesterday by a young man who had requested a book on philosophy, the police said.

title: Joe Greene in Hospital
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14 (UPI)  The Pittsburgh Steelers' defensive tackle, Joe Greene, was admitted to a hospital today with a back sprain, but was expected to be ready for Sunday's game here against the Denver Broncos.

title: Budget of $1Billion, Sought For First Time in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14 (Reuters) Mayor Richard J. Daley today proposed a budget of $1.053billionthe city's first billiondollar budget.

title: Caterpillar Talks Halted
description: PEORIA, III., Nov. 14 (AP)Talks between the United ?? Workers and the Caterpilla Tractor Company were recesse?? today, and the union said strike scheduled for noon to morrow would be carried out.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE HIMALAYAS. Photographs and commentary by Yoshikazu Shirakawa. Introductory essays by the King of Nepal, Arnold Toynbee, Sir Edmund Hillary. Historical text by Kyuya Fukada. 300 pages. Illustrated. Abrams, $75 through Dec. 31; $85 thereafter.

title: GRAND UNION GETS A BRITISH OFFER
description: The Grand Union Company, the nation's ninth largest supermarket chain, announced yesterday it had received a proposal from Cavenham, Ltd., for a cash tender offer for 51 per cent of the Grand Union common stock at $19 a share.

title: The New Federalism
description: Once upon a Presidency there was an approach to a method of govern ance called The New Federalism.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Taconic Deer Hunt Is Nigh
description: Once again, deer hunting will be allowed in Taconic State Park during the New York State Southern Zone season, which runs from Nov. 19 through Dec. 4.

title: Heinz Medjimorec, An Austrian Pianist, Illuminates Haydn
description: Heinz Medjimorec, a 33yearold pianist from Vienna, proved to be a musician of high quality in the recital he gave at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night under the auspices of the Austrian Institute.

title: $1,000,000 Winner to Retire Early
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 14 (AP)Henry J. Bowden moved up his retirement date today when he became the 31st winner of the state's millionaire lottery.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jerseyys daily lottery number yester, day was:

title: 4 Dismissed Playboy Bunnies Over 28 Charge Age and Sex Bias
description: Four Playboy bunnies, discharged two weeks ago for haying lost their bunny image, appeared before the State Commission on Human Rights here yesterday to press their complaint that Playboy Practices sexual and age discrimination, and that their union, is aiding the managewent.

title: Price Of Gold Drops in Europe
description: PARIS, Nov. 14The price of gold dropped sharply in Europe's financial centers today following the disclosure of the termination by seven nations of an accord barring bullion transactions by monetary authorities on the free market.

title: Northwest Supplier Asks 81% Rise on Gas.
description: The Westcoast Transmission Company, Ltd., which supplies almost all of the natural gas to British Columbia and the Northwestern United States, announced yesterday that it had raised the price of gas from 33% cents per 1,000 cubic feet to 61 cents to United States customers. The price increase, if approved by the Federal Power Commission in Washington, would mean an 81 per cent price increase in Colorado, Utah, Wyoming, I d a ho and Washington and in other States that use Canadian natural gas.

title: Compromise Set on $2.4Billion Aid Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14A SenateHouse conference committee agreed today on legislation that would authorize $2.4billion in foreign economic and military aid in the fiscal year ending next July 1, or about $400million less than requested by the Administration.

title: Aides of Many Museums Join Pickets at Modern
description: Staff workers from many of the city's museums walked the picket line in front of the Museum of Modern Art yesterday in support of that institution's professional and administrative staff, which has been on strike since Oct. 9.

title: Nothing Exotic, Please, us That Tried and True Turkey
description: First, you must catch your turkey. Our forefathers would never recognize the taste of most of what is sold as turkey nowadays. You cannot expect oldfashioned flavor from birds that have been frozen, injected with nameless oils (guilefully called butter ball), boned and treated with sodium tripolyphosphate or other allowable chemicals.

title: The Temptation to Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Richard Nixon who insists that he will not resign over the Watergate scandals is following the formula for handling crises that has enabled him to overcome adversity through much of his long political career.

title: The Myth of American Might
description: COLUMBUS, OhioPresident Nixon's decision to alert American military forces throughout the world at the height of the Middle Eastern crisis provoked the wrong debate.

title: FIRST CASE FILED ON WETLANDS LAW
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L.I., Nov. 14The first criminal charges arising under the state's new tidalwetlands protection law were brought today against a Long Island realestate syndicate accused of destroying wetlands here for construction of a housing development.

title: Amusement Park's Plan Stirs a Quiet Illinois Town
description: GURNEE, Ill., Nov. 14It won't, said Richard Welton. It will, said Kenneth Miller. It won't, said Robert Sheridan. Oh, it will, too, said Grace Smith.

title: Currency Exchange in Oslo Closed Today Amid Rumors
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 14 (UPI)  The Norwegian National Bank said today that the foreign currency exchange would be closed tomorrow amid rumors that Norway might revalue her currency.

title: MERCURY RISES TO A RECORD 71
description: A sudden return of Indian summer following more than week of chill brought recordbreaking high temperatures to the metropolitan area yesterday.

title: CALM IN HONOLULU AFTER PRISON RIOT
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 14 (UPI) Calm was restored at the Haiwaii State Prison today after a riot by 180 convicts. A state official said that the prison was a boiling pot That is cooling off.

title: Watson in 6Stroke Lead After a RecordTying 62
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Nov. 14 In an 11stroke change, reddishhaired Tom Watson of Kansas City swung into a sixshot lead after scoring a recordequaling 62 in golf's $500,000 World open today.

title: MARTHA C. CHENEY
description: NEW HOPE, Pa., Nov. 14Martha Candler Cheney, a writer on the arts, died here at her home Monday evening. She was 86 years old.

title: Simpson Tops Poll
description: O. J. Simpson's spectacular running earned him the edge over World Series stars in the October poll for the annual S. Rae Hickok Award to the professional athlete of the year. Simpson led with 46 firstplace votes.

title: OilSupply Situation Spurs Suggestion
description: An authority on international trade proposed here yesterday that the pending trade bill be revised from top to bottom to take into account the changing world situation, particularly with regard to oil supplies.

title: Sandman Attributes His Defeat To Watergate and Nixon's Woes
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor, today attributed his defeat to the scandals in the Nixon Administration and said, If we had all the money in Fort Knox, in my judgment, the result would not have been different.

title: Schiaparelli Dies in Paris; Brought Color to Fashion
description: Elsa Schiaparelli, one of the brilliant figures of high fashion, died Tuesday night at her home in Paris. She was 83 years Old and had been in a coma since having suffered a stroke seven weeks ago.

title: U.S.I.A. SAYS SCANDAL SHOWS FREE SOCIETY
description: The United States Information Agency is telling audiences around the world that the Watergate scandal illustrates how a free society works out a problem, its director said yesterday, The Associated Press reported.

title: Music
NIXON SEES PERIL TO NATION IN CALL FOR HIS REMOVAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 President Nixon, cautioning against demands for his resignation or impeachment, reportedly told Republican members of Congress today, If you cut the legs off the President, America is going to lose.

title: Chris Evert a Smash Hit in Demoiselle
description: Carl Rosen has sent a cable to Chris Evert, about to start play in the South African tennis championship at Johannesburg, saying, You won up here. We hope you win down there.

title: Rationing Is Fairer
description: A battle has erupted within the Administration over gasoline rationing. Secretary of the Interior Rogers Morton and John Love, director of the White House Energy Policy Office, have both predicted the necessity of gasoline rationing within a relatively short time. The National Petroleum Council, an industry advisory group, has backed this position, calling for immediate action on gasoline rationing as well as other energy conservation measures to avoid a severe blow to United States production and employment.

title: Britain Worst Hit by Energy Squeeze As Western Europe Cuts Consumption
description: LONDON, Nov. 14An eerie twilight began descending tonight on Piccadilly Circus, traditionally one of the world's brightest and most colorful centers of nocturnal diversion, as Britain entered the first stages of a national state of emergency declared yesterday by the Government.

title: Abbie Hoffman Fights Defining of Cocaine as Narcotic
description: Abbie Hoffman and three other persons have filed papers seeking to have cocaineselling charges against them dismissed on the ground that cocaine has been misclassified in state law as a narcotic drug, a position that was challenged yesterday by Frank J. Rogers, the city's special narcotics prosecutor.

title: North Korea, in U.N., Demands U. S Pullout in South
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14  North Korea today used its first speech in the United Nations to demand that the United Nations military command in South Korea be dissolved, the remaining American troops withdrawn and the two Koreas left alone to work out their reunification.

title: Total Best in 13 Years
Princess Anne Wed Amid British Pageantry
description: LONDON, Nov. 14Princess Anne, the only daughter of Queen Elizabeth II, and Capt. Mark Phillips, son of commoners, were married today in a ceremony wrapped in pageantry and watched by millions.

title: U.S.SOVIET ACCORD ON CANCER SIGNED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) American and Soviet scientists agreed today to expand their joint efforts in cancer research, the National Cancer Institute announced.

title: Schiaparelli Dies in Paris; Brought Color to Fashion
description: Elsa Schiaparelli, one of the brilliant figures of high fashion, died Tuesday night at her home in Paris. She was 83 years old and had been in a coma since having suffered a stroke seven weeks ago.

title: Mrs. Court Bombards King, Riggs
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 14 (AP)Mrs. Margaret Court steered several Volleys today at Mrs. Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

title: Talks on a New Milk Pact Continue Past the Deadline
description: Negotiations aimed at averting a threatened strike by 3,000 truck drivers and dairy plant workers in the metropolitan area continued last night at the Sheraton Inn near La Guardia Airport.

title: A Convention Center Vote By Board Possible Today
description: The Board of Estimate, meeting in executive session last night, decided to hold a public hearing today and possibly vote on the initial financing for the construction of the $200million West Side convention center.

title: Personal Finance
description: Banks rarely fail any more, but many people with long memories and sizable bank accounts feel decidedly uncomfortable keeping more than $20,000 in any one, savings account.

title: Foreign Subsidiaries Provided Illegal Nixon Gifts, Oilmen Say
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Officials of two big oil companies told Senate investigators today that they had arranged secretly to withdraw cash from foreign subsidiaries in the Bahamas and Gabon to make illegal contributions to the Nixon reelection campaign.

title: Issues Muddled in City Ballet Strike
description: Representatives of the New York City Ballet management and orchestra met without success yesterday in an effort to thrash out the issues in a labor situation that was compounded by a strike by the company's dancers.

title: TV: Royal Wedding's Panache, Panoply and a Parade of Trivia
description: As one of the more prominent nonevents of the year, the wedding of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Phillips could have benefited from a measure of benign neglect. There are, admittedly, certain types of anxious bystanders keenly interested in all royal affairs, but American network television's coverage blitz could only leave the average viewer puzzled and blinking.

title: Sandman Lays Loss Of Governor's Race To Nixon Scandals
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., the unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor, today attributed his defeat to the scandals in the Nixon Administration and said, If we had all the money in Fort Knox, in my judgment, the result would not have been different.

title: NEW TALKS STARTED BY PERU AND CERRO
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 14 (AP)  President Juan Velasco Avlarado's Government has reopened negotiations with the Cerro de Pasco Corporation to buy the company's six mines in Peru, a top official announced today.

title: Energy Crisis In Sports: Will Lights Go Out?
description: What effect will a prolonged energy shortage have on massentertainment major sports? None of the to administrators of football, baseball, basketball and hockey has any answers yet, but all have set in motion studies of possible consequences.

title: Plan to Use Austrian Town For Soviet Jews Protested
description: VIENNA, Nov. 14 UPI The decision to set up an aid station for Soviet Jews at Wollersdorf endangers the lives of the village's 2,500 inhabitants, Otto Mayr, secretary of the Wollersdorf village council, said today.

title: Quarter Rise Is 11.8%
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation realized increases of 11.8 per cent in third quarter earnings and 13.9 per cent for the nine months on sales gains of 19 and 18 per cent for the respective periods. The report yesterday said the results all set new records.

title: Bulldogs Help Fancier Go to College
description: At the age of 32, Sam Steding has done more in the world of dogs than most fanciers twice his age. He has been an owner and breeder for a quarter of a century, has founded a dog club, has judged and now he's teaching youngsters how to handle. My mother had a kennel long before I was born, he said. She had chows and German shepherds. But it was neither of these breeds for which Steding is known.

title: One Reaction to Nixon Breakfast
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Before Representative John W. Wydler participated in today's White House breakfast meeting with President Nixon, the Nassau Republican worried that his defense of the President would continue to be undermined by new disclosures.

title: KISSINGER BEGINS PARLEYS IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Thursday, Nov. 15 Secretary of State Kissinger met with Premier Kakuei Tanaka this morning, amid deep anxieties here that recent Arab oil cutbacks confront Japan with one of her most serious crises since World War II.

title: Shape of Byrne Cabinet
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Although the shape and caliber of the incoming Democratic administration of Brendan T. Byrne has yet to be established, the realities of New Jersey politics and the incumbency of several top officials in the outgoing Cahill administration have already filled nearly half of the new Governor's cabinet.

title: SENATE PANEL VOTES 11% RISE IN PENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) The Senate Finance Committee approved today a twostep, 11 per cent increase in Social Security benefits for 29 million Americans.

title: RevenueSharing Hopes Are Revived
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 14Don't give up on longpromised special Federal revenuesharing programs, a Nixon Administration official told the New Jersey League of Municipalities today.

title: Jeffrey P. Cohen, 30, Dies; Queens Narcotics Official
description: Jeffrey P. Cohen, an assistant to Borough President Donald R. aMnes of Queens, died Tuesday after an automobile accident in Flushing, Queens. His age was 30, and he lived at 7130 167th Street, Flushing.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A key New York State official proposed yesterday that adoptions be encouraged by extending subsidies, paid by the state and local governments for the last five years, to middleclass families. The intent is to enable more black and Puerto Rican families to adopt hardtoplace children.

title: West German President Will Resign
description: BONN, Nov. 14 President Gustav Heinemann, who will be 75 next summer, announced today that he would not run for reelection and would resign at the end of his fiveyear term next June 30.

title: Saigon Devalues Currency
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 14 (Reuters)South Vietnam today devalued the Master from 525 to 535 to the United States dollar in the eighth devaluation this year.

title: Namath Is Doubtful Again for Sunday
description: From an expectant and, optimistic outlook a week ago, the Jets' game plan for Joe Namath has turned doubtful and pessimistic. Coach Weeb Ewbank indicated yesterday that it was not likely Namath would be ready to play against the Cincinnati Bengals Sunday.

title: Fugitive Black Militant Is Killed In Bronx Shootout With Police
description: Twymon Ford Myers, a reputed member of the Black Liberation Army, was killed last night on the corner of Tinton Avenue and 152d Street, in the Bronx, in a gun battle with agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and city police officers.

title: WIDER AID SOUGHT TO SPUR ADOPTIONS
description: A key state official proposed yesterday that the adoption of children be encouraged by extending subsidies, paid by the state and local governments for the last five years, to middleclass families.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Perhaps the loudest gobblegobble Thanksgiving shoppers will hear this year will come from the cash register.

title: NIXON SEES PERIL TO NATION IN CALL FOR HIS REMOVAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 President Nixon, cautioning against demands for his resignation or impeachment, reportedly told Republican members of Congress today, If you cut the legs off the President, America is going to lose.

title: Richardson Seeks to Bar Political Dirty Tricks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)  Former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson has quietly prepared legislation to outlaw political dirty tricks and is urging the Justice Department to press for its enactment.

title: Russian and Aide of U.S. Differ on Ties
description: American and Soviet officials, assessing the prospects of EastWest trade in the wake of the Middle East war, differed subtly in their perception at a panel discussion here yesterday.

title: City Urges Federal Action To Aid FuelOil Company
description: Federal authorities have been asked to take emergency action to allocate new supplies of home heating oil to a large Bronx oil company that city officials say will run out of fuel in a few days.

title: Red Wings Set Back Islanders
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14 (UPI)Henry. Boucha scored with 2:25 remaining to give the Detroit Red Wings a. 43 victory over the New York Islanders tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Rebecca M. Warfield Dies at 58; Wrote on Beauty for Magazines
description: Rebecca Mactier Warfield, the magazine writer who was credited with first using the phrase the Beautiful People, died of cancer Tuesday night at New York Hospital. She was 58 years old, and lived at 320 East 53d Street.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 15, 1973

title: UNSOUGHT TAPES REFUSED BY SIRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Judge John J. Sirica rejected today President Nixon's offer to give the court several nonsubpoenaed tape recordings of Watergaterelated conversations, saying that the offer, if accepted, would turn the court into a depository and clearing house for extraneous material.

title: Hogan's Staff Investigates Big Realty Tax Reductions
description: A number of property owners to whom the City Tax Commission granted large reductions in propertytax valuations for 1972 had submitted figures to the commission that differed from the figures in their incometax returns or other documents, according to the Manhattan District Attorney's office.

title: OIL EXECUTIVE ASKS ACCORD WITH ARABS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 14 Seven to eight million Americans will be out of work within four months unless some accommodation is reached with the Arab nations, a major company oil executive predicted here today.

title: U.S. Is Ending Airlift to Israel, But Supplies Are Going by Sea
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)The Defense Department today virtually ended its airlift of war supplies to Israel, which was begun during the Middle East war.

title: High School Sports
description: The Bayside and South Shore football teams spent week together last summer preparing for the season camp; Saturday they will spend the morning playing for the Public Schools Athletic League title.

title: M.T.A. LOWERING SEAT ON TRANSIT
description: The fuel shortage has forced the Metropolitan Transportation Anthority to order reductions in heat to the lower 60's on commuter trains, subways and buses here and to extinguish lights during the day on the commuter trains, a spokesman said yesterday.

title: PRISONER EXCHANGE BEGUN AS ISRAEL AND EGYPT END A DEADLOCK ON PROCEDURE
description: JERUSALEM, Thursday, Nov. 15Israeli and Egyptian negotiators broke a threeday deadlock yesterday on steps to carry out the ceasefire accord agreeing on the immediate exchange of all prisoners of war.

title: G.A.O. Says Some Litton Aides Used Questionable Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The General Accounting Office has said that some officials at Litton Industries' shipyard in Pascagoula, Miss., had engaged in questionable procurement practices, including possible kickbacks from subcontractors, on shipbuilding projects for the Navy.

title: War Brings Volunteers to Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 14Steven Ellis's friends in the Third Royal Canadian Regiment volunteered for the Canadian contingent of the United Nations Emergency Force, whose job is to keep peace between the Israelis and the Egyptians.

title: Part of Campaign Spending Law That Had Effect of Limiting Ads Is Struck Down
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14A Federal court struck down as unconstitutional today a key section in the campaign spending law that had the effect of limiting political advertising in newspapers and magazines and on television.

title: Estimate for Work At Yankee Stadium Up to $49.9Million
description: The latest price tag for the Yankee Stadium project has risen to $49.9million, or $25.9million more than the city's original estimate for purchase. and renovation of the 50yearold Bronx ball park and upgrading the area around it.

title: Nurse Recruiting Plan
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 14 (UPI)The University of Utah Medical Center has posted $100 reward for information leading to the employment and retention of a registered nurse. Any hospital employewho recruits a nurse who stays on the staff for one year will have earned the bounty.

title: MORE STUDY SLATED ON SAXBE MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) The Senate decided today to investigate further the constitutionality of a measure intended to speed the confirmation of President Nixon's nominee for Attorney General, Senator William B. Saxbe, Ohio Republican.

title: COST RISES AGAIN ON STADIUM WORK
description: The latest price tag for the Yankee Stadium project has risen to $49.9million, or $25.9million more than the city's original estimate for purchase and renovation of the 50yearOld Bronx ball park and upgrading the area near it.

title: Volcano on Mt. Pavlof In the Aleutians Erupts
description: COLD BAY, Alaska, Nov. 14 (AP)Lava erupted 200 to 300 feet into the air from 8,215foot Mount Pavlof in the Aleutian Islands today, the National Weather Service reported.

title: Foreign Subsidiaries Provided Illegal Nixon Gilts, Oilmen Say
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Officials of two big oil companies told Senate investigators today that they had arranged secretly to withdraw cash from foreign subsidiaries in the Bahamas and Gabon to make illegal contributions to the Nixon reelection campaign.

title: SKYLAB ACTIVITY GOING SMOOTHLY
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 14The countdown proceeded smoothly today for the launching Friday morning of the twicedelayed Skylab 3 astronauts on a planned 85day mission orbiting the earth.

title: Lads Want to Join Up
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 12Early in the morning, when the streets of Saigon were splashed with sunlight, three 16yearold boys tried to become soldiers.

title: Didn't Know Gun Was Loaded, Policeman Tells Murder Jury
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 14 (UPI) A former Dallas policeman, Darrell L. Cain, tearfully testified today that he had placed his revolver at the head of 12yearold Santos Rodriguez and pulled the trigger because the youth refused to confess a burglary.

title: And Now, Project Truth
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14It is in the Attire of most political leaders to play the role of Dr. Panglossto assure their public that, whatever the preset difficulties, an easier and richer life lies ahead. President Nixon has done nothing unusual, therefore, in taking such a reassuring line about the energy problem.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A police bombdisposal truck yesterday pulled up DeWitt Clinton High School on Mosholu Parkway in the Bronx at 11 A.M., a wing of the school was cleared and bombdisposal squad delicately carried a container of four pounds of picric acid, a potential explosive, to the truck, and then to the Pelham Bay Park range for study and disposal.

title: British Soccer
description: INTERNATIONAL MATCHES

title: STATE DEMOCRATS BACK POLICY UNIT
description: State Democrats expressed strong support yesterday for holding a national policy conference of the party midway between the Quadrennial national conventions to formulate party policy on issues.

title: Screen: The French Conspiracy Examines Political Scandal
STUDENTS IN ATHENS STAGE MASS PROTEST
description: ATHENS, Thursday, Nov. 15 Thousands of student protesters last night urged the Greeks to revolt against the militarybacked Government of President George Papadopoulos in one of the most vigorous and longest mass demonstrations in downtown Athens since the coup in 1967.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Irving Trust Drops Rate On FuelSaving Loans
description: The Irving Trust Company announced yesterday that it would make energy conservation loans to homeowners at an interest rate of 9.5 per centalmost 2 points below the 11.49 per cent it charges on regular threeyear homeimprovement loans.

title: Speed Cut's Effect On Insurance Rates Is Studied in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Governor Cahill ordered a study to day to see if automobileinsurance rates could be cut as a result of the lower speed limits imposed on New Jersey highways.

title: Price of Gold Drops
description: The price of gold plunged about $7 an ounce to about $90 on European free markets yesterday following the announcement Tuesday night by the United States and six European nations of the end of an agreement banning centralbank transactions in the privatesector bullion market. Page 67.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPIN OFF The Boston Symphony Chamber Players consists of a dozen string, woodwind and brass firstdesk men and the solo timpanist of the Boston Symphony, who formed their splinter group in 1964 and have since then played 200 smallerthansymphonicsize concerts.

title: THOMAS F. RICHARDSON
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 14 Thomas F. Richardson, retired chief of the Stamford Fire Department, died yesterday at his home, 44 Sherwood Road. He was 73 years old.

title: College, School Results
Issue of Catholic Weekly Is Sampler of Its Memorable Articles
description: Commonweal, the layedited Roman Catholic weekly, is celebrating its 50th anniversary year with publication this week of a 56page sampler of memorable articles from the past. In keeping with the plight of most journals of opinion today, the weekly is also marking the occasion with an appeal for funds.

title: NICK CONDOS, 65, DIES; BOXER AND WRESTLER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 14  Nicholas Thomas Condos, who, as Nick Condos, was boxer and wrestler, died Monday in Daytona, Fla., while on vacation. He Was 65 yearsold and lived here at 82 Crystal Street.

title: Vesco Extradition Case Hinges on Man Accused of Conflicting Statements
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Nov. 14 The charge on which the United States bases its plea to extradite Robert L. Vesco revolves around a man Mr. Vesco's chief counsel has accused of giving conflicting sworn statements.

title: Linen, President 5 Years, Gets Urban League Award
description: As the National Urban League reaffirmed its commitment to integrated leadership, the organization presented its 17th annual Equal Opportunity Award last night to James A. Linen, who retired this year as its president.

title: People and Business
description: About two years ago, William D. Baker, president and chief executive officer of CooperJarrett, Inc., remarked during an interview how difficult it was to work for a relative.

title: Notes on People
description: With Election Day, 1973, barely out of the way, Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama drew the first announced opposition to his plans to win reelection. State Senator Eugene McLain of Huntsville, a 42yearold lawyer and developer, said he planned to seek the Democratic nomination for Governor in next May's primary. Charging Governor Wallace with a record of indecision, the. State Senator said, Government has let things get out of control in Alabama. Most public opinion polls show Mr. Wallace a heavy favorite for reelection.

title: COPPER FUTURES RISE DAILY LIMIT
description: Prices in the London copper market were strong yesterday, pushing up prices in New York, where trading on the Commodity Exchange starts several hours later.

title: Nixon to Attend Parley Of Managing Editors
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 14 (AP)President Nixon plans to attend the Associated Press Managing Editors convention here Saturday, convention officials announced tonight.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: New Jersey Sports
description: It hasn't been easy in recent years to maintain football teams at costburdened parochial schools.

title: U.A.W. IS SHIFTING TACTICS WITH G.M.
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14The beleaguered leadership of the United Automobile Workers Union made a major shift in strategy today in its bargaining with the General Motors Corporation and also took steps to salvage the agreement already reached with the Ford Motor Company.

title: Visit to Mao
description: On his way home from arranging a negotiated truce between Israel and Egypt, Henry Kissinger dropped in to see his old friend Mao Tsetung. Such is the pace changing times that it is now possible for the American Secretary of State and the world's leading revolutionary hero to meet in a friendly atmosphereand the visit seems like a mere way station on a roundtheworld tour.

title: Chess: The End Can Be the Means To Making a Meaningful End
description: Of the classical masters, Emanuel Lasker, world champion from 1894 to 1921, has always been the least understood, partly because his play poses such a challenge to interpreters. To account for the staggering number of games he savedand even wonfrom busted positions, no less a theorist than Richard Reti (18891929) suggested that Lasker deliberately played bad moves, encouraging his opponents to go after him so he could show off his great skill in complications.

title: ELIAS GECHMAN, PHYSICIAN, DEAD
description: Dr. Elias L. Gechman, a physician who was the first chairman of Tribute to the Danes, died yesterday in Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn. He was 62 years old and lived at 128 Central Park South, He also had homes in Woodstock, N.Y., and Jerusalem.

title: Cox's Ouster Ruled Illegal; No Reinstatement Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  A Federal judge ruled today that the dismissal of Archibald Cox as special Watergate prosecutor was illegal.

title: BEAME WILL TAKE FARE TO GOVERNOR
description: While Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rockefeller were swapping blows yesterday about how the 35cent fare could or could not be saved a spokesman for Mayorelect Abraham D. Beanie said Mr. Beame had not given up on saving the fare.

title: MESKILL ASKS LIMIT OF 50 M.P.H. IN STATE
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 14Gov. Thomas J. Meskill said today that he would ask the Connecticut Traffic Commission to set the maximum speed limit in the state at 50 miles an hour.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Rosita and Ottavio (Tai) Missoni, whose knitted clothes have become international status symbols, like Vuitton bags and Gucci shoes, were in New York this week for a reason. For several reasons, in fact.

title: Version of Florida Man's Burning Called a Hoax
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 14 (AP)A black woman who the told police that a gang of black attackers had abducted her and her white husband and set him afire made up the story, the authorities say.

title: The English Princess and the English Gentleman
description: LONDON, Nov. 14After a long running battle with the press, Princess Anne and Capt. Mark Phillips subinitted on Monday to the combined forces of B.B.C. and the Independent Television Network.

title: AMEX PRICES DROP 5TH SESSION IN ROW
description: In their fifth consecutive drop, prices tumbled sharply on the American Stock Exchange yesterday as investor confidence continued to ebb because of the energy crisis. Prices also fell markedly in the overthecounter market.

title: POWER CONTRACT SET ON BREEDER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 14  With the chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission, Dr Dixy Lee Ray looking on, a contract was signed today for the nuclear portion of the $700million breeder demonstration power plant scheduled for completion in 1980, a goal set two years ago by President Nixon.

title: Red Wings Celtics Spoil Russell's Return
description: Bill Russell returned to Boston last night, but for the man who became a legend in his own time with the Celtics the evening in Boston Garden was unsuccessful. The Celtics beat Russell's. Seattle Supersonics, 110104.

title: Bankers National Life Held In Sound Financial Shape
description: The Bankers National Life Insurance Company, a New Jersey subsidiary of the financially troubled Equity Funding Corporation of America, was declared yesterday to be in sound financial condition.

title: SINGAPORE HATS FUEL TO U.S. UNITS
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 14 (UPI) Singapore, the biggest refining center in Southeast Asia, has cut off all fuel supplies to American forces in the Pacific because of Arab threats to stop supplies to the island, industry sources said.

title: ISRAEL AND EGYPT REPORT AN AGREEMENT TO INITIATE P.O.W. EXCHANGE AT ONCE
description: JERUSALEM, Thursday, Nov 15Israeli and Egyptian negotiators broke a threeday dead. lock yesterday on steps to carry out the ceasefire accord agree. ing on the immediate exchange of all prisoners of war.

title: Fugitive Black Militant Killed, 4 Wounded in Bronx Shootout
description: Twymon Ford Myers, a reputed member of the Black Liberation Army, was killed last night on the corner of Tinton Avenue and 152d Street, in the Bronx, in a gun battle with.agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and city police officers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The President's message on energy is too little and about five years too late. The statistics and dilemmas he quoted were predicted at least that long ago by thoughtful earth scientists and others, including Walter Hickel. There is no use pretending these messages never reached the White House. They did and they were largely ignored.

title: ARABS PLANNING SUMMIT PARLEY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 14 A fullscale meeting of Arab chiefs of state, requested by Egypt and Syria, will be held in Algeria on Nov. 26 to review the Middle East war and plan future Arab strategy, it was announced today.

title: CANADA TO CONTINUE U.S. OIL SHIPMENTS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 14 (Reuters) Canada will not cut off oil exports to the United States even if advised to by Arab countries, Prime Minister Pierre Elliot Trudeau said yesterday.

title: Son of Jerry Lee Lewis Dies In Mississippi Car Crash
description: HERNANDO, Miss. Nov. 14 (UPI)Jerry Lee Lewis Jr., the son of the popular rock n roll singer and pianist, died yesterday in an auto accident near here. He was 19 years old.

title: An Italian Death List of 1,617 Attributed to Rightist Plotters
description: ROME, Nov. 14Judicial authorities are examining a death list of 1,617 Italians whom neoFascist plotters had allegedly planned to assassinate. The existence of the list is a matter of intense nationwide interest, and inclusion in it is a political status symbol.

title: 13,000 Audi Cars Face Recall for Check on Bolts
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N. J., Nov. 14 (AP)  Volkswagen of America announced today that it was asking about 13,000 owners of Audi Foxes to return the cars to the dealer for inspection of bolts on rear wheel backing plates.

title: Transit Fare Freeze Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 14 (UPI)Representtative Bella Abzug, Democrat of New York, introduced a bill in the House today to freeze mass transit rates, She said the action was needed so that people would not be discouraged from using buses and subways. Under her bill, the Federal Government would make up any losses with subsidies to the transit firms.

title: Statement In Peking
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14 (UPI)Following is the text of the joint communiqu issued by the United States and Chinese Governments today after the visit of Secretary of State Kissinger to Peking, as made public by the Kissinger party on arrival here:

title: Dow Drops 21.15 as Stocks React to FuelCrisis Fears
description: The spectre of an energy crisis dealt another crushing blow to stock prices yesterday The DowJones industrials, the market's most closely watched barometer, plunged 21.15 points to register one of the biggest losses of the last dozen years.

title: Shultz Declines Any Comment On Whether U.S. Will Sell Gold
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz declined today under questioning by members of Congress and reporters to give any clues on whether the United States would sell gold on the free markets.

title: Firefighters' Obligation
description: A city groggy from repeated evidences of irresponsibility by unions in control of its vital services got refreshing pledge of commitment to duty yesterday from its unionized fire officers.

title: BEAME'S REGIME IS TAKING SHAPE
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beanie peppered the people helping to, shape his administrationtobe with telephone calls from his undisclosed vacation spot yesterday.

title: Advertising: Halting the Drain
description: A considerable amount of marketing money is going down the drain because of poor communications between manufacturers and retailers.

title: West Bury, Now 30% Black, Seeks to Stay MiddleClass
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Nov. 14 Walter Eidelkind believes in integration. Otherwise, he says, he would never have moved to this old Quaker village in the first place.

title: DOLLINGER ACTION ON BENCH STUDIED
description: State Supreme Court Justice Isidore Dollinger and former Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer are among the judges who in rent years illegally freed Mom narcotics defendants, according to court records and law enforcement officials.

title: OUSTED S.B.A. AIDE BACKED BIG LOBS
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 14 (AP)The ousted head of the Small Business Administration's Richmond office approved at least $2.Smillion in funding during the last year to companies with which his present brotherinlaw was associated.

title: TeenAlters Offer Information on Sex
description: George Dunn has shortish blond hair, blue eyes and the geewhiz grin of an oldfashioned teenager. His 18yearold face grows intense, though, when he talks about his job in the Peer Group Information Service at Brooklyn's John Jay High School.

title: N.F.L. to Check Redskins on Drug Report
description: The National Football League said yesterday it would investigate a report that onethird of the Washington Redskins players use amphetamines to help charge themselves up before games.

title: STUDENT LEADERS EXPRESS DISTRUST
description: A survey of 26,000 high school student leaders across the United States indicates that they are generally distrustful of government but perhaps somewhat more conservative in their attitudes than some people might expect.

title: Energy Fears Send Stock Prices Down
description: The energy crisis that quickly has been transformed into a stockmarket dilemma sent prices tumbling again in Wall Street yesterday. Glamours and blue chips alike were pounded.

title: $65,000 Hicks Tops a Sale of Folk Art
description: One of the numerous versions of The Peaceable Kingdom, painted by Edward Hicksthe 19thcentury carriage and sign painter whose enduring fame largely rests on this theme, with which he was preoccupied from about 1820 to 1849was auctioned last night for $65,000.

title: Army Won't Seek a Draft Despite Lag in Enlistments
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) Despite an expected Army recruiting shortage of 15,000 to 20,000 volunteers by next June, the Pentagon has no plans to seek resumption of the draft, a top Pentagon official said today.

title: ENERGY HOPE SEEN IN NEW TECHNIQUES
description: Exploration, drilling and producing techniques now being perfected will permit explorationists to tap huge new oil and gas fields off shore in water depths of 600 to 10,000 feet, Edwin Van den Bark, vice presidentinternational of the Phillips Petroleum Company, said here yesterday.

title: Connally Urges Caution On Move to Oust Nixon
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 14 (UPI)John B. Connally urged Americans today to be patient and wait until all the facts about the Watergate affair are known before trying to get rid of President Nixon.

title: Cox's Ouster Ruled Illegal, No Reinstatement Ordered
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  A Federal judge ruled today that the dismissal of Archibald Cox as special Watergate prosecutor was illegal.

title: UNSOUGHT TAPES REFUSED BY SIRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Judge John J. Sirica rejected today President Nixon's offer to give the court several nonsubpoenaed tape recordings of Watergaterelated conversations, saying that the offer, if accepted, would turn the court into a depository and clearing house for extraneous material.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The police have charged Luther Evans, a 43yearold Newark man, with the fatal stabbing of an elderly crippled tavern owner in Elizabeth. The victim, Mrs. Mildred Hopkins, 62, was found on the floor of her tavern by a friend. Her throat had been slashed and she had been stabbed the chest in an apparent robbery attempt.

title: Blast in Britain Kills 6
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Four women and two men were killed instantly and at least 20 people injured when a blast ripped through part of an arms and explosives plant today. A spokesman for the concern, Imperial Metal Industries Company, said sabotage could not be ruled out though there was no evidence to suggest it.

title: Defense, Robertson Help Bucks Thrive
description: This regularseason weekend in the National Basketball Association will look more like playoff time in March and April. Seven of the eight teams that figure to make the playoffs will oppose one another. These are the matchups: Tomorrow night  Milwaukee at Boston and Chicago at Los Angeles. Saturday nightMilwaukee at New York and Capital at Atlanta. Milwaukee has a 15.1 wonlost record, including 13 in a row. The Seattle SuperSonics are the team that beat the Bucks, and that was more than a month ago.

title: People in Sports: Sanderson's Ordeal
description: Derek Sanderson, trying to get back into form and rejoin the Boston Bruins, played 34 of the 60 minutes Tuesday night and helped the Boston Braves beat the Rochester Americans in the American League, the hockey minors. Between puffing on cigarettes and sipping beer, he explained the differences between the A.H.L. and the World Hockey Association, to which he had jumped and from which he later returned to the Bruins. The W.H.A. is a lot faster and a little smarter, he said, but this is a tougher league with harder checking.

title: CITY FIRE OFFICERS CONDEMN STRIDES
description: The leader of the Uniformed Fire Officers Association, which supported last week's strike by firemen, announced yesterday that the association's executive board had decided that the fire officers would not strike or take any action in the future that might conflict with their firefighting responsibilities.

title: Stanford Increases Tuition
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)Stanford University has increased its annual tuition from $3,135 to $3,375, starting in 197475. The university's board of trustees approved the $240 increase yesterday.

title: Memorex Reports $3.9Million Loss For Third Quarter
description: The financially troubled Memorex Corporation reported yesterday a thirdquarter net loss of $3.9million, which swelled the deficit for the first nine months to $105.2million.

title: Nixon Gets Turkey Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) Today, for the 28th consecutive year, the turkey industry made its annual Thanksgiving gift to the Presidenta live 40pound turkey and two 32pound frozen ones. Mrs. Richard M. Nixon gave the live turkey to Oxon Hill Children's Farm in Maryland, and the frozen birds to the Salvation Army and to St. Stephen's Church here.

title: City Lists 34 Food Establishments as Violators
Fall Called Suicide
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 14 (AP)A former University of Massachusetts student was killed yesterday in a 19story plunge from a university dormitory. The death of Edward T. Waddington, 19 years old, of Amherst was termed a suicide by a police spokesman.

title: U.S. and China Are Closer To Full Diplomatic Ties
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14Secretary of State Kissinger left China today after signing a joint communiqu that seemed to move Washington and Peking another step closer to the establishment of full diplomatic relations.

title: NEW STATE PANEL ON WOMEN URGED
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14  The New Jersey State Commission on Women heard suggestions today from a number of women on how the commission might be restructured to advance the cause of women's rights.

title: 10 Deaths Attributed to Hospital Strike
description: Three nursinghome operators charged yesterday that 10 of their patients died as a result of the, weeklong strike by 30,000 hospital workers.

title: RATIONING'S FOES GAINING IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Opposition to gasoline rationing broadened within the Nixon Administration today even as officials assembled an emergency group to examine rationing and other ways to conserve energy.

title: 2 CRIME VICTIMS. SUING LANDLORDS
description: To what extent is a landlord responsible for crimes committed by outsiders to tenants and others on the landlord's proptry?

title: Without the Slightest Dissent
description: Knowledgeable baseball men shook their heads in disagreement when one private polling agency named Reggie Jackson of the Oakland A's the outstanding performer of the recent World Series. They admitted that Reggie had finished with a fancy flourish in the last two games. But the most solid man for Oakland throughout and the biggest contributor to victory, they insisted, was Bert Campaneris, the shortstop. Campy, however, speaks halting English and has a flat personality, while the articulate, attractive Reggie sparkles. So Reggie got the sports car and Campy didn't even get a ride around the block.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 14 (AP)  Virginia James, a 4yearold filly in foal to Executioner, brought top price of $95,000 today at the Keeneland sales. Consigned by Maple Lawn Farm, Inc., and Ramon Coto, she was purchased by H. E. Sutton as agent for an undisclosed buyer.

title: The Quest for Funds to Keep the Arts Lively Goes On
description: The age of private patronage in the arts is drawing to a, close, and the age of comprehensive Government subsidies for the arts is not yet upon us Meanwhile, in the chaotic interim, the great cultural institutions founded upon the economic and social premises of one era are showing signs of foundering upon the demands and expectations of the other. The Museum of Modern Art, for example, which has been struck by its professional and administrative staff since Oct. 9, is a private institution. Although its worldwide fame as the greatest museum of its kind attracts a great many outoftown visitors to New York, thereby benefiting the city's economy (not to mention Its spirit) in incalulable ways, the city contributes nothing to its support. (The city contributes only to the maintenance of museums that occupy city land.)

title: ROBERT BROWN, 66, EXECUTIVE OF AM!
description: Robert Q. Brown, an executive with AMF Incorporated since retired as, a brigadier general from the Army in 1961, died Tuesday in Seattle. He was 66 years old and lived in York, Pa.

title: WorkRelease Inmate Charged With Larceny
description: A 32yearold Rikers Island inmate, who was employed at the Fulton Fish Market in a workrelease program enbling him to live in a Manhattan halfway house, was charged yesterday with the theft and forgery of $1,700 worth of checks from his employer.

title: FIRST CASE PILED ON WETLANDS LAW
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L.I., Nov. 14The, first criminal charges arising under the state's new tidalwetlands pro tection law were brought today against a Long Island realestate syndicate accused of destroying wetlands here for construction of a housing development.

title: Bridge: Autobiography by Schenken Tells About a Long Career
description: More than 30 years ago, the leading bridge authority of the period published his autobiography, The Strange Lives of One Man. This was interesting and readable, but there was not much in it about bridge, because Ely Culbertson had had a remarkable and varied life.

title: Princess Anne Wed Amid British Pageantry
description: LONDON, Nov, 14Princess Anne, the only daughter of Queen Elizabeth II, and Capt. Mark Phillips, son of commoners, were married today in a ceremony wrapped in pageantry and watched by millions.

title: Rangers Tie Hawks at 4 to 4
description: What Sheldon Kannegiesser seriously calls keeping the faith and hanging in there paid off for the New York Rangers last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Treasury Bills Rise; Average Rate 7.71%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The average rate on oneyear Treasury bills rose today 7.71 per cent from 7.13 per cent a month ago as the Federal Government sold $1.8billion of these securities its usual monthly sale.

title: Defeatism on the Fare
description: Residents of this city and its suburbs and, of other cities throughout the state will not join Governor Rockefeller and legislative leaders in the defeatist approach they are taking toward imminent increases of 70 per cent in fares on subways, buses and commuter railroads.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
5 CITED FOR MURDER IN '71 RIOT AT ATTICA
description: WARSAW, N.Y., Nov. 14 (AP)  A Vyoming County grand jury investigating the 1971 Attica prison uprising today indicted five men accused of participating in the rebellion on charges of murder in the slaying of a fellow inmate.

title: New Car Sales Are Down 11% For First 10 Days of November
description: DETROIT, Nov. 14Domestic make new car sales totalled 250,178 in the Nov. 110 period, a decline of 11.1 per cent from the 281,577 sold in the same period a year ago.

title: Screen:'Don Is Dead' Scans Gang Power Struggle
description: There is enough firepower in "The Don Is Dead," which crashed into the Rivoli and other theaters yesterday, to raise the dead. But the struggle for power between Anthony Quinn, other dons and the young gunmen in this Mafia-like gangland, is sound and fury that imitates but rarely flatters the big guns in the genre from the 1930 "Little Caesar" to "The Godfather."Expertise, if not imagination, is evident in the explosive, action-oriented direction of Richard Fleischer as an aging Anthony Quinn battles the likes of Frederic Forrest, Robert Forster and others for control of the mob and its illicit enterprises. Naturally, these "families" are enmeshed in doublecrosses and misunderstandings that seem confusing only to the principals involved. A fairly attentive viewer can see it all coming before Quinn falls for Forster's girl, the pretty, altruistic chanteuse-song-writer, Angel Tompkins, and unwittingly sets off the fireworks.Any red-blooded American boy should be delighted by the virtually incessant bullets and gore and a climactic bombing and shootout. But "The Don Is Dead" has the attributes of some lively, pithily accented performances that are adult and effectively natural. Among these are Forrest, as the brainly hood who attempts to escape the racket, but winds up a don; Al Lettieri, as his roughhewn, dependent, ill-fated brother, and Forster, as the rising, vengeful muscleman who is eventually cut down.As the embattled don who is finally felled by a stroke, not a gun, Quinn is moodily menacing and as polished and relaxed as a professional long familiar with this sort of role. He is off the mark, however, when he observes, quality can be bought, talent can't." There's talent, if not quality, in "The Don Is Dead."

title: Girl, 13, Is Raped by Nine in Brooklyn Following Similar Bronx Gang Assault
description: A 13yearold girl was abducted on the street near her home in Brooklyn Tuesday night and raped by nine youths, reputedly members of a Brooklyn gang called the Tomahawks, the police said yesterday.

title: Dispute Erupts in House On Meetings With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The Democratic leader in the kouse of Representatives, Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., accused President Nixon today of trying to curry favor with his prospective grand jurors by inviting members of Congress to meet with him at the White House.

title: ISRAEL AND. EGYPT EXCHANGE P.O.W.'S
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 15The first 26 Israeli prisoners released by Egypt, all of them wounded, arrived from Cairo today, beginning a prisoner exchange that is expected to last a week.

title: E. Cloud Wampler Dead at 78; ExChairman of Carrier Corp.
description: E. Cloud Wampler, retired chairman of the Carrier Corporation, which he led during The years of greatest expansion of the airconditioning industry, died Wednesday at the Stanford Medical Center in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 78 years old and had been living in Scottsdale, Ariz.

title: Hoover Memorial Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today to authorize a $5million Federal contribution to construct and equip a memorial building near Palo Alto, Calif., in honor of former President Herbert Hoover.

title: Kissinger Called Unable To Assure Tokyo on Oil
description: TOKYO, Friday, Nov. 16 Secretary of State Kissinger concluded two days of talks with Premier Kakuei Tanaka and other senior Japanese leaders yesterday, apparently without giving them the assurances that they had hoped he would provide as to when the Arab nations would restore their oil cuts.

title: MARCOR NET ROSE 41.2% IN QUARTER
description: Marcor, Inc., which combines Montgomery Ward retailing and the Container Corporation paperboard packaging operations, announced yesterday record sales and earnings for the three and nine months ended Oct. 31. The rise in profits  41.2 per cent for the quarter and 47.6 per cent for the nine months  were attributed by the company to improved merchandising efficiency and from strong demand and added shipping container ca

title: BREZHNEV, TITO FOCUS ON MIDEAST
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 15  The Soviet Union and Yugoslavia today took their first public steps to promote a Palestinian national state as an essential part of a Middle East settlement.

title: Mrs. Archibald Silverman, Former Hadassah Officer
description: Mrs. Ida Camelhor Silverman, a former national vice president of Hadassah and the widow of Archibald Silverman, a Providence jewelry manufacturer and civic leader, died Nov. 2 in Herzliya, Israel, where she moved in 1971. She was 91 years old.

title: Medical Researchers Told to Inform Public
description: Researchers must explain medical science to the public more clearly and in more depth if research is to survive, Senator Ernest F. Hollings told a group of health leaders yesterday.

title: Fuel Truck Drivers Strike
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 15 (AP)Some 350 fuel truck drivers went on strike at midnight, curtailing heating oil and gasoline service to thousands of residents in central Ohio.

title: Lot of Faith Behind Midnight Madrigal
description: The program at Aqueduct yesterday listed Martha M. Gonzalez as the owner Of Midnight Madrigal, in the eighth race. There was more to the ownership than was mentioned in the program, for M. Gonzalez is a Catholic nun.

title: Yale Student Is Drowned After Crew Shell Mishap
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 15  A Yale student drowned this evening as he tried to, swim ashore from a shattered crew shell.

title: Hawks, Led by Hudson, Subdue Blazers, 123114
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 15 (UPI) A fourthquarter comeback, led by Lou Hudson, gave the Atlanta Hawks a 123114 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers tonight.

title: Where the Enthusiastic Amateur Reigns as Chef
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: U.S. HINTS SHIFT ON U.N. IN KOREA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 15 The United States suggested today that it was willing to see new arrangements made for safeguarding peace and security in the divided Korean peninsula.

title: Lot of Faith Behind Midnight Madrigal
description: The program at Aqueduct yesterday listed Martha M. Gonzalez as the owner of Midnight Madrigal, in the eighth race. There was more to the ownership than was mentioned in the program, for M. Gonzalez is a Catholic nun.

title: 24Hour Strike Disrupts French Life
description: PARIS, Nov. 15Independent shopkeepers, the mainspring of [commercial life in this fiercely individualistic nation, went on a 24hour strike today to vent their anger against antiinflation measures of the Government and the sprawl of chain stores.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: Tickets matching only the last two win five 50cent tickets for any subsequent weekly drawing when shown to any lottery vender.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: Kissinger Thrives During a Journey to China
description: TOKYO, Nov. 15Shortly after his Air Force jet left Peking for Tokyo, Secretary of State Kissinger walked to the rear to chat with newsmen about the visit to China. Twice as he was trying to make himself heard over the engine noise, the pilot's voice came booming over the publicaddress system, drowning out the Secretary, to point out landmarks.

title: CORPORATE BONDS ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: Corporate bond prices moved up sharply yesterday in active trading. Higher prices were also noted in the taxexempt and Government bond markets.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: $1Million Given for Law Enforcement

title: LINDSAY SUBMITS 4 BILLS TO ALBANY
