description: POINT JUDITH, R. I. Was it really only 15 years ago that a small boy, appearing on my Rhode Island neighbor's veranda at cocktail time, demanded, What am I having for supper, Ma?

title: Governor Scores House's Plan For Aged, Citing Cost to State
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that the state would face a $48million extra cost next year if it were to provide the additional benefits for the aged, blind and disabled poor that were authorized Thursday by the House of Representatives.

title: Pop
description: To a man who has reached the age of 2,013, the last 13 years hardly rate the blink of an eyelid. But to the rest of us, the years since 1960 have been chock full of change. Bombarded by moon landings, hippies, wars, scandais and the high cost of beef, we are lucky if we can remember the name of the current attorney genoral. Luckily, 2000 Thirteen (Warner Bros. BS 2741) by Carl Reiner and Mel Brooks has been released in time to remind us plus a change, plus c'est la mme chose.

title: Trundling Down To Florida on The AutoTrain
description: THE green and silver highway sign on Interstate 95 is modest. It sayssimply AutoTrain Terminal Next Exit. We were 13 miles south of Washington heading south, and for the last 5 miles I had been keeping a sharp lookout for this sign.

title: New and Recommended
description: BURR, by Gore Vidal. (Random House, $8.95.) An imagined biography cum autobiography of the conventional textbook villain; a wicked entertainment In which Mr. Vidai slyly upends American history.

title: LETTERS
description: Energy Use

title: Year Later: Few Women at the Bar
description: HOBOKEN  It is now more than a year since women won the right to hoist, their tankards side by side with men at the famous bar of the Clam Broth House. But, unlike its New York City brothers in battle  McSorley's and the Oak Room at the Plaza Hotel  the Clam Broth House bar has not really become a mecca for women. The vast majority of its patrons are still men.

title: Egypt Is Reported To Press the U.S.
description: CAIRO, Nov. 17Egypt has asked the United States to put diplomatic pressure on Israel to carry out the sixpoint ceasefire agreement more rapidly, wellinformed political sources said here today.

title: Duke Drops 213 Verdict To N.C. State
description: DURHAM, N.C., Nov. 17 (AP)Bruce Shaw scored one touchdown and set up another with a 40yard pass as North Carolina State defeated Duke, 213, today to nail down a Liberty Bowl hid.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Camp Fare
description: WENTWORTH LOCATION, N. H.One small doe was hanging from the porch rafters and a savory duck soup was simmering in a huge aluminum pot on the back of the wood stove when my brother Dan and I arrived at the cabin we were to share with five other deer hunters.

title: Lindbergh House Now Haven
description: HOPEWELL  The fieldstone, slateroofed country house from which the infant son of Col. and Mrs. Charles A. Lindbergh was abducted in 1932 still stands here today, not as a reminder of one of the nation's major tragedies but, instead, as one of the country's few successful rehabilitation centers for teenagers with criminal records.

title: Nittany Lions Win, 4910
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Nov. 17 (AP)John Cappelletti rushed for 204 yards on 25 carries and scored four ouchdowns in less than three quarters today as sixthranked Penn State trounced Ohio University, 4910, en route to its New Year's night appearance in Miami's Orange Bowl.

title: CHURCH DISPUTED ON MARITAL LAMS
description: BOSTON, Nov. 17A group of divorced Roman Catholics here is publicly challenging their church's ban on divorce and remarriage in a way that the priest who is their sponsor calls analagous to the civil disobedience of the early civil rights workers.

title: Diagramless, 22 by 15
description: ACROSS

title: Christmas Display Dropped
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17 (UPIThe Merchandise Mart, the largest wholesale buying center in the world, announced today that its blocklong illuminated Christmas display would not appear for the first time since World War II. Thomas V. King, geneeral manager of the mart, said that the move was part of the building's program to economize in the use of energy.

title: Collectors' Items: Imperial Helmets
description: TOMS RIVER  When William J. Kalwick wants to expand his hobby, he frequently has to consider a coasttocoast trip and, perhaps, even a flight overseas.

title: Cow comfort
description: Women are forever on the lookout for a comfortable way of dressing. One prime example is the sweaterandpants solution that has persisted for so many years now. This year, when women seem to hanker to look female again, to wear dresses, the sweater has been extended to dress length. makes for comfort, style and warmth all in one easy pullover. With a winter of noncentral heating a chilly possibility, sweater dressing is a warm way to stay stylish.

title: Marcia Kelly Fiancee
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 17Mr. and Mrs. Vilar F. Kelly have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marcia Helen Kelly, to James A. Yoshizawa, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur H. Yoshizawa of Tokyo, formerly of Stamford. Miss Kelly and her fiance, who are seniors at Tufts University, plan to be married Dec. 22.

title: Measles, Brought by Road, Killing Indians in Amazon
description: Rio DE JANEIRO, Nov. 17 (AP)Measles, brought to a once remote section of the Amazon Jungle by a new and controversial highway, is killing members of a primitive Indian tribe, a Brazilian newspaper reported this week.

title: A classy company troubles a classy town
description: The basic purpose of Xerox Corporation is find the best means to bring order and discipline to informationto develop, as it were, an architecture of information. C. PETER MCCOLOUGH.

title: Biggest Soviet OreCarrying Vessel Making Her Maiden Voyage
description: The Soviet Union's biggest orecarrying ship has set out on her maiden voyage from the Black Sea to Japanthe latest symbol of the accelerated growth of the Russian merchant fleet.

title: LAWYERS A TARGET OF F. T. C. OFFICIAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17Lawyers seeking to augment their legal fees may be impairing the effectiveness of the Federal Trade Commission's advertising substantiation program, according to a high commission official.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Week after week the evidence keeps mounting that the field goal has assumed such a position of dominance in the National Football League that old values and old scoring concepts have been kicked lopsided. If the change were for the better, there would be no complaints. But the fans grumble at the overuse of the placement 3pointer.

title: SPECIAL ATTORNEY REVIEWS CAREER
description: In 1970, in his annual State of the State message, Governor Rockefeller announced a bold new plan to stem the growing wave of crime which threatens the nation and destroys the quality of life for our citizens.

title: Barber Captures World Open Golf
description: PINEHURST, N.C., Nov. 17 There is no need now to call Miller Barber golf's Mr. X. The 42yearold Texan whose tinted glasses have often obscured his identity, won the world open golf tournament today and $100,000, the biggest first prize the game has ever known.

title: U. C. L.A. Wins, 5614; 9th in Row
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 17 (UPI)Kermit Johnson became the first University of California, Los Angeles, back in history to gain 1,000 yards rushing and also scored three touchdowns as the Bruins registerd their ninth straight victory by defeating Oregon State, 5614, in the rain and mud today.

title: Syracuse Defeats B.C., 2413
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y., Nov. 17 (AP)Bob Mitch, a quarterback, scored twice on runs of four and one yards today, carrying Syracuse to a 2413 football victory over Boston College.

title: Chattanooga Wins In Last 4 Seconds
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 17 (AP) Micky Brokas passed for a 2point conversion with no time on the clock to give Chattanooga a 2524 surprise victory over Tampa tonight.

title: Somerset G.O.P. Hails Civil Service Defeat
description: SOMERVILLE  Somerset County Republicans, hailing the voters recent refusal to put county employes under the state's Civil Service system, assert that present Civil Service personnel methods are archaic, bureaucratic and. out of touch.

title: Pearson Named Stock Driver of Year
description: David Pearson, of Spartanburg, S.C., stock car racing's second millionaire driver, was named Martini & Rossi's driver of the year yesterday. He was awarded $7,500 to go along with the $213,966 he earned while winning 11 Grand National races this year.

title: An Authentic Colonial Repast
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.Last Sunday evening, 150 people enjoyed a gastronomic restoration of the Revolutionary War period. The event, a Colonial dinner, opened the bicentennial celebrations on Long Island.

title: The Chairman of the Board
description: PEKINGMao Tsetung is in effect chairman of the board of that great enterprise called China. No longer an active executive, 80 and semiretired in terms of administrative routine, he is still the ultimate boss for major policy decisions.

title: News of the Screen
description: Robert Altman, the director of the hit adaptation of Raymond Chandler's novel, The Long Goodbye, is ready to tackle three new film projects.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Although I have visited beautiful Candlewood Lake, Conn., my knowledge of the controversy over the housing development along its shores extends no further than the debate between Paul Davidoff and Malcolm Cowley [A Lake Is Backdrop for Debate on Suburban Integration Plan, Nov. 4].

title: One of the Great Sculptors of Modern Times
description: THE late Jacques Lipchitz was a sculptor whose career perfectly matched his opportunities. In 1909, when he arrived in Paris from his native Lithuania, he was 18. After a few years and some success as a betterthanaverage academic sculptor, Lipchitz was befriended by the Cubists notably Picasso and Juan Gris. Thereafter, following in the footsteps of his Cubist colleagues, he developedin almost model, programmatic termsa systematic application of Cubist principles to three dimensional forms that made him one of the great pioneers in Cubist sculpture.

title: A Goddess Watches Over The Honorable Guests At Tokyo's Mitsukoshi
description: THREE hundred years ago a Japanese merchant named Takatoshi Mitsui opened a dry goods store called Echigoya in the town of Edo, then. the headquarters of the Tokugawa warrior family who ruled Japan. Today the Tokugawa generals have faded into history, Edo has become Tokyo, and the shop once called Echigoya is Mitsukoshi, the most famous store in all Japan.

title: Driven, blazing, protean: from sexsymbol to revolutionary
description: I should say first what this book about Jane Fonda and her changes is not. While it is an unauthorized biography, it is not really an intimate one, as the subtitle claims. It keeps, for the most part, a respectful, truthful, journalistic distance (truthful because Thomas Kiernan doesn't know Jane Fonda very well, and because she refuses to have anything to do with his book); when it does come close, it is in the speculativepsychoanalytic, not the Jackie Kennedytelephotolens mode. So those who come to it hoping for either sexual or political scandal will be disappointed. What they will find is a sympathetic, dispassionate portrait of a confused and talented woman. The book deals pleasantly, competently, even poignantly (though not profoundly) with Jane's childhood under dour father Henry and its bequest of drives to later life and work, but fails to deal satisfactorily with her conversion to radical activism, or, perhaps, simply fails to make interesting something that intrinsically isn't.

title: Multinationals and Accountability
description: Most managers of multinational enterprises approach the issue of social responsibility with a touch of genuine indignation.

title: Mooty, Rowan in New A.K.C. Posts
description: Two medalwinning pilots are taking over new posts in the American Kennel Club's chain of command.

title: The Region
description: Abraham D. Beame is still weeks away from being installed as the city's 104th Mayor, but he will come home from a postelection vacation this week and face a challenge that may give him some new empathy with John Lindsay about the problems of running New York. The job: Find $300million for mass transit in the coming year.

title: Social Announcements
description: Weddings

title: The Great Jazz DreamCan It Come True?
description: THE great jazz dream of a permanent performing organization giving an annual season of concertsa dream that has been drifting through the jazz World ever since jazz began invading concert halls 30 years agois suddenly taking on an unprecedented semblance of reality.

title: And Now a Word for Platform Tennis
description: Platform tennis? You mean that game where you hit the ball off the chicken wire with a sawedoff kind of racquet?

title: Olympian Athletes on Wheels
description: Last Tuesday, a Braniff International airliner flew south to Lima, Peru, carrying the 47member United States team to the Fourth Annual Pan American Wheelchair Games. Among the athletes to participate in the weeklong games, which started last Friday, is John Behan of Montauk who described his feelings before departure.

title: Dr. Pascal F. Lucchesi, 70, Philadelphia Health Leader
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17 (AP)Dr. Pascal F. Lucchesi, a leading figure in public health and educatio nhere for more than 40 years, collapsed and died last night after making a speech at a dinner. He was 70 years old.

title: VIETNAM TYPHOON LEAVES 60 DEAD
description: TINH HOA, South Vietnam, Nov. 17 Tran Thip Phuong, who is 42 years old, has seven children and is pregnant, squatted in the dirt under the straw roof of a house by the side of Route 1, looking out at the rain.

title: BIRTH CURBS GAIN IN THE PHILIPPINES
description: MANILA, Nov. 17  In the three years, since a national familyplanning program was instituted by the Philippine Government, more than one million of the 39 million Filipinos have been enrolled in it.

title: MRS. JOSEPH E. CONLON
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 17Mrs. Margaret Farrell Conlon, a former member of the New Jersey Board of Children's Guardians, and the widow of Judge Joseph E. Conlon of the Essex County Court, died yesterday at her home, 156 Irving Avenue. Her age was 81.

title: Pact Set for Tunnel in English Channel
description: LONDON, Nov. 17  Prime Minister Heath and President Pompidou of France today concluded two days of talks and then toasted the signing of an historic treaty that will bring their countries closer together.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1DAVID DOUBILET

title: Marita Mulligan Wed To Gregory F. Conron
description: Miss Marita Cecilia Mulligan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. T. J. A. Mulligan of New York and Spring Lake, N. J., was married here yesterday to Gregory Francis Conron, son of Mrs. William H. Conron of Southport, Conn., and the late Mr. Conron. Msgr. Harry Byrne performed the ceremony in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.

title: A TV Season That Died
description: EVERYBODYtrade magazines, critics, Mr. Nielsen, the President of the United States, and the dying snakeleaf plant in my denseems to agree that the new TV season is a calamity. (According to the Psalms, I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint; my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.) The calamity is blamed by some on the staggered start of the TV season, owing to the writers' strike. It is blamed by others on the public's preoccupation with such trifles as impeachment. And it should be blamed by all on the poor quality of the new programs: sitcoms and shoot'emups recycled from the pulp of old network meatloaves.

title: PANEL ON CHOICES FOR U.S. IS NAMED
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday announced the appointment of 35 prominent figures in government, industry and education as members of the national study commission he has founded at President Nixon's request to anticipate the problems of the country's third century.

title: Millie's Boy
description: The search for one's identitythe Who is the real me? syndrome  is such a well thumbed theme that it takes a good deal of novelty to make it seem fresh. In Millie's Boy, Robert Newton Peck has thrown such a net of problems at his hero that simply to survive them

title: COVERNORS DOUBT NIXON WILL RESIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The ranks of the Republican Governors have shrunk from 32 to 18 during the Nixon Presidency so far.

title: UConn Is Tied, But Wins Title
description: KINGSTON, R,I., Nov. 17 (AP)Connecticut gained a 77 tie with Rhode Island and won the Yankee Conference football championship today with Eric Torkelson, UConn fullback, setting two school records.

title: Art
description: EN ROUTE to Terry Dintenfass's gallery at 18 East 67th Street one day last week to see June Leaf's new show, I found myself previewing it in my head, mentally jotting down an outline for this article on the basis of work in her 1968 New York debut at the Frumkin Gallery and in the summer, 1972, exhibition at Chicago's Museum of Contemporary Art, Chicago Imagist Art. If I had bothered to check ahead of time in Franz Schulze's Fantastic Images: Chicago Art Since 1945, published in connection with the latter show, I'd have known I was wasting my time, but the flow of consciousness went somelike this:

title: WATKINS GLEN FIRE KILLS 6 IN A HOUSE
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y., Nov. 17 (UPI)  Six persons were killed when a fire destroyed a twostory house here early today. Five other persons, including two infants, escaped with only minor injuries, authorities said.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONAt a suburban pizza parlor one evening last week, a woman with three schoolage children, a husband and two cars was wondering whether the energy squeeze would disrupt her family's life.

title: Man Who Helps G. O. P. Keep on Top in Nassau
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. LJoseph M. Margiotta, the 46yearold chairman of the Nassau County Republican Committee, which has been described as the most powerful Republican organization in the state, is alive and well here and extremely happy about his party's overwhelming victory in the county elections two weeks ago.

title: Letters Support Nixon
description: LAFAYETTE, Calif., Nov. 17 (AP)One of two California housewives who formed the Committee to Support President Nixon says the group has received letters of support from persons in more than 30 states. Bernice Pantell, who started the committee four weeks ago with another housewife, said the committee had gathered about 5,000 signatures so far from persons in more than 30 states to send to the White House.

title: Study Questions Belief That Home Is More Vital to Pupil Achievement Than the School
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 17 An international study of schools and learning is giving educators second thoughts about the growing belief that the home background of youngsters is more important to their academic achievement than anything the schools do.

title: Philippine Bamboo Pipe Organ, World's Oldest, to Be Restored
description: BONN, Nov. 17The oldest bamboo pipe organ in the world and for more than a century, possibly the only one has been brought to Bonn for a muchneeded restoration.

title: Photography
AROUND THE
description: Last call to plant bulbs.... Oil tools and store them. ... Dig and store gladiolus and dahlia tubers; shake off excess soil and cut off and discard tops; store indoors in a cool, dry place.... Mulch newly planted trees and shrubs. ... It is too early to put protective mulches on perennial beds or to hill up rose. bushes; wait a few weeks.

title: Vote Set on Disputed Garage in Queens
description: The city's Board of Standards and Appeals will decide on Tuesday whether to permit construction of a controversial fourlevel parking garage and car rental facility in the East Elmhurst section of Queens.

title: L.I. Woman Is Charged With Stabbing Death of Son
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Nov. 17 (UPI)A 41yearold woman has been arrested and charged with stabbing her son to death during an argument last night in their home, the East Hampton town police reported today.

title: Holy Cross Is Victim
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 17 (AP)  Two touchdowns by J. J. Jennings, the nation's leading collegiate scorer this season, paced Rutgers to a 277 victory today over Holy Cross.

title: Edison's Runners Win 10Mile Relay
description: Jon Williams led Edison High School of Queens to victory yesterday in the Brooklyn Tech fiveman, 10mile relay event at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: Lloyd Mangrum, Golfer, Dead; '46 U.S. Open Winner Was 59
description: APPLE VALLEY, Calif., Nov. 17 (UPI)Lloyd Mangrum, one of professional golf's big three of the nineteenforties, and fifties, along with Ben Hogan and Sam Snead, died of a heart attack today at his home. He was 59 years old.

title: Fairy Tale Vietcong Now Movie
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 13Once upon a time there was a Vietcong fairy And this fairy tale, made of animated characin living color, could have taught Walt Disney a thing or two about the skilluse of film.

title: Illinois Miners Returning After Strike on a Closing
description: PEORIA, Ill., Nov. 17 (AP)Union and industry officials said today that striking United Mine Workers in Illinois were returning to their jobs in compliance with Federal court injunctions.

title: Diabelli's Inane Waltz and Its 86 Progeny
description: THE Complete Diabell Variations. Rudolf Buchbinder, piano. Telefunken SMA 25091T/1.3, three disks.

title: ABPLANALP EYES SWAN TRACT
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Nov. 17  Although it has officially withdrawn its controversial bid to take over operation of Sullivan County International Airport, the Precision Valve Corporation of Robert H. Abplanalp has submitted another application to the county to lease a small trace of land Within the abandoned facility's 640 acres.

title: Concert: Musica Aeterna Plays Vienna Classics
description: Any Musica Aeterna concert at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium is among the more pleasant musical experiences in the city. Not that Frederic Waldman leads a virtuoso ensemble (though performances are never less than competent and well thought out). It is the total ambiance: good musicians playing together in a relaxed atmosphere, among friends, dealing with programs that show real imagination.

title: Mrs. Kimathea Rand Griffisant Floyd D. Hall Marry at St. Bartholomew's
description: Mrs. Kimathea Rand Gritfis and Floyd D. Hall, chairman of the board and president of Easterie Airline's, were married herb yesterday at St. Bartholoyomew's EpiscoTerenc J. Finlay. A reception followed at the River Club.

title: When Answerable Courages Are Called For
description: LONDONThe genius of America, I believe, is to organize free and strongminded men to solve great problems. It is to meet and overcome challenges. It is to generate in the end what William Bradford, in the seventeenth century, called answerable courages.

title: Haggling Is a High Art At the SabzehMaidan Bazaar in Teheran
description: POETS to the contrary, east and west do meet, and seldom more successfully than when western travelers venture into the great covered bazaars of the Middle East if any single place captures the indefinable essence of life in the east, it's the bazaar  a seething, irresistible warren merchandiseladen stalls in twisting, unnamed lanes. An eddying flood of humanity. Legendary bargains, but also equally legendary swindles perpetrated on the unwary.

title: News Summary and Index
Newsmen Report They Saw Causeway Being Built at Suez
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 17 (AP) Israel was pushing thousands of tons of dirt into the Suez Canal today to build a land bridge across the closed waterway, newsmen reported.

title: November 22, 1963
description: Here on the 10th anniversary of President John F. Kennedy's assassination, David Belin has come forward to try to restore sanity and reason to the morbid atmosphere of suspicion that still hovers over the tragedy in Dallas.

title: GREECE RETURNS TO MARTIAL LAW TO HALT FIGHTING
description: ATHENS, Nov. 17President George Papadopoulos imposed martial law today after a night of street clashes in Athens between the police and student and worker demonstrators.

title: People and Business
description: What is described as a broadly expanded fairadvertising program for 1974 has been announced by the New Jersey Automobile Dealers Association.

title: Teachers College Plan to Close Private School Angers Parents
description: Teachers College of Columbia University, in a step that has aroused bitterness in the Morningside Heights community, has decided to close an innovative private elementary school it has operated for the last 25 years.

title: Skylab 3
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla.  For six months now, a huge observatorylaboratory called Skylab has been orbiting high above the earth, the durable base of operations for an unspectacular but successful experiment in living and working in space.

title: Okker 63, 64 Victor
description: LONDON, Nov. 17  Tom Okker overcame a wrist injury to pull off a surprisingly easy victory over Ilie Nastase in the final of the Dewar Cup Grand Prix indoor tennis tournament at Royal Albert Hall tonight.

title: TransitData Signs to Go Up In 2 Boroughs by YearEnd
description: The first of 28 transitinformation signs at key bus stops in downtown Brooklyn and in shopping districts in Jamaica, Queens, will be installed by the end of the year, Mayor Lindsay said today.

title: Formality and Farce
description: Whenever I am in a grumpy mood, says Emily Pig, I always have a little snack.

title: His own one and only life
description: My grandfather, who as a boy in the Mississippi Valley in the 1880's actually met one of Mark Twain's border scamps, went fishing in Canada in 1931. When he returned people asked him how he liked it up North. He liked it fine, he said. Canada, he said, was just like the United States used to be; before everyone went crazy. Now that's nostalgia. One by one I count the failures, wrote William Alexander Percy in Lanterns on the Levee, at law undistinguished, at teaching unprepared, at soldiering average, at citizenship unimportant, at love secondbest.... I am not proud, but I am not ashamed. What have defeats and failures to do with the good life? That's autobiography. Huck on the raft, George Willard in Winesburg, Nick Adams in the Michigan woods, even frail Holden Caulfield running away from schoolthose are real boy's stories.

title: Susan Handal Wed Here To Philip Ward Warner
description: St. Vincent Ferrer's Roman Catholic Church was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Handal, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham S. Handal of New York, to Philip Ward Warner, son of Mrs. John M. Warner of Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia, and the late Mr. Warner.

title: Science Instructors Plan Parley on '74
description: PEMBERTON  Science teachers from throughout the state and the Delaware Valley will meet at Burlington County College on Dec. 8 for a conference on New Directions in Science '74.

title: THAILAND GIVING REIN TO FREEDOM
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 5Civil liberties are flourishing here after years of supression under the military dictatorship overthrown last month In a student uprising.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A threatened strike by 30,000 taxi drivers here was averted early yesterday after a 12hour bargaining session. Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, said negotiators for the New York Taxi Drivers Union and the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, representing 70 fleet operators, had agreed to submit unresolved issues to subcommittees. Issues that the subcommittees cannot clear up will be submitted to binding arbitration, Mr. McDonnell said. Talks at the Prince George Hotel continued past the midnight expiration of the drivers' old contract and ended at 5:30 A.M. with the mediator's announcement that there would be no walkout.

title: A BLACK ELECTED EPISCOPAL BISHOP
description: A 44yearold black clergyman, the Rev. Harold Louis Wright, was elected Suffragan Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese Of. New York yesterday.

title: Lower East Side Group Will Use Panic Button Against Muggers
description: Beginning late this month, 135 residents of the Lower East Side will be armed with panic buttons  devices resembling pocketsized transistor radios that are the latest weapon against muggers.

title: LOW VISION'S ROLE IN DRIVING ARGUED
description: Specialists here are debating whether the legally blind should continue to be licensed to drive.

title: Ma and Pa and JohnBoy in mythic America
description: A bobwhite cry breaks the quiet of night among the firs and pines of the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia. ... Good night, Ma. Good night, JohnBoy. Good night, Pa. Good night, JohnBoy.... and the lights of the Walton house on Walton's Mountain sometime in the early nineteenthirties dim and a million viewers turn away from their television sets, eyes wet, souls heavy with false memory and hopeless longing. C.D.S. has filled another Thursday night with nostalgia, bathos, soap opera, formula plot, tearjerking junk, and I and all those other viewers share a moment of tender shame at having been so painfully touched by such obvious commercial exploitation.

title: East Side Clinches Tie For Newark City Title
description: Newark East Sled clinched at least a tie for the City, League championship yesterday wtih a 140 victory over Shabazz, while Barringer, the defending champion defeated contending Newark Central.

title: Experts to Discuss Child Development
description: EAST BRUNSWICK  The New Jersey Coalition for Children has announced a statewide conference on child development. It will be held on Nov. 29 at the Ramada Inn here.

title: Architecture
description: YOU'VE got to be around this town for about 10 years and watch the progress of a major project or two to develop a proper sense of the ludicrous, or the miraculous, or both. That the two are not mutually exclusive gives New York its special flavor. It is also a New York truism that if you wait long enough for something to happen, it will happen, but not remotely in the way you expected. It can be an epic disaster or a cockeyed miracle, as in the case of the new Police Headquarters downtown.

title: No one can tell him he's 6 feet tall
description: The new Mayor of the richest and most troubled city in the world, Abraham D. Beame, is 5 feet 2 inches tall and 67 years old. Apart from these two handicaps, if that's what they are, the public knows little about him that is accurate, believing him to be both a nitpicker., which he is not, and a political centrist, which he is not either. There are amazingly vocal critics who claim he will be a disaster as Mayor. There are an equal number of not unintelligent people who believe he can save the city. They seem to be afraid to say so out loud, mainly because Abe Beame is 5 feet 2 inches tall and 67 years old. America, after all, is the new race of giants. Young giants. In recent years we have had to go elsewhere even to find our best jockeys. Abe Beame is not a jockey. He's possibly the tiniest Mayor this side of the Orient, and possibly the oldest. Are these mere details? I'm not making jokes. The incumbent he supplants is, and has been for the past eight years, one of the tallest, handsomest, youngest rulers in the world, a kind of crown prince to a constituency that evaporated before his eyes.. Abe Beame is not gorgeous, and he's no price. Can he rule or not?

title: Street Repairs Cut To Aid Traffic Flow During the Holidays
description: Transportation Administrator Constantine SidamonEristoff has announced that rigid restrictions on streetrepair and construction work will be in effect, starting tomorrow, to ease traffic flow during the busy holiday season.

title: Antitheft Barriers Banned
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 17 (UPI)The New Castle County Council has unanimously approved an ordinance prohibiting the construction of harriers in front of shopping centers and grocery stores and requiring the removal of existing barTiers, which are designed to curb theft and vandalism of shopping carts. A Council member, Lois Park, said store owners had 30 days to comply.

title: For Families of Missing, a Place to Hope
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 17They crowd around a bulletin board covered with photographs of groups of haggard, bowed mensome with their hands tied, all downcast.

title: Insurance for TaxExempts
description: The municipal bond business asserts proudly that the securities in which it deals have a safety record against default second only to those of the United States Government.

description: MORGES, Switzerland, Nov. 17 (Reuters)  The World Wildlife Fund has announced a project in collaboration with the Indonesian Government to save the last 15 Javan tigers from extinction.

description: HAMPTON, Va., Nov. 17The New York Nets concluded the longest trip in the club's history tonight by defeating the Virginia Squires, 11597, at the Hampton Roads Coliseum.

title: MINERS CONTINUE KENTUCKY STRIKE

description: British doctors have reported the discovery of a test that detects severe, paralyzing brain and spinal cord birth defects, early in pregnancy from a few; drops of the mother's blood.

description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Photography
description: WHILE it appears we won't have Dick Nixon to kick around much longer, his benighted attitudes will be with us for years to come, embodied in the present Supreme Court of the United States. This avenging legacy to the American people may disown its maker in his lastditch struggle, but the Burger Court's regressive philosophy has been expressed clearly in numerous decisions. Nowhere has this occurred more insidiously than in its rulings on obscenity last June 21.

Attendance Is Up by 116 At Private Schools
description: SUMMIT  Despite inflation, a decline in membership and the elimination of some state benefits, the New Jersey Association of Independent Schools reports increases in both student enrollment and faculty.

Sahm Jr. of Indianapolis, a University of Notre Dame freshman, was elected today as president of the Catholic Youth Organization's national executive council. description: To the Editor:

title: Army Short on Manpower
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (AP)  Pentagon officials predict that the Army will continue to fall short of its recruiting goals, and will be 15,000 to 20,000 men short by next June. However, William K. Brehm, Assistant Secretary of Defense for Manpower and Reserve Affairs, said Thursday the shortage was not severe enough to require reinstatement of the draft, which ended last December.

title: The End of Book World
description: Amid all the carnage along the Potomac these days, at least one recent casualty warrants lamentation by the functionally literate. And while there are surely enough such wouldbe mourners to fill the Jefferson Memorial to overflowing, it is a wake where even the best and the brightest would likely be among the noshows. Culture has never been the long suit in the nation's capital, a town where long hair is an allSousa program at the Kennedy Center featuring Fred Waring and the Pennsylvanians, Where the most highly regarded artistic ensemble in sight is the Washington Redskins, and where the last respected folks on the blockthe Justices of the Supreme Court have linked up with the derrieregrade by thumbing down Fanny Hill, Deep Throat and other no doubt dubious forms of free expression.

Georgian New York is suggested by a few crumbling houses and stubborn ghosts. Greek Revival New York struggles for survival. Victorian New York is fair for the bulldozer.

Brindley, a retired vice president of the national advertising and public relations firm of Doremus & Co., died Thursday, apparently of a heart attack, aboard the cruise ship Sagafjord in the Pacific. He was 68 years old and lived in Kentfield, Calif. Mr. Brindley retired last December as manager of the San Francisco office of Doremus.

Clifton Jr., for homicide, and has once again raised questions about the methods of narcotics enforcement personnel.

title: What's Opened In the Theater?
description: BOOM BOOM ROOM, the New York Shakespeare Festival Lincoln Center production of a play by David Rabe, got eight favorable reviews (Gottfried, Women's Wear; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Lewis, Bergen Record; Gaver, UPI; Harris, WCBSTV; Virgil Scudder, WINSRadio; Alvin Klein, WNYCRadio; Kroll, Newsweek), four mixed reviews (Wallach, Newsday; Stewart Klein, WNEWTV; Kalem, Time; Clurman, Nation) and 12 unfavorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watt, News; Watts, Post; Glover, AP; Holder, WNBCTV; Sanders, WABCTV; Bookspan, WPIXTV; Woodruff, WMCARadio; Novick, Village Voice; Simon, New York; Stasio, Cue; Hewes, Saturday Review/World). Clive Barnes: The New York Shakespeare Festival's first play at the Vivian Beaumont Theater is the fourth play by David Rabe that Joseph Papp has produced, and it is also the first play by David Rabe that does not deal with Vietnam. The problem is to decide what it does deal with. It is possibly intended as a portrait of a young tramp as a neurotic. Its heroine is Chrissie, a gogo girl in Philadelphia, who dreams ofwell, she seems to dream of very little really. The trouble with the play is that we are asked to spend three hours with Chrissie, and we really know no more about her at the end than we did at the beginning. It would have been quicker to send a telegram. Mr. Rabe was not helped at all by the production, which seemed to fasten on the weakest aspects of the play. The play is said to be directed by Mr. Papp, but, of course, as has been announced, Julie Bovasso was in charge until a few days ago. Still, as it is, Mr. Papp must take the rap. Let us hope that the Shakespeare Festival will have better luck next time. For Walter Kerr, see Page 3.

title: Late TV Listings

title: Ballet: Pennsylvanians Step Out
description: The Pennsylvania Ballet is to make its New York home at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, which is very nice for the Brooklyn Academy of Music. It is pretty nice for the Pennsylvania Ballet as well for the Opera House at Brooklyn offers a grand settirig for this splendid young company.

title: Dinner for six ... under $15 ... wine included; It can be done
description: When a French chef becomes involved in a dinner party, most people expect a very luxurious menu. But the fact is that most professional chefs are more concerned with good eating than with luxury. And, of course, our knowledge and skill help us produce better meals for less money. I recently cooked a dinner for six at a total cost of $6, but this admittedly limited me to a very simple menu. With just a little more money, I can produce a classic, elegant dinner for six people (the one outlined on these pages is an example) for less than, say, $2.50 a person. The menu presented today consists of consomme, chicken in vinegar, puffed potatoes, a salad, cheese and a superb orange tart. The total cost of the meal, which included two bottles of wine as well as a predinner aperitif, was $14.59 ($2.43 a person). The prices given are those that were in effect on Sept. 24 at Sloan's Supermarket at 110th Street and Broadway. The cost would be lower today since the prices of chicken and some vegetables have come down.

title: A Brothel on Federal Land Is Ordered Evicted by Judge
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 17 (UPI)The madam of a brothel on Federal land has lost a bid to block her eviction.

title: Thefts Help L.S.U. Take 9th in Row

title: Proof Is Biggest Burden in Drug Cases
description: Pete Rozelle's drug problem boils down to this: how do you prove a player is taking drugs when the player himself denies it? Suspicion, accusation, even reasonable certainty, come easy. But proof, the sort that will stand up in a court of law, is another matter.

title: FUEL CRISIS SEEN AS BOON TO CITIES

title: New Bedford Gets Land

description: WASHINGTON TOWNSHIPThanks to Vincent Panella of this Morris County community, the wild turkey is safe from extinction in both Morris and Warren Counties for some years to come.

title: The Finest Judges Money Can Buy
description: Charles Ashman's welldocumented dissection of the third branch of Government provides a perceptive and rare closeup of the inner sanctum of judicial life. The Finest Judges Money Can Buy is a brilliant model for sparking social criticism packaged for mass appeal. Ashman is a young law professor turned author with a taste for political irony and a highly sensitive flair for popular biography. Last year his irreverent sketch of our strangelovian Secretary of State (Kissingerthe Adventures of Super  Kraut) amused and alarmed readers around the*world.

Y., disclosed yesterday that he had already spent more than $100,000 for the start of a major effort to win the Democratic nomination for Governor, and to convince politicians that he was in the race to stay even to the point of giving up his Congressional seat.

title: Parking Lots for Car Pools Approved in Suffolk

title: Mussic
description: FRANCIS TOYE, writing about Rossini's L'Italiana In Algeri, referred to the opera as an examplethe first example, indeed of the irresistible appeal of the great laugh that Rossini brought into music. It is a fine term: great laugh. And it is correct. Rossini in real life was a noted wit who refused to take anything seriously, and his comic operas express a kind of joie de vivre that make them eternally fascinating. The essence of their charm is that Rossini wrote with tongue in cheek, and we realize that they are tongue in cheek. He was having fun, and the fun communicates itself.

title: The Federal Role Does It Make a Difference?
description: Since the Great Society years of the mid1960's, when Federal involvement in American education took a quantum jump, the effectiveness of Washington's role in helping children learn has been a subject of intense debate.

The ceremony was performed in the chapel of the Riverside Church by the Rev. Robert Polk, assisted by the Rev. George B. Ford.

title: As Some Shows SelfDestruct, Diversions Are At Hand

Not at all. There's another batch on the back burner, and the publicrelations machines are already geared up for still another barrage of press releases and press junkets. Only the programs selfdestruct., The game itself is unending.

title: BLACK ACTIVIST SEES NEW SOUTH
description: The year that the Black Panther and black power emerged as the symbols of a new direction for black politics in the South1966was the year that whites were urged to leave the movement and work in their own communities.

title: PRESIDENT IS OPEN ON GAS RATIONING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17President Nixon expressed strong personal distaste tonight for governmental rationing but would not rule out completely the possibility that gasoline would be rationed in the months ahead.

title: Headliners
description: Here we go again. New Yorkers are about to pay higher prices for two basic commodities: telephone service and milk. To offset rising operating costs, the state Public Service Commission last week authorized a $304million gross increase in ratesabout 15.4 per centfor the New York Telephone Company as of Nov. 28. In New York City, that means an increase of $2.14 in the average monthly residence bill (now $13.90 before taxes). The last rate increase, 22 per cent, was in February, 1972. The price of milk is expected to go up 3 or 4 cents a quart on Dec. 1 as a result of pay raises, agreed upon last week, for employes of distributors and rawmilk price increases decreed recently by the Government. the city, the typical price of milk will jump from 39 cents a quart to 42 or 43 cents. Last May the price 34 cents.

title: Whetting the Appetite in Short Hills
description: SHORT HILLSMunching on madeleines. That's what babies do in their strollers as their mothers wheel them through the Food Department at Bloomingdale's, here in the Short Hills Mall. And Junior doesn't even know that he's enjoying a classical French treat.

title: Music Theater? Isn't Pure Music Enough?
description: WHAT impels a composer poser of serious music to inject theater into his work? Isn't pure music enough? In the days when opera was popular entertainment and a Rossini could grow rich enough at it to retire early, the answers were easy. But more lately, when opera has evolved into a prohibitively expensive pastime for the relatively few, musical purity has come back into its own. Many composers with a subliminal yen for the theater have to console themselves with the thought that mixing music and the drama is a low form of artistic activity. Music, they say, is Bach's Art of Fugue, the abstract arrangement of notes, and contemplation of this frozen architecture is the highest form of esthetic experience.

title: Miami, Ohio, Wins On 95Yard Return
description: OXFORD, Ohio, Nov. 17 (AP)Miami of Ohio macle a gameopening 95yard kickoff return by Larry Harper stand up for a 60 victory over Cincinnati today.

title: Princeton 3013 Loser
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 17  Yale had a difficult time wrestling down the tattered Tiger today.

title: Nigerians Busy as They Prepare to Be Counted
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 17Nigeria, Africa's most populous nation, is mobilizing to determine just how many people she has.

title: Welfare Policy In Nassau Disputed
description: MINEOLA, L.I.Taxpayers have been demanding cuts in welfare spending, and in Nassau, during last month alone, more than 1,000 recipients were stricken from the welfare rolls. County officials see the trend as a major achievement. Those who have been cut feel otherwise.

title: Arizona Upset by Air Force
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Nov. 17 (AP)  Steve Heil stopped a 2point conversion attempt with 27 seconds left to preserve a 2726 upset victory by the Air Force over Arizona today.

title: HOTEL HASSCARS OF ATHENS CLASH
description: ATHENS, Nov. 17By noon today they had replaced the bloodsoaked cushions on the lobby sofa of the Acropole Palace Hotel where a student demonstrator bled to death early this morning.

title: M'CARTHY OPPOSES IMPEACHING NIXON
description: Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy said yesterday that little good would be served by the impeachment of President Nixon.

title: Wayside Defeats South Shore, 2812, for P.S. A. L. Title
description: Pierre Davis scored three touchdowns yesterday as he led Bayside to the Public Schools Athletic League title and helped prove a point.

title: Springfield: Blend of Old and New
description: SPRINGFIELDThe statue of a Minuteman in front of the old First Presbyterian Church on Morris Avenue is just one reminder for the 18,000 residents of this Union County community that their town traces back to, the Revolutionary War. Additional evidence is supplied by the Colonial decor of a great many houses and public buildings, and by street names that recall some of the battles fought in this area or the military leaders who were in command. It is further elaborated upon by oldtimers, who quote from history books or point to sites that figured prominently in the early days of this country.

title: Weinberger Doubts Gas Curb Need
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI)  Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that, the Government could discourage gasoline consumption without rationing or an increasedi tax.

title: 50Mile Speed Limit: For, Mainst and Effects
description: TRENTON  New Jersey was a pioneer last week in President Nixon's program to curb energy consumption by reducing highway speeds and, although compliance was generally good, the acceptance of fuel conservation as an automatic result of slower driving was far from unanimous.

title: Driven by a desire for sheer destruction
description: Most of Erich Fromm's 20 books, including this one, could bear the same subtitle: In Search of Human Nature. The radical daring of Freud Fromm has writtenwas to put forth a normative theory of man, a concept of what a healthy human being should be; but because Freud's vision was limited by his cultural background, he was mistaken in many regardias Fromm believes most notions of human nature have been mistaken and socially selfserving. Nonetheless, for Fromm the mission of psychology, the Science of Man, should still be to discover the inherent nature of man. Fromm began to discern the broad outlines of human nature in the 1930's, and his main effort since has been to enlarge and refine upon his basic discoveries and apply them to social problems. Like the portrait of the dead Dorian Gray, Fromm's shows have been.

title: Ban on Sexy Ads Sought
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov 17 (UPI)An ordinance was proposed posed to the City Commissior this week aimed at eliminating sexy advertisements.

title: A tidal more radical than the Civil War itself
description: A tidal wave has transformed southern Spain even more radically than the terrible Civil War itselfbringing 27 million tourists to the country in 1971 alone. This book about Tajos, a small mountain village seven miles from the coast, is about the past somewhat more than about the present:

title: Stremmel, M'Duffie Wins Jersey Races
description: WEST PATERSON, N. J., Nov. 17Greg Stremmel of Gateway High and Steve McDuffie of Neptune had the fastest times among the seven individual winners at the New Jersey scholastic group crosscountry championships today at Garret Mountain.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Insurance Rates On Home Policies Now Vary Widely, Buyers Informed
description: Thousands of New York State householders can now save themselves money if they shop around for their homeowners' insurance. They should scout the field, much as they would if they were buying a car or a washing machine. But few people do.

title: HEALTH SERVICE ACT IS SIGNED BY NIXON
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 17 (UPI)  President Nixon signed legislation today authoriztng the spending of $185million over three years for planning, development and research in emergency medical services.

title: To the middle
description: ACROSS

title: S. L. Houston Fiance Of Sheryl S. Graham
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 17The engagement of Miss Sheryl Suzette Graham to Samuel Lee Houston has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Robert Graham, parents orthe future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Houston of Panola, Ala.

title: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Fire
description: LOS ANGELES The most extraordinary Hollywood bargain of the last few years was sealed recently over a tray of diet cherry cola, diet red apple, diet root beer, Tab, and one glass of diet chocolate soda.

title: Women Get the Short End of the Shtick
description: SHOW biz is show biz and almost anything's good for a shtick, but some things are still sacred. No television comic has yet done a boffo impersonation of Cesar Chavez slipping on a grape peel. Or gotten off a joke about how the Oglala Sioux would have been only too happy to give back Wounded Knee. . . if only they hadn't drunk so much fire water and forgotten where they put it.

title: JESUIT HAILS CHINA FOR BIRTH CONTROL
description: ROME, Nov. 17A Jesuit sociologist stated in a lecture here this week that Communist China had the most efficient birthcontrol system, and, predicted that other large societies would follow its example.

title: Gonzalez Retains Flyweight Crown
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 17 (AP)Venezuela's Betulio Gonzales retained his World Boxing Council flyweight title today by stopping Alberto (Costenito) Morales of Mexico at 1 minute 40 seconds of 11th round.

title: Mickey Mouse in Newark
description: NEWARK  Bamberger's will open its sixth annual Holiday Art Exhibit tomorraw with a remarkable collection of 500 pieces of Mickey Mouse memorabilia. Quite apart from the irrepressible Disney character himself, the exhibit has the added distinction of not having a single piece of plastic in it.

title: Cooler Economy
description: The fuel shortage has done more, than send householders to their thermostats to turn down the temperature  it has also sent economists back to their slide rules to turn down their forecasts for the nation's economy next year.

title: Notes: Fly MeIf We Have Gas
description: IT'S going to be a long winter of discontent for the airlines. As it, begins, they face the unenviable task of informing passengers that while they have endured delays, burnpings and other inconveniences in the past, they haven't really seen anything yet. The shortage of jet fuel, which has aIready forced domestic carriers to cancel more than 400 flights a day, means that the choice of departure times will be sharply reduced and that many of the planes that do fly will be fully booked, with consequent greater congestion at airports and longer delays in baggage collection. Many of the cuts are falling on the transcontinental routesbetween New York and Chicago, Las Vegas and the West Coast, for example  and they're also hitting the route to San Juan, P. R.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENNA, Nov. 17 (AP)Major Middle East oilproducing countries met briefly with the major international oil's companies today, but the session was adjourned without reaching agreement on how to determine oil prices.

title: 2 New Sewage Plants Curbing Pollution.
description: WEST DEPTFORD TOWNSHIP  The first regional sewagetreatment plant to be built with money from the $242  million clean  waters bond issue of 1969 was dedicated here yesterday.

title: Music in Review
description: Theodore Lettvin's piano recital at Hunter College last Sunday afternoon rested on a solid base of Central European romantic standards (Beethoven's Waldstein Sonata, the two Brahms rhapsodies, three Chopin selections) with two comparative novelties for a touch of variety (sonatas by J. C. Bach and Weber).

title: Six Are Injured in Ulster In Attacks on Catholic Bars
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 17 (UPI)  At least six persons were injured today in a series of bomb attacks against bars owned and frequented by Roman Catholics. The police blamed Protestant extremists seeking to prevent any relaxation of tension between Northern Ireland's two feuding religious communities.

title: Holiday Travel Cut
description: With fuel in short supply and airlines curtailing schedtiles, travel has been severely crimped this Thanksgiving holiday. Page 58.

title: Miss Irene Almirall Sets June Nuptials
description: SOUTH SALEM, N. Y., Nov. 17Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd V. Almirall have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Irene Almirall, to Wayne Petrie Hobin, son of Mr, and Mrs. William M. Hobin of East Rutherford, N. J.

title: DAMAGED CROPS PUZZLE EXPERTS
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Nov. 17Extensive damage to lettuce, barley, alfalfa and other leafy vegetable crops has been reported in the Orange, Riverside and San Bernardino Counties areas surrounding Los Angeles. Scientists attribute the damage to an unexplainable air pollution episode.

title: 4Goal Spree Tops Stars,
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 17  The New York Rangers recovered tonight against the Minnesota North Stars in their first National Hockey League encounter of the season. The 63 Ranger victory came on the heels of a 102 shellacking they absorbed Thursday night from the Boston Bruins.

title: Shopping Mall Planned
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 17 (AP) A $15million shopping mall will be constructed near here, it has, been announced by a Philadelphia developer and John Wanamaker's. Work will begin in 1975. The mall will be situated at the intersection of Interstate Route 95 and Delaware Route 7.

title: Susan Schneider Bride Of David Norman Ness
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 17  Miss Susan Scott Schneider, daughter of Dr. Ralph F. Schneider, corporate medical director of the Exxon Corporation, and Mrs. Schneider of Garden City and Lake Placid, N. Y., was married, here this afternoon to David Norman Ness, an associate professor and special assistant to the dean of the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. P. Norman Ness of Minneapolis.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: THE news of the Forum in the Vivian Beaumont Theater's being renamed the Mitzi E. Newhouse has, coupled with recent similar occurrences, given me great cause for distress.

title: Pope Calls Gains by Women Foreseeable and Desirable
description: ROME, Nov. 13  Pope Paul VI today called for a progressive equalization of the basic rights of man and woman.

title: Four novelists in search of themes
description: If a novel is an imitation world, then the characters must be imitation people and the narrator must be an imitation priest, interpreting and executing the instructions of the author, who must be an imitation God. If that's what a novel is, however, what connects it with reality? Very little. An imitation God can do whatever he wants, and his priest is typically a martinet whose will is irresistible.

title: 2 City Council Panels List Hearing for Week
description: The following are open hearings of City Council committees to be held this week:

title: Bassist Seeks New Sounds
description: NEWARKVinnie Burke is a man of principle. And for the last ten years, his principles have been costing him money.

title: A Struggle for Power Under Way in the Legislature
description: TRENTON  Commanding one of the biggest legislative majorities in New Jersey's political history, the newly elected Democrats in the Assembly and State Senate have begun jockeying for power and leadership posts in the new Legislature that will convene here on Jan. 15.

title: Kennedy Son's Leg Amputated Because of Cancerous Growth
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) The 12yearold son of Senator Edward M. Kennedy had his right leg amputated today in an operation for cancer.

title: Name of Sigma Delta Chi Is Changed at Convention
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 17 (AP) Delegates to the national convention of Sigma Delta Chi, national journalistic society, voted 113 to 77 today to change the name of the organization, which was founded in 1909.

title: Aid to Minority Business a Lever for Nixon in '72
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Nixon Administration's program to provide funds and other aid to minority businessmen was turned in 1972 into the vehicle by which the President's reelection effort sought nonwhite support.

title: Nixon On The Road
description: WASHINGTONpresident Nixon is now running around the country like a traveling salesman and he has relieved the pressure for his resignation by opening himself to questions and promising full disclosure of all relevant Watergate evidences but he is still living with two nightmares.

title: Randall Blank to Marry Linda C. Woycik
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Nov. 17 Miss Linda Christine Woycik, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Woycik, and Randall L. Blank, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Blank of New York, plan to be married next Saturday in the United Nations Chapel in New York. Announcement of their engagement has been made by the prospective bride's parents.

title: Siegel, Faulkner Gain Tennis Final
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Nov. 17Steve Siegel, the topseeded player, and unseeded Ed Faulkner reached the final of the New Jersey state men's indoor tennis championship tonight.

title: Mr. Nixon Makes His Move
description: WASHINGTONHis most steadfast supporters had begun openly questioning whether he could resurrect his Presidency and Richard Nixon conceded that he had gone through seven months of pure hell over Watergate. But last week, in a broad counteroffensive, the President began trying to blunt the attempt by his critics to impeach him, to demonstrate his capacity and determination to govern, and to persuade a doubting nation that he deserved to complete his second term in the White House.

title: Maryland Beats Clemson, 2813
description: CLEMSON, S. C., Nov. 17 (AP)Louis Carter scored three touchdownsthe first on a 50yard runas Maryland beat Clemson, 28 to 13, in an Atlantic Coast Conference game today.

title: Katherine McCarthy Is Engaged
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 17Mr. and Mrs. Daniel V. McCarthy have made known the engagement, of their daughter, Miss Katherine McCarthy, to Kevin Ecclesine, son of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Ecclesine of White Plains. A wedding in March is planned.

title: Scarlett Leas Plans Nuptials in June
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17Mrs. Wanamaker Leas of Chestnut Hill has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Scarlett Leas, to William Douglas Robertson, son of Donald. L. Carter of South Dartmouth, Mass. and the late Dr. Gordon Farquhar Robertson of Greenwich, Conn.

title: Other Men's Daughters By Richard Stern. 244 pp. New York: E. P. Dutton & Co. $6.95.
description: Despite Henry James's unshrill insistence that we must grant the artist his subject, his donnde, that we must not take the fearful responsibility of prescribing startingpoints, it's difficult to imagine any sensitive reader not finding himself absolutely compelled to caution Richard Stern against' the destructive folly of publishing a novel about a post40yearold Harvard physiologist abandoning his wife and four children for a carnal (and surely doomed) liaison with a 20yearold summer session student from Swarthmore (tall, slightly prognathotis, browneyed . . . her hair waterfalled to the top thoracic vertebra human sunflower).

title: Views Linking Race and I.Q. Called Unfit to Discuss
description: A New York University conference was told yesterday that theories linking intelligence to race by heredity were unfit for college classrooms because they are as untrue as the world is flat.'

title: Publishers Group to Move
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 17 (UPI)The Southern Newspaper Publishers Association has voted to move its headquarters from Chattanooga to Atlanta and has appointed Reed Sarratt as executive vice president. Tams Bixby 3d, publisher of the Muskogee (Okla.) Daily Phoenix and TimesDemocrat, was elected Wednesday as president at the association's 20th convention.

title: Trash Men Facing New Curb By State
description: TRENTONThe Cahill administration, which already has banned the dumping of butof state garbage in certain parts of New Jersey, is now proposing tougher, restrictions for refuse haulers in the state itself.

title: Nixon Weighs New Plan to Shield Citizens Privacy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The Nixon Administration is considering proposing early next year legislation designed to protect citizens from wiretapping, bugging and other forms of invasion of privacy.

title: World's Business Slowing
description: Evidence is mounting that the worldwide economic boom of 197273 has cooled off and that a less frantic period of economic growth has set in. Whether the slowdown deteriorates into something more serious remains to be seen. The onrush of the oil shortage has clouded

title: A New Cooper Union Emerging
description: Like a dowager too proud for a facelift but in need of support, the Cooper Union Foundation Building has donned a 20thcentury version of the corset and hoopskirt.

title: Eleanor W. Watrous Plans Bridal
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Nov. 17Dr. and Mrs. Joseph B. Watrous Jr. of Binghamton and Hallstead, Pa., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eleanor Williams Watrous, to Ralph Lewis Abelow, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ira M. Abelow of Bel Air, Md.

title: Polarization in Spain
description: When Generalissimo Franco presided recently over meeting of Spain's only legal political body, the National Council of the Movement, he heard his Labor Minister declaim on the need to accentuate the political participation of all Spaniards. But 24 hours earlier, police had arrested 113 leaders of a wideranging spectrum of antiFranco organizations as they met in the parish house a Barcelona Catholic church to demand basic freedom and to advance the cause of Catalonian autonomy independence.

title: Columbia Routed, 428
description: With Marty Vaughn leading the attack with an explosive aerial display, Pennsylvania kept its slim hopes alive for a firstplace tie in the Ivy League race yesterday by crushing Columbia's eleven, 428, at Baker Field.

title: 2 Climbers Die in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 17 (UPI)Two young mountain climbers from the United States and New Zealand were killed attempting to scale 10,600foot Mount Fitz Roy in southern Argentina, one of their comrades reported yesterday. The American was identified as Steve McAndrews, 23 years, old, of Iowa City, Iowa.

title: The Conflicting Loyalties of Andre Masson
description: ANDRE MASSON is, at the age of 77, one of the few senior survivors of the School of Paris. Though overshadowed by the greater fame (and greater accomplishment) of Joan Mir and Max Ernst, Masson is nonetheless a figure of great interest, and it says something about our tenuous relation to the School of Parisat any level below the very highest, anywaythat no American museum has seen fit to mount a comprehensive retrospective show of his work. One would gladly forgo one of the many, redundant exhibitions lavished on the art of Jean Dubuffet for a single serious survey of Masson's, but no such survey has been forthcoming, Masson remains for the moment an artist we know only in fragments fragments that impress us, tantalize us and quite often disappoint us, fragments that sustain our interest even when they do not satisfy it.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Nov. 25New York Region, Sports Car Club of America Solo 2 at Nassau Beach, Long Beach, L. 1. Registration: 9 A.M., first car off 11. Information: Art Trier, phone (516)4730639.

title: Bonomi Rich in Money and Racing Skills
description: Carlo Bonomi, This year's world offshore powerboat racing champion, is a rich man. He was rich before he entered the sport three years ago, and he will be richer still because of his meteoric success.

title: Big Money Talks
description: WASHINGTONThe list of companies that have admitted using corporate funds to help insure the reelection of President Nixon, an illegal act, now totals seven. And officials of six of these companies came before the Senate Watergate committee last week to talk about their part in raising an unprecedented $60million for the 1972 Nixon campaign. What the committee wanted to know was not just what the companies did, but how and also why respected chief executives of the firms involved knowingly broke the law.

title: Philby
description: Kim Philby's was an extraordinary career, and not the east remarkable thing about it was the character of the man who contrived, with utmost success, to dupe the British Government for almost all of the ??0 years he was employed in ??ts counterintelligence agencies. Philby was the product of a secure, uppermiddleclass English family; the son of an ironwilled individualist and eccentric, Harry St. John Philby, who had instilled in his rather more correct and diffidentseeming son something of his own brand of moral selfconfidence. (St. John himself ended, finally, a devoted Arabist, living in the desert with one of the two wives given him by King Ibn Saud).

title: Jamie Lewin. Affianced
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Nov. 17 Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Lewin have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jamie Lewin, to Dr: Mark T. Meadow, a veterinary surgeon. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Isadore Meadow of Liberty. The prospective bridegroom is a resident consultant at the Harry Bergh Memorial Hospital of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals in New York. A December wedding is planned.

title: 26Game Loss Streak Ends for Trinity School
description: Trinity School ended its 26game losing streak yesterday by downing St. Hugh's, 360, at Riverside School in the Bronx.

title: Julie Marie Callahan Is Bride Of Allen P. Miller in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 17In St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Julie Marie Callahan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Callahan of Darien, became the bride of Allen Paul Miller. He is the son of Paul Miller of SaleM, Ore., and the late Mrs. Miller.

title: SOUTH GRAPPLES WITH ITS SUCCESS
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Ark., Nov 17The challenge to the South to avoid the mistakes of the North in seeking economic growth was renewed here this week by three liberal Southern Governors who have discovered that a decade of success is creating nearly as many problems as did generations of poverty.

title: Cornell Stopped, 170
description: HANOVER, N.H., Nov. 17Continuing its winning ways since losing the first three games, Dartmouth's football team shut out Cornell, 17 to 0, today for its fifth victory in a row.

title: Wedding Ceremony Brings Happier Moment to Kennedy Family
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17Kathleen Kennedy, the eldest of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy's children, was married today, to David Lee Townsend, a Harvard graduate student, in a ceremony slightly dimmed by yet another family tragedy but ebullient enough to include the singing of When Irish Eyes Are Smiling.

title: Jets Expect to Activate Namathfor Game Today
Family Business: Everyone Profits
description: PLAINFIELD  In these times of inflation and women's liberation more and more women are sharing the responsibilities of breadwinning with their husbands. But there is nothing really new about one sort of working mother: the woman who runs a family business with her husband.

title: A Different Woman By Jane Howard 413 pp. New York: E. P. Dutton & Co. $7.95.
description: Three  quarters of the way into A Different Woman, Jane Howard's rambling account of a twoyear talking tour through American womanhood, the author recalls Martin Buber's admonition that we must relinquish undirected plenitude in favor of the one taut string, the one stretched beam of direction. Buber's thought occurs to her when she is adrift at Miami airport, afflicted with turista and too much carryon baggage, and totally unable to decide which way to fly next in pursuit of the ultimate female rap session. She has complained before of a lack of direction, describing herself as a hyperactive journalist of a coiled, hectic, and flippant nature. She has also quoted twice, with emphasis, SaintExupry's copout, It is the time you have wasted on your rose that makes your rose so important.

title: Syosset, Carle Place Advance to Playoffs
description: Syosset, which has played second fiddle to Farmingdale in recent seasons, won the Nassau County North Shore Division I championship yesterday by stopping Hicksville, 16.0. Syosset's Kevin Mannix scored two touchdowns to take the county scoring title again, this time with a total of 20.

title: Iowa Eleven Outclassed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 17 (UPI)Archie Griffin rushed for a record 246 yards and Bruce Elia scored four touchdowns today to give topranked Ohio State a 5513 victory over. Iowa.

title: Exypstate Police Sergeant Is Found Guilty of Perjury
description: A former Newburgh, N. Y. police sergeant, William Lee, was found guilty yesterday of two counts of perjury in a gamblingcorruption investigation and was acquitted of two other counts by a jury in Federal. Court in Manhattan.

title: BUSINESSMEN TOLD TO AID ON HOUSING
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 17Westchester County businessmen were urged this week by a leading banker to join in sponsoring the housing that their skilled, middleincome employes could no longer find in this affluent county.

title: Judging Judges
description: Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi, a stolid figure with 24 years of experience on the bench, stood in the dock last week in Brooklyn Supreme Court, one floor below his own chambers, and pleaded not guilty before a colleague to charges of lying under oath.

title: FundRaisers Get the Ski Ball Rolling
description: Gordon (Mickey Cochran) of Richmond, Vt., the newly appointed coach of the United States Alpine squad, and six members of the international downhill events' team will he guests of the New York Committee for the United States Ski Team Fund at the annual ski ball at the WaldorfAstoria Nov. 29. Only Lindy Cochran, youngest member of the Four Flying Cochrans, will accompany her father to the affair. Missing will be the teenager's two sistersMarilyn and Barbaraand her brother, Bobby.

title: Sadat's War
description: CAIRO. Eternal Egypt murmurs amidst The present and the future on the road from Cairo to Qantara. We hasten, beneath a brilliant sky and eucalyptus trees, along the length of the Sweet Water Canal, a Nile tributary flowing toward that territory in the Sinai which Egypt's army has wrested from the Israelis. We see peasants in white robes hoeing the muddy earth, and convoys of troop carriers; women in black with bundles of sticks atop their heads, and immense Soviet tanks; oxen pushing water wheels as oldfashioned as the Pharoabs, and mobile SAM missiles. It is all slightly phantasmagoric, the donkeys and the dust and the millennial population along that road and in those teeming towns, intermingled with multitudes of men in uniform and the ubiquitous phenomena an ultramodern military machine. And yet peasants and soldiers hum and blend like bumblebees and go about their business as if the countenance of Egypt had always been so paradoxical.

title: A Special Prosecutor For Attica?
description: Maybe the state of New York needs a special, independent prosecutor to look into its affairs, just as much as the Nixon Administration does. At least, that's the impression created by the state's refusal so far to hold any of its agents responsible for anything that happened at the Attica Correctional Facillity on Sept. 13, 1971.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: PRESIDENT NIXON signed into law the bill authorizing construction of a 789mile oil pipeline between the Alaskan North Slope and the warmwater port of Valdez. ... The United States balance of payments, from the standpoint of liquidity balance, showed a surplus of $1.1billion in the third quarter, against a deficit of $1.5billion in the second quarter.

title: Newark Holding Off Its Report on Water
description: NEWARK  City officials are delaying for a couple of monhs more their submission to the state of a $1million report on Newark's overtaxed potable water sources. The report, promised to the state last February, was to have been ready on Oct. 15.

title: Dance
description: THE Ford Foundation has done very many noble things across the world. In comparison with some of its acts of simple humanity, possibly its enormous and farsighted assistance of American dance, and more particularly American ballet, may seem of comparatively small importance. However, dance is the only performing art in which America leads the world, and this leadership is partly due to the Ford Foundation. Without Ford, it seems certain that dance wold be in a very different condition in the United States.

title: Bucknell Crushed By Delaware, 500
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Nov. 17 Delaware scored a 50.0 victory over Bucknell today, rolling up 452 yards, making four pass interceptions and recovering four Bucknell fumbles. Dave Witmer ran 74 yards for a touchdown on one interception.

title: Alabama Is 4313 Victor Over Miami
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Nov, 17 (AP)Gary Rutledge, a junior, passed for two touchdowns and ran for another today to lead Sugar Bowlbound Alabama to its ninth straight victory, 4313, over Miami.

title: The Black Child: A Parents' Guide
description: The authors of this practical guidea black pediatricianpsychiatrist and a white magazine editorcall it the first complete manual for black and white parents. And, in its scope, in terms of its intended readership, in its careful both sides now approach, the book is an admirable guide for overcoming the problems of raising black children in a white world. The text is forthright, nontechnical, at times even a bit folksy, but it is never patronizing. Intellectuals, however, should not shun the book. The many ways in which color consciousness and prejudice can be instilled in children are often as obscure to the intellectual as they are to the sharecropper.

title: I.T.T. Unit Bombed in Berlin
description: BERLIN, Nov. 17 (AP)  A bomb ripped the offices of the West German subsidiary of International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation early today in West Berlin, the police said. A second bomb was defused by policemen. Damage to the offices of the SchaubLorenz company was estimated at $40,000. The police said no injuries were reported from the blast, which occurred at 1:30 A.M.

title: TRANSIENT BOOKED IN LOS ANGELES FIRE
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov, 17 (AP) An 18yearold transient has been booked for investigation of murder in an apartment blaze that killed 24 persons, the police said today.

Y., Nov. 17Mrs. Margaret Love Wright and Norton Stevens of New York, president of the Norlin Corporation, an international musicalinstruments manufacturing company, were, married here, this afternoon. title: Deerfield Turns Back Mt. Hermon
description: MOUNT HERMON, Mass., Nov. 17  Deerfield racked up 28 points today in the first three periods and then held on to defeat Mount Hermon, 2820. Deerfield completed its season with a 43 wonlost record while Mount Hermon finished at 16.

title: Detroit Oil Strike Ends
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17 (UPI)New threeyear contracts between the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the Marathon Oil Company have been ratified ending a twoweek strike that held up deliveries of fuel oil. The three agreements were approved yesterday by members of Local 283, employed at Marathon's refinery, gasoline transport terminal and fuel oil bulk plants in the Detroit area.

title: Leads Cup Tennis, 21

title: SOUTH GRAPPLES WITH ITS SUCCESS
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Ark., Nov 17The challenge to the South to avoid the mistakes of the North in seeking economic growth was renewed here this week by three liberal Southern Governors who have discovered that a decade of success is creating nearly as many problems as did generations of poverty.

title: Death Penalty
description: On the night of Aug. 15, 1963, Eddie Lee Mays, a 34yearold convicted murderer from Manhattan, was put to death by electrocution at the New York State prison at Ossining. He was the 614th person to lose his life in the Sing Sing electric chair since 1891.

Page Smith, former Surrogate of Fulton County, and Mrs. Smith of Johnstown, N.Y. A January wedding is planned.
