description: MORRISTOWN, Nov. 197Randolph Township, charged in a suit with having exclusionary zoning laws, has filed a motion in Superior Court here to have 31 other Morris County municipalities named as thirdparty defendants.

title: Quaker Volunteer Reported On Missing Vietnam DC3
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 19 (UPI)South Vietnam said today that an American Quaker volunteer was aboard an Air Vietnam DC3 with 23 people aboard that has been imissing since Saturday on flight from Saigon to the northem city of Quang Ngai.

title: Group That Raised Funds for Agnew Draws $2,000 Fine
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 19The Salute to Ted Agnew Committee, which held a fundraising event for former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew last year, pleaded guilty today to four counts of violating Maryland election laws.

title: LON NOUS PALACE BOMBED BY PLANE
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 19A Cambodian Air Force fighter plane dropped three or four bombs on the presidential palace today, killing at least three people, blowing holes in roofs, shredding doors and scattering fragments of glass throughout the palace grounds.

title: Senate Votes to Extend Jury Inquiry 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (UPI)The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to a bill authorizing a sixmonth extension of the Watergate grand jury.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Notes on People
description: After 25 years in Congress, William Jennings Bryan Dorn, dean of South Carolina's Congressional delegation, will run for Governor next year. The 57yearold Democrat, who entered the House of Representatives in 1947 with such freshmen Congressmen as Richard M. Nixon and John F. Kennedy and now holds the position of chairman of the Committee on Veterans Affairs, is the first announced candidate for his state's gubernatorial race. The present Governor, John C. West, also a Democrat, is not eligible for reelection.

title: RISE IN G.I. BENEFITS EXPECTED TO BE CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) Vietnam veterans will probably receive an increase this year in educational benefits, but it will not be as much as expected, says the chairman of the House Veterans Affairs Committee.

title: Future Dealing Seen By Americans in Gold
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP)Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz said today that the presumption is that Americans would be permitted to deal in gold at some appropriate moment.

title: Production of Steel Declined by 0.9% In Week to Nov. 17
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 17 slipped to 2.91million net tons, a decline of 0.9 per cent from the 2.93million tons in the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The weekly production index dipped to 119.2 from 120.2 in the week ended Nov. 10.

title: 6,000 Gaullists Gather Under a Giant Shadow
description: NANTES, France, Nov. 19 The talk was all politics, and the people, from every caste and corner of France, were those who still light a candle for Charles de Gaulle.

title: F.B.I. Man Appears To Contradict Nixon On Hughes Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19An agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation has given his superiors an account that appears to contradict President Nixon's version of how a secret $100,000 gift from Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire industrialist, was handled.

title: Copper Futures Set High For December Delivery
description: Copper futures contracts for December delivery set a record yesterday on the Commodity Exchange. The surge in price was a followthrough on the action in the London metal market, which opens earlier than here because of the time differential.

title: That Vanderbilt Name Was an Obstacle
description: The simply framed picture of Little Orphan Annie, hanging alone in the whitewalled foyer, is the first thing to meet the eye. The familiar mop of tousled curls almost overshadows the discreet line of print that inquires: How does it feel to be famous?

title: Tangerine Bowl Surprise
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 19 (UPI)In two sunrise developments tonight, the Tangerine Bowl decided to invite Florida with a 54 wonlost record, to meet undefeated Miami of Ohio, Dec. 22, and asked for permission to move the same to Gainsville's Florida Field.

title: 2 Imprisoned in Seoul Student Protests
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 19  While antiGovernment student dissension continued to spread today, two university students were sentenced to prison and five others received suspended sentences on charges of conspiring to overthrow the Government.

title: Nation Is Living on Less Energy For Travel, Heating and Lights
description: Mr. and Mrs. Richard Ward of Detroit began turning off the lights last week when they brushed their teeth or talked on the telephone at night, to save electricity.

title: Racing Bill in Stretch
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19 (AP)The Senate passed by 310 and sent to the Assembly today a bill that would renew a 45day extension of the thoroughbred racing season in New Jersey next year among the Monmouth Park, Atlantic City and Garden State tracks.

title: Slap or Pat or Tap by Nixon Stirs New Controversy With Some in Press
description: MIAMI, Nov. 19President Nixon slapped or patted a man on the face Saturday night, it was disclosed today, stirring news controversy between the White House and some segmenis of the press.

title: The Spirit of '73
description: After nearly two hundred years, the American Revolution is in trouble. The official organization created by Congress to give the bicentennial celebrations some meaning for today is floundering despite seven years of trying to cross the Delaware and capture the public imagination. It is blocked by ice flows of politics and frozen patriotism. Of course, the Republic can survive without putting on Indian feathers and dumping chests of taxed tea into Boston Harbor a second time. But inherent in the Nixon Administration's disputed bicentennial concept is a philosophical question that tells little about where the country is and could be going to keep alive the spirit of Revolutionary change.

title: Nixon Asking Greater Voice on Israel Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 The Administration's bill proposing $2.2billion in military aid for Israel would give President Nixon the power to determine how much would be a loan and how much a gift, and this is being interpreted in different ways here.

title: Soviet Is Said to Release Dissident, Without Charges
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 19 (Reuters) The Soviet authorities have released a young dissident, Irina Belogorodskayq, held without trial since January, dissident sources said today.

title: Experts Ask Changes to Ease Flow of Information to Public
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 19 A series of legal changes intended to ease the flow of information to the publicincluding the passage of a strong Federal shield law to protect reporters and the removal of all Government control over television and radio programingwas urged today by a panel of 58 lawyers, journalists, scholars and other specialists.

title: G.O.P. Governors Praise Nixon on Foreign Policy and Watergate
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 19Republican Governors issued a welcome to President Nixon today in a unanimous resolution commending his outstanding accomplishments in international and domestic affairs.

title: Killings in Oakland Turn Air of Optimism Into One of Rising Fear
description: OAKLAND, Nov. 19Just a few months ago it all looked so promising. It was warm and sunny then and Bobby Seale was immersed in his mayoral campaign and all the talk was of building a better Oakland.

title: Smith Heads Tennis Team In Cup Final
description: With Australia gripped by feverish excitement over the prospects of regaining the Davis Cup, the United States chose a tennis team headed by Stan Smith and Tom Gorman yesterday to defend the cup in the final at Cleveland Nov. 30.

title: 5 Snakes Stolen in Munich
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Nov. 19 (AP)Five rare snakes and two lizards were stolen from the Hellabrunn Zoo here early today. A zoo spokesman said that the thief must have been an expert. The glass panes of the zoo's terrarium were smashed and the most valuable reptilesan amethyst python, a king python and three Aus. tralian snakeswere stolen, as were a pair of emerald lizards.

title: Tohill Is Dismissed As Coach at T.C.U.
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Nov. 19 (AP)Billy Tohill said tonight he had been dismissed as Texas Christian football coach.

title: Suspect Aids His Arrest
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 19 (AP) Michael Mora, 18 years old, was charged with smoking marijuana after he was arrested Saturday night as he smoked in the police headquarters while waiting to visit a prisoner.

title: Jets See A Score On Film
description: If there ever was any doubt about the kind of electricity Joe Namath can generate on the football field, consider this: in just 4 minutes and 40 seconds, he ignited more excitement and more controversy than the Jets had experienced in the first 595 minutes and 20 seconds of this season.

title: Peace With Apprehension
description: A commendable tone of modesty and reserve is now apparent in President Nixon's reading of Vietnam. Gone are the invocations of peace with honor, of hints new American intervention if things don't go exactly as projected by the diplomats.

title: TRIAL LAWYERS UNIT BACKS CURB ON F.C.C.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov.19 (AP)The power to regulate program content on radio and television should be removed from the Federal Communications Commission, according to the research branch of the Association of Trial Lawyers.

title: Leader of Libya, On Yugoslav Tour, Inspects Weapons
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 19Col. Muammer elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, visited a display of Yugoslavproduced guns and other military equipment today at Nikinci, about 30 miles from Belgrade.

title: Music: Pianist Begins Faure Series
description: More talent and inventiveness are required to play a successful Faur program than one devoted to Beethoven or Mozart. From which it follows that Judith Alstadter has her work cut out for her in the threerecital series that she began Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall. For what she believes to be the first time in America, the complete piano works of Faure will be played by one pianist in consecutive programs.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Sharks' Coach Suspended
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 19 (AP)The World Hockey Association suspended Terry Slater, coach of the Los Angeles Sharks for five games for molesting Dennis Dahlmann, a linesman, after Friday night's game with the Cleveland Crusaders, the Sharks announced today. Slater also was fined $500.

title: Judging Sentences
description: Accusations against several judges by the State Select Committee on Crime remain accusations only, until hard facts and evidence are produced. The cases under question need to be explored thoroughly, but the judiciary must not be convicted in advance by general charges, especially in so complex an area as the sentencing procedure where discretion is required.

title: The Traveling Witness
description: President Nixon has become a traveling witness in his own behalf. After addressing all the Republican members and a few of the Democratic members of the House and Senate in six large groups at the White House last week, Mr. Nixon journeyed to Florida for a press conference, to Georgia for a speech and is due in Tennessee for a meeting with the Republican Governors.

title: Joseph Papp Signs an Exclusive Contract With A.B.C.
description: Joseph Papp, whose relationship with the Columbia Broadcasting System ended abruptly earlier this year, now has signed an exclusive contract with the American Broadcasting Company. He is to produce minimum of two contemporary drama presentations for prime time and to develop programs for other areas of the schedule.

title: U.S. Astronauts in Soviet To Train With Russians
description: ZVEDNY GORODOK, U.S.S.R., Nov. 19  Which way is north? asked Brig. Gen. Thomas P. Stafford, American commander for the joint SovietAmerican space mission set for July, 1975.

title: The Stigma of Seeing a Psychiatrist
description: If one thing was made perfectly clear in this first slow, polite day of Senate committee hearings on the nomination of Representative Gerald R. Ford to be Vice President, it is that consulting a psychiatrist or psychotherapist is still an unforgivable sin for an American politician. Thus wrote Linda Charlton in The New York Times.

title: Books of The Times
description: Irving Howe is usually so reasonable that one tends to forget how witty he is. We have fallen into the habit of assuming that only extremists and eccentrics are witty, that wit is not to be trusted, but enjoyed. It is regarded as a bad habit, almost a vice, like gambling or drinking or sleeping around. And in fact, many wits do just that: They gamble a truth in exchange for an effect. They get drunk on their own excesses. And they don't care what sort of bedfellows they have to accept in order to turn a tricky phrase.

title: Army Rejects Plea To Erase 2 Charges On Benedict Arnold
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) After poring over timeyellowed records, an Army board has ruled that there is not enough evidence to clear Gen. Benedict Arnold of Revolutionary War misconduct charges.

title: POISON SHELLFISH STIR FLORIDA ALERT
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Nov. 19 (AP)Two more persons along central Florida's Gulf Coast reported paralytic symptoms of shellfish poisoning today after eating clams believed to be contaminated with a red tide algae.

title: City Eases CleanOil Rule, Fearing Crisis This Week
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration decided yesterday to relax its pollutioncontrol restrictions on fuel oil in the face of an energy shortage that has deepened to a point, according to an official, where it is apparent to us that there may be problems of supply as early as this weekend.

title: S.I. College Blacks Plan To Boycott Shockley Talk
description: Black student leaders at the Staten Island Community College said yesterday that they would boycott a seminar tonight featuring Dr. William B. Shockley, the physicist and Nobel laureate who argues that, because of genetic factors, blacks are generally inferior to whites.

title: Fire Union's Leader Tells Why He Lied
description: Richard J. Vizzini, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, said last night that he had been badgered and needled by reporters into lying about the results of a strike referendum that preceded his union's five  and  a  half  hour strike on Election Day.

title: PreHoliday Special: Hope on the Hoof Aintree Sale
High School Sports
description: Kennedy of Bellmore, L. I., has found out that a little bit of believing goes a long way. The Nassau County school has changed last season's football record of no victories and eight losses into a perfect 80 mark this season and the championship of South Shore Division I. Kennedy meets Syosset, the North Shore Division I winner, Saturday in a playoff game.

title: Griffith Loses to Aussie
description: PARIS, Nov. 19 (AP) Tony Mundine of Australia scored a unanimous decision over the former world champion, Emile Griffith, in a 12round middleweight bout tonight. The 22yearold Mundine weighed 159 pounds and the 35yearold Griffith 157.

title: SYRIA IS REPORTED VIILLING TO ENTER INTO PEACE TALKS
CORPORATE BONDS EXTEND ADVANCE
description: Corporate and taxexempt bond prices extended gains registered in late trading last week but closed below their highs for the day.

title: Renowned Plant Research Institute, Long in Yonkers, Plans to Move
description: Fifty years ago, a selfmade mining magnate named William Boyce Thompson decided to take some of the $100million fortune he had built on copper, silver and gold and invest it in a project that he believed would pay handsome dividends for humanity.

title: Du Pont Yearend Dividend
description: Directors of E. I, du Pont de Neetours & Co., Inc., declared yesterday a yearend dividend of $2 a share on its common stock, payable Dec. 14 to holders of record Nov. 28. The yearend dividend wlil bring total dividends for this year to $5,75 a share, compared with $5.45 share in 1972.

title: Justices Will Weigh Detroit School Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether urban school desegregation plans can incorporate a heavily black city system with predominantly white suburbs, linked by extensive busing.

title: YOUTH OUTBREAKS ALARM KASHMIRIS
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, Nov. 19The Government here has appealed urgently to New Delhi to send additional policemen to help deal with a wave of proPakistan student demonstrations.

title: SYRIA IS REPORTED WILLING TO MEE INTO PEACE TALK
description: CAIRO, Nov. 19Syria, after long hesitation, has reportedy declared herself willing to at tend a peace conference unde United Nations auspices aimed at establishing a durable Mid dle Eastern, peace, it was dis closed here today.

title: AfoAKom to Be Shown At Washington Gallery
description: The AfoAKom, the wood carving sacred to the people of the tiny West African kingdom of Kom and missed by them for seven years, has begun its journey home.

title: Slayer Attending College Held in RobberyAssault
description: WOODBURY, Nov. 19 (AP)A convicted murderer who had been attending college classes in a special studyrelease program was being held today on suspicion of beating and robbing the wife of the chairman of the Delaware River Port Authority.

title: Treasury Bills Fell At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: U.S. RETALIATION ON OIL REJECTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 The United States has decided for the time being not to retaliate against Arab states participating in the oil embargo against this country, Administration officials said today.

title: OIL ISSUE PERILS GOALS OF MARKET
description: PARIS, Nov. 19  The European Common Market is hoping to take a number of ambitious steps by year end to further its goal of unity, but clouds hang heavy over the project because of the Arab oil squeeze on the Netherlands and the refusal of other market member countries so far to help the Dutch out.

title: Dunkometer Yields To the Breathalyzer
description: The drunkometer, known and feared by two decades of drinking drivers in New York City, is being retired.

title: Smith Heads Tennis Team In Cup Final
description: With Australia gripped by feverish excitement over the prospects of regaining the Davis Cup, the United States chose a tennis team headed by Stan Smith and Tom Gorman yesterday to defend the cup in the final at CleveLind Nov. 30.

title: 50Mile Speed Limit Called a LifeSaver
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 19 (UPI)Thanksgiving holiday auto travelers who save their gasoline by cruising at 50 miles an hour stand a better chance of surviving an accident than more speedminded companions on the highways, a spokesman for the National Safety Council said today.

title: A Loss of $443,000 Reported by Amex For Third Quarter
description: A thirdquarter deficit of $443,000, compared with a loss of $47,000 in the similar period last year, was reported yesterday by the American Stock Exchange. This year's drop occurred despite a return to profitable operations in October, the exchange said.

title: Ramapo Building Seized By 15 Minority Students
description: MAHWAH, Nov, 19About 15 students, most of them black or Hispanic, seized the Student Life Building at Ramapo College today, apparently to dramatize demands for more financial aid, free transportation from anywhere in the state to the campus and the dismissal of racist faculty members.

title: Archdiocese Here to Start an Advertising Drive to Recruit Priests
description: Faced with a shortage of priests and an uncertainty among the public of just what a priest does, the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York has launched a 13week campaign that will place advertisements in newspapers and magazines throughout the 10county diocesan area.

title: F.B.I. Man Appears To Contradict Nixon On Hughes Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19An agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation has given his superiors an account that appears to contradict President Nixon's version of how a secret $100,1I000 gift from Howard R. Hughes, the billionaire industrialist, was handled.

title: Aintree Sale Gives Grand National Life
description: LONDON, Nov. 19 (AP)Mrs. Mirabel Topham sold today for $7.2million the 300acre Aintree race course, saving the Grand National steeplechase for at least five years.

title: Justices Will Weigh Detroit School Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether urban school desegregation plans can incorporate a heavily black city system with predominantly white suburbs, linked by extensive busing.

title: A.P. Editors Group Picks Rowe to Had Regents
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 19 (AP)  Charles S. Rowe, the editor and copublisher of The Fredericksburg, (Va.), Free LanceStar, was elected today as regent chairman of The Associated Press Managing Editors Association at the association's annual convention.

title: POLICEMAN IS SHOT; ONE SUSPECT SEIZED
description: A 20yearold Brooklyn man was charged with attempted murder yesterday in connection with the wounding of a police officer in the BedfordStuyvesant area. The man, James R. Harrison of 80 Dwight Street in Red Hook, was detained in a search after the incident and was later booked on the attemptedmurder and weapons charges.

title: MINORITIES SEEK AID TO BUSINESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 An interracial coalition was formed today to lobby to preserve and reorganize the Federal Government's minority capitalism program.

title: U.S. Visitors to Hanoi Say Vietcong Want Coalition
description: HONG KONG, Nov, 19 (UPI) After nearly four weeks in North Vietnam and sections of South Vietnam that are controlled by the Vietcong, two American antiwar activists said here yesterday that fullscale war would likely break out if a coalition Government was not formed in Saigon.

title: Inflation's Spiral Spurs Strikes and Pay Rise in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITYMexico is in the throes of an inflationary spiral that has increased the wholesale price index by more than 18 per cent in the last year, according to Government sources.

title: Portuguese Guinea Rebels Join African Unity Group
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 19 (Reuters)The Organization of African Unity today admitted the black nationalist movement in Portuguese Guinea as a full member.

title: MRS. COOK SEEKS APPELLATE SEAT
description: Assemblyman Constance E. Cook, resetting her goal to be the first woman on the state's high court, said yesterday that she had appealed directly to Governor Rockefeller and he had agreed to meet with her to hear her request for appointment.

title: New Home Likely for Blades
description: Because the Golden Blades as of last night still were unable to come up with about $8,000 for Madison Square Garden expenses, the probability is that the club will be unable to continue in the arena.

title: Emil Von Elling, Track Coach At N.Y.U. 44 Years, Dies at 90
description: WINSTED, Conn., Nov. 19Emil Von Elling, track and field coach at New York University for 44 years, died yesterday at the Winsted Memorial Hospital He was 90 years old and lived here at Highland Lake.

title: IRAQ TO BOYCOTT SUMMIT PARLEY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 19No Iraqi representatives will attend the Arab summit conference that is to be held in Algiers next week, the Iraqi Government press agency announced today.

title: Josef C. James Is Dead at 57; Director of Roosevelt Library
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 Josef C. James, director of the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library in Hyde Park, N.Y., died of cancer yesterday in Freedmen's Hospital here, He was 57 years old.

title: Bon Johnson in Best Form of Season Against Cards
description: Ron Johnson knew what some people had been saying that he had lost that extra quickness, that he was favoring his injured leg, that he was down on himself like the rest of the New York Giants.

title: Maple Leafs' Swedish Pair Impress Kelly With Skating
description: Although he never had to address Swedish hockey players when he was a member of the Ontario Parliament, Red Kelly apparently has learned the protocol.

title: City Opens a Drive to Find Elderly Poor
description: The city started yesterday search for more than 200,000 poor people over the age of 65 who might be eligible for the new Federal program of Supplemental Security Income starting Jan. 1.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Canada Focuses on Oil Sands
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 17Energy shortages and supply interruptions are focusing renewed attention here on Canada's Athabasca Oil Sands, one of the largest oil deposits in the world.

title: Tennessee State: 17 in Row on Shoestring
description: There isn't a blade of grass on the Tennessee State practice field, and when it rains, practice is canceled because of the mud. When the weather is dry, the field has to be watered to keep down dust.

title: MUSICIANS ENHANCE MISS ZIA'S FINE VOICE
description: Anita Zia's program for her New York debut in Carnegie Recital Hall late Sunday afternoon was an especially attractive one, partly because she is a fine singer and partly because she chose a number of songs and arias requiring a diversity of instrumental forces.

title: Senate Gives State Official Right to Bar Outside Waste
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19  The Senate today passed and sent to the Assembly two important environmental bills affecting waste disposal and coastal development and a third measure increasing the salary of the Governor to $65,000 from $50,000.

title: Dow Stock Index Off by 28.67; Decline Is Largest Since 1962
description: Investors' fears over the widening energy crisis and the possibility of a recession yesterday dealt stock prices their biggest blow for a single day in more than 11 years.

title: CARRIER CORP. UNITS PLAN RISE IN PRICES
description: The Carrier Corporation said yesterday that its domestic air conditioning divisions were planning price increases ranging from 3 to 4 per cent on unitary equipment.

title: CocaCola Profits Increase by 12.5% In the 3d Quarter
description: The CocaCola Company, the nation's largest soft drink maker, posted record sales and profits in the third quarter and first nine months this year, according to results announced yesterday from the company's headquarters in Atlanta.

title: Prefontaine Takes N.C.A.A. Run Again
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Nov. 19 (UPI)Steve Prefontaine of the University of Oregon won the National Collegiate Athletic Association crosscountry championship today for the third time.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Big is beautiful in this season's jewelry.

title: GEORGE S. RAYMOND
description: STONY POINT, N. Y., Nov. 19 (AP)George S. Raymond, a lawyer credited with writing many of New York State's, industrial codes, died today in Ramapo General Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: NATHAN WALKER
description: Nathan Walker, general counsel of the New York Chapter of the American Institute of Architects and law partner in the firm of Walker, Walker & Kapiloff, here, died yesterday of a heart ailment at New York Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 16 East 69th Street.

title: CONDOMINIUM BID IN BRONX SET BACK
description: Harry B. Helmsley, one of the largest realestate operators in the country, suffered at least a temporary setback yesterday in his plans to convert the entire 12,000family Parkchester housing complex in the Bronx the nation's second largest apartment development  to a condominium.

title: Police Union Vote to Raise Dues Challenged by Opposition Chief
description: A Brooklyn policeman who heads an opposition group within the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association has questioned the announced results of a union referendum in which an increase in the membership dues was approved.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The scriptwriter had been defying all laws of probability as he wove his outrageous plot. Those were teasing devices he used in building toward a prodigious dramatic climax and emotions mounted with gripping intensity. But the expected denouement never came. Abruptly the curtain fell with a leaden clank just as the hero seemed about to pull off a final theatrical showstopper.

title: Army Rejects Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) After poring over timeyellowed records, an Army board has ruled that there is not enough evidence to clear Gen. Benedict Arnold of Revolutionary War misconduct charges.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Restaurant Associates is relinquishing control of three of the city's dining landmarks: Four Seasons, Forum of the Twelve Caesars and Tavern on the Green. It would appear that the corporation has recognized that operation of a restaurant with a personality of its own is incompatible with bigtime industrial food management.

title: Supreme Court to Consider Challenge to College Admission Quota Systems
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 The Supreme Court agreed today to consider a challenge to the quota systems that some colleges and universities have applied in recent years to admit more members of minority groups for a more balanced student body.

title: Wolfman Prowls The Ratings Front
description: ?? Brucie's days are numbered, ran the plugs, and tombstone paperweights turned up all over town. It was part of an advertising campaign last summer by rock radio station WNBC to launch Wolfman Jack as its new nighttime disk jockey, and the barrage was aimed directly at WABC's Cousin Erucie Morrow, who has dominated the ratings in the New York area over the last decade.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City has started a search for more than 200,000 poor people over the age of 65 who might be eligible for the new Federal program of Supplemental Security Income. On Jan. 1 the program will replace the present welfare system for aged, blind and disabled which now covers 74,000 elderly in the city.

title: Ford Inquiry Hears Contrasting Views
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 Gerald R. Ford was variously pictured today as little more than a messenger from the White House and as another potentially great Harry S. Truman.

title: MRS. PAUL P. COHEN
description: BUFFALO, N.Y., Nov. 19Mrs. Frances Proskauer Cohen, widow of the lawyer Paul P. Cohen and daughter of the late Joseph M. Proskauer, who was a former justice of the State Supreme Court and chairman of the Crime Commission, died today at her home here. She was 68 years old.

title: SAUDIS WANT 51% OF ARAMCO NOW
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon Nov. 19 (Reuters)The Saudi Arabian Government wants a substantial revision of its participation agreement with the Arabian American Oil Company to bring its ownership in the concern to more than 51 per cent immediately, according to news reports here today.

title: People in Sports: Shavers, Ali Beat the Drums for Their Bouts
description: Muhammad Ali is training for his fight against Joe Frazier on Jan. 28 and Earnie Shavers is also working out in preparation for a bout against Jerry Quarry on Dec. 14.

title: Greek Millionaire Tank Owners Hit by Cuts in Shipments of Oil
description: ATHENS (AP)The oil production cutbacks by Arab nations and their embargo against the United States and the Netherlands have hit one of this country's best known clans the millionaires who own and operate tanker fleets.

title: Advertising: Y. & R. Expanding
description: Young & Rubicam International, which began the year by acquiring the country's largest agency in the healthcare field Sudler & Hennessey, Inc., now is expecting to end it with the acquisition of the nation's largest directmarketing agency.

title: Early U. S. Furniture Sold For $668,650 at Sotheby's
description: Bidders from around the country were active in a fivepart auction here of Early American furniture and decorations that ended last weekend with receipts of $668,650, a total approximating presale estimates.

title: AMERICANARAB UNIT IS ORDERED TO MOVE
description: Dr. Mohammed T. Mehdi, secretary general of the Action Committee on AmericanArab Relations, said the committee had been evicted from its offices yesterday at 441 Lexington Avenue, at 44th Street.

title: Freight Surcharges Planned By Some Shipping Concerns
description: Steamship operating between the United States East and Gulf coast and Latin America will introduce special freight surcharges next month to offset the higher cost of fuel oil the ships use, it was announced yesterday.

title: Duchamp Retrospective at Modern Art Is. Postponed After Teamster's Decision
description: In the face of a refusal by members of the Teamsters Union to cross picket lines, the strikebound Museum of Modern Art announced yesterday that it was postponing indefinitely the highly acclaimed Marcel Duchamp Retrospective, scheduled to open Dec. 5.

title: New Snag on Ostpolitik
description: It is incredible at this late date that the Communist rulers of East Germany should be allowed to sidetrack West Germany's effort to normalize relations with Czechoslovakia, Hungary and Bulgariabut it seems be happening. As a result, Chancellor Brandt's trip Prague to sign a treaty establishing diplomatic ties and formally voiding the Munich Pact, under which Czechoslovakia was dismembered, is again in doubt. And Bonn's negotiations with Hungary and Bulgaria are a standstill.

title: New Books
description: Fifty Years of Movie Posters, compiled and edited with commentary by John Kobel, introduction by David Robinson (Bounty Books: Crown Publishers, spiral binding, $9.95).

title: Nixon Assures Governors He Will Allay Public Doubt
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 20President Nixon assured the nation's Republican Governors today that he would clear up the public doubts about him with the release of detailed information about Watergate, his personal finances and other charges of scandal in the White House.

title: About the Rangers
description: Someone remarked to Brad Park that it must be tough playing four games in five nights. Yeah, Park replied, remembering the 102 loss at Boston, but we only played three. ... The New Yorkers face the Golden Seals tonight at the Garden, where Charlie Finley's men have won once in seven seasons. . . . The Seals, Rangers and Bruins are the only National Hockey League clubs to avoid being shut out. . . . The next blanking that grayhaired Ed Giacomin turns in will equal Dave Kerr's club career mark of 47. . . . The exuberant rookie defenseman, Larry Sacharuk, has been teamed with the steadying Rod Seiling. Sacharuk dashes straight for the goal and apparently never hears Seiling yelling at him to slow down. If that keeps up, a Ranger told Seiling, your hair is going look like Giacomin's. . . . Gene Carr and Mike Murphy remain out of action for the Rangers, still recuperating from their car accident in Boston.

title: Inspectors Absolve Postmen of Charge Of Mail Harassment
description: The United States Postal Service has decided that there was no basis to complaints by a Manhattan businessman that mail carriers harassed him and scrawled ethnic epithets across his letters after he told of poor mail service in an article last Feb. 18 in The New York Times.

title: Full Circle Nears End
description: Full Circle, the Erich Maria RemarquePeter Stone drama, will end its Broadway run at the ANTA Theater on Saturday night after 21 performances. Bibi Andersson and Leonard Nimoy are costarred in the Otto Freminger production.

title: NEVETT BARTOW, 39, COMPOSER, TEACHER
description: Nevett Bartow, composer and chairman of the music department of The Blair Academy in Blairstown, N.J., died yesterday of leukemia at Fitzgerald Mercy Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 39 years old.

title: Parisians' Concert Attempts to Trace Varese Influences
description: Edgard Varese was generally considered one of the great rugged individualists of contemporary music whose unique compositions neither indicate direct forebears nor foster immediate descendants. The Contemporary Music Orchestra of Paris, conducted by Konstantin Simonovitch, attempted to demonstrate the fallacy of this attitude Monday night in Carnegie Hall and with very little success.

title: Hearing on Dean's License
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 20 (UPI)The former White House counsel, John W. Dean 3d has been ordered to appear before a threejudge panel to show cause why his license to practice law in Virginia should not be revoked.

title: Holiday Fun Begins With the Big Parade
10 County Chairmen Discuss Leadership Vacuum Want Moderate Rule
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20A number of Republican county chairmen, who hope to force a change in leadership of the New Jersey Republican party following heavy losses in the Nov. 6 election, met today to discuss rebuilding along moderate lines.

title: $119MILLION ADDED TO HUCHES CONTRACT
description: The Hughes Aircraft Company received yesterday a $119.3million addition to a Navy contract for the Phoenix missilecontrol system used in F14A aircraft.

title: H.I. ROMNES DEAD; EXCHIEF OF A.T.&T.
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Nov. 20H. I. Romnes, retired board chairman and chief executive officer of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, died yesterday at Sarasota Memorial Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: Who's Afraid?
description: PARISWho said the French were no more playing a major role in international politics? It is they who contributed the most widely used term of the momentand thus, the concept: dtente. Detente was the first term of the trilogy used by de Gaulle as of 1963 to sum up his policy towards the East: Dtenteententecoopration.

title: Warriors Down Bucks
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 20 (AP)Nate Thurmond blocked a shot by Oscar Robertson with 35 seconds to play tonight, then sank a driving layup with 12 seconds remaining to preserve a 108105 triumph for the Golden State Warriors over the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Business Briefs
description: The New York Stock Exchange, buffeted by a drop in volume, barely stayed in the black during the third quarter of 1973, Big Board figures disclosed yesterday.

title: Music: Henze Premiere
description: Asking a composer to talk about his music is not necessarily a guarantee of enlightenmentthe old one about asking the centipede to describe how it walks is often much to the point. But as a first resort, it can hardly hurt. So, we have a new series of six concerts at Town Hall, called The Composer Speaks, at which an artist will be on hand to explain and possibly defend his work.

title: Blazers Restructured
description: VANCOUVER, Nov. 20 (AP)James A. Pattison owner of the Vancouver Blazers of the World Hockey Association, announced today that the club had been sold to Neonex International, Ltd.

title: New Transit Curbs Planned to Purify Washington's Air
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Environmental Protection Agency announced today a series of transportation controls, including the imposition of stiff parking fees, to help this metropolitan area meet Federal cleanair standards.

title: Boston Gets Planning Grant
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (AP)Boston has been awarded $420,000 Federal grant to expand a planning program for potential civilian use of Navy property in South Boston and Charlestown.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: HAITI There is a current vogue or better yet, recognition of Haitian art around town these days, and one of the stranger places to find a large assortment of it is at the north end of the lobby of the Americana Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 53d Street. There are more than 150 works making a colorful splash in this most transient of places, all of them by Haitian artists, and giving a wide perspective of themes and styles.

title: N .F .L. Official Disputes Jets on Disputed Plays
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 20 (AP) The Cincinnati Bengals' coach, Paul Brown, said today that the National Football League agrees that the two disputed plays the New York Jets believed should have been called touchdowns Sunday were not touchdowns.

title: Agreement to Avoid a Vote In U.N. on Korea Reported
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20An agreement has been reached, acceptable to North and South Korea, to avoid a vote for now on two rival resolutions dealing with the status of the United Nations military command in South Korea, diplomatic sources said today.

title: Boy, 6, Fatally Attacked by Guard Dogs
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 20  A 6yearold boy was fatally attacked, apparently by two German shepherds, in a vacant lot here last night, the police re ported today. The two dogs, who were found by the body, lunged at police officers and were shot to death.

title: U. S. Politicians in Soviet Find Komsomol a WellOiled Machine
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20  After an 18day visit that afforded rare access to Soviet political circles, a delegation of young American political leaders has concluded that the Soviet Union grooms its future political leadership as carefully as any large American corporation.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International The Soviet note that led to a precautionary alert of United States forces around the world on the night of Oct. 24 carried an implied threat rather than an actual threat of the dispatch of Soviet troops to the Suez war zone. We strongly urge that we both send forces to enforce the ceasefire and, if you do not, we may be obliged to consider acting alone, the Soviet note said, according to two officials who have read it, [1:67.]

title: 12 on Rafts Cross Pacific in 177 Days
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Wednesday, Nov. 21  Two rafts reached Australia yesterday after a 177day voyage of more than 8,000 miles from Guayaquil, Ecuador. But a third raft in the adventure was abandoned by its crew when it began to break up in heavy seas about 45 miles off the New South Wales coast this morning.

title: GARAGE PREPARED TO BAR CAR FUMES
description: Safety precautions have been taken to prevent a repetition of the Thanksgiving Day incident last year in which carbonmonoxide fumes from backedup cars felled seven children in the Lincoln Center garage.

title: GOVERNOR TO TELL 74 PLANS BY JAN. 9
description: Governor Rockefeller says he will announce whether he will seek reelection before the Jan. 9 opening of the Legislature so that the legislators will not be diverted by confusion over his intentions.

title: Salvation Army Opens Christmas Red Kettle Drive
description: A chilly wind and Christmas carols performed by a children's choir and a 40member band heralded the Salvation Army's annual Red Kettle drive at Rockefeller Center yesterday.

title: A Boost for NATO
description: The French draft Declaration of Alliance Principles, proposed as a NATO response to the American call for a new Atlantic charter, augurs well for an enterprise that has encountered more European skepticism than enthusiasm since its launching by Henry Kissinger seven months ago.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 20Some day New Jersey's top high school football players may grow up wanting play for their home state University. If it ever happens, look out for Rutgers, the home state university. It could become a national power.

title: NIXON CRITICIZED BY MRS. MITCHELL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell said today that President Nixon had discussed every move of his reelection campaign with Mr. Mitchell, who was his campaign manager. The President knew everything that was going on before and after the Watergate burglary, she asserted.

title: Bridge:
description: A player who makes 12 tricks when he had only contracted for game often suffers from a guilt complex. Sometimes the slam was a good proposition and should have been reached, but just as often the slam was a lucky one that required good breaks or a helpful lead.

title: Buckley Labels C.B.S. Schizophrenic on Drugs
description: Senator James L. Buckley, accusing the Columbia Broadcasting System of corporate schizophrenia, said yesterday that while one subsidiary was showing concern for drug abuse in the nineteensixtties, another was implying approval of drug use by buyers of rock records.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Rockefeller Sees Beame, Calls Saving Fare Possible
description: Governor Rockefeller met with Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame yesterday and said later that there could be a chance of saving the 35cent transit fare if Federal masstransit aid Were enacted.

title: Policeman Found Guilty of Bribery In Narcotics Case
description: A suspended policeman who was arrested last May on charges of accepting a $2,000 bribe to alter his testimony in the trial of an alleged narcotics dealer was found guilty yesterday by a State Supreme Court jury here.

title: Boston Gets Planning Grant
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (AP)Boston has been awarded a $420,000 Federal grant to expand a planning program for potential civilian use of Navy property in Sbuth Boston and Charlestown.

title: Racing Goes to the Campus for Recruits
description: While aides minded the store at Aqueduct, the president of the New York Racing Association did some lowkey recruiting yesterday at Queens College.

title: 5 INDICTED IN RAPE OF 2 BRONX SISTERS
description: A 17yearold girl and four male members of a gang known as the Savage Skulls were indicted yesterday in the kidnapping and rape of two teenaged sisters in the Bronx last week.

title: Coal Company Seeks to Reopen A Mine Where 38 Are Buried
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 20Five years after a mine explosion that killed 78 men here, the Consolidation Coal Company is trying to counter a coalfield tabooa reverence for the dead that runs as deep as the minesby resuming production while unrecovered bodies remain interred in the tunnels.

title: China's Managing Director
description: PEKINGI know of no partnership in history like that of Mao Tsetung and Chou Enlai who have worked hand in flan& for mere than two generations reshaping the ideological, political, military and administrative apparatus of the world's largest country.

title: Books of The Times
description: GIDEON WELLES: Lincoln's Secretary of the Navy. By John Niven. 676 pages. Illustrated. Oxford University Press. $17.50.

title: Soviet Team Wins Shooting Crown
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 20 (AP)Valeri Postoianov of the Soviet Union beat a countryman, Alexandr Kediarov, by a point today to win the gold medal in the running boar mixed runs event at the world moving target championships.

title: No Explanation
description: President Nixon's murky explanations of Watergate are models of candor and clarity by contrast with the televised selfdefense offered by the head of the Uniformed Firefighters Association in presenting his reasons for falsely reporting the results of the union's strike vote.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was: 00506 Tickets matching the number win $2,500. Tickets, with the five numbers in reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers In order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle, or last three numbers in sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second end third, the third end fourth the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: Proceedings in the U.N. Today
A.B.A. Attendance Up
description: Attendance is up 14 per cent in the American Basketball Association this season, Commissioner Mike Storen told the league's board of trustees yesterday.

title: Rights of Teachers Defined in 3 Rulings Of Court in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20The New Jersey Supreme Court handed down three opinions today overturning lower court rulings on subjects that teachers may negotiate with school boards.

title: Fishing Limit Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Senate Commerce Committee wil lhold hearings Dec. 6 and 7 on whether United States Fisheries management jurisdiction should be extended from the present 12 miles to 120 Omiles offshore.

title: Africans Urging Arabs to Curb Oil to White Regimes
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 20 (Reuters)  The Secretary General of the Organization of African Unity said today that the time had come for Arab nations to use oil sanctions against the whitedominated minority governments in southern Africa.

title: Lost in New York
description: Recent months have brought forth gratifying hints of innovative thinking within the Transit Authority. The muchappreciated Culture Bus Loop I (mid and upper Manhattan) had hardly become a fixture when Loop II (Brooklyn and lower Manhattan) was added to these openended See New York First weekend tours.

title: Dutch Optimistic on Help in Oil Embargo After Market Meeting
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 20The Netherlands, under an Arab oil embargo, formally told her partners in Europe today that she might have to restrict exports of natural gas to them unless oil moved freely within the Common Market.

title: BostonNew York Fare Raised to $11 by Amtrak
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)Amtrak has raised rail fares between Boston and New York to $11 from $9.90 and has also increased fares between other stops along the BostontoWashington corridor, officials said today.

title: Radio and TV News in Spain Accents Positive at Home but Negative Abroad
description: MADRID, Nov. 20Spain is a haven of peace and contentment in a world of conflict and unrest.

title: N.F.L. Official Disputes Jets on Disputed Plays
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 20 (AP) The Cincinnati Bengals' coach, Paul Brown, said today that the National Football League agreed that the two disputed plays the New York Jets believed should have been called touchdowns Sunday were not touchdowns.

title: MSGR. VINCENT GENOVA
description: Msgr. Vincent O. Genova, pastor of Holy Family Roman Catholic Church in the CanarIsie section of Brooklyn for 38 years, died yesterday of a heart attack at Lefferts General Hospital, Brooklyn. His age was 68.

title: Nature and Man Peril Chesapeake Oyster Fleet
description: CAMBRIDGE, Md., Nov.20 Under the cold pallor of a November moon, eight tall ships awaited dawn in the snug, keyholeshaped harbor, their jutting masts and angled rigging creaking softly, casting long, bobbing shadows on the low skyline of docks and warehouses.

title: Gordon Resigns as Stars' Coach
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 20 (AP)  Jack Gordon, citing a case of nerves, stepped down today as coach of the Minnesota North Stars of the National Hockey League and was replaced by Parker MacDonald.

title: U.S. TOLD TO FIGHT ARAB BLACKMAIL
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 20 Eight leading American economistsincluding all four American Nobel laureates in economicsurged the American Government today to resist what they called oil blackmail in setting Middle East policy.

title: A.E.W. QUESTIONS SCORED AS RACIST
description: The city's Board of Education accused the United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare yesterday of directing a number of schools here to administer pupil questionnaires that the board said were racist, highly inflammatory, and polarizing.

title: Football Leads Sports in Burning Fuel
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 20 (AP)The multimilliondollar auto racing industry, responding to sporadic charges that the sport is a big consumer of fuel, released its own figures today to show that less than 110th of 1 per cent of all leisuretime fuel consumption is related to car racing.

title: Cougars Defeat Rockets
description: DENVER, Nov. 20. (AP)Billy Cunningham scored 25 points and Carolina's pressure defense led the Cougars to their seventh straight victory, a 113107 triumph over the Denver Rockets in the American Basketball Association tonight.

title: Falcons' Rise Means Fall of Cowboys or Redskins
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 20Late in the game won by the Falcons over the Minnesota Vikings last night, it occurred to two distant coaches, George Allen and Tom Landry, who have been to the Super Bowl and would like to go back, that what was happening on the television screen was decidedly against the best interests of their teams. The Falcons, in a significant a n d smashing victory, indicated they are going to keep either Landry's Dallas Cowboys or Allen's Washington Redskins out of the playoffs that lead to the Super Bowl.

title: SENATE UNIT VOTES PENSION RISE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Senate Finance Committee gave final approval today to a bill increasing Social Security benefits in two steps over the next seven months.

title: CIGARETTE LIGHTERS STIR U.S. CONCERN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Government may move to block the sale of butane cigarette lighters that it says can spout a foothigh flame.

title: BEAME CUTS STAFF IN MAYOR'S OFFICE, ADDS A 3D DEPUTY
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame announced a major reorganization of the Mayor's office yesterday, including the elimination of 50 jobs on the Mayor's executive staff and the setting up of a more powerful Bureau of the Budget and three positions of Deputy Mayor with new responsibilities.

title: Ensemble Presents Elizabethan Music On Theme of Love
description: The New York Pro Musica Antigua began its 20thanniversary New York season Monday night with a concert in Tully Hall devoted to Elizabethan music on the theme of love. The group has had its occasional troubles since the death of its founder, Noah Greenberg, and many of them have to do with the simple increase in the number and quality of competing groups that likewise specialize in preBaroque repertory.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The pink Cadillac convertible stands outside the pink beauty salon at 2551 Seventh Avenue. Pink is my favorite color, explains Rose Morgan. We even used to paint the sidewalk pink at my former shop. Downtown may know the handsome woman with the big smile and erect carriage because she was Mrs. Joe Louis back in the 1950's. But in Harlem, she's been a household word since she came from Chicago in 1940 to open a small salon and pioneer the idea that black is beautiful, especially with a little help from experts who understand the black woman's beauty problems.

title: Woodall Stoically Returns to His Old Seat
description: Al Woodall could look at his situation this way:

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Islanders Drop 4th in Row, 42
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 20, With a sloppy performance that moved Coach Al Arbour to say, We've got to start from scratch, the Islanders dropped their fourth straight game tonight, a 42 loss to the rejuvenated Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: E. Stroudsburg Wins
description: EAST STROUDSBURG, Pa., Nov. 20 (UPI)East Stroudsburg State College defeated Elizabethtown, 10, today to win the Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Delaware Regional National College Division soccer tournament. The winning goal by Brian Garhrielson, a senior, was the first of his college career and came in the second overtime.

title: People and Business
description: Edward S. Donnell, president of Montgomery Ward and its parent company, Marcor, told analysts yesterday there just might be some business for his industry in the energy crisis.

title: Washington Star Guild Unit Protests Impeachment Call
description: WASHINGON, Nov. 20 (AP)More than 100 members of The Washington StarNews unit of the Newspaper Guild are protesting the recent action of the Guild's international executive board in calling for President Nixon's impeachment.

title: Qaddafi Sees Virtual Alliance Between Libya and Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 20  Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan revolutionary leader, today depicted a virtual alliance between his country, which has great oil wealth, and Marxist Yugoslavia.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Manhattanbound subway train was derailed on the IRT's Flushing line yesterday afternoon, putting the stretch between Court House Square in Queens and Times Square out of service for more than two hours. No injuries were reported as a result of the accident.

title: Mediation Pledge Ends SitIn at Ramapo
description: MAHWAH, Nov. 20  A group of about 13 black and Hispanic students ended a 28hour sitin at the Ramapo State College recreation building today after agreeing to Federal mediation of their demands, which included more financial aid and the dismissal of 10 faculty members they callled racist.

title: Cambodian Officials Seem Untroubled by Palace Raid
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 20The Government took a considerably more relaxed attitude today toward the bombing of the presidential palace than it did last March, when a similar incident occurred.

title: PENNEY EARNINGS SHOW AN 82% GAIN
Walker Paces Bulls
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (UPI) Chet Walker scored 6 of his gamehigh 30 points in the final two minutes tonight to lead Chicago to a 106101 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers. It was The Bulls' 14th victory in the last 16 contests.

title: I.B.M. Files an Appeal On Damages Owed Telex
description: DENVER, Nov. 20 (AP)The International Business Machines Corporation filed an appeal today of the $259.5million damages a Federal judge ordered the company to pay the Telex Corporation for alleged monopolistic practices.

title: Nadjari Charges A City Aide Shared Bribe Given Judge
description: The office of the state's anticorruption prosecutor yesterday accused a $22,000ayear official in the City Finance Administration of having received a substantial sum of money that was part of the proceeds of a bribe.

title: CopperFutures Contracts for the December Delivery Rise by the Daily Limits
description: After a delayed opening, copper futures contracts for December delivery agair soared the daily permissible limit of 3 cents a pound, setting another record price. It closed at the new high of $1.05 85/100 a pound, up from $1.02 85/100, on the Commodity Exchange.

title: Ahumada to Fight Kendall Dec. 14
description: Jorge Ahumada of Argentina has been matched with Andy Kendall, of Portland, Ore., for a 10round lightheavyweight semifinal bout to the Jerry QuarryErnie Shavers heavyweight fight in Madison Square Garden on Dec. 14.

title: Fannie Mae Reduces Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (Reuters)The Federal National Mortgage Association said today it was reducing its shortterm discount rates, The new rates it will pay are: 30591 days, 7,75 per cent, down from 7.90 per cent; GO89 days 7,85 per cent, from 8,20 per cent 90.179 days 7.95. per cent, from S.50 per cent; 180270 days 7.95 per cent, from 8,40 per cent.

title: Bork and Jaworski Viewed as Reluctant to Investigate Aspects of the I.T.T. Cass..
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Representative J. J. Pickle charged today that Acting Attorney General Robert H. Bork and Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, were engaged in an Alphonseand Gaston act over who had jurisdiction to investigate various aspects of a merger of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation and the Hartford Fire Insurance Company.

title: Quiet Illinois Village Backs Big Amusement Park
description: GURNEE, Ill., Nov. 20The Village Board of Gurnee unanimously approved last night the annexation of 600 acres of farmland that is scheduled to become a $40million amusement park owned by the Marriott Corporation.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN BOND MARKET
description: Prices moved up yesterday in the corporate, taxexempt and Government bond markets.

title: GASOLINE SALES ON SUNDAY FACING PRESIDENTIAL BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Wellplaced Administration sources said today that President Nixon would prohibit the sale of gasoline on Sundays, but that the ban was unlikely to take effect before Dec. 9.

title: GASOLINE SALES ON SUNDAY FACING PRESIDENTIAL BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Wellplaced Administration sources said today that President Nixon would prohibit the sale of gasoline on Sundays, but that the ban was unlikely to take effect before Dec. 9.

title: NEWSPRINT GROWTH SEEN NOT PROFITABLE.
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 20 (AP)Three paper mill presidents said today that the current newsprint price of $200 a ton did not make it profitable to expand operations in order to meet growing demand.

title: Senate Unit Backs Ford, 9 to 0; Approval on Floor Is Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Senate Rules Committee unanimously approved today the nomination of Gerald R. Ford as Vice President of the United States.

title: Texas, Citing Supply, Plans 100% Output
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 20The Texas Railroad Commission said today it would continue virtually all Texas oil wells at 100 per cent production through December.

title: Lockheed Leads In Defense Work For a Fifth Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (Reuters)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation headed the list of the Defense Department's prime contractors for the fifth straight year in the 1973 fiscal year, ended last June, the Pentagon announced today.

title: Football Transactions NATIONAL CONFERENCE
description: NEW ORLEANSPlaced Box Brown, tight end, on injured reserve list.

title: Senate Confirms 38 Nominees Snarled by Treasury Deadlock
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The Senate, in a unanimousconsent action, confirmed 38 executive appointments today that had been blocked in some cases for over a fortnight by disagreement over the nomination of Helmut Sonnenfeldt as Under Secretary of Treasury.

title: Coast Guard Coach Quits
description: NEW LONDON, Nov. 20 (AP)Ted Schroeder, who rebuilt a losing Coast Guard Academy football team with two winning seasons in the last three years, will resign Nov, 29. Schroeder said he had no definite plans.

title: Prices of Stocks Plunge Again; Declines Exceed Gains 9 to 1
description: The stock market yesterday suffered its second consecutive sharp drop in heavy trading.

title: U.N. Association Planning To Publish Monthly Paper
description: The United Nations Association of the United States has announced that it will start publishing a monthly tabloid newspaper in March. At the same time the association announced it would cease publication of VISTA Magazine with the December issues.

title: Soviet Wants Palestinian Role In Any Mideast Peace Parley
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20  The Soviet Union has taken the firm position in private talks with the West that the Palestinians must be represented at any Middle East peace conference.

title: Records
description: If Ruth Etting is remembered at all these days, it is probably because of a film made 20 years ago that was based to some extent on the life of the onetime Ziegfeld Follies star. It was called Love Me or Leave Me and Doris Day played and sang the role of Miss Etting. Apropos of nothing in particular, a collection of recordings by the real Miss Etting made between 1926 and 1931, Hello Baby (Biograph C11, $5.98), has now suddenly appeared. It serves not only to rescue Miss Etting from the oblivion of being a character in a Doris Day movie, but also as a reminder that not all pop singers of the twenties were the ridiculous camp characters that have recently been portrayed.

title: TV Stagehands End Walkout; Get 42% Increase Over 4 Years
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20 (AP) Television studio stagehands ended their threeweek strike here against the three major networks today, accepting a contract providing for a 42 per cent pay raise over four years.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: First Campaign Act Fines Levied

title: Blazers Restructured
description: VANCOUVER, Nov. 20 (AP)James A. Pattison owner of the Vancouver Blazers of the World Hockey Association, announced today that the club had been sold to Neonex International, Ltd.

title: Saigon Raises Gas Prices To Cut Energy Consumption
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 20 (UPI)The South Vietnamese Government raised gasoline prices about 32 cents a gallon today in an attempt to cut civilian energy consumption by 25 per cent within two months.

title: Oil: Alarms Growing in Europe and U.S.
description: PARIS, Nov. 20The cutback of Arab oil supplies, now running into its second month, is affecting the economies of European nations, and fears that it could trigger a recession next year are sending the stock markets of the Continent down about as sharply as in Wall Street. French, British, West German, Italian and Dutch share averages are all down 15 to 20 per cent over the last month.

title: EDWARD TERRACE, 37, ART EXPERT, IS DEAD
description: Edward L. B. Terrace, an authority on Egyptian and ancient Near East art, died Nov. 13 in Cairo, where he was studying ancient decorative arts with the aid of the Smithsonian Institution and the Kress Foundation. Associates at the headquarters in Princeton, N. J., of the American Research Center in Egypt, which was sponsoring his studies, said they had been advised that the Cairo police were investigating the death as a murder, with robbery as a possible motive. Mr. Terrace, who was found dead in his apartment, was 37 years old.

title: Mt. Carmel Guild Offers Hope and Help To the Handicapped of Four Counties
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20  When the 700 people expected to turn out for the Mount Carmel Guild's annual luncheon at the Robert Treat Hotel today turned out to be 900, nobody was much surprised.

title: Manfield Reads Senate His Elegy For John Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The irst order of business of the ??enate today was a poem of emembrance of President Kenledy, by the Senate majority eader, Mike Mansfield of Monana, which he read into the ecord as a few Senators stood by.

title: Israel's Cabinet Considers Its Next Move in Deadlock
description: JERUSALEM, Wednesday, Nov. 21The Israeli Cabinet net for four and a half hours last night to debate Israel's next move in the deadlocked negotiations with Egypt over the withdrawal or torces along the Suez Canal. The deadlock, it has become increasingly clear, involves much more than technicalities about the Oct. 22 ceasefire line.

title: Bache in Black for the Quarter Following 6 Months of Red Ink
description: Bache & Co., Inc., the nation's largest securities house, after Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., operated in the black in the first fiscal quarter ended Oct. 31 after six months of deficit operations.

title: GRUMMAN, CHECKER RESUMING DIVIDENDS
description: The Grumman Corporation and the Checker Motors Corporation announced today the resumption of dividend payments to shareholders.

title: Vote Fraud Charged
description: Mrs. Betty Beatty, wife of State Senator Vander L. Beatty of Brooklyn, was indicted yesterday on charges alleging voting fraud and forgery in the District 17 Community School Board elections on May 1. Page 50.

title: On a Mixed Police Patrol in Midtown
description: It was 6:15 P.M. and Squad Car 2376 was weaving through rushhour traffic, siren screeching, flashing light turning, heading to O'Keefe's Bar at 31st Street and Sixth Avenue, where there was report of a fight with knives.

title: Rockefeller Sees Beame, Calls Saving Fare Possible
description: Governor Rockefeller met with Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame yesterday and said later that there could be a chance of saving the 35cent transit fare if Federal masstransit aid were enacted.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Hold Bolstered As Foes Join Her at State Level
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 20Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's political position has been substantially strengthened by defections at the state level among her principal opponents.

title: Hockey Transactions NATIONAL LEAGUE
description: BOSTONAnnounced Ross Brooks and Ken Broderick, goalies, would alternate two week stints with Bruins and Boston Braves of American League; recalled Derek San. dersen, center, from Braves.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: HORSE Trucking4 sale 6 yr Bay Gel 15.3 high $500. 12 yr Buckskin 16.1 $400. Good riders only. Stalls for rent $75 & up. Horses for rent. Winter months only, $125 each, 5164770493.

title: Nature and Man Peril Chesapeake Oyster Fleet
description: CAMBRIDGE, Md., Nov. 20 Under the cold pallor of a November moon, eight tall ships awaited dawn in the snug, keyholeshaped harbor, their jutting masts and angled rigging creaking softly, casting long, bobbing shadows on the low skyline of docks and warehouses.
