description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: On a Mixed Police Patrol in Midtown
description: It was 6:15 P.M. and Squad Car 2376 was weaving through rushhour traffic, siren screeching, flashing light turning, heading to O'Keefe's Bar at 31st Street and Sixth Avenue, where there was a report of a fight with knives.

title: Senator's Wife Accused of School Election Fraud
description: Mrs. Betty Beatty, the wife of State Senator Vander L., Beatty of Brooklyn, was charged yesterday with voting fraud in a 62count indictment that accused her of forgery and tampering with public records in District 17's Community School Board elections on May 1.

title: Connecticut Water Gets 10.8% Increase in Rates
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 20 (UPI) The State Public Utilities Commission yesterday gave the O.K. for Connecticut Water Company to raise its rates 10.8 per cent.

title: Ann Swinburne Munroe Dead; Singer Was Schirmer Director
description: Mrs. Ann Swinburne Ditchburn Munroe, a former comic opera star and for many years a director of G. Schirmer, Inc., died Saturday in Doctors Hospital. The widow of Charles A. Munroe, a financier, she was 87 years old and lived at Munroe House in Nassau, the Bahamas.

title: C F & I's Roebling Division Ends WireFabric Output
description: The Roebling division of the C F & I Steel Corporation said yesterday it had discontinued the manufacture of welded wire fabric at Roebling, N. J. The division's general manager, J. R. Nelson, said the action was made necessary because the company had been unable to secure price relief from the Cost of Living Council in the face of rising costs.

title: MARTHA GRAHAM SALUTED BY CITY
description: Basking in the glow of public testimonials and murmured greetings from longtime admirers, friends and 500 guests invited for the occasion, a radiant Martha Graham received a special tribute last night on behalf of all New Yorkers from the Mayor's office.

title: Israel's Cabinet Considers Its Next Move in Deadlock
description: JERUSALEM, Wednesday, Nov, 21The Israeli Cabinet met for four and a half boars last night todebate Israeli next move in the deadlocked negotiations with Egypt over the withdrawal of forces along the Suez Canal. The deadlock, it has become increasingly clear, involves much more than technicalities about the Oct. 22 ceasefire line.

title: Woodall Stoically Returns to His Old Seat
description: Al Woodall could look at his situation this way:

title: SCALI, U.N. DELEGATE, HAS HEART SURGERY
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 20John Scali, United States representative to the United Nations, underwent open heart surgery today at the Arizona Heart Institute.

title: Senate Unit Approves $475Billion Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)The Senate Finance Committee today approved a Housepassed bill fixing a new $475.7billion national debt limit through June 30, 1974.

title: Prisoner Escapes Upstate
description: COXSACKIE, N. Y., Nov. 20 (UPI)  The State Police searched today for one of two inmates who escaped last night from the Coxsackie Correctional Facility and stole a car. The car, chased by troopers, overturned in the Columbia County town of Livingston, and David Roy Burns, 18 years old, was captured shortly afterward. However, the other inmate, Howard Louis Stocking, 22, disappeared into the woods.

title: UNIONISTS SUPPORT ULSTER COALITION
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 20Former Prime Minister Brian Faulkner today barely defeated an effort by hardliners to take control of the Unionist party, Northern Ireland's major Protestant political grouping.

title: Thanksgiving Schedule
description: Thanksgiving Day will be celebrated as customary tomorrow with family turkey dinners at home, special meals for inmates of government institutions, the needy and homeless, holiday exhibitions at museums and Macy's anuual balloon parade down Broadway.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Russians Ask Soccer Delay

title: Bus Crashes in Mexico; 15 Die and 10 Are Missing
description: SAN NICOLAS, Mexico, Nov. 20 (AP)An overcrowded bus carrying religious pilgrims skidded off a mountain road tonight and plunged 141 feet down a ravine. The Red Cross said that 15 persons had been killed and 43 had been injured, most of them children.

title: Energy Shortage Expected To Trim G.N.P. 1% in 1974
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A leading economic forecasting group estimated today that the energy shortage would cut only about 1 per cent from the total output of the American economy next year.

title: Phillips Petroleum to Spend
description: The Phillips Petroleum Company expects to spend over $400million on next year's capital expenditures, Robert Sears, vice president, told St. Louis security analysts yesterday. He said this would be about the same amount that will be spent this year and compared with $265million in 1972. Mr. Sears said that from 1972 to 1974 and for the foreseeable future, about 75 per cent will be spent on exploration and production.

title: 3 TOP POLITICIANS CURBED IN GREECE
description: ATHENS, Nov. 20Three leading Greek politicians were put under police guard tonight after being repeatedly accused in Government statements of instigating the students revolt here.

title: 80 Clinics in the New Bellevue Giving 1,300 More Personal Care Each Day
description: Eighty clinics are treating more than 1,300 outpatients a day at Bellevue Hospital's new glassandconcrete skyscraper a little more than a week after its opening.

title: Will the Ides of '69 Plague Dartmouth?
description: In 1969 Coach Bob Blackman took an undefeated Dartmouth team into Palmer Stadium to play Princeton in the season finale. The Tigers won, 357, and grabbed a share of the Ivy League championship with Dartmouth and Yale. Once again in the topsyturvy league race Dartmouth has a chance to win the title outright or share it with Haryard. And those two teams were not even supposed to have a chance at the title.

title: UTILITY MLLS UP OVER THE NATION
description: Home heating and lighting bills are climbing across the nation, with more increases likely before the end of winter.

title: Spokesman Denies Vesco Plans to Ask Haven in Argentina
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, Nov. 20 (AP)A spokesman for Robert L. Vesco confirmed today that the American financier had a permanent resident visa in Argentina but denied that he planned to use it as a safe haven from United States authorities.

title: Saxbe's Route to Capital Began on Ohio Campus
description: Years ago, the boys of Si U's would gather at Smitty's drug store on the fringes of the Ohio State University campus before and after football games to fill up on chili and political chitchat.

title: Albany Budget $41.6Million
description: ALBANY, Nov. 20 (UPI) Mayor Erastus Corning 2d unveiled a record $41.6million city budget yesterday, saying it would provide raises for all city employes but generally hold the line on property taxes. Mr. Corning said the current tax rate of $64,06 for each $1,000 of assessed valuation would be affected by only a few pennies, up or down, once the final budget tabulation was in. The Common Council set Dec 3 for a hearing.

title: BEAME CUTS STAFF IN MAYOR'S OFFICE, ADDS A 3D DEPUTY
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame announced a major reorganization of the Mayor's office yesterday, including the elimination of 50 jobs on the Mayor's executive staff and the setting up of a more powerful Bureau of the Budget and three positions of Deputy Mayor with new responsibilities.

title: Rally of Forests Is Led by Makinen
description: YORK, England, Nov. 20 (AP)Timo Makinen of Finland led the British Rally of the Forests today in a worksentered Ford. Escort. After four days and 1,800 miles, he led by more than three minutes.

title: Amid Attacks on Press, Richardson Order Is Seen as One Bright Spot
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Judicial, legislative and executive attacks on the press have been increasing, in some cases quietly and subtly, at the very time that the press has been receiving praise for its Watergate disclosures.

title: APA Truck Ends Agreement To Buy Stock From Eastern
description: Eastern Freight Ways, Inc., announced yesterday that the APA Truck Leasing Corporation had terminated its recently announced agreement to purchase Eastern's approximately 46 per cent stock interest in Associated Transport. APA had proposed a tender offer for all of the outstanding shares of Associated at $14.25 a share.

title: BROOKLYN AREA MADE LANDMARK
description: A slice of an old Brooklyn neighborhood that has been reborn in the last decade after having deteriorated into a slum was designated by the Landmarks Preservation Commission yesterday as a historic district.

title: Notes on People
description: One man who isn't happy with all the talk about banning Sunday driving is the Rev. Billy Graham. Sunday, he said in an interview, thinking of church services, is the one time of week that we ought to use as much gasoline as possible. If our country ever needed the Lord, it is now. If we have to cut down, let's do it somewhere else. But Dr. Graham would not mind, especially, if gasoline sales on Sunday were banned. This would also mean that the gas station operators could go to church, he said.

title: Opera: Taiwan Style
description: Chinese opera is very, very, very, very old, old, old, old. Its roots go back 3,000 years, and through the centuries it has built up a specific vocabulary of movement, gesture, symbolism and mime. Few nonOrientals are attuned to the subtleties. But any Westerner can appreciate the gorgeous color and costumes, the sheer athleticism of some of the action, even the basic action.

title: E.C.A.C. Teams Land TV Series
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference has announced a 10game television contract with TVS, Inc., for the 197374 basketball season. Robert M. (Scotty) Whitelaw, the E.C.A.C. commissioner, made the announcement.

title: UTILITY BILLS UP OVER THE NATION
description: Home heating and lighting bills are climbing across the nation, with more increases likely before the end of winter.

title: Top Federal Health Aide Calls Cancer Law of 1971 a Mistake
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The nation's top health officer conceded today that the current law to implement an allout drive against cancer was mistake administratively.

title: W. H. A. Shifts Blades to Jersey; Howell Takes Over as Coach
description: The weeks of waiting and wondering ended for the New York Golden Blades' players and their families yesterday when the World Hockey Association plucked the team out of Madison Square Garden and moved it to the more rustic, and less expensive, Cherry Hill Arena in New Jersey.

title: Jaworski to Look Into a Series of Sensitive Areas
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 The special Watergate prosecutor made clear today that he planned to look into a series of sensitive areas that in the past have raised objections from the White House.

title: ARREST WRIT VOID IN GREEKART CASE
description: The Italian magistrate investigating the origins of a Greek vase sold to the Metropolitan Museum of Art for $1million unofficially confirmed reports yesterday that an Italian high court had annulled an arrest warrant against the seller, Robert E. Hecht Jr.

title: Astronaut Reports on Weightlessness
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)Edward G. Gibson, Skylab 3 astronautscientist, said today that lack of gravity in the eightroom space vehicle had disoriented the crew and even made tying shoelaces a chore.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Henri Bendel's, which is constantly exploring new fashion frontiers, has introduced collections by two designers that offer interesting departures from the cookycutter look of a lot of current clothes.

title: Mekong Delta Communists Step Up Terrorist Activity
description: BEN TRE, South Vietnam, Nov. 20 While large  scale fighting is spreading in other parts of the country, Communist units appear to be stepping up a program of selective violence in the Mekong Delta.

title: Women Who Clean Offices Through the Night: A Lonely Life
description: The women come to work each weekday night at 5:30. The hugeness of the two tallest buildings in the world does not bother them. Nor does the sound the wind makes in the vast, empty lobbies or the long corridors where they are alone, moving their mops.

title: Senate Unit Backs Ford, 9 to 0; Approval on Floor Is Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate Rules Committee unanimously approved today the nomination of Gerald R. Ford as Vice President of the United States.

title: 76ers 109103 Victors
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 20 (UPI)Tom Van Arsdale and Larry Jones scored 10 points each in the third quarter tonight, sparking the Philadelphia 76ers to a 109103 victoty over the Kansas CityOmaha Kings in an N.B.A. game.

title: Advertising: Sport Trustables
description: Because the average guy is familiar with a sports personality and respects his (or her) talent doesn't mean he likes him (or her) or would trust his (or her) endorsement of a product, an almost completed national survey pointedly shows.

title: T.W.A. Strike Deadlocked.
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 20 (UPI)The president of Trans World Airlines, F. C. Wiser, said today that there appeared to be no prospect for an early end to the stewardess strike that has grounded all TWA planes since Nov..5. No additional meetings have been scheduled nor are there any in prospect at this time, he said.

title: DECISION NEARING ON FIREMEN'S PACT
description: The Board of Collective Bargaining was reported yesterday to be close to a final determination in its review of the recommendations of the impasse panel in the recent firemen's dispute.

title: Red Wings Victors Over Kings, 6 to 5
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20 (AP)Mickey Redmond and Nick Libett scored two goals apiece as the Detroit Red Wings struggled to a 6.5 victory over the Los Angeles Kings tonight.

title: Less Oil on the Waters
description: Three times in the past twenty years; international attempts have been made to stein the deadly polluting of the world's oceans. The most recent effort is far and away the most sweeping and the most hopeful. Under the auspices of the Intergovernmental Maritime Consultative Organization, a United Nations agency, representatives of 79 nations earlier this month agreed on steps that could conceivably reduce oceanic pollution by fifty per cent.

title: Nixon Assures Governors He Will Allay Public Doubt
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 20President Nixon assured the nation's Republican Governors today that he would clear up the public doubts about him with the release of detailed information about Watergate, his personal finances and other charges of scandal in the White House.

title: Bonavena Halts Sorrels
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 20 (Reuters)  Oscar Bonavena of Argentina, currently rated the No. 7 heavyweight in the world by Ring Magazine, knocked out Terry Sorrels of San Antonio, Texas, after 1 minute 37 seconds of the second round of a seceduled 10rounder tonight.

title: British, Football
description: By Reuters

title: Kodes 63. 62 Victor
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Nov. 20 (AP)Czechoslovak players were in the spotlight today in the second round of the South Australian tennis championships.

title: NADJARI ACCUSES CITY AIDE IN BRIBE
description: The office of the state's anticorruption proseeutor yesterday accused a $22,000ayear official in the City Finance Administration of having received a substantial sum of money that was part of the proceeds of a bribe.

title: Amex Prices Continue to Sink; Index Drop of 2.89 Is a Record
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to plunge yesterday. Declines were also recorded in the overthecounter market.

title: Young Rebels, a New Force in Greek Politics
description: ATHENS, Nov. 20The militarybacked Government has put down last week's student rebellion with tanks, mass arrests and courtsmartial, but many Greeks predict that a radical youth movement is here to stay as a political force.

title: An Implied Soviet Threat Spurred U.S.Forces' Alert
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Soviet note that led to a precautionary alert of United States forces around the world on the night of Oct. 24 carried an implied threat rather than an actual threat of the dispatch of Soviet troops to the Suez war zone.

title: Pacers Beat Stars
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 20 (AP)  Bob Netolicky and Kevin. Joyce, a rookie, led an Indiana Pacer rally that helped the defending American Basketball champions beat Stars. 10298, Association the Utah tonight.

title: GOVERNOR GOVERNOR GOVERNOR TO TELL '74 PLANS BY JAN. 9
description: Governor Rockefeller says he will announce whether he will seek reelection before the Jan. 9 opening of the Legislature so that the legislators will not be diverted by confusion over his intentions.

title: KISSINGER MEETS WITH SENATE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 20Secretary of State Kissinger told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today that the United States still hopeddespite some Israeli qualmsto start the Middle East peace conference around the middle of next month.

title: MRS. A. S. GROSS SR.
description: Mrs. Marie Gross, widow of Alexander S. Gross Sr., a custom tailor, died Monday in Parkway Hospital, Forest Hills, Queens. She was 93 years old and lived at 9918 66th Ave., Forest Hills.

title: The Energy Illusions
description: BETHESDA, Md.A nation that bases a vital national policy on illusions is inviting trouble. The energy crisiswhich is worsening each week is a classic example of policymaking by myth. For the past two years we have seen monumental miscalculations both by energy executives and the Nixon Administrationand the President's latest special message (his fourth on energy since April) essentially applies a bandaid to hemorrhage.

title: Special Dividend Declared
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 20 (AP)The Republic Steel Corporation declared today a $1 special dividend on common stock in addition to the regular quarterly dividend of 30 cents, its board of directors reported. The dividends are payable Dec. 20 to stockholders of record Nov. 30. The action brought the 1973 dividends to a total of $2.15 per share.

title: Knicks Take 5th Straight
description: Bill Bradley did it all for the Knicks last night. He scored a season high of 29 points, passed off, set picks and boxed his men out as the Knicks beat the Los Angeles Lakers, 10589, for their fifth straight victory.

title: 2 Arabs Plan Tour to Explain Demands
description: VIENNA, Nov. 20  Two Arab oil ministers will begin a tour of Western Europe, the United States and Japan next week to explain why the Arab pit embargo was imposed and how it may be lifted.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: If President Nixon sanctioned or acquiesced in the White House campaign to terrorize and intimidate the media, as revealed by the memorandums made public by Senator Weicker, it is one more addition to the potential list of impeachable offenses which ought to be examined by the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Construction Worker Killed
description: A worker was killed shortly after noon yesterday when he was struck by a crane at a construction site at 135th Street and 12th Avenue. The police identified the victim as Quincy Cook, 48 years old, of 2086 Second Avenue.

title: Borg, Dibbs Advance
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 20 (AP)Bjorn Borg of Sweden, Ion Tiriac of Rumania and Eddie Dibbs of Miami were among the firstround winners today in the $40,000 South American open tennis tournament. All three beat Argentines. Julie Heldman of Houston advanced in the sec ond round of the women's singles.

title: Falcons' Rise Means Fall of Cowboys or Redskins
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 20Late in the game won by the Falcons over the Minnesota Vikings last night, it occurred to two distant coaches, George Allen and Tom Landry, who have been to the Super Bowl and would like to go back, that what was happening on the television screen was decidedly against the best interests of their teams. The Falcons, in a significant and smashing victory, indicated they are going to keep either Landry's Dallas Cowboys or Allen's Washington Redskins out of the playoffs that lead to the Super Bowl.

title: Stock Prices Suffer 17.76Point Tumble
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday for the second consecutive session, with declines outnumbering advances more than nine to one in heavy trading.

title: Vote Fraud Charged
description: Mrs. Betty Beatty, wife of State Senator Vander L. Beatty of Brooklyn, was indicted yesterday on charges alleging voting fraud and forgery in the District 17 Community School Board elections on May 1. Page 50.

title: The Shifting Gold Role
description: First came the announcement last week by Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, that the United States and six European nations had agreed to end the twotier gold system, which had prevented governments from buying or selling gold on the free market since 1968. Then came the statement this week by George P. Shultz, Secretary of the Treasury, that individual American citizens might soon be able to buy or sell goldsomething they have not been able to do, since 1933 when Congress raised the buying price from $21 to $35 an ounce and called in private bullion holdings.

title: Council's Finance Group Delays Stadium Decision
description: The City Council Finance Committee yesterday laid over until next Tuesday consideration of two important, controversial budget amendments$15.9million for the reconstruction of Yankee Stadium an $50million to start construe tion of a new $200million con vention center.

title: Auto Industry Seeks New Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Auto industry executives asked the Cost of Living Council today for a new round of price increases to help soften the impact of rising costs.

title: People in Sports: For Coaches, Security Is Not in the Contract
description: If the unemployment statistics are showing a sharp rise, football may be the reason. Several coaches lost their jobs yesterday, other departures seemed imminent, a few players quit and one coach neared retirement.

title: W.H.A. Shifts Blades to Jersey; Howell Takes Over as Coach
description: The weeks of waiting and wondering ended for the New York Golden Blades' players and their families yesterday when the World Hockey Association plucked the team out of Madison Square Garden and moved it to the more rustic, and less expensive, Cherry Hill Arena in New Jersey.

title: U.S. and British Airlines Cut Flights
description: Four airlines that operate between London and the United States agreed yesterday to sizable cuts in service to help cope with the fuel shortage.

title: Auto Industry Seeks New Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Auto industry executives asked the Cost of Living Council today for a new round of price increases to help soften the impact of rising costs.

title: Figure in Milk Case Gave Own Funds to Muskie Drive
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20 (AP)A lawyer who admits receiving payments disguised as legal fees from Associated Milk Producers, Inc., said today that he had made personal contributions to campaign committees for Democratic Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine.

title: Hecklers on Staten Island Bar Shockley Speech on Genetics
description: A clapping, shouting, whistling group of young people at Staten Island Community College succeeded last night in preventing a talk by Dr. WilLiam B. Shockley, a Nobel prizewinning physicist who has aroused national controversy with his views about intelligence and race.

title: Doctors Encouraged by Liver Implant
description: Surgeons at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center here said yesterday that they were very encouraged by progress made in developing an experimental technique of giving selected patients an auxiliary liver.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Red Smith
description: Eightyone years ago a cafe parfait in Parker's in Boston cost 30 cents. For this intelligence, which you can't get from just any old sports column, we are indebted to a new periodical called Harvard Magazine, edited by John Bethel, who wears a beard and writes under the name of Sedgwick Wetherbee. Using that nom de plume, he produced a piece on HarvardYale football (known to the reverent simply as The Game) and illustrated it with a reproduction of a dessert menu from Parker's defaced Loren F. Deland's original diagram of the flying wedge. Deland was a chess master at Harvard and his wedge was first employed in 1892 against Yale. Though Yale won that game, 60, Deland's 11man juggernaut worked such carnage that it was outlawed after one year.

title: Something for Which To Be Thankful
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20If you're trying to figure out what you should be thankful for over the holiday weekend, you might begin by being thankful that you don't have to handle the fuel shortage or administer the National Emergency. Energy Bill (S.2589) just passed by the Senate, 786.

title: Nicolson Calls His Book a Panegyric
description: At the heart of Portrait of a Marriage, Nigel Nicolson's bestselling book about the open marriage of his late parentsthe poetnovelist Vita SackvilleWest and the authordiplomat Harold Nicolsonis his mother's secret memoir confessing her passionate love affair in 1920 with the novelist Violet Trefusis.

title: Aleksandr Komarovsky Dead; Led Soviet Army Construction
description: Gen. Aleksandr N. Komarovsky, the Soviet Union's military construction chief, died Monday in Moscow, the press agency Tass announced. He was 67 years old.

title: 2 DEAD, ONE HURT IN A FIGHT UPTOWN
description: Two young men were dead from gunshot and stab wounds and a third lay seriously wounded following a violent street argument on 110th Street between Lexington and Park Avenues last night.

title: Boy, 6, Fatally Attacked by Guard Dogs
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 20  A 6yearold boy was fatally attacked, apparently by two German shepherds, in a vacant lot here last night, the police reported today. The two dogs, were found by the body, lunged at police officers and were shot to death.

title: MARIJUANA FOUND NO ANESTHESIA AID
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20A University of Pennsylvania anesthesiologist Investigating the possible medical uses of marijuana has tentatively concluded that the drug is unsuited for a major role as a surgical anesthesia.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Mrs. Leonard Maurer, 72; State Department ExAide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Mrs. Isabel Avila Maurer, a former State Department information officer and wife of Leonard Maurer, a Washington printer and printmaker, died Friday in Washington Hospital Center. She was 72 years old.

title: Prices of Stocks Plunge Again; Declines Exceed Gains 9 to 1
description: The stock market yesterday suffered its second consecutive sharp drop in heavy trading.

title: Braves Rout Suns With 3615 Period
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Buffalo Braves, hitting 63.7 per cent from the field in the second quarter, coasted to a 127100 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns tonight.

title: MUSICUS CHARGES OIL DOUBLE TALK
description: Mayor Lindsay's energy chief charged yesterday that a large Bronx oil company had used double talk when it said it would run out of fuel in a few days.

title: School Bus in Collision
description: A school bus and a privately owned bus collided yesterday, injuring 18 school children and their driver. The children were on their way to Intermediate School 24 when the bus collided at Hylan Boulevard and Cleveland Avenue about 9:30 A.M. The children and their driver were treated at Richmond Memorial Hospital and were released.

title: An Implied Soviet Threat Spurred U.S. Forces' Alert
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Soviet note that led to a precautionary alert of United States forces around the world on the night of Oct. 24 carried an implied threat rather than an actual threat of the dispatch of Soviet troops to the Suez war zone.

title: About New York City Tales in Search of a Moral
description: This is what happened on a lovely morning on Sixth Avenue between 42d and 43d Streets the other day: A handful of people paused and watched, while a man got into a limousine that had a parking ticket under its windshield wiper. Then the man's chauffeur plucked the ticket from underneath the windshield wiper, and with elaborate unconcern let it drop to the ground. Then the chauffeur got into the limousine, drove away, and left behind the people who had been watching. One of them picked up the parking ticket, and saw that the license plate on the limousine had been recorded as DPL223, which meant that the limousine belonged to a diplomat. This is a small lesson in arrogance, bad manners, and the impossibility of enforcthe parking regulations.

title: Senator's Wife Accused of School Election Fraud
description: Mrs. Betty Beatty, the wife of State Senator Vander L. Beatty of Brooklyn, was charged yesterday with voting fraud in a 62count indictment that accused her of forgery and tampering with public records in District 17's Community School Board elections on May 1.

title: Ethnic Diversity Marks Thanksgiving
description: Fifteen 25pound turkeys homecooked in Lower East Side kitchens accustomed to kosher, soul and Puerto Rican cuisineswere served last night at the annual preThanksgiving dinner at the Henry Street SettlementUrban Life Center.

title: Ashe Wins In. S. Africa Net Debut
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 20 (AP)Arthur Ashe, the black American playing for the first time in this apartheid country; scored a fifthround victory today in the $100,000 South African open tennis tournament. He beat Sherwood Stewart of Baytown, Tex., 61, 67, 64.

title: Leon Fokine, 68, Is Dead; Dancer Taught at Harkness
description: Leon Fokine, former ballet dancer and teacher, died Monday at his home, 181 Claremont Avenue. His age was 68. Mr. Fokine, the nephew of the late Michel Fokine, who was known as the father of modern ballet, was a teacher in his later years at the Harkness School of Ballet here and accompanied the Harkness Ballet Company on its European tours. He retired in 1967.

title: ANOTHER SECTION OF TAPES IS BLANK, A NIXON AIDE SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 The White House disclosed in court today that a portion of another Watergate conversation this one between President Nixon and H. R. Haldeman three days after the Watergate burglary  had not been recorded.

title: WOULDBE DINERS SURVIVE ORDEAL
description: DAVIS TOWNSHIP, Me., Nov. 21 (AP)Two men and two women on their way to formal dinner in a singleengine plane crashed into a mountain here and survived through night of swirling winds in five inches of snow by starting a fire using part of one woman's evening gown.

title: 28 Make Debuts At League Ball
description: Twentyeight provisional members of the Junior League of the City of New York were presented last night at the league's 25th annual Debutante Ball in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza. Mrs. Myers Torrey was chairman for the event, which benefits the league's Community Services Trust Fund.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Lambs, the theatrical club marking its centennial next year, will celebrate with a potpourri of scenes, sketches and songs from major Broadway shows of the past.

title: Lakers Roll As Goodrich Stands Out
description: COLLEGE PARK., Md. Nov. 21 (AP)Gail Goodrich scored 30 points, 18 in the second half, to lead the Los Angeles Lakers to a 10697 victory over the Capital Bullets in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HOLIDAY Thanksgiving. Someone in the kitchen, pots banging, getting ready for company and gourmand dining and the wish is that you and the rest of the family would go away until dinner is served. The object is to work up an appetite or, after eating, to work down the meal.

title: COUPLE PLANNING U.S. SNAKES SHOW
description: ALBEMARLE, N. C., Nov. 21 (UPI)Randy Gallagher and his wife soon will embark on what they hope will be a long tour of the United States, financed by taking along a van full of pets.

title: KENNEDY FAMILY OPPOSES '76 RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today that his family did not want him to run for President, but that did not necessarily mean he would not seek the nomination in 1976.

title: Pamela Stonesifer Is Bride in Jersey
description: RUMSON, N. J., Nov. 21Miss Pamela Ann Stonesifer, daughter of Richard J. Stonesifer, president of Monmouth College in West Long Branch, and Carl W. Hurley were married here this afternoon by the Rev. G. P. Mellick Belshaw at St. George's By The River Episcopal Church.

title: Bridge: Lead of the Ace in NoTrump Can Be Right in Some Cases
description: Beginners have a tendency to lead unsupported aces and then look round for something else to do. They soon learn to save their aces in the hope of using them more effectively to capture the opponents' kings and queens. In defending notrump, the ace should usually be preserved as an entry later in the play.

description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Because of increased costs, the armed services have cut back every serviceman's serving of turkey this Thanksgiving by 30 per cent.

title: City Council Unit Passes a Bill to License All TV Repairmen
description: A bill requiring the licensing of television, radio and audioequipment repair dealers and their service managers was approved yesterday by the City Council's Consumer Affairs Committee.

title: ' Sambizanga,' New Film About Angola, Tells of Oppression and Determination:The Cast
description: We've had all too little word of Angola since two black groups at Harvard and Radcliffe occupied a building in April of 1972, demanding that the university sell its shares of Gulf stockin light of Gulf's relationship with the Portuguese colonial regime in Angola. Harvard kept its stock. And the issue of independence for black Angolans hasn't gained much attention in this country.But now a very fine film, set in 1961, brings us a slab of the recent Angolan pastand forces us to wonder if the present is any different. "Sambizanga," which opened Wednesday at the Fifth Avenue Cinema, was directed by Sarah Maldoror, who was the assistant to Gillo Pontecorvo for "The Battle of Algiers." One of her collaborators on the screenplay was her husband, Mario de Andrade, a leader in the Angolan resistance. Since the movie couldn't be made in Angola, it was filmed in the Congo."Sambizanga" focuses on a young black couple (splendidly played by Domingus Oliviera and Elisa Andrade), who bask in each other's presence until the husband, a tractor driver, is suddenly arrested as a political prisoner.His wife, who knows nothing about his politics, walks with their baby on her back from village to village, between fields of tall grasses and huge hills, trying to locate him. Angry or desperate at moments, stoical at others, she struggles through a world that rarely explains anything to women. While she's sent from one police station to another, often repulsed or lied to, he's beaten by inquisitors who torture him in hopes of learning the names of others in the movement. He remains mute, but we almost wish that he would talk. And even his death is a relief.The power of this picture lies in contrasts. The fact that the inquisitors are murderers as well as racists is highlighted by the calm con-??? as blacks. Despite the daily suffering, there's also a stress on friendship and affection, the ease of intimacy and some fond teasing among people who are close, plus the gaiety of dancing and music and feasting. Therefore, when we see prisoners walking slowly in a small circle inside the prison yard, we're all the more aware of the simple freedoms of those on the outsidewho are at least able to stroll down a street or through a doorway.When the prisoners delicately cleanse the bloodied face of the husband's corpse, singing to him rather as though they were trying to comfort the dead, we remember him laughing and joking with his wife. It's that range of possibilitiesgood or atrocious, life enhancing or death dealingthat makes "Sambizanga" a revolutionary picture. Both subtly and simply, we're shown how bad things are, how much better they could be. As Americans, we may feel helpless while we watch this film. Yet the determination for change is deeply contagious.The movie doesn't put forth heroes or villains, and it offers a class analysis rather than a racial one. The emphasis is on the oppression of the poor by the richon the system that perpetuates a minority. Throughout, the plight of individuals helps to nail the political point. Meanwhile, let's hope that this impressive new director makes many sequels to her first feature film.

title: EGYPT TO RESTUDY SUMED PIPELINE
description: PARIS, Nov. 21Egypt has ordered a new feasibility study for the Sumed pipeline, raising doubts whether the biggest project in years involving Americans in the Middle East will ever get under way, it was learned today.

title: Kennedy's Role in History: Some Doubts
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 21 However the public may remember John, Fitzgetald Kennedy 10 years after his assassination, the scholars who will eventually fix his place in history are at loggerheads.

description: ACROSS

title: Vesco's Lawyers Link Politics To U.S. Bid for His Extradition
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, Nov. 21 (AP)  Lawyers for Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive United States financier, argued yesterday that politics and his $200,000 payment to President Nixon's reelection campaign were behind United States attempts to extradite Mr. Vesco on fraud charges.

title: Campo Saddles 2 Victors; He'll Try 151 Shot Today
description: Just after the fourth race at Aqueduct yesterday, there was a long wait until the photofinish camera showed that Grand Impression had beaten Brilliant Sage by the narrowest of margins. When the official sign went up, a fan shouted at Johnny Campo, Hey, Johnny. That's two for two. And the rotund Campo shouted right back, I know it. I'm doing all right, eh? The dialogue was occasioned by successive triumphs of 2yearold fillies owned by Arlene Schwartz and trained by Campo, Pig Puddles took the third, at $10.20, and then cameGrand Impression, who was much more popular with the crowd of 14,922, for her price was even money. These two were the only horses saddled by Campo on the program.

title: 6Man Panel of Experts Named To Examine White House Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Chief Federal Judge John J. Sirica announced today the names of a sixman advisory panel of technical experts selected by the Watergate prosecution force and the White House to study the authenticity and integrity of the tapes that the White House has furnished to the court.

title: Officials Suspect Russians Sent Atom Arms to Egypt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Defense officials said today that the United States had intelligence information suggesting that the Soviet Union might have moved nuclear warheads into Egypt at the height of the ArabIsraeli war last month.

title: AllAmerican Band To March in Parade
description: In the vanguard of Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade today will be a 102piece Marching ensemble in which probably the only discordant note will be that their dress pants don't match.

title: People and Business
description: Three vice presidentstwo octogenarians and one who is almost thereare retiring at the end of this Month from Jas. H. Oliphant & Co., Inc. Three younger menaged 73, 71 and 69, respectivelywill remain as vice presidents of the Wall Street brokerage house.

title: TREASURY PLANS TORAISE 3BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Treasury announced today an unexpected financing operation to raise $3billion in cash, mainly as a result of We indirect effects of the strength of the dollar on the foreignexchange markets.

title: ROBERT BOWER, 51, UNION CARBIDE AIDE
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Nov. 21 Robert D. Bower, a vice president of the Union Carbide Corporation, died today of heart attack at his home. He was 51 years old and lived at 3 Huguenot Drive.

title: Jailed Mafia Figures Lose Plea for Holiday at Home
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21  The New Jersey Superior Court refused today to continue a tradition of releasing five reputed Mafia figures from jail so they could spend Thanksgiving with their families.

title: PAINTER IS KILLED IN SYNAGOGUE FIRE
description: One man was killed in a twoalarm fire that burned out a twostory building housing a synagogue and yeshiva in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon.

title: Switzerland Bans Driving For Next Three Sundays
description: GENEVA, Nov. 21  The Swiss Government today announced a general ban on the private use of motor vehicles, planes and boats for the next three Sundays as a fuelconservation measure.

title: CONSULTANT POST AWARDED TO AGNEW
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21(AP) Former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew has been hired as consultant for J. W. Industries, a newlyformed international trading concern, Frank Jameson, the company's cofounder said today.

title: G.M. REDUCES BID FOR A PRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)The General Motors Corporation told the Cost of Living Council today that it would need less of a price increase for 1974 model cars than it had originally proposed.

title: Cosmos 609 Is Launched
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 21 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched today the 609th in its series of Cosmos satellites designed for space exploration and research, Tass press agency said all instruments on hoard were functioning normally.

title: Fare Subsidy Backed
description: Governor Rockefeller and Republican legislative leaders endorsed the concept of a state subsidy to help communities hold down transit fares, but said they would await Congressional action on masstransit aid before making any moves. Page 56.

title: AfoAKom Draws 200 at Washington Show
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21On a freshly painted black pedestal, beneath a single spotlight alone in an allblack room, the sacred statue AfoAKom went on display for the general public today for the first time in its 100year history.

title: Majors's Success at Pitt Breeds Foes' Suspicions
description: Johnny Majors has turned the University of Pittsburgh football team into a winner so quickly that opponents are restless and suspicious.

title: The Screen: 'Westworld':Robots and Fantasies in Film by Crichton The Cast
description: Michael Crichton, the young medical doctor and author of more than a dozen popular novels, including "The Andromeda Strain," makes a creditable debut as a film director with "West-world," a science-fiction melodrama about Doomsday in Disneyland. The film opened yesterday at the National and other theaters.The setting is not really Disneyland but a complex of three resorts  Westworld, Romanworld and Medievalworld  that carry some of the Disneyland-Disney World concepts as far as they can go.Guests at Westworld, for example, like the two Chicago businessmen played by Richard Benjamin and James Brolin, pay $1,000 a day each to realize their fantasies about living in the Old West.In a perfect reproduction of a frontier town, they can spend two weeks having the times of their lives in barroom fights, robbing the bank, shooting the sheriff and sleeping with the local dancehall girls, who are, like all the other citizens of the town, life-sized, computerized robots.Crichton the director seems to have had more fun with the film than Crichton the writer, whose screenplay can offer us no better explanation for the sudden, bloody robot rebellion than an epidemic of "central mechanism psychosis." This basic facetiousness is partly obscured by the vivid and sometimes amusing dimension of the film's anecdotes, which are mostly about the peril of the guests when make-believe gives way to reality.In addition to Benjamin and Brolin, the cast includes Yul Brynner as the town sheriff, who has no more humanity or sense of justice than a multicycle washing machine.

title: Boston Looks Into Alleged Bribes By Priests on Church Gambling
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)The District Attorney's office and the police announced today a combined investigation into alleged payoffs to the police by Roman Catholic clergymen to ignore illegal gambling activities at certain churches.

title: Scali Said to Be Making Good Surgical Recovry
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 21 (AP) John Scali, United States representative to the United Nations, was reported making a good recovery today after undergoing openheart surgery yesterday.

title: 300 Honor Kennedy At Dallas Ceremony
description: DALLAS, Nov. 21 (UPI)About 300 persons gathered in a cold wind at Kennedy Memorial Plaza today for 30 minutes of music and prayer to eulogize President John F. Kennedy one day ahead of the 10th anniversary of his assassination.

title: COPPER FUTURES DROP DAILY LIMIT
description: The new limitations on cop. per trading for December contracts ended yesterday the recent sharp rise in price on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: Four on Airliner Hurt
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 22 (AP)  Four passengers reported minor injuries today when they evacuated through the emergency chute of an Eastern Airlines jet that had skidded to a stop at Tampa International Airport. Its brake gear locked, an official said.

title: $86,000 THEFT LAID TO 7 IN POST OFFICE
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21Seven mail handlers have been accused of stealing $86,000 in travelers checks from a mail bag and going on a spending spree.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Even while you are contemplating your Thanksgiving turkey today, various consumer officials are warning that this is the season to be wary. As the Better Business Bureau puts it, gyp artists are usually extra busy during the Christmas season, and the bureau and others offer some advice on how not to get taken.

title: Lee Krasner's ArtHarvest of Rhythms
description: The exhibition of Large Paintings by Lee Krasner, currently installed in the spacious fourthfloor galleries of the Whitney Museum of American Art, is the first major museum survey of the artist's work to come to New York. (A retrospective was mounted in London as long ago as 1965.)

title: That Time We Huddled Together in Disbelief
description: FROGMORE, S. C.  The Warren Commission said it all, nine years ago: Lee Harvey Oswald killed President Kennedy and did it alone. The commission's report, the most completely documented story of a crime ever put together, has been challenged, but its mountain of positive evidence has never been refuted.

title: Jacobson Is Granted Right for Lawsuit
description: ALBANY, Nov. 21 (AP)The New York Court of Appeals granted permission today to the horse trainer, Howard (Buddy) Jacobson to sue the New York Racing Association for denying him stall space at major thoroughbred tracks in the state.

title: Market Rebounds In Heavy Trading
description: Stock prices rallied yesterday in heavy trading after falling to a twoyear low on Tuesday in the face of the widening energy crisis. Volume was 24.26 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: PRICES CLOSE UP ONANIEX AND OTC
description: Rebounding from two sessions of sharp drops, prices opened higher on the American Stock Exhange yesterday, dropped at midday, but then surged again to close higher for the session. A similar situation prevailed in the overthecounter market.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: (New Jersey numbers were drawn yesterday because of Thanksgiving.)

title: Ashe Gains Round of 8 In S. Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 21 (UPI)Manuel Orantes, the topseeded player, was the victim of fastrising Byron Bertram of South Africa in the first major upset of the $125,000 South African open tennis championships today. Arthur Ashe of the United States was a winner, gaining the quarterfinals.

title: BIG BATTLE ERUPTS IN MEKONG DELTA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21 (AP)  Government and Commmunist troops fighting over the Mekong Delta's rice harvest clashed in a major battle today, leaving more than 100 dead and wounded, the military command said.

title: A MICHEL PREMIERE IN MONTERO RECITAL
description: Patricia Montero, a young Mexican pianist with fleet fingers but no consistently satisfying idea of how to put them to use, gave a recital Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. She made her best impression in the first New York performance of Variations concenritques (1967), by PaulBaudoin Michel, a tonally oriented but highly chromatic work that dealt in sharp dynamic contrasts and violently alternating mood and made some pretty effects by putting the pedal down and letting the overtones clash and mingle. Miss Montero handled all this with agility and a definite feeling for the modern idiom.

title: Giants Favored With Redskins, Cowboys
description: Because Roman Gabriel, who has done so much for the Eagles this season, is hurt and may not play, the Giants are favorites to win in Philadelphia on Sunday. That gaine will be televised, Channel 2, 1 P.M., followed on the same channel by Atlanta and the Jets at Shea Stadium, in which the Falcons are favored. The Jet game starts at 4 P.M., as does Channel 4's game, Kansas City at Denver.

title: U.S. TakeOver of Bridges Across Delaware Is Urged
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 21  The chairman of the Delaware River Port Authority of Pennsylvania and New Jersey proposed today that the agency's four big bridges across the Delaware be turned over to the Federal Government.

title: Critics Still Doubt Slayer Was Alone
description: FREDERICK, Md., Nov. 21The day begins at 5 A.M. for Harold Weisberg, former agent of the Office of Strategic Services and occasional investigator for the Senate who for the last few years has been on a personal crusade to find out the truth about the Kennedy assassination.

title: Congressmen Warn Israel Defense Treaty Is Unlikely
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 21  Four visiting. American Congressmen advised Israelis today not to count on an American defense pact, a possibility raised last week by Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: CATERPILLAR, U.A.W. AGREE ON CONTRACT
description: PEORIA, Ill., Nov. 21 (AP)The United Auto Workers announced today that it had reached tentative agreement with the Caterpillar Tractor Company on a new contract.

title: PROSECUTOR BILLS GO TO THE SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)The Senate Judiciary Committee sent to the Senate floor today without recommendation two bills calling for the appointment of a special Watergate prosecutor. One bill provides for court appointment and the other for selection by the Attorney General.

title: JAPANESE CAUfION ISRAELIS ON TIES
description: TOKYO, Thursday, Nov. 22Japan formally urged Israel today to withdraw from Arab territories occupied during, the 1967 war and warned obliquely that if Israel did not comply, Japan might break diplomatic relations.

title: Cousy Will Resign As Coach of Kings
description: OMAHA, Nov. 21 (UPI) Bob Cousy, coach of the National Basketball Association Kansas City  Omaha Kings since 1969, said tonight he planned to submit his resignation, and hoped that it would be accepted immediately.

title: U.S. SAYS OIL CUT WILL NOT ALTER MIDEAST POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 Secretary of State Kissinger asserted today that the United States would not alter its Middle East policies because of the Arab oil embargo and warned that countermeasures might have to be considered if the embargo continued unreasonably and indefinitely.

title: Allan Sherman, Lyricist, Dies; Noted for My Son Parodies
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21Allan Sherman, the rotund entertainer whose comical lyrics, set to wellknown tunes, elevated him to swift international celebrity 11 years ago, died last night while entertaining friends at his home here. He was 48 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The president of New York University, Dr. James M. Hester, said yesterday that he was temporarily suspending efforts to evict three elderly women tenants of the Brittany Hotel, a universityowned student dormitory. Dr. Hester said the school was investigating the situation anew to detegmine whether there might be a feasible way to enable the three to stay.

title: His Lawyer Says Garrow Attempted Suicide in Cell
description: LAKE. PLEASANT, N.Y., Nov. 21 (AP)A lawyer for Robert Garrow, accused in an Adirondack camping murder, said today that the defendant had punctured his arm in the county jail here in a suicide attempt, although a statepolice investigator, Richard Beckwith, said the incident did not look like a suicide attempt.

title: Soviet Uneasy Over Growing Political Cooperation in Europe
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 21  The Soviet Union gave a new sign, of uneasiness today over the trend toward increasing political cooperation in Western Europe.

title: COURT BACKS ORDER ON NEWS DISCLOSURE
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court has upheld a lower court order that compels a Wall Street Journal reporter to disclose her news sources in connection with a libel suit.

title: Qaddafi's Visit to Tito Results In Oil, Shipping and Other Deals
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 21 (AP)The visit here by Libya's leader, Col. Muammar el Qaddafi, produced an agreement today providing crude oil for Yugoslavia, tankers for Libya and joint economic ventures.

title: Judge Delays Boyle Hearing On U.S Conspiracy Charge
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 21 (UPI) Today's scheduled hearing for W. A. Boyle, the former United Mine Workers president, in connection with a Federal conspiracy charge in the death of a union insurgent, Joseph A. Yablonski, has been postponed until next Wednesday.

title: WILLIAMS PRESIDENT OF CHAMBER COUNCIL
description: Harvey Williams has been named president of the United States Council of the International Chamber of Commerce, it was announced yesterday by Ian MacGregor, chairman of the council and of American Metal Climax, Inc.

title: CNA Financial Signs Pact
description: The CNA Financial Corporation said yesterday it had reached an agreement to provide insurance abroad for multinational companies through the Winterthur Group of Switzerland, the Norwich Union Group of Britain and the Chiyoda Group of Japan. CNA in turn will represent these companies in this country.

title: HARTFORD SPURNS 3 ABORTION RULES
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 21 (UPI) Connecticut's Attorney General, Robert K. Killian, yesterday rejected three sections of the proposed state regulations governing abortion and sent them back to the State Public Health Council.

title: D. G. DeWerd Weds Ann apple
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Nov. 21Miss Ann Howard Kopple, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Kopple of Rollingwood, Roslyn and Southold, was married here at noon today to Donald George DeWerd, son of George DeWerd of St. Thomas, V. I., and Mrs. Sylvia DeWerd of Green Deer, Wis.

title: Widener Wallops Fordham, 49 to 20
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 21 Billy Johnson scored three touchdowns and gained. 215 yards rushing tonight to lead Widener College to a 4920 triumph over Fordham in the Thanksgiving Bowl game in Convention Hall.

title: Waldheim Finds Good Start Toward Mideast Peace but Fears Momentum Will Slacken
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y. Nov. 21  Four weeks the] the ceasefire in the Middle East, Secretary General Wald helm fears a slackening of the momentum needed to get the Arabs and Israelis to the con ference table.

title: Patti R. Brody, Junior at Tufts, Married to Daniel K. Lehrhoff
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Nov. 21 Miss Patti Robin Brody, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Brody of Scotch Plains, was married here this evening to Daniel Kenneth Lehrhoff, son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Lehrhoff of Short Hills.

title: I.R.S. Will Use New Tax Forms To Make Filing Returns Easier
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21, (AP)Improved income tax forms to make filing easier and faster have been announced by Internal Revenue Commissioner Donald C. Alexander.

title: Music: The New Piano
description: Marie  Franoise Bucquet, the French pianist who is giving four Tully Hall recitals devoted to contemporary music, presented her second program Tuesday night, The New Piano in Europe.

title: SAIGON AIDE CITES NEED OF U.S. JETS
description: LAI KHE, South Vietnam, Nov. 21A South Vietnamese division commander said today that the Saigon Government's forces would need American air support if the Communists staged a major offensive in the next few months.

title: PROF. PAUL KENDALL, BIOGRAPHER, WAS 62
description: Paul Murray Kendall, historiar and biograhper, died yesterday in Lawrence, Kan., where he was visiting professor of English at the University of Kansas. He was 62 years old.

title: Nixon Has No Plan to Bare Tax Returns for '70 and '71
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) The White House said today that President Nixon had no plans to release his 1970 and 1971 personal income tax returns in connection with his efforts to clear up Watergaterelated matters.

title: Business Briefs
description: I.B.M. Denies Monopoly Charge

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Brooke Firm About Nixon
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts said today nothing has happened to change his view that President Nixon should resign.

title: Rehearing Sought by Garden
description: Madison Square Garden Corporation announced yesterday it would apply for a rehearing of an Illinois Supreme. Court decision finding that the corporation's Illinois race track subsidiary must pay about $5.6million in additional state privilege taxes for interest for the years 1966 through 1972. Earlier yesterday the court reversed a lower court ruling that no additional taxes were payable.

title: Interrogated and Threatened, Mrs. Sakharov Says

title: Once Dinner Is Over, the Best Is Yet to Come: Tomorrow's Turkey Soup
description: Pearl Bailey was talking the other day about beans. She said she always fixed plenty, in case somebody dropped in, and so as to have some left over.

description: RICHMOND, Nov. 21 (UN) Following a tradition nearly 300 years old, the Mattaponi Indians today presented Gov. Linwood Holton with his Thanksgiving Day breakfast and dinner, a turkey and six rockfish.

title: Director of Library Says Johnson Got Little Tax WriteOff
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 21 (AP) Former President Lyndon B. Johnson gave the hulk of his papers to the United States without obtaining any tax advantage, according to the director of the Lyndon Baines Johnson Library.

title: Lawyer Fined for Contempt Of a Grand Jury in Suffolk

title: The Woman Cooks, the Man Carves...Right? Wrong!
description: Some Thanksgiving that was. Mashed potatoes missing, gravy boat empty. His daughter carved the turkey after her husband had cooked it. Poor grandfather. Instead of a proper New England Thanksgiving, he got his fill of feminism.

Baltimore Zoo Evicts Python For Otter to Save on Fuel
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Big Bertha of the Baltimore Zoo's reptile house had a vicious hiss for the energy crisis yesterday when she was displaced by an otter.

The appeal came from Walter Adams, president of the American Association of University Professors, who is an economics professor at Michigan State University.
