description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 The Nixon Administration was ordered by a Federal district judge here today to free from impoundment $380million for the nation's grade and high schools.

title: NATIONAL SERVICE FAVORED IN POLL
description: A new Gallup survey indicates that a majority of the public supports a proposal that would require young men to give a year of national service in the military forces or such nonmilitary agencies as VISTA or the Peace Corps.

title: Record Price of Pelts Fosters a State Trapping Boom
description: RED HOOK, N. Y., Nov. 21  Robert Moul, an offduty policeofficer, stopped at the side of Saw Mill Creek here the other day and examined the footprints in the wet earth.

title: Nixon's Proposals On Nuclear Plants Scored by Nader
description: Ralph Nader joined yesterday with a Bostonarea professional group, the Union of Concerned Scientists, in an attack on President Nixon's proposed speedup of nuclear power development to ease the energy crisis.

title: French Urge European Defense SetUp
description: PARIS, Nov. 21Foreign Minister Michel Jobert called today for Western Europe to build up its own defenses against new danger of tacticalnuclear and conventional attack, now that the United States and the Soviet Union have agreed to prevent nuclear war between themselves.

title: Christmas Tree Due Monday
description: The Rockefeller Center Christmas tree, a 65foot Norway spruce, will arrive next Monday at 8 A.M. from Tenafly, N. J. Workmen will spend most of the morning raising and securing the tree, whose branch spread is 30 feet.

title: 28 Student Groups Outlawed by Greece
description: ATHENS, Nov. 21The chief of the Greek armed forces outlawed and disbanded 28 student organizations, today in the latest move to discourage a revival of the Creek student revolt.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Turnpike Authority has awarded the first construction contract for the Alfred E. Driscoll Expressway despite challenges from environmental and civic groups.

title: New A.P.M.E. Chief Elected
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 21 (AP) Richard D. Smyser of The Oak Ridge, Tenn., Oak Ridger is the new president of The Associated Press Managing Editors Association. Mr. Smyser, who was elected yesterday at the annual A.P.M.E. convention being held at Walt Disney World, succeeds John C. Quinn, vice president for news of Gannett Newspapers.

title: TWO HELD IN DEATH OF 2YEAROLD BOY
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 21 (AP)A soldier and his wife were charged with murder today in. the death of his wife's 2yearold son.

title: Stage: The Entertainer at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N, J.  John Osborne's The Entertainer made such an impact when it was first produced in 1957 that it seems surprising that it has not been more often revived. Yet it remains an extreme rarity, and one reason for this must be the understandable reluctance of actors to risk comparison with the incomparable.

title: Stremmel Takes Jersey Run Title.
description: RARITAN, N. J., Nov. 21Greg Stremmel of Gateway took individual honors and St. Joseph's of Metuchen won the team title in the second annual New Jersey interscholastic allgroup crosscountry championships at Bridgewater  Raritan. West High School.

title: MayorElect's Deputy
description: When James Alfred Cavanaugh returned last night to the eightroom, shingled house in the Bergen Beach section of Brooklyn that has been his home since 1949, a double celebration was awaiting him.

title: Nets Win In 2d Half By 10592
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 21 During the Nets' recent ninegame losing streak the party line was that the talent was there and it was just a matter of time before they jelled.

title: Canadiens' Late Score Sinks North Stars, 43
description: Pete Mahovlich, who had tied the game in the second period, scored the winning goal in the final four seconds last night to lift Montreal to a 43 victory over the hapless Minnesota North Stars.

title: VATICAN MAY DROP ITS HIGHEST COURT
description: ROME, Nov. 21Reforms reportedly under way in the Roman Catholic Church are to include an overhaul of the Vatican legal structure.

title: MINERS IN BRITAIN REJECT PAY OFFER
description: LONDON, Nov. 21Britain's. energy shortage took a new turn for the worse today with the refusal of the coal miners' national leadership to accept a Government proposal aimed at ending the industry pay dispute.

title: Inquiry Opens on Dogs' Killing of Boy
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 21 The Hudson County Prosecutor's office today was trying to fix legal responsibilities involved in the killing of a 6yearold boy here Monday by two German shepherd guard dogs.

title: Shock on Wall Street
description: Since the Middle East war erupted six weeks ago, the stock market has taken one of its worst plunges since the Depression. Although the market rallied yesterday in turbulent trading, the DowJones industrial average has fallen by over 125 points13 per centsince the weekend of Oct. 5, when Egypt and Syria launched their attack on Israel. The selloff on Wall Street clearly reflects fears of what the energy crisis provoked by the Arab oil embargo will do to economic conditions in the United States and abroad.

title: State's Wild Turkeys Are Doing So Well Others Ask for Them
description: HARTFORD Nov. 21Connecticut may get the wild turkeys it ordered from New York, but certainly not for this Thanksgiving and probably not until another winter has set in.

title: Books of The Times
description: STAY OF EXECUTION. A Sort of Memoir. By Stewart Alsop. 312 pages. Illustrated. Lippincott. $8.95.

title: Colleges Face Rights Suit
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 21 (UPI)1 (Every fouryear statesupported college in Virginia stands accused today of conspiring to deny equal rights to women employes, according to a suit filed by three former professors. The suit was filed yesterday before United States District Judge Robert R. Merhige Jr. by Ruth Talliaferro of Farmville, Salta Schotta of Blacksburg, and B. Patricia Dyson. Each woman seeks $300,000 in damages and a court injunction barring discrimination.

title: Aluminum Co. Will Curtail Alumiframe System Output
description: The Aluminum Company of America said yesterday that it was curtailing production of its Alumiframe residential construction system because of the tight metal situation. The company said this would enable it to improve its ability to meet needs of longestablshed customers for other products.

title: Officials Forsake Limousines in Face of Fuel Crisis
description: State officials in New Jersey and New York were busy banishing Cadillacs yesterday to conserve fuel.

title: Views on Bowel Habits Are Disputed
description: Misconceptions about the need for regularity of bowel habits are widespread, and there are hazards associated with dependence on some laxatives, according to a leading medical publication.

title: Pressmen and 3 Newspapers Agree on a New 2Year Pact
description: Newspaper Printing Pressmen's Union No. 2 and publishers of The Daily News, The New York Times and The New York Post have reached agreement on a new twoyear contract, William J. Kennedy Jr. president of the local, announced yesterday.

title: Excerpts From the Kissinger News Conference
description: Following are excerpts from Secretary of State Kissinger's news conference in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: British Soccer Results
description: U.E.P.A. Amateur Cup

title: Ash Wednesday' Opens:The Cast
description: Can Barbara Sawyer (Elizabeth Taylor), a woman in her fifties, rekindle the flame that once burned within the breast of her husband Mark (Henry Fonda) by getting, what is, in effect, a head-to-foot face lift?Will Mark, after 30 years of marriage to Barbara, be put off by those funny little scars behind the ears, under the bosom and very high on the backs of the thighs? Should Barbara, after emerging from that fancy Swiss clinic looking a fabulous 41, have an affair with a much younger man whose stare contains a sexual message?What should she say when Mark looks at her, his eyes filled with memories but empty of desire? Should she lie in the sun? Eat pastries? Hit Mark on the head with a shoe?Every question save the last is proposed in "Ash Wednesday," and then answered at somewhat greater length than is absolutely necessary for anyone over the age of 2. The movie opened yesterday at Loews State 2 and Loews Cine Theaters."Ash Wednesday" was directed by Larry Peerce ("A Separate Peace," "Goodbye, Columbus," etc.) and written by Jean-Claude Tramont with all the fearlessness and perception demanded in the boiling of an egg.It would have us believe that such pursuits of youth are doomed to failure, yet it treats the reconstructed Barbara (who is, after all, Elizabeth Taylor, one of the world's great beauties) less as a woman to be understood than as an artifact to be admired.Barbara is miserable, of course, but miserable in some of the most magnificent settings (Cortina, the Dolomites) that money can buy."Ash Wednesday" has some shock effect in its early surgical scenes, showing us how the subcutaneous tissue is removed (what we really see is chicken fat) to firm up the skin under Barbara's eyes and other organs. Mostly the film is interested in what Barbara is going to wear next. This is not a male chauvinist's conception of a woman, but her hairdresser's, full of envy, awe and superficial compassion.

title: ULSTER IN ACCORD ON COALITION RULE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 21A Northern Ireland executive body in which Protestant and Roman Catholic parties will share power for the first time in this century was agreed on tonight.

title: Crash Involving Mrs. Hunt Ruled Accidental by a Jury
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (AP)A Cook County coroner's jury ruled today that the death of Mrs. E. Howard Hunt Jr. and 44 other persons in a plane crash near Midway Airport last December was accidental.

title: FourDay Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The fourday work weeka quiet revolution in American lifecould come to pass a decade before its time, hurried along by a sustained fuel shortage.

title: Any Hope for Transit?
description: After their experience of the past quartercentury, New Yorkers will receive with appropriate skepticism the hopes for retaining the 35cent transit fare that were voiced by Mayorelect Beame and Governor Rockefeller following their initial meeting on the transit crisis this week. Given the size of the transit deficit$300 million and the persisting uncertainty of governmental responses, it will be a major achievement if the present fare can be retained or even if the prospective increase can be kept within reasonable bounds.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Youth Held in 24 Deaths
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (UPI)Michael Altenburg, 18 years old, of Tucson, was arraigned yesterday on 24 charges of murder and one of arson for allegedly setting the deadliest residential blaze in the history of Los Angeles. He was ordered held without bail. Investigators said the youth confessed setting last Thursday's fire at the Stratford Apartments.

title: Thanks From Mrs. Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixor called the president of the Federation of Kentucky Republican Women's Clubs today to thank the organization for sponsoring advertisements urging prayers in support of th?? President.

title: Lion Injures Woman
description: OGDEN, Utah Nov. 22, (AP) Ann Hadlock, 21 years old, attending a theater performance last night, was bitten by a lion that apparently had been attracted by the oder of her blond wig. She was gashed on the forehead, on the right side of her neck and on the top of her head.

title: 4 Heroin Dealers Get Holiday at Home
description: Four narcotics dealers who were convicted in Federal Court here yesterday were permitted to remain free on bail so they could spend Thanksgiving with their families, requiring 30 narcotics agents to give up part of their own holiday to keep them under surveillance.

title: Orders for Durable Goods Up in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21New orders for durable goods rose strongly in October to a new record after declines in the two preceding months, the Commerce Department reported today on the basis of preliminary figures.

title: STATE AID ON FARE BACKED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 21  Governor Rockefeller and Republican legislative leaders today endorsed the concept of a state subsidy to help communities hold down transit fares, but said they would await congressional action on aid to mass transit before making any moves.

title: Prefontaine Scorns Pro Track
description: I still have a sour taste in my mouth from what happened in Munichthe killings and the whole Olympic structure, Steve Prefontaine said yesterday after completing his college track eligibility at Oregon. The distance runner said he was far from ready to join the pros. They have nothing to offer, he said. If they buy me, they are buying my amateurism, my ability,

title: WHITE HOUSE DENIES RICHARDSON SMEAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) A Presidential spokesman denied today that anyone at the White House was involved in preading a report that former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson had a drinking problem.

title: After 10 Years
description: The assassination of John F. Kennedy brought sudden, unaccustomed attention to a few Individuals who found themselves by accident on the periphery of a national tragedy. Here is how some of them have fared in the years since.

title: Rose Voted Most Valuable
description: Pete Rose of the Cincinnati Reds, who triggered the fight with the Mets in Shea Stadium last month, was elected the most valuable player in the National League yesterday  and immediately triggered another fight.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Am I glad you phoned! said Pete Rose's wife, Karolyn, as she breathed a deep sigh of relief. Pete has been climbing the walls for two days, hoping against hope that you'd call.

title: NIXON POPULARITY REVIVING IN SOUTH
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 21 President Nixon's popularity apparently is reviving in the South.

title: Mayor Scored at Dedication Of Psychiatric Center Here
description: William Del Toro, chairman of the community advisory board of the Metropolitan Hospital Center, yesterday attacked a number of individuals and organizations connected with hospital patient service, including the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: Forbes Gives DowntoEarth Answers
description: What do you ask a man who crossed the United States in a balloon?

title: Sunday Racing Here Scratched
description: A plan to introduce Sunday, horse racing in New York next spring has been abandoned because of the energy crisis.

title: Fumes Kill Five on Coast
description: IMPERIAL BEACH, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)  Fumes from leaking gas heater killed a woman and four children, officers said. They said Carol Landis, who lived in the Imperial Beach Apartments, returned yesterday fro man overnight stay with friends to find the bodies of her three children, her roommate and the woman's son.

title: Lost Hiker Safe and Sound
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 21 (UPI)A 16yearold hiker, almos given up for dead by searchers after three days lost in snow and cold in the San Gabriel Mountains, walked onto a forest highway yesterday, healthy and in good spirits. Chris Anderson was treated and released at Huntington Memorial Hospital and returned to his home.

title: Morris Bishop, Scholar and Poet, Dies
description: Morris Bishop, the Cornell scholar, literary biographer and master of light verse, died Tuesday at Tompkins County Hospital in Ithaca, N. Y., after a brief illness. He was 80 years old and lived in Cayuga Heights, an Ithaca suburb.

title: Four Airlines Will Cat TransAtlantic Flights
description: LONDON, Nov. 21 (AP) Four international airlinestwo of them Americansay they will cut down on their transAtlantic flights in order to save fuel. One official said that 68 roundtrip flights a weeek would be eliminated.

title: Time Remembered
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21I was at the University of Chicago Law School, attending a conference. A student came into the room and made an announcement: There had been shooting in Dallas.

title: EXINMATE DENIES 2 ATTICA KILLINGS
description: WARSAW, N.Y., Nov. 21 (UPI) An attorney representing Eric Jomo Thompson, accused of having slain two fellow inmates during the 1971 Attica prison riot, yesterday entered a plea of not guilty for his client.

title: A Special Christmas Gift
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Nov. 2 (AP)  Berkshire Communit College is offering a special Christmas gift: education. The Director of Continuing Education, Gene A. Kamp, said the college was selling gift certificates good for a threesemeste course in the college's evening division. The price of the gift certificate is $79, Mr. Kamp said.

title: Con Ed Discerns Hopeful Sign In Customers' Power Cutback
description: After years of rising energy consumption, the major utilities in the metropolitan area are seeing the first tentative signs that the public may be responding to urgent requests to cut back the use of gas and electricity.

title: STATE AID ON FARE BACKED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 21  Governor Rockefeller and Republican legislat he leaders today endorsed the concept of a state subsidy to help communities hold down transit fares, but said they would await congressional action on aid to mass transit before making any moves.

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP 0.8% IN MONTH, LED BY FUEL COST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The rise in consumer prices continued in October at an exceptional rate for peacetime, even though food prices were essentially stable, the Labor Department reported today.

title: About the jets:
description: John Riggins, who suffered a minor shoulder separation last Sunday, feels he'll be ready to play against Atlanta. So does John Ebersole (bad back), who could lose his middle linebacking job to Al Atkinson, returning after a sevengame absence with a pulled thigh muscle. ... Coach Weeb Ewbank talked with Mel Hein, one of the league officials in charge of officials, about the controversial pass catches against the Bengals in last Sunday's game, but Ewbank said Hein had no comment. As for Coach Paul Brown's statement that the catch by Rich Caster just over goal line wasn't a touchdown, Ewbank said, Brown needs glasses.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Bringing Back the Salmon
description: Three Atlantic salmonstocking ponds on Connecticut's Farmington River in Barkhamsted will be constructed this fall and winter as part of the continuing effort to restore this valuable food and game fish to the Connecticut River basin.

title: Kennedy's Role in History: Some Doubts
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 21 However the public may remember John Fitzgerald Kennedy 10 years after his assassination, the scholars who will eventually fix his place in history are at loggerheads.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Film

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Scituate Cancels Classes
description: SCITUATE, Mass., Nov. 21 (UPI)  The Scituate School Committee canceled all classes today because of a shortage of gasoline. The committee voted to ask the board of selectmen to seek an injunction against the Garrity Oil Company, of Boston, for failure to meet terms of their contract. The company told the school system that gasoline for school buses would be cut by 15 per cent.

title: High School Sports
description: Amid the final bustle of the football season, basketball has begun in the high schools. Most of the Public Schools Athletic League members got their seasons under way list week with some interdivision contests. League play begins the first week of December.

title: Holiday Crowd Leaving CityMany on Public Transit
description: New Yorkers began leaving the city by thousands yesterday for the Thanksgiving holi day weekend, and a grea many appeared to be depend ing more on public transporta tion than in the past, perhaps because of the fuel shortage.

title: NIXON POPULARITY REVIVING IN SOUTH
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 21 President Nixon's popularity apparently is reviving in the South.

title: Personal Finance
description: One of the most perplexing problems faced by parents with money, particularly where one parent has died and the other is growing old, is how to get someone competent to manage their financial affairs when they no longer can, and then, how best to leave this money to the children and grandchildren.

title: On Campus, Magic of Camelot Fades
description: For today's college students, the glitter of Camelot has been dulled by textbooks and time.

title: Byrne Outspent Sandman By Almost 2 to 1 in Race
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21Brendan T. Byrne, New Jersey's Governorelect, outspent his Republican rival, Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., by almost 2 to 1 in the gubernatorial race that was decided in the Nov. 6 election.

title: Gulf & Western Offers to Purchase $7Million More Stock in Garden
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., announced yesterday a cash tender offer to buy up to 1 million common shares of the Madison Square Garden Corporation stock at $7 net a share. Gulf & Western already holds approximately 972,000 shares, or 20 per cent, of the 4,801,000 common shares outstanding of Madison Square Garden. If all 1 million shares are purchased pursuant to the offer, Gulf & Western's interest in Madison Square Garden would rise to about 41 per cent.

title: METHODIST FUND LOSES MILLIONS
description: The United Methodists' New York Conference has lost more than half of a $7million investment fund used chiefly for pension payments, because of what are described as improper highrisk loans by the corporate treasurer.

title: Quintuplets in Finland
description: TAMPERE, Finland, Nov. 211 (UPI)  A 25yearold woman who took fertility drugs gave birth to quintuplets prematurely yesterday, hospital officials said today. Officials at Tampere Central Hospital said that all five babies were alive but that chances of survival were not good because of the premature birth, in the 25th week of the pregnancy. The mother, who was not identified, was reported in good condition.

title: Protest Prompts City to Hold Up On Brighter Lights for Village
description: A block association in Greenwich Village has demanded and won a halt to the installation of highintensity sodium vapor lights in a sixblock landmark rea.

title: A Maharaja Bows to the Present
description: MYSORE, India, Nov. 1In the evening during the autumn festival the palace shimmeredwith thousands of tiny lights and the streets were crammed with soldiers and sword dancers and flowerbedecked elephants. The Maharaja, with diamonds in his ears, sat on his gold and emerald peacock throne to welcome the princes and nabobs of India.

title: Preparing Dog to Show Means Work, Sacrifice
description: To have a topwinning dog, there must be complete understanding between the animal and his handler, E. W. (Tip) Tipton told the Dog Fanciers Club at its luncheon here last week. Training must be done every day, not just the day of the show, he said. Tipton, who comes from Kingsport, Tenn., was relating his experiences when he campaigned his miniature pinscher. Ch. Rebel Roc's Casanova von Kurt, or Little Daddy as he was more familiarly known. The champibn garnered 75 bestinshow awards, a record for an Americanbred toy dog.

title: VOLTAGE CUT SET FOR NEW ENGLAND TO CONSERVE FUEL
description: Beginning Monday afternoon, New Englanders will have to get by on a voltage reduction of 5 per cent for four hours a day.

title: WilkesBarre Paper Stud
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Nov. 2?? (AP)The WilkesBarre Times Leader News Record was forced to suspend publication today after 120 printers wen?? on strike.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Commissioner Mike Storen upheld Tuesday a protest by the San Antonio Spurs, marking the first time in the sevenyear history of the American Basketball Association that a decision has been made to replay any portion of a game. Storen ruled that the final 30 seconds of a game between the Spurs and the Indiana Pacers, played Nov. 14, be replayed.

title: Thanksgiving Day
description: Banks, libraries, stock exchanges, department stores, post offices, public schools and other public buildings will be closed. There will be no regular mail deliveries.

title: RED CROSS TALKS IN KOREA LIKELY
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 21North and South Korea appear likely to reopen the suspended Red Cross talks next month. These have been one of the two channels of dialogue between the two Koreas on ways to improve their relations.

title: U.S. SAYS OIL CUT WILL NOT ALTER MIDEAST POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Secretary of State Kissinger asserted today that the United States would not alter its Middle East policies because of the Arab oil embargo and warned that countermeasures might have to be considered if the embargo continued unreasonably and indefinitely.

title: VOLTAGE CUT SET FOR NEW ENGLAND TO CONSERVE FUEL
description: Beginning Monday afternoon, New Englanders will have to get by on a voltage reduction of 5 per cent for four hours a day.

title: Market Place: A.T.&T. Move Is Encouraging
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company's decision to raise its dividend, announced yesterday, presented a ray of hope in a devastated stock market.

title: TAKEOVER SOUGHT AT HARLEM PREP
description: Harlem Prep, a nationally known school aimed at preparing disadvantaged blacks for college educations, is expected to be transferred to the jurisdiction of the city school system.

title: Notes on People
description: Warned by a physician that his health was in danger, Valery Panov, the Russian ballet dancer who wants to emigrate to Israel, ended a 21day hunger strike yesterday.

title: Farrell Harriers Score
description: Monsignor Farrell High scored 25 points to win the Staten Island crosscountry title yesterday, beating Susan Wagner, the Public Schools Athletic League champion, on the 2.5mile course at Clove Lakes Park. Joe Walsh of Farrell took individual honors with a time of 12 minutes 47 seconds.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: (New Jersey numbers were drawn resterday because of Thanksgiving)

title: ANOTHER SECTION OF TAPES IS BLANK, A NIXON AIDE SAV
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 The White House disclosed in court today that a portion of another Watergate conversation this one between President Nixon and H. R. Haldeman three days after the Watergate burglary  had not been recorded.

title: Findings of Impasse Body Ruled Binding in Fire Pact
description: The Office of Collective Bargaining ruled yesterday that the recommendations of the impasse panel in the firemen's dispute with the city were final and binding on both parties.

title: Nixon Officials Say Blackouts Could Occur This Winter, Especially in East
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Administration officials said today that rolling blackouts, as well as electrical brownouts, could occur this winter, particularly along the Eastern Seaboard, where the oil shortage is expected to be most acute.

title: Two ExPrincipals Of Plohn Acquitted
description: Two former principals of Charles Plohn & Co., a brokerage firm, were acquitted Tuesday at 7 P.M. of having illegally pledged customers' securities for bank loans.

title: Senator Criticizes Guild
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 22 (AP) Senator Jesse A. Helms, Republican of North Carolina, criticized the Newspaper Guild today for urging the impeach, ment of President Nixon. The action raised the gravest questions of bias.

title: Wife and Daughter Of Minister Taken By 3 Kidnappers
description: JONESBORO, Ga., Nov. 21 (UPI)The wife and daughter of a local Methodist minister were kidnapped at about 2 A.M. today by three armed men apparently seeking the release of a bank robbery suspect.

title: Strike Watch
description: A report on curreht labor negotiations in the arts.

title: Sandman Out of Hospital
description: ERMA PARK, Nov. 21 (AP)Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. was back home and feeling good today following a threeday hospital stay. The Republican Congressman, who lost the race fort Governor to Brendan T. Byrne, spent three days undergoing tests and resting in Burdette Tomlin Memorial Hospital in Cape May Court House after he suffered chest and abdominal pains Sunday. His doctor said, his heart showed some flutters, but he attributed them to exhaustion.

title: Peron Is Reported Stricken by a Light Heart Attack
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 21 (AP)President Juan D. Pern was placed under medical care today for what doctors described as a bronchial condition. But reliable sources said that the 78yearold leader had suffered a light heart attack.

title: FORD CONCEDES AID OF JUSTICE AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 Gerald R. Ford acknowledged today that the Justice Department provided him with some leads that he used three years ago in preparing his request for an inquiry into possible impeachment of Associate Justice William O. Douglas.

title: Samuels Scores Proposal For Primary in September
description: Howard J. Samuels, a Democratic gubernatorial contender, charged yesterday that a shift in the primary from June to September would increase the cost of campaigning and give an unfair advantage to the incumbent Rockefeller administration.

title: Beame Names Cavanagh To Top Operations Post
description: Mayorelect, Abraham D. Beame made the first two appointments of his new administration yesterday, and at the same time appeared to be drifting into a dispute with prominent blacks who supported him during his campaign.

title: Caster Hopeful of Beating Shea Jinx Against Falcons
description: Why don't you get some glue for those hands?

title: Fare Subsidy Backed
description: Governor Rockefeller and Republican legislative leaders endorsed the concept of a state subsidy to help communities hold down transit fares, but said they would await Congressional action on masstransit aid before making any moves. Page 56.

title: Beame Names Cavanagh To Top Operations Post
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame made the first two appointments of his new administration yesterday, and at the same time appeared to be drifting into a dispute with prominent blacks who supported him during his campaign.

title: Ten Years Later
description: The shot that claimed the life of John F. Kennedy shortly after noon in Dallas ten years ago today will be remembered for more than the murder of a charismatic and promising young President; it marked the beginning of the end of an era filled with the ebullient optimism and confidence identified throughout the world with the spirit of America.

title: Israel Sets Up Civilian WarInquiry Commission
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 21 (UPI)Israel today set up a fiveman civilian commission headed by the President of the Supreme Court to investigate the state of the nation's preparedness for the war that began Oct. 6, the Government said. The members include two former armed forces chiefs of staff.

title: 5% Rise in Domestic Air Fares Approved by C. A. B. as of Dec. 1
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board approved yesterday a 5 per cent increase in all domestic airline fares, effective Dec. 1.

title: Kennedy, Nixon: 2 Faces of One Era
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Now in the bleak November of President Nixon's unhappiest year the nation is being reminded of another November and another PresidentJohn F. Kennedy, dead these 10 years. Comparisons between the two men are inevitable, but to some in Washingtonand not Mr. Nixon's friends alone  comparisons somehow seem unfair: Jack Kennedy made the Presidency look so easy. For President Nixon these days, it looks so hard. Once they were contemporaries and competitors. They served together in the House of Representatives. Each went on to the Senate. They ran for President against each other. Each in his turn was elected narrowly.

title: Chairman Sells Majority Of His Shares of Braniff
description: Harding L. Lawrence, chairman and chief executive officer of Braniff Airways, Inc., was among corporate insiders who were major sellers of their companies' stocks last month.

title: A.T.&T. Increases Dividend 10%
description: Directors of the American Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, raised the quarterly dividend yesterday to 77 cents a sharea 10 per cent increase over the previous rate of 70 cents. It is payable Jail. 2 to holders of record Nov. 29.

title: Joseph Cahill of West Point, ExSports Information Chief
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 21Joseph M. Cahill, chief of the specialprojects division in the information division of the United States Military Academy, died today, apparently of a heart attack, in the West Point Army Hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: Rise of 6c a Gallon For Milk Set Dec. 1; Supply Is Dwindling
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Milk prices will rise by 6 cents a gallon to a minimum of $1.30 on Dec. 1. The State Agriculture Department said dwindling supplies had caused the increase and warned of severe shortages if the higher price did not reduce the demand for milk.

title: Price Index Here Up 0.6% in October
description: The Consumer Price Index in the metropolitan area rose sixtenths of 1 per cent in October, primarily because of increases in the costs of housing and private transportation, the Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Japan Warns Israel
description: The Japanese Government today urged Israel to withdraw from Arab territories she occupied in the 1967 war and warned obliquely that if Israel did not, Japan might break diplomatic relations. Page 17.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Am I glad you phoned! said Pete Rose's wife, Karolyn, as she breathed a deep sigh of relief. Pete has been climbing the walls for two days, hoping against hope that you'd call.

title: Kennedy Doctors Optimistic
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 21 (AP) Edward M. Kennedy Jr., son of the Massachusetts Senator, is making good progress from a leg amputation last Saturday and there is an excellent chance the surgery arrested the 12yearold boy's bone cancer, doctors say.

title: FRANCE IS FACING OIL DELIVERY CUT
description: PARIS, Nov. 21  International oil companies have notified France that they will be forced next month to cut their deliveries here by 10 to 15 per cent because of the worldwide petroleum shortage.

title: Governor Dedicates Mall, Center of Lengthy Dispute
description: ALBANY Nov. 21After a decade of controversy and hundreds of millions of dollars of expense, Governor Rockefeller dedicated his grand pet project, the South Mall, as frigid winds whipped through the vast marbled tract today.

title: More Food Outlets Cited as Violators Of the Health Code
description: The city's Health Services Administration has announced the names of 35 more restaurants and food stores that have violated the health code.

title: Federated Department Stores Shows Profit Dip
U.N. Debate on Korea Ends; With Assembly Compromise
description: UNITED NATIONS, N, Y.,1 Nov. 21North and South Korea each claimed victory today when the General Assembly's Political Committee, without voting, ended a weeklong debate on what should be done about the United Nations military command in South Korea.

title: American Indian Leader Warns of New Violence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 Russel Means, a leader of the American Indian movement, today threatened further Indian violence unless the Government resolved Indian treaty disputes quickly.

title: Something to Believe In
description: The fallen leaves skitter in the November wind and the chickadees and the juncos swirl and flutter in the dooryard. Winter birds, they have come down from the woodlands and the hills, back to the dooryard feeders where they were welcomed last year. The nuthatches are here, too, and the tree sparrows and the field sparrows and the downy and hairy woodpeckers. We are grateful for them.

title: Hormel Recalls Products Because of Mushrooms
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration said today the Hormel Company of Austin, Minn., was recalling products ranging from chicken chow mein to salisbury steak because they may contain tainted mushrooms.

title: MayorElect's Deputy
description: When James Alfred Cavanaugh returned last night to the eightroom, shingled house in the Bergen Beach section of Brooklyn that has been in his home since 1949, a double celebration was awaiting him.

title: L. I. Warning on Charity
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 21 (AP) Nassau County Police Commissioner Louis K. Frank today warned residents against groups allegedly soliciting donations as members of the Nassau County Police or the Nassau County Policemen's Benevolent Association. He said no department members had been involved in attempts to raise funds for charity.

title: CONSUMER PRICES UP 0.870 IN MONTH, LED BY FUEL COST
Giants Do Not Return To Norm, Randy Starts
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 21There was merriment at the New York Giants' news conference today. What a difference a victory means after seven straight defeats, noted Leon M. Yablon, the owner of the Captain's Table restaurant, who has observed a deepening gloom each week as the coaches tried to explain what went wrong.

title: Giacomin Ties Rangers' Shutout Mark
description: The Rangers conducted a relaxed, easygoing hockey school for the California Golden Seals last night at Madison Square Garden, beating them, 3.0, without breathing very hard.

title: FERRARO SETS UP SCREENING PANEL
description: Nicholas Ferraro, the recently Elected District Attorney of Queens, announced yesterday that he had set up a panel to screen all candidates for the position of assistant district attorney, in an effort to restore public confidence to, the office.

title: 4 Servicemen Termed Dead
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) The Defense Department announced today that four servicemen previously listed as missing in Indochina have now been declared dead. There remain 1,201 men listed as missing. Among those declared dead is an Army major, John W. Lafayette, husband of Mrs. Catherine V. Lafayette of Red Bank, N. J.

title: 5% Rise in Domestic Air Fares Approved by C.A.B. as of Dec. 1
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board approved yesterday a 5 per cent increase in all domestic airline fares, effective Dec, 1.

title: PLANNINGCONTINUING ON LOUISIANA PORT
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 21 (UPI) Louisiana officials and oil companies seeking to build an offshore superport are going ahead with their plans, even expanding them, despite the cutoff of Mideast oil to the United States.

title: U.S. Agrees to Pay Its Part Of Bill for U.N. Peace Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 21The United States was the first of the big five powers today to agree to pay its share of the costs of the United Nations' new peace force for the Middle East.

title: A.M. SHAKES UP PRIMETIME LIST
description: The American Broadcasting Company is discarding five series in the midseason revision of its primetime program schedule. The other two networks have already announced their January changes.

title: Markets to Mark Holiday
description: The nation's major securities and commodities markets will be closed today in observance of the Thanksgiving holiday. Banks, business and Government offices will also he closed. Canadian and European markets will be open. All of the major markets in the United States and elsewhere are scheduled to operate on a normal schedule tomorrow. Banks will be open tomorrow, although some businesses may be closed.

title: EXOIL AIDE BALKS ON ELECTION GIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A former oil company official who had been expected to tell Watergate investigators about political contributions by the petroleum industry has invoked the Fifth Amendment's protection against possible selfincrimination rather than testify.

title: City Aide Gets Denver Post
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that John D. Simpson, deputy administrator of the city's Environmental Protection Administration, had been appointed executive director of the regional transportation district of Colorado. Mr. Lindsay made the announcement jointly with Colorado officials, describing Mr. Simpson's new responsibilities as developing and implementing a masstransportation system in the six counties including and surrounding Denver.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The lists include the following:

title: Driver in Mexican Crash Was Drunken, Police Report
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 21 (UPI) The police said today that the driver of an overcrowded bus speeding over twisting mountain roads was drunken and was to blame for the deaths of 15 persons, most of them children, when the vehicle plunged into a 150foot ravine and split in half.

title: George M. Feigin, Lawyer, Headed Camp Association
description: George M. Feigin, a lawyer and past president of the Association of Private Camps, died yesterday in the Veterans Administration Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 7026, Fleet Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Military Contracts Awarded
description: The McDonnellDouglas Corporation received a total of $16,6million in military contracts, including $10million from the Navy for continued development of the Harpoon antiship cruise missile and $6.6million for ground support equipment for the Air Force F15 fighter aircraft.

title: Chess:
description: Sal Matera, the 22yearold Marshall Chess Club champion, took the third game in his fourgame match with George Kramer, the Manhattan Chess Club champion, for a 2 victory in the series. Winning both of his oddnumbered games as White, Matera got $1,000, the Thomas Emory Cup and an allexpensespaid entry into an international tournament. Kramer's purse was $600.

title: Bridge Reopened Partly
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (AP)The MysticTobin Bridge, closed since Sept. 10 because of a collapse, reopened today to northbound traffic. One section of the upper level of the bridge caved in when a truck struck a post. The bridge is scheduled to open for southbound traffic about Dec. 1, according to the Massachusetts Port Authority, which operates the span.

title: Fitzsimmons Denies Teamsters Gave Nixon Unreported Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 Frank E. Fitzsimmons, president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, denied today that his union had made surreptitious donations to President Nixon's 1972 campaign and said that his predecessor, James R. Hoffa, was a damn liar if he said otherwise.

title: Stocks Rise in Heavy Trading; Dow Advances 10.08 Points
description: The stock market finally mustered a rally yesterday on Thanksgiving Eve, after having plunged earlier this week in its sharpest twoday break since October, 1929.

title: Stage: Repertory Julie
description: As Strindberg observed, there is a multiplicity of motives in Miss Julie, There is also a complexity of characterization. Who seduces whom? It is the servant Jean, not Miss Julie, who is worried about pride and reputation (and the maid Kristin who is concerned with morality).

title: Hope for Housing
description: Homesteading is a nineteenth  century idea whose time, apparently, has come once again. It implies number of nineteenthcentury virtues that the twentiethcentury state of mind, which might loosely be called the Watergate mentality, has considered neither shrewd nor chic: oldfashioned pride of place and ownership, personal involvement, hard work, often with one's own hands, and the struggle against the odds of the frontier.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., Nov. 22 (AP)  Ben Schwartzwalder's replacement as head football coach at Syracuse University will be Frank Maloney, 32yearold defensive coordinator at the University of Michigaon, it was reported today.

title: Kodes Tops Aussie
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Nov. 22 (AP)  Bob Giltinan of Australia, seeded fourth, eliminated fifthseeded Milan Holocek today in a South Australian lawn tennis championship quarterfinal match Thursday.

title: Good Start
description: If all the key appointments made by Mayorelect Beame measure up to the high standard he has set selecting his chief deputy, the city should be well served.

title: THOMAS M. PELLY, LEGISLATOR, DIES
description: OJAI, Calif., Nov. 22 (UPI)Thomai M. Pelly, who retired as a Representative from the state of Washington last year after 20 years in the liouse, died last evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 71 years old and lived in Seattle.

title: Rutgers to Honor Father of the Blues
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22  A collection of the recordings, pictures and letters of W. C. Handy, father of the blues, goes on exhibit Monday at the Rutgers University Institute of Jazz Studies here.

title: Company Planning On Giving Drivers Gasoline at Homes
description: A Houston gasoline marketing company is planning to turn the clock back 75 years by delivering gasoline to motorists's homes, United Press International reports.

title: Ellsberg Burglary Cited in Push By A.F.L.C.I.O. to Oust Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations continued its drive for impeachment of President Nixon today with its third weekly statement detailing charges against him.

title: Chemicals Basic to Life Found Plentiful in Space
description: Peering into the darkness between stars, radio astronomers have found that, instead of void, there is a chemical ferment that is apparently the initial stage in the evolution of stars, planets and, ultimately, of life.

title: Notes on People
description: President Juan D. Peron of Argentina was reported yesterday to be fully recovered from what has been officially described, as a recrudescense of bronchitis but that reliable government sources said was actually a mild heart attack.

title: The New Rockefeller: A Nixon Supporter
description: There was a time when Richard Nixonnot John Lindsay  was Governor Rockefeller's favorite political ogre. But now, when the President is in the deepest trouble of his political life and many Republicans are openly antagonistic to the President, Governor Rockefeller has studiously avoided any criticism of Mr. Nixon.

title: AllWoman Bar Is Opened at a College
description: CONVENT STATION, Nov. 22 (AP)A woman's answer to the allmale McSorley's bar of yesteryear is open for business at the College of St. Elizabeth here.

title: About New York
description: The holidays and the crises come one on top of the other in New York. The holiday season almost begins with the first Christmas lights hung in some store window, and truly begins with the Thanksgiving parade down Broadway. It is the time now when the city's pulse is supposed to quicken and its sense of gaiety to revive.

title: Mobs as Censors
description: The disruptive demonstrators who prevented Dr. William B. Shockley from addressing a public forum at Staten Island Community College are guilty of subverting the Bill of Rights and academic freedom.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 23, 1973
description: International

title: Moscow Paper Lauds Soviet Heating Situation
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 22 (UPI) The Englishlanguage Moscow News said today that Moscow's production of heat and electricity is second to none in the world. It did not mention the plight of Western or Communist countries suffering an energy crisis.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: TV: The Holiday Menu
description: This being a holiday week, television is stuffed, like some enormous turkey, with that rare programing commodity called family entertainment. The reasons are not altruistic but practical. Family holiday gatherings do not lend themselves easily to sitting mesmerized in front of a TV set. So the programing ante has to be raised.

title: PAKISTAN DECREES CURB ON OPPONENTS
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 22 (Reuters)Pakistan today assumed sweeping powers to arrest or ban groups or individuals engaged in antinational activities.

title: Richardson Asserts Haig Backed Cox on Tapes Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Elliot L. Richardson says that Alexander M. Haig Jr., President Nixon's chief of staff, told him he had unsuccessfully tried to dissuade the President from ordering Archibald Cox on Oct. 19 to stop all court actions to obtain White House tape recordings and related documents.

title: Alguero's 20 Points Pace Hayes Victory
description: Tony Alguero put on a show for 12,000 fans at Baker Field yesterday. The junior running back ran for 209 yards and three touchdowns as he led Cardinal Hayes to a 2821 victory in the 31st meeting between the schools.

title: 11MAN EXECUTIVE TO RULE ULSTER UNDER NEW PACT
description: LONDON, Nov. 22The British Government disclosed today the details of the hardwon compromise reached yesterday under which moderate Protestant and Roman Catholic parties agreed to share power in Northern Ireland.

title: Union Boycott Is Urged On Church Collections
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22 (AP)The president of a gravedigger's union, Sam Cimaglia said yesterday that he would urge unions across the country to boycott the collection baskets in Roman Catholic churches until the Archdiocese of Newark learned how to treat its employes.

title: Former Boom Town Sees Hope in Hills
description: TAFT, Calif., Nov. 22They're talking boom again in this town of 4,700 in the heart of one of the nation's richest oil fields.

title: Warriors Trip Hawks
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 22 (AP) Jeff Mullins scored on a layup with seven seconds

title: The Arab Oil Threat
description: While strenuous diplomatic efforts are being made to bring Israel, Egypt and other combatants in the recent Middle Eastern war to the peace table, the Arab oilproducing states are continuing to wield their oil weapon against the United States, Western Europe and Japan. Secretary of State Kissinger has properly warned that this country's Middle East policies stand on their own merits, and will not be altered under pressure of oil embargo.

title: Stepinac Defeats White Plains
description: Archbishop Stepinac concluded one of its finest seasons ever yesterday, defeating White Plains, 177.

title: Edith Bing Is Married
description: Miss Edith Bing, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Raphael Bing of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Bernard J. Firestone, son of Mr. and Mrs. Isaac Firestone of Pittsburgh. Rabbi Joseph Grunblatt performed the ceremony at the Fifth Avenue Synagogue.

title: 2 ASTRONAUTS FIX SKYLAB ANTENNA
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 22Two Skylab astronauts ended a record sixandonehalfhour space walk tonight after repairing a jammed radar antenna and completing most of their other tasks.

title: Music: Lovely IdeaEvening of Wind Serenades
description: It was billed as an evening of wind serenades: a lovely idea. An awesome amount of music has been composed that seldom, if ever, is heard. We fall too easily into categories. In music there is the symphony orchestra with its repertory, and the soloist with his, and the string quartet with its. But much music falls into no easily classifiable group, and as a result it tends to be lost.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: SYDNEY F. FOSTER, A RETIRED JUDGE
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Nov. 22Sydney F. Foster, former associate judge of the New York State Court of Appeals, died yesterday at his home here of a heart attack. He was 80 years old and formerly lived in Liberty, N. Y.

title: Ohio University Downs Marshall
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 22 (AP)  Rich Bevly passed for two touchdowns and ran for a third as Ohio University defeated Marshall 35 to 21 today in the last football game this season for both schools.

title: Ignatius O'Shaughnessy Dead; Oilman and Philanthropist, 88
description: MIAMI, Nov. 22 (AP)Ignatius A. O'Shaughnessy, a, philanthropist whose explorations for oil earned him the title King of the Wildcatters, died in St. Francis Hospital on Wednesday. He suffered a stroke Sunday.

title: ExSeabee Builds Ranch Empire on Islands
description: TINIAN, Mariana IslandsChamorro cowboys are chasing cattle on the abandoned runway where the B29 Enola Gay roared into the black earlymorning sky on Aug. 6, 1945, with an atomic bomb destined to explode over Hiroshima.

title: Dance
description: Kathakali dance drama is a form dating from the end of the 16th century, with roots going back much farther. Something of its style and technique have been known in the West for years through the efforts of such popularizers of Indian dance as Ram Gopal.

title: Europe Seeks Lessening Of I.B.M. Computer Role
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 22  The Common Market Executive Commission said today that Europe's governments should coordinate public use of computers to help Europeanowned computer companies reduce the dominance of International Business Machines in the European market.

title: TwoCar Crash Kills Man
description: MONROE TOWNSHIP, Nov. 22 (AP)  A Madison Township man was killed last night when the car he was driving collided with another auto and slammed into a pole in this Middlesex County community, the police said. The victim, Michael Varsolona, 21 years old, was dead on arrival at Middlesex General Hospital in New Brunswick.

title: OIL HUNT PRESSED IN AMAZON REGION
description: LIMA, PeruThe northwest corner of the forbidding Amazon jungle has become one of the world's most promising oil regions.

title: Eban Bars a Syria Parley Until P.O.W.'s Are Freed
description: United Nations efforts to intercede with Syria so far have been unproductive, he told news correspondents after seeing Secretary General Waldheim and conferring with Under Secretary General Roberto Guyer, who had just returned from Damascus.

title: Cerro Announces a Plan To Redeem Leadership Stock
description: The Cerro Corporation has annonuced that as part of its plan to merge Leadership Housing, Inc., the Series A preferred stock of Leadership would be redeemed on Dec. 21 at a price of $10 a share.

title: At a French Restaurant, Taking Good With the Bad
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Russians Pushing Output At Bauxite Mine in Guinea
description: The Soviet Union, eager to develop foreign sources of bauxite for its growing aluminum industry, has disclosed that its Guinean mining project in West Africa is to go into production at the end of this year.

title: 43% in Survey Believe President Should Quit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)President. Nixon has lost so much credibility over his handling of the Watergate scandal that 43 per cent of Americans now think that he should resign, according to a public opinion poll.

title: SHAKEUP BY THIEU ANTICIPATES BATTLE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 22 (UPI)  President Nguyen Van Thieu shook up South Vietnam's officer corps today in anticipation of a major Communist offensive late this year or early in 1974.

title: Vesco and Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Efforts by Robert L. Vesco's lawyers to label as political the fraud charge on which the United States is basing its bid for his extradition from the Bahamas touch on the most pervasive undercurrent of the entire Vesco affair. There is no connection between the Federal fraud indictment and the scandals that have engulfed President Nixon and his Administration, but Watergate investigators from several quarters will almost certainly swoop down on the international financier if he is forced to return to this country.

title: 300 Jews, Protesting 2 Fires Seek Added Police Protection
description: About 300 Jews, including yeshiva students, rabbis and a contingent of the Jewish Defense League, demonstrated yesterday in front of a Brooklyn yeshiva and synagogue that was destroyed by two fires in a 12hour period.

title: Revitalization of Cleveland at a Turning Point
description: CLEVELAND  Jazz at noon fills the Cleveland Arcade. Three tiers of ornate late 19thcentury balconies come to life as figures drift out on them, drawn by the mellow sound that floods the trussspanned, skylit street from Superior to Euclid Avenues. The lights are on again in Playhouse Square, where the theaters have been dark. The nearly complete Huron Road Mall in front of it is receiving trees. Young people are walking downtown again, from the modern; mushroomgrowth of new construction at Cleveland State University just beyond. An apartment complex of 1,000 suites is renting in the nearby financial district where a new park, Chester Commons, attracts local crowds.

title: 2 Riders Hurt, 4 Horses Dead in a Racing Spill
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Nov. 22 (AP)  Two jockeys were injured and four horses died as the result of a spill involving six horses in today's third race at Churchill Downs.

title: RISE IN VIOLENCE STIRS SAN QUENTIN
description: TAMAL, Calif., Nov. 22It has been nearly two years since the effort to close San Quentin began, but the rotting old state prison is still here and it is again overcrowded and seething with discontent.

title: Nixons at Camp David for Thanksgiving
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., Nov. 22 (UPI)President Nixon joined his family today at his Maryland mountaintop retreat for Thanksgiving dinner.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Red Smith
description: Manny Fernandez has sad eyes, mustaches that grow clear down over his jaw line and valid credentials as the finest defensive lineman on the Miami Dolphins, football champions of this green footstool. When he disembowels a quarterback he does so with professional detachment, yet he has a considerable capacity for indignation and no special reluctance about expressing it. He displayed this quality last Sunday when the Dolphins, having qualified for the playoffs for the fourth year in a row, had to celebrate on lemon pop because Pete Rozelle, the omniscient, wants players to set a nonalcoholic alcoholic example to the young. Baseball players can have beer in the locker room after every game, Fernandez said, but you see, we're animals, we can't cope with alcohol. We go through four years of college to get to the pros, but we can't be trusted with alcoholic beverages. They're afraid we might say something to the press. What they don't realize is, we say it anyway.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: How a City Panel Copes With the Energy Crisis
description: On the 18th floor of the Municipal Building, across from City Hall, a small group of city officials meets once a week to make decisions that will eventually determine how much heat and light New Yorkers will have in their homes and offices this winter, whether their children will continue to attend school for a full day and what leisuretime activities families may pursue.

title: FOOD BAN ON ARABS WILL FAIL, U.S. TOLD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP),  A Congressional researcher reports that an American food embargo, suggested by some members of Congress, would be ineffective as a weapon against Arab oil cutbacks.

title: Government Begins Welfare Payments To 3.2 Million in '74
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)  The Government is preparing to mail the first checks providing, in effect, a guaranteed minimum income to 3.2 million aged, blind and disabled Americans in early January, only about half as many as previously estimated, a Social Security official said today.

title: Ramon Guthrie, Poet, Dies at 77
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 22Dr. Ramon Guthrie, the poet and professor emeritus of French at Dartmouth College, died today at Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital. He was 77 years old and had lived in Norwich, Vt., since his retirement in 1963.

title: Little E. Rockaway Wins Big One, Finishes at 90
description: Even though it won the Metropolitan League title, where it plays bigger schools like Fordham Prep and Xavier, most of the East Rockaway players know that bragging rights would only come from beating nearby schools.

title: Oostdyk's Passes Help Clifton Romp, 7512
description: Powerful Clifton, bidding for recognition as the state's top team, set a school record yesterday as it rolled to its 19th straight victory, a 7512 over Passaic in Clifton.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Las Vegas, Nev.Willie Jenson, 112 pounds, Las Vegas, knocked out Danny Young, 114, Tucson, Ariz., 5 rounds.

title: Seoul Seeking to Reopen Political Talks With North
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 22  South Korea, in a new attempt to reopen official political talks with North Korea, proposed today a preliminary meeting of the deputy cochairmen of the NorthSouth Coordinating Committee for next Tuesday.

title: THANKS ARE GIVEN, DESPITE TROUBLES
description: Tempered in their celebration of the nation's historic holiday of bounty by the international scarcity of fuel, by rising fuel costs, by domestic political taint and by the recollection of a Presidential assassination, Americans here and across the country observed Thanksgiving yesterday.

title: MORE FUEL CURBS IN INDUSTRY URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) A coalition of consumer and environmental groups said today the Nixon Administration's fuelsaving programs were aimed too much at individuals and too little at industry, whose longsought goals, the coalition declared, are now being won in a climate of energy hysteria.

title: Ellsberg and Sakharov Will Get SANE Award
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident Soviet physicist, will be presented the Eleanor Roosevelt Peace Awards for 1973 by SANE, which describes itself as a citizens' organization for a sane world.

title: Whitlam Assails U.S. Alert
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Nov, 22 (AP)Prime Minister Gough Whitlam said today that the United States should have consulted Australia before putting its bases in Australia on alert during the Middle East war. Mr. Whitlam said that the issue would he raised by Deputy Prime Minister Lance Barnard during a visit to the United States in January to renegotiate terms under which the United States maintains the bases.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: The Pop Life
description: The fall rock season must be under way. Between last Sunday and next, our city will have experienced 14 rock and rockoriented concerts and will also have seen six rock clubs introduce new groups and artists. By my reckoning, it would cost about $120 to attend all this activity in good seats.

title: Dibbs Gains in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 22 (AP)Eddie Dibbs of Miami breezed past Jaime PintoBravo of Chile 61, 62 today in the quarterfinal round of the $40,000 Argentine open tennis tournament.

title: VATICAN DENIES PLAN TO ABOLISH TRIBUNAL
description: ROME, Nov. 22A Vatican spokesman categorically denied today that the church was contemplating the abolition of the Sacred Roman Rota, the ecclesiastical supreme court best known for its role in the annulment of marriages.

title: Pamela R. Toombs Is Bride in Jersey
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 22  Miss Pamela Ruth Toombs, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James Raye Toombs, was married here this afternoon to Oglesby Herbert Young 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Young 2d of Lake Oswego, Ore. The Rev. Melvin Campbell, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: How a City Panel Copes With the Energy Crisis
description: On the 18th floor of the Municipal Building, across from City Hall, a small group of city officials meets once a week to make decisions that will eventually determine how much heat and light New Yorkers will have in their homes and offices this winter, whether their children will continue to attend school for a full day and what leisuretime activities families.

title: ESPOSITO SOUGHT MITCHELL MEETING
description: A spokesman for Governor Rockefeller acknowledged last night that the Governor had arranged in early 1972 a meeting between Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, and former United States Attorney General John N. Michell at Mr. Esposito's request.

title: GO VERNOR READY TO ACT IN 2 CRISES
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that he was ready, at a moment's notice, to call a special session to deal with the energy crisis and the 35cent fare, if it becomes necessary.

title: A Deer Hunter, 17, Is Killed
description: ALFRED, N.Y., Nov. 22 (UPI) Paul J. Maniscalco, 17 years old, of Buffalo, was killed today in an apparent hunting accident near here. The state palice said the youth, a member of a deerhunting party, was shot in the neck by a 15yearold boy in the group who mistook him for a deer.

title: Ashe Tops Hewitt in Three Sets
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 22 (AP)Arthur Ashe of Miami, the No. 4 seeded player, moved into the semifinals of the South African open tennis championships today with a 63, 76, 73 triumph over unseeded Bob Hewitt of South Africa.

title: Mrs. Dewart Is Wed to C. R. Hoopes
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 22 Mrs. Elinore Hoelzel Dewart of Delray Beach, Fla., was married in the Princeton University Chapel today to Clement R. Hoopes, a 1929 graduate of Princeton and an author.

title: Microfilm on Kennedy's Life To Be Presented to Library
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Nov. 22Nineteen rolls of microfilm representing more than 30,000 newspaper clippings on the career of President Kennedy are to be presented to the Kennedy Memorial Library, next month by a Waltham man.

title: C. Islip Victor
description: Tony Black, who set a school season scoring record two weeks ago, ran for four touchdowns and locked up Suffolk's scoring title yesterday as Central Islip scored a

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Edward W. Kilpatrick, the acting Commissioner of Education, announced yesterday that Douglas Villanova, a sixthgrade teacher in East Greenwich, Gloucester County, had been chosen as New Jersey's Teacher of the Year. Mr. Kilpatrick said that Mr. Villanova, in spite of his innovative ways, exemplifies the oldfashioned dedication which New Jersey has long enjoyed in the majority of its teachers.

title: Gullible Governors
description: The Republican Governors who met in secret with Richard Nixon at Memphis this week have been had. Just one day after they said he assured them personally that the existing seven subpoenaed tapes of White House conversations were audible and complete, the White House counsel disclosed in Federal court that an eighteenminute segment was missing from one of them.

title: A Ford Executive Slain in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 22An American executive of Ford Motor Argentina and threes bodyguards were ambushed and killed today on their way to work in the industrial city of Crdoba in northern Argentina. The killers escaped.

title: Canada Hanging Curb Stays
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 22 (Reuters) The Senate today approved extension of the Government's partial ban on housing for another five years, effective Dec. 31.4fhe ban limits capital punishment to killers of policemen on duty and prison guards.

title: A Drug Dealer's Thanksgiving at Home
description: The sounds of dishes rattling and quiet domestic chatter could be heard yesterday afternoon in the dimly lighted hallway outside apartment 6B of a large brick apartment building in the Bronx where Steven Dellacava, a convicted narcotics dealer, was eating Thanksgiving dinner with some 20 relatives.

title: Blast Traps Korean Miners
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Friday, Nov. 23 (UPI)A gas explosion at a provincial mine trapped 17 miners deep underground early today with little hope that they are alive, police said. The explosion, at a mine in Chongson 100 miles southeast of Seoul, caused a cavein some 1,500 yards below ground.

title: Business Briefs

title: Waste Embankment Check Made Routine at Coal Mines

title: C.W. Post Trounces Hofstra, Retains Title
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 22Offering little thanks, giving nothing and scoring nearly a point a minute, C.W. Post defeated its arch rival, Hofstra, 5314, today.

title: Whose Special Prosecutor?
description: WASHINGTON  I've changed my mind. When I first considered the question of the constitutionality of empowering a prosecutor outside the executive branch to prosecute crime, my initial reaction was that such measure would probably be unconstitutional. Further study and reflection have, however, led me to different conclusion: Although the matter is not free from doubt, there is powerful and, ultimately, persuasive support in the law for the position that Congress has the constitutional authority to create such an office of special prosecutor.

title: Fire Safety Official Warns On Makeshift Heating Units
description: BOSTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The National. Fire Protection Association's president, Charles S. Morgan, warns that makeshift methods of trying to warm homes may result in death and destruction this winter.

description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 18The women's movement has not yet come to Thailand and, paradoxically, one of the country's leading advocates of women's rights wants to keep it that way.

LOUIS, Mo., Nov. 22 (UPI)  Glen Sather scored with less than three minutes remaining in the game tonight to give the St. Louis Blues a 21 National Hockey League victory over the Minnesota North Stars. Gary Unger fed the puck to Chris Evans, whose shot bounced off the pad of Gump Worsley, Minnesota goalie. Sather swooped in on the loose puck and fired it past Worsley.

title: Books of The Times
description: TOURISTS. By Gerald Green. 471 pages. Doubleday. $8.95. When a novel is a cornucopia, the accent is usually on corn. Panoramic comes to mind, and cast of thousands. Every character can be counted on to represent a particular emotional set. I remember a group of Harvard psychologists who compiled a partial list of human emotions: I believe it ran to something like 276. In the cornucopia novel, the author often seems to be working his way through this list. The grimjawed and the chinless; the hypocrites and the straight ones; the sexy and the sexless; the rich and poor; bright and dull; black and white; subtle and hamfisted; cruel and compassionate. Et cetera.

title: A Gentle 'Cajun' Documentary
description: Les Blank's "Dry Wood and Hot Pepper," which opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art, is a gentle, two-part documentary about the life and music of the French-speaking blacks in southwestern Louisiana's Cajun country.The two parts, "Dry Wood," 37 minutes, and "Hot Pepper," 54 minutes, flow one into the other so easily that the only lines of demarcation between them are the closing credits of the first and the opening credits of the second.Although the film was made within the last several years, it has the air of someone's remembering events of long ago. This is particularly true of "Dry Wood," and is due in part to the seemingly stable quality of lives being explored, as well as to Mr. Blank's manner, which is to pay almost as much attention to the landscapes, seasons and weather as to people.This isn't necessarily the most interesting kind of film making. It has the effect of softening the focus so that we can barely define the sharp, rough edges of the lives he shows us. He prefers to record the happy times, the preparations for a rural Mardi Gras, the daily routines of farm life that are a continuing life cycle.At one point a farm woman, who has borne 16 children and reared 14, recalls the good old days when people sat around and talked. Now, she says, the men drink and the children leave, one by one. She is, however, surrounded by members of her family, all at work preparing what looks to be a holiday feast.Clifton Chenier, something of a local celebrity who plays an electric accordion and has a small band, is the star of "Hot Pepper," which devotes as much time to Chenier's music (a mixture of blues and Cajun) as it does to him and his friends. The music is full of soul and so exuberantly ironic that it cannot be especially sad, no matter what the lyrics say.A bit of barroom dialogue in this sequence is worth preserving. Says one customer, solemnly: "People is people." To which his friend gravely assents: "Everywhere you go," prompting them both to laugh.The people in "Hot Pepper" take themselves less pompously than the film maker does, which is my only reservation about Mr. Blank's work.

It was no ordinary student protest that brought death to at least twelve, injuries to 200 others and the reimposition martial law throughout the country.

title: Parish in El Barrio Marks 100th Year
description: Cardinal Cooke helped mark the 100th anniversary of St. Cecilia's Roman Catholic parish in East Harlem yesterday by saying a Thanksgiving Day mass and praising the various ethnic groups that have constituted the parish over the years.

title: Bloomfield Wins in Final Seconds, 1512
description: A disputed touchdown pass with 50 seconds to go yesterday gave unbeaten Bloomfield a 1512 upset victory over Montclair before 15,000 fans in Bloomfield.

title: Accident Victim Released
description: HYANNIS, Mass., Nov. 22 (AP)The last of seven young persons injured in an accident involving a car driven by Joseph P. Kennedy 3d last August was released from Cape Cod Hospital here yesterday. She was Mary Schlaff, 22 years old, of Grosse Point, Mich., who suffered a fractured peivis and lea in the accident Aug. 13.

title: Toros Top Nordiques, 4.2
description: QUEBEC CITY, Nov. 22 (UPI)  The Toronto Toros scored three goals within three minutes and five seconds in the last period to down the Quebec Nordiques, 42, tonight in a World Hockey Association game. Wayne Carleton, the Toros' leading scorer, tallied his 10th and 11th goals of the season.

title: 5 Mountain Climliers Killed By Slide in Northern Japan
description: KAMIOKA, Japan, Nov. 22 ((UPI)Five student mountain climbers have been killed in and avalanche on Mount Yarigatake in the northern Japan Alps.

title: A Tree Trail for Christmas: Canada to Jersey to Caribbean
description: PORT NEWARK, Nov. 22The Christmas season has begun in the vast port basin here. Thousands of Christmas trees, aromatic Nova Scotia pine arrived earlier this week by truck at the local terminal of PrudentialGrace Lines.

title: Dolphins Subdue Cowboys, 147, for 9th in Row
description: DALLAS, Nov. 22The Miami Dolphins, who had been annihilating those secondclass teams back in the Eastern Division of the American Conference, stepped up in class today and won again. It was not that easy against the Dallas Cowboys, the score being 147 for Miami in a contest that lacked a climactic finale because the Dolphins would not let any anxiety surface in the final quarter.

title: Between Parent and Child, What Does Watergate Mean?
description: To 10yearold Sarah Hilsrnan, morality has become a simple equation.

title: Strife Delays Normalization and the Greeks Wonder for How Long
description: ATHENS, Nov. 22  The spokesmen and newspapers of the militarybacked Government assert that the strife of the, last few days may have retarded normalization, but have not put it off indefinitely.

title: Chance Miltie Captures Handicap at Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 22 (UPI)Eugene F. O'Connell's Chance Miltie beat an equally fastclosing Escaped by threequarters of a length today and won the $26,625 Festival Handicap at the Atlantic City track.

title: People and Business
description: Nicolaas Diederichs, South African Finance Minister, said yesterday that he expected the freemarket price of gold to rise to $150 an ounce next year.

title: Bridge: Players to Reach High Rank Analyzing Own Errors Aids
description: Players who reach high rank in the game do so by analyzing their errors. When something goes wrong, they give the circumstances sufficient thought in the hope of ensuring that it will not happen next time. If the error is a matter of partnership, they discuss it with their regular partners.

title: Change, More Than a Sense of Tragedy, Now Dominates Dallas
description: DALLASVisitors still go down to Dealey Plaza where the shooting was done.

title: Chicago Schools Now More Segregated
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23  An increasing number of black students are leaving the Chicago public school system this year, and those who remain are more segregated.

title: Nixon Returns to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)  President Nixon returned to the White House tonight from Camp David, Md., for a meeting tomorrow with Melvin R. Laird, his domestic adviser, and John A. Love, his chief energy adviser.

title: Fisco Expects a Loss
description: A substantial net loss is expected by Fisco, Inc., of Philadelphia, William Rush, president of the insurance holding company said yesterday. He said completion of its report for the first nine months would be delayed until January and that a substantial loss was expected for that period and for the year 1973.

title: JULIA T. WELD, 86, RESEARCHER, DIES
description: Mrs. Julia Tiffany Weld, who made important contributions to medical research although she had no scientific degree, died Thursday at her home here. Her age was 86.

title: Qaddafi in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 23 (Reuters) President Pompidou's band struck up the wrong anthem when Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, arrived here today on his first visit to a Western capital.

title: Widow, 71, Is Evicted From RoadSite Shack
description: LORDSBURG, N.M., Nov. 23 (UPI)A county sheriff pushed down the door of a 71yearold widow's desert shack today and took the woman off to jail for refusing to vacate her land for multimilliondollar highway project.

title: U.S. Leads Golf as Miller Cards 65
description: MARBELLA, Spain, Nov. 23  With an 11underpar performance, the United States took the lead today at the end of the second round of the 21st World Cup golf competition over the par72 Nueva Andalucia course.

title: Kiichi Aichi, Finance Minister Who Helped Rebuild Japan, Dies
description: TOKYO, Nov. 23  Kiichi Aichi, Japan's Minister of Finance and a familiar figure at recent international economic conferences, died tonight of pneumonia. He was 66 years old.

title: Landmark Status Given To Queensboro Bridge
description: The Queensboro Bridge was designated as a city landmark yesterday by the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS DRIFT AIMLESSLY
description: The stock market drifted aimlessly yesterday as advances and declines finished almost evenly divided in small volume.

title: Statistics Hint a Shift in Eating Habits
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The explosion of food prices this year has caused a significant change in the eating habits of Americans, according to strong, though indirect, evidence from recent Government statistics.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 3.3 From WeekAgo Level
