description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 194.1 from 190.8 last week.

title: Mexico Leads In '74 Davis Cup
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 23 (AP)Mexieo took a 20 lead over Canada today in the first day of 1974 Davis Cup zone eliminations.

title: Books of The Times
description: Books on esoteric collectibles seem this year to outnumber by far those on more conventional antiques. The following round up of some of the best reflects the delight many collectors experience in the exotic or in anything that provokes nostalgia.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Nov. 23In these dark days of Princeton University football fortunes, at least one Tiger fan is confident that a turnabout soon will be made.

title: French to Build Plant for Nuclear Fuel
description: PARIS, Nov. 23In an immense undertaking to make Europe less dependent on foreign energy supplies, the French Government announced today that it would start construction next January on a plant to make fuel for nuclear power reactors in the 1980's.

title: ExDentist, 92, Saves His Energy With 4 Days a Week of Silence
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 23 (AP)  Dr. Abraham Wolfson, 92 years old, has stopped talking four days a week to conserve time and energy to do all the things he wants to do before he dies.

title: A Surprise for Museum
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa., Nov. 23 (AP)  Mrs. David Eisenhower, the President's daughter, was a surprise visitor today at the opening of a Christmas exhibition at the Brandywine River Museum.

title: Princeton (17) Not in Mourning Okla. Routs
description: Last week Fred Daizell Scotchtaped four short business letters to the southern wall of his dormitory living room. That's my wailing wall, said Dalzell, a senior quarterback at Princeton University. The stark white sheets with their terse black messages were rejections from medical schools.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 3.3 From WeekAgo Leve
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 194.1 from 190.8 last week.

title: Dog Sled Trail Is Sought By Varied Alaskan Groups
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 23 (AP) While bicycle paths are becoming more popular around the nation, several groups here are pushing for a permanent dog sled trail.

title: The Philippines: Finding a Way
description: MANILAShould the proclamation of martial law in the Philippines arouse the American conscience.

title: LIBYAN, IN PARIS, MAY REQUEST ARMS
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  Col. Muammar elQaddafi, Libya's leader, arrived here today on a visit during which he was expected to demand that France deliver more and better arms to his country, possibly including atomic weapons, and lift restrictions on the transfer of French arms to Egypt and Syria.

title: A Time for Terms in the Mideast
description: WASHINGTONIt Is time for the Israeli Government and the American Jewish establishment to pay attention to some of us Jeremiahs.

title: GasOil Drill Usage Rises
description: Drilling for gas and oil in this country has been increased to the highest level in five years, the Hughes Tool Company, a major equipment maker reported yesterday. It said that during November an estimated 1,411 rotary drills have been in operation, which was 77 more than October and 197 more than a year ago.

title: Living Cost Increase Due
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 23 (UPI) The United Steelworkers announced today that 34,000 aluminum workers employed by five major producers would receive cost of living increases of 11 cents an hour effective Dec. I. The adjustments will be paid under terms of the 1971 contract signed by Alcoa, Reynolds, Kaiser, Olin and Ormet.

title: Beame Cites Importance of Deputy Post
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that his Deputy mayor for Community Affairs would be dealing with many important city functions and that he would be overseeing the operations of many city agencies and reporting directly to the Mayor.

title: UNION AND BANK SIGN NOSTRIKE CONTRACT
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., Nov. 23 (UPI)A major financial institution has signed an unprecedented nostrike labor contract with the United Steelworkers to cover 200 nonsupervisory bank employes in the company's 12 offices.

title: Senator Says Nixon's Trips Set Bad Example for U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) Senator J. Bennett Johnston Jr., Democrat of Louisiana, said today that too much Presidential travel sets a poor example for the nation to follow during a time of fuel shortages.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: By their eagerness to accept the assurances of Mr. Nixon that he will be able to explain away, to his personal credit and to the satisfaction of the public majority, the scandals of his Administration, Republican Congressmen are displaying a propensity for gullibility.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: War of the Roses to Enter Its Decisive Stage Today
description: Those who have not tired of television football this long holiday weekend will have the blearyeyed pleasure of watching the college season's biggest TV doubleheader todayOhio State vs. Michigan, followed by Southern California vs. The University of California, Los Angeles, both on Channel 7 here.

title: Empire: DoItYourself College
description: When Jim Zink decided to resume his quest for a bachelor's degree after being away from college long enough to marry and have three children, he wanted to find a way of becoming a student again with the least disruption to his job and family life.

title: Milked Cobra Bites Boy, 15
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (UPI)  Carmen Hicks, a 15yearold Philadelphia boy who purchased a deadly Asian king cobra without his parents' knowledge, was in critical condition from a snake bite today at Albert Einstein Medical Center Northern Division. The police said that he was bitten on the left thumb yesterday afternoon while he was milking the snake, which he received by mail about two weeks ago.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israel's Defense Minister, Moshe Dayan, said that he did not share the optimism generated by the talks between Egyptian and Israeli generals on carrying out the sixpoint ceasefire agreement. There was another meeting at the United Nations checkpoint at Kilometer 101 on the CairoSuez road at which the disengagement of forces was discussed. The talks, which are showing some progress, will continue today, [1:1.]

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: Antiques: T'ang Vigor
description: The Chinese tomb and household treasures on view here in the small but choice Arts of the T'ang Dynasty exhibition will come as a surprise to those accustomed only to understatement in oriental art, For the T'ang period (A.D. 618906) is full of the sort of robust prizes shown: fiercefaced warriors with bristling muscles and clenched fists; camels and horses, their heads held high and nostrils flared; and ewers and jars, vigorously shaped and splashed with bold glazes.

title: DONALD J. MILLER
description: MIDLAND PARK, N.J., Nov. 23Donald J. Miller, financial vice president of the United Artists Theater Circuit, Inc., in New York, died of a heart attack Wednesday while driving his car home from Paramus. His age was 48, and he lived here.

title: Skyscraper Near Battery Park Is Urged As Permanent Home for Baruch College
description: Dr. Robert J. Kibbee, the Chancellor of the City University, said yesterday that he favored the purchase of a 40story office structure at 2 New York Plaza, near Battery Park, for use as the new home of the university's Bernard M. Baruch College.

title: EARLE VV. CARDER JR.
description: DARIEN, Conn, Nov. 23 Earle Weston Carder Jr., associate executive of Movies en Route and Modern Film Corporation, both at 1540 Broadway in New York, died of cancer yesterday at Stamford Hospital. His age was 47, and he lived here.

title: New Bedford Rations Fuel
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Nov. 23 (AP)  Mayor John A. Markey said today that the city would ration fuel and oil to its departments because of the energy shortage. He said that the city had received an extra allotment from its supplier, Gulf Oil Corporation, but that the extra fuel would not be enough to go around without rationing.

title: WINE TALK
description: Here are two sad stories to carry you through the unrelenting joyousness about to envelop us all for a month or so.

title: De De Pierce Dies
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 23De De Pierce, who with his wife, Billie, led the Preservation Hall Jazz Band on highly successful national tours over the last six years, died today. He was 69 years old.

title: The Latke vs. the Hamantasch
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23With the intensity of medieval scholastics racking their brains to determine how many angels could dance on the head of a pin, a number of academicians held a symposium at the University of Chicago this week on an issue of soaring unimportance: the merits of the latke vs. the hamantasch.

title: Waldheim Reports Nothing Decided On Mideast Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Secretary General Waldheim of the United Nations said today that the whole question of the Middle East peace conference is still open and nothing has been decided.

title: PENN CENTRAL CO. WARNS OP FAILiNG
description: The Penn Central Company, the holding company that owns all the stock of the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad, in a proxy statement now in the mails, has advised its 160,000 shareholders that next year it too may have to file for bankruptcy.

title: GIGANTE PROTESTS POLICE SUSPENSION
description: The Rev. Louis R. Gigante, the Roman Catholic priest who was elected to the City Council from the South Bronx, took issue yesterday with the Police Department over the suspension rof Capt. Salvatore M. Salmieri.

title: Today's Football at a Glance
description: * Night game.  National television game.

title: BONN CURBS HIRING OF FOREIGN LAMP
description: BERLIN, Nov. 23West Germany restricted the entry of foreign workers today to counteract expected repercussions of the energy crisis.

title: Cup Belongs to Victor
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 23 (UPI)The winner of tomorrow's football game between Penn State and Pitt will get a special rewardThe Governor's Trophy. Gov. Milton J. Shapp said today he would present the trophy to the winning team after the game.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Department of Commerce reported today that department !store sales last week were an estimated $1.3billion, up 16 per cent from the yearearlier $1.1billion. Total retail store sales were about $10.5billion, up 12 per cent from last year's $9.3billion.

title: LIBYAN, IN PARIS, MAYREQUEST ARMS
description: PARIS, Nov. 23  Col. Muammar elQaddafi, Libya's leader, arrived here today on a visit during which he was expected to demand that France deliver more and better arms to his country, possibly including atomic weapons, and lift restrictions on the transfer of French arms to Egypt and Syria.

title: W. Hempstead Wins, 228; Carle Place Is 130 Victor
description: UNIONDALE, L.T., Nov. 23 West Hempstead deprived Levittown Division of an undefeated season and the Conference II championship today, 228, and Carle Place disposed of Hempstead, 130, for the Conference III crown in a Nassau County playoff doubleheader at Hofstra Stadium.

title: New York's Future Malls
description: Politics builds cities as much as planners: the Madison Avenue Mall proposal was killed by a combination of political pressure and legitimate uncertainties. There was too much real doubt about traffic and business dislocation and the stakes, in midtown, were too high. That doesn't make malls a bad or unworkable idea. It just puts New York far behind other cities here and abroad, where pedestrian precincts have been established in automobile  saturated areas and the conversion has been both economically and environmentally sound.

title: French to Build Plant for Nuclear Fuel
description: PARIS, Nov. 23In an immense undertaking to make Europe less dependent on foreign energy supplies, the French Government announced today that it would start construction next January on a plant to make fuel for nuclear power reactors in the 1980's.

title: Actors Guild Service Is Set
description: Walter Abel, the actor, will be the chief speaker at the annual memorial service of the Episcopal Actors Guild at the Protestant Episcopal Church of the Transfiguration (the Little Church Around the Corner), East 29th Street, tomorrow at 4 P.M. Also taking part will be the Rev. Dr. Norman T. Catir Jr., the rector; Lon Clark, exlecutive administrator of the guild, and Paul Kirk Giles, actor.

title: Holy Shroud of Turin Is Displayed on Television
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 23The Holy Shroud of Turin was shown on television tonight, the first public showing of the relic in 40 years.

title: Pennsylvania Bans the Use Of Inmates in Experiments
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 23 (AP)  The state has imposed a permanent ban on all medical experimentation on inmates in state and county prisons.

title: ANIEX STOCKS UP; OTC ISSUES OFF
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday in light postholiday volume, as many traders took a fourday weekend. Prices in the overthecounter market declined.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New Home Urged For Baruch College

title: Two Sisters Must Leave Foster Home
description: JOLIET, Ill., Nov. 23 (UPI)Two sisters who wanted to remain with their foster parents were ordered today to be returned to their natural parents and never again permitted to see the family that gave them home.

title: A Lee Who Took Atlanta Can Burn Jets
description: With his freckled face and boyish appearance, Bob Lee might be mistaken for a slightly grownup Tom Sawyer. But with a football in his hand, Lee has become more mischievous than Tom ever was with a paint brush.

title: Capital Gets Rent Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP) President Nixon has signed a bill giving the District of Columbia's government discretionary authority to regulate rent increases and to set up a temporary rent commission, the White House announced today. Mr. Nixon signed the measure Thanksgiving Day, but the White House, delayed making the announcement.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: New York952073

title: Greenwich Will Fight Suit To Open Town Beaches
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 23 (AP)Greenwich will join Fairfield in fighting a suit filed by the Connecticut Civil Liberties Union to open town beaches on Long Island Sound to nonresidents, according to A. William Mottolese, town attorney.

title: Policeman and Killer Slain
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 23 (AP)A patrolman who was to be married Wednesday was shot and killed tonight, and his partner shot and killed the assailant, Police Chief Bill Price said. The victims were identified as Edward J. Hammonds, 27 years old, a police officer since October, 1972, and Arthur Berry, 59.

title: Flames Set Back Canucks by 41.
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23, (AP)Chuck Arnason scored twice in the third period tonight to pace the Atlanta Flames to a 41 National Hockey League victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Stores to Close Sundays
description: RUTLAND, Vt., Nov. 23 (AP) Beginning Sunday, chain supermarkets across Vermont will cease Sunday sales in an energy conservation measure. Ronald Goldberg of the Vermont Retail Grocers Association said today that all of the major chain supermarkets would be closed Sundays as of Dec. 2.

title: Baby's Skeleton Found
description: WORCESTER, N. Y., Nov. 23 (AP)The state police investigated the death of a newborn baby whose skeletal remains were discovered in a cardboard box yesterday by a woman outside a summer cottage near the Otsego County hamlet of South Worcester.

title: PRESIDENT ASKED TO MEET ON FARE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Administration officials remained adamant today against any Federal subsidies to operate masstransit systems, as Governor Rockefeller and Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame requested meeting next week with President Nixon to seek such funds to save the 35 cent fare in New York City.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Mexico's Miguel Baigts surged into the lead today after 13 matchplay quarterfinal games in the World Cup bowling event. Baigts gathered 2,579 pins from 10 victories and three losses for a total of 2,804 points, including bonuses for victories and games over 200.

title: Disarray Over Policy on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The fuel shortage caused by the Arab oil embargo has led to deep divisions within the Nixon Administration and some feelings of disarray and selfdoubt.

title: Nebraska, Wins Title
description: NORMAN, Okla. Nov. 23 (AP)  Third  ranked Oklahoma with a devastating defense and the running of a pair of shifty sophomores, Steve Davis and Joe Washington, routed Nebraska, 270, today and clinched the Big Eight football championship.

title: BuiltUp Communities in Florida Are Competing for Fresh Water
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla Conversation, when it gets around to drinking water these days in Florida, can sometimes sound strangely like dialogue lifted from an Old West range war.

title: The Dance: Inner City
description: Donald McKayle's excellent Inner City Dance Company was founded and is based on the West Coast, but it regularly visits our Atlantic shores. This season its visit is unfairly briefjust three performances at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, beginning last night.

title: REWARD IS OFFERED FOR PLANE VANDALS
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 23 (UPI) Pacific Southwest Airlines mounted guards on all its parked planes yesterday and offered a $20,000 reward for the vandals who did $3million damage with fire and acid to two jetliners.

title: City Basks in a Day of Many Ambiguities
description: It was spring in November yesterday  an ambiguous sort of day that was not quite a holiday and not quite a working day; not quite a coat day and not quite a shirtsleeves day, and not quite the Christmas season and not quite not.

title: Business Briefs
description: Court Backs Project Fought by Indians

title: Jersey State Police Investigated By U.S. on Charges of Job Bias
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Charges that the New Jersey State Police discriminate against blacks in hiring are being investigated by the United States Department of Justice.

title: International Plane Fares Up 6% to Meet Fuel Cost
description: Airlines flying international routes announced agreement yesterday on a 6 per cent fare increase, starting Jan. 1, to meet the recent drastic increases in fuel costs.

title: Proxmire Tells Nixon That Bork Is Serving Illegally
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Senator William Proxmire charged today that Robert H. Bork, the Acting Attorney General, was serving in violation of a Federal law requiring his confirmation by the Senate after 30 days in office.

title: Hunter's Orphan Killed By Shot Fired At Deer
description: KALISPELL, Mont., Nov. 23 (AP)An 18yearold Kalispell deer hunter has been shot to death only 10 days after his father died in a hunting accident.

title: The Dance: Tamayana
description: Kathakali, the dancedrama from southwest India, represents a people's theater. Once one is attuned to its special conventions, the degree to which Kathakali has the ability to communicate to the audience that understands it becomes very clear. Certainly this was true at Carnegie Hall on Thursday during Ramayana, the second program of the brief return engagement here by the extraordinary Kerala Kafamandaiam Company.

title: Soviet Deplores Sexual Adventurism Among Its Youth
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23  The Soviet Union hardly has an international reputation as a society of free love, but a Soviet sociologist is evidently worried that young people are moving in that direction.

title: Volkwagen Sales Rise 7% Worldwide in Nine Months
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Nov. 23 (AP)Worldwide motor vehicle sales of Volkswagenwerk, A.G., totaled 1,727, 000 units in the first nine months of the current year, up 7 per cent from the like 1972 period, the company said in a letter to shareholders.

title: LESLIE H. ALLEN
description: Leslie H. Allen, who retired as an editor of The Christian Science Monitor in 1969, died Wednesday in St. Joseph's Hospital in Yonkers. He was 87 years old and lived at 511 West 235th Street.

title: Top Cairo Editor Urges Nuclear Arms for Arabs
description: CAIRO, Nov. 23The editor of Egypt's semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram stressed today that the Arab world needed to build, buy or borrow nuclear weapons as a deterrent to any use of such weapons by Israel.

title: Shultz Is Reported In Monetary Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz and his counterparts from Britain, France, West Germany and Japan began a secret meeting in France today, it was reliably reported here.

title: OilAllocation Aide In U.S Office Here Is Deluged by Calls
description: A cluster of drab green rooms that used to house the Navy Recruiting Service at 252 Seventh Avenue is now the regional office of the Federal Office of Petroleum Allocation, and the telephones ring there constantly.

title: Coast Group Buys Padres; Club Will Stay in San Diego
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 23 (AP)  An allCalifornia group, which includes Mrs. Marjorie (Marje) Lindheimer Everett, majority owner of Hollywood Park race track, won approval today to buy the San Diego Padres and keep the National League team in San Diego.

title: Business Briefs
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 23 (AP)  An appeals court has opened the way for construction to resume on a $6billion hydroelectric project that Indians and Eskimos claim will change their way of life.

title: Jacobson Goal: Complete Court Victory
description: Howard (Buddy) Jacobson, the horse trainer banished by the New York Racing Association, said yesterday he was kind of overwhelmed by what appears to be a significant victory in his 2 year legal battle.

title: Finlandization
description: The long, hard road democratic Finland has had to pursue to obtain Moscow's acquiescence to new trade links with the ninenation Common Market illustrates the kind of Soviet pressure known as Finlandization.

title: 16 OF G.M. PLANTS MAKING BIG AUTOS TO SHUT FOR WEEK
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23  In what was seen here as a major out growth of the energy crisis. General Motors announced to day that it planned to close down operations during the work week beginning Dec. 17 at 16 assembly plants where standardsize and intermediatesize cars are produced.

title: IRVING L. ROLLINS
description: Irving L. Rollins, assistant attorney general in the office of the New York State Attorney General since 1949, died, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 34 Plaza Street, Brooklyn, on Thursday. He was 71 years old.

title: Bridge: Analyzing Own Errors Aids Players to Reach High Rank
description: Players who reach high rank in the game do so by analyzing their errors. When something goes wrong, they give the circumstances sufficient thought in the hope of ensuring that it will not happen next time. If the error is a matter of partnership, they discuss it with their regular partners.

title: Mitchell Denies Discussing Podell and Brasco Cases
description: A spokesman for John N. Mitchell, former United States Attorney General, yesterday denied that Mr. Mitchell had ever discussed the problems of Representative Bertram L. Podell or Representative Frank J. Brasco with the Brooklyn Democratic county leader, Meade H. Esposito.

title: U.S. SAYS IT REGRETS JAPAN'S ARAB STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (Reuters)The United States said today that it regretted that Japan had found it necessary to issue a proArab statement urging Israel to withdraw from territories occupied during the war of 1967.

title: Campus Notes
description: An internationally famous Brazilian scholar, writer and former director of economic and social research at the University of Chile has been offered a teaching position at Hostos Community College in the Bronx.

title: Bill in Congress to Lift Inventor Fees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 23The inventor of a new laser or a new coathanger is likely to find that getting a patent probably will mean increased costs and red tape under President Nixon's recommendations for reform of the patent system.

title: POUND AND STOCKS TUMBLE IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Nov. 23Britain's financial markets absorbed a heavy beating today amid growing doubts about the national economy.

title: A Fatal Frieght Derailment Is Attributed to Vandalism
description: WINDHAM, Ohio, Nov. 23 (AP)Officials of the ErieLackawanna Railroad have blamed vandalism for an open switch that they say may have caused a freight train derailment in which one crewman was killed and another was injured.

title: HORACE H. NAHM, 76, DIRECTMAIL LEADER
description: Horace H. Nahm, a leader in the directmail industry and a former president of the Advertising Club of New York, died Thursday in the Hospital for Joint Diseases. He was 76 years old and lived at 305 East 86th Street.

title: VIETCONG LEADER FAILS TO STIR CHOU
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 23 president Nguyen Huu Tho, president of the Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government of South Vietnam, left for home today after a six  day visit to China that apparently was a disappointment to him.

title: Connors, Drysdale, Okker Gain at South African Net
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 23 (AP)Cliff Drysdale of South Africa, Tom Okker of the Netherlands and Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., won the quarterfinal matches today in the South African open tennis tournament.

title: Greenwich Rebuffs Xerox On Plan for Office Campus
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 23 The Greenwich Planning and Zoning Commission has rejected a controversial proposal by the Xerox Corporation to build a 104acre headquarters campus in the rural back country of this rich commuter town, it was announced today.

title: 151 New Firemen, at Graduation, Are Praised for Their Aid During Strike
description: The November class of probationary firemen was graduated in ceremonies here yesterday after receiving warm praise from Mayor Lindsay and Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan for operating in the field durin. the recent firemen's strike.

title: Brokerage Trustee Sues for 2 Banks To Return Shares
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 23, (AP) The trustee for the bankrupt Paul R. Dean & Co., investment brokers, filed suit today to recover 30,000 shares of Xerox Corporation stock from two banks.

title: Arabs Are Confident of Policy Of Using Oil Cuts as a Weapon
GOING OUT Guide
description: CENTENNIAL In 1874, the folks who live in what is now the Bronx, the part west of the Bronx River (which flows through the Bronx Zoo and the Botanical Garden) broke away from Westchester, and their land was annexed to the expanding City of New York, in which it was known as the 23d and 24th Wards. In the middle eighteennineties, the part east of the Bronx River, which seems to have taken on the political importance of the Jordan or the Rhine, left Westchester for the big city.

title: CADILLAC AND FORD RECALLING VEHICLES
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23 (AP) General Motors Corporation announced today the recall of nearly 400,000 latemodel Cadlilacs to check for steering defects, and the Ford Motor Cornpapy said that it was calling in 3,500 new school buses because of brake problems.

title: Celtics' No. 10 Spoils Debut of Kings' Coach
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23, (AP)Paul Silas helped break open a close game with 14 points in the second period, and the Boston Celtics went on to their 10th consecutive victory tonight.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Mexican Leads World Bowling

title: Twice a Prince Will Try Again Today
description: A colt who attracted attention of a mixed nature in the spring will be seeking the first stakes triumph of his career in the Roamer Handicap at Aqueduct today. Twice a Prince, who represents the Elmendorf interests, is listed as one of the 10 contestants in the 1 3/16mile event for 3yearolds, and he is hardly expected to win.

title: Ulster Guerrillas Step Up Raids In Wake of New Accord on Rule
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 23 (AP)  Guerrillas struck around Northern Ireland today after vowing to smash the new administration that gives Catholics their first significant government voice in Ulster's history.

title: New Bedford Rations Fuel
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Nov. 23 (AP)  Mayor John A. Markey said today that the city would ration fuel and oil to its departments because of the energy shortage. He said that the city had received an extra allotment from its supplier, Gulf Oil Corporation, but that the extra fuel would not he enough to go around without rationing.

title: DAYAN IS OPPOSED TO YIELDING LAND VITAL TO SECURITY
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23  Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that he did not share the optimism generated by the talks between Egyptian and Israeli generals on carrying out, the sixpoint ceasefire agreement.

title: Living Cost Increase Due
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 23 (UPI) The United Steelworkers anJnounced today that 34.000 aluminum workers employed by five major producers would receive cost of living increases of 11 cents an hour effective Dec. I. The adjustments will be paid under terms of the 1971 con tract signed by Alcoa. Reynolds. Karser. Olin and Ormet.

title: Spring in November? Well Not Quite
description: It was spring in November yesterdayan ambiguous sort of day that was not quite a holiday and not quite a working day; not quite a coat day and not quite a Shirtsleeves day, and not quite the Christmas season and not quite not.

title: Denmark Expects Political Turmoil as 2 New Parties Join in Dec. 4 Election
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 23The Danes, buffeted by winter winds and the rhetoric of an election campaign, have reached broad agreement on one thingthey are heading for a period of rare political turmoil.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Public Service Commission will begin hearings Dec. 11 on a request by the Western Union Telegraph Company for increases in rates for telegrams, money orders, personalopinion messages and delivery by messengers. The company also proposes to end its singing greeting service, which has serenaded thousands of surprised recipients with Happy Birthday and other greetings over the years.

title: Crib Maker Seeks to Enjoin A.B.C. Film
description: A furniture manufacturer attempted yesterday in an Indiana court to enjoin A.B.C. News from televising segments of a documentary in which a crib it produces is depicted as highly flammable.

title: Patricia Lyons, C. F. Randolph Are Wed Here
description: Miss Patricia Ann Lyons, who is on the staff of Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Christopher Fitz Randolph, a former member of the Senator's staff now in his first year at the Brooklyn School of Law.

title: Mitchell Denies Discussing Podell and Brasco Cases
description: A spokesman for John N. Mitchell, former United States Attorney General, yesterday denied that Mr. Mitchell had ever discussed the problems of Representative Bertram L. Podell or Representative Frank J. Brasco with the Brooklyn Democratic county leader, Meade H. Esposito.

title: Money Talks Reported
description: Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz was reliably reported to be meeting secretly in France with financial officials from Britain, France, West Germany and Japan. The subject of their meeting was not known. Details on Page 43.

title: Outgoing Administrator Calls for Halt In Federal and State Aid for Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23  Cornelius Bodine Jr., who served as city business administrator for the last three years, left today with a call for a citizen's suit against the city and a Federal and state embargo of further grants to the Newark city government.

title: CAHILL NOMINEE MAY BE STALLED
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 23The planned nomination of Evan W. Jahos, director of the New Jersey Division of Criminal Justice, for a Superior Court judgeship may not be acted on by the Senate, political leaders said tonight.

title: Three in Family Found Dead In Wreckage of Light Plane
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Nov. 23 (AP)  Three members of a Minneapolis family were found dead today in the wreckage of their light plane that crashed in a heavily wooded area in northeast Pennsylvania.

title: Proposal Is Pressed to Give Justice Agency New Status
description: WILKESBORO, N. C., Nov. 23 (AP)The Senate Subcommittee on Separation of Powers will open hearings early next year on a proposal to make the Justice Department completely independent from the executive branch, the chief counsel to the subcommittee says.

title: JOSE A. JIMENEZ
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 23 (AP) Jose Alfredo Jimenez, composer of more than 400 popular songs in Latin America, died today in a hospital here. He was 47 years old. He had been under treatment for bleeding ulcer.

title: B. G. Rothberg Weds Carol Koerschner
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 23Miss Carol Koerschner was married here this afternoon to Burton G. Rothberg, a professor at the New York University Gradate School of Business and a doctoral candidate at the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration. The Rev. Kimball Kehoe performed the ceremony in the Appleton Chapel of Harvard University.

title: Agnew's Lawyers Submit Arguments Against Disbarment
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 23 (UPI)  Former Vice president Spiro T. Agnew's lawyers argued today that his plea of no contest to a charge of income tax evasion was not grounds for disciplinary action, such as disbarment.

title: Miss Zemlansky Wed To Robert Macauley
description: CLIFTON,. N. J., Nov. 23In the Athenia Reformed Church here this evening Miss Naomi Zemlansky, daughter of Peter Zemlansky and the late Mrs. Zemlansky, was married to Robert George Macauley, a widower, of Bloomfield. The Rev. Douglas A. Haak, pastor of Grace Lutheran Church in Forest Hills; Queens, New York, performed the ceremony.

title: Students Revolt
description: Because Of preoccupation with Watergate, the Middle East crisis and the energy emergency, Americans so far have paid scant attention to the recent student revolt Thailand. However, the swift overthrow of an apparently wellestablished military triumvirate in Bangkok already is having repercussions elsewhere and it could have important implications for United States policy.

title: OilAllocation Aide In U.S. Office Here Is Deluged by Calls
description: A cluster of drab green rooms that used to house the Navy Recruiting Service at 252 Seventh Avenue is now the regional office of the Federal Office of Petroleum Allocation, and the telephones ring there constantly.

title: A Skylab Gyroscope Fails, Leaving Only 2 for Control
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)A control gyroscope failed aboard the Skylab space station today and officials said the loss of another one could force the 84day Skylab 3 mission to be shortened.

title: Miss Seyffer Has Nuptials
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., Nov. 23 Miss Louise Seyffer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Wieland Seyffer, was married here this afternoon to Carlton Jeffers Schmidt Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Schmidt of Richmond. The ceremony in the Second Congregational Church was performed by the Rev. Dr. Robert Fred Berkey, professor of religion, at Mount Holyoke College. The Rev. Dr. Ronald E. Wallen assisted.

title: Senate Clause Is Used to Prod NATO on Troop Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A littlepublicized amendment to the recently passed military procurement bill is proving to be an irritant to America's NATO allies but a boon to United States officials pressing for an increased European contribution to the alliance.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURE SHOW PRICE RISE
description: The price of soybean futures for December delivery was pushed up yesterday by the 20centabushel daily limit. Contracts on the Chicago Board of Trade closed at $6.29 a bushel.

title: WILMURT BURR LINKER
description: ISLIP, L. I., Nov. 23Wilmurt Burr Linker, a founding partner in 1936 of Delafield, Hope, Linker & Blanc, a New York law firm, died today in Southside Hospital, Bayshore, He was 71 years old and lived at 58 Elder Road.

title: Fined on Sleeping Bag Ads
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 23 (UPI)A Syracuse, N.Y., sleeping bag manufacturer has paid $2,500 in civil penalties for false and misleading advertising concerning the water repellency end size of its bags, the California Department of Consumer Affairs reported today. The department said it had reached a stipulated agreement with GladdingRanger, Inc., after the filing of a complaint based on laboratory tests.

title: Dave Anderson
description: The other day, two of the Midwest's most conscientious Sports editors, Pat Harmon of the Cincinnati Post and Wayne Fuson of the Indianapolis News, were discussing their Heisman Trophy ballots.

title: Empire: DoItYourself College
description: When Jim Zink decided to resume his quest for a bachelor's degree after being away from college long enough to marry and have three children, he wanted to find a way of becoming a student again with the least disruption to his job and family life.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: The price of soybean futures for December delivery was pushed up yesterday by the 20centabushel daily limit. Contracts on the Chicago Board of Trade closed at $6.29 a bushel.

title: PRESIDENT ASKED TO MEET ON FARE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Administration officials remained adamant today against any Federal subsidies to operate masstransit systems, as Governor Rockefeller and Mayorelect Abraham A. Beame requested a meeting next week with President Nixon to seek such funds to save the 35cent rare in New York City.

title: I.C.C. Approves a Merger Of Southern and Norfolk
description: The Southern Railway received approval yesterday from the Interstate Commerce Corn mission to merge the 624mile Norfolk Southern Railway into its giant 10,000mile system.

title: Greenwich Rebuffs Xerox On Plan for Office Campus
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 23 The Greenwich Planning and Zoning Commission has rejected a controversial proposal by the Xerox Corporation to build a 104acre headquarters campus in the rural back country of this rich commuter town, it was announced today.

title: Boom Boom Room and the Role of Women
description: Q. Do you intend Chrissy as a metaphor for women generally?

title: Vietnam down Has Air of the Frontier West
description: GIA NGHIA, South Vietnam, Nov. 9  This quiet  perhaps too quiet for some peopleprovincial capital in the Annamite Mountains has the look of a Hollywoodstyle frontier town in the American Southwest. The town consists of a few thousand yards of low white buildings set in a rectangle, open at one end, around a large dusty square.

title: Elderly Couple Die in Fire
description: ANDOVER, Mass., No. 23 (AP)An elderly couple were killed early yesterday morning in a fire, at their twostory home, but their 62yearold daughter was saved by the police. The victims were identified as Carl E. Elander, 89, and his wife Anna, 90. Rescued was May E. Elander.

title: Blankets and Wraps Sought For 272,000 Jewish Poor
description: In response to the energy crisis, the Metropolitan New York Coordinating Council on Jewish Poverty yesterday announced an emergency campaign to provide sweaters and blankets for 272,000 Jewish poor.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Holiday Gas 82 Cents a Gallon

title: Mad Scientist Hunted In German Poison Scare
description: BONN, West Germany, Nov. 23 (Reuters)  Cautious Germans shopped for bottled water today as the police searched for a mad scientist who has threatened to poison the nation unless he is bought off.

title: Senate May Stall Approval Of Jahos for a Judgeship
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 23The planed nomination of Evan W. Jahos, director of the New Jersey Division of Criminal Justice, for a Superior Court judgeship may not be acted on by the Senate, political leaders said tonight.

title: WATERGATE INQUIRY IS COSTING MILLIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)  The Government has appropriated $4.8million so far to investigate the Watergate scandal and may spend twice that.

title: Soviet Sets Deal for U.S.Built Factory
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23The Soviet Union signed a contract today with two United States companies for the construction of a petrochemical complex valued at more than $100millionits first outright purchase of a complete plant from American industry since the current detente began.

title: MARGARET E. PRICE
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 23, (AP)Margaret E. Price, a designer of children's toys, writer of novels, illustrator of children's books and painter, died Tuesday at the age of 84.

title: U.A.W. REACHES PACT WITH CATERPILLAR
description: PEORIA, Ill., Nov. 23 (AP) The Caterpillar Tractor Company and striking members of the United Auto Workers have reached tentative agreement on a threeyear national contract, but local disputes remain unresolved in three cities.

title: Money Talks Reported
description: Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz was reliably reported to be meeting secretly in France with financial officials from Britain, France, West Germany and Japan. The subject of their meeting was not known. Details on Page 43.

title: Mrs. Schilling Married
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Nov. 23 Mrs. Gail Commette Schilling and Dr. Richard Houston McShane of Denver, a surgeon at the University of Colorado Medical Center, were married here this afternoon by the Rev. William Roeger at Christ Episcopal Church: The couple's previous mairiages ended in divorce. Their parents are Mr. and Mrs. Albert Sheehan Commette of Middletown and Mr. and Mrs. J. Russell McShane of. Montclair.

title: Responsibility for What?
description: In his Disney World news conference, President Nixon said: I recognize that because of mistakes that were made, and I must take responsibility for those mistakes, whether in the campaign or in the course of an Administration, that there are those who wonder whether this Republic can survive.

title: Soviet Sets Deal for U.S.Built Factory
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23The Soviet Union signed a contract today with two United States companies for the construction of a petrochemical complex valued at more than $100millionits first outright purchase of a complete plant from American industry since the current dtente began.

title: 200 Start Fight on Homosexual Myths
description: In a collective as well as an individual effort to publicly come out of the closet, more than 200 homosexual faculty members and graduate students met yesterday to discuss methods of using their professional abilities to combat the myths of homosexuality.

title: People in Sports: Rodgers Foils Skeptics
description: When Johnny Rodgers, 1972 Reisman Trophy winner and San Diego's No. 1 draft pick, spurned the Chargers in order to play football in Canada there were some skeptics who said the 5foot, 9inch, 170pound, all purpose wingback from Nebraska might be too small to play in the pros anywhere. Rodgers has been proving them wrong all year, but capped it yesterday by being named the Canadian Football League's rookie of the year.

title: Queens Judge Submits Analysis Of 24 Illegal Narcotic Sentences
description: State Supreme Court Justice Charles Margett has provided the State Select Committee on Crime with an analysis of 24 cases in which people convicted of narcotic felonies were illegally set free in 1971 with sentences of conditional or unconditional discharge.

title: Notes on People
description: After two centuries of Congressmen giving birth to ideas and legislation and suchlike, Representative Yvonne Braithwaite Burke yesterday became the first member of Congress to give birth to a baby. The California Democrat, who is 40 years old, set the precedent at Queen of Angels Hospital in Los Angeles at 3:55 P.M. with the arrival of a 7pound, 9ounce daughter, Autumn Roxanne. Mrs. Burke, whose husband, William, is a healthcare consultant, took the course of many working motherstobe. She was granted maternity leave by her boss, Carl Albert, Speaker of the House.

title: MRS. ISADORE J. LOWE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 Mrs. Etta B. Lowe, widow of Isadore J. Lowe, lawyer, author, Biblical scholar and lecturer, died yesterday of circulatory complications at the George Washington University Hospital. She was 79 years old.

title: Nets End Spell in Denver
description: DENVER, Nov. 27  The New York Nets no longer regard Denver Arena as a snake pit following tonight's 12886 success over the Rockets in an American Basketball Association game.

title: British Bank Cuts $100Million In U.S. Groups' Lines of Credit
description: LONDON, Nov. 23The National Westminster Bank, which is suing for recovery of debts following the collapse of the United States National Bank of San Diego, has eliminated or reduced credit lines with other United States banks totaling more than $100million.

title: New Ambulances Here To Offer Treatment Aid
description: A new kind of ambulance that is built for treatment as well as for transportation, will start service in the city early next year.

title: Heath Twichell, 77, Dies; Alcan Highway Engineer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Heath Twichell, a retired Army colonel who just before World War II commanded the 95th Engineer Regiment, which built part of the Alcan Highway linking Alaska to the Pacific Northwest, died Tuesday at the Veterans Administration Hospital. He was 77 years old and had lived at Cove Point Beach, Md., since his retirement in 1954, following service since his graduation from the United States Military Academy in 1918.

title: POLITICS IN HIRING CONCEDED BY G.S.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 The General Services Administration has abolished a special referral unit that circumvented United States Civil Service Commission regulations by hiring some personnel because of their political influence rather than merit.

title: MAN IS WOUNDED ON IRT PLATFORM
description: A man who the police say is an unemployed drug addict was shot in the stomach yesterday iby an unknown assailant as he !waited to board an IRT train at Lenox Avenue and 135th Street.

title: Connors, Drysdale, Okker Gain at South African Net
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 23 (AP)Cliff Drysdale of South Africa, Tom Okker of the Netherlands and Jimmy Connors of Belleville, Ill., won the quarterfinal matches today in the South African open tennis tournament.

title: Judge Details Illegal Drug Sentences
description: State to Supreme Court Justice Charles Margett has provided the State Select Committee on Crime with an analysis of 24 cases in which people convicted of narcotic felonies were illegally set free in 1971 with sentences of conditional or unconditional discharge.

title: U. S. Finishes Plea on Vesco; Defense to Seek Dismissal
description: NASSAU, The Bahamas, Nov. 23 (UPI)Attorneys for Robert L. Vesco worked today on a motion for dismissal to be presented at a Bahamian hearing into a United States request for extradition of the financier.

title: NAN SUNDERLAND, ACTRESS, IS DEAD
description: Nan Sunderland, actress and widow of Walter Huston, who appeared opposite him in Elmer the Great and Dodsworth and who played Desdemona to his Othello in 1937, died yesterday at her home, 60 Sutton Place South.

title: Rationing of a Heating Oil Is Predicted
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., Nov. 24 (AP)The Government will soon announce a rationing system for a widely used heating oil, cutting residential usage by 15 per cent from last year and industrial usage by 10 per cent, an official of the New England Institute said.

title: Xavier Sets Back Toledo by 3531
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 23 (AP) Bill Howe intercepted a Toledo pass to blunt a late drive and preserve a 3531 victory for Xavier of Ohio today.

title: NO CLUES UNEARTHED IN 2 YESHIVA BLAZES
description: Chief Fire Marshal Edwin H. Sheppard said that investigation into two fires at the Sephardic Yeshiva for Advanced Learning last Wednesday afternoon and early Thursday morning had failed so far to produce any evidence that the fires had been set illegally.

title: Homesick For France, They Open Charcuterie
description: Two Frenchmen homesick for the foods of their childhood have endowed New York with a charcuterie.

title: JOHN MORRIS HINCKS
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., Nov. 22John Morris Hincks, chairman and former president of the Middlesex Insurance Company of Middletown, died today at his home here, He was 75 years old.

title: Jersey Symphony Members Take 2d Jobs To Make Ends Meet After Big Wage Cut
description: MILLBURN, Nov. 23Some of the musicians are teaching, others are looking for club dates and one has given up an apartment and gone back to live with her parents.

title: New Union Is Organizing East's Migrant Workers
description: VINELAND, Nov. 23 Leaders and supporters of a new labor union for migrant farm workers held a strategy session here this week, outlining plans to organize the Puerto Ricans and others who pick New Jersey's crops.

title: Dissident Warns Against Hope Of a Liberalized Soviet Society
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23A Soviet dissident has warned the United States not to expect its improving relations with the Soviet Union to promote liberalization here, asserting that the Stalin regime was at its most repressive after Washington had opened diplomatic ties with Moscow in the nineteenthirties.

title: Rates Show Gains On Money Market
description: Several key money market rates were higher in the week ended Nov. 21, according to Federal Reserve data released yesterday by the Federal Resery Bank of New York.

title: International Plane Fares Up 6% to Meet Fuel Cost
description: Airlines flying international routes announced agreement yesterday on a 6 per cent fare increase, starting Jan. 1, to meet the recent drastic increases in fuel costs.

title: Heroes and for Traitors in Northern Ireland
description: LONDON, Nov. 23Paddy Devlin is a big, shaggy, intransigent man who has battled these past years for his hardpressed constituents in Belfast's Lower Falls district. He organized street demonstrations and rent strikes, and once he was jailed. In the House of Commons yesterday another Irish battler, Bernadette McAliskey  she was Bernadette Devlin before she was married, but she is no relation to Paddy Devlinrose to denounce him.

title: A BOMB IS FOUND IN BUS TERMINAL
description: An explosive and incendiary bomb that the police said could have killed anyone within a few yards was discovered yesterday in a Port Authority Bus Terminal baggage locker, only a few hours before it was set to go off.

title: Easy Slate Gives Hope To Rangers
description: Now is the time for sunshine to come to the aid of the New York Rangers so that they can make hay. A month of sunshine, to be precise, in which they can pick up points in the standing of the East Division of the National Hockey League.

title: FRANCIS T. MURPHY, EXASSEMBLYMAN, 77
description: Francis T. Murphy, a lawyer and Democratic party political figure here for half a century, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, at St. Barnabas Hospital in the Bronx. He was 77 years old and lived in the Bronx.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Tired of all that African art and looking for something bit different in the primitive line? A visit to Oceanic Primitive Arts might be worthwhile.

title: Saigon Air Raid Reported Against Communist Base
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, Nov. 24 (AP)Waves of South Vietnamese fighterbombers attacked a Communist air base at Katum, 70 miles northwest of Saigon near the Cambodian border, military sources said today.

title: Beame Cites Importance of Deputy Post
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that his Deputy Mayor for Community Affairs would be dealing with many important city functions and that he would be overseeing the operations of many city agencies and reporting directly to the Mayor.

title: ALGERIA SAYS PRESS EXAGGERATES ON OIL
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 23The Algerian Government has charged that Western news outlets have been exaggerating the impact of the Arab oil embargo in order to create a blackgold psychosis and to accuse the Arabs of all the evils of the earth.

title: Latin Leftists Suspected In Killing of Ford Official
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, Nov. 23 (AP)Police officials suspect that the assassination of a United States businessman, John A. Swint, and two of his bodyguards by a band of youths was the work of the leftist People's Revolutionary Army. But they have no proof.

title: Utica MayorElect Guarded by Police After Phone Threats
description: UTICA, N. Y., Nov. 23 Mayorelect Edward A. Hanna and five Councilmen who voted to reject a new police contract giving beginning policemen a salary increase of 16 per cent over the next two years have been placed under police surveillance to protect them from harassment.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: New York952073

title: Women's Lib In China
description: PEKINGBefore the Maoist revolution the role of Chinese women was markedly inferior to that of men. Con??ucius more or less set the pattern when he wrote: Only women and lowclass men are hard to keep. If allowed to approach you, they show no respect; if kept at a distance, they complain.

title: Prison Inmate Slain
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Nov. 23 (UN)  A San Quentin inmate was stabbed and killed yesterday as he stood in a chow line. It was the seventh fatal knifing at the prison this year. He was identified as Thomas Gregory, 34 years old, who was serving a term of five years to life for robbery, escape and assault.

title: Trudeau's Fuel Pro gram Is Ridiculed by Opposition
description: OTTAWA, Nov, 23 Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's emergency program for the conservation of oil and gasoline was ridiculed and attacked in the House of Commons today, but the opposition leaders indicated that they would not try to block it.

title: Police Catch a Cruiser After East River Chase
description: City and federal lawmen using two boats, a helicopter and four cars, yesterday overtook a 35foot cabin cruiser in the East River that they suspected of carrying contraband.

title: Rabbinical Group Seeks to Allay Fears of AniSemitic Backlash
description: The Rabbinical Council of America, prominent Orthdox body declared yesterday that fears that the energy crisis and the Middle East oil embargo could cause an antiSemitic backlash were overdrawn.

title: DAYAN iS OPPOSED TO YIELDING LAND VITAL TO SECURITY
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23  Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said today that he did not share the optimism generated by the talks between Egyptian and Israeli generals on carrying out the sixpoint ceasefire agreement.

title: AMEX STOCKS UP; OTC ISSUES OFF
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday in light postholiday volume, as many traders took a fourday weekend. Prices in the overthecounter market declined.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Arabs Gather in Algiers And Signs of Rifts Appear
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 23Signs of divisions on such key questions as the future of the Palestinian refugees and the effects of the new oil policy appeared here today as Arab foreign ministers and other notables arrived to work out the agenda for the summit conference that is to begin here Monday.

title: Curfew Eased in Athens
description: ATHENS, Nov. 23Life in Athens drifted back to a seminormal state tonight as the country's military leadership decided to reduce the curfew to allow people to stay out pntil 1 A.M. instead of 10 P.M. Traffic resumes at 5 A.M.

title: Botswana, at 7, Begins to Reap Success
description: GABORONE, BotswanaBotswana may be the only country in the world that doesn't have a barber, but the new beauty shop in Gaborone will cut men's hair after 5 P.M. on Mondays. And, seven years after independence, the country finally has a dentist.

title: Hughes Has Some of the Answers for the Giants
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 23 Pat Hughes spends the offseason working for a New York brokerage house or answering pertinent questions about the misfortunes of the New York Giants from inquisitive and sharp kids, as a member of the club's speakers bureau.

title: To Fight Fuel Crisis
description: Sitting around thinking up ways to save energy and maybe some money? Well, you could wrap up the house in plastic like the Alfred Paulys did in Belle Plain, Minn. All it took them was $5.60 worth of plasticplain, clear plastic that you see in the supermarket. Tenfoot rolls. That made it 10 degrees warmer inside but a little harder to get outside with the front door wrapped. We used the hack one, Mrs. Pauly said.

title: Kerz Quits City Health Post
description: The New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation has announced the formal resignation of Paul Kerz, 32 years old, as senior vice president, finance, effective Nov, 30. Mr. Kertz, who joined the corporation in June, 1970, as director of program analysis, is giving up his $48,000ayear post to take an unspecified management position with the General Instruments Corporation.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: CorrugatedBox Business Makes 86YearOld Run
description: At the age of 86, Sam Kipnis is one businessman who has not slowed down.

title: Miss Ryan Is Bride Of Army Captain
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 23  Miss Donnita Blanch Ryan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald J. Ryan of East Williston, was married here this afternoon to Capt. Henry Sayward Whittier Jr., U.S.A., son of Mrs. Robert L. Allcott of Middlebury, Vt., and Mr. Whittier, professor of English at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia. The Rev. Gerard Murphy performed the Roman Catholic ceremony in the St. Ignatius Retreat House.

title: Infant Kidnapped By Mother in Fear Of Hospital Rules
description: A night of intensive detective work led to the return of an 11monthold baby to St. Luke's Hospital yesterday. The child's mother who had given a false name and address when the baby was admitted, had removed him against city regulations.

title: Debutante Dinners Precede Junior Assembly at the Plaza
description: Thanksgiving week can still be a busy time for the debutantes who choose to spend the holiday in the metropolitan area. With the Junior League and Gotham Balls out of the way, it was the Juhior Assembly's turn last night to take over the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza.

title: The Tenant on Ocean Avenue
description: ORANGEBURG, S.C.Ocean Avenue (not its real name), is really a lane. It is narrow, paved, with no sidewalks or curbing. Ocean Avenue in Orangeburg, S.C., is situated between the main shopping district and the pride of Orangeburg the beautiful Edisto Gardens which are down by the Edisto River.

title: Preparing for Scarcity
description: In view of the heavy burden that has been placed on American taxpayers in the past to support extravagant and often misdirected farm subsidies and the huge Federallyheld surpluses they produced, it is easy to sympathize with the efforts of Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz to reduce government intervention in the free farm market, both domestically and internationally.

title: Firemen Save Dog on L.I.
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I., Nov. 23 (AP)Three volunteer firemen rescued and revived a German shepherd dog overcome by smoke last night after fire broke out in the home of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Osmer. Mr. Osmer said he has urged that the volunteer, Robert Oliejnik, James Fickorelli and John McMahon, receive the Humane Society Medal.

title: In SoHo
description: SoHothat lively district of art galleries and artist's lofts south of Houston Street is more than a thriving art community. It is also a state of mind that seems to attract all of the strange, perverse or unlikely experiments that occur nowadays in the visual artsthe way a magnet attracts metal filings.

title: 2 Shows Display Work of Hans Richter
description: The career of Hans Richter recalls us to a legendary era in the history of modern art. Born in Berlin in 1888, he was an early convert to the avantgarde, ardently embracing the expressionist, cubist and futurist movements as they made their initial appearances on the European art scene. In 1916, Mr. Richter was one of the small band of rebels who launched the dada movement in Zurich as a protest again World War I, and something of the dada spirit has remained with him to the present day.

title: 160F OEM1 PLANTS MAKING IG AUTOS TO SHUT FOR WEEK
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23  In what was seen here as a major outgrowth of the energy crisis, General Motors announced today that it planned to close down operations during the work week beginning Dec. 17 at 16 assembly plants where standardsize and intermediatesize cars are produced.

title: POLICE ATTACKED IN AIDING WOMAN
description: The Hartford police said that three of their men were attacked by an angry crowd early yesterday morning as they were giving emergency treatment to a woman who had suffered heart attack. The crowd apparently thought the policemen were heating the woman.

title: Brooke Says He Still Feels
description: I BOSTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)Senator Edward Brooke of Massachusetts, the first Republican Senator to call for the President's resignation, says nothing has happened to change his mind.

title: Top Cairo Editor Urges Nuclear Arms for Arabs
description: CAIRO, Nov. 23The editor of Egypt's semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram stressed today that the Arab world needed to build, buy or borrow nuclear weapons as a deterrent to any use of such weapons by Israel.

title: Pollution Free Use of Refuse as Fuel Tested
description: GOLDEN, Colo., Nov. 23  It was a typical pile of Denver garbage an old phone book, half a brassiere, a broken plastic toy truck, a few potato peels, newspapers, cardboard, junk mail, shrub trimmings, one glove and so on.

title: ARAB AIDE OUTLINES OPTIONS ON OIL CUTS
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 23 (Reuters)The Saudi Arabian Oil Minister, Sheik Ahmed Zaki alYamani, discussed the Arabs' alternatives in using their oil weaponincluding the possibility of further cuts in productionin talks with Foreign Minister K. B. Andersen of Denmark today.

title: TRACY MYGATT DIES; LED WAR RESISTERS
description: Tracy D. Mygatt, who had been a cofounder with Frances Witherspoon in 1923 of the War Resisters League, died Thursday. She was 88 years old and had been living in a nursing home in Philadelphia.

title: Ramon Guthrie Memorial
description: HANOVER, N.H., Nov. 23A memorial service for Dr. Ramon Guthrie, the poet, professor emeritus of French at Dartmouth College, painter, novelist and translator, will be held at Rollins Chapel on the Dartmouth campus next Thursday at 4 P.M. Dr. Guthrie died yesterday at the age of 77.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on U.S. railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17.1 billion tonmiles, 7 per cent above the corresponding week last year. Carloadings in the latest week totaled 554,540 cars, 3.6. per cent above, last year. The intercity track tonnage report will not be available this week because of the Thanksgiving Day holiday.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on conference report on bill authorizing construction of Alaskan pipeline, which passed 80 to 5, Nov. 13.

title: Information Can Be Read by a Laser
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23The RCA Corporation has developed a method of storing data in crystals the size of sugar cubes, out of which the information can be read by rotation in a laser beam, such as photographic slides in a projector. Patent 3,773,400 was granted this week to David L. Staebler of the technical staff at RCA Laboratories in Princeton. N. J., and Juan J. Amodei, formerly on the staff.

title: Art: Echoes of Ottoman Empire
description: The Metropolitan Museum's latest offering, The Art of Imperial Turkey and Its European Echoes, is a sort of puzzler, beginning with an admirably clear, chastely elegant installation of opulent objects going back as far as the 16th century and winding up with a Matisse odalisque. For such a range, it's rather a small show, and for so small a show it has an extremely hazy focus. But since there is not a single uninteresting object in the lot, maybe you don't need a focus. You can just go and look, without worrying too much about being edified.

title: Plane Runs Off Runway
description: LOUISVILLE. Ky., Nov. 24 (AP)A DC9 airliner ran off the end of the runway at Louisville's Standiford Field today. Officials said damage to the airplane was minor and no iniuries were reported. The cause of the accident was not known.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 250 bookstores to 110 communities of the United States. The figures in the righthand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: Equine Cotillion Marks a Birthday
description: WEST ORANGEA graceful musical cotillion on horseback preceded the Brooklyn Riding Club's gala Thanksgiving dinner  dance last week, an event that marked the group's 25th year. Founded at the turn of the century, the club disbanded for a few years, then regrouped in 1948.

title: Charlotte La Rue Wed to J. Isaacs
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 24Miss Charlotte LaRue, a city planner, was married here this afternoon to Jonathan L. Isaacs, a senior management consultant with the Boston Consulting Group of Boston.

title: Furs for everybody
description: Furs have become a way of winter life for women of every age, income bracket and fashion persuasion. After all, mink isn't the only fur in the forest (or on the ranch). There are jackets of inexpensive pelts to toss on over pants, coats of fox pieces to dress up or down depending on taste, and of course lavish fox for the woman of means.

title: A New Career Beckons Young Mexican Women
description: MANZANILLO, MexicoWhile it may well be another generation before the tiny, wrinkled, shawldraped Mexican women can stop their weary selling and begging up and down Mexico's dusty roads, a new kind of Mexican career woman is traveling the same roads these days.

title: Wine Prices Reported Down In France After Big Harvest
description: PARIS, Nov. 24 (UPI)Despite inflation, the price of wine is dropping as a result of a nearrecord harvest, perhaps the best in a century, the newspaper FranceSoir said this week.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the author's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of coinparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Gem of a saltbox
description: Grouped around the green and scattered along the quiet country roads of Guilford, Conn., are some 200 houses that were standing in Colonial days. Only two other New England towns, Salem, Mass., and Newport, R. I., have more habitable houses dating from the period. This old saltbox, built in 1710, was passed down from generation to generation in the same family until the nineteenthirties, when it was sold. The new owners started to restore it and the present owners, who bought the house in 1959, have completed the job. Fortunately, they say, the house never suffered from too much prosperity. All those lean years helped preserve the original hearths, floorboards, beams and other details that might have been swept away in a modernization. Today, the house holds a collection of country furniture, antique cooking utensils, coverlets and courting mirrors, chests and chairs that the owners have assembled in the 30 years of their marriage. They have watched attitudes toward restoration change over the years. Each generation has become more purist, they report. Our parents' generation cleaned and stripped everything away, believing that the old wood must be shown. The present generation is more educated. They seek to preserve the old paint and decoration. And the upcoming generation replaces and restores the paint and decorationsbut in the old way, with the old methods and the original materials.

title: KISSINGER IS SAID TO CITE TAP ON HIM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 Secretary of State Kissinger has said privately that he is virtually certain his telephone was tapped at some point since, he joined the Nixon Administration in early 1969, according to a former White House associate.

title: READERS POLLED OVER PRESS BIAS
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 24 (AP) About 75 per cent of 800 newspaper readers queried in a survey believe offers of favors to newsmen in exchange for good press coverage come from politicians, according to a University of Michigan journalism professor.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Increasing concern by investors that the spreading energy crisis could result in a recession sent stock prices sharply lower last week in active trading.

title: Consortium BankingA New Breed
description: LONDONThe announcement here not long ago of the formation of a new foreign bank would not by itself have caused much of a stir since some 275 such institutions already compete, directly Or indirectly, in the City's compact banking arena.

title: Welfare Clients Working When They Can
description: A popular myththat people collect welfare to shirk employmentcame into question last week as the result of an exhaustive survey that found that 40 per cent of the families on welfare in New York City had some member working and used public assistance to supplerunt that income in order to survive.

title: Newark Academy: '29 vs. '73
description: LIVINGSTON  IN 1929, the headmaster of Newark Academy conducted a monthly reading of report cards before the student body, with the cards arranged from worst to best and the students publicly rewarded accordingly.

title: Oil Leak Starts Pier Fire
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 24 (UPI) Oil leaking from a fuel tank on a pier here caught fire this morning. About 30 firemen and 10 pieces of equipment, inducting a New York City fireboat, fought the fire, which started at 8,35 A.M. at a fueloil tank of the Dock and Barge Company. It was brought under control about 40 minutes later.

title: Rookie Astronaut Sees Chance in Space Shuttle
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 24 (AP)He sits in a padded swivel chair confronted by winking lights and flicking digital clocks, a rookie who never got a mission, the Mission Control console his closest approach to space.

title: Nets Turn Back Stars by 119113
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 24  Julius Erving scored 38 points as the New York Nets ended a twogame road trip by defeating the Utah Stars, 119113, tonight at the Salt Palace.

title: Individual Consumption Of Meat at 6Year Low
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 24 (ReutersAmericans are expected to eat an average 180.3 pounds of meat this year, the lowest amount in six years, according to David Stroud, president of the United Slates National Livestock and Meat Board.

title: Breakthrough in Ulster
description: Is it peace at last for Northern Ireland? British Minister William Whitelaw, who engineered the historic agreement under which Protestants and Catholics will share governing power over the province for the first time, wisely prefers to speak of a start and a good start, and to warn of a very long way to go before one can be sure that this effort will succeed.

title: An espresso cheesecake
description: Machiavelli would have appreciated the subtlety of this cheesecake, rich with ricotta and heavy cream, flavored with espresso coffee and set in a crust of graham crackers and amaretti crumbs. Amaretti are those mushroomcap shaped, rather crisp Italian macaroons made of sugar, apricot kernels and egg whites. The result is extremely elegant and could be served in the late afternoon with cups of steaming espresso (and possibly a liqueur) or as an artful windup to a dinner party. Amaretti are not cheap, but neither are they hideously expensive. A onepound tin, which contains 36 little packages of cookies, costs about $3.50. They are available at Bloomingdale's and Altman's delicacies departments and at most Italian stores.

title: She Finds Roller Derby And Marriage Do Mix
description: To Roller Derby fans, Judi McGuire is a starnot in the splashy, Hollywood tradition, but in a homey Middle America sort of way. She's the girlnextdoor at 33 years old, a happily married wife and mother who spends five days a week whizzing round a banked oval track dodging elbow jabs, hip blocks and hairpulling fingers. She gets flowers and marriage proposals from male fans, earns about $50,000 a year and plans to retire at 35. I haven't regretted a minute of it, said the 5foot, 114pound star of the New York Chiefs, but I'm really looking forward to retiring.

title: John Hayes Jr. Weds Linda Fish
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla., Nov. 24  Miss Linda Ann Fish, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Manning Fish of Freeport, Ill., and Delray Beach,. was married here this afternoon to John Bruton Hayes Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Hayes of Manhasset, L. I. The Rev. Frederic F. Bush performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church.

title: MassTransit Parley to Open
description: PRINCETONSenator Harrison A. Williams Jr. and Representative Joseph G. Minish will meet here tomorrow with state and local officials in an effort to develop legislative programs that could bring effective mass transportation to New Jersey.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A spokesman for the Connecticut state police said the troopers would meet Friday to consider a slowdown unless Gov. Thomas J. Meskill approved their request for salary increases to $12,537 from the present top pay of $10,036. Trooper James Cavanaugh, speaking in Hartford for the statepolice chapter of the International Brotherhood Police Officers, said the troopers wanted a threestep increase begun immediately.

title: AT TRUCE TALKS, AN UNCERTAIN AIR
description: KILOMETER 101, on the CairoSuez Road, Nov. 24 EgyptianIsraeli talks on disengaging their forces continued today in a tent at United Nations Checkpoint Delta, ending under a cloud of uncertainty about the future of the discussions.

title: After the Tumult and the Shouting Dies And the Captains and the Kings Depart
description: Kipling's lines from Recessional seem appropriate for the remains of Persepolis, ancient capital of the Persian Empire and, in 1971, the site of a glittering international celebration of the 2,500th anniversary of its founding by Cyrus the Great. Kings, heads of state and other world figures came then for caviar in regal tents at the invitation of the Shah and Empress of Iran. Today the vast ruins of the palaces of Darius and Xerxes and their successors (destroyed by Alexander the Great in 330 B.C.) play host to thousands of tourists, students and schoolchildren. They come, usually by way of nearby Shiraz, to inspect what remains of such structures as the Hadish, the private palace of Xerxes (above), and to examine such details as a soldier's head, a victory symbol (Persia, the lion, attacking its bulllike enemies) and an eagle's head believed to have proved too heavy for the column it was to have graced.

title: The impact of the tube in politics
description: In the long view of history, the impact of television upon our society may well turn out to be more profound than the atomic bomb, the discovery of antibiotics or the exploration of outer space. We are literally bathed in the new medium. It has altered our perceptions of the universe. It has shrunk time and distance and changed our concepts of community.

title: Food Store Official Repays Concern for Gifts to Agnew
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 24 (AP)A Food Fair executive who regularly sent gifts of food to former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew has repaid the company for gifts.

title: Disputes Increase Over Open Land
description: BOONTON  This community of 9,200 people in the northern hills of Morris County is striving to block the use of a 53acre tract for commercial development.

title: Joseph Papp at the ZenithWas It Boom or Bust?
description: IT is November 8, 9:20 P.M. The curtain has just come down on the opening night of Boom Boom Room, David Rabe's sprawls ing new play about a gogo dancer which is initiating the New York Shakespeare Festival's takeover of the Vivian Beaumont Theater in Lincoln Center. Festival producer Joseph Papp stands at the rear of the house. He is resplendent in a blue velvet tux and champing on a cigar as the members of the audience file out, many of them congratulating him on the way.

title: RALPH MALONEY, 46, NOVELIST, IS DEAD
description: Ralph L. Maloney, a writer, died Thursday in St. Vincent's Hospital of a liver ailment. He was 46 years old and lived in East Hampton, L. I.

title: SEVENTH AVE.
description: A sellers' market for almost all types of textiles is expected to complicate the problems of apparel manufacturers next year. Higher fabric prices will force up the cost of finished apparel. This worries manufacturers in light of the expectations of declining consumer demand.

title: The full story of how Amepka got burned and the Russians got bread
description: High over the Volga basin, a gigantic high pressure system stationed itself in early June, 1972, just as the wheat on the collective farms was reaching the middle of a man's calf. As the month wore on, the weather system wound itself up clockwise and began draggles ovendry air off the Kazakh desert and blowing it across the Caspian Sea, into the Volga basin.

title: Energy Staffs Called Few
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (UPI) Representative Michael J. Harrington, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today that he was upset because two key Federal agencies dealing with the energy crisis were inadequately staffed. Mr. Harrington said the White House's Office of Energy Policy and the Interior Department's Office of Energy Conservation were staffed by only nine and ten professionals, respectively.

title: Point of View
description: The Nixon Administration's policy of New Federalism has set off a strange sort of debate. The Administration argues for decentralized decisionmaking, and some local officials object to Federal abdication of the responsibility to set national priorities and goals. In the following articles, adapted from speeches given at the recent conference of the American Institute of Planners in Atlanta, the debate is joined as it applies to housing policy.

title: O'Neill
description: Had Freud never existed, O'Neill would have had to invent him

title: If books about him continue, he will rank with Christ, Napoleon and Wagner
