Confident that Joe Namath's idolators would pack the park at any hour in any weather to welcome the noted sex symbol back to Shea Stadium, they waited until the sun was down, rain was pouring and floodlights were blazing before starting the match between the New York Jets and Atlanta Falcons. It was the most glaring example of overconfidence thus far this season.

title: PROSECUTOR CHECKS UNION GIFT TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) Investigators for the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, are looking into a $100,000 gift from the Seafarers' International Union of North America to President Nixon's reelection committee, Time magazine reported today.

title: Greek Pilot Defects to Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 25A Greek Air Force pilot landed today at an airport in the southeast Italian city of Brindisi and asked for political asylum, according to reports reaching Rome. The police said that the pilot, Lieut. Col. Dimitrios Zelios, 39 years old had defected after hearing of the military coup in Athens.

title: ARCTIC PEOPLE MEET AND ASK RIGHTS BILL
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 25The first Arctic peoples' conference ended here today with a call for recognition of the rights of minority races.

title: King Constantine Defers Commenting on the Coup
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 (AP)Constantine, the deposed King of Greece, declined today to comment on the overthrow of the Government of George Papodopoulos pending a study of the events surrounding the coup d'tat, according to a spokesman.

title: MADRID MAY ASK DEFENSE TREATY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The Spanish Government is expected by Defense Department officials to demand a security treaty with the United States as the price for renewing American military base rights in Spain.

title: EDWARD T. SANDERS
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 25Edward T. Sanders, executive secretary of the late Thomas W. Lamont, chairman of the board of J. P. Morgan & Co., Inc., died here yesterday. He was 82 years old and lived at 397 White Oak Shade Road.

title: Con Edison Presses Conversion to Coal At Two Plants Here
description: In the hope and expectation that a city ruling will be overturned, the Consolidated Edison Company disclosed yesterday that it was going ahead with the conversion of two generating plans from oil to coal.

title: Architecture's 5 Make Their Ideas Felt
description: These are days of great pressure on the architectural profession. The idea of traditional, highstyled building is under attack from students who see as irrelevant to social concerns and avantgardists who see it as technologically backward. On top of that, such problems as the state of the economy and materials shortages make traditional design all the harder. Against this background, it is all the more amazing that the talk of the New York architectural world today centers largely around a group of five architects who have rejected the notion of orchitecture as a social tool, rejected prefabrication, rejected the fads of computer design, megastructures and other bits of super technology, and, instead have concentrated their efforts on what is perhaps the most traditionaland elevatedarchitectural problem of all: the making of form.

title: 31 Triumph in Jersey
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 25 The parking lot was muddy (but it cost only 50 cents a car), the phonograph for the national anthem didn't work and chicken wire instead of Plexiglas surrounded the rink.

title: By Any Standards It Was a Doggone Good Birthday Party
description: In many ways, it was just like any other birthday party for a pampered 9yearold from Fifth Avenue: Paper hats, gourmet goodies, fancily wrapped presents from Bonwit's and Blonmingdale's. This birthday boy, however, happened to be a dog. A black schipperke named Fellow, to be more exact. And since Fellow is not exactly the paragon of canine health, his mistress, Mrs. Michele Bertotti, a divorced art collector, decided that this birthday should be special, sort of a night to remember.

title: Knicks Routed
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Nov. 25The rollercoaster ride the New York Knicks were taking in the early stages of the National Basketball Association season took a sudden, violent dip tonight.

title: Planetarium Aids Rock Band's Debut
description: The Hayden Planetarium is normally given to more or less sober descriptions of the heavens at its home on Central Park West and 81st Street. But last night planetarium officials ventured downtown to the Academy of Music on 14th Street and into the slightly scruffy world of rock V roll.

title: Symington to Have Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP)  Senator Stuart Symington, Democrat of Missouri, announced today he would undergo prostate surgery at Washington Hospital Center tomorrow.

title: Sunday Sales and Holiday Lights to
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 President Nixon told the American people tonight that he would take a variety of actions to reduce consumption of energy, including a cutback in home heating oil deliveries and a 15 per cent reduction in gasoline production that is sure to cause shortages.

title: White House Lifts Ban On Women in Pants
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)The energy crisis has forced the White House to relax its dress code. Pantsuits are in.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HASHBVIOTO, Japan, Nov. 25 (AP) Al Geiberger of Santa Barbara, Calif., won the individual title today in the United StatesJapan golf tournament with a threeround, total of 218, but the Japanese took the team honors by 17 strokes.

title: The Arab World: Fighting Instills a New Confidence
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21The Israeli Defense Minister, Moshe Dayan, telephoned Hafez alAssad, the Syrian President, just after the Arabs' armies attacked Israel on Oct. 6, according to a fable making the rounds of Arab capitals, and the following dialogue ensued:

title: Constane Talmadge, 73, Dead; A Film Star of the Silent Era
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 25 Constance Talmadge, a film star of the silent era, died Friday in California Hospital here, according to friends. She was 73 years old, the widow of Walter M. Giblin, a New York stockbroker, who died in 1964.

title: Advertising: Regulation Efforts
description: Both Canada and the United States have advertising selfregulation machinery The difference is that most Canadians know they do.

title: NEW FINANCE CHIEF IS NAMED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25Premier Kakuei Tanaka today appointed Takeo Fukuda, his leading political rival and economic critic, to the vital post of Minister of Finance, signaling a change in Japanese economic policy.

title: Sluggish Growth Is Seen For Economy Next Year
description: With inflation and energy shortages looming as major threats, the economy can look forward to sluggish growth in 1974, The Conference Board said over the weekend.

title: Theater: Brustein Spoofs Watergate With Revue
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 25in Watergate he spoofed? Can you tickle a funnybone that has already been pinned in a hammerlock? Will Robert Brustein fall on his face?

title: NATHANIEL KEITH, A HOUSING EXPERT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Nathaniel S. Keith, first director of the Federal urban renewal program, died yesterday at the National Institutes of Health. He was 66 years old.

title: About New York
description: Spread Lots of Cheer, the sign on the side of the bus said. It showed some Christmas wrappings and tickets, and it was an advertisement for the lottery. Mingling venality and sentiment, it was one way of announcing that the holiday season was on the city, while another was the great number of people who came down on the department stores in the two days after Thanksgiving.

title: New Greek President
description: ATHENS, Nov. 25  Last month, President George Papadopoulos sought to oust the chief of the First Army, the most powerful branch of the Greek armed forces.

title: ISRAEL WILL JOIN THREE ARAB FOES IN PEACE PARLEY
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 25Israel accepted today an American proposal that she attend peace talks with Egypt, Syria and Jordan on Dec. 18.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The police in Brooklyn early yesterday freed two 15yearold girls held captive for four hours in the M.V. Paint and Hardware Store, 1592 Broadway, in the BedfordStuyvesant section, by an employe, 28yearold Matthew Ballard of 440 Chauncy Street, who was arrested and charged with kidnapping and raping one of the two girls repeatedly, the police said.

title: Michigan Steams as Ohio State Wins Bowl Vote
description: Ohio State was voted into the Rose Bowl by the Big Ten athletic directors yesterday and Bo Schembechler, Michigan's football coach, reacted quickly and bitterly, accusing these conference administrators of being guided by petty jealotisies.

title: Personal Finance: 19YearOlds' Insurance Woes
description: Every year for the last few years Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Greater New York, as well as Blue CrossBlue Shield organizations in other states, have been trying to get across the message to its subscribers that if they have youngsters who will reach their 19thbirthday, they may be headed for trouble.

title: The Tapes Devalued
description: Disclosure yesterday that an eighteenminute segment of one of the subpoenaed White House tapes has been erasedwhether inadvertently or notraises the gravest questions about usefulness of the tapes as evidence.

title: SHOP TALK
description: When Peter Blodgett traveled to Europe recently he was amazed to find jewelers there doing fine work in nonprecious metals. He says he saw things he never dreamed of and that now he, too, is designing jewelry for its dramatic impact rather than the monetary worth of the materials.

title: Philadelphia Is Victor by 2016 On Rushing Game, Ball Control
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 25Don't make fun of the Philadelphia Eagles any more. The New York Giants learned that today when they lost, 2016, at Veterans Stadium.

title: Father of Nine Is Slain
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25 (AP)The shooting of a father of nine children was Boston's 117th homicide of the yearequaling the previous record for a full year in the city. Melvin Cook, 32 years old was shot six times last night, the police said.

title: Architecture's 5 Make Their Ideas Felt
description: These are days of great pressure on the architectural profession. The idea of traditional, highstyled building is under attack from students who see it as irrelevant to social concerns and avantgardists who see it as technologically backward. On top of that, such problems as the state of the economy and materials shortages make traditional design all the harder. Againstthis background, it is all the more amazing that the talk of the New York architectural world today centers largely around a group of five architects who have rejected the notion of architecture as a social tool, rejected prefabrication, rejected the fads of computer design, megastructures and other bits of super technology, and, instead have concentrated their efforts on what is perhaps the most traditionaland elevatedarchitectural problem of all: the making of form.

title: Heart Research Has Key To Sudden Fatal Attacks
description: BOSTON, Nov. 25Psychol??gists and cardiologists working with dogs at the Harvard School of Public Health have inked Pavlovian methods and American technology to unlock the secret of why so many people die suddenly.

title: MICRONESIA GRANT IS UPHELD BY O.E.O.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Alvin J. Arnett, director of the Office of Economic Opportunity, overrode last week a veto of a $600,000 grant for the Micronesian Legal Services Corporation by the trust territory's High Commissioner.

title: Customers Are Warned To Read All Warranties
description: NEWARK, Nov. 25The Consumers League of New Jersey, a nonprofit, volunteer organization affiliated with the National Consumers League, has warned consumers to read contracts, guarantees and warrantees carefully, especially those involving large sums of money. The league recommends a 24hour period of study and discussion for contracts, especially with another person, before signing.

title: Gulf Oil Denies a Report Of Major Find Off Africa
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 25 (AP) The Gulf Oil Corporation denied today that it had made a major new oilfield discovery off the west coast of Africa. The Sunday Observer of London said in current editions that Gulf had made a discovery that company officials were calling a new kuwait.

title: Washington: An Upsurge of the Arts
description: WASHINGTONThe capital, transformed in many ways since the last generation, is also experiencing a rapid expansion of the arts. New galleries are blossoming; new museums and theaters are opening; new performing groups are setting up; older ones, such as the National Symphony, are taking on more prestige. And the number of on  the  scene painters, poets and playwrights is increasing.

title: Cars, for Inconvenience' Sake
description: Now, as in its glorious past, the automobile business overshadows American industrial life. In the 1920's, auto production dominated national economic growth, where auto factories seemed part of the greatest industrial machine in the history of the world, and the Italian car designer Pininfarina found Detroit an earthly Paradise, the color of smoky grey. Automobiles, in the 1920's and 1930's, were the most romantic of all products, and traffic jams an emblem of prosperity. When I grew up in New Jersey, a modern Ford dealer laments, the automobile was the one product that universally signified success in America. What has happened on the way to Paradise?

title: U.S. Reported to Have Known Coup Was Imminent in Athens
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25The Nixon Administration had considerable forewarning of the coup d'tat that replaced George Papadopoulos with Lieut. Gen. Phaidon Gizikis, United States officials said today.

title: Events of Six Years Under the Colonels
description: Six years and seven months ago the tanks of Col. George Papadopoulos first rolled through Constitution Square, taking positions around the royal palace in the heart of Athens and setting up the rule of the colonels.

title: MOLLY WOOD
description: Molly Wood, a former dancer in the Ballet Russe de Monte Carlo, died yesterday of a heart attack at her home, 26 East 81st Street, Her age was 63.

title: Miss Maddox Has Nuptials
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 25Miss Rebecca Maddox and Andrew Steven Nerve were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Callahn Maddox, by Rabbi James A. Rosenberg of Temple Israel in Boston. Mr. Nerve is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Morton I. Narva of Boston and Laconia, N.H.

title: A FRENCH PARTY REELECTS CHIEF
description: PARIS, Nov. 25The Radical Socialist party today reelected JeanJacques ServanSchreiber as its president, just after he had announced his intention to resign and not to run for the post again.

title: Pilot of Homemade Plane Killed in Florida Crash
description: ORMOND BEACH, Fla,, Nov. 25 (AP)  A small homemade plane crashed on the Oceanside Country Club golf course here today, killing the pilot and narrowly missing several golfers, the police said.

title: (But One Buick Is Beautiful)
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y.I have long been among the most vociferous critics of the shoddy products offered to the American public. Smoking toasters, leaking washing machines and ineffective vacuum cleaners are facts of life.

title: OIL AND FIGHTING SWAYED AFRICANS
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 25The Organization of African Unity suffered through near suicidal wrangling in the spring in Addis Ababa, Ethopia, when Libyan delegates attacked some black African countries for maintaining diplomatic relations with Israel.

title: 11 Acting Couples Join Hands, Talents To Give Montclair TheaterinResidence
description: MONTCLAIR, Nov. 25After working together for six months in Europe, developing an ensemble through workshops, professional group of actors, directors and designers has taken up residence in a Baptist church in Montclair to present quality plays and attempt to build an audience for them.

title: PIERRE DUCLOS
description: PARIS, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Pierre Duclos, a composer, died here today. The nature of his illness was not disclosed. He was 44 years old.

title: Transcript of Nixon's Address
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's address last night regarding the energy crisis, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: A Future President?
description: After announcing that the Senate Rules Committee had unanimously approved the nomination of Rep. Gerald R. Ford as Vice President, Senator Cannon, the committee chairman, was asked by reporters whether he still thought the group was recommending the next President. I think that's a very strong likelihood, he replied.

title: LEO E. HONORE
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Nov. 25Leo E. Honore, retired president of the New York Gravure Corporation and a former New Jersey Commander of the American Legion, died here yesterday. His age was 83.

title: Chilean Troops Assault Swedish Envoy
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 25The Swedish Ambassador and 11 four embassy secretaries were beaten up today by Chilean troops and nolicemen who were trying to take custody of Uruguayan woman who had sought political asylum.

title: Bridge:
description: When the choice lies between a play to drop a singleton king and a finesse, the odds favoring the finesse increase as the total suit length decreases. If only two cards are missing, the king will be a singleton slightly more than half the time. But if five cards are missing, the chance of singleton king is less than one in 16.

title: California Is Still Seeking Spree of Lettuce Pollutant
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Nov. 25 (UPI)The state Air Pollution Research Center is attempting to pin down the cause of widespread damage to lettuce and other leafy crops in four Southern California counties.

title: Music: Shades and Fires of Flamenco
description: The flourishes of flamencoguitar praying in their more or less natural state were heard at Tully Hall on Saturday night in Francisco Espinosa's recital there.

title: Breitel Names a Panel of Eight To Find a Courts Administrator
description: ALBANY, Nov. 25Associate Judge Charles D. Breitel of the Court of Appeals, who will take over as chief judge on Jan. 1, today appointed a committee of eight former judges and lawyers to recruit a new administrator for the state's court system.

title: U.S. Victor By 6 Shots In Cup Golf
Dismissed Aide to Get Unemployment Benefits
description: For three years, Bernard Goodman worked with poor tenants who lived near him in Manhattan's Chelsea neighborhood as a $130aweek community aide for the Legal Aid Society. But in June, he was discharged, touching off a legal struggle he finally won last week.

title: TOP ARAB CHIEFS STRESSING UNITY
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 25 Arab heads of state ranging from Saudi Arabia's conservative King Faisal to Syria's radical President, Hafez alAssad declared feelings of unity today as they gathered for tomorrow's summit meeting.

title: Sunday Sales and Holiday Lights to Be Forbidden
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25President Nixon told the American people tonight that he would take a variety of actions to reduce consumption of energy, including a cutback in home heating oil deliveries and a 15 per cent reduction in gasoline production that is sure to cause shortages.

title: New Orders for Machine Tools Posted Gain of 12% in October
description: Net new, machine tool orders booked during October totaled $258.9million, up 12 per cent from the September level and 183 per cent over the level of October, 1972, the National Machine Tool Builders Association reported yesterday.

title: POSITION TENSE ON SOVIET ENERGY
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin reports that the Soviet Union is in an incomparably more favorable position for energy supplies than Western powers but its situation is nonetheless still tense. The statement represents the first recent highlevel public acknowledgement of energy difficulties from the Soviet leadership.

title: 2 L. I. Policemen A re Wounded In Gunfight in a Darkened Store
description: Two Suffolk County police officers were wounded late last night in gunfire that erupted as they searched for burglars in a darkened department store in Lindenhurst, L. I.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MOUNTAIN LAKES, Nov: 25Highlighted by two achievements that were unsurpassed in New Jersey High School football this year, Mountain Lakes High has completed the first undefeated, untied and almost uriscoredupon season in the school's history.

title: Soviet Diplomacy: Waiting Game as Pendulum Swings Away From Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25At the height of the Middle East war, the Soviet Union seemed to have gained considerable influence from the conflict. But now, Western diplomats believe, the pendulum has swung away from Moscow, leaving the Russians feeling a bit let down.

title: Strategy Described as a Disaster by City's Official
description: President Nixon's plan for dealing with the nation's energy crisis was described by New York City's top energy official last night as shortsighted and inadequate, on the ground that it did not include rationing of fuel oil and gasoline.

title: ELECTRICAL UNION REACHES G.M. PACT
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26 (AP) Negotiators for about 34,000 electrical workers reached a tentative contract agreement with the General Motors Corporation today, averting a threatened strike.

title: 19 Food Outlets Here Are Cited A 2d Time for Health Violations
description: The Health Department has cited 19 more restaurants and other foodhandling businesses for healthcode violations found upon a second inspection, and it warned that a third inspection could result in :closing orders unless the violations were corrected.

title: WELFARE RENT UP IN PRIVATE UNITS
description: The average rent for a family of four on welfare in private housing in the city shot up 14.3 per cent in the last year to $126.08 a month as of last September  double the rate of rise for all families.

title: Tractor Workers Return
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 26 (Reuters) Most of the 33,000 employes of the Caterpillar Tractor Company, which makes farm and other heavy equipment in Illinois and four other states, returned to work today after an 11day strike, A new agreement between the company and the United Automobile Workers provides for a wage increase of 3 per cent a year for three wars plus an extra 4 cents an hour in, the first year and bin its on mandatory overtime.

title: Israelis Accuse the Japanese Of Yielding to Arab Threats
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 26  Israel accused Japan today of surrendering to Arab threats in calling for an Israeli withdrawal from all Arab areas occupied in the war of 1967.

title: The Less Oleaginous Life
description: There are three ways of living with the oil shortage. One is the Government's way. It boils down to chins up, stiff upper lip, mittens in the bedroom, allinthisthingtogether, sacrifice for the good cause, London can take it, and all that.

title: The Arab World: Israel Revising Estimate of Foe
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 26From frontline soldiers to Government ministers, the Israelis as a nation are viewing their Arab neighbors in a new light in the wake of the October war.

title: State MentalHealth Projects Slowed
description: ALBANY, Nov. 26 Eight years after Governor Rockefeller announced an ambitious $500million program for contruction of mentalhygiene facilities, only 23 of 40 projects have been completed or are under construction, and the cost exceeds the original estimate for the entire 40 projects, an auditing agency for the State, Legislature said today.

title: Nets Cut Ollie Taylor
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 26 (AP)  The New York Nets placed Ollie Taylor, a guard, on waivers today and agreed to terms with another backcourtman, Rich Rinaldi. Taylor appeared in just eight games for the Nets this season. Rinaldi, from St. Peter's of Jersey City, was cut by the Capital Bullets of the N.B.A. earlier this season.

title: Jonathan Eldridge Dead at 64; Won Medal for His Role in Radio
description: Jonathan Eldridge, a retired ITT World Communications executive who had operated the marine coastal station WSL near Southampton, L.I., known to Atlantic mariners as Amagansett Radio, died Saturday in Falmouth (Mass.) Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived in Chatham, Mass., his birthplace, after retiring in 1970.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: PICKETS TO PRESS ROMAPO PROTEST
description: MAHWAH, Nov. 26Representatives of 250 Educational Opportunity Fund students at Ramapo State College here say they will picket the 300acre campus beginning early tomorrow morning and continue to picket until the administration negotiates a list of 15 or more demands including additional financial aid, the discharge of 10 racist teachers and free transportation to the sprawling campus in northern Bergen County.

title: TV Announcers Brighten 49er Victory
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 26 In a game made necessary by a television commitment and made noteworthy only by Bruce Gossett's two field goals, the San Francisco 49ers defeated the Green Bay Packers, 206, at Candlestick Park tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: ADVANCING PAUL NEWMAN. By Eleanor Bergstein. 373 pages. Viking. $7.95.

title: Union Leader Views Layoff at G.M. As Just the Beginning of Shutdowns
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 26 A United Auto Workers union leader said today 'that he had told workers that next month's layoff may be just the beginning.

title: Jaworski Office Criticized By White House on Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The White House raised publicly today its first criticism of the Watergate special prosecutor force since Leon Jaworski replaced Archibald Cox as its director. In an irritated but very, measured way, Gerald L. Warren, the Deputy Presidential press secretary, cited two instances that he said might be called leaks to the press from Mr. Jaworski's office.

title: Ford Affirms His Support Of Israel at U.J.A :Dinner
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Nov. 26  Representative Gerald R. Ford affirmed his support of the State of Israel at a dinner tonight, while at the same time giving 3,000 Long Islanders a chance to view the Vice Presidentdesignate.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Workers' Buying Power Increased

title: Secret Money Talks Draw Protests
description: PARIS, Nov. 26The secret weekend meetings of top financial officials of the United States, Britain, France, West Germany and Japan brought a formal diplomatic protest today from Italy and generated disquiet in financial markets.

title: Economists Assert 1974 Jobless Rate May Go Up to 6%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26A rise in unemployment next year is almost universally predicted by private, economic forecasters, but only partly because of the energy shortage.

title: Reduction in Skiing Seen
description: SANTE FE, N.M., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Several operators of New Mexico ski areas said today they expected to see a big drop in their weekend business this winter as a result of President Nixon's ban on Sunday gasoline sales.

title: BURGER ASKS CURB ON TRIAL LAWYERS NOT FULLY TRAINED
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger called last night for radical revision of American legal practice that could bar threequarters or more of the 375,000 lawyers in the country from appearing in court at all.

title: L.I. MAN IS KILLED BY POLICE IN SIEGE
description: A 23yearold man with a record of arrests for burglary and larceny was found shot to death yesterday by the police who beseiged a Long Island department store with shotguns and tear gas after two of their colleagues were wounded.

title: Most Service Stations Expected To Close Voluntarily on Sundays
description: Most service station operators throughout the country are expected to lock up their gasoline pumps on Sundays, although some say that the closings will mean 10 to 30 per cent less money in their cash registers.

title: Israeli Teachers Told To Discuss Land Return
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 26 (AP)Iklieli teachers have been told to prepare their pupils for the eventuality that some or most of the territories captured in 1967 may have to be given back to the Arabs.

title: Nixon Says the Energy Crisis Is Temporary and Will Probably Last About a Year
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26President Nixon predicted today that the energy crisis in the United States would probably not last for much more than a year if international developments were favorable.

title: 44% IN POLL BELIEVE NIXON VIOLATED LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI)  A Harris poll released today indicated that 44 per cent of Americans believe that when the Watergate investigation is completed, President Nixon will be found to have violated the law.

title: Advertising: Love Affair Ending
description: Soft drinks are a fun thing and the advertising for them reflects that fact. But a retail market in excess of $7billion is nothing to joke about and the people involved in marketing soda pop in all its wonderous forms reflect that fact. For them fun is serious.

title: WOMEN'S BANK SETS TRUST COMPANY PLAN
description: The First Women's Bank and Trust Company filed last Friday a notice of intention to organize a trust company, the New York State Banking Department's weekly bulletin disclosed yesterday.

title: Santa Comes Early on Clinchfield Railroad
description: ELKHORN CITY, Ky., Nov. 24Once again, Christmas came early today for the children of this small mining community and the others along the 93mile route of the Clinchfield Railroad's Santa Claus Special, an engaging combination of public relations and warmheartedness that has become a tradition in these hills and hollows.

title: Croup Formed in Newark To Save Historic Edifices
description: NEWARK, Nov. 26  The formation of the Newark Preservation and Landmark Committee, a group to save and promote the city's remaining historic buildings, was announced at Plume House, 407 Broad Street, today. A growing number of cities, including Trenton and Jersey City, have taken similar measures.

title: Denison Mines Sets $800Million Sale Of Uranium Oxide
description: TORONTO, Nov. 26 (Canadian PressDenison Mines, Ltd., announced today an agreement for the sale of $800million worth of uranium oxide to Tokyo Electric Power Company. Inc., of Japan. Delivery will be at the rate of four million pounds a year from 1984 to 1993, for a total of 40 million pounds.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: ST, ALBANS WINS A U.S. REPRIEVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The House Appropriations Committee directed today that St. Albans Naval Hospital, which the Defense Department ordered closed last April as part of a nationwide economy program, be kept in operation as a military installation.

title: Attacks in an East Flatbush School Spur Demand for Police Protection
description: About 150 teachers and parents of pupils demonstrated outside Public School 219 in the East Flatbush section of Brooklyn yesterday in an appeal for increased police security.

title: BREZHNEV ARRIVES IN INDIA FOR TALKS
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 26  Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, was exuberantly welcomed to New Delhi today to begin talks on the shape of Moscow's relationship with India.

title: ASSEMBLY ADOPTS CURB ON DUMPING
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26The Assembly gave final approval today to a bill that would enable the State Commissioner of Environmental Protection to ban the dumping in New Jersey of solid or liquid waste collected outside the state.

title: People and Business
description: Edward N. Cole, president of the General Motors Corporation; plans to enter the air freight business when he retires next fall. Mr. Cole will reach G.M.'s mandatory retirement age of 65 in September, 1974.

title: DELAYS OCCURRING IN POSTAL SERVICE
description: The energy crisis has begun to delay the movement of transcontinental mail, particularly between New York and Los Angeles, and the United States Postal Service is concerned that the disruptions may spread widely before Christmas.

title: McGee Says Nixon Will Release Data On Tax Returns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI) President Nixon is going to make public the contents of his income tax returns later this week to clear up the controversy over his deductions once and for all, Senator Gale W. McGee, Democrat of Wyoming, said tonight.

title: FullTime Public Utility Unit Backed by Assembly in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26The Assembly dramatically reversed itself before adjourning this evening by approving a highly controversial Cahill administration measure that would require the three members of the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners to serve full time.

title: Knicks Lose Reed for Week to 10 Days
description: It's been a long, long day, said Coach Red Holzman of the Knicks yesterday just before leaving Madison Square Garden for his home in Cedarhurst, L. I.

title: Pioneer 10 Gets Checkup
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)Scientists gave Pioneer 10 a final rocket thrust and made crucial communications adjustments today in preparation for the space prohe's flyby of the planet Jupiter.

title: ...Choices for New York
description: New York City may be compelled to pay an unconscionably high price in polluted air to meet its energy and transportation needs unless an adequate sense of urgency is shown at all levels of government in instituting less noxious alternatives.

title: Arab Leaders Open Meeting on Strategy
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 26 The conference of Arab heads of state opened today with spokesmen talking exultantly of the Arab oil weapon and its impact on the outside world, but adding notes of caution about its use.

title: Bill to Curb Coal Exports
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP) Representative Ken Hechler, Democrat of West Virginia, today introduced legislation to limit coal exports, which he said now constitute about 10 per cent of the nation's total coal output.

title: Herman N. Liberman Jr. Dies; Walked All Manhattan Streets
description: Herman N. Liberman Jr., who recently completed a sevenyear walking tour of Manhattan, died last night at his home at 1010 Fifth Avenue after a brief illness. He was 62 years old.

title: Prisons Furlough 400; No Roads Lead to Roam
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 26 (UPI) All 400 inmates of Connecticut correctional facilities returned from their Thanksgiving furloughs, Deputy Correction Commissioner Dorin Polvani said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Penn State, which completed a perfect season by beating Pittsburgh, 3513, Saturday, was unanimously named last night as the Lambert Trophy winner. The trophy goes to the top major college football team in the East. It was the third consecutive year that Coach Joe Paterno's team had won the award and the 10th time since it was introduced in 1936.

title: Democratic Liberals Divided on Ford
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Gerald R. Ford encountered both support and opposition from Democratic liberals today as a House committee ended six days of hearings and the Senate opened debate on his nomination for Vice President. The Senate is expected to confirm the nomination tomorrow, while House approval is likely by Dec, 6.

title: City Officer Suspended For Gunfire in Argument
description: A city police officer was arrested and suspended yesterday after he fired his pistol into the ground during an argument with a citizen in a parking lot.

title: Truck Tonnage Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported today that intercity truck tonnage during the week ended Nov. 17 was 5.6 per cent above the yearearlier level. Tonnage was 1.9 per cent above the preceding week. Based on a terminal survey of 35 metropolitan areas, 25 of them reported increased tonnage from a year ago and 20 reported increased tonnage from the prior week.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 1.8% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 24 rose by 1.8 per cent to 2,959,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Woman Found Dead on L.I. Was a Resident of Queens
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 26A woman whose body was found near the Northern State Parkway in Woodbury, L.I., last Monday was identified by the Nassau County police today as Mrs. Frances Goldberg, 33 years old, of 1843 215th Street, Bayside, Queens.

title: Saigon Reports That Its Jets Heavily Bombed 2 Airfields
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 26 (Reuters)  Military sources said today that Government aircraft flew 114 bombing sorties over two Communist airfields Friday  the heaviest raids since the ceasefire agreement last January.

title: JERSEY APPROVES CURB ON DOPING
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26  The Assembly gave final approval today to a bill that would enable the State Commissioner of Environmental Protection to ban the dumping in New Jersey of solid or liquid waste collected outside the state.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Norman D. Archer, a former assistant Queens district attorney whose Federal court conviction on charges of accepting a bribe to quash a criminal case had been overturned by the United States Court of Appeals last July, was indicted yesterday on similar charges by a special state grand jury. The indictment was announced by the state's special anticorruption, prosecutor, Maurice H. Nadjari. He had in effect been asked by a Federal appeals panel to investigate possible state prosecution against Mr. Archer and two associates after the panel determined that the Federal Government had injected itself into a matter of state concert.

title: ENERGY MEN FIND NIXON PLAN WEAK
description: President Nixon is not moving fast enough or far enough to meet the nation's energy problems, according to economists, businessmen and oil industry experts.

title: Business Briefs
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26All 22 people indicted the Equity Funding Corporation of America conspiracy and fraud case pleaded not guilty here today before Federal District Court Judge Jesse W. Curtis.

title: MidMonth New Car Sales Down 4.5%
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26New earl sales, continuing to feel the impact of the energy crisis, totaled an estimated 258,633 units in midNovember, down 4.5 per cent from sales in the same period last year.

title: Arab Hijackers Off Again Alter Freeing 255 at Malta
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Tuesday, Nov. 27Three Arab bijackers aboard a KLM Dutch jumbo jet freed all 247 passengers and eight stewardesses today, took an airline official as a volunteer hostage and left Malta for an undisclosed destination.

title: Clearing Cancer Research Contracts Takes Longer Than Year Ago, U. S. Aide Says
description: BETHESDA, Md., Nov. 26Despite the existence of a law designed to speed and expand the nation's war against cancer, it now takes much longer than it did a year ago to get, a research contract approved, the director of the National Cancer Institute said today.

title: People in Sports: Matthews Is N.L. Top Rookie
description: Gary Matthews, a 23yearold outfielder who batted .300 for the San Francisco Giants last season, yesterday was named the rookie of the year in the National League. Matthews, an outstanding defensive player, collected 11 votes from a 24man commitee of the Baseball Writers Association of America.

title: Bridge: 4 From Neighboring Clubs Victors in a Charity Event
description: Two pairs from neighboring clubs headed the standings in the Sidney Lenz Memorial Charity game earlier this month.

title: PetrolLewis to Buy Oil and Gas Interest From White Shield
description: The PetrolLewis Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed to buy all of the oil and gas properties of certain subsidiaries of the White Shield Corporation for approximately $11million in cash. The producing properties to be acquired include interests in more than 600 oil and gas wells in Oklahoma, West Virginia, Texas, Louisiana, Kansas, Ohio and Canada. Included in the assets to be acquired are a 31mile intrastate natural gas pipeline system in West Virginia and oilfield, equipment and supplies. The completion of the transaction is scheduled for Dec. 31.

title: Honeywell in Polish Deal
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 26 (Reuters)Honeywell, Inc., said today it had reached an agreement with Metronex, a Polish foreign trade enterprise, to manufacture a Honeywell processcontrol instrumentation line near Warsaw.

title: 1$100Million Disneylike Park Planned in Ocean County, N.J.
description: Plans were announced yesterday for converting 1,500 acres in Ocean County, N. J., into a $100million total entertainment center for the Eastern United States that would be similar to, but smaller than, Disneyworld in Florida.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Some of the more talented schoolboys ever to play in New Jersey emerged from the football season that finished last week.

title: CLARENCEP SHEDD OF YALE DIVINITY
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 26Dr. Clarence Prouty Shedd, a faculty member of the Yale Divinity School for 32 years who prepared scores of students for campus ministries, died Saturday at a nursing home here. He was 86 years old.

title: TV: A.B.C. Pursues the Real George Washington
description: At 8 o'clock, the American Broadcasting Company network presents the first installment of The American Heritage, a series of historical dramatizations labeled Bicentennialthemed. The onehour programs are being produced by the Wolper Organization in association with American Heritage Publications.

title: Photos Termed Israeli Evidence of Syrian Atrocities
description: Representative Bella S. Abzug yesterday showed photographs, given to her by Premier Golda Meir, which the Israelis had described as evidence of Syrian atrocities against captured Israeli soldiers at several places on the Golan heights during the Middle East war.

title: Brooklyn Museum Split Over Director
description: The Brooklyn Museum, the seventh largest in the United States and one of the jewels in the city's cultural crown, is being split by factionalism so severe that, according to museum and city officials its effectiveness as a museum of first rank is endangered.

title: Former Justice Whittaker Of Supreme Court Is Dead
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 26 (AP)Former Associate Justice Charles Evans Whittaker of the United States Supreme Court died today in St. Luke's Hospital of a ruptured abdominal aneurism. He was 72 years old.

title: I.B.M. Increasing Prices for Most Of Product Line
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced price increases yesterday on most of its products and services, including its principal product line involving the Model 370 computer:

title: Pamela Howard Wed to Clarkson N. Potter
description: The Chapel of St. James at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Pamela Howard to Clarkson Nott Potter. The bride, who intends to Veep her maiden name, is the daughter of Jack Rohe Howard, president of the ScrippsHoward Newspapers and the ScrippsHoward Broadcasting Company, and the late Mrs. Barbara Balfe Howard.

title: Slower Speeds May Cut Fatalities by 5,000 in 74
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26A Federal safety expert estimated today that the cut in the highway speed limit would reduce traffic fatalities by one per cent, saving 5,000 lives next year if the controls rewined in force.

title: Canada to Set Oil Distribution Priorities
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26The Canadian Government, faced with increasing shortages of heating oil as the long winter begins, announced today that it planned to set priorities for the wholesale distribution of petroleum products, and establish an emergency allocation board to enforce them.

title: Zoo Quarantine Is Lifted
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 26 (AP)A quarantine of 400 animals at Forest Park Zoo here was lifted today. The quarantine was ordered by state officials last January after a virulent strain of tuberculosis was; found in a dead aoudad, a wild African sheep.

title: Canada Placing Controls Over Foreign Investors
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26  After sears of controversy and months of debate, the House of Commons today passed a bill that will impose strict controls for the first time on a broad range of foreign investments in Canada.

title: Chinese Seeking T rade in the Philippines
description: MANILA, Nov. 26An 11man trade mission, the first sent here by the Communist Government in China, discussed expanded trade with the Philip pines in a series of meetings today with President Ferdinand E. Marcos and his top advisers.

title: Utilities in New England Begin FuelSaving Cutback
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 26In an effort to save fuel, the electric power companies in New England today began a 5 per cent voltage reduction to their customers during four hours of peak demand.

title: Bell Decries Tactics Of Falcons' Defense
description: Barring some unexpected development, such as Bob Lee tripping over the 50yard line and breaking his right arm, the Atlanta Falcons will wind up in pro football's playoffs and they'll take with them, according to Eddie Bell, one of the most vicious secondaries in the league.

title: Chesr: It's Neck and Neck and Neck Till Larsen Pulls Ahead
description: The recent Philippines International Tournament, held in Quezon City, featured a hot threeway fight for first prize that saw Bent Larsen of Denmark pull away from Ljubomir Ljubojevic of Yugoslavia and Lubomir Kavalek of the United States to snatch a wellearned victory in the closing rounds.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: MRS. MAURICE RAGSDALE
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Ragsdale, former fiction editor of McCall's magazine, died yesterday at the Royal Marsden Hospital, London. Her age was 58 and she lived at Kingston Hill, Surrey.

title: ECONOMISTS SAY 74 JOBLESS RATE MAY GO UP TO 679
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26A rise in unemployment next year is almost universally predicted by private economic forecasters, but only partly because of the energy shortage.

title: The Auto Shift: II
description: The present troubles of the American automobile industry are not extraordinary in economic history. Earlier industries have faced a long decline in market growth, foreign competition, a continual reproach of public distrust. Other mature businesses were weighted by the policies of a glorious youth: in the case of the auto business, the policies of elaborate and expensive auto selling, of Fordist minutely organized mass production, of costobsessed management attitudes. Yet the auto industry's problems are of peculiar force, at least in their power to affect the national economy. This power, in decline, can be compared most closely to the power of great aging industries of the past, and particularly of the railroads and textile of late Victorian Britain.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 27, 1973
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: SOVIET DISSIDENT IS REPORTED TRIED
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26A dissident Soviet mathematician held incommunicado for 14. months finally went on trial in absentia today and was ordered committed indefinitely to a mental hospital, dissident sources said.

title: Notes on People
description: Gov. Ronald Reagan of California appears to have parlayed a modest charity fundraising trip to Australia into a fullscale taxpayerspaid Presidential trade mission to three Eastern hemisphere countries.

title: Nixon Scientific Aide Foresees More Curbs
description: LONDON, Nov. 26 (UPI)President Nixon's chief scientific adviser said today that more curbs to meet the nation's fuel crisis may be necessary beyond those announced yesterday by the President.

title: 90 at City U. Tenured Under New Rule
description: The Board of Higher Education last night approved the first list of City University faculty members for full tenure under the recently adopted rules requiring special justification for granting tenure to teachers in departments where more than half the faculty are already tenured.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: LawBreaking
description: Rising food costs are already putting unusual pressure on the nation's fish and game resources.

title: Maloney, Michigan Aide, Syracuse Football Coach
description: Syracuse University yesterday named Frank Maloney, an assistant coach at the University of Michigan, to sucteed Floyd (Ben) Schwartzwalder as the head football coach.

title: Arab Leaders Open Meeting on Strategy
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 26 The conference of Arab heads of state opened today with spokesmen talking exultantly of the Arab oil weapon and its impact on the outside world, but adding notes of caution about its use.

title: DOW STOCK INDEX PALLS 29 POINTS
description: Fears that the energy crisis might result in a 1974 recession sent stock prices tumbling yesterday in the biggest singleday break since May 28, 1962, following a confrontation between President Kennedy and the steel industry.

title: PETER ELLER DIES; BUILDER, WAS 83
description: Peter W. Eller, former president of the Thompson Starrett construction company and retired chariman of the board of governors of the Building Trades Employers' Association of the City of New York, died Friday in Montclair, N.J., where he lived. His age was 83.

title: Michigan Coach Assails Big 10 Chief on Bowl Vote
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 26 (UPI) Michigan's football coach, Bo Schembechler, today accused the Big Ten commissioner, Wayne Duke, of influencing the decision to send Ohio State to the Rose Bowl and invited him to explain to his team why it wasn't good enough.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Cougars Turn Back Colonels by 9482
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky., Nov. 26 (AP)The Carolina Cougars, paced by Billy Cunningham, outscored the Kentucky Colonels 25.12 in the fourth period and recorded a 94.82 American Basketball Aisociation victory tonight. Kentucky held a 7069 edge entering the fourth quarter.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: The renewed controversy over saccharin versus cyclamates gasts my flabber. We have a food industry that shoots sugar into our bread, cereals, sausages, hamburger, ketchup, salad dressings and canned goods of all kindsand clamors for the right to shoot lowcalorie sugar substitutes into our desserts.

title: Ashe Bows In Final in So. Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 26 (AP)Jimmy Connors, playing at the peak of his game, upset Arthur Ashe, 64, 76, 63, today for the men's singles title in the South African tennis championships.

title: I.C.C. Hears Argument on U.P.Rock Island Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The Interstate Commerce Commission began 10 hours of oral argument here today on the 10yearold plan by the Union Pacific Railroad to merge with the nearly bankrupt Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific Railroad.

title: GREECE'S LEADERS CONSOLIDATE HOLD
description: ATHENS, Nov. 26The new military rulers of Greece moved to consolidate their power today by purging from the armed forces highranking officers who supported the ousted President, George Papadopoulos.

title: Ashe Bows In Final in So. Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 26 (AP)Jimmy Connors, playing at the peak of his game, upset Arthur Ashe, 64, 76, 63, today for the men's singles title in the South African tennis championships.

title: Soviet Vows Continued Aid To Palestinian Guerrillas
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 (AP)Yasir Arafat and other guerrilla leaders have been told that the Soviet Union would continue to give the Palestinians assistance and support, the official press agency Tass reported today.

title: GRESKO, PIANIST, PLAYS SUPERBLY
description: Why don't we hear more about Richard Gresko? The 31yearold Canadian pianist's appearance Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall left no question but that both his talent and his level of artistic achievement are considerably above ordinary. He rightly took offense at the condition of the hall's piano, and complained about it to the audience before his last programed piece. But such a technicality did not prevent him from giving a thoroughly brilliant recital.

title: Senate Study Cites Sports Drug Abuse
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)A Senate subcommittee has found distressing evidence of drug abuse among athletes, the committee announced today to use drugs would give their competitors an edge.

title: Gas Siphons Sell Fast And So Do Tank Locks
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 26The gasoline shortage is producing a run on New Jersey autoparts stores for locking gas caps and siphons, a random survey indicated today.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The humane thing to do in this season of football desolation in our village is to cast one's glance in another direction. There is no way of pretending that the indignities being heaped on the Giants and the Jets are not happening, but it would be an act of kindness to glance elsewhere. Because the New York gridiron mercenaries are not behaving with proper violence, it even would be refreshing to take a 180degree turn to an area where the most violent gesture of antagonism is to transfix an astigmatic linesman with a look of loathing.

title: Currency Reflow Is Called Healthy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz indicated today that the United States would welcome a decision by European countries to sell dollars from their monetary reserves if necessary to prevent the dollar's value in the foreignexchange markets from rising much above its present level.

title: Mrs. Sulzberger Gets Ochs Ship's Nameplate
description: The nameplate of the Liberty ship Adolph S. Ochs, named after the late publisher of The New York Times, was presented yesterday to his daughter, Mrs. Arthur Hays Sulzberger.

title: Two London Banks Suing On U.S. National's Assets
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 26 (AP)Lawyers for two London banks filed a class action suit in Federal District Court today challenging the sale of certain assets and liabilities of the United States National Bank of San Diego.

title: SWEDEN COMPLAINS TO CHILE ON ASSAULT
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 26 (Reuters)Sweden filed an official protest with the Chilean Gov ernment today after an incident yesterday in which her Ambassador and several embassy officials were beaten by the police in Santiago.

title: Toward Free Elections
description: The Watergate scandals have totally discredited the traditional system of financing political campaigns from private sources. Briefcases stuffed with $100 bills, illegal corporate contributions laundered through foreign intermediaries, and secret slush funds used to finance espionage and buy the silence of witnesses have brought the nation's politics into alarming disrepute.

title: Prime Rate Raised to 9% By Major Chicago Bank
description: The First National Bank of Chicago, the 10th largest commercial bank in the United States, increased yesterday its prime, or base, lending rate from 91/2 per cent to 9% per cent, effective today.

title: MOST PRICES OFF FOR COMMODITIES
description: Virtually all commodity futures contracts were sharply lower yesterday, with the energy crisis and the break in the stock market as the major causes. It is unusual for so many commodity markets to be swept by lack of confidence and by interest in selling out at the same time.

title: Barside Bargains In Airline Holidays Halted by Arrest
description: The call to vacations in Honolulu, Delhi or other farflung places will no longer he answered by those patrons of Manhattan's East Side cafes who for the last three months could buy airlines tickets at half their face value. The end came as a result of an arrest announced yesterday by Bronx District Attorney Mario Merola.

title: Some Supplies for Gardening
description: Opinions about the lighting required for growing plants indoors are exceptionally diverse, but there is basic agreerdent that ordinary fluorescent tubes are satisfactory for growing plants.

title: Jaworski Office Criticized By White House on Leaks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The White House raised publicly today its first criticism of the Watergate special prosecutor force since Leon Jaworski replaced Archibald Cox as its director. In an irritated but very measured way, Gerald L. Warren, the Deputy Presidential press secretary, cited two instances that he said might be called leaks to the press from Mr. Jaworski's office.

title: HOUSE PANEL CUTS DEFENSE BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The House Appropriations Committee, cutting the defense budget by 3 per cent, voted today to slow down the Navy's Trident missile submarine program and to kill a new missile defense system developed by the Army.

title: Viruet Stops Piton
description: Adolfo Viruet of Puerto Rico handed Oscar Piton of Argentina the first defeat of his professional boxing career last night when he scored a thirdround knockout at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum.

title: Nearby Towns Urging Xerox to Move In Following Rejection by Greenwich
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov 26Greenwich, Conn., may not want the Xerox Corporation a neighbor, but other communities in the metropolitan area apparently do.

title: CITY U. PLANNING MIDDLE COLLEGE
description: The City University plans to open an experimental fiveyear middle college by combining the last three years of high school with two years at La Guardia Community College in Long Island City, Queens, beginning next fall.

title: Western Canada Feels East Just Doesn't Understand
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Nov. 17  One of Edmonton's many oil executives was explaining power struggle that has erupted between this rich Western province and the federal Government.

title: FRANK H. BULLEY
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 26 Frank H Bulley, a retired member of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in a Stamford nursing home.

title: EDITH MASON DIES; LEADING SOPRANO
description: Edith Mason, a lyric soprano who sang at the Metropolitan Opera and reigned as a favorite for many seasons at the Chicago Opera, died of a stroke yesterday in San Diego. She was 80 years old and the wife of William E. Ragland.

title: OFFICIAL IDENTIFIES KIDNAPPING SUSPECTS
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 26 (AP) Two of the three men sought in the Nov. 21 kidnaping of a Jonesboro minister's wife and daughter were identified tonight by the State Division of Investigation Director Bill Beardsley.

title: DeSalvo, Confessed Boston Strangler, Found Stabbed to Death in Prison Cell
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27Albert H. DeSalvo, who became known as the Boston Strangler, was found stabbed to death at Walpole State Prison this morning.

title: Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Autopsy Shows Woman Found on S.I. Was Slain
description: The Medical Examiner's office said yesterday that the nude woman whose body was found near the La Tourette Golf Course on Staten Island on Sunday afternoon had been murdered.

title: British Freighter Burns Here
description: Firemen using more than a dozen pieces of equpiment, including a fireboat, worked for more than an hour yesterday to control a smoky fire aboard a small British freighter docked at the North Marine Terminal at 39th Street and the East River. The fire broke out at 9:37 A.M. in cotton stores in a storage locker in the stern section of the 350foot freighter Clement. There were no immediate reports of injuries or serious damage.

title: Coal Mine Permit Sought
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 26 (AP) The Consolidation Coal Campany has asked the Government for permission to resume coal production at its No. 9 Mine at Farmington, W. Va., where 78 miners were killed in an explosion five years ago. A spokesman for the company here confirmed today that a letter was sent Nov. 16 to the administrator of the Mining Enforcement and Safety Administration of the Interior Department, asking for a meeting to discuss the future of our No. 9 mine at Farmington. There has been on response to the request, the spokesman said.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SEASON The first subscription season for a series by professional performers at the Riverside Church, 490 Riverside Drive, at 120th Street (7497000, ext 128), gets under way at 8 tonight. It's the project of the new Theater of the Riverside Church producing unit, which will he giving three plays. The first is Eric Bentley's Are You Now or Have You Ever Been, a documentary play based on the author's book about the testimony of so many people in show business before the House UnAmerican Activities Committee in the nineteenfifties.

title: Laurence Harvey, Screen Actor, Is Dead at 45
description: LONDON, Nov. 26Laurence Harvey, the actor, died of cancer here at his home last night. He was 45 years old.

title: MISS WOODS SAYS SHE CAUSED GAP IN TAPE BY ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26President Nixon's personal secretary testified today that through some terrible mistake she had pressed the wrong button on her tape recorder and thus caused an 18minute gap in one of the subpoenaed Watergate tape recordings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Excerpts From White House Analysis and Executive Privilege Claims for Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26Following are excerpts from the White House analysis and claims of executive privilege for subpoenaed tape recordings, submitted today to United States District Judge John J. Sirica:

title: U.S. Fuel Bureau to Hire 5,500
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 The new Office of Petroleum Allocation, which will administer and enforce the fuel conservation program, expects to employ about 5,500 people to do the job. About 500 of them will be oil industry executives recruited for the purpose, many of whom will receive little compensation.

title: Politics and Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26In his second energy broadcast in 18 days, President Nixon sought last night to reassure the American people that things wouldn't be so bad.

title: Papadopoulos's Fall
description: ATHENS, Nov. 26  Four months ago, President George Papadopoulos went on teleVision and told the Greek people that the 1967 coup that brought him to power had been a model of success in the history of revolutions.

title: Prices Fall on Amex and OTC; NASDAQ List Declines by 3.62
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange plunged yesterday in steppedup trading after rising slightly on Friday. Prices in the overthecounter market were also lower.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: MISS WOODS SAYS SHE CAUSED GAP IN TAPE BY ERROR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26President Nixon's personal secretary testified today that through some terrible mistake she had pressed the wrong button on her tape recorder and thus caused an 18minute gap in one of the subpoenaed Watergate tape Tecordings.

title: U.S. Wine Mislabeled
description: Almaden Vineyards, a major American wine producer, was fined $250,000 for having mislabeled bottles sold to airlines. Details, Page 9.

title: Consumer Group Files Suit To Revise Trucker Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI) A consumer group filed suit today against the Transportation Department, contending that Government regulations allow bus and trucking companies to keep drivers at the wheel long after they are too tired to see straight.

title: Auto Makers Win Ruling on Pollution
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 (AP)  A Federal judge ruled in a decision released today that United States automakers cannot be forced under antitrust laws to provide equitable relief for air pollution damages.

title: Woman Fatally Knifed Here; Injured Friend is Arrested
description: A 23yearold woman was found stabbed to death yesterday in her fourthfloor East Side apartment, and the police said a male friend whose wrists were cut was in the apartment when they arrived.

title: A City Aide Admits ParkingTicket Fix; Will Testify Against Two CoDefendants
description: One of three city officials charged with fixing more than 1,000 parking tickets for a privileged group pleaded guilty yesterday to conspiracy and obstructing governmental administration.

title: In a Surplus Market, Teachers Wait
description: Some years ago when 23yearold Shelley Isaac was making plans for her future, she considered possible careers in teaching, acting and nursing. But she chose teaching, because I wanted security.

title: Panel Tells Pentagon: No More New Cars
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The House Appropriations Committee, in approving the defense budget today, imposed a fuel conservation measure on the Pentagon: No more new passenger cars or station wagons,

title: 9TH SUEZ TALKS; IMPASSE REMAINS
description: KILOMETER 101, on the CairoSuez Road, Nov. 26Egyptian and Israeli generals meeting in a United Nations tent at this checkpoint failed today to break the deadlock between the two countries on the issue of troop withdrawal.

title: Ford Recalls Continentals For Possible Short Circuit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today it was recalling 17,744 currentmodel Lincoln Continentals because of a possible short circuit from an improperly routed starter cable.

title: Brooklyn Museum Split Over Policies of Director
description: The Brooklyn Museum, the seventh largest in the United States and one of the jewels in the city's cultural crown, is being split by factionalism so severe that, according to museum and city officials, its effectiveness as a museum of first rank is endangered.

title: Broncos Are Sky High in Mile High City
description: That the Denver Broncos, so long a synonym for defeat, are a firstplace team in the third from last week of the season is the phenomenon of the year. The Broncos have lost more games since their start in 1960 than any other franchise in the league, 123 of 193 for a .326 winning percentage. And now they are in first place, for a few days at least.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: An unusually large increase of 2 per cent in the purchasing power of factory production workers in the New YorkNorth Jersey area in September was reported yesterday by Herbert Bienstock, the Department of Labor's assistant regional director for labor statistics. The gain, the first in five months, reportedly made up for about half the loss in real net spendable earnings such workers had suffered since September a year ago.

title: BLACKS OPERATING FIRST TV STATION
description: A predominantly black group of residents of the United States Virgin Islands has bought a Virgin Islands has assumed control of a networkaffiliated television station on St. Croix, making it the first major television station owned and operated by blacks on United States territory.

title: Brandt Urges Europeans to Stick Together in Overcoming Shortages of Oil
description: PARIS, Nov. 26Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany told President Pompidou tonight that the members of the European Economic Community must stick together and help one another face the oil crisis or all would suffer.

title: Negotiations, Aided By Mediator, Held In Museum Strike
description: Intensive negotiations were held yesterday in an effort to end the sevenweek strike by employes of the Museum of Modern Art, a walkout that has cut attendance and forced the cancellation of some exhibitions.

title: SLACKS GIVE VIEW ON DEPUTY MAYOR
description: A group of 10 prominent blacks who hope to gain more influence with Abraham D. Beanie's administration in issues affecting the black cornmunity called yesterday for strengthening of the new post of Deputy Mayor for Community Affairs.

title: Stock Prices Plunge 29.05 In Biggest Drop Since 1962
description: Stock prices, plummeted yesterday in their biggest oneday drop since the 1962 market break as the energy crisis raised fears of an economic slowdown next year. Volume was moderate at 19.83 million shares.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Britain's Hawkwind Gives Earthy Rock The Cosmic Touch
description: Not every British rock group can bring officials of the Hayden Planetarium downtown to an American concert debut at the Academy of Music, on 14th Street, as Hawkwind did on Sunday. The Planetarium presented a lecture on the Kohoutek comet: Hawkind introduced flashing lights, back projection film (basically on an Other Worlds theme), a dancer and nearly two hours of their Space Ritual suite.

title: Whalers Defeat Jersey Knights
description: BOSTON, Nov. 26 (UPI)Tom Williams scored a goal and an assist in the second period tonight to give the New England Whalers a 42 victory over the Jersey Knights in a World Hockey Association game.

title: 3 Boys Held in a BreakIn At School in East Harlem
description: Three teenaged boys were being held yesterday on charges of breaking into Intermediate School 93, at First Avenue and 110th Street in East Harlem, and causing considerable damage, the police reported.

title: Energy Gap ...
description: By his own admission, the measures announced by President Nixon Sunday night to deal with a major energy crisis fall substantially short of what will be required to close the widening gap between this country's fuel needs and available supplies.

title: The Arab World: Israel Revising Estimate of Foe
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 26From frontline soldiers to Government ministers, the Israelis as a nation are viewing their Arab neighbors in a new light in the wake of the October war.

title: TV Stations Seek Trade Center Move
description: The TV Broadcasters All Industry Committee, made up of 10 New York City area television stations, has urged the Federal Communications Commission to grant at the earliest possible date permits to relocate their antennas atop the World Trade Center.

title: Sears and BroadwayHale Cite Rise in Net, but Associated Lags
Islander Defense Improves
description: The New York Islanders will face the best of the National Hockey League's West this week at Nassau Coliseum starting with the Atlanta Flames tonight. They will meet the Philadelphia Flyers on Saturday.

title: For DeDe Pierce: Jazz Funeral With 4 Bands
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26As the wake wore on last night, the mourners drifted into the back room at the Blandin Undertaking Company and talked about the funeral music.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SEASON The first subscription season for a series by professional performers at the Riverside Church, 490 Riverside Drive, at 120th Street (7497000, ext 128), gets under way at 8 tonight. It's the project of the new Theater of the Riverside Church producing unit, which will be giving three plays. The first is Eric Bentley's Are You Now or Have You Ever Been, a documentary play based on the author's book about the testimony of so many people in show business before the House UnAmerican Activities Committee in the nineteen fifties.

title: In a Surplus Market, Teachers Wait
description: Some years ago when 23yearold Shelley Isaac was making plans for her future, she considered possible careers in teaching, acting and nursing. But she chose teaching, because I wanted security.

title: Maloney, Michigan Aide, Syracuse Football Coach
description: Syracuse University yesterday named Frank Maloney, an assistant coach at the University of Michigan, to sucteed Floyd (Ben) Schwartzwalder as the head football coach.

title: Senate Watergate Hearings Put Off Until Early '74 to Seek More Evidence
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26No more Senate Watergate hearings are planned until after the first of next year.

title: In New Jersey...
description: The Assembly passed a bill yesterday that would provide up to 45 extra days of thoroughbred horse racing in New Jersey next year. The measure was passed by a 459 vote and was sent to Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: FUNERAL OF LOGAN SET FOR THURSDAY
description: The funeral of Dr, Arthur C. Logan, a prominent surgeon and civic leader who died Sunday in a fall, will be held Thursday at noon in Riverside Church, his family announced yesterday. His body will be on view at the church, on Riverside Drive at 120th Street, tomorrow from 2 to 9 P.M. and Thursday morning from 9 to 11 A.M.

title: Simon's New Play Is a Change of Pace
description: The odd couple of this Broadway season is, undoubtedly, Neil Simon and Anton Chekhov. For Simon it is an affair of the heart  he loves Chekhov. And the extent of his passion will be revealed tonight when The Good Doctor, Simon's 10th play, opens at the O'Neill Theater.

title: Students of 4 Seoul Schools Protest Government Moves
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 26 (AP)Students from four colleges and universities in Seoul demonstrated today against suppressive measures by President Park Chung Hee's Government.

title: Jaynes in Shrine Game
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 26 (UPI)David Jaynes, a Kansas quartrback, headed a list of nine players named today to the West squad for the Dec. 29 EastWest Shrine football game.

title: Church Group Seeks to Bar TV License
description: Should an officer of a racially segregated Mississippi private school be licensed to operate that state's major television station?

title: Ulster Accord Brings Wave of Killings
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 26A new surge of violence has greeted the announcement of a political accord among the dissident factions in Northern Ireland.

title: 2 Agencies Explain End of Drug Inquiry With Link to Vesco
description: Two Federal agencies are developing preliminary answers to the question of whether they halted a narcotics investigation when it led to Robert L. Vesco, the controversial financier.

title: BYRNE HAS PARLEY ON GIANTS SHIFT
description: New Jersey's Governorelect, Brendan T. Byrne, emerged from his first direct exposure to major negotiations over the proposed Hackensack Meadowlands sports complex yesterday with the fate of the $280million project still hanging in the balance.

title: Crabwise Controls
description: Just when the Nixon Administration was looking forward to winding up its increasingly unhappy excursion into wageprice controls, along comes the energy crisisand the need for a host of new restraints on the free market.

title: $100Million Disney WorldType Park Is Being Planned for Ocean County
description: Plans were announced yesterday for converting 1,500 acres in Ocean County, N. J., into a $100million total entertainment center for the Eastern United States that would be similar to, but smaller than, Disney World in Florida.

title: Hornsby Sure He Can Do Giant Linebacker's Job
description: Ron Hornsby's view from the bench is unobstructed these days, which helps him evaluate why the New York Giants were bullied by the Philadelphia Eagles last Sunday.

title: Anderson Stars Off Track, Too
description: Petey Anderson used to be the stickball champion of Yorkville, and now he flatly lays claim to the table tennis doubles championship of the jockey room at Aqueduct, in partnership with Mike Venezia. In making that bold claim yesterday, Anderson was greeted with raucous jeers and derisive hoots by Johnny Ruane and Oswaldo Rogado. But he stood his ground, and repeated his claim, while playing Venezia at bumper pool.

title: EXAMINER MYSTIFIED BY PAGANO'S DEATH
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Nov. 26The Rockland County Medical Examiner said today there were indications to support both suicide and murder theories to the death of James Pagano, 20yearold son of an alleged Mafia member.

title: Widow to Stay in Jail
description: LORDSBURG, N. M., Nov. 26 (UPI)A District Court judge said today that Mrs. Rita Hill, a 71yearold widow, would remain in jail until she agreed to comply with a court order that she not interfere with an Interstate 90 construction project through her ranchland.

title: A.B.C. BLACKS OUT CRIBFIRE SCENE
description: The American Broadcasting Company yesterday bowed to a ruling by an Indiana county judge and agreed to black out a controversial section of a television documentary on flammable materials scheduled to be seen nationwide last night.

title: Fluorescent Lights Can Turn an Apartment Into a Greenhouse
description: It may still bi true, as was claimed in Ecclesiastes, that there is no new thing under the sun, but there is indeed something new under a surrogate for that radiant star. This is the growing of flowerseverything from orchids and geraniums to miniature rosesunder lights. It has been going on in a small, experimental way for good many years, but now the castom is spreading as apartment dwellers are realizing that suburbanites and town house owners are not the only ones who can have gardens. With the proper fluorescent bulbs and some reflectors, plants can thrive in a dark hallway that has never had a ray of sun.

title: Delay in Egypt Pipeline Talks Denied
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 26Negotiations between Egypt and an American financial and engineering group for construction of the SuezMediterranean oil pipeline are proceeding normally in Cairo, according to sources involved in the. talks.

title: U.S. Wine Mislabeled
description: Almaden Vineyards, a major American wine producer, was fined $250,000 for having mislabeled bottles sold to airlines. Details, Page 9.

title: Stage: Chemin de Fer
description: A Feydeau farce is a Feydeau farce and Chemin de Fer, which opened at the Ethel Barrymore last night as the second entry in the New Phoenix repertory, is undoubtedly a Feydeau farce.

title: JAHOS IS BLOCKED IN JUDGESHIP BID
description: TRENTON, Nov. 26 (AP)John R. Fiorino, the Monmouth County Democratic chairman, formally notified Senate President Alfred N. Beadleston today of his opposition to the nomination of Evan W. Jahos for Superior Court judge.

title: CABINET IN BOLIVIA OFFERS RESIGNATION
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 26 (Reuters)The entire Bolivian Cabinet offered its resignation today after President Hugo Banzer Suarez had announced that he would not run in Presidential elections he has called for next year.

title: A Tale Of Two Presidents
description: From interviews with Harry S. Truman recorded ten years ago by Merle Miller and just now being published, the ringing story has emerged of how Mr. Truman put Gen. Douglas MacArthur in his place at their Wake Island meeting in 1950. But there may be more to this story than meets the eye.

title: VINEYARD IS FINED FOR MISLABELING
description: That bottle of Almaden Pinot Noir you drank on your last coasttocoast flight may not have been Pinot Noir at all, according to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: N.H.L. Plans to Teach Chinese Hockey Players
description: Helping China develop a professionalcaliber hockey team is the least Alan Eagleson can do. After all, he said yesterday in a telephone conversation from Toronto, it was the application of Chinese acupuncture that relieved his allergy last weekend.
