Eagleson is the lawyer and executive director of the National Hockey Players Association who played a key role in setting up last year's eightgame series between Team Canada and the Soviet Union's national hockey team.

title: Anderson Stars Off Track, Too
description: Petey Anderson used to be the stickball champion of Yorkville, and now he flatly lays claim to the table tennis doubles championship of the jockey room at Aqueduct, in partnership with Mike Venezia. In making that bold claim yesterday, Anderson was greeted with raucous jeers and derisive hoots by Johnny Ruane and Oswaldo Rogado. But he stood his ground, and repeated his claim, while playing Venezia at bumper pool.

title: Arab Hijackers, on Malta, Begin Freeing Passengers
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Tuesday, Nov. 27Arab hijackers who seized a Dutch jumbo jet Sunday night while flying over the Middle East agreed here last night to release the 247 passengers in exchange for two hostages and a load of fuel.

title: Coast Police Exams Halted
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 26 (UPI)A Federal judge halted today the use of entrance and promotion examinations in the San Francisco Police Department on the ground they discriminate against minorities. District Judge Robert F. Peckham also told the department and the Civil Service Commission to establish two lists for entrants into the department and bring in qualified individuals on a 3to2 basis in favor of minorities to make up at least 30 per cent of the police.

title: Trapped
description: Rarely, if ever, do animals kill for the pleasure of killing or for the pleasure of bedecking themselves with one another's pelts. Only men do that.

title: GREECE'S LEADERS CONSOLIDATE HOLD
description: ATHENS, Nov. 26The new military rulers of Greece moved to consolidate their power today by purging from the armed forces highranking officers who supported the ousted President, George Papadopoulos.

title: DON STOCK INDEX FALLS 29 POINTS
description: Fears that the energy crisis might result in a 1974 recession, sent stock prices tumbling yesterday in the biggest singleday break since May 28, 1962, following a confrontation beween President Kennedy and the steel industry.

title: ARCHER RECITED IN BRIBERY CASE
description: Norman D. Archer, a former assistant Queens district attorney whose Federal conviction on charges of accepting a bribe to, quash a criminal case was overturned by the United States Court of Appeals last July, was indicted yesterday on similar charges by a special state grand jury.

title: Burger Urges Curb On Trial Lawyers Not Fully Trained
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger called last night for a radical revision of American legal practice that could bar threequarters or more of the 375,000 lawyers in the country from appearing in court at all.

title: 2 Agencies Explain End of Drug Inquiry With Link to Vesco
description: Two Federal agencies are developing preliminary answers to the question of whether they halted a narcotics investigation when it led to Robert L. Vesco, the controversial financier.

title: On Key Cambodian Road, More Blood
description: ON ROUTE 4, Cambodia, Nov. 26  It was another bloody, inconclusive day on Route 4.

title: Jet Fuel Cuts Called a Threat to Essential Air Service
description: Airline officials and Government aviation experts asserted yesterday that the latest Federal cutback in jet fuel allocationsa 15 per cent reduction announced Sunday by President Nixonthreatened for the first time to jeopardize essential service at many points in the country.

title: Canada Placing Controls Over Foreign Investors
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26  After years of controversy and months of debate, the House of Commons today passed bill that will impose strict controls for the first time on a broad range of foreign investments in Canada.

title: Officials Here Press Efforts to Cope With the Fuel Shortage
description: Officials in the New York metropolitan area pressed ahead yesterday with the task of coping with the developing energy crisis.

title: HOUSE PANEL AIDS ENERGY RESEARCH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)A $1.4billion catchall money bill, including $52.1million to speed energy research and $21.1million to run mandatory fuel allocation programs, was approved by the House Appropriations Committee today.

title: Jury, Deadlocked on 11 Counts, Acquits ExBuffalo Official on 8
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 26 (AP)A retired superintendent in the Buffalo Streets Sanitation Department has been acquitted on eight counts of a 19count indictment charging conspiracy, grand larceny and filing false instruments. The jury was unable to agree on the remaining 11 counts.

title: ROCKEFELLER TALK DRAWS GUFFAWS
description: Governor Rockefeller heaped praise on Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame at a formal banquet last night and then went jovially on to mangle a prepared speech with wisecracks and asides that brought guffaws from the 1,000 business and civic leaders in his audience.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: South African Game Ranch For Sale

title: HouseSenate Panel Agrees On a D.C. HomeRule Bill,
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) HouseSenate conferees agreed today on a homerule bill for Washington, D.C., that would set aside a national capital enclave but give the rest of the city substantial local government.

title: Basque Separatists Raid Club in Bilbao And Burn It Down
description: BILBAO, Spain, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Six masked Basque separatists armed with submachine guns held more than 100 persons inside a suburban yacht club last night, doused the floor with gasoline and set the building afire, police officials said today.

title: United Air Lines Plans to Lay Off 1,000
description: United Air Lines said yesterday that it was laying off almost 1,000 employes, including 300 pilots, because of flight cutbacks resulting from jetfuel shortages.

title: Foreigners Supplant American Tourists Here
description: The summer of 1973 may well be remembered in tourist circles as the summer of the flipflop, when the mass movement of Americans flocking abroad for vacations reversed itself and a new immigration of European and other foreign businessmen came flooding into New York.

title: Boston, With Two Papers Poles Apart, Shows Journalistic Void
description: BOSTONThere is, sadly, no more Boston Evening Transcript. Nor is there a Boston Advertiser, American, Daily News, Daily Times, Herald, HeraldTraveler, Journal, Pilot, Post Record, RecordAmerican, Traveller or Sunday Courier.

title: Sales of R. H. Macy Up in November
description: November volume showed improvement over the October level at R. H. Macy & Co.'s 68 stoves around the country but did not indicate recovery of any high level of consumer optimism, Donald B. Smiley, chairman, said at the annual meeting here yesterday.

title: Mobil Closing Refinery
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation announced yesterday it was mothballing its 47,000barreladay refinery in East Chicago, Ind.

title: On Moral Turpitude
description: The following excerpted remarks were made in the Senate by Senator Richard M. Nixon on Oct. 8, 1951. The statement concerns a Senate investigation of William M. Boyle, Democratic national chairman, and of Guy G. Gabrielson, Republican national chairman.

title: Manila Charges a U.S. Priest With Acts Against Government
description: MANILA, Nov. 27  An American missionary of the Roman Catholic Maryknoll order, who has worked among Filipino peasants, was charged today with acts against the martiallaw Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: DATA WERE DENIED WIRETAPPED AIDE
description: A former Nixon Administration official has testified that Henry A. Kissinger precluded his access to sensitive national security information three days before the official's telephone was tapped under a secret program that President Nixon has defended as necessary to halt leaks of such information.

title: Election Funding Voted
description: The Senate approved legislation yesterday that would require that public funds, rather than private donations, pay for election campaigns for the Presidency and Congress. Details on Page 48.

title: Inquiry on Impeachment Backed By A.B. A. Chief to Settle Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Chesterfield Smith, president of the American Bar Association, said today that Richard Nixon's continued right to the Presidency should be decided through a Congressional impeachment investigation as the only legal forum that could resolve deep national doubt about his guilt or innocence.

title: Bunker, in Panama, Begins Conference On New Canal Pact
description: PANAMA, Nov. 27 (AP)Ellsworth Bunker, now an Ambassador at Large, began week of conferences today with Panamanian leaders on the possibility of a new Panama Canal treaty.

title: Hanratty Injured Ribs 5 Weeks Ago
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (UPI)A spokesman for the Pittsburgh Steelers disclosed today that No. 2 quarterback, Terry Hanratty, played the last five weeks with two broken ribs.

title: TV: Controversial Fire! Is HardHitting Survey
description: Although it tries occasionally, television is rarely shocking. The American Broadcasting Company accomplished that feat on Monday evening with an A.B.C. News CloseUp called Fire! The shocks were delivered on two entirely different levels.

title: Doctor and Hospital Are Fined $3Million for Needless Surgery
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)A local hospital and a surgeon who admitted performing at least 37 unnecessary, back operations were ordered, today to pay a former patient now dying of cancer $3.7million in damages.

title: E.P.A. ASKS EASING OF EXHAUST LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Environmental Protection Agency recommended today that legal limits on emissions of nitrogen oxides from automobiles be raised to a level five times that decreed by Congress for vehicles produced after 1976.

title: DAYLIGHT SAVING FOR NEXT 2 YEARS IS VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The House voted today to put the nation on yearround daylight saving time for the first time since World War II in move to conserve energy. The tally was 311 to 88. . .

title: U.S. Inquiry Requested On Byrne's 30% Raise
description: GLEN GARDNER, Nov. 27 (AP)A repairman here is asking the Federal Cost of Living Council to investigate the 30 per cent salary increase the Legislature has approved for Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne.

title: Brandt Backs Pompidou on Arms Talks
description: PARIS, Nov. 27Chancellor Willy Brandt and President Pompidou today concluded their third meeting of the year by agreeing that the countries of Western Europe should get together to discuss defense problems.

title: COURT HEARS TAPE WITH BUZZING GAP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27A copy of the tape recording of President Nixon's June 20, 1972, conversation with H. R. Haldemanthe conversation in which Mr. Nixon ordered public relations actions to be taken in the wake of the Watergate breakin three days earlierwas played in Federal District Court here today.

title: Belgium Calls for Israel To Leave Occupied Land
description: PARIS, Nov. 27The Belgian Government, in what appeared to be a reaction to pressure from Arab oil cutbacks, called today for Israel to withdraw from all territories occupied in the 1967 war.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company has won conditional approval to build a $40million office complex on 200 acres in Bedminster Township for the national headquarters of its Long Lines Division. The Planning Board of the township, which is in Somerset County, voted to approve the complex pending compliance with 14 conditions. A spokesman for A.T.&T. said it had agreed to an conditions.

title: SEOUL STUDENTS AND POLICE CLASH
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 27About 500 university students clashed with 200 clubswinging riot policemen here today as several antiGovernment demonstrations were held in various parts of the capital.

title: People and Business
description: William B. Dale, the United States executive director of the International Monetary Fund, has been named to a fiveyear term as deputy managing director of the fund. His appointment was announced yesterday by H. Johannes Witteveen of the Netherlands, who has been managing director since September.

title: 247 on Flights Made Ill
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 27 (UPI)Improperly refrigerated custard prepared by a Lisbon catering concern caused an acute illness that struck 247 passengers on three transAtlantic flights, according to the National Center for Disease Control. The illness, staphylococcal food poisoning, occurred Oct. 10 on two flights originating in Rome and a charter flight originating in Lisbon and terminating In New York, San Juan and Philadelphia.

title: CONTRACTORS FEAR '74 STEEL SHORTAGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Spokesmen for the nation's major contractors, after meeting with steelcompany executives today, warned that a large shortfall in structural steel anticipated for next year would cause economic havoc in the construction industry.

title: LITTON NET UP 16% ON 5.9% SALES RISE
DOW OFF BY 7,22; COAST STOCKS UP
description: Stock prices continued to decline yesterday in what some Wall Streeters  shrouded in gloomhave tagged the energycrisis bear market.

title: PROJECT SANGUINE IS SET BACK AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Navy's controversial Project Sanguine, a billiondollar underground radio transmitting system for sending messages to missile submarines, has received still another setback.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: 33 Are Injured In Two Crashes Of Jet Airliners
description: An Eastern Airlines DC9, unable to stop after landing at the AkronCanton Airport, ran off the end of a runway and crashed last night. At least 24 persons were reported injured.

title: MRS. JAMES K. CRIMMINS
description: Mrs. Irene Lawler Crimmins, wife of James Kershaw Crimmins, a senior partner in the law firm of Chadbourne, Parke, Whiteside & Wolff, died yesterday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. She was 67 years old and lived on Vineyard Lane in Greenwich.

title: OTB, Roosevelt Ready For $3 Double Exacta
description: Despite the security hazards of bigpayoff exotic wagers, Roosevelt Raceway and the Offtrack Betting Corporation hope to introduce a new gimmick next month.

title: Oil Allocation Act Signed As Nixon Ends Opposition
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27President Nixon signed into law today the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act of 1973, a bill his Administration had opposed for many months.

title: Securing the Peace...
description: Israeli Defense Minister Moshe Dayan has raised a serious challenge to efforts to promote a negotiated Middle East peace settlement with his renewed call for retention of substantial portions of the occupied Arab territories.

title: Election Funding Voted
description: The Senate approved legislation yesterday that would require that public funds, rather than private donations, pay for election campaigns for the Presidency and Congress. Details on Page 10.

title: Notes on People
description: The audience pelted Maria Callas with flowers when she made her London comeback, after an eightyear absence, in Royal Festival Hall. Many in the crowd of 3,000 swept toward the stage like teenagers at a rock concert, once the twohour performance was over, and they tried to grab her and they blew kisses at the 50yearold soprano.

title: FUEL IS DIVERTED FOR THE MILITARY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Defense Department, faced with an inability to buy sufficient oil from American producers, has taken the first step in commandeering oil supplies for the armed services.

title: Music: Supple Budapest Symphony
description: What are contemporary Hungarian composers doing? The Budapest Symphony Orchestra, playing in Carnegie Hall on Monday night; provided a partial answer in Andras Szollosy's Musica per orchestra.

title: World Trade Center Removing OneEighth of Those Light Bulbs
description: There are times when I wish we had black drapeson all 87,200 windows, Richard Ehmann, operations manager of the World Trade Center, said wryly yesterday.

title: State Obscenity Law Sustained; New Stay Is Sought on 4 Films
description: The constitutionality of New York State's civil obscenity statute was upheld yesterday in a unanimous opinion of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court.

title: 3 Robbers Wound Dweller In an East Side Apartment
description: Three robbers who invaded an East Side apartment early Yesterday seriously wounded 56yearold man and escaped with an undetermined amount of money and some clothing.

title: $20Billion Energy Program Approved by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The Senate Interior Committee approved today a $20billion research and development program designed to make the United States selfsufficient in energy over the next 10 years.

title: Bucks Halt Braves' Bid, 115 to 110
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 27 (AP)The Milwaukee Bucks withstood 16 straight points by the Buffalo Braves in the second half tonight and got some clutch plays by Lucius Allen in the final minute for a 115110 National Basketball Association victory.

title: Pouring Trouble on Oil
description: It's going to mean dirtier air, no matter how you cut it, said Gerald M. Hensler, the regional director of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, after New York State announced its plan yesterday giving Consolidated Edison permission to burn dirtier fuel during the energy crisis. Mr. Hansler's remark reflects a general agreement among officials that the moreplentiful, dirtier fuel will have to be burned in the face of shortages. But that is where the agreement stops.

title: 4 Police Stations Are Dedicated; Mayor Cites Gain in His Regime
description: Mayor Lindsay dedicated four new police stations yesterday in what, in effect, was his summation of enormous change in police work that has taken place during his eight years.

title: Islanders Turn Back Flames First Time, 42
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 27 Perseverance paid off handsomely for the New York Islanders tonight. Refusing to sit on a onegoal lead with a period to play against Atlanta, the New Yorkers kept the pressure on, scored two more goals and put out the Flames, 42, at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Dance:Carmina Burana
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater's threeweek season got off to a flying start last night with the kind of spectacular production usually associated with a company such as the New York City Opera rather than a moderndance group.

title: Hudson's Bay Co. Gets Tenders For 50% of Markborough Stock
description: The Hudson's Bay Company said yesterday it had received commitments that would permit it to purchase at $19 share more than 50 per cent of all the outstanding shares of Markborough Properties, Ltd., of Toronto and shares issuable under purchase warrants. On Monday, the Hudson's Bay Company, a retailer based in Winnipeg, Manitoba, said it was increasing its offer for Markborough shares to $19 a share from $17.50. This was to counter a revised offer by the Campeau Corporation, an Ottawabased realestate development concern, which is offering to pay $18.50 a share for the Markborough stock. On Monday, before Hudson's Bay raised its offer to $19 a share, Campeau said it had received tenders for about 70 per cent of Markborough's outstanding shares. Markborough is a real estate developer.

title: SOVIET RATIONALE ON VISAS DERIDED
description: MOSCOW, Nov, 27A leading Jewish scientist who was denied permission to emigrate to Israel has challenged the Soviet Union's assertion that its emigration policy is an internal matter.

title: J. W. Mays and Bond Down for Quarter
description: Higher quarterly profits were reported yesterday by three retailersthe F. W. Woolworth Company, the Allied Stores Corporation and Hughes & Hatcher, Inc. Two others, J. W. Mays, Inc., and Bond Industries, Inc., reported declines.

title: A.A.A. Promises Towing
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27 (UPI)Motorists who run out of gasoline on the weekend got encouraging words, with qualifications, today from the American Automobile Association. We will tow people who run out of gas to a safe place, said Lamar Phillips, local manager of the A.A.A, office. He also said 42 local emergency vehicles would assist A.A.A. members. But, Mr. Phillips added: We cannot sell them gasoline. That would be illegal.

title: A.E.C. SEEKS EASING OF URANIUM CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.27 (AP) The Atomic Energy Commission announced today that it wanted to relax and eventually remove restrictions on uranium enrichment, the process which converts natural uranium into Material that can be used as nuclear energy fuel.

title: City Aims at Scofflaws' Credit Ratings
description: The city's Parking Violations Bureau will put into effect today a plan through which holders of millions of dollars worth of Unpaid parking tickets will be hit where the bureau hopes it hurtsin their credit ratings.

title: Benny Goodman Previews Exhibit Here on His Music
description: Benny Goodman, the king of swing during the nineteenthirties and forties, came to New York City yesterday to preview a biographical exhibit and visit with some former musical cronies at the New York Jazz Museum.

title: HIJACKERS ARRIVE IN DUBAI, 6TH STOP
description: DUBAI, Wednesday, Nov. 28 (Reuters)The Dutch jumbo jet that was hijacked by Arabs over Iraq Sunday night landed early today in this Persian Gulf sheikdom, its sixth stop so far. The three hijackers, who had demanded that the Netherlands alter drastically what they called her proIsrael stance, had released all 247 passengers and eight stewardesses in Malta early yesterday after long negotiations.

title: College, School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: County Executives Join Drive for U.S. Transit Aid
description: The state's major County Executives were enlisted yesterday in Governor Rockefeller's drive to reverse Nixon Administration opposition to subsidizing local transit fares.

title: JUDGE CUTS RENTS IN NEWARK STRIKE
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27The presiding judge of the Essex County Court today ordered the rents in the Stella Wright public housing project reduced by 80 per cent because of multiple abuses and said that if they could not be corrected the huge development should be demolished.

title: Mrs. George Brewer, Wife Of State Aide Taught Art
description: CAMBRIDGE, N. Y., Nov. 27 Mrs. Kathryn Young Brewer, a former art teacher and the wife of George E. Brewer, director of Standards and Purchase for New York State, died Saturday at the Mary McClelIan Hospital here. She, was 71 years old and lived in Albany.

title: Not a Great Fool I Hope
description: LONDON  During a visit to the Chinese People's Republic, I started my columns by recalling the advice of Father Teilhard de Chardin to a Shanghai friend: Write about China before you have been there too long; later you would break your pen. Now, having broken my typewriter, I can add another quotation, this time from an old Chinese sage, Chuang Tzu: He who vvows that he is a fool is not a great ??ol.

title: Delta Is Expanding Airline Operations In New Office Here
description: Delta Air Lines yesterday, announced a major expansion of operations and said it would add 300 reservation and clerical workers to its work force between now and mid1974.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LOWER VOLUME
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange fell again yesterday as volume dropped slightly. Prices also fell in the overthecounter market in steppedup trading.

title: U. S. Steel Seeks Price Increases Of About 6% on Many Items
description: The United States Steel Corporation said late yesterday that it was seeking price increases of about 6 per cent on a long list of items.

title: ExWelfare Aide Pleads Not Guilty on Drug Counts
description: A 27yearold former city welfare investigator arrested by Bronx authorities last July as the mastermind of a $15millionayear narcotics ring pleaded not guilty yesterday to new Federal drug charges lodged against him in Brooklyn.

title: TOKYO AND MANILA GET OIL EXEMPTION
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 27 Japan and the Philippines have been exempted from the next scheduled reduction of per cent in exports of Arab petroleum, the secretary of the Arab League, Mahmoud Riad, announced here tonight after session of the Arab summit conference here.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Yorkville Under Siege
description: If left to its manifest commercial destiny, the same speculative forces that have already driven out so many of the residents will doom everything that makes Yorkville desirable in both human and urban terms. Not only are the local enterprises being sacrificed, but so are the residents and their needs. Not the least loss is the vital but intangible sense of community that is one of a city's most essential and fragile assets.

title: NEW PHONE SYSTEM TO BE MADE BY RCA
description: The RCA Corporation announced yesterday its entry into the manufacture of private telephone exchange equipment with a new system that uses largescale integrated circuits.

title: 3 Killed and 100 Injured in South By Tornadoes and Heavy Rains
description: Tornadoes and torrential rain swept across Tennessee, Alabama and northern Mississippi yesterday, killing three persons and injuring more than 100 others.

title: Red Smith
description: Long before Richard Nicolls laid out America's first formal race course on Long Island, the practice of sticking a needle into a horse was frowned upon by the better element of livery stable society. We live in an era change, however. Today reputable men of science are using needles on horses for purposes that the stuffiest steward of The Jockey Club would applaud. They are veterinarians experimenting with the ancient Chinese art of acupuncture to treat animals with ailments that defy Western methods.

title: Robert Branner, Art Historian And Expert on Gothic Style, Dies
description: Dr. Robert Branner, professor of art history and archeology at Columbia University and an authority on French Gothic architecture, sculpture and manuscript painting, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital of complications following heart surgery. He was 46 years old and lived at 21 Claremont Avenue and had a summer home in Brattleboro, Vt.

title: World Team Tennis Hires the Spectrum
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov, 27 (UPI)  The Philadelphia Freedoms of World Team Tennis signed a threeyear lease today with the Spectrum.

title: U.S. Trade in Surplus
description: A continuing boom in exports helped the United States register another large surplus in its foreign trade in October, the Commerce Department reported yesterday. Details on Page 61.

title: Time to Settle
description: The strike blanket that has shrouded New York City's cultural scene this fall shows signs of lifting. Musicians at the New York Philharmonic, away from Avery Fisher Hall for two months, are scheduled to vote tonight on a modified contract offer that may well represent the last chance to salvage their shattered concert season.

title: Ethnic Pressures Are Effective In Barring Offensive TV Films
description: Minority group organizations  Hispanic, Oriental and American Indian, as well as black have been exerting pressure on television stations in various parts of the country to ban from the air, or substantially edit, hundreds of motion pictures that they consider racially offensive.

title: Saudi Aide at Oil Tap Ahmed Zaki alYamani
description: RIYADH, Saudi ArabiaSheik Ahmed Zaki alYamani, Saudi Arabia's Minister of Petroleum, admits unabashedly lit Arab company that he likes Americans, among whom he has studied and worked for many years.

title: Michigan Suit Filed On Vote
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27Unhappy partisans of the University of Michigan took the Big Ten Conference to Federal Court today in an effort to overturn the conference's decision to send Ohio State to the Rose Bowl instead of Michigan.

title: Richardson Says He Warned He'd Quit Over Cox
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Former Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson said tonight that he had made it clear to White House officials on two occasions that, he would be forced to resign if they went through with efforts to dismiss Archibald Cox.

title: Underwriter to Limit Role
description: American Express Company, Inc., has announced that its wholly owned subsidiary, W. H. Morton & Co., will discontinue its corporate securities underwriting business as of Dec. 31. American Express said that Morton, which it acquired in 1966, would continue to operate as a division and to underwrite and distribute state, municipal, authority revenue, United States Treasury and agency issues.

title: Foreign Service Expects to Lose Sisco
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Joseph J. Sisco, the State Department's top official on Mideast affairs, is expected to leave the Government soon to accept a college presidency, a wellplaced Administration official said today.

title: U.S. Trade in Surplus
description: A continuing boom in exports helped the United States register another large surplus in its foreign trade in October, the Commerce Department reported yesterday. Details on Page 61.

title: Morrison Finds First Coaching Season Bitter Sweet
description: CHATTANOOGAAt 1:35 P.M. last Saturday, 25 minutes before game time, fewer than a dozen people were on the sidewalk outside the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga football stadium and a friend of the school was trying to give away a fistfull of tickets. There was no traffic on Vine Street, no one hawking pennants or programs and no one was in line at the only ticket window.

title: Nicklaus's Goal: First In Earnings
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov. 27Are there any goals left this year for Jack Nicklaus?

title: Nixon's Yacht to Face Temporary Mothballing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)The White House indicated today that the Presidential yacht Sequoia would be temoprarily mothballed to conserve fuel, but that President Nixon would continue to travel when it's necessary.

title: MRS. C. W. CONRAD
description: WALPOLE, Mass., Nov. 27Mrs. Flora Tansy Conrad, widow of Charles W. Conrad, who had been president of Conrad & Young, Inc., an engineering consultant firm, died today at Phillips House in Boston. Her age was 83.

title: Jay N. Whipple Dies at 76; Led Investment Bankers
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27Jay N. Whipple, a past president of the Investment Bankers Association of America and a governor of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in Lake Forest Hospital after a stroke. He was 76 years old and lived in Lake Forest.

title: DAYLIGHT SAVING FOR NEXT 2 YEARS IS VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The House voted today to put the nation on yearround daylight saving time for the first time since World War II in a move to conserve energy. The tally was 311 to 88.

title: Sides Press Talks To Settle Strike At Philharmonic
description: Bargaining talks continued into the night as negotiators for the New York Philharmonic and Local 802 of the American Federation of Musicians sought yesterday to arrive at a contract agreement that could he presented for a vote tonight by the orchestra's 106 striking musicians.

title: Severed Head Brings City Into Jersey Murder Case
description: The Medical Examiner's office here is controversially involved in a New Jersey murder case, The New York Times has learned, because it severed the head of a woman who was believed to have drowned in the East River, buried her body in potter's field and discovered only by chance a week later that the head contained a bulet hole.

title: Bridge: Joy Quickly Turns to Gloom For a RubberGame Player
description: The rubberbridge player, unlike his ?? counterpart, feels joy and gloom according to the strength or weakness of his hand. Within a threeminute period a player can rise from a pit of despair to a height of ecstasy and back into a pit again without having any part to play in the proceedings.

title: India and Soviet Agree to Solidify Links
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27 Leonid I. Brezhnev and Prime Minister Indira Gandhi expressed their resolve today to solidify the links between the Soviet Union and India.

title: RICHARD O. PINOVER
description: Richard O. Pinover, publisher of Pinover Publications Service, trade journals, of 225 West 34th Street, died of a heart attack Monday at his office. He. was 31 years old and lived at 263 West 11th Street.

title: A Child Views Divorce in A.B.C. Drama
description: The separation of his parents and ultimate divorce as seen through the eyes of a child are projected with intelligence and restraint in today's Afterschool Special, for youngsters, at 4:30 over the American Broadcasting. Company TV network. The lowkeyed hourlong drama, another sturdy entry in this worthy series, does very well indeed, with a quietly thoughtful tone and no frills.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: When Mrs. Carolyn Cudone left West Caldwell, N.J., in March of 1966 to live with her husband in retirethent in Myrtle Beach, S.C., she was 48 years old and had years of tournament golf behind her.

title: Ingredients of a Coup: Timing and Infiltration By NICHOLAS GAGE
description: ATHENS, Nov. 27Last week, in the wake of largescale student demonstrations against his Government, President George Papadopoulos slept in a bed set up in his offices in the heavily guarded old palace in the center of Athens.

title: Stage: Simon's Chekhov
description: What is a cherry orchard without its cherries, or a Neil Simon without his New York? The answer was to be found last night at the Eugene O'Neill Theater, where Mr. Simon's play, The Good Doctor, had its first performance.

title: Valenti in a Scarlatti Sonata Marathon
description: Fernando Valenti has long been identified with the harpsicord sonatas of Domenico Scarlatti. He made a heroic stab at recording them complete for Westminster in the nineteenfifties, getting through more than 300 of the some 550 that have survived before the project was abandoned (there is talk now of a newly recorded integral set). But although he is widely recognized as one of the leading contemporary harpsichordists, Mr. Valenti hadn't ever subjected New York to a real, unadulterated Scarlatti blitz. Before this week, that is.

title: CASH SUBPOENAED IN HUGHES INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Senate Watergate committee has issued a subpoena for 1,001 hundreddollar bills that President Nixon's friend Charles G. Rebozo accepted from aides of Howard Hughes and reportedly kept in a safe deposit box for three years, according to a committee lawyer.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The formalization last month of the February devaluation of the dollar had the effect of increasing the dollar value of United States monetary reserves by more than 51.4billion, the Treasury disclosed today.

title: Staff Doctors Battle Englewood Hospital
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 27All but two of the Englewood General Hospital's 38 resident doctors and internes were subpoenaed by their own attorney today to appear in a case in which the group is attempting to gain recognition as a collectivebargaining unit for the institution's medical staff.

title: BEAME TO APPOINT DINKINS, GRIETZ
description: Mayor  elect Abraham D. Beame will announce today the appointments of David Dinkins, who was the first black president of the Board of Elections, and Judah Gribetz, former Buildings Commissioner under Mayor Robert F. Wagner, as Deputy Mayors in the newly organized administration.

title: Concord Bridge Saved
description: CONCORD, Mass., Nov, 29 (Reuters)  An attempt has been made to blow up historic Concord. Bridge, Police Chief William Costello said today. He said that a crude but powerful time bomb, made from four sticks of dynamite and the mechanism of an alarm clock, had been dismantled by a state police bomb expert yesterday five minutes before a was set to ?? ode.

title: Chris's Baseline Shots Defeat Miss Goolagong
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Nov. 27 (AP)Chris Evert, playing from the baseline, blunted Evonne Goolagong's attacking game and won the women's singles title in the South African open tennis championships today, 63, 63.

title: Mr. Kissinger's Middle East Strategy
description: Secretary of State Kissinger says that the main hope of easing the Middle East oil embargo lies in progress toward an ArabIsraeli peace agreement, but the chances are that it will be the middle of the winter before any substantial progress can be made.

title: TOKYO AND MANILA GET OIL EXEMPTION
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 27 Japan and the Philippines have been exempted from the next scheduled reduction of 5 per cert in exports of Arab petroleum, the secretary of the Arab League, Mahmoud Riad, announced here tonight after a session of the Arab summit conference here.

title: Con Ed's Plan for Coal Sets Off Conflict
description: The state's Environmental Conservation Commissioner agreed yesterday to permit the Consolidated Edison Company to burn coal in two of its generating plants here.

title: 4 City Marshals Lose Jobs Following an Inquiry
description: Four city marshals have lost their jobs and a process server his license as a result of an investigation into the sewer service of eviction papers and other legal documents, Investigation Commissioner Nicholas Scoppetta announced yesterday.

title: Big Trade Surplus Spurred by Exports
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 United States foreign trade registered another large surplus in October as exports continued to boom, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Whose Impropriety?
description: The criticism leveled by the White House against special prosecutor Leon Jaworski for allegedly leaking to the press information unfavorable to the President's cause conjures up visions of the fate that befell Archibald Cox. Viewed against the background of Mr. Cox's dismissal, the complaint by deputy Presidential press secretary Gerald L. Warren contains unmistakable suggestions of intimidation.

title: KELLOGG TO BUILD 8 PLANTS IN CHINA
description: The M. W. Kellogg Company, a division of Pullman, Inc., announced in Houston yesterday that it had received five contracts from China for the construction of largescale ammonia plants valued at a total of $130million.

title: Ingredients of a Coup: Timing and Infiltration
description: ATHENS, Nov. 27Last week, in the wake of largescale student demonstrations against his Government, President George Papadopoulos slept in a bed set up in his offices in the heavily guarded old palace in the center of Athens.

title: Foreigners Supplant American Tourists Here
description: The summer of 1973 may well be remembered in tourist circles as the summer of the flipflop, when the mass movement of Americans flocking abroad for vacations reversed itself and a new immigration of European and other foreign businessmen came flooding into New York.

title: Israelis and Swiss Intercept Total of Eight Letter Bombs
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 27 (AP)  Israeli postal authorities discovered three letter bombs mailed from Switzerland today, and the Swiss authorities anmounced that they intercepted five bound for Israel yesterday. All were discovered before they exploded.

title: State Antismut Law Sustained in Appeal; New Stay Is Sought
description: The constitutionality of New York State's civil obscenity statute was upheld yesterday in a unanimous opinion of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court.

title: Kissinger May Visit Mideast To Discuss Peace Conference
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Secretary of State Kissinger may make another trip to the Middle East in two weeks to discuss the prospects for the expected ArabIsraeli peace conference with key countries in the area, Administration officials said today.

title: RULING COALITION DIVIDED IN BOLIVIA
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 27Bolivia's principal political party announced today that it had decided to withdraw from the militaryled coalition Cabinet, which President Hugo Banzer Suarez shuffled last night.

title: Jersey Turnpike Raises Limit To 55 M.P.H. as a Safety Move
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 27  The New Jersey Turnpike, the first highspeed toll road in the country to reduce its speed limit to 50 miles an hour as a fuel conservation measure on Nov. 8, increased it today to 55 miles an hour. Its previous maximum speed limit had been 60 miles an hour.

title: COURT HEARS TAPE WITH BUZZING GAP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27A copy of the tape recording of President Nixon's June 20, 1972, conversation with H. R. Haldemanthe conversation in which Mr. Nixon ordered public relations actions to be taken in the wake of the Watergate breakin three days earlierwas played in Federal District Court here today.

title: Oil Allocation Act Signed As Nixon Ends Opposition
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27President Nixon signed into law today the Emergency Petroleum Allocation Act of 1973, a bill his Administration had opposed for many months.

title: What Is Going On Puts Racism to a Daily Test
description: During its four years, the Henry Street Settlement's New Federal Theater, under Woodie King's direction, has introduced a number of provocative new plays and playwrights. Because of its record of accomplishment, this valuable company should be allowed an occasional offnight, such as the current offering, Ben Caldwell's What Is Going On (playing through Sunday at the New Federal).

title: Severed Head Brings City Into Jersey Murder Case
description: The Medical Examiner's office here is controversially involved in a New Jersey murder case, The New York Times has learned, because it severed the head of a woman who was believed to have drowned in the East River, buried her body in potter's field and discovered only by chance a week later that the head contained a bulet hole.

title: 2 Nights With LaterDay Rorem
description: TWO CONCERTS OF RECENT MUSIC BY NED ROREM. At Alice Tully Hall. Sunday, Nov. 25: Day Music (7971), Last Poems of Wallace Stevens (1972), War Scenes (1969), Gloria (1970). Monday, Nov. 26: Night Music (1972), Ariel (1971), Trio (1959), Bertha, a oneact opera (1968).

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: College Basketball
description: PRESEASON POLL

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Richard J. Vizzini, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, said yesterday that he and the union's executive board had received what he described as an overwhelming vote of confidence at a special meeting of firemen at Manhattan Center.

title: An Origami Christmas Tree, and Other Entertainments
SENATE APPROVES CAMPAIGN REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Senate approved today legislation that would revolutionize the financing of campaigns fox the Presidency and Congress by requiring that public funds rather than private donations pay for all elections to these offices.

title: Council Votes $ 15.9Million for Stadium And $50Million for Convention Center
description: The Lindsay administration's last two major building projects cleared the final hurdle yesterday when the City Council approved funds for the renovation of Yankee Stadium and the start of construction of the West Side convention center.

title: About New York
description: They hung a plaque for Eugene O'Neill on Broadway yesterday, and they hung it exactly one block from where they were supposed to do it. They did it in rain and drizzle, and while they did, people stopped and stared.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 610
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched No. 610 in its Cosmos earth satellite series today to continue space studies, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Nixon Wilderness Message
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)President Nixon will send to Congress tomorrow a message on his national wilderness proposals, the White House announced today. Coinciding with the message will be a noon meeting with Secretary of Interior Rogers C. B. Morton and the National Parks Service director, Ronald Walker.

title: Pouring Trouble on Oil
description: It's going to mean dirtier, air, no matter how you cut it, said Gerald M. Hansler, the regional director of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, after New York State announced its plan yesterday giving Consolidated Edison permission to burn dirtier fuel during the energy crisis. Mr. Hansler's remark reflects a general, agreement among officials that the moreplentiful, dirtier fuel will have to be burned in the face of shortages. But that is where the agreement stops.

title: City Aims at Scofflaws' Credit Ratings
description: The city's Parking Violations Bureau will put into effect today a plan through which holders of millions of dollars worth of unpaid parking tickets will be hit where the bureau hopes it hurtsin their credit ratings.for example, department stores, banks, major creditcard companies, buying or selling a house, he may find his record blemished and unable to obtain the required credit,

title: Beame's Campaign Committees List Heavy Late Contributions
description: Campaign committees that helped Abraham D. Beame raise funds for the Nov. 6 mayoral election reported yesterday a surplus of $45,000 for the closing days of the race.

title: White House Pressure Alleged at Inquiry on S.B.A. Corruption
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27More allegations of criminal violations, mismanagement and White House pressure were made today at the opening session of public Congressional hearings on the Small Business Administration.

title: FORD IS APPROVED BY SENATE, 923; HOUSE SET TO ACT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Senate approved today, 92 to 3, the nomination of Gerald Rudolph Ford of Michigan as the 40th Vice President of the United States.

title: Con Ed's Plan to Use Coal Sets Off StateCity Conflict
description: The State's Environmental Conservation Commissioner agreed yesterday to permit the Consolidated Edison Company to burn coal in two of its generating plants here. The decisionwhich also relaxes sulphur requirements for fuel oil burned in the citybrings the state into direct conflict with the city, which reaffirmed its earlier decision to deny Con Edison permission to use coal.

title: F.T.C. Sets Consent Order Barring Grant's Credit Plan
description: The Federal Trade Commission said yesterday that it had tentatively adopted a consent order that bars the W. T. Grant Company from using deceptive tactics to sell a couponbook credit plan.

title: Delta Is Expanding Airline Operations In New Office Here
description: Delta Air Lines yesterday, announced a major expansion of operations and said it would add 300 reservation and clerical workers to its work force between now and mid1974.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Jersey Turnpike Raises Limit To 55 M.P.H. as a Safety Move
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 27  The New Jersey Turnpike, the first highspeed toll road in the country to reduce its speed limit to 50 miles an hour as a fuel conservation measure on Nov. 8, increased it today to 55 miles an hour. Its previous maximum speed limit had been 60 miles an hour.

title: A.M.C. Auto Sales Up
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27  The American Motors Corporation reported today that its Nov. 1120 sales totaled 10;285, compared with 8,407 a year ago. This raised total domestic sales for the year to 258,818 com pared with 270,683 in the 1972 period. Industry sales in the first 20 days of November totaled 508,996 compared with 552,260 a year ago. Sales for the year total 8,827,500 compared with 8,264,125 last year.

title: Burke Wants Youth on His Legal Staff
description: I don't know what they did with the furniture, but I'm sure that whatever's there will be adequate. I'll take the pieces as they are. I'm not much on furnituremy emphasis is on work.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LOWER VOLUME
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange fell again yesterday as volume dropped slightly. Prices also fell in the overthecounter market in steppedup trading.

title: Hanratty Injured Ribs 5 Weeks Ago
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 27 (UPI)A spokesman for the Pittsburgh Steelers disclosed today that No. 2 quarterback, Terry Hanratty, played the last five weeks with two broken ribs.

title: Prices Decline Limit As Selling Continues In Soybean Futures
description: Heavy selling of soybean futures continued yesterday, dropping prices the 20centsabushel limit in all positions on the Chicago Board of Trade. Soybean meal prices also declined the daily limit. The meal is a high protein cattle feed.

title: Nixon Sees Progress In Drive Against Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 27 (AP)President Nixon said today that evidence indicated the nation was now on the way to winning the battle against narcotics and drug abuse.

title: Thieu Giving His Bureaucrats BootCamp Treatment
description: VUNG TAU, South Vietnam, Nov. 20  President Nguyen Van Thieu has nudged 15,000 South Vietnamese bureaucrats out of their offices into a revolutionary retraining program where whitecollar workers are learning to wear black pajamas, to box with their feet and, presumably, to cut red tape.

title: THOMAS DURRANCE, TEXACO OFFICIAL, 56
description: Thomas D. Durrance, who retired in 1971 as director of employe and public relations for Texaco Europe, Ltd., in Brussels, died of leukemia yesterday in a hospital near Le Fleix, France. He was 56 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Advertising: Paper and Energy
description: The Dec. 4 issue of Saturday Review/World out today is printed half on its refular coated stock and half on uncoated textbook stock.

title: Many Dolphins Unhappy On Pay, Eye New League
description: At least a dozen members of the champion Miami Dolphins would jump to the proposed World Football League if it got off the ground and could pay higher salaries, according to Doug Swift, the Dolphin linebacker. A dozen to 15 if they had the money, said Swift. They can have Jim Mandich right now. Mandich is the talented reserve tight end, who is playing more but still not enough to satisfy him. He did not sign a contract this season and will be a free agent within the National Football next May 1.

title: About New York
description: They hung a plaque for Eugene O'Neill on Broadway yesterday, and they hung it exactly one block from where they were supposed to do it. They did it in rain and drizzle, and while they did, people stopped and stared.

title: Byrne Accord With Mara Ends Snag on Jersey Bonds
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, Nov. 27Governorelect Brendon T. Byrne announced here tonight that he and the New York Football Giants had reached complete agreement on the club's planned move to a new sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: HARRY HELMSLEY AND WIFE STABBED
description: Harry B. Helmsley, one of the nation's biggest real estate developers, and his wife, Leona, were stabbed by an intruder in their Palm Beach, Fla., penthouse early Sunday morning, Mr. Helmsley said last night.

title: Jets Lifted By Return Of Atkinson
description: Overlooked in the hullabaloo surrounding Joe Namath's return last Sunday was the return of Al Atkinson, the New York Jets' middle linebacker.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
FRICK DROPS PLAN FOR ITS NEW WING
description: The Frick Collection has abandoned its plan for eventual construction of a wing to the east of its museum site at Fifth Avenue and 70th Street, and instead will create a permanent garden and terrace on the space earmarked for the wing.

title: U.S. Steel Seeks Price Increases Of About 6% on Many Items
description: The United States Steel Corporation said late yesterday that it was seeking price increases of about 6 per cent on a long list of items.

title: Seeking Alternative Gifts? Here's a Catalogue of Ideas
description: Christmasgiving does not have to be a trauma or a crass commercial venture. It can fulfill the human desire to give without making the giving an orgy of useless or earthdestroying things.

title: A.A.A. Promises Towing
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27 (UPI)Motorists who run out of gasoline on the weekend got encouraging words, with qualifications, today from the American Automobile Association. We will tow people who run out of gas to a safe place, said Lamar Phillips, local manager of the A.A.A. office. He also said 42 local emergency vehicles would assist A.A.A. members. But, Mr. Phillips added: We cannot sell them gasoline. That would be illegal.

title: PRAVDA CAUTIONS ON WASTING FUEL
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27Pravda came up with a new wrinkle in, the energy crisis today: The Soviet Union is losing 10 million tons of badly needed coal every year because wind is blowing it out of open railroad cars.

title: Onassis Company to Build New Hampshire Refinery
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 27Olympic Refineries, Inc., a company recently created by the Greek shipping magnate Aristotle Onassis, plans to build a major oil refinery in New Hampshire, Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr. announced today.

title: Israeli Commission Begins Investigation Into War Setbacks
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 2 (AP)A fiveman commission today began investigating the causes of Israel's severe setbacks on the Syrian and Egyptian fronts during the first days of the latest war. The inquiry was ordered a week ago amid continuing clamor for the Government to punish those responsible for the army's initial failings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: There is a natural economic (as distinct from political) response to the Middle East oil restrictions. The freemarket price of oil, which restricts demand to the available supply, is the appropriate price for every user to pay. Anyone who pays less will use more, forcing others to use less even though they need it more. The price to the producer cannot be less than the cost of the most costly barrel of oil produced. But the average cost is much less. The difference provides the billions of profits or gravy, and economists have shown how governments can take a share of the gravy in taxes without damaging efficiency, since there is no principle as to how the gravy should be divided.

title: Byrne Accord With Mara Ends Snag on Jersey Bonds
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 27Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne announced here tonight that he and the New York Football Giants had reached complete agreement on the club's planned move to a new sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: Prices Are Mixed on Corporates and TaxExempts
description: Trading was quiet and prices mixed yesterday in the corporate and taxexempt bond markets as dealers and investors began assessing several new offerings.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH ASS'N CUP

title: Schmautz's Goal For Canucks Ties Blues, 22
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Bobby Schmautz notched his ninth goal of the season tonight to give the Vancouver Canucks a 22 tie with the St. Louis Blues.

title: Judge Challenges U.S. Officials for Letting Newsmen Accompany Police on Drug Raids in City Area
description: A Federal judge demanded an explanation yesterday of how and why newsmen were allowed to accompany Federal and local agents in a massive roundup of suspected major narcotics dealers last spring.

title: Paris Is in a Tizzy, but Then It's Not Just Another Fashion Show
description: PARIS, Nov. 27John Barry Ryan 3d, a partner in Kuhn, Loeb, the investment banking firm, arrived here Sunday and headed for the Plaza Athenee Hotel. As the car approached the Avenue Montaigne, he noticed a larger than usual cluster of gendarmes.

title: ACLI International to Widen CommodityFutures Service
description: ACLI International, Inc., a large commoditytrading concern specializing in cocoa, rubber, sugar, coffee and shrimp, announced today an expansion of its commodityfutures services business through its subsidiary, ACLI International Commodity Services, Inc.

title: Operation Candor: Unanswered Questions Proliferate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27In the third week of its operation candor, the White House finds itself mired once again in contradictory stories and growing incredulity.

title: Gas Hoarders Warned
description: With nearly all gasoline stations expected to close this Sunday, sales of gasoline containers are booming. But in many areas the storage of more than a few gallons of gasoline without a special permit violates either state or city laws.

title: 12 Aides Back Brooklyn Museum Chief
description: Twelve senior members of the staff of the Brooklyn Museum last night told the institution's 35member governing committee that they supported the administration of their controversial director, Duncan F. Cameron.

title: G.M. Auto Union Council Votes Overwhelming Approval of Pact
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27 (AP) The General Motors Council of the United Automobile Workers voted overwhelming approval tonight for a tentative national contract covering 415,000 employes.

title: Judges Slashes Rent By 80% in Strike At Newark Project
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27  The presiding judge of the Essex County Court today ordered the rents in the Stella Wright public housing project reduced by 80 per cent because of multiple abuses and said that if they could not be corrected the huge development should be demolished,

title: WAGEPRICE CURBS LIFTED ON CEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27In a new step toward the elimination of most price and wage controls, the Cost of Living Council granted an exemption today to producers of cement, a key material in construction and industrial expansion.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 610
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (Reuters), The Soviet Union launched No. 610 in its Cosmos earth satellite series today to continue space studies, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Gurney Denies Wrongdoing; Plans Reply to Allegations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)  Denying any wrongdoing, Senator Edward T. Gurney, Republican of Florida, said today that he would fight allegations that he benefitted from a slush fund raised by Florida home builders.

title: F.D.A. GIVES WARNING ON HEALTH PRODUCTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration warned today that two health food products made with parts of apricot pits contain poison that could kill adults and children.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. Houston Rockets, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M.

title: A Team's Poultry Is Another's Meat
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 27 (AP)An opponent has been found for Stephen F. Austin State University in the first annual Poultry Bowl, to be played here Deck 8, bowl officials announced today.

title: Stereotypers Reach Tentative Accord With 2 of 3 Papers
description: John Kennedy, president of Stereotypers Local No. 1, announced yesterday that his union had reached tentative agreements with The Daily News and The New York Times, but was still without a settlement with The New York Post.

title: ACLI International to Widen CommodityFutures Service
description: ACLI International, Inc., a large commoditytrading concern specializing in cocoa, rubber, sugar, coffee and shrimp, announced today an expansion of its commodityfutures services business through its subsidiary ACLI International Commodity Services, Inc.

title: W. T. Grant Consent Order
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 27 (AP), The Federal Trade Commission announced today that it had negotiated a consent order with the W. T. Grant Company to end what the agency had complained was deceptive practices used to sell a coupon book credit plan. Grant agreed to provide future customers with a statement notifying them that the Grant's open end credit plan was different from the coupon book plan.

title: Stabilizing Problem Delays Maneuvers For Skylab Studies
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)Flight controllers indefinitely postponed further maneuvers of Skylab 3 today because of an unexplained high consumption of the thruster gas that stabilizes the space laboratory.

title: NEW GREEK JUNTA BIDS FOR SUPPORT
description: ATHENS, Nov. 27The new Greek leadership, moving to generate public support, today began releasing students and others jailed in the demonstrations and riots against President George Papadopoulos before his ouster on Sunday.

title: Major Gain Seen in Detection Of FoodProduct Carcinogens
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Food and Drug Administration claimed today a major achievement in reducing human exposures to cancercausing substances called aflatoxins that sometimes contaminate peanuts and some other food products.

title: The Arab World: Use of Oil Weapon Is Designed to Pay Political Dividends
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27They thought in Washington that King Faisal was bluffing when he warned that oil production might be cut, a senior American official in Saudi Arabia said last week. The war has shown how serious he was.

title: OTB and Roosevelt Plan Sale $3 Double Exacta
description: Despite the security hazards of bigpayoff exotic wagers, Roosevelt Raceway and the Offtrack Betting Corporation hope to introduce a new gimmick next month.

title: Jaworski Says He Presses Inquiry Into I.T.T. Matter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, gave assurances today that his office is vigorously pursuing an investigation into allegations of wrongdoing, including possible improper White House influence, in the I.T.T. matter.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Holders of season tickets to the home games of the lately departed New York Golden Blades will receive refunds under an arrangement negotiated between the World Hockey Association and the office of the New York State Attorney General. After the new management of the club moved the home arena from Madison Square Garden to Cherry Hill, N. J., holders of season tickets were unable to get any refund information from the previous management, and as the result of their complaints Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz ordered an investigation.

title: TV TALK BY A CRITIC OF POMPIDOU BARRED
description: PARIS, Nov. 27Arthur Conte, former director of France's stateowned radio and television system, was barred last night from appearing on French television screens where he was to have talked about his memoirs of his oneyear tenure.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ETERNAL CHANGE History walks the downtown Manhattan streets furtively, flinching at the bulldozer stalking it, the perpetual mugger of the past in our everchanging town. Some of this is brought out in a modest but interesting exhibition at Trinity Church, Wall Street and Broadway (4256677), where a large model at the entrance shows the buildings we have and the ones to come as land is filled in and projects are blueprinted.

title: BEANIE TO APPOINT DINKINS, GRIBM
description: Mayor  elect Abraham D. Beame will announce today the appointments of David Dinkins, who was the first black president of the Board of Elections, and Judah Gribetz, former Buildings Commissioner under Mayor Robert F. Wagner as Deputy Mayors in the newly organized administration.

title: AIR FORCE TOTALS AID SENT TO ISRAEL
description: The United States Air Force flew 22,300 tons of military equipment, ammunition, spare parts and medical supplies to Israel from Oct. 13 to Nov. 14.

title: People in Sports: Uclan Makes A Grand Gesture for ArchRival
description: Tom Bradley, the Mayor of Los Angeles and a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles; said yesterday he would root for Southern California, U.C.L.A.'s crosstown rival, in the Rose Bowl game against Ohio State. I'm sure that having beaten U.C.L.A., the Trojans are the best team in the United States, he said in accepting a Southern Cal rooter's badge.

title: Army Plans More Realistic Look at Football Foes
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Nov. 27Conceding that it may be asking too much of the football players it recruits, the United States Military Academy indicated today it was planning to change future schedules to make them more realistic.

title: Controller Tried to Block S.E.C. Suit in Bank Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The head of the Government agency that inspects national banks testified today that he had tried to stop the Securities and Exchange Commission from taking legal action against the bank controlled by President Nixon's longtime friend, C. Arnholt Smith, although his own agency had evidence of numerous violations of criminal statutes by the bank.

title: WHITE HOUSE ROLE IN INQUIRY DENIED
description: The White House said yesterday that it had never sought to limit an investigation of $300,000 heroin smuggling operation after Federal investigators were told by an informant that Robert L. Vesco was to have provided the financing.

title: Judge Burke to Be Corporation Counsel
description: Adrian P. Burke, the senior associate judge on New York State's highest court, was appointed yesterday by Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame to be New York City's corporation counsel, one of the handful of top jobs in his administration.

title: DICK CAVETT TAKES A.B.C. SHORT RATIONS
description: Dick Cavett has accepted the take it  or  leave  it offer from the American Broadcasting Company for a reduced schedule of broadcasts next year. His new oneyear contract calls for 26 programs, or one every other week.

title: Knicks, Nets Offer Area Fans Melange
description: Tom Riker and Wilt Chamberlain are coming back to New York tonight. Riker will try to lend a helping hand to the Knicks, who are battered by injuries, and Chamberlain will be making his New York area coaching debut when his San Diego Conquistadors of the American Basketball Association meet the Nets on Long Island.

title: Monday's Fights
description: New York  Adolpho Viruet, 140 pounds, New York, knocked out Oscar Piton, 140, Argentina, 3 rounds.

title: Children's Laws Eased
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  A bill repealing the cries of truancy, running away from home and being a stubborn child has been signed into law, Gov. Francis W. Sargent announced today. He said the bill was designed to end the practice of treating children as criminals when they have unmet social, psychological, medical or educational needs.

title: Byrne Will Visit Beame And Gov. Shapp This Week
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27  Governorelect Brendan T. Byrne announced today that he would meet this week with Gov. Milton J. Shapp of Pennsylvania and Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame of New York to discuss mutual cooperation in meeting regional problems.

title: Books of The Times
description: Four novels worth your attention:

title: Faulkner Selects 5 Protestants To Complete Coalition in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 27 (Reuters)The former Protestant Prime Minister, Brian Faulkner, today announced the names of the live members of the Unionist party who will join him in the new coalition government of Northern Ireland

title: America's Motorocracy
description: DETROITThe trouble with cars, to adapt the old saying, is that you can't live with them or without them. We in Detroit are told that we produce an extravagant luxury that can no longer be tolerated. We are admonished, on the other hand, not to push up the price of one of life's necessities.

title: Vietcong Boycott Session, Charging Bombing of Town
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 27 (Reuters)The Vietcong today boycotted a meeting with South Vietnamese military negotiators in protest against what they charged was the bombing of a Communistcontrolled town on Friday.

title: As Forecasts Diverge
description: The stock market has tumbled as though it were forecasting a major recession or even a depression. But the economists have kept their cool, forecasting nothing worse than slower growth in the national economy. Does the market know something the economists don't know, or is it the other way around?

title: Ethnic Pressures Are Effective In Barring Offensive TV Films
description: Minority group organizations  Hispanic, Oriental and American Indian, as well as black have been exerting pressure on television stations in various parts of the country to ban from the air, or substantially edit, hundreds of motion pictures that they consider racially offensive.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 28, 1973

title: Two Projects Are Compared
description: NEWARK, Nov. 27Here is a comparison from the opinion of Municipal Court Judge Joseph Walsh of the Stella Wright housing project here and of the PruittIgoe housing project that was demolished in St. Louis:

title: FORD IS APPROVED BY SENATE, 923; HOUSE SET TO ACT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Senate approved today, 92 to 3, the nomination of Gerald Rudolph Ford of Michigan as the 40th Vice President of the United States,

title: PLANE TRAVELERS WARNED BY C.A.B.
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board warned the public yesterday to expect difficult traveling conditions during the Christmas holidays because of the growing number of flight cancellations caused by jet tuel shortages.

title: FLEXIBILITY URGED FOR HIGH SCHOOLS
description: A report to be issued next month by the National Commission on the Reform of Secondary Education will urge that the nation's high schools make their curriculums and attendance requirements more flex??ble.

title: Englewood Hospital To Hold an Election On Bargaining Unit
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 28 Superior Court Judge George B. Gelman today approved settlement that calls for an election to decide whether a group of 27 internes and residents can represent Englewood General Hospital's inhouse medical staff as a collectivebargaining unit.

title: Arab Hijackers Free Dutch Jet And Last 11 Hostages in Dubai
description: DUBAI, Thursday, Nov. 29 (ReutersThree Palestinian gunmen yesterday surrendered the Dutch jumbo jet they hijacked over Iraq Sunday night and in return for safeconduct guarantees freed the last 11 hostages they were holding.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Aid Handicapped, City Schools Told

title: TRW Sees Spending Rise
description: TRW, Inc., diversified engineering and research concern, expects capital spending for 1974 to total $125million to $130million compared with about $100million expended this year and $62million spent in 1972. This was said yesterday by Ruben F. Mettler, president of the company, after meeting with a group of security analysts in Cleveland. He added that concern over energy shortages had not slowed the company's plans so far.

title: Vehicle Agency's Head Convicted of Speeding
description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 28 (AP) Ray J. Marini, who heads the state office responsible for warning drivers about speeding and other vehicle violations, was found guilty today of speeding on the Jersey Turnpike last month.

title: 3 Die in Ulster as Guerrillas Block Roads, Rails
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 28Three men were killed last night as guerrillas believed to be members of the illegal Irish Republican Army blocked 90 roads and rail lines in all of Northern Ireland's six counties.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 26story facultyapartment building for Rockefeller University will rise between 62d and 63d Streets on York Avenue, adding a 16th building to the university's 15acre campus along the East River. Consruction on the $9.3million edifice will begin immediately and will be completed by June, 1975.

title: BYRNE AND SHAPP SEEK TAX ACCORD
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 28. New Jersey's Governorelect, Brendan T. Byrne, met this afternoon with Gov. Milton J. Shapp to explore the possibility of working out a system of tax reciprocity for individuals living in either state and being taxed on earnings in the other.

title: Judge and Jury Reenact Murder in a Subway Train
description: BOSTON, Nova 28 (AP)A Judge, jury, defendant, lawyers and court officers spent half an hour in a twocar subway train reenacting the slaying of a porter.

title: STOCK RALLY AIDS COMMODITY RISE
description: Prices of many basic commodities rose sharply yesterday because commodity traders were influenced by the rising stock prices reflected by the DowJones industrial average.

title: MUSEUM WILL ACT ON CAMERON CASE
description: The governing committee of the Brooklyn Museum has set Dec. 11 for what could be the ultimate confrontation between the museum's controversial director, Duncan F. Cameron, and the group of critical for mer staff members who contend that he has been a divisive force at the institution.

title: U.S. PLANS TO DOUBLE PARK SYSTEM ACRES
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Nov. 28 (AP)The Interior Department has disclosed plans to nearly double acreage in the national park system by carving out 10 new parks in Alaska.

title: Mrs. Abzug's Image Shifts, But Is She Same Old Bella?
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28She takes the floor of the House of Representatives less often these days, and when she does, her words flow more slowly and more softly. She works more quietly in committees, introduces fewer amendments and takes an unaccustomed back seat in some important legislative battles.

title: At Yonkers . . .
description: Noble Wejover is rated as the 52 favorite in tonight's $15,000 Bridgeport Trot. The 4yearold was assigned the outside post in a field of six yesterday, by the racing secretary, Ed Parker. In his last start, Noble Wejover left from the No. 8 slot and breezed to a comfortable 2 length victory. But Gilmour was the driver for Noble Wejover that time, but Carmine Abbatiello will be in the sulky tonight.

title: SHOP TALK
description: People may be more dietconscious every day, but furniture seems to be getting fatter. At least Angelo Donghia's is.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today

title: RAMAPO STUDENTS ASK FOR MEDIATOR
description: MAHWAH, Nov. 28A group of students staged a brief demonstration in the administration building at Ramapo College here today to seek mediation of their request for more financial assistance, student employment and other improvements.

title: CITIES SERVICE IS LEAVING CITY
description: The Cities Service Company, one of the country's major oil companies, announced yesterday that it would move its corporate headquarters from the city to Tulsa, Okla., next summer.

title: Tax Bill for Commuters
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)  Representative William E. Minshall, Republican of Ohio, introduced legislation today to permit commuters a full tax writeoff for mass transit fares for going to and from work. Mr. Minshall said the tax deduction would induce many Americans to ride buses or trains instead of driving to work and would be an important tool not only in easing the current petroleum shortage, but the longterm urban problems of trafifc congestion and air pollution.

title: People and Business
description: Paul S. Mirabito, executive vice president of the Burroughs Corporation, has been named president of the businessmachine company. He succeeds Ray W. Macdonald, who was appointed to the vacant post of chairman and continues as chief executive officer.

title: Trip to the Pound Opens Path to the Show Ring
description: Some people; before buying a dog, carefully research the various breeds. If they decide on one, they go to a dog show where they can see the animal and speak to the owners. With others, it's chance. Mrs. Ben Nolan Dale falls into the second category. We went to a dog pound, she said, and saw a dog we liked. He happened to be a Kerry blue terrier but at the time that meant nothing to us.

title: 90 GAMBLERS HIT BY U.S. TAX RAIDS
description: Flash thrusts in the dawn hours yesterday in the city and Nassau and Suffolk Counties resulted in the serving of 90 known gamblers with massive tax bills.

title: Open Interest
LEONARD TUSHNET, WRITER, PHYSICIAN
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 28  Dr. Leonard Tushnet, a writer who was a physician, died at his home here today at the age of 65.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The American Stock Exchange yesterday issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange did not make such a report available this week.

title: 7.75% Discount Rate Set By Belgian National Bank
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 28 (AP)The Belgian National Bank raised its discount rate today from 7 to 7.75 percent, effective tomorrow.

title: STEINGUT QUERIED ON POLITICAL AIMS
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 28Gov. Stanley Steingut?

title: AMTRAK EXPANSION URGED BY MANSFIELD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 International showed that leader, Mike Mansfield, today urged an expansion of rail passenger service to help alleviate transportation problems created by the energy shortage.

title: Death Penalty Bill Passed
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 28 (AP)The Pennsylvania Senate passed a hill 41 to 7 yesterday that would make this the 22d state to restore capital punishment since the United States Supreme Court decision last year. The House has passed a different version.

title: TV: Cousteau Adventure
description: The estimable Jacques Cousteau and his scientific explorers have now zeroed in on Antarctica with four connecting hourlong decumentaries. The first segment, South to Fire and Ice, tonight at 8 over the American Broadcasting Company television network, is another Cousteau exercise indicating even better to come.

title: China Shifts Currency
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 28 (UPI) China has readjusted the value of its currency, renminbi, from 39.23 to 39.47 per 100 Hong Kong dollars, the Bank of China announced today.

title: Humphrey Faces Queries On a Hughes Political Gift
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota has been asked to tell under oath whether he received a $50,000 political contribution from Howard R. Hughes in 1968, allegedly delivered by a former Hughes aide, Robert A. Maheu.

title: The Arab World: New Solidarity in a Mideast Changed by the Fighting in October
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28The October war has changed the military and political landscape the Middle East.

title: NIXON'S AIDE SAYS ADDITIONAL TAPES HAVE BLANK SPOTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 One of President Nixon's attorneys testified in Federal District Court here today that there were a number of blank sections lasting several minutes each on subpoenaed White House tape recordings.

title: Colonial Coins Stolen
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)  A theft last night at the Springfield Museum of Fine Arts netted two thieves 35 to 50 colonial coins worth $10,000 to $15,000, the police said today. The museum director, Jeffrey R. Brown, labeled the report purely supposition and said that the museum was still taking an inventory to determine the number and value of the missing coins.

title: Notes on People
description: According to Earl L. Butz, Secretary of Agriculture, news about Watergate will be less than a paragrapha mere footnotein the pages of history.

title: City Market Survey Finds Food Prices Up 1.3%
