description: Food prices in the city last week rose 1.3 per cent above the previous week's for the largest increase since midAugust when the Federal freeze on most meat prices was lifted. The increase was reported in the Department of Consumer Affairs Market Basket survey.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: Woodcliff Lake ExMayor Indicted

title: Holiday Flight Warning
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board warned the public yesterday that the jet fuel shortage would cause many flight cancellations during the Christmas holidays. Page 29.

title: Blacks Call Post for Dinkins a Milestone
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame officially named David N. Dinkins yesterday as a Deputy Mayor, an appointment seen by prominent black figures as one of the most significant movements by blacks into the upper echelons of municipal power in this city's history.

title: Korean Reprieve
description: In one of the more anticlimactic events of the diplomatic season, the United Nations General Assembly has wisely deferred for yet another year any change in the old Korean armistice arrangements. This month's debate on the issue, the first in three years, turned into a perfunctory affair instead of the anticipated Communistled assault on the continuing presence of a United Nations Command in South Korea and its garrison 40,000 United States troops.

title: JAMES F. BURNS
description: James F. Burns Jr., senior vice president of Harris Upham & Co., investment brokers, died Monday at the Mary Manning Walsh Home, 1339 York Avtnue, His age was 71, and he lived at 29 East 64th Street.

title: Bridge:
description: The Brazilian domination of South American bridge continues, and seems likely to continue. Earlier this month in Rio de Janeiro, six young Brazilians captured the South American title for the seventh straight year, and did so in convincing style. They thus qualified once again for the world team championship, and will compete in Italy in May against Italy, France, North America, the Far East champions, as yet undetermined, and perAustralia.

title: B.B.C.'s 5Part Nana Will Be Shown Next Week on Channel 13
description: The British Broadcasting Corporation's fivepart dramatization of Emile Zola's Nana, considered too sexually explicit for networking on the Public Broadcasting Service, has been purchased on pooled funds by four public television stations, including New York's WNETTV/Channel 13.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Senators Kill Consumer Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) A bill that would have given the consumer the right to obtain a copy of his credit rating report was killed yesterday by a Senate Banking subcommittee. Senator Wiliam Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, chairman of the Consumer Credit, Subcommittee, who sponsored the hill, said that the 4to2 vote against the measure was a restilt of lobbying by the credit reporting industry.

title: New Dance Works At Cubiculo Make Easygoing Evening
description: Sandra Genter and Judith, Schmukler presented a pleasantly easygoing evening of new dances for themselves and seven other dancers, all women, at the Cubiculo on Tuesday night. Even the few moments of obligatory angst seemed goodhumored.

title: TV's Ethnic Censorship
description: The history of Hollywood filmmaking is studded with examples of bad taste and shoddy exploitation of popular stereotypes. The motion picture industry, in virtually every era, turned out too many films which chased after boxoffice profits by catering to the lowest common denominator of the audience. The Hollywood version of Gresham's Law has been operative from the days of the old Westerns' savage Indians and the thirties' Stepin Fetchit Negroes to the forties' stock characters of Oriental villainy and the current crop brutalized SuperBlacks.

title: Phone Company Leads Industry By Hiring 15 Relief Graduates
description: Lucille Rose, the city's Commissioner of Employment, applauded the New York Telephone Company yesterday for being the first private enterprise to take graduates of the city's new Work Relief Employment Project on its regular staff.

title: INDIA AND SOVIET WILL EXPAND TIES
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 28A Soviet official said tonight that the talks here between Leonid I. Brezhnev and Prime Minister Indira Gandhi would lead to al qualitatively new and positive advancement of relations between India and the Soviet Union.

title: Lindsay Calls for Investigation By City in Case of Severed Head
description: Mayor Lindsay ordered an inquiry yesterday into the unusual circumstances surrounding the severing of a dead woman's head by the Medical Examiner's office before a bullet hole was accidentally found in the head.

title: Big Technical Rally Sends Stocks Soaring 22 Points
description: Stock prices rose sharply esterday in what Wall Street analysts called a technical reboundin the absence of any compelling news developments after the huge selloff of the last five weeks.

title: NIXON TO DISCLOSE HIS FINANCIAL DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (Reuters)  President Nixon plans to release information about his personal finances that will lay to rest misconceptions and allegations of unethical conduct, the White House said today.

title: Stocks in Sharp Rally
description: The stock market staged its biggest rally in three and a half years yesterday as the DowJones industrial average climbed 22.05 points. Page 65.

title: Mrs. King Treated
description: KING OF PRUSSIA, Pa., Nov. 28 (UPI)Mrs. Billie Jean King was taken to a hospital today after complaining of severe stomach pains. Hospital officials said the tennis star was treated for cramps caused by a virus and was discharged. She planned to resume her regular schedule within 24 hours.

title: AID HANDICAPPED, CITY SCHOOLS TOLD
description: The State Education Commissioner, in what one local school official called a historic decision, has directed the Board of Education immediately to place all students with diagnosed handicaps in appropriate public school classes or private schools at public expense.

title: NATO After Yom Kippur
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 28What's the state of the Atlantic alliance, now that the reality of a Mideast war has called all the rhetorical bluffs?

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Maine Is for the Song Birds
description: When snow covers the ground and the bare bones of trees are stark against leaden skies, there is much pleasure to be had in attractin song birds about the house with one or more feeding Stations.

title: FoulUp on Foul Air
description: The conflicting orders issued by state and city environmental authorities on what fuel Consolidated Edison can and cannot burn in the energy crisis threaten to push New York City into a blackout by bureaucracy.

title: Flamenco Tradition Gets Embellishment By Paco de Lucia
description: Flamenco guitar playing Is in its rococo phase, and Paco de Lucia stands out as one of the more accomplished practitioners of this declining art. Like other recently fledged virtuosos, he specializes in solo recitals (the older flamenco guitarist was part of an eniemble of dancers and singers and only played solos as occasional relief so the others could catch their breaths).

title: The Egg Falls Victim To Cholesterol Fears; Industry Ads Defend It
description: The egg has fallen on hard times, primarily the victim of anticholesterol admonitions that this year will help to push annual egg consumption in this country below 300 per person for the first time since 1935.

title: Yugoslav Contract Is Won By Westinghouse Electric
description: KRSKO, Yugoslavia, Nov. 28 (AP)The first nuclear power plant in Yugoslavia will be built by Westinghouse Electric Corporation, it was announced today.

title: Pickets Here Protest Shift of Warehouse From Jersey
description: About 1,500 workers, representing a half dozen unions, demonstrated in front of Concord Fabrics, Inc., 1411 Broadway, near 40th Street, yesterday charging that the company had dismissed about 80 employes at its North Bergen, N. J., warehouse and transferred the operations to the South.

title: Rockefeller Plaza Tree To Have Fewer Lights
description: The traditional Christmas tree at Rockefeller Plaza will be lighted on Dec. 6  but with what has been described as a minimum amount of electricity.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy showed a slight upturn in October, based on preliminary figures, after a large drop in September, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Ferry Accord Reached
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 28 (AP)Striking ferry boat pilots have reached agreement on a threeyear contract that ends a twomonth walkout against Casco Bay Lines.

title: Argentina Denies Reports of Granting Vesco a Haven From Extradition to United States
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 The Government of Argentina denied today published reports that it had granted a permanent resident visa to Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive United States financier.

title: MORRIS H. KLEIN
description: WYNCOTE, Pa., Nov. 28Morris H. Klein, a retired sales and manufacturing executive of Sandoz Colors and Chemical Companyip Hanover, N.J., died of a heart attack today in a hospital here. He was 76 years old.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)American League baseball officials are studying ways the nation's energy shortage may affect airline travel by clubs and the scheduling night games. Bob Holbrook, executive assistant to Joe Cronin, American. League president, said today, What we have to do is plan now and prepare the options.

title: City Joining SteppedUp Efforts To Burn Garbage for Electricity
description: Government officials are stepping up efforts to generate electricity from garbage as oil supplies dwindle, but the first power from garbage is not expected to flow here for at least two and a half years.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Insulation has ranked high as a way to save on home heating costs and on fuel expenditures, yet more than twothirds of the 45 million homes in the United States do not have proper insulation, according to George J. Haufler, executive vice president of the Certainteed Products Corporation, a company that sells insulation material.

title: Jersey Vehicle Official Convicted of Speeding
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov 28 (AP)  Ray J. Marini, who heads the state office responsible for warning drivers about speeding and other vehicle violations, was found guilty today of speeding on the New Jersey Turnpike last month.

title: DR. JOAN GILES, 54, OF N.Y.U. MEDICAL
description: Dr. Joan P. Giles, research associate professor of pediatrics at the New York University School of Medicine, died yesterday of cancer at the Presbyterian Hospital. She was 54 years old and lived at 134 Brightwood Avenue, Westfield, N. J., with her husband, Frederick Giles, an engineer.

title: MISSIONARIES' SON MISSING IN BRAZIL
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Nov. 26 A former Brazilian state Congressman who is a son of American missionaries was arrested here in early September and has since disappeared.

title: Articles of Impeachment
description: Impeachment is at one and the same time a political and a legal process. The Constitution specifies the legal grounds, however vaguely, as treason, bribery or other high crimes and misdemeanors. It also recognizes the political nature of the process by designating Congress as the special court to institute and adjudge the impeachment proceedings.

title: Two Rights Groups Charge Resistance to School Desegregation Has Led to Expulsion of Many Blacks
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28Continuing resistance to desegregation has led to the suspension or expulsion of extraordinarily large and disproportionate numbers of blacks from Southern schools, two civil rights groups charged today.

title: Peron's Illness: A Political Void Is Feared
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 28The days pass and although President Juan D. Pekin was supposed to be back at Government House, he remained at his suburban mansion, dressed in his dark satin bathrobe recuperating from what has officially been described as a bronchial condition. Some think I am ready to he thrown to the cats, but, no, not yet, the 78 year  old leader told a nationwide television audience in a 90second broadcast last Friday night from his home to diespel rumors that his sudden illness of last week had left him near death.

title: Philharmonic Ready for the Downbeat
description: The New York Philharmonic has been standing ready for 10 weeks with a simple plan for resuming its strikeinterrupted season immediately upon settlement of the contract dispute. The season will pick up the regularly scheduled concert on the Thursday night following ratification. The orchestra's heartbeat begins again as if the orchestra has been in a state of suspended animation.

title: Chess: A Verity of Opening Theory Nothing Is True Forever
description: At the United States Open in 194G in Pittsburgh, an unknown woodpusher approached the late Herman Steiner between rounds and asked to he taught how to play a variation of the Two Knights' Defense, The genial California master obliged with detailed battle plans that spelled Black's demise, only to be greeted by a second question not 20 minutes later from the same woodpusher: Now, how do I win in that variation when I have Black?

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was: 80035 Tickets matching the number win $2,500 tickets, with the five numbers in reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last tour numbers in order win $225. Tickets with the first, Middle or last three numbers in sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second and third, the third end fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: 40 Die as Fire Sweeps Through Store in Japan
description: KUMAMOTO Hapan, Thursday, Nov. 29 (AP)A fire raged out of control in a crowded department store today, and the police reported that 40 persons had been killed and 28 had been injured.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MONTCLAIR, Nov. 28If Jay H. Reichbach, director of the North American Wilderness Survival School, has his way, youngsters interested in hunting or fishing will learn how to live in the woods without need of rifles or rods.

title: Adamle an Artful Dodger On, Off Field
description: There are two aspects of Mike Adamle's physical appearance that are at once striking and repeatedly prompt two questions:

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 20:

title: 68 and 90% Make 11/28 in City Seem More Like a 7/28
description: Many New Yorkers donned light clothing yesterday as warm, muggy weatherwhich the National Weather Service attributed to conditions that usually prevail in Julymoved into the area.

title: U. S. Maritime Industry Reports It Can Operate With Less Fuel
description: The maritime industry expressed confidence here yesterday that it would be able to maintain adequate services despite reduced fuel allocations.

title: BILL ON ELECTIONS REPORTED CURBED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Leaders of the House and Senate apparently reached agreement today to reduce dramatically the scope of the campaignfinancing bill that was passed by the Senate yesterday.

title: Text of Declaration After the Arab Leaders' Meeting
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 28 (UPI)Following, in unofficial translation from the French, is the text of the declaration by the meeting of Arab heads of state that concluded here today:

title: Role of Banks in Stolen Stock Is Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28An undercover man for the Government has alleged that loan officers from many of the country's leading banks are involved in stolenstock schemes.

title: Schools, Facing Shortages, Intent on Remaining Open
description: With the energy outlook appearing grimmer by the day, school officials around the nation are striving with increasing urgency to conserve energy and to keep the schools open.

title: Food Lovers, Don't despair There Is Life in the
description: After more than a century of erosion, the food scene in America is a dreary moonscape. Yet there is life, for an outpouring of books about food shows that many Americans know that something delicious is missing from their lives.

title: Russians Accuse French Of Imperiling Special Tie
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28The Soviet press published its first tdirect criticism of France today for having derided collaboration between Washington and Moscow and for having advocated tighter coordination in Western Europe on political and defense policies.

title: CITY CITES PLEDGE BY U.S. FOR FUEL
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration said yesterday that it had received private assurances from the Federal Government that when emergency national fuelallocation priorities were established, New York would be one of the first cities to get any available lowsulphur fuels and would be one of the last to be asked to burn coal for energy.

title: Contract Ratified At Philharmonic; Museum Vote Set
description: Striking musicians last night ratified a new threeyear contract with the New York Philharmonic Society, ending a 10week walkout that had compelled the orchestra to cancel all performances since Sept. 25.

title: The Ford Nomination as a Way Out
description: WASHINGTONThe choice of Gerald Ford to be Vice President is, of all Mr. Nixon's personal political decisions, both the worst and the best he has ever made. Worst because Ford as Vice President will prove fatal to Mr. Nixon's efforts to retain the Presidency; best in that the country in the weeks and months ahead will see the end of the nightmare of the Nixon Presidency and a transition of power into a Ford Presidency that is both honest and competent.

title: '71 Inquiry on Richmond S.B.A. Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The former head of the Philadelphia regional office of the Small Business Administration declared before a House subcommittee today that he would not he the fall guy for loan activities in the agency's Richmond office that are under scrutiny.

title: Stocks in Sharp Rally
description: The stock market staged its biggest rally in three and a half years yesterday as the DowJones industrial average climbed 22.05 points. Page 65.

title: ADAM TREPEL DEAD RETIRED FLORIST, 90
description: Adam Trepel, who at one time owned 27 florist shops in Brooklyn and Manhattan, died Tuesday at his home, 1 St Paul's Court, Brooklyn. He was 90 years old and had retired] 20 years ago.

title: Splendid Rationing
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Prompted to look back, it now seems to me splendid how the strict rationing in wartime Britain cleared the streets. The only traffic people in a small town saw was a bus or a taxi, a van or two, a doctor's or a farmer's car, a dispatch rider's motor bicycle or an odd convoy of lorries. A marvelous calm spaciousness revealed the skeleton of the towns. For years this was to me simply how life was. The inconveniences of carlessness never struck me. The only way I felt personally involved, as a schoolgirl, was with the business of marketing.

title: PRESSURE IS CITED IN MATTHEW CASE
description: An investigator for a House subcommittee dealing with smallbusiness matters has testified during public hearings in Washington that the White House tried to get the SmallBusiness Administration to burn its files on Dr. Thomas W. Matthew.

title: HAYES REDMON
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)Hayes Redmon, a former assistant press secretary to President Johnson, died here yesterday. He was 42 years old.

title: Coach Wilt Has Identity Problem Player Wilt Didn't
description: He straightened up after clearing the doorway from his plane ramp at La Guardia Airport yesterday, and as he walked into the bright light of the terminal people stopped and just stared. Up.

title: Hope for Harlem Prep
description: When Harlem Prep went into the precarious business of salvaging School dropouts and grooming them for admission to college, Edward Carpenter, its headmaster, said that he put more faith in the teachers' unshakable faith that the students can make it than in any specific methods. In the six years that followed, 637 students rewarded their teachers' faith by making it, many them into the nation's leading universities.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Trip to the Pound Opens Path to the Show Ring
description: Some people, before buying a dog, carefully research the various breeds. If they decide on one, they go to a dog show where they can see the animal and speak to the owners. With others, it's chance. Mrs. Ben Nolan Dale falls into the second category. We went to a dog pound, she said, and saw a dog we liked. He happened to be a Kerry blue terrier but at the time that meant nothing to us.

title: Mrs. Everett Seen Losing Padres' Bid
description: The purchase of the San Diego Padres by a group headed by Mrs. Marjorie (Marji) Lindheimer Everett will be voted on next Thursday by the National League club owners at their annual winter meetings in Houston.

title: Chile Wants Soviet To Pay $200,000
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 28 (AP)Chile said today she would ask the Soviet Union to pay $200,000 for not sending its soccer team here for a World Cup elimination game, The Russians refused in protest against the overthrow of the Marxist Allende regime.

title: 51% in Gallup Poll Believe in U.F .0.'s; 11% Note Sightings
description: A Gallup survey released yesterday found that 51 per cent of those persons interviewed believe that unidentified flying objects, sometimes called flying saucers, are real and not just a figment of the imagination or cases of hallucination.

title: Boyle to Face Trial Feb. 25 In the Killing of Yablonski
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 28The trial of W. A. Boyle former president of the United Mine Workers who has been charged with conspiracy in the murder of Joseph A. Yablonski, a union insurgent, has been set for Feb. 25.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Del Bello Gives Yonkers Aide No. 2 County Job
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 28Westchester County's first Democratic County Executive, Mayor Alfred P. Del Bello of Yonkers, reached next door today to fill the No. 2 post of executive officer in his new administration.

title: Gas Pipeline Ruptures
description: MANHATTAN, Kan., Nov. 28 (UPI)A twofoot wide pipeline carrying natural gas from Texas to Michigan ruptured near here late yesterday, shooting flames 150 feet into the air and showering a pasture with steel. No injuries were reported.

title: Rangers Brace for Flyers
description: Philadelphia likes to hawk itself as the City of Brotherly Love, but that concept necessarily excludes the unfraternal Philadelphia Flyers, as the New York Rangers well know. The Rangers play the Flyers tonight at the Spectrum in Philadelphia (8 P.M., Channel 9 in New York) in the first of five meetings this season.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: A Decent Respect
description: If one man is allowed to determine for himself what is law, every man can. That means first chaos, then tyranny.

title: Chessie Rebuffs TakeOver Bid
description: The management of Chessie System, Inc., which owns the Chesapeake & Ohio and Baltimore & Ohio Railroads, said yesterday it had flatly rejected an offer of certain individuals who had indicated their interest in acquiring control of the $2.5billion holding Company.

title: SOOTHE COMPUTER REDUCES ITS LOSS
description: The Boothe Computer Corporation, the financially troubled computer leasing concern, whose proposed acquisition by is subsidiary of the Flying Tiger Corporation was mutually terminated on Monday, reduced its loss in the three and nine months ended Sept. 30. The report yesterday also showed lower revenues for the periods.

title: K.G.B. Interview of Wife Is Opposed by Sakharov
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28Andrei D. Sakharov, the dissident atomic physicist, posed a new challenge to Soviet authorities today by asserting that he objected to further interrogations of his wife and took entire responsibility for her refusal to appear.

title: U. S. Forecasts A Mixed WinterMaybe
description: While much of the central United States is expected to have a mild winter, helping to conserve scarce fuel, the prospects for the Eastern Seaboard are a tossup, according to a longrange forecast made public yesterday by the National; Weather Service.

title: High School Sports
description: In a gym on West 61st Street, Kareem AbdulJabbar became famous as Lew Alcindor. As a star at Power Memorial Academy, he developed into one of the most soughtafter high school basketball players. Now, almost a decade later, the good players still go to Power.Last Saturday, Power, led by this season's star, Bob Misevicius, played a sixperiod practice game against Long Island Lutheran, The gym was almost empty except for the players, coaches and the everpresent college recruiters. A pairing like this for a regular game could draw several thousand spectators.

title: GOING OUT
description: LUNCH BREAK The new show at Theater at Noon, the midday series at St. Peter's Center, 16 East 56th Street (7534669), is called A Day in the Port Authority. It's a comedy by Gloria Gonzalez, performed by Ann Hodapp and Tony Lang, and has nothing much to do with the big bistate agency except that it is set in its bus terminal.

title: California Court Adopts Redistricting That May Increase Democratic Majority in U.S. House
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov, 28The California Supreme Court adopted today a redistricting plan that may increase the Democratic majority in the United States House of Representatives and is expected to put many state legislative incumbents out of office.

title: A Cambodian Respite From War's Tension
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 28The war has not gone away, but Phnom Penh is enjoyingif that is the worda brief respite from the tension of recent months.

title: Arthur Daley
description: These have been distracting days for Gabe Paul, president of the New York Yankees. He's been having considerable difficulty in getting work done because he has kept staring at his telephone in hypnotic fascination The only phone call that could break the spell would be one from Joe Cronin, the president of the American League. The hope was that this call would settle the status of Dick Williams and the Yankee managership.

title: AntiErasure Safeguards Of Tape Device Detailed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The tape recorder that President Nixon's personal secretary, Rose Mary Woods, has testified she used to transcribe a conversation of June 20, 1972, between the President and his former chief of staff, H. R. Haldeman, has builtin protections against inadvertent erasures.

title: White House Proposes AmbulancetoHospital Radios
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28A plan to set aside ample radio frequencies for emergency medical service networks all over the country was made public today by the White House Office of Teleconununications Policy.

title: Israelis find Letter Bomb; The Fourth in Two Days
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 28 (Reuters) Another letter bomb, the fourth in two days, was intercepted here today without causing any damage, a police spokesman said.

title: State Examiner Is Indicted In DriverLicense Fraud
description: An examiner for the State Department of Motor Vehicles here was indicted yesterday on charges of having frauudulently approved forged applications for drivers' licenses by ineligible convicts or persons with physical defects.

title: Patriarca Case Dropped
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Nov. 28 (UPI)Two indictments against, Raymond L. S. Patriarca, reputed head of organized crime in southern New England, were dismissed yesterday in Rhode Island Superior Court because of the state's failure to grant Patriarca speedy trials demanded by his attorneys three years ago.

title: Pioneer Indicates That Jupiter Has a Strange Magnetic Field
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. Nov. 28 (Reuters)The tiny unmanned spacecraft Pioneer 10 today began to plumb the mysteries of the giant planet Jupiter as it appeared to report back a magnetic field of a shape never seen on earth.

title: Senate Inquiry's Uncertain Future: Panel Viewed as Treading Watergate for the Moment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28It flashed suddenly and brilliantly, onto the nation's television screens six months ago, but now the Senate Watergate Committee is fading from sight like a comet on an awesome yet brief circuit across the night sky.

title: At Yonkers ...
description: Noble Wejover is rated as the 5.2 favorite in tonight's $15,000 Bridgeport Trot. The 4yearold was assigned the outside post in a field of six yesterday, by the racing secretary, Ed Parker. In his last start, Noble Wejover left from the No. 8, slot and breezed to a comfortable 2 length victory. But Gilmour was the driver for Noble Wejover that time, but Carmine Abbatiello will be in the sulky tonight.

title: ADVANCE ON AMEX ENDS 2DAY DROP
description: The twoday drop in prices on the American Stock Exchange was halted yesterday by a spirited afternoon rally that enabled them to close considerably higher. Prices in the overthecounter market were also up.

title: Death of Student, 21, on L.I. Laid to Overdose of Drugs
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., Nov. 28 (UPI)  An autopsy completed today disclosed that a 21yearold C. W. Post College student from Westchester County died in his dormitory room in Greenvale from an overdose of drugs.

title: Despite the Hisses, The Fashion Show Was Mostly Funny
description: It was the kind of fashion show you don't often see in New York: The models had ample bosoms and hips, the men cheered wildly while the women hissed mildly, and the clothes, well, they were perhaps the best the country has to offer in the way of schlock frocks and passion fashions.

title: David N. Dinkins
description: Between appointments yesterday, David Norman Dinkins, the newly appointed Deputy Mayor for Planning, paused in his hectic schedule to settle into a phone booth, remove his jacket and spend nearly an hour on the telephone returning business calls and making appointments. It was an inauspicious setting, not half as glamorous as his midtown office, where he is a partner in the law firm of Paterson, Michael, Dinkins and Jones. But it was in line with his style of doing things, efficient and effective despite the setting. These are the two words that friends and associates most often use to describe the 46yearold former president of the Board of Elections.

title: Celtics Greet an ExStar With 12th Victory in Row
New Wage Bill Pressed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)Legislation was introduced in the Senate to raise the minimum wage to $2.20 an hour, 60 cents above the current level. The bill is similar to a measure that was vetoed as inflationary by President Nixon Sept. 6.

title: MRS. REUBEN R. JENSEN
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28Mrs, Jo Thurston Jensen of Northville, the, wife of Reuben R. Jensen, General Motors group vice president with jurisdiction over overseas operations, died here lyesterday. The Jensens also maintained a home in New York at 303 East 57th Street.

title: Care for Released Mental Patients Urged
description: A group of parents of patients in state mental institutions met yesterday with representatives of business and city and state governments to ask support for a plan for the care and rehabilitation of patients once they are discharged.

title: Management Promotions Approved by Times Board
description: Extensive promotions in the top management ranks of The New York Times Company, effective immediately, were approved by the board of directors and announced yesterday.

title: Carter Group Planning to Acquire Unit
description: Carter Group, Inc., announced yesterday it anticipated making a merger proposal to its 51 per centowned subsidiary, the Utilities & Industries Corporation, under which each shareholder of Utilities & Industries would receive $35 a share in cash.

title: F.P.C. Nominee Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 28 (AP)  The Senate confirmed today Don S. Smith of Arkansas as a member of the Federal Power Commission. Mr. Smith, who will serve until June 22, 1978, succeeds John A, Carver Jr.

title: STEEL PRICE RISE SEEN SPREADING
description: Other major steel producers almost certainly will follow the United Slates Steel Corporation in seeking higher prices for long list of items, steel industry sources said yesterday.

title: Ballet Negotiators Set Dec. 6 Deadline On Fate of Season
description: Negotiators for the New York City Ballet said last night that they would recommend to their directors cancellation of the entire 14week fall season if they did not have a new contract with their union musicians by next Thursday.

title: Robert J. McKim, ExChairman Of Associated Dry Goods, Dies
description: Robert J. McKim, former board chairman of the Associated Dry Goods Corporation, died on Tuesday in St. Luke's Hospital, apparently following a coronary occlusion. He was 78 years old and lived in Lake Wales, Fla.

title: DAIMLER BENZ CUTS SOME PLANT OUTPUT
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Nov. 28 (AP)  Daimler Benz became today the third Weston German automobile manufacturer to announce shorttime shifts in some of its commercialvehicle plants because of fewer orders.

title: Arabs Halt Oil to Portugal, Rhodesia and South Africa
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 28Arab chiefs of state, ending their conference here today, announced an embargo on oil exports to Portugal, Rhodesia and South Africa and conditionally endorsed Arab efforts toward a Middle East peace settlement.

title: Plan for PeaceTalk Start Said to Omit Palestinians
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed that ArabIsraeli peace negotiations should begin next month without the participation of Palestinian representatives, a wellinformed diplomat said today.

title: Holiday Flight Warning
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board warned the public yesterday that the jet fuel shortage would cause many flight cancellations during the Christmas holidays. Page 29.

title: PRESSURE IS CITED IN MATTHEW CASE
description: An investigator for a House subcommittee dealing with smallbusiness matters has testified during public hearings in Washington that the White House tried to get the SmallBusiness Administration to burn its files on Dr. Thomas W. Matthew.

title: ADDITIONS PROPOSED FOR WILDLIFE. AREAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  President Nixon proposed today, in a special message to Congress, that 12 areas embracing more than a million acres be added to the National Wilderness Preservation Systern.

title: HOUSE DELAYS VOTE ON PENSION REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Rouse Democratic leaders announced today that legislation for the reform of private pension programs would not be brought to the floor until January.

title: Books of The Times
description: I find Robert Frost's statements about poetry fully as poetic as his poems. In fact, I feel that some of them are even more poetic. This is not to be taken as a disparaging of the poems. It is simply that have never heard anyoneincluding T. S. Eliotsay so many apt, eloquent, original, unexpected, farreaching, helpful and practical things about the writing of poetry. Mr. Frost must surely be the world's most quotable critic.

title: AGENT DESCRIBES WHITE HOUSE LINK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 An undercover agent has told Senate investigators that, despite White House denials, he made perhaps 10 or 15 telephone calls to the White House last July in an effort to alert staffers there to the halting of a narcotics investigation after it led to Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier.

title: NIGERIANS ACCEPT RECORD OIL OFFER
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 28 (Reuters)The Nigerian Government has accepted a record offer of $16.40 a barrel for its oil, informed sources said today. The offer was understood to have been made by a number of oil companies.

title: Auto Price Ruling Near
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  John T. Dunlop, director of the Cost of Living Council, said today that the council would announce on Friday or Saturday its decision on proposed new increases in the cost of 1974 new automobiles.

title: Community Aide Charges Corruption in Brownsville
description: Major R. Owens, the city's Commissioner of Community Development, yesterday demanded Federal and other investigations of what he called corruption and conflicts of interest in the Brownsville local school and antipoverty programs and of the cite of teachers union funds.

title: Producers of Christmas Lights See Industry Losing Its Glow
description: Makers of decorative Christmas lights said yesterday that they were threatened with extinction because of President Nixon's proposed ban on outdoor Christmas lighting.

title: Heavy Mayonnaise, Once a Claimer, Wins Remsen and Moves Up a Shelf
description: Heavy Mayonnaise, a colt who had been in claiming races only recently, is now regarded as one of the foremost campaigners among 2yearolds as a result of winning the Remsen at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Douglas Links Lobbies To the Energy Crisis
description: BUFFALO, Nov, 25 (UPI) Supreme Court Justice WiIliann O. Douglas said last night that the current energy crisis had been caused by powerful corporate lobbies.

title: Miami Seeking Nightclub Singer In the Hospital Killing of Mother
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 (UPI) Mrs. Mary Axelson Cropper was being sought by the police today for questioning about the death of her 82yearold mother, Mrs. Mary McDougal Axelson, a playwright and artist, who was beaten in a hospital TOM.

title: IDENTITY PAPER FOR EUROPE SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Diplomats reported today that the nine member countries of the European Common Market were secretly drafting a European identity paper to be issued as a declaration next month at a meeting of heads of governments.

title: NIXON'S AIDE SAYS ADDITIONAL TAPES HAVE BLANK SPOTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov., 28 One of President Nixon's attorneys testified in Federal District Court here today that there were a number of blank sections lasting several minutes each on subpoenaed White House tape recordings.

title: New Board Is Asked for Capital Markets
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 28 A new Government board is needed to preserve the capital markets, the chairman of Securities Industry Association said here today.

title: 5,000 Students Rally in Seoul As Protests Go Intro the 3d Day
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 28 AntiGovernment demonstrations by South Korean university students continued for the third day today with nearly 5,000 students participating in six protests here.

title: GEORGE AUERBACH, FILM WRITER, DIES
description: George Auerbach, a stage and film writer and producer who was currently a consultant to the American Broadcasting Company, died of a heart attack in Exeter (N. H.) Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Kittery Point, Me.

title: TAKEOVER VOTED FOR HARLEM PREP
description: The city's Board of Education voted last night to take over Harlem Prep as of Feb. 1. It also agreed to settle out of court a series of suits by teachers dismissed in the early nineteenfifties during investigations into Communist influences

title: CITY CITES PLEDGE BY U.S. FOR FUEL
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration said yes. terday that it had received private assurances from the Federal Government that when emergency national fuelallocation priorities were established, New York would be one of the first cities to get any available lowsulphur fuels and would be one of the last to be asked to burn coal for energy.

title: Plan for PeaceTalk Start Said to Omit Palestinians
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed that ArabIsraeli peace negotiations should begin next month without the participation of Palestinian representatives, a wellinformed diplomat said today.

title: RATIONING OF GAS APPEARS LIKELY, PLANNERS ASSERT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Administration is moving toward rationing of gasoline, although no formal decision to take such a step has so far been made, energy planners in two Federal agencies said today.

title: Philharmonic Ready for the Downbeat
description: The New York Philharmonic has been standing ready for 10 weeks with a simple plan for resuming its strikeinterrupted season immediately upon settlement of the contract dispute. The season will pick up the regularly scheduled concert on the Thursday night following ratification. The orchestra's heartbeat begins again as if the orchestra has been in a state of suspended animation.

title: Democrats Are Said to Plan Convention at Kansas City
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)The Democrats plan to hold their 1974 miniconvention in Kansas City, Mo., and a formal decision is expected within two weeks, party sources said today.

title: TaxAnticipation Bills Sold by the Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Following are the results of the $3  billion taxanticipation bills offered by the United States Treasury in a competitive sale today:

title: Witness Says a Revenue Agent Asked Him to Testify Falsely Against Rinaldi
description: A Long Island automobile salesman said that he told a Federal grand jury yesterday that an Internal Revenue Service agent had asked him testify falsely against Justice Dominic S. Rinaldi of the State Supreme Court, who is under indictment.

title: Harry Ferleger, Directed Philadelphia Civic Center
description: PHILADELPHIA. Nov, 28 Harry Ferleger, retired executive director of the board of the Philadelphia Civic Center and Museum, which he served from 1955 to 1972, died today in Hahneman Hospital. He was 60 years old.

title: Greenwich Christmas Bazaar Shines Without Holiday Lights
description: GREENWICH. Conn., Nov. 28 The 16th annual Christmas bazaar that opens here tomorrow is, like the town, observing the edict against the decorative lighting that, for as long as most people here can remember, has been a hallmark of the holiday season.

title: Personal Finance
description: Rodney Dangerfield, the comedian, is always griping that I don't get no respect. In much the same spirit, the small investor is always complaining that nobody loves him.

title: Agreement Reached in Orchestra Strike
description: A tentative agreement was reached late yesterday that was expected to end the 10weekold musicians' strike that had forced the New York Philharmonic to cancel all its performances since Sept. 25.

title: UNIT OF METROMEDIA IS SOUGHT BY TIMES
description: An agreement in principle was announced yesterday for the sale of the assets of the musicpublishing companies of Metromedia, Inc., to The New York Times Music Corporation, a subsidiary of The New York Times Company.

title: TV: Catholics, Landmark for PrimeTime Drama
description: Catholics, a 90minute production being presented on the Columbia Broadcasting System tonight at 9, is Brian Moore's television adaptation of his own highly acclaimed novella. Quite simply, it represents a most significant and most encouraging landmark for drama on commercial television.

title: Arabs Halt Oil to Portugal, Rhodesia and South Africa
description: STAOUELI, Algeria, Nov. 28Arab chiefs of state, ending their conference here today, announced an embargo oil exports to Portugal, Rhodesia and South Africa and conditionally endorsed Arab efforts toward a Middle East peace settlement. ditionally endorsed Arab efforts toward a Middle East peace settlement.

title: H.U.D. Scores Newark Rent Reduction
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28S. William Green, regional administrator of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development, today vigorously attacked a court order reducing rents in the Stella Wright housing project here by 80 per cent and suggesting that the project be razed if multiple housing violations could not be corrected.

title: Knicks Lose 4th Straight By 114106
description: The Houston Rockets beat the Knicks, 114106, last night in a game of strange happenings at Madison Square Garden.

title: 420,000 G.M. Employes Begin Ratification Vote on 3Year Pact
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (UPI)The 420,000 hourly employes of the General Motors Corporation began voting today on a new threeyear contract as union leaders predicted major layoffs in the coming year because of slumping sales of large model cars.

title: Surgery Fund Aided By Marijuana Dealers
description: DAVIE, Fla., Nov. 28 (UPI)A group calling itself the Broward County Marijuana Dealers Association pitched in yesterday to help a bank here raise funds to pay for a child's heart operation.

title: Trenton Hospital Strike Now in 10th Week
description: TRENTON, Nov. 28  A strike of 225 hospital workers it the Helene Fuld Memorial Hospital here is now in its 10th. week, and shows no sign of being resolved, according to hospital and union spokesmen. Unlike hospitals in New York City, which had difficulty providing patient care during a sevenday strike, Helene Fuld, a 375bed voluntary nonprofit hospital, has carried on all es, sential services, by hiring about 180 temporary employes.

title: DENTIST EXPLORES BONE BREAKDOWN
description: A New York dentist has formulated a hypothesis he thinks could explain why some people brush their teeth regularly and still have gum diseases, while others are irregular about brushing but do not develop such disorders.

title: Morton Approves a Test Move For Using Deposits of Oil Shale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)  Interior Secretar) Rogers C. B. Morton gave his approval today for initial experimental development of the Federal Government's vast oil shale deposits in the Western states.

title: Bank Robber Captured
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 28 (UPI)  Janet I, Awdard, 19 years old, wanted for a pair of bank robberies in New York and Virginia, was captured yesterday at a Hollywood motel, the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported today.

title: TV Blackout: Criticism Grows
description: As the pro football season nears its end, evidence is accumulating that, abolition of the television blackout of soldout home games has proved a mixed blessing for those it was intended to help: the home viewer's. Under the new system, the quantity and quality of National Football League play available to home viewers have decreased, and an increasing number of complaints have been received by newspapers and the N.F.L. office.

title: SEOUL BARS TERMS OF NORTH ON TALKS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 28North Korea said today that it would agree under certain conditions to a South Korean proposal to resume next month the suspended Red Cross talks for family reunions. But the conditions were termed unacceptable by South Korea.

title: FRED S. WEITZNER
description: Fred S. Weitzner, a lawyer long active in the real estate field and a past president of the Building Industry League, died yesterday at his home, 215 East 68th Street. He was 71 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LUNCH BREAK The new show at Theater at Noon, the midday series at St. Peter's Center, 16 East 56th Street (7534669), is called A Day in the Port Authority, It's a comedy by Gloria Gonzalez, performed by Ann Hodapp and Tony Lang, and has nothing much to do with the big bistate agency except. that it is set in its bus terminal.

title: Jaworski Aide Robbed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The home of an assistant special Watergate prosecutor, Jill Volner, was burglarized yesterday, but both the Police Department and the office of the special prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, said today that the robbery was routine.

title: Judah Gribetz
description: A quarter century ago, Judah Gribetz traveled the subways daily to his Columbia University classes from the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, where he lived at Union Street and Nostrand Avenue, and where he worshiped in the same synagogue as another Crown Heights resident in those days, Abraham D. Beame of Carroll Street. In more recent years, Mr. Gribetz has traveled daily to his I home in the Belle Harbor section of the Rockaways, Queens, where he has often seen Mr. Beamehimself now a parttime Belle Harbor residenton the nearby beach.

title: Judge Orders Kleindienst To Testify at LSD Trial
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 28 (AP) Richard G. Kleindienst has been ordered by a Federal judge to testify in the trial, of seven persons accused of smuggling eight ounces of LSD into San Diego County.

title: GOLD PRICE SOARS TO $101 IN EUROPE
description: PARIS, Nov. 28Investors staged the greatest gold rush today since the dollar crisis last July, bidding the metal up nearly $10 an ounce to $101 in London and Zurich and forcing a new record for gold coins here.

title: Concert: Israeli Talent
description: The AmericaIsrael Cultural Foundation, a strong supporter of the arts in Israel and of cultural interaction between the two countries, presented the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra in a benefit concert at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH CUP

title: Profits Off in Quarter for McCrory, Zayre and Good
A.L. Picks Bumbry as Top Rookie
description: Al Bumbry, a 26yearold Vietnam veteran who had a 337 batting average, hit seven home runs and drove in 34 runs for the Baltimore Orioles, yesterday was named the American League's rookie of the year. He received 13 votes of 24 cast by the Baseball Writers' Association and became the oldest player to win the award since Gary Peters of the Chicago White Sox did it at the same age 10 years ago. Pedro Garcia of Milwaukee was the runnerup, trailing by 10 votes.

title: Heavy Mayonnaise, Once a Claimer, Wins Remsen and Moves Up a Shelf
description: Heavy Mayonnaise, a colt who had been in claiming races only recently, is now regarded as one of the foremost campaigners among 2yearolds as a result of winning the Remsen at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Watts Out of 2 Concerts
description: Andr Watts, the pianist who was scheduled to appear with the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center at Tully Hall next Sunday and Tuesday will not play in those concerts, and the Brahms Piano Quintet in F minor announced for the programs will he replaced by Elgar's Piano Quintet in A minor. Richard Goode will be the pianist in the Elgar work, and Charles Wadsworth, pianist, will perform with Jaime Laredo in Grieg's Violin Sonata in C minor. Mr, Watts has been scheduled to appear with the Society in April, 1975.

title: Licenses for Scrap Metal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The Commerce Department today announced it would license up to 2.1 million tons of ferrous scrap metal for export in the first quarter of 1974. The exports will be allocated by country on the basis of the amounts the countries received during a three year period from July 1, 1970 through June 30, 1973.

title: Jerome D. Schwitzer Dead; U.S. Magistrate in Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 28 (AP)United States Magistrate Jerome D. Schwitzer of Inter laken, whose career as a Federal legal official spanned more than 20 years, died today, apparently of a heart attack, in his chambers here, He was 65 years old.

title: Jersey Senate Gets Bonds Plan Today
description: TRENTON, Nov. 28Legis lation containing the state's moral pledge to back the bonds needed to finance the $280million sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands is expected to pass the State Senate tomorrow, legislative leaders said today. But one Republican leader said, It will be no leadpipe cinch.

title: SENATE BACKS MORE FOR MEDICARE DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Senate approved today an amendment to a pending Social Security bill that would expand benefits under the Medicare program to include payment for prescription drugs that are needed for chronic illnesses by persons who are not hospitalized. The Medicare program of helth insurance for the elderly now covers no drug costs for persons outside of hospitals.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Building Operators Learn How to Use Less Energy
description: In a room where body heat and sweaters provided the warmth, and only 4 of 55 overhead lighting fixturesalong with eight windows cleared of their drapes  provided the light, a group of building owners and managers yesterday began to learn how to save electricity and steam to counter the energy crisis.

title: Blacks Call Post for Dinkins a Milestone
description: Mayorelect Abraham D. Beame officially named David N. Dinkins yesterday as a Deputy Mayor, an appointment seen by prominent black figures as one of the most significant movements by blacks into the upper echelons of municipal power in this city's history.

title: MANPOWER MEASURE APPROVED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The House approved today compromise overhaul of Federal manpower programs, ending long battle with the Nixon Administration over the legislation.

title: Dow Jones Is Expanding
description: Dow Jones & Co., Inc., the publisher of The Wall Street Journal, said yesterday that it had bought 6.7 acres of land in Orlando, Fla., for construction of a printing plant. The facility would be completed by late 1974 and be in operation in 1975, the company said.

title: Canadiens Down Kings On 5Goal First Period
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 28 (UPI) Pete Mahovlich and Guy Lapointe scored twice apiece for Montreal during its fivegoal opening period tonight to help the Canadiens celebrate Frank Mahovlich Night with a 53 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: DELAY IS BACKED ON CAR EMISSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28In the first action in Congress to ease the impact of legislation limiting automobile emissions, the Senate Public Works Committee voted today to delay from 1976 to 1977 the starting date for meeting the most severe antipollution standards.

title: PIANOSONG EVENING BY THREE IN FAMILY
description: It was a family occasior Tuesday night in Tully Hald Yehudi Wyner performed his own piano compositions and those of his father, Lazas Weiner, while Susan Daven ny Wyner (Yehudi's wife) sang a sampling of songs by both father and son. Finally, as an encore, Mr. Weiner took over a the keyboard to accompany his daughterinlaw.

title: AntiErasure Safeguards Of Tape Device Detailed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The tape recorder that President Nixon's personal secre, tary, Rose Mary Woods, has testified she used to transcribe a conversation of June 20, 1972, between the President and his former chief of staff, H. R. Haldeman, has builtin protections against inadvertent erasures.

title: Perfume Counterfeiting Laid to 2 in Ozone Park
description: A man and a woman were arrested in their homes in the Ozone Park section of Queens last night and charged with bottling hundreds of tiny bottles of ersatz Chanel No. 5 perfume, apparently to be sold during the Christmas season, the police said.

title: Carter Group Planning to Acquire Unit
description: Carter Group, Inc., announced yesterday it anticipated making a merger proposal to its 51 per centowned subsidiary, the Utilities & Industries Corporation, under which each shareholder of Utilities & Industries would receive $35 a share in cash.

title: PURCHASING GROUP SEES A SLOWDOWN
description: The economy next year will be in a nogrowth position oil a recession, depending on the severity of fuel cuts, E. F. Andrews, chairman of the businesssurvey committee of the National Association of Purchasing Management, Inc., said yesterday.

title: SUSLOV IS MAKING TOUR OF LITHUANIA
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28Mikhail A. Suslov, the Communist party's chief ideologist, is touring Lithuania in an official show of Soviet solidarity with the sometimes troublesomel Baltic republic.

title: CORPORATE BONDS IN MIXED MOVES
description: Corporate, bond prices were mixed again yesterday in quiet trading. Attention still was focused on several large new offerings. Taxexempt issues were down slightly and the Government market was mixed in advance of the Treasury's auction of taxanticipatiod notes. With Federal funds trading in the 10per cent area, the Federal Reserve came into the market and carried out an overnight repurchase agreement. The Fed's action appeared to have little effect on the Federal funds rate, which often moves widely on the Wednesday settlement date.

title: Lillian Reis Out on Bail
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 (AP)Lillian Reis, the former showgirl, has been released on $2,500 bond after ending her battle against extradition to Philadelphia to face charges of firearms violations, loan sharking and handling stolen property. Miss Reis surrendered Monday in criminal court here after losing a court fight against extradition. She is also awaiting sentencing for a 1965 conviction for possession of marijuana and six counts of obtaining drugs by fraud.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: New Greek Leadership Plans to Govern by Decree Indefinitely
description: ATHENS, Nov. 28The new Greek leadership told the nation tonight that it would rule indefinitely by decree until it felt that the people were prepared for elections.

title: RATIONING OP GAS APPEARS LIKELY, PLANNERS ASSERT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Administration is moving toward rationing of gasoline, although no formal decision to take such a step has so far been made, energy planners in two Federal agencies said today.

title: Hitchhikers Force Driver To Drop Them in Far West
description: NEEDLES, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI)'Drive west, the man with the gun said in Detroit. So James G. Dotson headed westall the way to California, he said yesterday.

title: Advertising: Billboard Dimout?
description: Faced with the possibility of a Governmentenforced blackout, the billboard operators of America are being asked by their industry association voluntarily to cut energy use by 25 per cent.

title: Football Transactions NATIONAL CONFERENCE
description: ST. LOUISSinned Fred DiBernardi, defensive end, who had been released by Baltimore.

title: Bahamas Declares It Will Nationalize Gambling Casinos
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, Nov. 28 (AP)  The Bahamian Government announced plans today to nationalize the islands three casinos by January, 1976.

title: Met, in Crisis, Lists More Cutbacks
description: The Metropolitan Opera's severe financial crisis has forced it to plan for a sharp reduction of its New York seasons, to cancel the fourweek June Festival of 19.5 and to work toward cutting the company's annual employment contracts frob a full 52 weeks to between 40 and 44 weeks.

title: Jets Lose TV for Game With Colts
description: The National Broadcasting Company said yesterday that the JetsBaltimore Colts football game at Shea Stadium on Sunday would not be telecast, even though it was sold out. Instead, N.B.C. will bring the ClevelandKansas City game to New York viewers, beginning at 4 P.M.

title: A Country Music Guitarist Shot to Death in Nashyille
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 28 (UPI)The country music industry was shaken today by the second slaying of an entertainer in less than a month.

title: H. FRANCIS CRISS
description: H. Francis Criss, a painter and teacher, died Tuesday at his home, 360 West 22d Street. He was 72 years old.

title: Japan Reacts Cautiously to Arab Reprieve on Oil Cut
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28The Japanese Government reacted cautiously today to an Arab reprieve on 5 per cent cut in oil deliveries that had been scheduled for December.

title: MRS. ROY WELCH
description: Mrs. Sylvia Eastman Welch, widow of Prof. Roy Dickinson Welch who organized the music department at Princeton University, died Saturday in a Princeton, N.J., nursing home. She was 80 years old and had a summer home at Eastville on Martha's Vineyard.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: A Hunting Fatality
description: LISBON, N. H., Nov. 28 (AP)  Norman Liberty, 67 years old, the president of the Lisbon Shoe Company has been found shot to death in an apparent hunting accident, the police said. The police said Mr. Liberty had been hunting wildfowl with a 12gauge shotgun and apparently put the gun down, tried to get over a fence and the weapon discharged.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: PHILADELPHIAPlaced Luther Rockier, center, on walvers.

title: MRS. MEIR'S PARTY SETTLES DISPUTE
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 28The older hardliners and the younger, more moderate members of the leadership of Premier Golda Meir's ruling Labor party papered over their differences today, drafting a compromise plank on peace terms to be included in the party's election platform.

title: EDUCATOR ENTERS CONNECTICUT RACE
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 28Stepping out ahead of a large field of candidates, Homer D. Babbidge of New Haven, former president of the University of Connecticut, announced tonight that he would seek the Democratic nomination for Governor at the party's convention in June.

title: Senate Acts to Clear Way For Saxbe's Appointment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 The Senate approved today a bill designed to remove a constitutional barrier to the nomination of Senator William B. Saxbe, Republican of Ohio to be Attorney General.

title: 3 Rugged Rivals to Test Giants' Mettle
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 28 With the easy part of their schedule out of the way, the New York Giants started today to get down to the business of dealing with the three tough opponents remaining: Washington, Los Angeles and Minnesota, in that order. All three are leading their divisions and are playoffbound.

title: Steps by Rebels Cloud Sihanouk's Role
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Administration officials say they are uncertain about the political future of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the former Cambodian chief of state, as a result of recent maneuvering within the Cambodian insurgent movement opposed to the Government of President Lon Nol.

title: REVAMPING IS URGED FOR ALBANY POLICE
description: The State Commission of Investigation called yesterday for immediate remedial action to reshape and revitalize the Police Department in Albany, where charges of alleged corruption and ineffective leadership were aired at recent hearings.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 29, 1973

title: Butz to Explain Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI) Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz, facing criticism of his new plan to consolidate his department's field offices around the country, will explain the new proposal personally tomorrow to field officials in a meeting at Temple, Tex.

title: U. of Massachusetts Post
description: AMHERST, Mass. Nov. 29 (AP)  A Rutgers University professor will be nominated as la new vice president of the University of Massachusetts. The university announced today that Ernest A. Lynton, a 147yearold physics professor, would be nominated to the newly created post of senior vice president for academic affairs.

title: S.B.A. Aide Tells House Panel Of Thousands He Got in Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 The head of the Richmond office of the Small Business Administration told a House subcommittee today how he incurred almost $500,000 in financial obligations, much of it with banks doing business with his office during the time his office has been accused of possible questionable loan activities.

title: Hebrew Unit Names Official
description: The election of Harry K. Gutmann of. Scarsdale, N. Y., as chairman of the board of trustees of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations was announced yesterday. The election took place at a special meeting of the board at the union's headquarters, 838 Fifth Avenue, near 65th Street. The union serves 710 Reform synagogues, with 1.1 million members, in the United States and Canada.

title: People in Sports: Big Ten Tempest Boils
description: Burt Smith, the athletic director at Michigan State University, told M.S.U. fans at a football dinner Wednesday night that he had voted to send Ohio State to the Rose Bowl because, it was my opinion that Ohio State best met the definition of the most representative team.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Vodka Cap Leads to Rape Conviction

title: Fred Apostoli, Boxer, Dies at 59; Middleweight Champion, '38'39
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 29Fred Apostoli, who formally won the world middleweight boxing title in November, 1938, after defeating two other champions in the same class in controversial fights earlier that same year, died after a heart attack in his office today. He was 59 years old.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.27billion up 10 per cent from last year's $1.15billion. Total retail store sales were about $9.96billion, up 11 per cent from last year's $9billion.

title: School for Disturbed, on Luxury Site, Is Dedicated Here to Robert Kennedy
description: By BARBARA CAMPBELLA school for emotionally disturbed boys, on the first four floors of a new luxury apartment building on the Upper East Side, was dedicated to Robert F. Kennedy yesterday.

title: RABBI ISAAC J. ASSEO
description: Rabbi Isaac J. Asseo, who had led the Sephardic Center of the Mapleton section of Brooklyn, 2143 65th Street, since 1961, died, apparently of a heart attack, in Maimonides Hospital on Tuesday. He was 78 years old and lived at the synagogue.

title: RISE IN ROBBERIES SPURS POLICE SHIFT
description: The commanding officer of the Police Department's 107th Precinct, in the Fresh Meadows section of Queens, has been relieved of his command and transferred because of official dissatisfaction over the growth of crime in the area.

title: A Lawyer in Miniskirts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 If there is one thing that Jill Wine Volner does not like, it is questions about her miniskirts; if there is another, it is to be described as a woman lawyer. So it was understandable that she might have been less than pleased when Judge John J. Sirica referred to her and the witness she was questioning as two ladies arguing.

title: Evans Is Suspended by Webster
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 29One day after saying he was tired of guys sounding off about who's playing and who's not playing, Alex Webster, the New York Giants' coach, suspended Charlie Evans, his unhappy fullback, indefinitely for conduct detrimental to the club.

title: Shortage of Drugs Is Termed Critical; Industry Seeks Oil
description: Because of the oil situation, the United States faces a critical shortage of penicillin, cortisone and other vital drugs, an industry spokesman said yesterday.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: PAPERWORK The Archives of American Art is a bureau of he Smithsonian Institution, It stocks documents for use by academicians and writers doing research into original records, personal letters, sketchbooks and other documents of American artists, critics; collectors, dealers, museums, anyone or thing with involveMent in art in America.

title: GEN. HUGH HUGHES, FREED BELSEN CAMP
description: Brig. Gen. Hugh Llewelyn Glyn Hughes, a physician whose British Second Army liberated the notorious BergenBelsen Nazi death camp in World War II, died Sunday in London at the age of 81, according to word received here yesterday.

title: Court Officer Injured
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (AP)A Suffolk Superior Court officer, Coleman Flaherty, 58 years old, of Quincy was knocked unconscious while attempting to handcuff a prisoner during a recess. Court officials said Mr. Flaherty had been struck and his head hit a railing as he tried to handcuff Charles E. Caine Jr., 26, who is charged with murder.

title: Saigon Aides Say U.S. Will Replace Lost F5's With Better Ones
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov 29Knowledgeable South Vietnamese Air Force officials say they are convinced that the United States will soon begin replacing Government fighterbombers destroyed since the ceasefire with faster, more maneuverable models of the supersonic planes.

title: Tanker Unloads a Huge Oil Cargo Here
description: The 785foot Norwegian tanker Iddi, the world's largest when it was built eight years ago but soon superseded by a succession of supertankers, discharged 429,388 barrels here yesterday of lowsulphur oil, one of the largest such cargoes ever to reach the United States.

title: British Petroleum Profits Rise 483%
Kissinger Is Still Hopeful Of December Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Secretary of State Kissinger said today that despite reports of a breakdown in the ArabIsraeli military talks, he was still hopeful that a Middle East peace conference would begin next month,

title: Boston Mayor Bars Cable TV Indefinitely
description: Boston's Mayor, Kevin H. White, announced yesterday that, after a twoyear study by the Boston Consumers Council, the city had decided, for an indefinite period, not to issue cabletelevision franchises.

title: JAINORSKI GIVEN MILK FUND DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Justice Department has turned over to the office of Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, documents on milk industry contributions to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: COPPER FUTURES RISE AND DECLINE
description: The twotiered market in copper futures continued yesterday. The nearby delivery months showed sharp rises, while the distant contracts dedined in price on the Commodity Exchange.

title: Federal Officials Transfer Hunt to a Prison Camp
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP) E. Howard Hunt Jr., one of seven men convicted in the Watergate burglary and bugging, has been transferred from a Federal detention center in the Washington area to the Federal prison camp in Allenwood, Pa., a spokesman for the United States Marshal Service said today.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 1.8 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commoditty spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 195.9 from 194.1 last week.

title: YOUTHS ARRESTED IN YESHIVA THEFTS
description: Four teenagers were arrested in Brooklyn last night as part of what the police said was a gang of youths that had been responsible for more than 30 burglaries, firebombings and other incidents of vandalism in religious institutions over the last several months in the Sheephead Bay and Gravesend neighborhoods.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 29 (UPI)Civil rights organizations said today they were intent on blocking the Sugar Bowl on New Year's Eve, possibly with sitins or other disruptive actions, unless its sponsors desegregated their organization. The president of the New Orleans MidWinter Sports Association, sponsor of the Sugar Bowl, said he had no immediate comment on the threat.

title: Prices of Corporate Bonds Rise As New Offerings Sell Quickly
description: Corporate bond prices regist tered gains in early afternoon trading yesterday but sever, issues closed below their bes levels of the session.

title: How to Test the Tapes
description: In the miasma of statements, revisions, retractions and endlessly urprising new developments that surrounds the Presidential tapes, no issue is more pertinent than the belatedly discovered poor quality of many of the recordings. According to the White House, portions of the subpoenaed tapes are inaudible and have blank spots. These portions happen to include some of the conversations that were expected to clear up a number of vital questions, including the ultimate question of whether or not President Nixon was directly involved in the Watergate breakin and the Watergate coverup.

title: F.P.C. CHIEF WANTS POWER CUT BY 10%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29John N. Nassikas, the chairman of the Federal Power Commission, said today that the nation's consumption and production of electric power must be cut by an average of 10 per cent, and perhaps more in regions like the Northeast where the oil shortage threatens to be most acute.

title: ZIEGLER ASSAILS JAWORSKI STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The White House bitterly attacked the staff of the special Watergate prosecutor today, charging that it has displayed an ingrained suspicion and visceral dislike for this President and this Administration.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (Reuters)The director of the Office of Foreign Direct Investments, Robert H. Enslow, said today that the foreign direct investment regulations were being amended to ease yearend compliance problems.

title: Common Viruses Believed To Cause Cancer in Some
description: It is becoming increasingly apparent that if viruses do cause cancer in people, the culprits are not unusual viruses that infect only some people. Rather, leading researchers believe, they are extremely common viruses that infect many, if not most, people, but only rarely, result in cancer.

title: Sirica Gets White House Tape Recorders
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 Nine tape machines that were used for recording President Nixon's White House conversations have been surrendered to Chief District Judge John J. Sirica's court, at the request of the special Watergate prosecutor's staff.

title: 10 in Gang in Jersey Indicted in 5 Killings
description: TRENTON, Nov. 29  Ten reputed members of an organized  crime gang were charged today with five murders and 100 robberies in an indictment that reported such bizarre details of the underworld as gunmen toasting them selves with champagne afterii killing and deploying crash cars to head off pursuing po icemen.

title: Market Place: Broker Views Energy Crisis
description: Occasionally, when a brokerage firm focuses on some narrow area of investment activity, it throws light on a broader aspect of the stock market.

title: Trot Driver Is Banned For Stroke of His Pen
description: It was an innocentenough question, as old as racing itself: Who d'ya like?

title: Jupiter's Magnetism Found to Be 40 Times the Earth's
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 29Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to navigate the outer solar system, hurtled deep into the magnetic field of Jupiter tonight and found the field's reach to be greater than expected, its strength 40 times that of the earth's magnetic field and its direction south instead of north.

title: Pollutant Kills 100,000 Fish in Millstone
description: SOMERVILLE, Nov. 29 More than 100,000 fish, mostly carp, have died of an unknown pollutant in a 15mile stretch of the Millstone River in Somerset and Middlesex Counties in the past three weeks.

title: Modern Museum's Staff Ends Walkout
description: A sevenweek strike against the Museum of Modern Art ended yesterday when its professional and administrative workers voted to accept a new 29month contract.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Cleveland  Jeff Merritt,. 218 pounds, Miami. Beach, knocked out Ron Stander, 245, Council Bluffs, Iowa, 3 rounds.

title: Let's Hear From Congress
description: The Congress has been asking all the tough questions lately about President Nixon and the Watergate horrors, but now the Congress itself is going to have to come up with some remedies for the outrages it deplores.

title: Soccer at Garden Is Off Till Dec. 22
description: The indoor soccer tournament scheduled at Madison Square Garden for tomorrow morning was postponed yesterday until Dec. 22 because of technical difficulties in setting up the arena.

title: 51st State Shows CribBurning Barred on A.B.C.
description: The burning of a baby's plastic crib was demonstrated Wednesday night on Channel 13's program The 51st State, even though an Indiana judge had barred the American Broadcasting Company from showing a similar demonstration on a network documentary broadcast nationwide Monday night.

title: Pacers Fall By 127111 To Denver
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 29 (AP)Willie Long and Warren Jabali combined to score 50 points and sparked a secondhalf surge that carried the Denver Rockets past the Indiana Pacers, 127111, in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Game Hog of Dallowgill
description: A few days ago after missing a fairly easy shot at a crossing merganser, my oldest son said in disgust, How in hell can a man get skillful at this if he only goes out three or four times a year?

title: Coping With the Gasoline Shortage: Extra Tanks and Chicken on Sunday
description: Americans are preparing for the first Sunday without gasoline stations by planning to fill up today and tomorrow and by buying locks for gas caps to thwart thievesbut otherwise, apparently, without any great change of plans.

title: Off Off Broadway Shows
description: It's advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to the show. Most, if not all, theaters accept Theater Development Fund vouchers.

title: Kleindienst Says He Gave Authority For LSD Wiretap
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 29 (AP)Former Attorney. General Richard G. Kleindienst testified today that he had signed a paper authorizing a wiretap in an LSD case.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Cambodians Flee to the Capital After Shelling by Guerrillas
description: KOMPONG SPEU, Cambodia, Nov. 29The shells, coming out of nowhere in particular and crashing into humble wood and thatch homes on the edge of town, had their effect.

title: Oil: Spread It Around
description: LONDONHow one thinks about the situation in the Middle Eastand particularly the Arab oil embargolargely depends on one's point of vantage. The Arabs justify the embargo as a reasonable response to our hostile action in airlifting military supplies to their enemy during recent hostilities. They see it as a proper diplomatic instrument to induce us to press Israel to settle on their terms, and, though Americans often refer to the oil curtailment as blackmail, it is a far less drastic action than our carpetbombing of Hanoi last Christmas in an effort to improve our position in the Vietnamese negotiations.

title: The Pop Life
description: Black Oak Arkansas's investment of a year ago is having an unexpected payoff. The Black Oak members, one of the hardest working and mosttraveled rock bands, bought a Greyhound bus and converted it into a home for themselves, deciding to make all their concerts by road and in as much comfort as possible.

title: STADIUM BONDS GAIN IN TRENTON
description: TRENTON, Nov. 29  With some of its most prominent members pointing toward New York and shouting, We're No. 1, the State Senate voted overwhelmingly here this evening to put the state's moral credit behind the financing of a new sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands.

title: 10 in Gang in Jersey Indicted in 5 Killings
description: TRENTON, Nov. 29  Ten reputed members of an organized  crime gang were charged today with five murders and 100 robberies in an indictment that reported such bizarre details of the underworld as gunmen toasting themselves with champagne after a killing and deploying crash cars to head off pursuing policemen.

title: TownGown Struggle Intensifies in New Haven
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 29In 1716 the residents of this city outbid all the other towns in Connecticut for the privilege of having Yale University locate here.
